My friend was having lunch there and I went to meet her.  I only tried the desert. It was a very good bread pudding. I will be back to try the whole meal next time I'm in New Orleans.

AWESOME.  This place was great, literally everything we ate was well cooked from the oysters, shrimp to our hot dishes.  They have great happy hour specials as well and the service is extraordinary.  Our waitress was a local student and she was very helpful and was accommodated all of our needs.

CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!!

I've been to Luke for both happy hour and dinner. Unfortunately, they've raised the price on the oysters! At $0.75 a piece for P&J oysters, they're still a good deal, but not quite as good of a deal. Generally speaking, they're pretty big and fresh. Other happy hour specials include 50% off cocktails, wines by the glass and draft beers. Service has always been spotty here; some of the waiters are really nice, but some of them will actually roll their eyes at you when you ask questions. It's nice that you can even make reservations during happy hour times. I've also had the fried oysters and the burger, both of which are good, but nothing amazing. As with the other John Besh restaurants, it's a pleasant atmosphere. For the times I've been here, it's been a mix tourists and locals that skews more toward tourists. I recommend trying out Luke at least once, but I wouldn't classify it as one of my go-to, staple restaurants.

Been to Luke twice and so far so good. The restaurant set up is nice and super clean unlike some other restaurants in NOLA. CMON! anyone in NOLA understands what I mean. Shoes stickin to the floors and what not...

Anyhow...I ordered the crawfish omelette the first time and it was ok. Plating was pretty and it tasted good but probably not the best thing to get when you're hung over. 

Second time I got the shrimp and grits. The grits were made with jalapeños and cheddar topped with a sauce made with sausage, green onions and decent sized shrimp. Every bite was...OH MY GAH! Toe curling goodness.

Lüke was the final lunch of our vacation to NOLA in February 2015, on the drive back to the airport. Parking was very difficult to find during lunch hour, but the hostess was very understanding while we tried to sort out a street spot.

Their must-have dish is the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "en Cocotte" (which rings in at $24) which was probably my favorite meal the whole trip. I added the poached eggs because we were still in brunch mode, and it just sounded too amazing.

We started with their 1/2 dozen Stuffed P&j Oysters (gulf shrimp and blue crab) ($17) which were unreal tasty. Highly recommended as a starter.

Great service as well, our server was attentive and very considerate of time constraints. This meal made it to so hard to leave! We will be coming back next time.

Make reservations to Luke's, a must stop if you're in NOLA. We started with a cocktails, and their complimentary bread and butter. I had the shrimp and grits and the hubby had the croque Madame. The grits were cheesy, creamy and flavorful, the shrimp and sausage were saucy and garlicky. We've had the croque in Paris and hubby said Luke's was right up there with the ones we had in France. I had a nibble and it was buttery, cheesy, and the right crisp. We shared the bread pudding, which was delectable. The service was friendly, helpful, and prompt. I am tempted to return for breakfast on our last day in New Orleans.

I was seriously disappointed with the quality of food and service at this location. The waiter didn't tell us about the happy hour specials and we had to wait 20-30 minutes for them to pack our left over food and get a check. 

My gf tried shrimp with grits which was good but not worth $24. Crab bisque was the main highlight. My burger was alright, nothing to separate it from a Chillis burger and fires were stale. 

Overall, this is a very pricy place ($$$) with a very mediocre quality food and service. They do have happy hour but they won't tell u about it. I'm not sure why are there so many positive reviews, I think u can do lot better at other places.

Enjoyed the happy hour today. The oysters were great, and the cocktails were just as incredible. The door#3 was so refreshing. Husband had the burger... Which was HUGE! Only complaint was lack of dark beer selection on draft.
The best Oyster Happy Hour in town! The P&J Oysters are the best. Sat at the bar and enjoyed great conversation with Shucker and awesome staff.

This place was okay, we were looking forward to the dinner here and really wanted to like this place. As other yelpers have suggested the food here is nothing to rave about. The decor is welcoming and the service was nice. We were checked on frequently throughout our dinner. Ordered the brussels sprouts for appetizer and I have to agree they were just too sweet and there was not enough green chili to balance it out. Also, orders the chicken the potatoes were delicious and chicken was soft but the seasoning was just okay. Also ordered the salad and the golden beets were again done very sweet and the balance is flavors were missing. The matzo ball soup had no flavor in it, and the dessert the yellow cake was so dense and hard that you would need a knife and a fork to get through it. I will go again to see if other things are good on the menu, but won't be my first choice.

I went here today for lunch with some vendors.  The service was exceptional and everything came out on time and perfectly.  We started with the crab and corn fritters.  They were full of crabmeat and the green aioli on the side with a little kick was amazing.  I got the black drum which was one of the best fish dishes I ever had.  Underneath was veggies and 3 side red potatoes.  The other person got the burger.  It was huge and delicious.  the other person got the croquet madam sandwich and was not a fan.  The ham and cheese on the inside were cold and not melted.  The cheese on top was, so she didn't like it at all.  The other person had the shrimp and grits.  Great large portions and very good just a little heavy and rich.  Spice was perfect. Will be back!

Enjoyed myself very much at this establishment,  I was in town on business and we had dinner here the steak was perfect.  I would tell you that the level of service was awesome from our servers. ...my wine glass never was empty. ...by the way corn and crab bisque was very good. .....

Quite honestly, the worst dining experience I've ever had, not just in Nola. 

We got there early for our reservation, and they sat us early. Good start. They brought out good bread. Ok, not so bad so far. First issue: we specifically asked for a game to be on their TVs when we made the reservation, and they assured us that the bar would be playing that game. They did not play that game. Oh well, not really a big deal.

Hey, that reminds me. Didn't we put in for drinks and oysters half an hour ago? Where are they? After another 15 minutes, a separate waiter comes and gets our drinks, finally. After another 15 minutes, no oysters, so we decide to put in our orders. Maybe the oysters have escaped.

Our oysters finally come after an hour of waiting for them, and they're ok. My matza ball soup is pretty much tasteless. The broth has a slight chicken flavor but other than that, nothing. The gumbo my friends got was tiny. Our waiter has now not talked to us or checked on us in well over an hour. He is busy talking to the bachelorette party and some random guy at the bar. Our other waiter is busy with his own tables, but makes more of an effort to check in on us probably 3 times over the course of a 2.5 hour marathon restaurant experience.

Now I get my entree, the fried oyster salad. The only redeeming quality of this salad is the bacon. Everything else was pretty much worthless. They oysters tasted slightly of salt, but that's it. 

The bread pudding was only good for the topping and ice cream. Once you run out of sauce, it became literally a semi-thick, unsweet dough. 

0/5 terrible experience.
Luke does the room service for the Hilton. I wouldn't recommend ordering room service. It was below average and I found the gumbo to be very bitter.

Never have I given 5 stats to a restaurant, until today. Last night we went to Luke's on St. Charles to celebrate our 21st anniversary with our friends. Why give stars well that's easy our server Kenney Schlotten earned most of them. His service and table side manners were fabulous. The food was great too but the service is what put the dining experience to five stars!. I would also put a shout out to Tarium Brazil who wasn't out server but treated us as we were his customer. Chef John Besh don't let these two get away!
Regards, 
Michael Hamilton

We had a large group here and had a semi-private area. The area's dedicated staff and coordinator were great and the food was amazing. We ordered way too much and everything was eaten. I cannot recommend Luke enough for a large group. Only minor complaint was the drink service was a bit slow.
The owner John and his manager have always been very nice to me.  Food is great and our server Cheyenne was hilarious and very good at her job.

Our first breakfast. Fancy!

Husband ordered the crab bisque, which was delish, creamy, rich in flavors,  had a few chunks of crab. 

We shared Stuffed P&J Oysters,  amazing!  Omg, it was so good.  Juicy!  Probably the best stuffed oysters ever.

Fried Chicken and Biscuit 
It is crazy good.  The batter is awesome,  we've never had batter this good.  It is a bit sweet.  The chicken itself was moist and juicy,  but not oily. The biscuit was also good.  Big portion.

Fried Soft Shell Crab
That was so good,  with fried kale and butternut squash.

En cocotte with crab
The flavors were explosive!  I wish I had more sauce.  Shrimps were juicy and big. The crab was an excellent addition,  however at $13, I felt more crab could have been added.

Overall,  this was one of the best breakfasts we've experienced.  A bit pricey,  but the food was phenomenal.

Very disappointing. The waiter seemed rushed. He didn't answer my questions about what i ordered correctly, so i ended up not getting what i was expecting. Our lattes were luke warm. No pun intended. As well as the food. It came out very quickly and my friends croque monseiur was not even melted in the middle. I got baked or fried kale when i was expecting wilted. The server asked my friend (as she was putting food in her mouth) if she was all done eating and did she need a box?!?!?!?? Not what i expected from JB. Think ill steer clear of celebrity chefs from now on...

Stopped in for happy hour on a Wednesday evening. The oysters were .75 but not that great. The drinks, however were very delightful! I had the Silver Saint and the Chelsea. The Chelsea was my favorite and absolutely fabulous!! We came back on Friday evening right around 5:00 pm hoping to snag a seat at the bar but the whole place was packed and the next available reservation wasn't until 8:30 pm. Be sure to make a reservation ahead of time!

Food is good, waiter not!.  Their wines by the glass are overpriced! So I ordered a Sauvignon blanc for $12... Bill arrives and was charged $14. I asked the waiter if he would double check for me. He brings me a menu with the $12 printed as I had seen and proceeded to tell me that it was a misprint and that the wine was indeed $14!
Wow, that took some nerve, really? So, I deducted two bucks from his tip.

Came here to celebrate my 60th birthday on the recommendation of my client in Toronto. We were seated @ the bar area right in front where the staff was shucking fresh oysters & ordered the large assorted seafood platter, brussel sprout, bread pudding, all were fresh & delicious. Service was excellent & will return for another rememberable meal, when in NOLA.
Oysters and shrimp and grits because that's what yelp said to get. totally delicious. Ate solo and the waiter was attentive but not overly so. They even plugged my phone in to charge behind the bar.

WOW I am never coming back nor taking my friends and family foodies here.

I tried this place today for the first time and I love trying new places and coming back if it was both a great food and service experience. Our waiter was not very talkative, he just took the order and brought the food. That is totally fine with me. But when we put our napkins down, and sat for him to come over and ask us if we were finished or wanted dessert... He didn't... He walked over and picked up one plate, and I told him we are ready for the check. He didn't clear the table like he should have, he picked up one plate, ignored and didn't acknowledge me and walked off. My friend said to me, I don't think he heard you. Well obviously he did because he brought the check and put it on the table and walked off!!! He NEVER said a word. Never said THANK YOU. Nothing. From the very beginning I just felt like he hated his job or was having a bad day, so my friends and I were being considerate and just tried to look past his grumpy miserable face. So we asked to split the check and he came back asking about tip to make sure we tip on the card since we split it etc... So basically he was assuming that we might forget or not tip or something. Then he came back to drop off the cards and we still gave him a 20% tip because we are just too nice and know what it's like to be in this industry. We no longer are in the service restaurant industry but used to be in the past for 10 years! So when he dropped the cards off, I asked him "are you having a bad day?" He smiled and said no im not having a bad day. Then walks off. It was the most uncomfortable smile... Because he never smiled until then. Honestly I felt like he was making assumptions from the start when we sat down. He did give us a look when we said we were going to share everything because as foodies, you want to try more than one plate to yourself but not over order and be disgusting full... And be able to go onto the next food stop later. But seriously I'm probably under describing the whole situation. He was so rude. You can be rude without talking and making the rude actions and not acknowledging. Just terrible, we should not have to feel like we didn't belong, not welcomed or didn't want to be waited on or if waiting on us was just a miserable hassle. No one should have to feel like that!

We went to Restaurant R'evolution and Commander's Palace the previous two days and the food was amazing and the service was more than perfect. Maybe you should send your staff and pay for them to eat there to see how it is to be a nice friendly waiter....
I'm just speechless at today's experience and restaurants like this need to be aware that there are countless other restaurants offering both amazing wonderful food WITH good service. 

On to the next amazing restaurant on my list. 
Don't care to ever come back.

We really really liked this place. Found it by dumb luck even tho we wanted to eat at a few of John Besh's places. Had brunch and while it was quite pricey, it was also very good. Loved the crab bisque and the chicken biscuit. The shrimp and grits wasn't the best I've ever had but it was a little different and I still liked it a lot. Our waitress was friendly and it's been one of the best breakfast/brunches we've had in Nola. It's also amazing to see how swiftly the manager replies to all the negative reviews! I did joke with my husband that I could lie to get a free meal but I'm not that underhanded! I'm not so sure some of these other bad reviewers aren't doing that tho ;) We had a great experience and would happily come back!

My favorite restaurant for my first trip to NOLA! Happy hour 3-6 pm! Raw oysters are $0.75 and fried are a dollar something. My fiancé and I had both and they were superb! The fried oysters were not overly fried and still nice and juicy on the inside but crispy on the outside. The raw oysters were not grainy and very fresh! We also had the chicken and rabbit pate and it was great with the bread. They give you a variety of small accompaniments to cut the taste of the pate. I enjoyed it but it's a pretty large portion so we couldn't finish it. We had the gumbo and it was average. Service was great! Nick & Nick were awesome! :)
Stuffed oysters, shrimp etouffee, chicken thighs, cabernet.. all excellent!
75 cent oysters are a steal.  They even gave my party of 8 a private room for happy hour.  I did enjoy the gumbo and wait staff.

The food here, is great!  I've been here twice! First time, the service was fine but the second time, was pretty bad. I wanted to make sure my friends loved New Orleans food and wanted them to be happy before sending them back home! I'm completely embarrass about the service here, after raving about one of John Besh restaurants to them! 

This is my first bad review on yelp! 
I'm more than just a little upset, our waiter Ruben, was incredibly disappointing. He probably hates us for sharing an appetizer and 2 entrees as a table of 3 for lunch. And splitting the bill in three. As we made sure he got cash tip! We ate here on Monday and my card was ran twice in two different amounts after I had ask him to run a certain amount that are the same on two different cards. He could've just told me, he ran my card for a different amount. It's was pending for 3 days and it's the wrong amount. The 2nd amount that was ran, disappear after two days. We left him a good percent of tip even though he didn't deserve it. Was just hoping he would cheer up a bit but he didn't. Whatever it is, it shouldn't be taken to work, he's representing an amazing restaurant with one of the best chefs in town with great food. There's so much more but really what's the point. This yelp has so many complaints on service and yet, nothings changed. But asking all of us to email the manager.

I came here on the recommendation of a friend, even though some of the reviews said it wasn't that great. I don't know what they were talking about...it was amazing!! I ordered the Louisiana Jumbo Shrimp "en Cocoette" with roasted jalapeño cheese grits & andouille & green onion sausages. Omg...so delicious. I also ordered the brussel sprouts as a side. They were a little sweet as some others mentioned, but they also had a little spice. I liked the flavor combination, and they were roasted a perfect brown. For dessert I had the steamed chocolate with salted caramel ice cream. Divine. Seriously. So good. Service was good as well. I had multiple people checking on me throughout the meal. Yum!

When my already large family group gained 4 more members while walking around the French quarter, we made the wise choice of visiting Lükes for brunch on a Saturday afternoon. Since there were 12 of us, they rushed to provide a private room with a clean and dressed table. 
Immediately our drink orders were taken. I went with one of the specialty cocktails with pomegranate juice and vodka. Wonderfully sweet and tart. 
When not even five minutes later we started receiving gorgeous complimentary appetizers and bread, I was so thankful we visited. The chicken pate is creamy with great flavor, and the Brussels sprouts are freaking amazing. I don't usually enjoy raw seafood, but I could not resist trying some of the shellfish tray. Everything was so fresh! 
For my entree, I ordered a bowl of the seafood gumbo. My other family members chose items like matzo ball soup, oysters, ginormous burgers, and the kids were even able to share a giant grilled cheese sandwich served with a side of fries. 
The waiter poured my gumbo in the bowl when it was served to me, and that small touch really made a difference. The actual meal was decently delicious too, and the bread served as the perfect dipping vessel. 
Derrick (I think he's in charge of the place) was an excellent host, and even joked around with us when he was able to stop by. 
I'd visit again for a nice brunch or even try stopped me by for dinner.

Hands down Luke is one of the best happy hours in the French Quarter, and busy! We found ourselves here after waiting to check in at the Hilton on St. Charles Avenue just in time. Luke quickly filled up and at one time was 3 deep behind our coveted bar spot with patrons trying to get drink and 75 cent oyster orders in. Happy Hour runs from 3-6pm ; all specialty cocktails , wines and beers ate half off! It's a great time to sample a drink you may have been wanting to try, like the Sazerac or French 75, both N'awlins 'native' 'must try once drinks'. I love the French 75 here; unlike some other establishments, Luke creates this special concoction with no gin, just enough lemonade, atop a small cherry, bitters and champagne.. the attentive bartenders even swirl a ' 75' or a pink heart atop the goodness. We made this our go to hh spot during our week in Nola. Can't find a place at the bar, no worries, you can enjoy the great hh prices from a table; another rarity. Great cappuccinos, which the bartender even suggested I try a smooth shot of a liquor called 43 / Cuarenta y Tres with: SOLD. We sampled bubbles including a nice Pinot Noir bubbly from France. We opted for dinner here one night , as well. I highly recommend reservations because the place gets packed and seemed to stay that way. For dinner I had the crab bisque , the best I've had in Nola , believe it or not. I say that , because I like the bisque to have pieces of crab throughout, and this one did. For my entree, I had the ribeye with maitre de butter and topped with crab. The ribeye was tender, but fatty. The waiter offered to take it back , but I did love the flavor and ribeye is not a filet! It was good, so no need to take it away! A wonderful warm bread comes with the meal and the ambience is old French bistro and lively. John Besh is known for his amazingness in his home of New Orleans. We had just missed his being here at Luke.. maybe someday again, we will have the opportunity.. because we will def return!

First restaurant that my hubby and I tried in New Orleans on our trip and it was AWESOME.  We arrived without reservation and was told that they don't have any availability for another 1.5-2 hr, but the bar is open seating and we were GLAD that we did.  Walked right up and there was two seats available in front of the oyster shuckers.  Order some oysters and also the Chappapeela Pork Schnitzel. Oysters were fresh and sooooo good, the pork schnitzel with wild mushroom sauce was great. Excellent service, had a great time talking to the oyster shuckers :) Definitely would visit again and would recommend sitting at the bar area !

Went there for a French 75. We were not impressed. It tasted like a whiskey sour. The food was very good. Flammenkuchen, Brussels sprouts and fresh oysters all excellent. Service very good. Serving the bread in a bag is a bit like a local diner. 

Overall we enjoyed

Lüke's Restaurant 

A great dining experience after a disappointing trip to two restaurants prior not working out. 

My fiancée and I shared and thoroughly enjoyed the Brussels sprouts (4.5/5) keeping in mind I've never liked Brussels sprouts in the past, they had an Asian like taste that reminded me of teriyaki. The stuffed oysters (4.8/5) which had such a great umami to them, truly delicious. Then for a main we had the Black Drum fish (3.5/5) where the highlight was actually the vegetables, simply done by way of sauté with garlic but so delicious.

But the best part of our meal had to be the waiter, Nick. He was great, good advice and very chatty (but not that over chatty, trying to get a big tip chatty)

The happy hour special of 50 cent oysters, which is daily, 3-6PM, is awesome, and that is the best thing about this place.  Oysters were fresh, great flavor, and you can't beat the price.  

However, the other food we tried there was only OK.  The fries had good flavor, but were super soft which is not my preference for fries.  The Salad Luke was overly dressed so the dressing overpowered any other flavors in the salad.  We also tried the gumbo, which was good, but not fantastic.  

I would totally go back for the happy hour and so I will likely try other items on their menu, but I think their oysters is really the only reason to come to this restaurant.

Great food, very helpful staff, small menu.  The clam bisque was the best, I also enjoy the fried oyster salad.  These two sides were enough food for me.  Salad had a little to much thick bacon chunks for me.

My fiancé and I stopped by for a quick eat before a conference. We let out waiter know this, and he really delivered on the service. We split the shrimp and grits and pancakes for a late breakfast. Not only did our waiter bring the food out quickly, it was split into two separate dishes nicely. And it was the best shrimp and grits we've had! Overall a great experience.

I don't care whether you love oysters or think you don't like oysters... Make sure you find some time to go here for happy hour.  Next order both the fried oysters and the raw oysters....again it doesn't matter what you think your opinion is about oysters. And prepare for mind blowingly good oysters!

All this with no line, reservations possible and $.75 raw oysters!!!!!! Incredible!!!
Best raw oysters I have ever eaten. The horseradish mixed with the cocktail sauce was superb. This is a definite must at happy hour for .75 cent oysters and half price drinks.

A bit disappointing for brunch. They were understaffed and service was slow. Brunch menu is a bit limited. Had the fried chicken and biscuit which was solid. The egg on top was superfluous and forgettable. Shrimp and grits were just ok for the high price point. 

Update: went back again for oysters at happy hour. Service was still pretty bad. The quality of the shucking was awful. There were gooey globs of dirt on the shells and on the oysters and most of the brine was gone.
Amazing raw oysters at great prices (65 cents during happy hour!). I loved the gumbo. The friendly, accommodating service pushes this place to 5 stars.

On the advice of a very kind gentleman we found this little cozy place.  Went for lunch and it was excellent.  Kinda tucked out of the way but worth the find.  It's a John Besh restaurant and worthy of his name for sure.

In a galaxy far far away, 

Luke seafood has returned to his home planet of New Orleans, in an attempt to rescue his friends, Shrimp and Grits.  Little does Luke know that his delicious oysters has secretly begun construction of an armored death oyster, known as a fried oyster, even more powerful than oysters rockefeller.  When the construction of the fried oyster was complete, Shrimp and Grits began to the true struggle to obtain freedom against the raw oysters. 

Will Luke restore freedom in this galactic oyster war?

This was the one restaurant I had to try in NOLA because of their happy hour oysters - only $0.75 each! What's great is that they have happy hour EVERY DAY from 3-6pm! Unfortunately we didn't make a reservation for Saturday and the next available table would be after 10pm (we came in around 4:45pm) but the bar was open so our group decided to just eat there.

DELICIOUS OYSTERS! Not sandy and most oysters were quite large. I'm not sure why only half of us received crackers and vinegar sauce..

Drinks:
DRAFT BEER - Something called Provision or prohibition. Super easy to drink and kind of tangy. Even my friend who hates beer actually loved it!
FRENCH 75 - Wish I had ordered this for myself. cognac, fresh lemon juice & champagne - what could go wrong?!
SILVER SAINT - tequila, fresh lime juice, cucumber syrup, serrano pepper, & soda water. Really tasty and strong drink!

HIGHLY RECOMMEND LUKE!

I'm not sure if we went on an off night but our experience was memorable in a bad way. 

The waitstaff wasn't coordinated, drinks took forever, and our food was LÜKEwarm. 

Out of the four of us, only one enjoyed the meal -- the ribeye. The other dishes were either bland or overflavored. 

Additionally, we witnessed one of the waitstaff eating fries off one of our entrees, which left a horrible impression. 

We walked out of the restaurant irritated because Lüke was the first restaurant we chose to try as soon as we got to NOLA.

A dinner with friends--special people is always an event.  We arrived ready for the P&J oyster specials.  The raw oysters, and grilled versions were wonderful.  The right mixture of lemon, horseradish, and cocktail sauce is my standard.  The restaurant has a beautiful, New World atmosphere.  I had a light early dinner that included the seafood gumbo.  It is hard to find bad gumbo in New Orleans, but this was particularly outstanding.  I have to find a way back to the Big Easy to try some other dishes at this popular New Orleans restaurant!  I miss New Orleans already!

Can't beat 75 cent oysters that are actually nice and meaty, half off cocktails and draft beer between 3-6pm. We also got the stuffed oysters, which we could have done without - itty bitty oyster hidden under a small mound of mayo and crab meat. Service was great!

Luke did not exceed my expectations, but was delicious. I feel like if I am going to pay a lot for food, I should be blown out the water, and I was not. Still gets 4 stars because I enjoyed everything, staff was great, and I really do not have any complaints. I would recommend this restaurant to a friend.

Easy pick--shrimp and grits. It's a southern staple and it is done really well here. You won't hear this often...the butter is outrageously good. That's right, the butter that comes with the mini baguette is actually memorable. 

One knock...the gumbo. Specifically, the shrimp IN the gumbo. I suppose since it is made in huge vats and sits, the shrimp gets mealy, otherwise I would actually suspect that it's *gasp* frozen. Great flavor, but the texture of the shrimp is a big turn off.

Had brunch here. Great ambiance. Very intimate. Visiting from Philadelphia it was nice to be in a establishment that put emphasis on southern traditions. Seafood was super fresh and affordable. Waiters we'e complete gentlemen. Enjoyed their accents. Lol. Drinks took longer than expected. Definitely will visit again when in NO

My two friends and I ate here while in town on vacation. To be fair, one of my friends really enjoyed his food and it did look good. But my other friend and I ordered the crab BLT (something we would not have done if we'd overheard the server tell the table next to us to order something else - we'd already put our order in when this occurred). It was so incredibly salty that it was inedible. Neither of us could eat our meals. In hindsight, I should have sent them back although I hate making a fuss at a restaurant. But for $30-something, not being able to eat my dinner really stunk. Service other than that was great so it's a shame the food didn't live up to our expectations.

This was, by far, my favorite restaurant experience in New Orleans.  I came for dinner and man oh man did I feast!  I'm so glad I looked at Yelp's pictures for this spot prior to my visit, otherwise I would've totally overlooked the flammenkuchen appetizer.  It's BACON PIZZA.  Get it, eat it...ALLLLLLL.  Best thing on the menu.  The fried brussels sprouts are pretty bomb too, and as for the pate, it can easily feed four people and it's so buttery and delicious, it'll be gone in a flash!

Now, no trip to New Orleans is complete without having some good ol' shrimp n' grits, and they were good indeed!  What was really nice is that I was splitting this dish with someone, and the kitchen served us two plates!  Great gesture!

You need to get the steamed chocolate dessert.  It's kind of like a mousse, but thicker and a bit more cake-y, and for someone who isn't the biggest fan of ice cream...SALTED CARAMEL FOR THE WIN!

Dinner is not cheap but worth the price

Brussel Sprouts were AMAZING 
Shrimp and Grits were as wonderful as expected 
Steak with side of grits was perfectly cooked
Creme Brule was the perfect end 

If you do not have reservations and they seat you in the overflow you can watch them prepare the meals it is a fun thing to see.

DESSERT

bread pudding - always a winner...solid new orleans bread pudding
steamed chocolate - deep dark chocolate was decadent and rich.  chocolate to ice cream ratio was perfect

Went for dinner on our last night in New Orleans.  Pretty expensive but good food.  Highly recommend the Gumbo -- my wife had the crab bisque which was also very good.

My wife and I shared some of the shellfish and the brussel sprouts which were really good.  Nice spice to them.

One of the best bread puddings for dessert.

Drooling just rethinking about the food here. Got the petite platter with oysters, clams, mussels and shrimp. Everything was CLEAN (which is hard to find around here) and the oysters were huge. Although the wait time is long you can see the servers and oyster shuckers working super hard, so just be patient because it's worth it.
Great atmosphere, food, and location.  The P&J oysters are an unbelievable deal at $16/dozen.   Really enjoyed the draft Luke Alt bier.

The ambiance of Luke is wonderful. The staff is on point as well. The food, well that's a different story. For starters I had the matzo ball soup which was pretty bland and didn't have nearly enough broth for the two matzoh that were provided. My main course, shrimp and grits was terrible. The shrimp were without a doubt frozen. The consistency of the grits were yet to be desired; very clumpy and lumpy. I have been to "hole in the wall" places with way tastier shrimp and grits. I'll never be back again as both tables beside me were also very disappointed in their dining experience as well. Sorry Luke but you need to pick up the slack and revamp your menu.

Loved our brunch here. Food and service were great and while it was one of the pricier meals of the trip (mostly due to the drinks, not the reasonably priced entrees), it was certainly worth it.

I was craving a burger but was hesitant to get something that I can get anywhere. Our waiter promised that it would be different than your average bar burger, though, and he was definitely right. In addition to being absolutely massive, the ingredients were so fresh and the fries were also prepared perfectly. 

As much as I enjoyed my burger, part of me wishes I had ordered some of the other dishes I sampled. My friend's fried chicken and tabasco honey biscuit was to die for and, to my pleasant surprise, not too spicy. If I ever come back, that's what I'm getting. 

I'd come back but I'm not a huge fan of this part of the downtown/CBD area, which is a little soulless compared to the rest of the city. That probably sounds a little douchey but as a visitor with a finite amount of time in town, I'm not looking to spend my time surrounded by 9-5 office buildings.

First place we walked into upon arriving to the city...right outside our hotel. Greeting ladies seemed flustered that we did not have reservations at 3:30 on a Thursday???

Anyway, although there seemed to be plenty of available tables...they told us it would be a 1hr 45 min wait?!? Didn't make sense...got the vibe if we would have dressed a little nicer we would have been treated differently, just my impression. 

We were told we could go to the Bar...which was over crowded...seems the thing here is to send everyone to the bar while the tables sit empty??! Weird

Don't even want to give them a second chance, too many other warm and friendly place close by!

Let's start with the good.

The food was really good. Here's what we had:

Blue crab and corn fritters- The tarragon aioli was delicious and paired well with the fritters. The crab flavor was strong and the corn had a good bite to it.

Gumbo- M liked it more than me. He remembers liking it more last year. Not a big fan of all the okra.

Shrimp & Grits- Yum! I liked the heartiness of the grits and the sauce was tasty. Good amount of shrimp.

P&J oysters- I didn't have any but M like these a lot.

Now onto the bad. Our waiter was never really around. After having the fritters, we were served the oysters but our table didn't get cleared of the empty basket of fritters. After the our entrees came, the basket of fritters,the oysters, and dirty appetizer plates were still sitting empty on our table. We had not received the gumbo we ordered so someone else (still haven't seen our waiter) brought it out. 

When Matt was 80% done with his main entree, our waiter finally came to check on us and asked if we needed anything from him. Uhh... Yea! How about clearing the table? Or checking to see how our food was because maybe then he would have known we were served our last appetizer after we were already served our entree. 

Food was great, but the subpar service tainted the experience. We did let a manager know on the way out. If our server was around we could have told him too.

If your looking for some good Cajun food, look no further. We started with the stuffed Oysters and crispy brussel sprouts for our appetisers. (so good) For my entree, I ordered the jumbo shrimp on jalapeno cheddar grits and it was absolutely to die for. We finished with a cream brulee and the bread pudding. Both were excellent.

I can't say enough about my experience at Lüke last Friday! Upon arriving, my boyfriend and I spoke to the hostesses and a woman who turned out to be the manager while waiting for a table. During our conversation it came up that we were celebrating our anniversary. A few minutes after sitting down, our waitress promptly brought over two glasses of champagne and congratulated us! We already felt at home!
Beyond the amazing service we received, the food was to die for. We had the most scrumptious and unique brussels sprouts, as well as the stuffed P and J oysters for appetizers. Even my boyfriend who is a self proclaimed Brussels-sprout hater, I couldn't stop raving about the vegetables. 
Sitting in the back with a view of the kitchen, gave us a pretty good idea of what we wanted to order as entrées after our hors d'oeuvres. We both ended up ordering red meat options (which is usually a faux pas at restaurants known for their seafood) and loved every bite!!
Our meal ended with not one but two desserts, because we kept seeing the waiters bring out tastier and tastier treats to other customers. They all look so good it was too hard to decide.
All in all, a great experience and we will definitely return!!

A trip to New Orleans without trying a John Besh restaurant wouldn't be proper. He is a pride of the south in this industry and his food highlights why their cuisine is truly a gem, by adding his own twist and a touch of class.

Make reservations in advance. The restaurant is in the Hilton Hotel but with a separate entrance. Though the ambiance is upscale, the atmosphere was very relaxed and casual, buzzing with patrons ranging from families with kids, girls on a night out, couples on dates, etc. You get the picture - everyone's welcome.

This was our first meal on our trip where we actually felt hungry before eating. That said, we went crazy and ordered quite a few things between two people.

The bread that started us off was warm but we knew better than to get full from that. We however indulged ourselves more than we should with the vibrant and earthy PATE of Louisiana RABBIT & CHICKEN LIVERS ($11). I ate this with sweet peppers, blueberry preserve, table pickles, relish, and honey grain mustard atop a nicely crisp crostini. It was fabulous. I had fun with mixing and matching all the sides because everything seemed to work together. That jar of pate was begging to be licked clean, I tell you.

SEAFOOD GUMBO a LA CREOLE ($10/bowl) was served on a tin cup then poured over the rice on the bowl. This was mighty tasty for our first gumbo on this trip and hearty as should be. A cup might have been a more appropriate portion for us though.

We initially had no greens added to our order but our server raved about the BRUSSELS SPROUTS ($12), crispy and glazed with honey siracha. Now, how can we possibly say no to that? One bite was all it took for us to know we made a wise decision.

Our main dish was no other than the JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP EN COCOTTE ($24). Wow, the shrimps were huge and succulent, the roasted jalapeno cheese grits were creamy and hearty, while the Andouille & green onion sausages were flavorful and added a kick - oh my palate was dancing and singing with joy! It was nice of them to serve this on split cast irons since we were sharing. The portion was just right, in fact, because the food was rich, you'll get easily stuffed. 

I don't know how we did it but trying BRENDAN's BREAD PUDDING ($8) was the very 2nd reason (next to the shrimp and grits) why we booked a table at Luke's. Our stomachs probably knew better and paved the way for its presence because man was it off the charts scrumptious in every way. The vanilla bean ice cream and the hot buttered pecan sauce were literally the icing on this cake. 

I have no complaints! Thanks to our server who was a sweetheart and for making our experience here more memorable.

Lüüüke!! I love this place so much. 50 cent oysters, 1/2 priced happy hour drinks for your liking, hand cut fries. Not the most expensive John Besh restaurant, but still a bit pricey. Worth every penny. Delicious food typical of any Besh restaurant. Parking is annoying. Staff is attentive and polite though and the burgers are so very good. Only the best ingredients used, and it tastes that way as well. My only complaint is that they shove a lot of tables in the restaurant and some are almost literally in the kitchen. The line of orders up are simply facing the other direction from the tables. I don't care though. I love it here! Classy burgers and fries, what's better than that?! Dress casual or dress it up, you're still dressed appropriately. (I should mention, it's more than burgers and fries. It's simply American food, presented in an upscale package, by a world famous chef, who hosts a comfortable yet fancy atmosphere. Love Lüke!)

Came yet again for a work lunch.  I had the softshell crab BLT, which comes on a toasted brioche bun and with fries.  Ho-Ly Cow!  It was delicious.  The crab was huge and the breading was crispy and flavorful.  The bacon was of high quality (very little fat) and was cooked to a prefect crispiness as well.  It was served as an open faced sandwich to be eaten with a fork and knife; and this is the only way to eat this monster dish because there's no way you could fit that huge sandwich in your mouth for a bite, let alone with the addition of another bread layer.  This dish is a home run for Luke.

Good food in a classier environment. If you want to eat at a place that the terms "Chef De Cuisine" "Celebrity Chef" apply to,  and has a team of wait staff tag teaming you throughout the meal, this is the place to go. The fish was excellent in both dishes. I had the local catch of the day and my wife had swordfish. The food overall was slightly edged out by the other classier, celebrity endorsed restaurant we went to, but it was still REALLY good. John Besh is like the poster child of New Orleans.

Picked Luke's for brunch on a Monday. Located in the business district you can come casual. Highly recommend the fried chicken with red beans and rice; it's like a spoonful of heaven in your mouth; smoky, bacon, maple, Tabasco, crunchy chicken skin all merge together to create an orgasmic effect. My wife's gumbo was a good authentic New Orleans gumbo, with a caramel like brown rue. The okra was a little stringy. We enjoyed a dozen oysters with our friends, they were awesome- fresh, clean, light smell of the sea, and shucked properly. All in all would go back to enjoy more!

Invited back to Luke after being contacted by management regarding my previous review I was privileged to a dinner out of this world. It began with huge raw oysters that were succulent and salty needing no additional condiments. My party then had the baked oysters which were again excellent, oysters on the half shell baked with fresh shrimp and crabmeat. Then we were treated to a chef's special called Flammenkuchen. The Flammenkuchen was a German style pizza with pork belly, caramelized onions and Emmenthaler cheese, that was unbelievable. The next course was a cup of gumbo which is always a staple for me anytime I come to Luke, a dark rich roux filled with seafood and sausage. The main course was their number 1 seller the famed shrimp and grits which was the best shrimp and grits I have ever had. The sauce was rich and full of flavor probably also made with a roux with huge shrimp, soft creamy grits and cheese. For dessert we settled on the bread pudding that was served in a soufflé dish served with a great pecan reduction sauce. Ask for Tristan if your going for dinner, he provided great service all evening long. This was from start to finish the best dinner I have ever had.
Fabulous place!  Ate at a few restaurants in Nawlins, and this one was the best.  Really cozy and cool spot, solid service, and great food.  The gumbo was amazing, in particular.
Very good. Happy hour $.50 oysters are where it's at. Great cocktails. Delicious desserts. Always a fav place to stop while in New Orleans.
Perfect Dinner, very family friendly. Coming from Germany and having traveled a week. This was the best food. And: thanks to Nick and Nick. The service was perfect too!

Visited this restaurant  because of the great reviews seen on yelp, it totally lived up to every word. 

We came in at 1030am for brunch. I ordered the shrimp and grits which was DIVINE! My friend ordered the Southern  breakfast with a side of mimi's pancakes.  This was also delicious and the bacon was cooked to perfection, crispy and smoky..

We had Mimosas to top it off and quench our thirst. Overall, the atmosphere  was cozy and our waiter Thomas was attentive enough but not intrusive. We will definitely  come again and would recommend it to anyone visiting  NOLA.

Their happy hour menu has only oysters on it...but that is all you need, my friend.  

The oysters are the freshest of all the places we tried in Nola - comes with cocktail sauce, whipped horseradish and lemon.  75cents a piece!  

The fried oysters are light and crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  Some of the best fried oysters I've ever tried - these were a little over a buck a piece.

All their cocktails and draft beer were half off.  If you join them outside of happy hour times, their other food looks amazing as well.  Prices are a bit expensive - they're a nice restaurant though - which I didn't expect at first.  Great for date night but also good for groups - they have a whole upstairs area.

I really want to like this place more than I do. The host staff could be nicer but I get the impression that they're so busy they don't really care if they're welcoming or not. I've had better experiences during lunch in general then happy hour or dinner. The bar area is not separated by much from the dining area and so if you're seated at the bar you tend to get jostled a lot from behind when it's full. That's a real turn off for me. Food's tasty, staff a little cold in general. Oysters are a good happy hour deal by local standards and excellent when compared to Florida and other cities. The bisque is one of the best I've ever had. The beer is definitely worth a try, if you're interested.

There's no better way to end your stay in New Orleans than a fancy Sunday brunch with good ol' Southern cuisine. We made last minute reservations and luckily had to wait only 10-15 minutes, although it helps it was only a group of 3 of us.

--Buttermilk Fried Quail - don't think about what you're eating and just do it. It's fancy fried chicken really, that's hard to mess up. Come with 3 so it good to share among a small group.

--Fried Chicken and Biscuit - still drooling about this dish as the chicken was incredibly tender inside. The biscuit is different as it seems more like a glazed puff pastry. I wish they gave you a Tabasco honey dispenser to  top off the dish as much as you want because it was incredibly addicting.

--Shrimp and Grits - literally still don't know what grits are as a sheltered Northerner but I'll buy into it. This place does it well and it tastes like mashed potatoes' Southern cousin topped with andouille sausage, and of course we had to add poached eggs on top. This dish definitely sets my standard from now on.

My friends seemed to love their crab bisque and soft shell crab. I still chuckle to myself that the servers and staff wear lab/clinic coats as their attire. Our guy was very apologetic that we kept missing out on the complimentary soft baked bread as it kept running short. Props to him though as he seemed to have literally grabbed them from the oven to rush em over to us mid-meal. I wish I had room for dessert since the pics look amazing. Prices are slightly higher as expected, but reasonable enough to recommended though.t

Outstanding food! Service was a little slow but the food made up for it.
It was slam packed when I went there. I had the shrimp and grits which were exquisite and the bread pudding for dessert. Both were recommended by the waiter and they did not disappoint!

I will definitely hit this place I my next visit to NOLA!

We read about the great happy hour at this place, and so we decided to try it on my first trip to New Orleans.  First, let me say that we were sitting at the bar, and Jamie was the bartender that evening.  She was so friendly and helpful, I have to credit her for a great start to our vacation.  The Oysters were some of the best we have ever had - but even better than that was the fact that they not only make their own cocktail sauce, but they even make their own horseradish!  It definitely makes a HUGE difference!  She whipped up some amazing drinks - and even let us sample some of their delicious brandy-soaked cherries she was using for one of the most popular drinks.

I am just sorry we didn't have more time in New Orleans, and couldn't get back to Luke's again and again.  

You MUST go for their great happy hour - and have dinner there as well.  We'll definitely be back if we get to New Orleans again!!!!

Luke has a fabulous happy hour (75 cent oysters  and half price drinks) . The P&J oysters are so fresh and delicious and they shuck them so perfectly that the oyster liquer stays in the shell..giving you that salty umami mouth feel.  Ordered the shrimp gnocchi (Harry style- extra fried shrimp on top) and my husband had the pork schnitzel.  Both were good..but the.pork was the standout. Awesome gravy in the side and A HUGE portion. The bread pudding was the BEST we've ever had. Topped with glazed pecans and caramel overflowing from the dish. Great value if you want to try some of John Besh's dishes without spending a small fortune.

Best shrimp and grits I have EVER had. And I usually don't care for grits. 
The portion is huge so I ordered half of it to be packed up to go.
The shrimp and grits served at Lüke is the best meal I've in New Orleans. I can see why they say it is their most popular item.
Love John Besh, great Croc Monseur. Definitely a fan of our lunch here.

John Besh is one of my favorite chefs and just all around a pretty awesome guy that has been true to his roots so I had pretty high expectations for months leading up to a trip to New Orleans.  I chose Luke this go around over his other restaurants in the area because I had heard about Oyster happy hour.  Our entire experience did not disappoint!  We started with some extremely fresh raw and fried oysters during happy hour so we got them at the happy hour price.  The friend oysters took a little extra time so they actually ended up taking them off the bill with no complaints from us just because they felt it was the right thing to do.  My boyfriend and I shared the shrimp and grits with the crab.  Don't question it...ADD THE CRAB!  It would have been delicious without but it took it to a whole new level.  My boyfriend is NOT a fan of grits but these jalapeno cheddar grits completely converted him. We also shared some frites which were quite delicious but I had wished I had not added those so I could have had room for dessert.  Lastly I have to say the cocktail list was pretty unusual and the happy hour pricing certainly made it easy to try several!  My new favorite is the French 75!  I have tried with little success to have it made for me back home.  The cocktail alone is worth a trip to Luke in my opinion!  Came home with an autographed copy of My New Orleans so we can't wait to cook our way through New Orleans at home and relive our meal at Luke!

MAKE THIS A STOP!!!!!!!

I felt that was necessary to put in the first line of this review.  This was recommended restaurant while in the Big Easy and I am so glad we listened.  We visited this location on a Sunday around 2:30pm and it was pretty busy.  It was Halloween weekend and a home game for the Saints.  For just two of us was a wait of 45 minutes.  We lucked up and got a seat at the bar right in front of the shucking station.  

While sitting at the bar we were able to see alot of food being delivered to everyone's tables and I must say EVERYTHING LOOKED GOOD.  My friend got the Shrimp and Grits which is suppose to be one their best dishes along with their oysters.  I didn't want to get the same thing and I decided upon the Crab omelette and the seafood gumbo as an appetizer.

The gumbo was delicious!  Some of the best I had while in the French Quarters.  And trust me I had alot of good gumbo during my 5 days here.  It wasn't runny and cling to the rice as GUMBO SHOULD.  It had sausage, shrimp and mussels ;)  Talk about perfect.  The gumbo was so good I literally came back about 5 hours later to get some more to go.  I am not exaggerating !  

My crab omelette arrived shortly after and the presentation along had me sold.  The eggs were perfect and so light and fluffy.  Inside the omelette their was cheese, crab, tomatoes, and mushrooms.  The crab meat was so sweet and perfectly seasoned. They really set the bar for a good omelette.  The dressing on the salad was so light and full of flavor.

The employees that work at the restaurant is what really sealed the deal for me.   The staff really works together to make sure their customers enjoy their experience.  I could really tell everyone really enjoy their jobs.  

Thank you Luke for the amazing experience!  I will be a return customer EVERY TIME I come back to Nawlins :)

This restaurant was very unexpected. We were walking by and were hungry so we got seated right away even without a reservation. The food was amazing. The best was the Brussel sprouts! Omg! I just can't even begin to tell you how good they were. For my main course I had the fish and it was delicious as well. I would rate the service and quality of food 10 stars if I could! Food is semi pricey but worth the money.

Colorado Springs is a dead town for foodies and as a New Yorker in exile I suffer greatly. Thankfully I have escaped franchise hell and am visiting New Orleans - a town that completely understands and creates amazing food.

Luke is perfect. Great vibe, great ambiance, great staff and of course great food. Shane was our server tonight and he was awesome. He spent some time in Boulder so we had great conversations. I had the crab and corn fritters which were ridiculously good. Wild bore for dinner which had amazing flavor.

Sadly, no room for dessert. 5 stars without question!
Good place for group meal or family gathering!! Fresh seafood!!

Luke's restaurant was amazing! My husband and I came for our anniversary and the service was excellent!! Shawn and Uusi were so friendly and recommended the best dishes for us to try. We had the crab fritter's which was crispy on the outside and perfectly cooked and seasoned on the inside. We also had the shrimp and grit which were God sent!! The shrimp and grit were the best meal I had in New Orelans!! They were perfectly seasoned the grits were light fluffy and cheesy, and they just the right amount of shrimp and sausage. I will recommend Luke to all my family and friend. Great food, amazing service and a cool bistro atmosphere!! We love Luke!!

Had been suffering from Luke withdrawal since our last trip to N.O. during JazzFest 2010.  Yes I bought John Besh's first cookbook and have enjoyed making many of the recipes - but I have been craving Luke's redfish court-boullion (Friday special) and have been nervous about tackling the recipe. 
Husband and I were recently on a chartered cruise that had a port stop in New Orleans - on a Tuesday. A few weeks prior I contacted the restaurant with a special request for the court-boullion for lunch on that day.  There was a nice email exchange with a couple of folks and the answer was a very gracious YES and I was so excited!
Our lunch that day at Luke was the absolute highlight of our wonderful but too short visit to the city. Our server Savannah was absolutely delightful - I thanked her for accommodating my special request (I don't think I've ever ordered "off the menu" before so this for me was a very special request). She explained that they always like to accommodate special requests ***as long as they are given ample notice*** which I think is so generous. And certainly I would never have requested the court-boullion last minute, after all, I've seen the recipe!!! Anyway we settled in and husband ordered the crispy Brussels sprouts - so delicious and imaginatively prepared. He also ordered the wiener schnitzel that he fondly remembered from previous visits - it was fork tender with a crispy yummy crust - huge portion. I ordered the crab bisque to accompany the redfish court-boullion. Am not exaggerating when I say that the bisque was the most delicious soup I have ever tasted. The court-boullion may have even been better than I remember - the flavor combination is unique and such a taste treat. We also enjoyed a unique appetizer of pate with various mustards and relishes.  Okay - then it gets even better. We ordered the bread pudding - but of course, because I remembered it to be the very best anywhere. It still is the very best anywhere. The sauce is killer - a butter rum goooooooey ooze of deliciousness with crispy sugared roasted pecans all over, with a huge scoop of homemade vanilla ice cream on top. Oh no, and we also were served a warm cherry apple strudel with salted caramel ice cream on the side.  I am salivating just remembering all this while writing.  
Needless to say, our experience went far beyond our already high expectations.  We were treated like royalty- or maybe dear family (even better) by Savannah and staff, we were thanked by the assistant manager as we left.  All in all it was an unforgettable experience and we cannot wait to return.

Brunch or oysters here are 5 stars alone. They had a ridiculous HH special for their oysters and I had the best Bloody Mary to date at Luke when I went for brunch before watching the saints crush the Giants.

Came here for breakfast and got their shrimp and grits. It was covered with a little gumbo and topped with two sunny side-up eggs. Fantastic food. The coffee was excellent.  Service was a little cold.

I was in a group of 8 people and had an awesome experience, this was all because of our waiter Kenny! He was so awesome and made sure we had everything we needed for dinner. The drinks were great and the food was also. Make sure you get ice-cream for dessert.

There's many factors that goes into making a restaurant a great one.  Near the top of any list would have to be consistency.  Luke hits that one out of the park.  Took about a two year hiatus from Luke (not for any particular reason) went again a week ago and it was like I had never left.  Casual, relaxed atmosphere, very good professional service, and the food was of a high level.  Cold seafood, bisque, steak, fries all still top notch.  Their remoulade sauce with the cold jumbo shrimp may be the best I've had.  Crab beignets and fish amandine were certainly good, but maybe not quite to the level of the aforementioned dishes.  A bonus is that since it's connected to a hotel it's open all day and you can go there in a tux or cargo shorts and you'd be equally comfortable.

Best meal we had in New Orleans.  Staff was friendly and engaging.  Wait was long but the bar staff kept us entertained as we watched football. Drinks were well made.  If you like pate you are in for a treat.  Chicken on biscuit was excellent.  Really all 7 of us had fantastic meals. You can't go wrong here!
Good food. Bistro atmosphere. Brussels sprouts were a favorite.  Staff was busy not overly friendly.  Good drinks. Would go back for the food.
Great food and super friendly staff. We had flummenkuchen, salads, steak & etouffe and would have them again.
Went again in NOLA and had the Wednesday special of jambalaya. Again, one of the best dishes I have. You really can't go wrong with the daily specials!

In terms of the experience-to-price ratio, Luke's breakfast asymptotically approached zero.

Our initial cup of coffee was, not ironically, lukewarm. It was eventually replaced, but only sporadically filled. (It bears mentioning that our server was managing exactly two tables.) The toast also was no better than room temperature - incidentally about 65 degrees - and it was replaced as well. The yogurt and granola featured no more than three tablespoons of insubstantial, powdery granola and perhaps half a cup of berries for $12. This stood in stark contrast to the previous evening's uniformly outstanding experience at Emeril's, at which no detail was overlooked.

The server predictably made no accommodation on our bill for either transgression, and so it was that we left $34 poorer, literally and metaphorically.

Our first day in Louisiana and after only small bites all day we picked to have dinner at Luke. 

We got there at 7pm as a walk in and was offered a  table with a leak from the roof or wait until 8; we went with the leaking table.

Right when we sat down our server comes and we order wine and stuffed oysters. He comes back with the wine and we add on the cold seafood platter. I'm not sure how long we waited but the server comes back and says the appetizers are taking a little long and asked if we wanted something else in the meantime. We order the Brussels sprout and shrimp and grits. 

Our seafood platter comes out. We finish and we wait. We flag down our server to check in on the first appetizer and he goes he knows what happened, mix up with neighbors food. He said it should be coming out right now. As we wait our neighbors put in their orders. 

Finally our stuffed oysters come out and we down those as our neighbor receives all of their food. We anticipate our meals should be coming as we ordered way before them and happy we got some food to hold us over. We wait and wait. It's 8:30, an hour and half since we got there. Our neighbors are practically done. The Server hasn't come to check in on us. My husband wants to cancel the food, but I was so hungry as we hadn't eaten all day so I said let's wait a little longer. 8:45 still no food or server in sight. I flag down another server. I tell him to please cancel our food as it has not come out hoping to catch food at another place. Even he thinks we are on our dessert and I say no, our entrees never came out. He apologizes, notifies our server. 

Our server comes back with the bill and says as if he did us a favor, I took the food off your bill. (Of course you did, I NEVER got it.) As he was about to put down the bill he second guesses and says I'll take some more off. Comes back and says he took off a glass of wine and asks us to give them another try. Said he was embarrassed and did put in our order and kitchen was backed up. (Reminder, our neighbor ordered after us and got their food. They actually ordered everything we ordered!)

As we sat and debated about tipping for a good 15 minutes (My husband still wanted to but I didn't feel there was any customer service to warrant a tip)  Our server comes back with a new receipt with 2 wine and 1 appetizer taken off our tab with no word. I figured decent enough gesture I paid/tipped. I'm in the restaurant industry so always try to be compassionate, but after 2 hours and leaving hungry, I was upset and surprised it was the first time I did not want to tip.

Suggestions: 
1. Offer to rush the food! Get it out!
2. A manager should have been notified and stopped by the table.
3. Offer a voucher or gift card (even just a for a drink or $5) to ask customer to come back, not just on your word or items comped. 

Food:
Seafood platter like any other cold platter. Ceviche was just ok and don't expect the shrimp to be peeled. Cocktail sauce had a nice kick to it.
Stuffed oysters were perfect. Just enough mayo mixed in with crab to top the oyster. Texture and taste was on point. Even then it could not make up the disappointment in the overall experience.

Unless I'm here for happy hour oysters (everyday between 3-6) the price doesn't match what I'm eating. The happy hour oysters price went up recently from 50 cents each to 75 cents each. Maybe that's to get rid of people who aren't as fancy as the building suggests should be like me. Blind Pelican down the street offers much cheaper happy hour oysters now.

Well I have to say I have hated brussel sprouts since I was a kid but after trying them here.... oh my I have a new favorite vegetable.  I could go on and on about how good the shrimp and grits are here or how fantastic the shrimp etouffee is over pasta but for Luke I will keep is short and sweet and just say if the chefs here boiled a hot dog it would probably be the best hot dog you ever had in your life.  If this place isnt on your bucket list put it on because it really is a 5 star must try.

Had the gumbo, jumbo Louisiana shrimp "en cocotte" and steamed chocolate for dessert. This was the best shrimp and grits I've ever had and I've had a lot of shrimp and grits. Would definitely go back for their happy hour. Also, I'm a big advocate of John Besh restaurants and wasn't disappointed.

We ended up here for dinner because our aunt was craving for some proper shrimp and grits. Lüke came up on my search and basing from the pictures previously posted - this is the place for that.

We posted up the bar right away and ordered couple of beers. We got an order of dozen oysters (which were part of HH, $.75 pp), pate and split an order of shrimp and grits. Btw, from what I gather - you need a reservation for the main dining room. So snag a bar spot as soon as one opens.

Oysters were big and clean tasting. It's not the sweetest I've had (Kumamoto oysters fans anyone?!) but not bad. It's good for the money, that's for sure! The pate was good - it's not strong flavored but more well rounded. The condiments it came with was a nice touch as well. Now, for the star of dinner - Shrimp and Grits. They were kind enough to split the order into two plates and I was blown away by the portion! Their grits was light, fluffy, creamy and cheesy paired with the red eye gravy plus the big shrimps - it was just glorious!! Even with the half portion it made me full. Definitely a must try dish at Lüke's! 

All in all, I would give this place a 4 stars and a fun experience from one of Chef John Besh's restaurants :)

loved the oysters!! the service was MMMEEHH!! most of the time I wondered if the server forgot about us...this happens alot there! I liked their crispy brussel sprouts! all in all GOOD FOOD! come back just for that!

Probably one of my favorite places to get oysters in the city! It's usually fresh and fast! Getting a table can sometimes be difficult but just sneak in and find a seat at the bar you'll get served right away. Get their crab bisque, it's solid!

Saw chef John Besh being interviewed on network TV, so I decided to come to Luke to find out what the hype was.  

Beautiful restaurant in an old school look.  Excellent service.  I had the shrimp cavatelli etouffee with extra fried shrimp on top.  The cavatelli with cheese was ok, didn't need the extra shrimp which didn't add anything to the dish.  The bread pudding was excellent.  

Should have ordered the gumbo.

Great breakfast spot..food was top notch, did not give 5 stars, other than the hostess claimed it would be 20 min wait when 10 + tables were open the entire time. We ate at the bar and service was great..

My fiancé and I were visiting New Orleans from Philadelphia last weekend and could only manage to squeeze this place in for happy hour- but I'm so glad that we did. The service was so welcoming and timely- and in the one instance when a cocktail that we ordered took a little long, our server took it off the check. Since we were eating light we went with happy hour oysters and the fried oyster salad, which they split into two separate bowls without us having to ask. Both were delicious and the thick-cut bacon in the salad alone was something to marvel at. 

We finished with the warm bread pudding and I can honestly say that in October 2016, when we return for our wedding, I'll make sure to stop by in the midst of all the craziness to have it again- it may have been the best dessert I have EVER had.

Had an excellent dinner!  So much flavor.  We started with crispy Brussels sprouts and buttermilk fried quail.  They were both excellent.  For our main course we had Luke burger and the grilled swordfish.  Both were delicious.  But my favorite of the night was the extra side we ordered of jalapeño grits.  Wow very delicious!  I was not a fan of grits until last night! John Besh you converted me to a grits lover!  My favorite meal so far in NOLA!  We had an extra special surprise our table was located up against a large window looking in on the kitchen!  Such a treat!

Loved the 75-cent oysters for happy hour! We sat at the bar and Sean gave us the VIP treatment. Quality was great and service was outstanding. Definitely our best dining experience while we were in New Orleans

We had tried to eat here around 6pm without a reservation but they were booked for the whole night which seemed crazy. We decided to put in a reservation for tomorrow around 8:45 pm which was the only time slot for the night. 

We sit down and wait for about a good 10 min before someone came to take our order. Which was ok since we were talking to each other. We ordered the fried quail which was amazing. It was fried to perfection and it was glazed in a sweet maple syrup which added the perfect blend of flavors and spices. She got the crab bisque which also was made to perfection and I only got one spoon full since that was all my girlfriend would let me have. I had eaten so much gumbo, étouffée, crawfish and seafood yesterday I wanted a burger. I ordered the burger which was really good but there is one thing I didn't like so much. The fries that come with the burger were way too thin and crunchy and this is my opinion. 

Other than that the food was great and it all depends what you order. This place did not receive five stars from me because of the service. Our waiter was slow and if it wasn't for other waiters helping out we wouldn't have had refills as much as we did. The bill was around 75$.

Delicious - completely worth it and I would eat here again and highly recommend.
We had the buttermilk fried quail, flammekuchen, shrimp and grits and the bread pudding

All were great! Super creamy and tasty grits - top quality. You must get the bread pudding!!!
Great food and service.  I had the shrimp and grits  and added crab and shaved back truffles.  Legit!

Loved the etouffee and the shrimp and grits.  Our party of 5 had a great business dinner together (with 2 bottles of wine among us), and the check was reasonable.  Lively and jovial, but not too loud to have a conversation.

I was in town for business and too tired to venture out and find something. Since I was staying at the Hilton next door, I decided to go out of convenience. I thought I would keep it simple with a burger and a beer. I'm always a sucker for a good burger!  I'll say that the burger meat itself was cooked to perfection (medium) with some great smokey flavor. However, the accompaniments were not so impressive. The bacon was limp, there was very little cheese, the bun was dry and crumbly, and the fries were barely warm and limp. If they had taken the time to prepare everything properly, it could have been amazing. For an $18 burger, I expect there to be a little more attention to detail.

A must go for happy hour if you want quality oysters (75 cents otherwise about double that price). The salad Luke's creamy dressing was also nice. This won't seem like a burger place but get a burger and fries- you will thank me later.

One more checkmark on the list of Besh restaurants!  This cute little brasserie makes me think of a bustling foreign area (I've never been to France but that's the definitely the vibe they're going for).  The seafood is on ice front and center at the bar, the small tables are quite close together, and people were coming in from the rain and shaking off, it kind of felt like a movie :)  We had a party of 4, and our two waiters were busy busy busy that night.  One of them was named Kenny, but I'm not sure of the other one.  They were helpful, but not the most attentive.  We started off with 2 dozen oysters, char-broiled, and an order of the Brussels sprouts (GET THEM THEY ARE SO GOOD).  Drinks were had by all, mostly wine, but I think someone had a scotch or whiskey maybe.  For meals, two of our party had the steak, I had the roast chicken, and the other person had an oyster salad.  Everyone else's meals were very good, mine was good but overly salty and the menu said it came with vegetables but there were no vegetables to be seen, just potatoes and chicken.  I was bummed that we were going to an event and couldn't take extra food home in a doggie-bag, because the chicken was great.   For dessert one couple shared the apple pie, and we shared the creme brulee.  So good!  
 Glad I got to experience this little Besh restaurant, overall happy with the service, food, and atmosphere.

At 3 PM everyday, it is $.50 gulf oysters on the half shell. Decent presentation, but nothing crazy. The corn and crab bisque was delicious and the Sammie's are good. Waitstaff was friendly and decently quick despite it being busy. $.50 oysters are they key here, 7 days a week!

Usually I only post reviews when I'm over the top about a place but Luke and chef John Besh are so well known I feel obligated to be painfully honest. The service was mediocre. We tried a wide range of small plates and one entree. The flavors were all too heavy handed, overwhelming the food itself. Only thing we really loved was the rabbit and chicken liver pate.
However I must say I'm now adding to this review to say I appreciate the prompt courteous response from the Mgr. A lesser restaurant I would not have held to as high a standard. Would definitely give Luke another try.

This place is unassuming. A little more modernized than your local NOLA hole-in-the-wall.

What We Ordered: the most savory, tasty brussel sprouts ever. Order them - you won't regret it.
The mussels. Above average. Good buttery broth.
Seafood Gumbo - so tasty. Great flavors and consistency. Not overly salted. It was my boyfriends first gumbo experience... He wanted to lick that plate so bad.

Service was friendly. Hostesses were charming. Cool, laid back atmosphere geared towards the older crowd.
We just came for dessert but what a treat we received!  The Creme brûlée with fresh fruit accents was incredible!  Can't wait to return to try out their dinner menu!

Generally love this place. Today they were a bit off. Seriously cold fries which they replaced immediately. Service a little slow.  Could be due to shift change. But on the plus side the French 75s are to die for.  Hubby loves the gumbo. Will certainly be back soon.
Everything from atmosphere to food and service were impeccable. Oysters were amazing, shrimp and grits to die for, delicious steak. Bread pudding to finish off this feast was insane!!!!

Fine dining prices with terrible service does not make a great meal. Our waiter took forever to greet us and seemed completely disinterested once he finally did. He got both of my parent's orders wrong and they had thoroughly discussed their food allergies and sensitivities with him while ordering. The pacing of the meal was totally off; entrees were brought as appetizers and appetizers as entrees. Once it was set right, the food was all very good but the service left us all with a bad taste. I don't think I'll be returning.

Pros: Seafood Gumbo, Shrimp w/Grits, Brussel Sprouts, Bread Pudding
Cons: Onion Tart appetizer had ANISE (didn't specify that on the menu), service was spotty
Great food, classy decor, but really noisy. I think this place is a bit overrated but I certainly enjoyed it and could see myself coming back.

Hands down the best restaurant for a anniversary! Our severs Chi & Shane made sure our night was perfect. Right when we sat down, we received complementary glass of champagne---amazing. We started with the crab bisque to split. It was overflowing with lump crab meat. Couldn't get enough of it! For dinner, I got the mussels and they were dynamite. They came in a buttery thyme sauce and I couldn't stop dipping bread and fries into it haha. My boyfriend got the infamous Lüke burger. It was so juicy and good. The fries were hand downs awesome. Love that they are shoe string style. You get enough in one order to split! For dessert we decided to get the creme brûlée to split. That was to die for. It came with fruit on top. We got the bill and noticed the restaurant comped our dessert! We will definitely be back and will ask for Chi and Shane!
Dining here would be cool maybe if it didn't come with a side of waiters talking about how they would fuck me. Y'all are around a corner, my boyfriend and  I can still hear you assholes.
Jumbo shrimp does not have any flavor but being salty. Happy hour has cheap and good oysters.
Elizabeth and Tristan were amazing!! And the thanksgiving dinner was excellent. Terrific service, delicious meal. Try the Sazerac cocktail to start and the Kumanmoto oysters if they have em.

Cozy french seafood bistro with strong German influence. Amaze balls Brussels sprouts appetizer but the highlight of the place are the oyster shuckers. Make sure you seat by them for good ol French quarter good time.
One of our very best dining experiences ever!! Enjoyed the turducken and rib eye for thanksgiving dinner. Best bread pudding ever and the drinks were delicious! Go there now!!

Love this place! Perfect seasoning.  Delicate flavors. Nice service.  Delicious drinks.  Beautiful ambiance.  got fresh and fried oysters.  Both fresh. Friday's lunch special is outstanding!  It is seafood tomato cream based stew. Incredibly delicious!  
I take a star for being on the pricey side.

Lüke made my honeymoon amazing!
We both love the food sooooo much!
The service is much more than excellent! 
They offered us champagne and dessert for free. And their bread pudding is amazing! Must try it!
We went for their happy hour oysters, they are good for its price.
Overall, we love lÜke! It's service is unlike those "French Quarter" service, which means servers are busy and they got no time to even check on you. Lüke's servers provide really personal service!
Love love it! Will be back for sure!

Had a rough previous night, so I needed a little hair of the dog. We stopped in here to order some to go Bloody Mary's. The bartender was really cool and that we looked like hell, so he helped us out with an extra shot of vodka on top. It was a delicious Bloody Mary and definitely helped the rest of my day.
