Came here for brunch during vacation. After reading the reviews I expected it to be absolutely fabulous but it was definitely a bit of a disappointment. The decor and service were impeccable I have nothing to say about that but the brunch selection was ehh. I was hoping for an amazing french toast or poached egg but other than some scambled eggs everything was pretty much a lunch option. The woman next to me must have been a little disappointed too because she asked the waiter to see if they could make her French toast but he said they could not make it for her. Seemed a little crazy since they just made it 20 minutes before for breakfast.  We started with the Brussel sprouts, crab bisque, and gumbo. The Brussel sprouts were delicious. The crab bisque and gumbo could have been much better. The gumbo tasted more like red beans and rice than anything. Then we shared the chicken and bisquit which was the biggest disappointment. The chicken was no better than anywhere else and the bisquit at popeyes is better than the one we had there. Maybe if we came for breakfast or lunch we would of had a better experience
By far my favorite happy hour in New Orleans. Such a friendly staff, and the oysters are always delicious!

Very cool restaurant with old look, been there for lunch, got good portion of food, Luke burger actually was really good, mussels taste delicious as well. Little bit overprice for ragout and shrimps. But the rest so far so good.
Great food and staff was very attentive. The raw oysters and gumbo were excellent. I think I had the Luke breakfast, which was good but my friends' meals by far exceeded my expectations.
Good raw and fresh oysters. .. bar staff was great... Happy hour prices that you can't beat ....looking foward to future visit to try tower
Went here for happy hour and got fried oysters & desserts. We were very pleased with the pricing , service and atmosphere . Would def go again. Thanks staff :)

This place is great for oysters. We came here mainly for their oyster happy hour and they were some of the freshest we've ever had. Not fishy at all. We also had their cocktails which were all amazing. Very complex. The only other thing on the menu that we tried was the brussels sprouts. Mind blowing. So, so good. I wish we had gotten to try the rest of their menu but we already had dinner reservations at another restaurant later that evening. Will definitely be coming back  on our next trip to New Orleans.

Stopped by for lunch. The ambiance is nice and the staff is very friendly. Prices are mid to mi-hugh, but hehe food was delicious. We had a burger and the friends chicken lunch special which came with crab bisque, which was creamy with big chunks of crab. The menu is not too huge so picking great lunch or dinner for old is not complicated.

We initially came across this restaurant because it was on the ground floor of our hotel, however a local friend of mine had also highly recommended it for their great happy hour. While we were there last summer, the happy hour was $.50 oysters as well as drink specials. At the time, I did not partake in the oysters, but that was a big mistake. Everybody who had the oysters raved about them. The drinks we had were also very good and appropriately priced for happy hour. The ambience of the restaurant was complete with a nice display of the fresh seafood. I cannot wait to go back and enjoy the oysters.

Whether you are on a date, with your parents, or with a group, Lüke is a wonderful, low-key spot.  It's a bit pricey for what it is, but it's the kitchen serves excellent, homey food.  It can get very busy so be sure to make a reservation.

The gumbo was spot-on although I'm not sure there's actually much difference between the $7 cup and the $10 bowl.  Even better was the Louisiana Shrimp "en Cocotte," which is their version of shrimp and grits.  The grits were cheesy and they were covered with shrimp, sausage, and a rich, flavorful sauce.

The drink menu includes NOLA classics like a Sazerac and French 75, was well as newer concotions (at least to me).  The Bufala Negra (Buffalo Trace bourbon, basil, balsamic vinegar, and ginger ale) was a great drink that stood up well to the rich foods.

The only item anyone at our table ordered that didn't go over well was the fried oyster salad, but I think that was more based on the individual not understanding what she was ordering rather than the dish itself.

Update: This restaurant was truly amazing in remedying an unfortunate situation. I was contacted almost immediately and management was very kind and attentive. They took my issue seriously and that meant a lot to me. My partner and I returned for dinner last night and were truly blown away. The service was excellent, shout out to Shawn and Vusi y'all were amazing.The food and drinks were also amazing. Highly recommend the stuffed oysters, shrimp and roasted jalapeño grits, and steamed chocolate. 


Dining here would be cool maybe if it didn't come with a side of waiters talking about how they would fuck me. Y'all are around a corner, my boyfriend and  I can still hear you assholes.

Luke is smaller restaurant located in the Hilton (the Hilton is a cool hotel that used to be a Masonic Lodge, go check it out).

I always head to Luke to check out their oyster bar teeming with ice and to enjoy a cocktail...they make the best French 75 in the city (with Cognac and cherry).  Wow!  

The food is American with a french twist.  I have had the Croque (fantastic), the oysters (fantastic), and the burger (fantastic).  This is a more formal french style restaurant...not over the top pretentious, but it is a classy place, with folks in jackets and dresses...so dress accordingly.

The service is excellent with the staff and others (managers, etc.) always stopping by to ask how things are.  They know how to take care of you at Luke!

Luke is a good value for the money, great food, and outstanding cocktails (try that French 75!).  You can eat at the bar, but it is a small bar with folks standing around waiting on their table.

One piece of advice:  GET A RESERVATION as this is a smaller restaurant and you probably will not get in as a walk in.

Luke nails it.

Delicious and rich! We stopped in for a Sunday morning breakfast. The atmosphere is lovely, the service was courteous and fast, and the prices are pretty reasonable. My partner got the crab omelette, and even without cheese it was "the best omelette she'd ever had". I had the fried oyster salad which was decadent with just enough greens to make it feel slightly healthy.

Food was so so.. Split some apps with coworkers, Brussels sprouts were good... We were not aware there were not free refills on fountain drinks and rang up a $20 bill on club soda, very annoying.  We were also freezing the whole time

I was in town for a conference and staying at the Hilton, so Luke was a clear choice. It was quite busy (definitely make reservations ahead) but the service was amazing! The waiters were very attentive and food arrived fast. Now for the food- it was superb! I tried shrimp and grits, and shrimp was cooked perfectly, roasted jalapeño grits were a little spicy and cheesy, and the chocolate bourbon pecan tart was sensational (the coconut ice cream complemented the sweetness of the tart). I am most definitely coming back here next time I am in town.
Nick V was absolutely amazing, charming, and the service was outstanding. Food was amazing... He even hooked us up with free desert

I love the location of this restaurant, it was right next to the hotel we were staying at (Le Pavillon)

The food was delicious! you definitely have to get the grits and the baked oysters! The restaurants ambiance was nice and fancy, service was good too.

Happy hour is from 3-6, and it gets booked fast so make a reservations!

Wow to this restaurant. If you come to NOLA and you're looking to eat somewhere romantic or nice with good service and outstanding dishes, then this is your go to place! 

The hostess was also every accommodating given I had no reservations. Very kind employees, clean restaurant, great food, and service.

The interior feels like it's part of an old, classic, and fancy hotel. It's small but cozy. The service is nice. There are revolving doors at the entrance but they don't work.

This restaurant focuses solely on food although breakfast is in the category. They don't have anything else beyond coffee and tea, which was fine. 

I ordered the fried chicken biscuit. It was the most expensive $14 biscuit I ever bought. The fried chicken was entirely tasteless. Maybe that's what the honey was for. However, the meal came with a pile of grits that had a subtle salty taste and grainy texture I enjoyed. The biscuits were baked well. Everything but the chicken was great.

Ok so mixed review. Really good food but the service...not so sure! My friends and I ordered the special that day - fried chicken & Tabasco honey. Apparently the chef that owns this restaurant is known for this chicken. Twenty minutes go by after our order and our waiter comes by to let us know they are out of the chicken. Really? You couldn't have let us know sooner? We then make a comment about seeing a picture online of the etouffee pasta and the waiter tells us he will check if the chef can make it even though it is not currently on the menu (nice of him). He checks and the chef says yes. We then order fries while we wait. Our food comes and the waiter never brought our fries. He never refilled my water or really checked in. Maybe he was just having an off day. Ok so the etouffee pasta was DELICIOUS! It felt lighter than any of the other ones I had in New Orleans. One of my friends got the shrimp and grits and really enjoyed her dish. I would come again but was turned off by the lack of attentiveness from our waiter.

3.5 stars.  Side note -- I ordered my food to go.
I was staying around the corner at a hotel and was exhausted from traveling all day so decided I just wanted to eat in.  I frequent New Orleans often for work and always start out my trip with a nice gumbo.  When I checked out the rest of the menu, I saw they had shrimp and grits as well and decided to get both to snack on for the night and leftovers the next day.  The shrimp and grits were great.  Very good consistency and flavor profile throughout the entire dish.  But thank God I decided to get two dishes -- the gumbo was legit terrible.  It wasn't even what I would consider warm!  I understand with any to go order that's almost a bargain you take, but my shrimp and grits were hot and tasty, with the gumbo this odd like warm room temperature.  I even showed up 10min prior to my promise time -- I can't imagine had I arrived right at my promise time.  Really poor flavor profile as well, just a let down.  It was also really awkward trying to pick my to go order up at the bar, way too crowded to get through anywhere, but that's what I get for going during happy hour and I was already exhausted so I'll chalk that up to just being irritable.  I may try it out again but would definitely eat in as opposed to order out.

Food is very fresh and delicious, and service was quite poor, which lowered our rating. Fruits de mer was good and a very nice selection with excellent jumbo Gulf shrimp. Brussels sprouts tasty but over priced, chowder exquisite.  Bread pudding light and rich. Hard to find service people on a Thursday night.

Visiting New Orleans and made reservations at Luke for my boyfriend's 30th birthday.  Good food isn't always hard to find, but paired with incredible thoughtful service? I was blown away and really touched by the effort the service staff made and how special our dinner was. They brought champagne to our table when we were seated and the hostesses helped me surprise my boyfriend with ordering a birthday dessert.

I had a great meal. Really great. REALLY great. 

Life affirming great. 

Called ahead 

Wish I could eat more because it was really good. Got a call in the middle of my lunch from a former NYAG, and had to take it. When I went back, not as hungry. If anyone hears of a dead former NYAG, it was me.

Friendly people, good atmosphere, nice decor. Hard to say "Fabulous Food" in NOLA, with so many great choices, but this place has Fabulous Food.

Eat here. It's good.

Absolutely fantastic!! They spoiled us, it was great food and great service. Elizabeth was our waitress and was so kind and accommodating, she brought us free appetizers and desserts!! Highly recommend!

So glad I had so many recommendations before coming to NOLA. Luke was one of the recommendations and it was right in our hotel. I went with the shrimp & grits which were delicious! What stole the show though was the Brussels sprouts. They were probably the best I have had in my entire life! What ever sauce/seasoning they use is fantastic!

We ended the meal with the delicious caramel bread pudding. I'll also add they have a happy hour from 3 to 6 with 75 cent raw oysters. Usually I'm weary about hotel restaurants, but this one was great.

this review is only for happy hour drinks and oysters:
the oysters weren't as clean,fresh and big as the oysters across the street (Trenasse) and there was very limited drinks on the happy hour menu. There were still pieces of shell on the oysters and they smelled very fishy. The fried oysters were even worse; they were very hard to chew. if you're looking for a good happy hour joint, save yourself a hassle and go across the street to Trenasse (they have much bigger, fresher, cleaner, variety of oysters). 
This place is overrated!

I am writing this review on their breakfast/brunch. I've only been for dinner once, and I prefer the breakfast. Being a creature of habit, I order the pain perdu 99% of the time. It is out of this world. Gooey mascarpone cheese, thick and delicious bacon, sweet challah bread...what more could you want?! They have a load of great stuff, so try more than me! My husband switches it up a lot and hasn't been disappointed. He prefers the shrimp and grits, though. We always bring friends and family here when they're visiting. 
Prices are decent, but no bottomless drinks for brunch. 
Wait staff is slow, but friendly. 
The interior is beautiful and stretches all the way to the back, where you can then see the cooks doing their thing.

My friends and I were drawn to Luke based on the incredible photos and reviews -- upon arrival we were thrilled to find everything even better than we imagined! From the food to the service the entire experience was incredible. Our server Nicholas V made us feel right at home and did an amazing job of answering our many questions and providing delicious menu recommendations. Luke will definitely be my first stop on my next trip to NOLA!

It was what I expected and more. Had shrimp and grits, Bloody Mary and a dozen Kumamoto oysters for breakfast. Service was excellent! I suck at reviews so just take my word and most everyone else's. Must stop for any foodie!

A must go to for happy hour and dinner! Some things on the menu are a hit, but there are many things on the menu that are a miss....choose wisely......

FOOD:
1) Shrimp and grits:
-On point!
-The grits were very creamy and the shrimp was plumped.
-The sauce was delicious, perfectly spiced!
-If you get fries, I suggest you dip it in the sauce.

2) Mussels:
-OMG DELICIOUS!! 
-The garlic has a great kick to it, you can tell it is fresh and not the jared garlic that had been sitting around for a while.
-They give you a lot and the herbs give it a perfect slaty garlic taste.
-I highly suggest you take the shells and scoop up the sauce while you slurp up the mussels. So bomb!

3) Gumbo:
-Eh, had better elsewhere.
-It wasn't as flavorful and taste bland. 
-Missing the southern spice.

RAW BAR:
4) Raw P&J oysters:
-0.75 each! definitely worth the wait and worth getting a dozen or 2 or 3 maybe even 4. 
-Down fall..the shells are very dirty so get your napkin ready!
-I didn't expect such a huge meaty piece for the price. I am not usually a fan of larger oysters because of the bottom feeder taste to it, but these were perfect. 

5) Fried oysters:
-Can't go wrong with anything fried!
-The batter was delicious, but a little on the thick side. Made the oysters look small, but still yummy.
-The tarter sauce was creamy with a hint of tart. Great match for its breaded shell.

6) Shrimp:
-Was't my favorite from the raw bar, but it was easy to peal and had a good crunch to its bite.
-They were kind of small though......

7) Thursday special: Jambalaya $17 with soup or salad
-Not a big fan of this dish. DO NOT ORDER THIS!
-I was so disappointed with this dish. I was expecting something grand since the day before I had an amazing lunch with their mussels and shrimp and grits. Was not a great way to spend my last meal in New Orleans....such a bummer.....
-It taste over cooked and the sausage was way to smoky and salty.
-There wasn't as much sauce as I would like and the corn bread taste a bit stale.

8) Crab Cake soup
-Creamy delicious!!
-LOVED the pieces of meat inside the soup. They definitely know how to deliver a cab soup with a mix of seafood worth the price!
-Although you can get this at anytime, it was included in the daily special.

SERVICE:
-The first day I went here, we had 2 brothers (forgot their names) and they were super nice and friendly, very attentive.
-The next day, we had this nasty waiter and ruined my experience that I had previously. He seemed very annoyed with us from the moment we sat down, not a great way to great your customers.
The croque madame was amazing.  Great restaurant!

AMAZING food and even though we got seated very promptly, it took a bit longer than usual to get our food and our tab :( Still, i would go back and enjoy this food again when I'm in town, the food is worth the wait for sure!

This place is a nice restaurant; very upscale and classic decor. They do take reservations so be sure to reserve ahead of time.

Due to the reviews, I ordered the shrimp and grits and the stuff O&J oysters. Both dishes were delicious! You have to order both!  

I think this is the best shrimp and grits I ever had. I absolutely love the andouille & green onion sausages and the big plump shrimps in the dish. It was so flavorful! Since this is pretty heavy dish, I recommend sharing it with another person. 

The O&J oysters were amazing. I would say it is similar to the charbroiled oysters, but on a higher level. The O&J oysters are stuffed with shrimp and crab. Can you say seafood heaven? Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.

I tried my friend's grilled ribeye and french fries. If you love thin cut crispy french fries like I do,  be sure to order some on the side. It won't disappoint.

The food here is fine, particularly the oysters. It is a bit of a cliche though, modeled on a French brasserie, and from the looks of it, focus grouped and researched heavily to hit just the right demographic in the John Besh empire. But as a result, the restaurant has no soul. Food is executed well but without imagination, and the decor is generic. The faux-French posters and other decorations look like they came straight from Pier 1 Imports. There is something overly corporate about the whole experience.

Wonderful good - rich, flavorful and the best food I had on my trip here. Have the gumbo - a great rue in this version. Skip the blue crab fritters. The Friday lunch special was amazing - highly recommend. I had several recommendations for this place; very happy with my experience there.

We had a small holiday party during lunch at Luks. They put us in a small private room that was really nice for the occasion. Staff was exceptionally friendly and patient with our crew. The big winner of the meal was the Brussels sprouts. Everyone loved them; crispy and sweet. Burger was huge and those that had it said it was great. Court bouillon was very flavorful and hot....perfect for cold weather.  I would have given 5 stars but it was very very chilly in back of building, and we were told there was no way to control the temperature.

I ordered the ribeye and it wasn't anything too exciting. Don't get me wrong, it was good but definitely something I could've cooked at home minus the $34. My waitress was also very pushy and seemed to be in such a rush to get my mom and I out of the restaurant. One time stop only
Not impressed. If your normal is macaroni grill you will like it. If you are a foodie you will be disappointed

John Besh. Brunch. You'd think you'd be in Creole heaven, but the experience was a bit dissatisfying. 

I ordered the Friday express, which included a soup or salad and an entree. I forget what it's called but it contained shrimp, oyster and a tiny crab claw. It was okay. Nothing stood out. 

After eating the Shrimp and Grits at Cafe Amelia, we were excited to see how others compared. At Luke, you get a sizable portion and it's good but not great. 

Overall, there were better samplings of brunch and creole food elsewhere.

Great food. Good service. John Besh is the man! 
We were there for the oysters happy hour extravaganza. I recommend Luke to tourists and locals alike!

The food and cocktails were really great.  The service was kinda odd, but not horrible.  Hostess seem clueless and had us mixed up with another party, which meant we waited 20 extra minutes for a table--and then we had two waiters who kept asking us the same things over and over..but the food is amazing so it was all worth it.  Try the Door Number 3 cocktail and the Shrimp Cavatelli Etouffee, and the bread pudding..
This is a Cajun restaurant, NOT a French restaurant!  The food is so so.  Happy hour drink is $5.  The restaurant is next to Hilton and very close to JW Marriott,

I had one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life here - shrimp and grits. Now,  I don't know if their shrimp and grits are just that exceptional or if ALL shrimp and grits are the best thing in the world... now,  for all the non-Americans and non-Southerners, grits are corn, something like polenta, only coarser.

Shrimp and grits are grits, sausage, shrimp, cheese, probably a ton of butter, sauce.... OH MY! It was incredible.

I also had the baked oysters and a cup of gumbo. Way too much food, but I wanted to eat everything (and I did). I liked both the oysters and the gumbo, but neither blew me away like the shrimp and grits here.

I made reservations through Open Table with a request to be seated in a quiet part of the restaurant (if possible) because it was our anniversary.  When we got there, they seated us in the back, near the kitchen, which was definitely quieter than the front of the house.  Our waiter, Patrick, gave us both complimentary glasses of sparkling wine when we sat down and wished us a happy anniversary.  He was very helpful in answering all our questions about the menu and did not judge us for all the food we ordered!  

The stuffed oysters were very rich.  It was hard to taste the oysters themselves, but the topping was tasty.  The serving of pate was more than enough for two people; I wish we could've taken the leftovers to eat another day!  I would DEFINITELY recommend the shrimp and grits; they will split it into two plates if you want to share with someone.  The pork schnitzel was well seasoned but not something I would necessarily order again.

Earlier, I had asked about the bread pudding, but we were too full for dessert by the end of our meal.  However, Patrick said he couldn't let us leave our anniversary dinner without having some sweets!  He brought us a complimentary order of the bread pudding with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on the plate.

This was such a memorable meal and definitely set the tone for the start of our anniversary trip in New Orleans!  The waiters will definitely take care of you here!

Uggh, I wrote a long detailed review and then accidentally hit back space. No, I didn't not hit the save now button. 

I refuse to spend another 8 minutes writing this reviews so, please excuse the blunt sentence fragments that may appear below. 

Hostess asked if we had a reservation... said no, we were seated in the half empty restaurant two minutes later.

Seated near the rear, above a leaking a/c vent, but it wasn't a deal breaker and I didn't ask to be moved.

Happy hour....yay! Half off drinks and hor d'ourves. Tried the fried oysters(first time having oysters...not a fan) The sauce for the oysters was tasty with a hint of spiciness. I didn't care for the consistency of the oysters. 

My kid's burger was huge and she explained it was delightful. String fries were included.  I decided on the shrimp and pasta(can't remember the name of the dish). It was rather cajun/creoleish, but I wasn't impressed with the combo. The shrimp was great on it's own. In my opinion the pasta was too thick. 

There you go a 3 star based on the shrimp dish. Luke has an upscale feel, though causal wear is acceptable.
Try happy hour fresh oysters.  Delicious! Bufala Negra cocktail was amazing.  Staffs were very kind.

We came here for lunch and decided to come back again for more delicious food!!! We were waiting at the bar for seats for the *infamous happy hour oysters" here. We got a little frustrated because there wasn't a waiting list...people had to stand around and basically ready to fight for seats whenever it got available! The manager stopped by and got a conversation with my Man... My Man shared his thoughts about how a waiting list could possibly make the guest experience better. The manager squirmed a lot, conceded the point, but couldn't promise to change their system... BUT... Then he came back, said they'd had a cancellation for a table, and gave that table to us :-) He even came back by later w a complimentary appetizer. That's New Orleans hospitality! It's not just the restaurant, it's not just the food, it's the people that make the experience so special!

Food was OK but very bad experience (the waitress dropped the source on me and my food). They did apologize but did nothing about my food. I tried to be nice though coz something like that happens. However, even I said nothing, what they responded was disappointing. Won't come back:-(

Gawd... so good!  Especially for the price!  

We went for happy hour oysters and ended up having dinner there.  Food was a tad salty for my taste but totally delicious... one of the highlights of my NO visit.

This restaurant disappointed - given it has 4 stars on Yelp and $$. It should really be 3 stars and $$$. Really too expensive for what you get. I was glad they were open on xmas, but that meant a more expensive menu with even less choice. The shrimp and grits was pretty tasty, as were the mussels, but other things disappointed. The worst offender was the Bibb lettuce salad (not sure how they messed up a salad, but they did) and the overly salty french fries. And the matzoh ball soup was just awful - but then again, why did I order that at a french brasserie? Probably because it was 30 degrees underneath the A/C (which they claimed they couldn't turn down because it's controlled by the hotel they are in).
A truly great restuarant.  baring some minor service errors they would have gotten a 5 star rating. I most definitely will return.

If you want a break from the rowdier restaurants in the French Quarter for a more classy dinner, this is a solid option. It's not too loud. The service was impeccable. Not only were our waters always filled, but several of waitstaff came up to us to apologize when our sides of fries took longer to come out than expected.

As for food, we ordered a half dozen of P&J oysters, matzo ball and chicken soup, shrimp and grits, mussels and frites, the Luke burger, and steamed chocolate for dessert. If you're ordering oysters, I think there are definitely better options elsewhere in the city. These oysters were fine but probably only worth it if you're getting them for the happy hour price. I generally find it hard to mess up dishes with shrimp and mussels, and these versions did not disappoint. While all the food was good, the truly memorable dishes of the night were the fries and the burger! 

Not sure there's anything unique enough on the menu that makes it worth rushing back to eat for a second time, but my family and I thoroughly enjoyed the meal and would recommend this for a classier night out!

We had a wonderful time and the service was amazing. Ordered the turtle soup, brussels sprouts, french fries, shrimp and grits (minus the sausage) and finally the rib-eye. For dessert we had the steamed chocolate and salted caramel ice cream. 

Apps - 
Fries were skinny and delicious. If you enjoy skinny fries, you will enjoy these too. 

Brussels sprouts were amazing! Get them, you will love it. 

Turtle soup, tastes like regular chili with ground beef. Didn't taste any special being that it was turtle. Take it or leave it, I wasn't impressed. 

Dinner - 
Shrimp and grits - my wife loves shrimp and I'm not a fan (I hate the crunch of the shrimp every time I chew.) This dish was creamy and very tasty. Loved the shrimp and no, the shrimp didn't crunch. In fact, the shrimp was perfectly delicate, meaty, and soft with the perfect amount of resistance. I loved this dish and would love to come back and have it again. They are known for this dish and it is available on their breakfast, lunch, and dinner menus. We ordered without sausage and devoured it. 

Our friends ordered the fish and sent it back for the rib-eye (medium.) It came out medium rare but he devoured it. Very fatty piece and it wasn't trimmed but he enjoyed it very much. It comes with fries so don't order any as a side if you order the steak. 

Desert-
You can't go wrong. If you like chocolate, caramel, sweet, salty, and a hint of coffee, order now. 

The service was with a smile, ambiance was fantastic (we were seated right next to the chicks window and we're lucky enough to enjoy the cooks put everything together.)

Loved the restaurant and would love to go back again soon.

We had a great experience eating at the bar here. The guys shucking oysters are so great - Tim, Jamaal and the head oyster shucker whose name I forget. We ordered salad, moules et frites, a dozen oysters and had so much food! We have big appetites so this was a lot of food. Everything was delicious. I'd suggest eating at the bar - it's a lot of fun seeing all of the oysters get shucked and the guys behind the bar look like they have fun everyday.

Happy hr: Raw oysters 75 cents each..ordered 1.5 dozen.
Fried oyster $1.25 each 6 each
Drinks 50% off: Silver Saints and Bufala Negra 
Door #3 super good
The Chelsea with rose and strong!

The first time I ordered take out from here, the food was pretty good (brussel sprouts and grilled shrimp). But the service was below average. The hostess seemed unsure of what to do with me when I arrived to pick up my order and I was kept waiting by the bar even though I could see my take out bag by the register. Despite this, I liked the food enough to try and order again via phone. I was only able to say "Hi, I'd like to place an order for pick up" before the woman who answered the phone (Ashley, I think she said) hung up on me (rather roughly too from the slam I had to endure in my left ear). Even if this weren't my last day in New Orleans, I would not consider trying for a third time due to the poor service.

Really good. My husband and Is a real foodie and since we were on vacation in New Orleans we looked up good local restaurants on Yelp. He had the shrimp escaroff. He loved it. We got take out since the kiddo only wanted pizza ( what else !!!). Only drawback is that they are busy so it took 45 minutes to get our order ( they warned us in advance ) still it was long time to wait 
We will be back tmrw to get the shrimp grits

Luke was hit or miss for us. 
First, dress well even though the food is really casual, because we felt really out of place in jeans and casual tops because this is that kind of restaurant/style of food in Chicago, but apparently everyone just dresses well in the south...

Food is fine here. Just execution wasn't up to my expectations of a restaurant of this price point/ambiance/reputation... Like, shells and grit in 4 of our 12 oysters?!, unevenly cooked vegetable in our salad (which they split for us because we were splitting everything; that was a nice touch), really really salty and overcooked shriveled mussels we had to send back because for $30 I hoped to get really great mussels and broth... They kindly made some sauce for my fries to dip into, but it came back underseasoned! 

Our favorite was the pan fried fresh gulf fish, which was cooked really well and had nice simple clean flavors and accompaniments that went well overall. 

Our server was a nice guy, but a bit absent and awkward? Had trouble answering our questions and did not deal with the mussels with the hospitality I hoped. I kept reading about great service here, but we ended up having to ask a floater who kept filling in for things (additional orders, our utensils replaced, our check). It was a bit of a bummer, because good service could have really saved our night despite food not being up to our expectations.

A little disappointed by how many things could be done better if they're charging this much for food. Glad we came, but would not recommend to friends who are visiting. August looked really good when we walked by though! Maybe next time we're in town...

Super let down. So to be fair nothing was horrible or anything like that but at this price point I think it's ok to expect a little more. 5 minutes after we got our appetizers were delivered they showed up with the entrées and you either have to send your food back to sit under heat lamps or inhale your apps- they whole experience was like that - extremely rushed and not really what one would expect. Pâté was probably the only real standout - all the other items you've had before and likely better and with better service.

Amazing oysters! We have come twice during happy hour. Their happy hour is from 3-6 pm, and you can get local oysters for 75 cents. Also, I highly recommend the Brussels sprouts! This place is busy, so if you want a table, I recommend a reservation.  We sat at the bar both nights and it was fun to watch the bar tenders make all of the speciality cocktails.  The sazerac was a hit! 5 dollars a pop during HH. Make sure you wander over to Luke! It won't disappoint!

I am a huge John Besh Fan and this was very close to our hotel so we had to dine in. I went with a few friends who arent as big of a foodie as I am so I was the one that was the most excited. I started off with a cup of the gumbo and when it came out and I tried it I realized I messed up by not getting a bowl instead. For my entree I had to try the Shrimp and grits so I went for it.. It came in a cast iron bowl, shrimp was cooked to perfection, the grits had jalapeno's in it, I believe and the sauce on top was simply amazing.. For Dessert I had the bourbon creme brulee, it came with cookies baked in house and fresh strawberries on top... The whole meal was simply perfect and if I ever visit new orleans again, this is a must stop!!

Stopped in for a quick, late-night bite while staying at the hotel. Some ups and downs made for a subpar finish. 

First, the bartenders and servers were outwardly miserable - it was a Tuesday night around 10p and two different employees told us that they were overworked and understaffed. One was very vocal about it - not being allowed time to eat or even go to the bathroom. 

Second, my fiancé got the chocolate bourbon pecan tart ($8) and said it's one of the best desserts he's ever had. 

Third, my cup of gumbo ($10) was decent - thick, rich, seafood-filled. Enjoyable, until I hit the oyster shell shards at the bottom. My bartender didn't really care when I told her, and didn't even mention it to a manager (that I could tell or was made aware of) to make sure the problem was fixed. 

Overall, not a place I would return to. Overpriced and underserved for the experience.

Got drinks here, Sazeracs to be exact, during their happy hour. Fantastic prices and solid drinks. Good bartenders here..On the con side, their oysters or whatever the hell they cook here makes the lobby of the hotel next door stank like bootay

What a nice place but SO pricy. This is the first restaurant I tried in New Orleans, Louisiana. Nice ambiance. Loud and busy. Service is fine and little bit slow.

Food: 

Gumbo soup - delicious flavors. It has a perfect spicy kick. Definitely recommended 

Crab bisque soup - one of the best crab bisque a I ever had. Very rich and creamy.

Jumbo shrimp and grits - ahhh this is a must to try. It is like a party of great spices in your mouth. Best one I ever had !

You will never go hungry in New Orleans.  This is just a fact of life.  One of the places to aid in this endeavor is Lüke and I have now been there 4 times over as many visits to the Crescent City.  It was recommended to me by my local colleague and this time I was in the city with my parents.  They liked it so much we went there two times!  

Ironically, I am a true Midwestern girl in that I prefer land based cuisine and am not a big seafood fan.  However, despite this shortcoming I have always been able to order delicious alternatives including the Lüke Burger and the amazing Flammenkuchen (the bacon is crazy thick - check it out on the menu).   I was brave enough to try the Kumamoto oysters once and they were tasty enough to me.

My parents are huge seafood fans and could not rave enough about the seafood platters including shrimp, oysters, and mussels.  This is what necessitated our return visit on our last night in NOLA.  Not that they had to twist my arm or anything.

The decor and atmosphere are lovely and the service always excellent.

I am sure I will go back here should my travels bring me back to New Orleans.  I certainly hope they do.

Luke did not disappoint; went for the raw oysters and they were lovely.... fresh, plump,  and luscious. The service was attentive, efficient, and fun. The ambience was perfect, and the entire experience relaxed.

I had such a fun time here!! The service was incredible. Our waiter was really fun and had a lot of character and personality. It was paced very well. We never felt rushed or like we were waiting too long on part of our meal. The only thing that felt like it was taking a while was the cocktail that my mom ordered and the waiter just gave it to us for free. The atmosphere was amazing, everyone sounded like they were having a great time and the decorations are very chic without being uncomfortably posh. We split the fried quail appetizer which was incredible! I highly recommend that because it was tender and beautifully seasoned. Then I had the ribeye as an entree which was very undercooked from what I asked (I asked for medium-well and got a steak that was closer to medium or medium-rare). But it was seasoned very well. For dessert I got the Creme Brûlée which was good but not great, but my mom got the bread pudding, which I tried a little bit of, and it was phenomenal!! I would absolutely recommend this place because it's reasonably priced and has an incredible atmosphere and good food!

On our recent short visit to New Orleans, my husband insisted we get grits for breakfast. I looked up the menu at Luke's to confirm our grits goal.

Couldn't have asked for a better visit. Loved the:
- Awesome service - waitress was originally from Hawaii but had the hospitality and charm of a New Orleans local.

- Food - I had the lump crab meat omelette with a tiny taste of cheese. Amazing!
(I always try to order what I can't get in my Denver home restaurants). And, the omelette came with a great green salad with a perfect vinaigrette and frites! My husband had the basic breakfast with eggs, bacon, and GRITS. The bacon was sublime.

- Atmosphere - very old school wood decor. I love a breakfast place with newspapers out. It encourages lingering. 

I'll be back on my next visit!

I came here a few nights ago and had one of the best meals. I had the barbecue shrimp which was to die for. The oysters were very fresh as well. Service was really great and I can't wait to return back to luke!

Clean, simple atmosphere. Let's the architecture speak for itself. The military plaques hung behind the bar are crooked and misaligned as if haphazardly placed in a rush before an uncle came to visit, expecting to see his honors displayed. Other than that, it's pretty to look at. 

Crab bisque is AMAZING! Our appetizer took an insane amount of time, so they threw in a few free cups of bisque. It was the only thing we didn't actually order, and it was by by far best thing we tasted. 

Bartender was great- warm, nice, helpful. We'd definitely go back if it wasn't so unbelievable crowded all the time.

Great happy hour oyster deal and drink specials! 75 cent oysters and half off all drinks! You really can't go wrong with either of those. Their happy hour is everyday from 3-6 pm.

The oysters were very fresh and I loved the sauces it came with. One was like a cocktail sauce and the other had a wasabi flavor. Well kept and elegant restaurant with playful waiters!

This place looks a lot nicer than it actually is, unfortunately. It's also priced as if it were a nicer restaurant.

I just ordered soup since I wasn't all that hungry to begin with, and it was just ok. My friend, however, ordered a full entree for $26 and she said it was subpar at best. The fries were soft and the schnitzel didn't have much flavor. It was a $30 fried meal basically. The staff also seemed inexperienced. They were nice though. 

I know we didn't have to order what we ordered. Maybe if we had ordered something else, our experience would have been better, but overall we weren't impressed.
Great food, great staff and their happy hour prices cannot be beat.  I recommend the fried oysters and Brussel sprouts ... !
Very nice atmosphere, the food was really good as well! We had the shrimp and grits which was great and I highly recommend that. We also ordered the swordfish which was good.

Am in on a quick business trip in New Orleans and checked out this place - mainly because of its proximity to my hotel, but also in part because of the excellent reviews here on Yelp. I ordered a bowl of gumbo and a sazerac, both of which were good but not transcendent. The gumbo, at $10 a bowl, was fairly priced but not what I expected in terms of quality. Probably not the house specialty and probably not what I should have ordred, but c'est la vie. 

Everything seemed a little dusty, as well. Just didn't feel all that clean or comfortable.

Would definitely come back, but with a bigger appetite and a wider focus on the menu.

We were in NOLA for vacation and this place rocks!  Half price oysters during happy hour for 75 cents a piece is just unbeatable. Also, try the butter, it's delicious.  

We had the Pate Of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers as appetizer.  It was so good and huge, we had to lick our fingers.  

Stuffed P&J Oysters is ok.  

Crab Bisque - YUM!!!

Matzo Ball & Roast Chicken Soup - the Matzo Ball is as big as the cup itself.  So there is actually not much soup, but what we had was good.

Salad Luke - This one is a delight.  It's light and flavorful.

Fried Oyster Salad - It's good, but do not order if you are already having oysters for appetizers.

Chappapeela Pork Schnitzel - this is good too!

Shrimp Cavatelli Etouffee - Fresh pasta with the shrimp.  Very good sauce.  

Moules et Fritos - Mussels were fresh and the fries were crispy

For dessert - we had Steamed Chocolate, just because some of us are allergic to nuts.  So anything with pecans and almonds, we can't order.  Steamed chocolate is very good anyway.  

I am taking off one star, b/c when I called in for a reservation, they said I can either go in at 5:45 pm or 9:45 pm. First time, I chose 5:45 pm the next day.  All is good.  Another day, I called again, they gave me the same times.  I ignored them and walk there at 7:30 pm and found that there were actually a number of tables available at the back near the kitchen.  I am not sure if those times are actually for outside, but the I didn't get seated outside near the bar the 1st time anyway.  So I didn't like their reservation policy.  Don't know what that is for, but if I were you, I'll not make a reservation and walk right in there.

Great restaurant and even better happy hour! $.75 oysters and half priced cocktails. Go early and stand at the end of the oyster bar and watch the guys shuck 'em! And if you're lucky, you'll get a little dance out of it too. Love this spot!

Had to make reservations 2-3 days ahead of time! 

It seems like this place is a well known, fancy spot. We showed up in leggings and hoodies.

Happy hour was half price wine/cocktails which was awesome! 

BRUSSELS SPROUTS!! GET THEM!! WE GOT THREE for our party of 4..lol 

I also got one of the salads and it was weird and not that good. Don't get it. 

Our service was really weird, he was just really casual with us and kinda grabbed plates in the middle of convos and stuff like that. Odd for a place that is fancy. 

You should go during happy hour (until 6pm) and get brussell sprouts + cocktails + wine :D

Went to Luke's for breakfast / brunch while visiting New Orleans for the first time! Luke's is delicious. It was too crowded and we got sat immediately in a cute cozy booth. I ordered the croquet mossier it was delicious! We also ordered blueberry pancakes which were incredible. This place is a MUST!!

This is our first meal in New Orleans and boy was it good we had the gumbo soup and shrimp and grits. This was the first time we had ever had shrimp and grits and they were amazing. The atmosphere the food and service were all great.
Food was tasty and portions were large sizes. I went during lunch so they have lunch special which I recommend!! Ambiance is a bit fancy and most of the customers dress nicely to go eat here.

We were during lunch hours and it was packed. I made a reservation so we were seated almost right away. The wait for the cocktails was kind of long. Maybe having more than 1 bartender would be quicker. However, it wasnt a big deal. I love everything. My husband got shrimps n grits and it was the best we ever had. Oysters tray was great and very reasonable price! I ordered the monday special dish. It was really good too.

Came here specifically for the Oysters during happy-hour and thought they were "okay."

My group of girlfriends were so excited, we ended up ordering 2-dozen Oysters along with appetizers such as: crispy brussels sprouts, shrimp & grits, and house-made fries. The oysters weren't shucked correctly and we had a few unfortunate surprises during our meal =( 

Overall, it's a good place to get your oyster fix while in NoLa but it definitely is not the best.

We made a reservation for dinner on January 2nd and had a great experience!  The dining experience couldn't be any better.  Our waiter and waitress were very attentive and were fantastic; they were very professional and knowledgeable.  We sat towards the back of the restaurant near the kitchen so we could see as the guys were plating the meals which was a really unique and cool experience.  I had the farm raised raw oysters as my appetizer; they were massive and delicious! My friend had the crispy brussel sprouts which I highly recommend; it was fantastic!  I had the mussels and frites as my meal; the sauce was a little bit more butter than I preferred but nonetheless, it was still very delicious and well cooked!  I would definitely go back and eat there again the next time we're in New Orleans.  The food and service was on of the best experiences.
Good customer service, awesome shrimp and grits. Perfect place to get a relaxing lunch before you take off to go back home

4.5 Stars

I'm going to combine two reviews into one for Lüke. We had breakfast/brunch here and later in the day we came back for Happy Hour.

Breakfast first:

We sat in the front of the house and enjoyed the French Press coffee served with heavy cream in a pewter pitcher while waiting on our food. The ambiance is very nice with parquet wood floors, tin paneled ceiling and dark wood bar providing a cool vibe.

The Shrimp & Grits was spot on, served in a cast iron dish with SSU eggs on top. The sauce had just the right bite with an excellent concentration of flavors, the shrimp were fresh and large. The Omelette of Local Crab was crazy rich with nice local greens to help even out the flavors and textures, minor glitch was that we felt it was a bit oily. The frittes were really good as well but wow; how do you finish all that food?!

Service was fast and friendly, we wanted for nothing.

Happy Hour:

We sat in the back of the house which was quieter and gave us a view of the action taking place in the kitchen.

Oysters OTHS Special
Deep Fried Oyster Special
Half price beer!

Raw oysters were very fresh, very clean and very cold; this is what propelled Lüke to the top of the NOLA Oyster Odyssey List.

The deep fried oysters were good but nothing out of the ordinary. Lüke Fru, Covington, Kolsch was crisp and cold; a perfect match with the raw oysters. Our server was awesome, she made the whole experience light and fun.

Lüke is a little walk from the crazier parts of town but totally worth a visit; especially for their Happy Hour.

Cheers!

overpriced.  Had the swordfish and it was dry, possibly over cooked.  It was also about 6 ounces.  $28 for a 6 oz swordfish that wasn't very good.  Disappointing.  Overall it's a nice restaurant but it is overrated.

These guys make 1 good thing. A big honking burger with lots of meat and bacon. It's satisfying to say the least. They also have great parmesan fries here. 

Other then that a very small menu. If you're looking for a burger in the land of creole, go here!
Had the swordfish and it was dry and over cooked.  Overall, a very good restaurant.  Just had a below average meal.

Went in to make a reservation, was told that the wait was 2 hour and that they would text us when the reservation was ready. That was perfectly fine. As we grew more hungry, hour 3 came around, still no text saying that our table was ready. We called in asking if there was a table available, the lady rudely snuffed it off saying that we should have stayed in the area. Guess service wasn't all that it was hyped up to be.
Biggest raw oysters I've ever seen for only .75 each at happy hour (3-6).

happy hour
$0.75 per raw oyster, $1.25 per fried oyster, half off all drinks between 3-6pm
Crab bisque was awesome - $10
Mussels with fries - huge amount of mussels and the sauce is absolutely to die for. I think our group ate at least 4-5 servings of bread. 

Great service, great happy hour, great food!
Overall, great place!!

Disappointed, went for breakfast. Greeted and seated promptly, then waited and waited, just as I was about to walk out a waiter recognized me and brought water, after further delay came to take my order and bring coffee. Food was good but there was no toast or bread with the omelette.  Had to ask for butter and coffee refill. Seemed like staff were B S-ing in the kitchen and not watching the store. For the price I expected better service.

Hostess staff less than cordial (girl with the 'Sideshow Bob' hair acts like she really doesn't give a Debbie Wasserman Schultz about her job); wait staff mediocre and tried to charge us for something not ordered that a manager gave us to make up for poor performance; foo foo food with a fancy cook's name; waste of expensive space

We tried it and the place looks pretty fancy we thought maybe out of our the budget but at the end it ended up nicely priced for seafood. Very tasty jumbo shrimps with grits. I would say that we were not lucky due to some noisy group around bit the service was good woth great food, definitely a nice place to gove a try for seafood from NOLA
Good food and great service.  Enjoyable dining experience.

Went for my mom's birthday. Our waiter, Kenneth, was amazing. Everything was perfect. They brought champagne to our table as we sat down. Then, it was happy hour til 6 so our choice of cocktails were half price. We ordered the brussel sprouts, which were INCREDIBLE. Then my mom and I split the swordfish and the drum, both of which were insanely good. We also got an order of jalapeño grits -- yum. Then, as if we weren't full enough, they brought us dessert, on the house, for my mom's special day -- a delicious bread pudding with homemade vanilla ice cream. 

Everything was so flavorful and the prices were EXTREMELY reasonable for the serving sizes and quality of the dishes. We will definitely be back. 

Thanks for making this such a great, memorable night!

Went there this morning for brunch. The waiter was not friendly at all. Had to keep asking for coffee refills...and creamer...and sugar. We were a party of 6 & all 6 of us were drinking coffee. How do you not bring more creamer & sugar? He seemed annoyed that i asked him to repeat the special. He never smiled or even looked at us. The portions were large. Overpriced. I had the burger. It was nothing great. Bisque was good. My son had the crabmeat omlette which he didn't like. My other son had the croquet madam which he liked. We will most likely not go back.

HAPPY HOUR! HAPPY HOUR! That's the absolute best time to visit LUKE... reason why? 75 CENT OYSTERS. No this is not a drill, delicous huge raw oysters sold for a tender 75 cents each which equal 9 dollars for a whole dozen for my math challenged friends. As soon as I found out about this I knew we had to check them out (we stayed at the adjacent hilton). anndddddd happy hr is from 3-7 every day can you really get better than that?

We actually visited twice in our short 4 day trip to NOLA. Both during HH. 1st visit it was just me and my boyfriend. we were able to snag two seats at the bar and we ordered a dozen oysters. I also got a glass of wine as it was half price during HH. The oysters came out so quick it was insane. Already plated with  the oysters were horseradish and cocktail sauce. They were perfectly shucked and we slurped them down with huge smiles on our face. I knew we had to come back, just to make sure it wasn't too good to be true.

Second visit was today. We had to head to the airport but had time to kill before our flight which was during HH so got 2 dozen oysters today. We were with my boyfriends sister. She does not like oysters, but under pressure tried one and even admitted "they are not that bad". she ordered matzo ball soup. Again- our oysters came out extremely quick (quicker than her soup actually) just as amazingly delicious as the first visit. She did not really like her soup, but really just get the oysters.

I cant say enough about this place and their amazing deals, if in NOLA make at least 1 trip to LUKE during happy hr, you will not regret it.

Came here twice on a short trip. Food and ambience are both great. The most amazing thing about this restaurant is our waiter Gary. Was fortunate enough to enjoy his company both times and he couldn't have been more hospitable. Come and ask for Gary!
Truly a great restaurant.  Fresh, fun ambiance.  Solid menu

I went here three times in five days. It was overkill, but I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

If you aim for their happy hour, the oysters and drinks are reasonably priced. This restaurant has the best raw oysters for the price. When I went in early January, the regular gulf oysters weren't too large, tasted great, and had minimal grit. I also stopped by Acme during this trip, and Luke's raw oysters were much better by far. The ones at Acme were too large and gritty.

Oysters aside, my absolute favorite item on the menu is the rabbit and chicken liver pate. My friends and I talked about it for days. The pate was rich and creamy without the usual metallic, slightly game-y taste. It's definitely a dish you'd want to share, because the portion is large.

If you attempt to catch their happy hour during a special event (we went New Year's Eve), you might have to "shark" it to get a spot at the bar if you don't have reservations.

I had lunch and dinner here on this trip. My lunch was not what I had hoped. The salad was basically lettuce and ranch dressing with beets hidden underneath. The croque monsieur had waaay too much bechamel sauce. I wanted to give it another chance, though, and I'm glad I did. At dinner, I had the ribeye and frites, while my husband had the schnitzel. Both were very good. We also had the greatest bread pudding ever. I disliked the serving methods (frites in a cone fell all over the table, bread pudding was hard to spoon out of a too-small cup) Service was great both times, but the dinner crowd was super noisy. Our server seemed to keep encouraging this hyena of a woman and her friends to laugh at every stupid joke, nearly screaming. I'm sure that woman had a great time, but the rest of us diners exchanged glances that said, "Is this really happening right now?" That would never happen at a real bistro in Paris.

We were a group of 7 who showed up with no res and were seated within 5 minutes at around 8:30, it was perfect!
The food and service was outstanding and there was something for everyone on the menu.
I would go back next time I was in NOLA for sure!
Something more 'classy' than a lot of the other popular tourist restaurants.

Upscale bar/restaurant with an adjoining elegant dining area. The establishment is large, has a full bar equipped with TV's and fresh oysters clearly on display for you to witness the art of shucking.

Daily Chef Specials are available Monday-Friday. I visited on a Monday and therefore went with the Honey Tabasco Chicken special. However, I started with a cup of Crawfish Bisque soup; a delicious choice to get my palate fired up for the main course. The Honey Tabasco Chicken was the perfect combination of sweet & spicy atop a succulent lightly battered chicken breast, accompanied by red beans and rice, putting a southern twist on a classic dish. I enjoyed it immensely but could only eat a small portion. My eyes are always bigger than my tummy. Jackson, my server, was a real gent & wrapped the remains for me. 

Lüke is a perfect NOLA spot for date night, business meetings and hour happy.

~Christy

Stopped by this cool place to check out the happy hour from 3-6pm.   Including Half price cocktails and wine by the glass.     The interior was really cool with high ceilings and pulley style ceiling fans. The oysters on the half shell were .75 each fried oysters 1.25 each.  Half shell were good but the fried oysters were so delicate and tasty cooked perfectly and tender with the perfect crunch.  Might have been the best fried oyster ever.   They served with a sauce that I didn't eat because frankly the oysters needed nothing at all.  The cocktails were different and tasty as well.  The service was absolutely outstanding and seamless.  They appeared to be working in teams everyone working to make sure your experience there was perfect.  I saw a neighbor table of 4 ordered the burgers and omg the looked delicious and they were huge!  Will definitely go back to this place on my next venture to Nola.

What a great find. Located in CBD we were overall exhausted with The French Quarter restaurants, Luke offers a daily happy hour from 3-6. I love that they only serve local beers. Try their own brew, very tasty. I also had the whiskey cocktail with basil and balsamic vinegar. Excellent combination that will definitely get you where you need to be!  We had several dozen raw oysters and the fried oysters were to perfection  Waitstaff very friendly and helpful.  Restaurant Is a mix between New Orleans and New York.  Great find!

We went to Luke for my birthday during our 8th annual  trip to New Orleans. We were disappointed that our dining experience was not as good as our first time at Luke's (both service and food). We walked into the place around 6 on a weekday, and the hostess told us we would be seated in a couple minutes, GREAT. We watched and waited. There were a good amount of tables available and we waited quite some time while we watched the other hostess chat with a fellow worker. Waited some more. 15+ minutes later when she was done talking, she came over to seat us. I believe it was the manager, who came over to apologize for the wait which was nice, since we were getting irritated. 

My wine glass came with wine spilled all around the top and bottom base of the glass and dripped on me when I picked it up. The handle of the glass was also all sticky. I had to wipe it clean with my napkin. At a higher end place like Luke you would expect it to be not dripping on you but it wasn't a big enough deal to mention to the waiter. 

Service was lacking this time around. To the 2 waiters' defense, they probably had 6 to 7 tables PLUS a big party in the party room so I know it was busy. But when you go to a place like Luke, you expect service to be a little more responsive. They probably should have had an additional designated waiter for the big party. We had empty water glasses 70% of the night and was never asked if we wanted more wine/drinks. And the 2 waiters were so busy they didn't have time to communicate with each other, so when we were helped, we were asked the same things twice in a row multiple times.

The food was just okay this time. The swordfish was dry, and the 2 burgers that our table got said they were average bar burgers. Okay but nothing special. 
The drum fish with meunière sauce didn't have the sauce on it, and when I asked the waiter about the sauce I was told there was, but he would get more. I grew up eating a massive amount of seafood and I can say there wasn't even a tiny hint of lemon or butter taste to the fish. Bread pudding was okay. Chocolate dessert was the only dish that was very good. 

I was not a happy camper for my birthday and I think the waiter sensed it so he didn't charge us for the bread pudding and also gave us the extra chocolate dessert. It would have been great if he could have came over to say that but I understand he was very busy with all the tables. 

After our second time here, Luke was okay, but for the money and just being okay I'm not sure if it's a place we would make a point to visit in New Orleans now. I was very happy with the gesture for the dessert so because of that, if someone wanted to go back to Luke I would. Maybe next time for us it would be better to order other things like oysters.
This place is a must for anyone visiting New Orleans. They  have the best Cheesy Shrimp and Grits in New Orleans!

Good happy hour with half price drinks. the creamy orange sauce for the fried oysters was really good. The French 75 (cognac, fresh lemon juice & champagne) was probably my favorite drink while in New Orleans. nice place with friendly staff. if I lived here I would be here all the time.

Good seafood. The crab bisque was wonderful. I also had raw oysters (the local ones) which were nicely cleaned and a good size. I give it 4 stars because while it's good, it's nothing special compared to other Nola seafood places. It's a solid place to go though. Great service too!

It is hard to navigate a French cuisine menu with celiac disease but the staff made it very easy and the food was fantastic. I really appreciate their patience and knowledge. Everything was very good.

So great! We had the oysters, mussels, clams & shrimp platter. All great and salty! The Brussel sprouts were delicious. Crab bisque is always delicious. Then we tried the Bread Pudding for the first time..... AMAZING!!!

To be honest, I've only eaten dessert at this place (bread pudding) and it is phenomenal! It's served hot with ice cream and lots of caramel. Not mention the service was great! Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'll go there for dinner.
Went here twice on a five day trip. The food and drinks were incredibly tasty and the service was amazing as well. Big thanks to Gary, making both nights very enjoyable.

Loved this place. We found it on Yelp. The food and service was excellent. I felt like I was a local not a tourist.  We ordered Washington Parish Roasted Chicken and I didn't want to share the Luke burger for my younger daughter ( she didn't want to share either) The next time we are in New Orleans we will be back to Brunch and Lunch and maybe even happy hour.

My husband and I sat at the bar for lunch last weekend.  The bartender was super friendly.  We sat right next to the oyster shucker area which was a fun site.  I started with a bloody mary which was really good and helped with my hangover from the night before!  My husband and I shared a bowl of the seafood gumbo which was good but kind of different from what I'm used to.  The mussels were by far my favorite EVER....and they came with fries which was a hit.  This place is a little too pricey, I would go back for a nice dinner but not a place to go for lunch.

Had this place as my first meal in New Orleans, I was very pleased with the meal, we got the crab au gratin, the shrimp and grits, and the bread pudding. All were outstanding dishes. The bread pudding was so good we went back for seconds the next day, but since it was about to close they made it to go, even though they let us eat it at the bar. It was missing the delicious candied pecans and wasn't as pretty but still yummy. I would love to come back and try the burger among other things!

Dear John,

You always welcome me with open arms, and this is no exception. My first visit to Luke Bob was more than a little grumpy because he was hungry and air travel is so damn annoying and let's face it...he is a little jealous of you, so maybe halfway there he was like "here's a place, let's just eat here" or "how much further?" I ignored him and just kept moving. And hot damn...we found it.

John - all of your restaurants are different, yet wonderful in their own special way. This one is more casual than others, kind of a Shrimp and Grits and Burger kind of place. It's also on the small side, so it can get crowded (and loud). Bob settles down when you put such a wonderful burger in front of him, and that makes me happy.  And the Bread Pudding...OMG the Bread Pudding is to die for. Even Bob loves you after the Bread Pudding.

This is also one of the best happy hours in NOLA. Drinks are delish, you can get me drunk for very little money except I fill my stomach with your half price apps. I met my first Yelper here - Rene D. suggested we meet for happy hour and raw oysters. Raw oysters just aren't my thing (flashback to a Friends episode where Joey stepped on one and said it was the biggest bugger he ever saw), but I've been told they're some of the best in town and she sure enjoyed them. I didn't mind sharing you with her when you walked up, cause that's what friends are for. You know, so many people make the mistake of thinking Yelp is "just a review site" but it's so much more than that. We are family, I got all my Yelpers and me. Don't get me going.

So just keep doing what you do best, and I'll look forward to seeing you in the Spring. You know I can't stay away.

Miss L.

Was in town for a meeting, and have always wanted to try Luke's, and only a 3 min walk from the Marriott Courtyard. I had Oysters, Salad, and Chicken for my main dish. Absolutely the best I've ever had! Great service, friendly staff, didn't have a reservation, but only took 5mins to seat me in a packed house, on a Thursday night.

Alright, so I saw this restaurant on a list of best restaurants in the kitchen and made it a point to have a meal here while on a recent trip. Not to mention, I'm a fan of John Besh. I chose to dine here for lunch during the middle of the week. It wasn't too difficult to get a last minute reservation and it seemed to be full of a lot of locals, which was a good sign.

I couldn't decide what I wanted because I was was past the point of hungry. It took what seemed like at least 10 minutes before anybody came to even fill my water glass and give me a menu, but when they finally did, I asked my server for suggestions. He seemed completely uninterested in talking to me and pushed for the Croque-madame. I should have gone with my gut, but listened to the server. While I was waiting- for what seemed like another 20 minutes before the meal even came, I asked for bread, which I saw on all the other tables. The server forgot about it, and by the time he came by to where I could ask him again, it finally came with my meal.

The sandwich itself was okay; I enjoyed the fries much more. Now it's been several years since I've had a Croque-madame, so maybe I didn't know what I was getting myself into. The sandwich was covered in what tasted like a thick bechamel sauce and broiled. In between two thick slices of bread were the ham and cheese. Oh, and let's not forget the fried egg on top. Honestly, it was so rich, I ate a quarter of it and boxed up the rest. 

The service was extremely slow, the server seemed like he could care less about serving me, and the best part of my meal was the fries. I was disappointed, and wished I would have come on Monday to get the honey tabasco chicken special. Coulda, shoulda, woulda....well I'm not sure I'll be back. Sorry, John.

This restaurant was recommended by a friend and so we decided to support the owner because he was a Marine. The food was great but the service was slow, in that it seems that we had to wait over 15 minutes just for orders to get taken. Overall they had a very good selection of beer and with a Pleasant atmosphere. The staff was very friendly, easy to get along with, and down-to-earth. The food was not too pricey and it was worth the price. I would have given this restaurant a five-star rating but its level of service was very poor, minus the pleasantness of the waiters. For my meal I had the chicken and red beans and rice.

I decided to come here in order to take advantage of the happy hour specials. They offer 75 cent oysters and half off beverages from 3pm-6pm which to me is a total steal.
I walked inside and the hostess was on the phone, talking to another customer. This didn't necessarily bother me how long it took her to seat us, it was that she didn't really seem to care or acknowledge that we were there waiting for her and it seemed she took her time chatting.
When we finally got seated I ordered two dozen oysters and a glass of Cabernet. My husband got the Tabasco honey chicken which is featured on Mondays. My oysters were very good, the only problem is that there were little pieces of shell inside my oysters so I was having to constantly pick out the little shells. On the other hand the oysters were large, plump and fresh. 
My husbands chicken was out of this world. It had all the flavors of New Orleans in one magnificent dish. The chicken was crispy with great texture and flavor. If you come to Luke this is one dish that you must try. It has a nice heat to it while also being very savory.
Our waitress was polite but was not very attentive, she maybe came to our table three times; to order, to deliver our food, and our check. In all honesty though the food was good and we aren't very high maintenance so it didn't bother us .

I will definitely be back to have more of that chicken! Thank you for the food!!!

Food in this place is excellent . Gosh so good. Service is a little slow but very nice, appropriate to the place. But Woooow food is amazing. We order the chicken and honey biscuit and was amazing. Also the shrimp and grits was to die for. Delicious . Highly recommend.

Had a good meal here with work colleagues.  We shared several appetizers including oysters, fried brussel sprouts, and crab and cheese dip.  The brussel sprouts were quite good unexpectedly.  The crab dip was good and I didn't taste the oysters.  The menu is interesting with burgers, fish, shrimp dishes, steak and pork schnitzel.  I had the shrimp etouffe which had the shrimp on top of pasta.  The taste was good and i enjoyed it.  The restaurant is in a Hilton hotel but better than many hotel restaurants.  I'd go again.

First time in New Orleans and we tried this restaurant.  Shrimp and jalapeño grits was absolutely the best thing I enjoyed while in New Orleans. I only wish I would have tried this restaurant sooner in my short stay, as I would have gone back and tried another dish. This is a must try if you are headed to New Orleans. Absolutely loved it.  All thumbs up!!!

When in New Orleans, do not miss the opportunity to have a meal at Lüke.

The ambiance is chic without pretention. Service is top-notch. Drinks are strong and made well. Food is out of this world!

My party was seated promptly, and taken care of by a very friendly waiter (I think his name was Kevin). He was attentive and helpful with his advice on what to order. I started my meal with a Sazerac ($10); the perfect apéritif. For my entrée, I had the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp en Cocotte, aka shrimp and grits ($24); hands down, the BEST thing I ate during my stay in New Orleans. It had the perfect amount of flavor and spice, and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. For dessert, Brendan's Bread Pudding ($8) was recommended, which was so decadent and also phenomenal.

The bill for our party of 7 (6 drinks, 4 appetizers, 7 entrees, 1 side dish, and 4 desserts) was just under $400 before tip; not bad for the quality of food and service!
Amazing raw oysters, and the fried oysters were delicious. Fresh oysters are on the menu at Luke, and the house drinks are also very delicious.

DID SOMEONE SAY 75 CENT OYSTERS?! Yes, 75 cent oysters everyday at Luke from 3-6PM!

It was my second day in New Orleans and although I had already eaten oysters at ACME the night before, I was eager for more - ESPECIALLY at such a steal. I walked over to Luke from my hotel and immediately got a seat at the bar. At around 4 PM, the restaurant was not too busy nor crowded. The atmosphere appeared classy yet casual at the same time. The bartender greeted me after a couple minutes and provided me with a menu. In addition to 75 cent oysters, the Happy Hour at Luke also included half-price wines by the glass, some cocktails, house brand liquors and draft beers!

I ordered a dozen raw oysters and a cocktail - all for just $16! The oysters were shucked right by the bar and presented with cocktail sauce, horseradish, lemons, and a red transparent sauce that I was unfamiliar with. The oysters tasted juicy and fresh, well-worth the HH price! 

While the bartender was not too engaging, the service was pretty prompt. I also got a chance to chat with some locals, which made my experience more memorable. PLUS, if locals were there, you KNOW it's a legitimate place! Luke, I will be back in the future!

Prior to visiting new orleans, I asked around for some rest recommendations. Luke was one. We had to make reservations 3 days in advanced for a Sunday 5pm table. 

It is a nicer place, we wore like jeans and whatev and kinda felt out of place.

I was pleasantly surprised to find that they offer happy hour even when you are dining (not just at the bar). Half price wine and cocktails. I believe $1 oysters. 

We ordered 4 orders of brussels sprouts lol. They're really good, just get them. I also ordered the crab bisque which was awesome. 

Service was soooo weird. Servers were dressed very professionally but their personality said otherwise. Maybe this is a southern thing? Also like I would barely put my fork down after my last bite and he would already be taking my plate.

I really hate to say anything bad about this place because I know people who work there, but this is one of the most overrated restaurants in the city. This place has got to be kept alive by tourists who don't know any better. The building, of course, is beautiful, the service is great, but the food? No. Go elsewhere.

Got the Luke Burger / it was fantastic / it was huge / loved the Shoe String French Fries.

The Service was Great / taking the order, then finally getting the product.

Gary H

Came here solo during Mardi Gras. No wait for the bar although a table would have been a short wait.

Brunch menu is very short. Only about 7-8 dishes, but that's not a bad thing. I ordered the pressed pork sandwich (it comes with skinny fries).

Huge portion. Great tasting. Good service. No real wow factor but this is a solid choice for brunch. Oysters are freshly shucked right in front of you by the friendly servers. Would recommend.

Didn't even get to sit. The place was half empty when we came with a party of 8 (bachelor's party). We were in sports gear for our bike tour after brunch.  Hostess proceeded to inform us they can't take a party of 8. When I asked if she can split us into parties of 4, she proceeded to let us know, politely, that she's actually all booked through Mardi Gras and can't take walk ins.  -.-"

Didn't even get to sit. The place was half empty when we came with a party of 8 (bachelor's party). We were in sports gear for our bike tour after brunch.  Hostess proceeded to inform us they can't take a party of 8. When I asked if she can split us into parties of 4, she had a peculiar look and proceeded to let us know, politely, that she's "actually" all booked through Mardi Gras and can't take walk ins.  -.-"  

Not sure if it's the dress code or our ethnicity, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt and assume the former. 

If there was a strict dress code, they should've been upfront with it. 

It goes without saying that we were a group of polite professionals with two officers with us
This is a late review (visited April 2014). Very good dinning experience, Hard to go beat at a John Besh restaurant. The gumbo and the octopus were the standouts, lots of bold flavors. I will return

I don't eat seafood and not much French food lol but I had an awesome glass of cabernet half off before 6pm! The matzo chicken soup which was very good and French fries which were of course amazing. Everyone in my party loved their food mussels, clams, oysters and crab bisque.

I love this place, named for John Besh's son, absolutely great for the 3 to 6 pm happy hour with actual NOLA people, friendly and fun, also, very good food, and the , as far, as I'm concerned, the best oyster shucker in town.

The 75 cent raw oyster special at LUKE made it to my Happy Hour hop around NOLA.  

At the point of arrival, around 4pm and stop #3/4, my crew and I had already discovered the sexy chargrilled cousin to raw oysters.  The appeal of taking them raw and stripped down didn't seem as appealing especially since none of us had the acquired taste for it...  until we had them here. 

Something between them being sift of sand, sin of slime, and less than a buck made for a very enjoyable time.  Only downsides on our brief experience here were very sweet cocktails and a very salty waiter who couldn't wait FIVE minutes for us decide on drinks and food.  I would still strongly recommend coming here for oysters or a full 3 course dinner.  See Juliana T.'s review for the more complete meal I missed out on...
Delicious restaurant of the John Besh chain! The food did not dissapoint! The bread pudding is a must!

Overall experience not so great but due to no fault of the staff. The staff was very patient and friendly and different people constantly check up on you to see if your food came out ok, if you need a refill, if you have any other issues. 

We went on the Saturday night before Mardi Gras and although there restaurant was on the parade route we easily scored a reservation; every point of interaction was nothing short of friendly.
