Great knowledge of menu and good recommendations; best shrimp and grits (their point of pride) and really delicious, buttermilk fried quail (think fried chicken but better - great price for the portion - two birds split into four pieces). The gumbo was underwhelming, lukewarm and strangely viscous, but otherwise it was a good dining experience.

The firealarm went off halfway through our meal and lots of patrons cleared out; they are obviously unable to turn off that alarm once it's on, so they gave us complimentary beer to-go to continue our mardi gras festivities, which was nice. However it's a damn shame that I did not get to sample their bread pudding due to the premature kitchen closure :( will try and return the next I'm in town.
I enjoyed a BANGIN' oyster salad and deliciously spicy Bloody Mary!

Very good experience overall! We started the meal with drinks.  The house mixed drinks we selected were sophisticated and well made.  The wait staff was a younger and authentically New Orleans which personally added to our experience.  The menu contained a good variety that fused local Cajun and German styles to please any palate.  Conclusion, the food and wait staff was very good and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Lovely dining experience! You may want to order light on the dressing if getting the Bibb, although next time I'd really like to try the soup instead. Hands-down, the best French 75 I have ever had! Who doesn't love a drink that finishes with a bubbly, high alcohol, marinated cherry-laced mouthful? The service was on point, and ambience was calming and neat. Cheers!

Stopped in for lunch. Crab bisque was wonderful! House salad was very good too, but seemed to take longer than expected for a salad to be made/served. Staff was very friendly and attentive at the bar.

I am glad I was able to join friend for their reservations at Luke. The drinks were wonderful! First time having raw and fried oysters, I was told the raw oysters were less salty then regular which I appreciated. I had the crab bisque which was divine, tried my friends shrimp and grits, and the bread pudding, all were glorious and to top it off the serves was great.

Came here just for the happy hour oysters and drinks! Our waitress was Savannah. As soon as she walked over to our table I already knew we were going to get along quite well. The girl was decked out in Batman themed hair clips and tie! She was super nice and attentive - great employee. The oysters were $0.75 each and so fresh! We got two dozen ($18). Fried oysters were half off too ($7.50). Good amount to share between two people. For drinks I would recommend the Buffalo Negra. Don't let the vinegar sway you away!

I was quite impressed with this place being one of the first places we went to in NOLA. The shrimp and grits are on point, even though I've never had it before, but I loved it and the whole experience was great. 

*Cooked and layer crusted Oyster - This was a smashing hit for me. It was hard to tell that these were even oyster because of what was on top of it. I believe it was scallop encrusted on top the oyster and it was delicious. They may have the happy hour oysters, but I think it's worth it to pay more for these cooked oysters. 

**Shrimp and Grits - MUST HAVE. This is what of the lick your plate moments where you wonder how have I not eaten this before. Shrimp and Grits is a common comfort food here and Luke knows how to mastermind it. The grits is covered in a great sauce and tons of large shrimp inside. Great from beginning to end. 

***Fried Pork Belly Thin Crust Pizza - If you want to have a headache from eating too much fat. This is the pizza that looks like it should be healthy at first glance, then you see the fried pork, and its not. The only thing thin is the layer, but the toppings are heavy.
Hostess a tad rude, shrimp over cooked. Otherwise the bar tender was great!  Oysters are tasty

Stopped here around 8:45pm because I'd just flown into town and heard this was a great spot.  I'm a vegetarian so I started with the sprouts which where simply perfect.  Roasted in a cast iron pan and then drizzled with honey and topped with a nice salty cheese and apple splices, they were delicious to the last bite.  

Service was a bit slow, had to watch an empty glass at the bar for quite some time before I was offered another but I digress.  

I heard from another patron that the happy hour is amazing so I might be back soon.
Average touristy place. When acclaimed chef goes mainstream commercial, it brings below average plates / experience.

While I realize the importance of seating people with reservations first, why is it such a fuss to get a table when so many are vacant--both at lunch and dinner? I had the buillabaisse and the gumbo. Both were rich in consistently if under-spiced. I also find seafood in New Orleans -/ certainly here -- to taste a bit muddy. Is it fresh? The fresh bread is warm and crispy, served with whipped butter and replenished as needed. The caramel pecan bread pudding was incredible. Service was quite attentive. A very nice Bordeaux was only $44. Again, front desk is a bit off: I wanted to get a burger and sit at the bar and it seemed a big production to determine that only a very small and awkward side spot was available.

Sorry. I was hoping this was going to be good. The food is just OK but worst of all is the service. The server and the hostess and another woman just stand at the front podium and giggling and don't pay any attention to the customers. Zero attention to detail.  Um, I'm here paying your salary...and tip!  But I guess you don't need the tip or the patronage.  Not recommended.

Are u kidding me? Not only were there 8 tables open when we walked in and they told us a 3 hour wait... We were about to order a drink at the bar when one of the waiters purposely kicked me in the back of the foot when I wasn't looking and tried to play it off like one of their other hostesses did it.  Way many better other options in new orleans

First, shout out to Kayla (spelling?), you were awesome!!!

Came here during Happy Hour and decided to go light on the raw oysters because ACME Oyster Bar was scheduled for Wednesday. [ Good catholic boys can't eat meat on Ash Wednesday =) ] Well, in retrospect, I regret that decision. Lüke served better oysters. They were delicious, fresh, big, and not gritty at all. ACME's oysters had so much grit. However, this is about Lüke so...Be careful with the horseradish, it was really strong; you'll clear any nasal congestion by overdoing it. I also got a half-dozen order of their fried oysters which is served with some really good dipping sauce. (5 out of 5)

Crab Bisque: got a cup portion because my friend and I wanted to split multiple dishes to taste the menu but don't do it guys, ordering the cup portion that is. This was so good! This creamy soup loaded with tons of shredded crab meat was my favorite of the night. Don't pass on this! Must have! (5 out of 5)

Crispy Brussels Sprouts: I wouldn't call it crispy. UCHI in a Houston, Texas serves "crispy" BS and they're worth every penny. I really liked this nonetheless; they come second after UCHI's. The Marcona almonds gives a nice nutty tune throughout each bite and the Espelette honey gave it a sweetness that didn't make you feel like you were getting a sugar overload. (4 out of 5)

Shrimp & Grits: this has a little spicy kick to it from the jalapeños; somewhere between mild and medium on spice level. The Louisiana shrimps were meaty and tender and the grits very creamy in an andouille sauce with pieces of andouille sausages. I enjoyed it, it wasn't packing with flavor so I wouldn't say I'd order it again. (3 out of 5)

Brendan's Bread Pudding: I was told this is what their known for dessert wise. Though I liked it, I can't say it was the best bread pudding. I would suggest you ask for an extra side of their pecan sauce because that's mostly where the flavor will come from. (3 out of 5)

The noise level was HIGH. I don't know if it was because it was Mardi Gras week but don't bring your sleeping baby here.
Plain and simple: my absolute favorite restaurant in New Orleans.

Went here for brunch and thought the food was just okay.  Had the shrimp and grits - $24 for five shrimp and an appetizer-sized portion of grits.  Food was a bit over-seasoned as well.  Left hungry and disappointed.  Maybe dinner is better?

Service was subpar for the type of place this is - it wasn't particularly busy but waited about 5 minutes after finishing our food before the waiter came by to even  check if we wanted a coffee refill.  So much for southern hospitality...

We went there last May upon recommendation of our daughter and son-I law.  It was awesome- great menu, excellent food  and service.  It's a small place but definitely worth going to.  Will definitely be back.

I'm going to start by saying the food was amazing, we started with a sazerac and bufala negra and got the ribeye and crawfish etouffee with bread pudding for dessert. Everything was fantastic.

The subpar rating is for the service. We had a late reservation on Valentine's Day but the front dining room was about half full around 9 pm. Our server came by for drink orders and about 15 minutes later we finally got our drinks, this was frustrating because I was facing the bar and could see the bartenders doing side work instead of making drinks for guests. The drinks and food came, both times they gave the items to the wrong person. I was under the impression that this was a fine dining establishment where the servers would be able to input which guest ordered what item so there was no confusion at the table. After some very minimal attention from the servers, one of them came over with the check while we were still eating dessert and said 'let's wrap this up' . 

The food was amazing but along with the large price tag I was expecting great service and instead it was just very underwhelming. I'm glad that we got to eat at a John Besh restaurant but we won't be back.

Outstanding food and just OK service.  Not my first time here and glad to see that the food is still as good as I remember.  I would have rated hie but the waiter was quite slow and desert too forever- Manager apologized but did not offer anything to compensate the 30 min wait for bread pudding.

This place is amazing! Great ambiance and service. Food was delicious! Best oysters my husband has ever had. I had the lobster and crab bisque soup and we were very happy with our meal! This was our first time in New Orleans and we will definitely be returning to Luke on our next visit!

Went here and sat at the bar to dine alone. Food was good, wine pour was way short and service was terrible. The bartender was extremely rude from the moment I sat down. I am in the hospitality industry so I try to be extra nice to those in the service business. Well, this girl didn't want to have anything to do with me. She seemed annoyed that I even sat there to begin with. I had to ask twice for my wine and where I sat (only seat available at bar) was sticky so I asked for it to be wiped down. She never smiled and couldn't get rid of me fast enough. There are many other restaurants that have great food so I will not come back here or recommend to anyone else.

LOVE this Place!  Arrived before a Saints Game, had a Large Party, no reservations... the staff was Great.  They seated us, no problems and the food was amazing!  We started with coffee and a wonderful "Southern Style" Brunch and of course some Adult Beverages.... The Staff and Fare is Not to be missed.  This place is a MUST for locals and I highly recommend it to visitors who wish to experience True New Orleans Cooking  and Southern Hospitality.

Fabulous meal here with friends -- had appetizers of stuffed P*J oysters (great), flammenkuchen (a decent pizza), tasty and slightly sweet crispy brussels sprouts and fried quail (nothing special). Also we had the salad Luke which was a little odd to have to cut our own lettuce, an otherwise average dish. The ribeye was delish and the rosemary potatoes were stellar. The gateau basque (vanilla cake with berry marmalade) was not memorable. Service was pretty good and I would be glad to come back here.
Man their shrimp and grits GOES! That was delicious, the waitress was effin great and the gumbo as well. Want to go back to New Orleans just to go back.

My girl friends & I came here for brunch & I must say: EVERYTHING IS ON POINT.
- The Nutella stuffed French toast was crispy, crunchy, lightly sweetened w/ Nutella & on a bed of fresh whipped cream.
- The brussel sprouts were lightly crisped, sweetened & delicious.
- The flambé was amazing w/ the melted cheese, large chunks of bacon & caramelized onions.
- Wow, the crab omelette had huge pieces of crab meat. It also had nice chunks of tomatoes & stalks of asparagus. And the vinaigrette on the salad was lightly sweet, adding a nice touch to the greens.
- I think I went to heaven when I ate the bread pudding... Vanilla ice cream on a bed of soft warm cup of bread pudding, yum yum yum. Soft, fluffy & lightly crunchy exterior topped w/ candied pecans. YES!

The service and food was so amazing, we ended up coming back for happy hour. Yes we did & boy, it was so worth it for those fat oysters & cheap drinks!

A must when you're in NoLa! Make reservations for brunch. So. Worth. It!

Crawfish bisque was absolutely outstanding.  The Brussels Sprouts dish is in believable. The flavor is a tangy and sweet combined.  Can't believe it was a vegetable.  Next course was Shrimp and Grits.  Spicy but a great mix. Outstanding meal with great service.

I came here with my girl for brunch. I brunch every weekend in NYC and this was the single best brunch I've ever had. I got the crawfish omelette and have never had anything near this good. If you don't get this I feel bad for you. 

This omelette is overflowing with buttered craw. There's a salad with it with a vinegar base to cut it. They through some fries my way for free but I didn't waste my time. I wouldn't let anything mar the perfect flavor of this plate. I recommend you do the same. 

Finish with the coffee they give you with real cream ( not milk and absolutely no cheesy little packets). 

I left feeling satisfied and classy. Odds are this place can't be beat. There can only be one best and I think Luke claims it. 

Andrew served and is a great host.

Can't go wrong here. Of course, the happy hour oysters and drinks are fantastic, but Luke is also a great place to go for a date or if you've got friends in from out of town. Awesome food and atmosphere. Not crazy expensive either.

Great place for oysters and beer.  Had the New Orleans ipa.  Was great!  Damn near knocked me on my butt after three.  Also had the raw oysters and fried oysters.  Bother were fantastic.  Service was fast, just a bit of a wait for larger parties but plenty of room for small parties.

We went here for m birthday last night in a group of  9 people. Their food and service was by far the best we've ever experienced! And for foodies, that's saying a lot. Every entree was love in our mouths. Our server Timmy Glitter was the sweetest and most accommodating! Thank you Luke for a memorable birthday dinner

Popped in for a late lunch on a Friday with my daughter. We were in time for their happy hour oyster special. 6 P&J raw oysters for .75 each? Um, yes please. We also had a really tasty crawfish bisque and flammenkuchen (basically a thin flatbread topped with onions, cheese, and thick cut bacon). The flammenkuchen was pretty good but we both thought the bacon was a bit too thick for our tastes. Service was spot on. I'd definitely come back for dinner.
We stopped by a couple of weeks ago for Sunday brunch.  The food was very good and filling.  Nice drinks, and we had a very pleasant server.  Cool cafe space.  Overall a good recommend.

For all the hype and build-up I received about Luke, it was a little bit of a let down. I had the wienerschnitzel and my friend had the shrimp and grits. My pork was pounded thin and cooked well. It was pretty tender, the panko crust was golden and crispy but could have used a bit of flavor. The wild mushroom ragout was a little lack luster. It tasted heavily of sherry, but had almost nothing else going for it besides a heap full of really amazing wild mushrooms (which was redeeming). The fries are shoestring and thin, and really tasty when they're piping hot, but stale quickly and then get kind of hard and yucky. My friend had the shrimp and grits, which was good, but overly rich even for a typically overly rich dish. We had a beyond amazing meal the next day at Commander's for the same price. Wouldn't do it again. I do, however, hear that their happy hour is great! Good oysters, their raw bar seemed on point.

We had reservation at 3 PM and of course we arrived 15 minutes early, Great! We can grab a drink at the bar. There were many empty tables so the host said there will be a little bit of a wait since they're waiting for the table that they were planning to seat is at to close their tab.  Of course I didn't mind since we are early. We sat at the bar and ordered many rounds of drink until I notice that it's 3:30ish, wow our reservation time had pass and the seating are being all filled up. So I walked up to the host she said it shouldn't be anymore longer until we get seated.... Ok we had reservation and didn't even get seated until 45 mins later! Which I told myself I wouldn't let that ruin my meal.

We bumped into Happy Hour.. Yay! $.75 Raw Oysters and $1.50 Fried Oysters. The raw oysters were so fresh but it wasn't clean, I was biting into little particles of shells crumbs in my oysters and some looked dirty. The fried oysters tasted delicious and even the dip that came with it taste just right. I even ordered the Brussels Sprouts skillet, that was top notch. The seafood gumbo was okay... There was a few oysters, a few shrimp and some sausage. It was kind of bland to me. But at all it's worth the experience!!!

If you have never been to a John Besh restaurant, there is no easier way to be introduced than to spend an early evening at Luke's rightfully acclaimed happy hour. I have eaten my share of oysters (and part of yours) in my day, and a significant percentage of them have been consumed in Louisiana, which is only notable because I've never lived there. If you like your oysters plump, briny, ice cold, well-cleaned and grit free, this is the place to go. It's even better during Happy Hour because they are only $.75 each! I have eaten my way around NO twice last year, and these are my unchallenged winners for best oysters on both visits, even though I ate at several traditional oyster houses each time. If that were not enough, they also offer fried oysters for $1 each during HH, and they are the best I have ever eaten, any time, anywhere. We eventually tried most of the items on the HH menu, and they all exceeded expectations. The specialty cocktails are outstanding, even at full price, but they are a cocktail connoisseur's best value in a city known for impeccable cocktails.

If you are like me you want great service to make it a truly great dining experience. Nicholas was our waiter, and he gave that perfect blend of friendly service and attention to detail that makes a meal into a perfect evening. He's worth asking for.

Went in without a reservation for brunch and were told it would be a 20 minute wait. Had a glass of wine at the bar and a few minutes later we were seated.  First off, service is fantastic. Had the Louisiana jumbo shrimp and jalapeño cheese grits...best shrimp 'n' grits ever. Grits were very creamy and the shrimp was perfectly cooked. Also tried the Fried chicken biscuit...Chicken was crispy, juicy, and well seasoned. Biscuit was light and fluffy and had notes of honey. Finished it off with bread pudding topped with vanilla bean ice cream. Pudding was warm, yummy caramel sauce made with rum and the pecans tied it all together. Great meal in NOLA John Besh restaurants never disappoint.

I would just like to commend my waiter, Mr. Tristan. He was very hospitable to my husband and I, he made wonderful reccomendations based on what I explained I was in search of and was very informative of the dishes we were going to be recieveing and what could be expected. Tristan was very very thorough and made sure everything was absolutely perfect, he really sets the standards for wait staff and I can honestly say that he made the ending to our splendid trip to New Orleans that much more special!!! Mr. Besh he should definitely be training all your employees :). Thanks again Tristan and I hope that we shall meet again!

What a great place in NOLA! We went there yesterday for happy hour and the cocktails and P&J fresh oysters were amazing! I think the four us ate 3 dozen. The wine list was very nice as well. 

Then this morning we returned for breakfast. I had never had shrimp and grits before and it was filling yea, but so delicious. Too bad we are leaving tomorrow.

The reviews did not lie. The bread pudding by itself deserved 5 stars. Completely awesome. You can taste the rum in the pecan sauce. OMG!!!! The shrimp n grits had soooo much flavor, the shrimp were not over cooked, soo good. You would not be disappointed with this selection. Go for it.
Make a reservation, it gets packed.

Came here based on other reviews, and we were not disappointed (although we didn't take the advice on booking a reservation. Should have!) Oysters were phenomenal...2 dozen between 3 of us and they all went down fast. I then had one of the best salads, yes salads, that I've ever had - Salad Luke. The beets were sweet and perfectly bitter. It was a little hard to eat, but worth the mess. My hubby and I split the King Crab and had a wonderful time cracking and dipping. So good. Finally, my 20 month old loved the grilled cheese with veggies (btw my husband may come back just for these veggies). I don't recommend coming with a kiddo, but if you have to, they still treat you right. We will be back!

My colleague and I ate here after attending a nurse practitioner conference. We had heard amazing reviews about this restaurant and were excited to experience a taste of New Orleans. We arrived at the restaurant and were informed it would be a two hour wait to be seated, though there were plenty of open tables. We gave them the benefit of the doubt, and assumed they were reserved. We took a seat at the bar, where we were helped by an amazing bartender who also seemed confused that we weren't able to get a seat. After speaking with some coworkers, the hostess was able to get us seated in the mostly empty restaurant. Our waitress was rude and blamed us for moving a water flask we never touched. Food was decent. But overall a bad and strange experience.

Fantastic! Shrimp and grits are a Southern staple. - and Luke has it down to perfection. The presentation was superb-cast iron small plate. The shrimp were soft and succulent. The reduction gravy was on point. Damn GOOD!   Nice size portion as well.

But wait.... BREAD PUDDING + Bananas fosters + a scoop of ice cream on top= sweet heaven on earth.    Whooooo Doooooogy it was GREAT!     -and I don't even eat sweets like that.

Came here for brunch on a Thursday morning at 10:30; we had reservations, but there were plenty of tables.

Service was great, and the ambience of the place was old-school and cozy. I ordered the pain perdu, laughing at the irony that the dish has both challah and bacon, and excited for some sweet/savory goodness.

It. Was. Delicious. And HUGE. I mean, really massive. I couldn't finish it. The mascarpone sauce was really yummy, so much so that I hardly used any syrup. I enjoyed every bite.

I also tried some of my husband's fried chicken and tabasco honey biscuit sandwich (very yummy, only a little kick from the tabasco) and cheesy grits (yes).

If you are looking for a real New Orleans food experience without pretentious of fancy pants items on the menu this would be a great choice. At first glance it looks like a bar but the mouth-watering display of oysters, crab legs and shrimp front-and-center when you walk in will tip you off to its real purpose. 

Lüke is buzzy, fun and the food, delicious. Diners at our table had everything from the etouffee to then fried oyster salad and all of it was delicious. They had an excellent selection of local beers, too.

Casual, lively, great service and all at a reasonable price. When next in NO, we'll be back.

We went to Luke for the 75 cent oyster happy hour. When we first walked in the restaurant looked packed and I was worried there were no tables, but the restaurant extends farther back than the first front room and we didn't have a problem being seated at a cozy banquette table in the back room. In addition to a dozen raw oysters, we also ordered a bowl of seafood gumbo and the rabbit and chicken liver pate, all to share. I absolutely loved the pate. It had a rich and creamy flavor and also came with several great accompaniments. My only "complaint" is that there was so much pate that we could have used more croutons. On the other hand I was pretty disappointed with the gumbo. While there was a lot of seafood in the bowl, the gumbo itself was bland and lacked any kind of kick. It was the most expensive and my least favorite of the four different gumbos I tried in New Orleans. All in all I'm glad we tried Luke's and coming from Orlando the 75 cent oysters were a steal. In general though we were underwhelmed by both John Besh restaurants we visited.

I think the food here is very good, and the oysters reasonable for the CBD, especially at happy hour.

I love the charcuterie, especially their hogs head cheese. everything is house made down to the horseradish, and that shines through. otherwise the menu would be somewhat forgettable. there's drum, shrimp, chicken...pretty much what you would expect on a coastal Louisiana menu except for the crazy German influence with dishes like the flamenkuchen (probably didn't spell that correctly). 

the portions are generous and the prices fair. there's many a tourist, but locals find their way here too. I keep finding my way back too...so they must be doing something right.

Dropped into Nola day after fat Tuesday...town was dead...found W.I.N.O ...Exelent pay per pour wine tasting bar...Sent us to Cuchaun...the best...Great first night....back at the hotel ..go to the bar...what a surprise...should have stayed home...Brandy & Chris are awesome...they made it great...as well as the food
Don't miss it

Powerful drinks, great happy hour specials!

Get there early, though, if you are going for the happy hour because it will get packed fast!

The chefs are fantastic.   The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The decor was interesting.  Check out the oysters and artwork.   The prices were reasonable.   I have gone with girlfriends during lunch and happy hour.   Great food.    You should try one of everything to see what you love.
I had the Drum fish meunière with veggies and The house Fru beer haven't had a meal in a while that just made me smile it was so good...this one did! Delicious meal, great atmosphere.

My husband is an avid hunter and says the quail was the best he'd ever had. The drum was pretty good. The vegetables were over salted for my taste.  The fresh oysters were delicious as our appetizer.  Nice location near le pavilion.

Yay for happy hour 3-6PM daily - 75 cents oysters and half off beer! Would've been a 5 star if not for the little mishap in getting our table. 

We arrived at 3PM on Sunday with no reservations. The hostess informed us that we could either wait for bar seating which is first come first serve or we could put our name down for a table. Since our hotel was nearby and we weren't too hungry, we didn't mind the one hour wait and left our name and number with the hostess. An hour passed by, we made our back to Luke, and the hostess seemed surprise that we came back. The restaurant was not even half filled, and many tables were open. It didn't make sense to us why they didn't bother to call/text when our table was ready. 

Anyways, the happy hour is as good as it sounds! We got two dozen raw oysters for only $18! What a steal! And the oysters were all meaty and juicy. It was a nice mid day snack, and next time I would consider trying their other food as well. 

Try to make reservation and double check with the hostess to avoid what happened to us.
Don't overlook this restaurant.  Located right next to the Hilton New Orleans / St Charles. Good wine selection and service.  The food was delicious.  Try the rabbit/chicken Pate as an appetizer.

Had a fabulous Sunday birthday brunch! Complete with mimosas and delicious shrimp and grits. I have to say it does annoy me when tails are on shrimp when a sauce it used. But the sauce was delicious, so I didn't mind too much getting in there to remove the tails, then lick my fingers . Finale was bread pudding a la mode!

We have been here twice for brunch and have enjoyed it immensely. Everything we have tried has been delicious, particularly the grits with scallions and sour cream. But the room is always freezing so be sure to bring a sweater!

I was really excited to try this place after reading all of the stellar reviews. Unfortunately the shrimp tasted like ammonia. The grits were excellent, but that shrimp shouldn't have been served... especially not to people who have lived on the gulf coast their whole lives. My fiancé had the schnitzel, and that was alright. It was weird that it was served with a mountain of fries though. A side of greens would've been a lot better rather than fried food on top of fried food. He did enjoy the mushroom ragu that came with it though. And the pecan bourbon tart was excellent. Oh well.
Outstanding and reasonably priced. I'll never forget the shrimp and grits, or the bread pudding, or the house salad!

This was average food.  Had a reservation for 7 people.   Restaurant confirmed it in the morning.  When we arrived it was obvious there was some confusion. Sat us at a table right in front which is kind of an after thought area.  Asked if there was a table more toward the back but there was not. Cool air comes in every time door is opened.  People waiting to be seated right on top of us.  Our waiter Vusi was very good.  Brightest spot of the place really. Manager came over to see if everything was ok after seating us with "5 minutes notice and doing the best they could ". So this was the issue our table was given to walk ins.  When we told her it was not ok and we had made a reservation over a week ago she realized their error.  So she offered dessert to the table as a consultation. Some dishes very good , shrimp and grits for example. Others just ok.  If back in the area would not make it a point to return

Really 4.5 stars.

Two of my friends took me here for my birthday, and it was quite a treat.

They serve .75 raw oysters, 1.25 fried oysters, and half-price drinks (drafts, wines, cocktails) during happy hour. My friends got the oysters, which they said were great. I ordered a Buffala Negra, which was a whiskey-ginger with balsamic vinegar and basil. Sounds kinda odd, and was a bit like a salad dressing with alcohol, but was very very good. We also ordered the flamenkuchen, a German onion, emmenthaler, and pork tart. It was good, but quite large and so rich that even between three of us it was a bit much to finish.

For dinner we ordered three entrees and shared family style: crawfish and pork pasta; swordfish with cauliflower and kale; and grilled shrimp over cheesy grits with andouille. All were good, the shrimp was definitely the best.

We got there for a Friday brunch. The service is great and the food was pretty tasty as well. I ordered the fried oyster salad and find the bacon to be the highlight of the dish. My pork schnitzel was lightly battered and deep fried. It comes with a mushroom Sauce. Personally I like it prepared without any sauce but the sauce actually is not bad at all. My hubby ordered a seafood bullion with creole flavor and he loved it.

Stumbled in. And basically never came out. We were here for three days and kept returning because the food was exquisite and the service (sybille?) made you feel special! She seemed busy but somehow managed to acknowledge everyone and even make jokes to entertain while you waited. Happy hour had .75 oysters and great prices on drinks! When she found out we're were honeymooning she made sure to congratulate us and offer us a drink! Which in turn made us stay longer and order more  great place to come over and over!

Happy Hour Oysters!! 75 cents!

Came for oyster happy hour with a friend while in New Orleans. Saw the great reviews figured I'd give it a shot while in the central business district. 

Nice space, friendly servers and quick service. 

The oysters were probably slightly above average. They seemed fresh however they were really quite sandy, which was disappointing. The sand kept us from ordering more than our original 2 dozen. 

The oyster are gulf oysters which are huge compared to Washington or east coast oyster, so be prepared to order less than you expect. Since they were so large we filled up quite quickly on just 2 dozen for a happy hour snack.

After seeing positive reviews decided to try Luke's for dinner. Walking in the place was busy and we were told the wait would be over two and a half hours for a table; luckily, there were spots at the bar. I decided to go with the shrimp and grits (termed 'en cocotte') and enjoyed watching them shuck oysters while I waited. I didn't have to wait long, though, and was pleasantly surprised at how quickly my entree came. The shrimp were nice and plump and the grits had jalapeños mixed in which made for a delicious combination. 

I was going to be satisfied leaving until someone asked for a dessert menu--and then I saw the bread pudding. Oh my gosh: this stuff is so good. Not only is it bread pudding: it's topped with a pecan sauce and then ice cream that perfectly melts as you scoop your spoon into it. 

Overall, a nice dinner and absolutely delicious dessert. And by sitting at the bar, some shucking entertainment.

This restaurant is the lobby of the Hilton where we were staying.  We tried three times to get in for a before dinner snack and twice for dessert each time the hostesses were less than friendly and told us that the wait would be over 30 minutes as we were staring at multiple empty tables.  The hotel staff advised us to order room service and that we wouldn't be refused. So we decided to do that while we sat in the lobby and people watched.  The hotel staff had been wonderful the hostesses at Luke not so much. They are so rude.

Went here for lunch with my wife during our NOLA trip. Nice location, can't even tell it's connected to the Hilton (which is a good thing).

I had the crawfish bisque as a starter and my wife had one of their salads. My bisque is one of the best seafood soups I've ever had, delicate but full of flavor big crawfish tails all over, in a word great. 

My gumbo was a great entree but my wife's schnitzel was lacking a little flavor. Crispy and tender as a schnitzel should be but very little seasoning so it came a bit bland.

Overall a great experience, will definitely go back.

I was disappointed with my dinner at Luke.  I was eating solo on a Sunday night, so I sat at the bar.  The vibe was great, but most of the food was poor.  I enjoyed the Salad Luke, but the market (Drumfish) fish meuniere was awful.  It was basically an oily, fried piece of fish that lacked flavor except for the heavy dose of salt - that also permeated the accompanying vegetables.  And it seemed as though the Crispy Brussels Sprouts were prepared in the same manner.  Yes, I expected them to be fried, but these were drenched in oil and doused with salt.  I was really not happy and left more than half of each dish.  I chose not to waste time with dessert.  The service was very good.
I personally liked this restaurant in Nola. The steak was SO good. But don't get the crab - it's not worth the price, the just put a thin layer on it.

Love the atmosphere here! My table was in the back and i could see the chefs cooking, which I loved. Service is very attentive and just to my liking. 

Onto the food...

First of all, try their soups!!! The seafood gumbo and crawfish bisque were amazing ways to start the meal. The crawfish head in the Bisque is stuffed -- a delightful surprise. The gumbo was super tasty but it was a little sandy when I got to the bottom of the bowl. I found a tiny rock in one of my bites :( 

The quail was well fried and I liked that they added sweetness to balance out the gaminess of the bird. The shrimp and grits were perfect -- hot and cheesy and saucy. 

Lastly, definitely definitely get the steamed chocolate & caramel ice cream. You won't regret it! It's rich and melt in your mouth amazing.
Had lunch there for the fist time. I absolutely love the Brussels sprouts! The entrees were delicious as well. Fast, friendly service.

I came here for happy hour where it's a great deal (all drinks are half off and oysters are only .75/each!!!!!) The oysters were some of the biggest I've ever seen - very meaty and tasted simple and "clean" as in not much of a sea/salt water flavor but enjoyable enough. The sancerre went very well with the oysters.

Unfortunately, the service was lacking for such a popular "more upscale" place. I got a seat at the bar right away but it took the bartender at least 5 minutes before she came over to wipe down the counter and give menus. After taking my order, I had to wait almost another 10 minutes for my glass of wine. I noticed she served the drinks of a pair who sat afterward first. It wasn't that busy but she acted as if she did not want to be there. I expected more and better at a place like Luke. At least she went around letting everyone know she was taking last orders for HH right before it ended.
The happy hour oysters are reaaaaally cheap! 75cents per oyster! We had a dozen--the oysters are quite fresh and big. The shrimp and grits are average though.

Only have been once as its impossible to get in for the oyster happy hour. Like seriously, don't  expect to get in.

Great French brasserie menu and an amazing burger. Attentive staff.
Best experience I've had since I've been to Luke. Request for Cybill bartender! She gives you a warm feeling.
This place has a ridiculous happy hour! The 75 cent oysters are such a treat, the atmosphere, the creamy crawfish bisque was so delicious I came back for another taste during my trip to NOLA.

Our food was delicious!! The brussel sprouts appetizer was to die for. We also shared the crawfish bisque and the shrimp and grits, which were both delicious as well. I would recommend both!! We made a reservation, which I would recommend doing as well. The service was very friendly, polite, and helpful. I only wish we had more money to spend on food!

An unpretentious throwback to Old World New Orleans. Luke offers German specialties such as house-made sausages, classic French fares and super fresh Louisiana Seafood. They have an extensive wine and beer selection. 

Flammenkuchen- Thin alsacien onion tarte, bacon, emmenthaler cheese. This appetizer could have well been my main dish. 4/5. Try it!  

Matzo ball and roast chicken soup - mehhhh...I compare Luke's matzo ball soup 3/5 with that of NAT N' AL 5/5 in Beverly Hills, California. 

Shrimp and grits- not a fan of creole, but this dish was spot-on. This dish is perfect to share and with bread......awwwwww 5/5.  Try it!  

Just one last thought. Just be aware that in today's world, your customers have the power to share their positive or negative experiences on social network. For every one person who complains, there are thousands who will not. They just will just stop doing business with you. This being said, the hostess of the day is in need of customer service training.
Nice happy hour specials.  Great oysters.  Brussels sprouts are a must!  Staff a bit rushed, surly at first, but we were all friends by the end.

I would qualify it as one of the best restaurants in town. It is a mist.
We got to sit in front of the kitchen and you get the real experience there. Food was incredible!
Also the service was amazing. When we finnished dinner started to rain and blow very heavy wind. Thanks to the hostess we didn't got wet!! We really appreciate it! She saved us from getting soaking wet!!
Great seafood platter. Gumbo was awesome. Worth the visit. Crispy Kale with the swordfish was unique and tasty. Fish very fresh. Bit pricey but great for a special meal

Luke is great for happy hour 3-6pm. Oysters are 75 cents each an amazing deal and fresh.

Drinks half price. Recommend Sazerac and The Chelsea. You will be happy.

Gumbo is decent as well.
The pate was as smooth and delectable as our charming and handsome server Andrew. Rib eye perfect. And wines paired to each course. Excellent choice when visiting New Orleans.

There's Luke when it first opened, and Luke now. Both are creative, memorable and palette pleasing. But personally, I like it the way it used to be. What has not changed are the shrimp and grits!! Highly recommend ordering it. 

Is it just me or does it feel like dining at dinner requires at least a 2-2.5 hour commitment?  Meaning the pace is definitely more of a laissez fare speed. But rest assured, if you appear to move your neck in any direction, your server will be there to assist you. Or another one will. That said, the quality of service has not changed. It is outstanding! If you need to get in and out, it is best to dine during the weekday lunch rush because it's quicker. You can also let your server know you have a plane or play to catch. Take it from me, they can speed it up when they need to.
Happy Hour Oyster! You must have it!!!! And for entree, try the Mussel !!!!! Awesome!!!!!

Great restaurant and yummy food. Definitely a little more upscale than what the group and I thought it was going to be. Oysters from Cape Cod were $31. Worth it! A couple of people got the Luke Burger and I had a bite of it...it is so good. The MOULES ET FRITES were delicious as well. A plate full of PRINCE EDWARD ISLAND MUSSELS STEAMED WITH GARLIC & THYME WITH HOUSE-MADE FRIES..yes...delicious..wow. JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP EN COCOTTEI was another dish that a couple of the group members ordered. Same comment, consistently great. They both enjoyed it so much. I had the Fruge Farms Crawfish Etouffee and it was definitely something that I enjoyed eating, but the presentation of it was not so great. Let's just say that the noodles don't look so appetizing. Overall, great restaurant...very beautiful on the inside and great service. We left the restaurant highly satisfied. What more can you ask for?
Can't beat 75 cent oysters and half price drinks during happy hour! Not the warmest of bartenders but I'll take it at the price!

Great ambiance, good food and amazing service. I wish I could remember our waitress's name since she was such a doll and deserves a shoutout (she was blond and super sassy if that helps :) We tried the tabasco honey fried chicken with dirty rice, the crawfish bisque, and the shrimp encocotte. Our favorite dishes were the crawfish bisque and the dirty rice. The other dishes were good...just not great. However, I'm still giving this place 4 stars because of the overall experience due to our wonderful server.

I recently traveled New Orleans for the first time with a group of friends. One of witch has a sixth sense for finding the best restaurants around no matter where we go. Lüke was by far the best of many great food experiences we had during our stay. To keep this post brief enough to not be overlooked by most, I'll just say this. 

In a nutshell, good location. Extremely good food and drinks. With unexpectedly friendly service.  

It's far enough from Bourbon st. to get away from the drunks. But not too far that it's not within walking distance from it. The main dining room looks like the upscale intimate atmosphere you would expect. But the upper dining room by the kitchen is where we preferred to be. Still very nice, but with a little more breathing room. 

The drinks are simply amazing! We all sampled each others and the conversations that came after that alone was worth the visit. But then we ordered.... To our surprise, the evening got even better. Again we all shared a sample with each other. And again, we were all surprised with how great everything was. 

Now the part that it seems like most people have negative things to say here, the service. I'm my experience, that couldn't be further from the truth. Our server Kris was extremely knowledgeable about the menu, professional and attentive to just the right degree. He never gave me the feeling like he was standing over my shoulder. But every time I looked to find him, he was already walking towards our table. 

This place will be a staple to every trip I take New Orleans!

Delicious shrimp and grits. A bit pricey and can be loud after work hours especially since they have happy hour and a lot of people take advantage of it after work. We came here twice and enjoyed both times. The price is the only difficult thing to swallow (pun intended).

Amazing, all the gals enjoyed their dishes, but the crowd pleaser for the evening were their burger and the cheese grits with shrimp. I still think of those grits and wish I was back in New Orleans! Service was excellent and I had the best bachelorette week during Mardi Gras!

We really enjoy coming to Luke when in town.  My favorite dish is actually the mussles & fries.  Great spot for a late night dinner!  While most customers tend to be dressed more casual, you won't be overdressed in business casual.  They also have nice rooms for larger parties and after-work dinners.

Lüke is a chef John Besh restaurant located in the Central Business district below the Hilton Hotel. It's very close to Canal Street. 

I visited Lüke with a group of 5 for happy hour. The happy hour special included: half off cocktails, wine, beer and OYSTERS daily from 3 to 6 p.m. 

We ordered 3 dozen raw oysters, a dozen fried oysters, jalapeno grits, pâté of rabbit & chicken livers, and crispy brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious and so flavorful. It was one of the best restaurants we dined at during our visit to New Orleans.

I am a fan of August. Luke is good but to me it's more of a burger, oyster or  breakfast place. It is not a destination restaurant in my opinion. There are places I would rather go, but if you are staying in the hotel, or live in the CBD,  it would be convenient.

Talk about torn! In some ways Luke is 3 stars, service is just ok, the feeling is "we will get to you when were ready". One caveat, we dined at 3 pm, which apparently was shift change for servers, maybe for cooks as well. Took 25 minutes to get an order of 4 oysters on the half! They took the entree order 35 minutes after we were seated.  As far as food quality Luke is 5 stars plus. Gumbo, crawfish bisque, fresh oysters+++, fried oysters, mussels, jambalaya with pork belly and smoked sausage +++ , shrimp n grits- literally everything we tried was as good as ever tasted before. So between the who cares service and the beyond great flavors it's 4 stars.

I would say it's very fancy looking place for southern food but I was like I am gonna go in anyways. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits. It's Louisiana's shrimp, eggs, andouille sausage and jalapeno cheese grits. I hella loved it. It was cooked like a sauce and all mixed together perfectly on top of a very very very bomb jalapeno cheese grits. The grits I would say was the highlight. This girl loves grits and with jalapeno even more amazing. I would definitely come back again.

We came here for Easter brunch and there were a lot of good things about it. The mains were very good- I had the shrimp and grits (grits w/cheddar and jalapeño), which was amazing. Great flavors. And I really appreciate that they worked with us to expand our reservation from 2 to 6 the night before what I am sure is a very busy time for them.

That being said, I was a little disappointed by the size of the menu; not a lot of options. And some of the side dishes weren't great.. the home fries were smothered in onions. Overall I thought it was a perfectly acceptable brunch spot, but a little pricey to not be wowed.

Just checked in at Luke's, apparently they can't combine two 2 seater  tables for a Grp of three because the restaurant closes at 11 and last call for food is 10:30....

Food is important and so, is the customer and when it's almost restaurant closing time, you can always do a lil more coz the crowd flowing in is less...

This review is solely for Luke's Happy Hour and the pricing definitely plays a part in the rating.

75 cent for raw oysters (any amount) and $1.25 for fried oysters (6 or a dozen). Half off for cocktails and alcohol. 

We got 2 raw oysters, a dozen fried oysters, a cup of gumbo and a French 75. I love the fact that they didn't cheap out and give us bottom shelf cognac. The raw oysters were slightly sandy. Fried oysters were a little too over coated with batter, but slightly lovely. The gumbo was out of this world - smoky with a depth given by the roux, rich without being heavy and creamy. I could have eaten a whole bowl of it by myself. The other great thing was the complimentary fresh baguette with whipped butter. The John Besh restaurants really do well in the bread category. 

Total bill came up to $40, which is a bargain for food and drinks of this quality.

Pleasantly surprised! I am always a little skeptical about restaurants in hotels but our recent experience at Luke surpassed our expectations. We were able to get a reservation for a Friday night on a busy holiday weekend and were seated promptly. Although the restaurant itself was very loud and the service was spotty, we really enjoyed our food. We had the Raw Seafood platter with oysters, jumbo shrimp, ceviche, clams and mussels. The oysters, ceviche and shrimp were so fresh and delicious! We gobbled those up instantly! We later split the shrimp and grits as our entree and appreciated that they brought it out already split on two small cast iron skillets. The dish was flavor packed and had great texture. 

Although the restaurant did not stand out to us at first and it is not the best NOLA has to offer, we are glad we got to have a nice dining experience and really enjoyed the food.

Philippe was initially a little perplexed by the umlaut,the odd maitre d'/manager interaction about urination at the hostess stand and not getting seated right away in a mostly empty restaurant at 1030pm. But the shrimp and grits made his knees weak with pleasure.
Best breakfast I ever had. Great service also. The home made sausages were delicious!

Had dinner here a few days ago with a party of 10 to celebrate my friend getting married soon, and it was exceptional! They seated us in the private room, which made the experience even better. Eating dinner at Luke's was probably one of our most favorite during our trip to NOLA. Our waiters, Richie & Gary, were the best! They were always attentive, accommodating, funny as hell, and super awesome! Thanks for the wonderful service & laughs! 

Regarding the food, it was phenomenal! The foods we shared include:

-Stuffed P&J Oysters ($17 for 1/2 dozen) - Super delicious! This is a must order. 

-Flammenkuchen ($13) This reminded me of a flat & very crispy pizza. It was good, but not our most favorite.

-Crispy Brussels Sprouts ($12) WOW! This is another must order. If brussels sprouts tasted that good, I would eat it every single day! And this is coming from a person that is not a fan of brussel sprouts.

-Crabmeat Au Gratin ($19) Delicious, and tasted like cheese w/ tuna fish. When you spread this on the crispy crouton they give you, the taste was amazing!

-Chappapeela Pork Schnitzel ($23) This is also another must order! One of the best schnitzels I had so far. It was tender, crispy, and nicely seasoned. Fries were delicious as well. Excellent!

-Grilled Swordfish ($29) - Delicious, but nothing special about this dish.

-Brendan's Bread Pudding w/ Vanilla Bean Ice Cream & Hot Buttered Pecan Sauce ($8) - WOW! This is another must order! This is the best bread pudding I have eaten. I was very sad when it was finished.

-Math's Dairy Cheesecake w/ local strawberries & White Chocolate ($8) This was delicious as well. My friends liked it more than I did as I am not much of a cheesecake lover.

-Steamed Chocolate w/ Chicory, Cocoa Nibs, Salted Caramel Ice Cream ($8) - This was very tasty! For big chocolate fans, you should order this.

Nonetheless, the foods was super delicious, atmosphere was wonderful & the staff was phenomenal! We had a wonderful time - thanks! If I ever come back to NOLA, Luke's will definitely be on my must eat list.

This place I found  one weekend while we were looking for a place for brunch. A Great find!

I ordered the Luke burger, and my wife had a bowl of the crawfish bisque, chicken liver and rabbit pate, and a prawns & grits I believe (Sorry, I'm writing this review late and I just can't remember the name).  The Luke burger was amazing!  The bun is so soft and the burger itself was cooked just, not too juicy or dry. The right size wasn't some ridiculous amount to make it sloppy or too small to be called a slider.  I would come back every time for the burger and their fries were just as good. I'm a huge fry guy, and the ones here are very good.  Get a side order if you don't have them with your meal.  :D  My wife liked her crawfish bisque and her pate.  While she didn't rave on and on about it, she was very pleased with those two particular selections.  I'm game for trying something new...but pate is NOT MY CUP of tea!  :(  However, for those that do like pate, my wife say this was top-notched! Now as for the prawns & grits, I believe they would have been great if they weren't over salted.  But I think this might have been a mishap from the kitchen.  Because the prawns themselves were huge and grilled to perfection, just a bummer it was over seasoned.  :(

This place has amazing value for the quality in food you get!  Yes, I think I paid like over $15 for the burger, but it was worth every darn penny and I would gladly, greedily pay it again!  :D

The atmosphere was good, they had a nice dining/bar area.  Even for it being a busy Sunday, it wasn't overly stuffy, crowded, or noisy!  The decor has both dark and light features throughout, so it makes it for a nice stop if you want to go somewhere special.  

The service was great.  We had a wonderful server that knew the menu inside and out with great recommendations.  

Not sure about the parking there, since it was located on a high traffic area on St Charles Ave.  We actually walked from our hotel, which was maybe 10 mins.  But like all things in that area, there is a parking lot or structure located somewhere near.  

Overall, I liked this place a lot.  When I come here again, I will definitely have to venture out and try something more original than a burger.  But IF YOU HAVE TO GET A BURGER, this one isn't that bad to get!  :D

We came to NOLA on our honeymoon and came to Lüke to celebrate. The local oysters are to die for! We had crawfish with handmade pasta and shrimp and grits...wonderful choices. Above all our server, Rich, went above and beyond with complimentary wine, champagne, and dessert to make the occasion extra special. Thank you for making our honeymoon unforgettable! Rich is amazing and if you can request him, I highly recommend you do! He made the experience that much better! :)

We came here for happy hour. $.75 raw oysters & $1.25 fried. We got the fried oysters and they were served with a hot sauce mayonnaise concoction. Over all they were good and tender yet crispy. 

We all ordered drinks. I wasn't impressed with those which is sad for a happy hour. 

Our server was great. He anticipated all of our needs and a sweet guy. 

We decided to have a progressive dinner and eat somewhere else. The dinners sound good. The prices were a bit on the pricy side.
Probably one of the best meals I have had in a long time. I had the shrimp and grits and it was glorious. The place was packed and we got a spot very easily. I recommend the brussel sprouts!

I have been to this restaurant three times.  The food is amazing.  They have the best brussels sprouts that I have ever had- honey, apples, and jalapenos, oh my!!  The only thing that keeps this place from 4 stars is the service. Each time that I have eaten here, the servers have been disinterested, sometimes to the point of being rude.  I expect better from a John Besh establishment.

Food was delicious.  I enjoyed the shrimp and grits and crawfish bisque.  Savory and salty, with just enough heat to liven up the dishes.  I especially appreciated the attention to detail in including the stuffed crawfish head in allusion to the practice of sucking the heads of boiled crawfish, after all the flavor is all in the head.  The oysters were wonderful.  My only complaint is the service.   Could have been faster and more attentive.

For a Sunday night, this place was sort of happening.  There weren't any festivals going on nor were there a lot of people walking around so we couldn't really find a restaurant that was open at 10pm at night.  This place was not only open, but also somewhat full.  It was lively with a nice atmosphere.  The food was pretty decent.  We weren't that hungry so we had soup and brussel sprouts.  I had a bowl of seafood gumbo; the portion size looked small, but it was just enough for a late night bite.  My friend had the matzo ball roasted chicken soup and enjoyed it.  We order the brussel sprouts with cheese and marcona almonds.  They were delicious- a bit oily, but nice and crispy and browned.  We asked for the brussels without the honey vinegarette and the staff was able to accommodate our request.  The bread served wasn't really warm and it seem a bit undercooked; it wasn't nice and brown on top and wasn't worth the carbs!  

The dessert selection looked delightful, but we didn't partake.  :(  Other tables around us ordered oysters and other dishes which looked really good so I think this place is worth going to late at night on an off night if you want a light meal or a big meal.

First stop after landing was our hotel, the Hilton on St. Charles, and down here for lunch. Very, very impressed.  I had the Luke salad, which far exceeded any and all expectations I had, and the special of Chappapeela Pork Ragout. Wow! such wonderful flavor, would definitely recommend!

We went here for the happy hr specials. Raw oysters were 75 cents each and 1.25 for fried ones. They were big n juicy. Had a three doors cocktail n hubby had a white wine for half off. The cocktail was ok only, nothing spectacular.  Server was nice and professional.

If there's only one thing you can order from here, order the crawfish bisque. And if you can, go to their happy hour also. You won't be disappointed. 

During my short trip to Nola, we stopped by John Besh's Lüke twice - once for lunch and the other time for happy hour. Both times, we ordered the crawfish bisque because it was that good. I don't usually like creamy foods, but I fell in love with the crawfish bisque and it's perfect creaminess and smooth texture. Combined with a generous amount of peeled crawfish, the bisque was nothing short of amazing. In addition to the bisque, we also ordered two entrees off their lunch menu. I got the jumbo Louisiana shrimp en cocotte aka shrimp and grits. It is a rich dish and very flavorful. While it was good, it got overwhelming very quickly. My boyfriend ordered their special of the day which was a pork dish that came with some very tender pieces of pork. 

For happy hour, we ordered a dozen oysters ($0.75 each) and half a dozen of their fried oysters. Both were really good and extremely reasonably priced in my opinion given the quality and size of the oysters. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans. At the very least, swing by for a quick happy hour and order their crawfish bisque. Can't stress that enough!
Brussels sprouts were amazing but the part I couldn't resist was the kale chips that came with the sword fish!  So amazing I would order them instead of fries with any meal!

Food was amazing. We ordered a ton of food and had to take some home!
Service slow and they were not interested. They could have made more money if they asked for drinks or came back to table. We would have ordered more appetizers.

I give 5 stars-food
I give 2.5 stars-service

I would recommend going! 
Loved the gumbo! Set the bar high and the whole vacation-"gumbo was good but not as good a LUKE!" I would go just for gumbo!

I ordered this-Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "en Cocotte" (DELICIOUS!! Had to take home ordered to much food)
Kids had Oysters which were inhaled and served with fries (which were awesome)

Go during happy hour but make a reservation it gets busy! 
Happy hour raw and fried oysters were great!

Minus service this place is Excellent! Go you will not be disappointed!

This is a great little place it's just between being fancy and casual. The food is excellent, especially the shrimp and grits. Be sure to show up between four and six for happy hour since your going to pay half-price on a lot of the drinks as well as special pricing on the oysters. Make sure to get reservations since it's rather hard to get into without them. Highly recommended.

75 CENT OYSTERS Y'ALL!! AND in a John Besh venue, to boot.

This must be the best happy hour deal in the Crescent city.  We got tipped off by a local, and landed at the bar.  We slurped down a dozen of the fat and slimy suckers (less briny than the East coast oysters) between sips of our $4 draft beers (Abita).  We also ordered the buttermilk fried quail and a side of the Brussels sprouts with apple slices.  The perfect meal!

A little pricey. But you will feel and taste what you paid for. We ordered breakfast today the pancake, shrimp and grits and the fresh oysters, shrimp,muscles, and clams platter. Super good and even if we choose to share waiter not snobby.. (Like at Peche) Tip happy hour 3-6 fresh oysters 75c a piece great deal considering they sell it fir $32 a dozen regular price

This place was highly recommended to me by a friend and unfortunately I was very disappointed.  

We ordered the shrimp and grits, a pasta dish, the fish soup, and a burger. The shrimp and grits lacked that burst of flavor and tasted very bland to me. The macaroni dish looked unappetizing and tasted very bland as well.  Overall my table was not very happy with the food and i felt terrible for dragging them along with me to try it (why you gotta let me down like that Luke????) 

Anyway, I will not be returning nor recommending this place.
Best happy hour! Oysters were amazing with great cocktails. Atmosphere was fun with a great crowd.

Overall good experience. The food and service were both pretty good. I loved the environment (causal yet classy), especially the bar's finish. My friend ordered the Croque-monsieur and I the Croque-madame, and both the rosemary potatoes and fries were delicious. From the looks of another table, I would've loved to try the buttermilk fried quail and oysters. The price didn't quite match the quality of the meal, in my opinion, but it was still a decent lunch.

My co-worker and I had breakfast here, and while it was solid, I didn't find anything particularly amazing or gourmet about it other than the prices and decor.  Don't get me wrong, the breakfast tasted great, but I'm guessing that lunch and dinner are the times to come here and get wowed.

Food was excellent. Ribeye was perfectly done and oysters were amazing. Nice atmosphere. Service was good. It got a little busy and there seemed to be not enough staff, but the food more than made up for it.
Just stopped by for happy hour so I can't do a full review but from 3-6pm they have 75 cent oysters and half of drinks. The oysters were tasty. Got so full on oysters we never moved past appetizers.

Amazing happy hour deals and the best oysters we had on our trip!  75 cent oysters during weekday happy hours 3-6 pm = to die for.

The bartenders were incredibly friendly and we had a great time chatting and having some happy hour drinks with our oysters.  It helped that our drinks were half off during happy hour as well!

Wow! Nearly a perfect meal.

Oysters were super fresh & cheap. Happy hour $.75 cent raw & $1.25 fried. Best raw we've ever tasted & we've had our fill over the years.

Tried a 1/2 price Sasarac for the hell of it. Not my thin, but worth a happy hour try.

But Ribeye brought me back to near perfection. Garlic butter & spices made the dish. Absolute perfect steak, medium, good char. Home made Steak sauce on the side was awesome. Still dreaming of the steak.

Shrimp & grits was by far the best we've ever had. Can't describe how incredible it was. Tons of flavors all meshed into a bowl of perfection. Still thinking of these grits too.

Bread pudding was very good. Solid dessert, but second to the entrees.

Menu looked interesting so decided to go for lunch. Service prompt and friendly. Ordered seafood gumbo, was excellent. Also had fried oyster salad. Oysters over fried, hard and crunchy with too many chunks of smoked bacon in the salad. Person next to me also had ordered the same salad, oysters were not over fried. Portion size good.
Best oysters in NOLA! Happy hour prices are amazing and the service is friendly. Sit at the bar, order a drink and a dozen and relax!

Thank you yelp! We came in on for Sunday brunch and requested something we've seen on YELP! They were more than happy to replicate the dish. We also ordered raw oysters and crab benedict. The main star dish was the Roasted jalapeno cheese grits with yard egg topped with a crispy fried soft shell crab. Yes, it was very rich in favor. The egg yolk oozing with perfection & you can taste the jalapeno like you just bit into a fresh one.
Great place with fat juicy fresh oyster. The service is attentive and efficient! Should go try!

We got there barely in time for the happy hour oysters. $.75. Quite a deal. They were huge! Also got the happy hour drinks good deal.
Had the crawfish etoufoille. It tasted a little squid like for me. But that is probably how the dish was supposed to be.
My wife got The softshell crab BLT. It was the biggest softshell crab I had ever seen. She ate it all even thiugh she had a huge lunch. It was great.

this restaurant is next to my hotel and when i checked in, the guest services agent advised that the room service was serviced by this restaurant.  Was not interested until speaking to someone at lunch today who advised that i had to try this great restaurant not far from my hotel - Luke.  
Because it was a along day working and a bit of a hike walk back to the hotel i opted to stop in so i could see the menu first hand, and do a take out.  I did order what seems to be a pretty popular item on the menu -JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP "EN COCOTTE", this was with a seriously delicious jalapeño cheese grits.  What i really like is that i was able to take a cup of beer out the door with me!  
this is a John Besh establishment and that is really all you need to know - when you see that name - run in.  Experience what food should be.

We ate dinner here on Wednesday night.  We started with the crabmeat au gratin and Brussel sprouts - both of which were very good.  To be honest, I am not a fan of Brussel sprouts but our friend was and I tried her's.  They were so good I would order them on my own next time.  My spouse and I each got the Luke burger and fries.  Our friend got the chicken.  They were ok, not good not bad just ok.  For desert we shared the bread pudding and cheesecake.  The bread pudding was outstanding and the cheesecake was good.  The restaurant got more and more throughout the evening.  By the end it was so hard to hear each other we just stopped talking.  The food was pretty good but the noise level was so high it was hard to really enjoy yourself.

Typically not one for brunch, I decided to go for it while in New Orleans and was glad I did. For this one, I did it New Orleans style....beginning with a cup of seafood gumbo, which had a deep, dark, thick roux that had just the right amount of kick. It was full of fresh tasting seafood including two plump oysters, shrimp, and a chunk of fish. What a perfect beginning for my Southern Breakfast to come....two eggs over easy, with Allan Benton bacon cooked crispy, two links of sausage, a biscuit, and creamy grits with specks of jalapeño peppers. I topped it off with deep, dark-roasted coffee. Outstanding! Service was good, but maybe could be a little more attentive. Would highly recommend - if I were in town for another day or two I would definitely go back for another meal!

We walked into Luke after having the wind driven rain turn our umbrella inside-out.  Not exactly happy coming in.  Wow, very welcoming.  Nice welcoming raw/oyster/crab display as you come in.  Got warm, got hungry, ordered crawfish bisque to warm up more.  Fantastic.  Then ordered the Pate of Rabbit and Chicken Livers.  That is a wonderful thing to have if you're a little pissed off about the rain (or anything else).  Between the Pate and all of the sides, you will get happy.   Sigh, wanna go back.

Yes. yes. yes. 

Breeze in through the revolving doors and take a load off. If you don't have reservations, you'll be lead into the back room, like pigs for slaughter. (No really, my sister and I were like, "Um, where are you taking us?") The service was still attentive and kind. No big deal. 

To start, we ordered the Brussels sprouts and fried quail. We practically gushed and got weak at the knees for the vegetable with a bad rap. Oh, it was sauteed to perfection with the perfect hint of honey. The breading on the quail was well-seasoned, not overdone, flawlessly fried and amazingly tender. This could have been my last dinner, and I'd have died happy.

We shared the mussels entree drowning in garlic butter sauce. Plenty of mollusks for everyone. Be sure to let your inner fat kid come out to play and dip-dunk the French bread in that magic sauce. 

I hope to God I can make it for the happy hour oysters next time, because $15 for a half dozen is ri-dic-ulous. I don't know who this Besh person is, but well done, sir.

-xoxo

Last night we had party of 4 went to this restaurant for dinner at 8pm.

We had ordered a whole lobster and a seafood platter with oysters, clams and shrimps.
First, we found that they did not have mussels, so the chef gave us more shrimps. But why don't they be honest and told us earlier!

Also, the most horrific part is, we ate the claws of the lobster. Then we opened up the body of the lobster. Then we found a LOT OF green, blue stuff inside the body. We had never seen a lobster with that many green stuff in it, I think it was tomalley. It was DISGUSTING. Then I googled it and found these warnings from FDA.

http://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/Newsroom/PressAnnouncements/2008/ucm116927.htm

http://www.webmd.com/food-recipes/food-poisoning/20080728/fda-dont-eat-maine-lobster-tomalley

The chef came to our table, trying to say the lobster is fresh and fine and actually people will eat the tomalley. The chefs said the lobster is from Maine. And this is a rare They kept on defending themselves and the manager, was rude to us. But we are cancer scientists and we know all they were trying to defend was invalid. The overloaded green stuff was full of toxins. According to the FDA report, if we ate that lobster I won't be typing this review right now, I would be suffering from Paralytic Shellfish Poisoning (PSP), being intoxicated and we may die if we consumed too much. 

The manager told me that we should not eat the green stuff, in a rude way. Then I said why a big, upscale restaurant like this is serving toxic lobster to the guests on the table? If they are professional, they should inspect the lobster before serving us! They should not serve anything that may harm the guests!!!

Very bad experience. Extremely furious for what we had been treated. The health authority should come and investigate this and get the answer professionally. One lobster can kill not only the restaurant reputation, also can potentially kill someone.

Update: I have lodged the complaint to the health authority.

I usually avoid hotel restaurants, but the menu here was quite different than what I have seen at hotel restaurants. I decided to have a small lunch bride heading back to the conference. I ordered the rabbit and chicken livers pate, and the crispy Brussel sprouts. The pate was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly spiced, rich, and creamy. The Brussel sprouts were also perfectly fried, and sprinkled with a declines farm cheese. 
I would certainly come back.

We had so much fun at Luke during happy hour. Amazing P&J oysters raw and fried. We came back several times during our short stay in New Orleans. Shucker Shawn made the experience unforgettable. Thanks for your hospitality!
I had the shrimp and grits like so many other folks here.  It did not disappoint.  It delivers on good old fashion southern classics.  The service was excellent as well.

Stopped in for a bite on a and enjoyed it thoroughly. The decor is nice, with a laid-back elegance that makes you feel warm and welcome. 

To eat, I cautiously followed a comrade's recommendation of the fried oyster salad. I'm not typically a salad guy (especially in the creole capital), but I have to tip my salad-discriminating cap to this one. A generous garnish of thick-cut-bacon-bits tossed in the fray with hearty and delicious fried Gulf oysters. Nom city, population: me. And you can tell people you got a salad. Take THAT, etouffee. 

Also, you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't take a nibble of the bread pudding. After all, you had a salad for dinner.

Great experience...enormous burgers.  Had lunch and some appetizers.  The service is awesome and the menu offers a nice variety.  The food is delicious and filling.  Your lunch meal maybe end up being the only meal of the day since the sandwiches are huge.

Richie Rich took care of the eight of us like royalty. The food was superlative. You have to try Bufala Negra. OMG. Btw you can't go wrong with the Brussel sprouts, oysters fresh or fried, shrimp & grits and bread pudding. Love this place.

We went here for the happy hour raw oysters.  Heaven! $.75 each and they were perfection. Cold, crisp, huge, not a speck of grit in the two dozen we had.  We're in love.  The service was expedient. Not super friendly but the oysters made up for it. I was reading an article about the best oyster happy hours and we had decided to try the Blind Pelican too. By contrast Luke is like Nordstrom and the Blind Pelican is an extra dirty Walmart.  Don't waste your time going anywhere else for raw oysters. Come here from 3-6p and enjoy!  Drinks are all on special too.

I m speechless! Well, no I'm not; this place is amazing!  Happy hour plate full of clams, oysters, shrimp, mussels AND ceviche for $29? Wow!  Silver Saint craft cocktail (tequila) also wonderful .  Be THEN the bartender brings us a lemon slice with a hot towel to clean our hands!  I'm in heaven, we will be walking 2 miles each day to get here from our hotel!  So happy!

Amazing brunch! Was here for a conference, needed a quick lunch and stumbled across this place. Had the Lüke Breakfast and about died. 2 eggs over easy, heavenly grits, smokey bacon and sausage, and a biscuit and a rhubarb ham... To die for!!! 

This place rocks!
Excellent service and etoufee was awesome . Also the crawfish soup was good as well. Riggidy Row is coming !

I give it 4 stars, but I think some in my party weren't that impressed by our brunch. I ordered the deconstructed chicken/egg sandwich and really enjoyed this. One in our party really liked the Luke breakfast. 

Where they let us down was the burger, and maybe this is just the usual Jazz Fest season overcapacity issue this city suffers. The menu description sounded unique and appealing as was the actual presentation.  My fiancee ordered it medium, and the kitchen staff just couldn't deliver on this. It came out rare the first time, and slightly less rare after she sent it back.  I like rare, so I thought it was very tasty, albeit too rich for my delicate stomach . Other who ordered the burger thought it was ok, but not fantastic and also a bit rich.  (you may be tempted to judge us unsophisticated for ordering burgers at a Besh restaurant, but most of us have pretty developed palates and just crave a burger sometimes).  

The manager did apologize and offer us a free round and took this off the tab. Everybody who tasted the Bloody Mary's really enjoyed these and the Mary's are now my new favorite.

Found this place on Yelp and was the first place we ate at after we landed in New Orleans. Luckily we made it for their happy hour. We ordered 2 dozens of raw oysters, it was big but wasn't very tasty. I guess we're just used to the oysters from the east coast where you can taste the sweetness in the oysters. Their fried oysters were surprisingly good, and we normally like our oysters raw. The crawfish bisque was also a hit. I normally don't like thick creamy soup, but this was delicious with the bread!

It's good, but everything in Nola is good. John besh does a nice job here, I'd do it again but only because I was in the hotel or convenient. I most likely wouldn't go here if it was out of my way. I'm just saying, if it was in any other town in the country it'd be a "go to" place but it's just an average Nola Resturant.
Amazing food in a great unpretentious atmosphere with an incredible server (Kenny)! Made a normal business trip a true culinary experience. Thanks for a great night!!

We checked out two different celebrity chef joints during our recent trip to New Orleans - the first was disappointing, but this John Besh shop was not.

We had a terrific lunch of fried oysters, honey-Tabasco fried chicken (served with rice and red beans with pulled pork), and jalapeno grits.

The decor had a comfortable rustic wood feel, although the floors were a bit too sticky and beat-up. Still, highly recommended.

Easy 5 star, but I was only there for happy hour. These oysters are divine, both raw and fried (that malt vinegar aioli!!). They're fat, juicy, but not too briney. Amazing value for HH, comfortable upscale casual atmosphere, and the service was attentive. I hope I can make it back before I leave town!

We came here on the suggestion of a friend and it worked since it was in the hotel we were staying at. 

The servers made the experience. We were sharing everything and the kitchen was kind enough to plate it four ways without us even asking! This is a first. They also brought out comped desserts since we shared that we were celebrating a special occasion and were visiting from Los Angeles. 

The food itself was ok.

There are so many restaurants serving creole/Cajun cuisine in New Orleans that it can be hard to choose one.  My wife and I had an all-around excellent experience during our lunch at Luke.  

We had the seafood gumbo which was outstanding as well as the crawfish bisque --which was even better.  I had an enormous croque-monsieur with very tasty fries.
