But the real highlight of the meal was the Friday lunch special court-bouillon which is a seafood stew.  The shrimp, crab, and fish were super fresh and the dish had the right amount of spice.  

Our server was knowledgeable and the bloody Mary's were fantastic.  Our only regret was that it was our last meal in New Orleans so we could not go back again!

Brought the wife and kids here for an early dinner. Had the oysters, shrimp and grits, fried chicken red beans and rice, and gumbo. The kids had the grilled cheese and Mac and cheese. Everything came out great. Also caught the end of happy hour, can never complain about half priced drinks. Highly recommended. Oh and the service was excellent!

Nice restaurant, very affable waiters and staff always attentive to our needs. Tried the duck and chicken paté which was very good and for main entrée had the sword fish which was fresh and well prepared. I was offered a pea puree instead of the eggplant puree, which was a very good recommendation. I'm taking one star because the desserts were less than spectacular. Tried the bred pudding with vanilla ice and was tasteless in our view, which we mentioned to the manager. He was very receptive of our comments. Would strongly recommend visiting while in NOLA.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton Homewood Suites which is pretty much right down the street from this restaurant. We went there for breakfast and it was delicious! I had the egg white frittata which was mouthwatering. Topped with pesto, arugula, tomatoes and avocado. My boyfriend has the Pain Perdu which was to die for! Challah break smothered with mascarpone and topped with smokey bacon. We went back the next morning to get more!

A part of me doesn't want to review this place, I would rather keep it a secret gem, but hey it's always good to share.

This maybe one of the best happy hours in New Orleans!  Happy hour is from 3 to 6 and it is not limited to bar seating.  It is a white tablecloth restaurant but most people where casually dressed and it seems pretty laid back.

Now on to the happy hour specials.  Raw oysters were 50 cents and I think the fried oysters were a dollar, but we kept with the raw.  These oysters were the best oysters we had during our twelve days in New Orleans and we had quite a few oysters.  No grit what so ever and they were good size oysters.

Specialty drinks, draft beer, and wine are half price.  We started with a couple of rounds of mojitos, the mojitos were not on the drink menu but they were included in the happy hour pricing.  They were a little on the sweet side but we asked our waiter if he could bring us some fresh lime wedges, which he did and that  solved that problem.

Decided on one more round of drinks but we changed it up an ordered a Silver Saint and a Sazerac.

The Silver Saint (tequila, fresh lime juice, cucumber syrup, Serrano pepper, and soda water) was a great drink, loved the kick from the Serrano pepper.  

The Sazerac (Rye, sugar, peychauds bitters and herbsaint) BF enjoyed this drink.

Definitely check out this happy hour, you will not be disappointed.  Wish we had learned about it sooner, I'm sure we would have gone a couple of more times.

Amazing find.  One of my favorite ways to start the day and a favorite stop.  Great food and great service.  No line out the door.  Catch the breakfast or brunch and ease into the day.  Casual dining in a nice atmosphere.

Lüke was one of my favorites in New Orleans. Their happy hour is SOLID!

- Half off cocktails (I recommend door#three if you like fruity, refreshing drinks)
- $1.25 fried oysters
- $0.75 raw oysters!!!

We had oysters at Felix's and Acme Oyster House, but Lüke's are by far our favorite. 

The food here is delicious. List of stuff I had the pleasure of trying: 
- Crawfish Bisque
- Crispy Brussel Sprouts
- Fruge Farms Crawfish "Etouffée"
- Moules et Frites (mussels)

List of stuff I had the pleasure of staring at:
- Entrecôte grillée et frites: a few from our group ordered the ribeye and it looked like it was cooked to perfection. I haven't eaten meat in over two years and looking at that steak really made my mouth water.. 

ANYWAY, solid happy hour, drinks, and food. Highly recommend!! If you're visiting New Orleans, DO NOT skip this one!

Good but maybe a little over hyped. I got the Brussel sprouts and the shrimp and grits. The sauce on the sprouts is overwhelming. Too sweet and too spicy. And the shrimp and grits the same, too saucy. A little goes a long way.

Don't even get me started on how great our dinner experience was at Luke.  The bisque, etoufee and shrimp & grits were fabulous.  Service was impeccable and we were very impressed with the collectivism here.  Kenny & Shay were wonderful and we were pleasantly surprised with a couple of comped tastes from the chef.  Cheers.

Good but maybe a little over hyped. I got the Brussel sprouts and the shrimp and grits. The sauce on the sprouts is overwhelming. It was like eating spoonfuls of bbq sauce. Too sweet and too spicy. And the shrimp and grits was better, but also saucy. A little goes a long way.

In a word; amazing!!!!! Order the crawfish bisque, because it's perfection, and then close your eyes and point to decide on an entree because you can't go wrong! I had the shrimp and grits at brunch, and it was a perfect balance of spice, creaminess, and juicy shrimp! My fiancé had the soft shell crab BLT and it was delicious as well. The service was attentive and friendly and the bloody Marys were perfectly spicy! Yum!

Great service, great food
Nice atmosphere 
The staff treats everyone with respect and care

A good friend in the know recommended this spot and I actually ended up eating here twice during Jazz feast because if was walking distance from the French quarter and walk-ins actually were seated quickly. This spot is mix of local and tourist and offers daily specials as well as time-tested classics. In my instance, the court-bouillon is a mix of both, being available only on Fridays and being an original menu item. Definitely get it if you can; the seafood inside, including oysters, shrimp and fish are drenched perfectly and well balanced seafood broth with rice. Perfect. On the apps side, 100% get the buttermilk fried quail. I'd say this is better than the chicken biscuit main. The LA rabbit&chicken livers pate looks great too. And the flammenkuchen should cure just about any hangover when paired with a bloody Mary.
When I'm in New Orleans again, I'l definitely stop back.

We stumbled among this place and are so glad we did. They have an amazing happy hour special
-$0.75 oysters and half off craft cocktails. The oysters were wet fresh and the cocktails were unique and delicious. We also had a fried oyster salad and frites both of which were yummy. Would highly highly recommend.

Had the gumbo; pretty average. Seafood in it was soggy and sort of mealy.

Small but decent bar.

So we at Luke which was across the street from our hotel. We have eaten here on other trips but decided to review it this time around. We sat the bar and was helped with drink choices by our very great bar tender. She recommended the drinks all of which were nicely made and interesting. We started with the brussel sprouts which have to be the best we ever had anywhere. They print the receipt as many ask for it. Seems to be laced with pepper jam, bacon and sliced apples. Really ensure you have some when you try Luke. Also ate the redfish which was good, just a little wet from too much butter. Then we had the mussels which are always very good. Bread pudding was good but not special. We will eat here again and at John B's other restaurants in NO.

A little pricey but you get what you pay for.  I suggest the collards as they are the best I've had as well as the soft shell crab BLT.  Also can't go wrong with the chargrilled oysters.  We come to New Orleans every year and love stopping at Lüke's.
i had a dinner on this , i order a sea food pasta and was great ,the service was spectacular !!

I was at a conference in NOLA for a week, and Lüke was one of the restaurants I planned to visit. I waited about 20-25 mins for a table, but it was worth the wait. 

I did my typical thing by ordering an entrée, a cocktail, and a dessert. 

Entree: Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" (shrimp and grits)
Cocktail: French 75
Dessert: Bourbon Vanilla Bean Crème Brûlée (Soooo good!)
My friend's dessert: Steamed Chocolate (She really liked it.)

It was all delicious. I will totally go back the next time I'm in NOLA!

This place is awesome! The happy hour they have is unmatched. $0.75 oysters and half off on all cocktails from 3- 6pm at the bar! I recommend getting the French 75! I think it's the best French 75 I ever had at a bar/restaurant. 

The service is top notch also! They staff are so friendly and helpful. They even gave us some free oysters after we already finished our order of oysters.

I've eaten dinner at the Luke's in San Antonio and the food is definitely delicious . I'm sure the food at this location  is just as good or better! The oysters definitely are delicious. We will definitely be back for happy hour. The oysters here are better than anything we've had in the French Quarter.
I had to hit up another OYSTER happy hour deal in between meals.  The P&J oysters (normally $2/each) were $0.75 during HH.  A great snack if you're having a late dinner.

Came here for lunch while on business in NOLA. It wasn't very crowded so I was seated quickly (the bar was full). Even though its a white table cloth establishment the atmosphere is relaxed. The staff was very friend and attentive. I had the LÜKE burger with fries. The burger was great: very juicy and cooked the way I requested. The cocktail and beer list are very nice as well. I would def come back here next time I'm in NOLA.
We had lunch here while on vacation. All I need to say is that our food was amazing. The service was quick and courteous! I would absolutely eat here again!
The best crawfish bisque I have ever taste! If you are visiting the big easy u should dine her, I promise you won't regret it !
Highly recommend for a savory, delicious, filling meal in New Orleans! Be sure to start off with the oysters and the Brussels sprout appetizer. The staff was very friendly and I will be back soon!

So thrilled with this restaurant!! Being here with 8 other wily women from Texas, and I know we ain't the easiest on a server. But my 87 year old grandmother has horrible back problems and was visibly in pain, and our sweet server brought her a pillow!!! The thoughtfulness of that gesture and the absolutely DELICIOUS food (Brussels sprouts omgggggg) will be the reason I tell all my friends Lüke's is the place to go when visiting New Orleans!!

Borgne was my favorite John Besh restaurant until I came here. Luke was absolutely outstanding. The service was impeccable and the food was some of the best in New Orleans. So many tough decisions on what to order. I went with the Oysters and the pork chop. Both were superb and cooked to perfection.

Came here with a party of 9 when down visiting my brother. I was so excited to try this place after reading all the reviews and dining at other John Besh restaurants. Honestly, I left just slightly disappointed. Everything was good but some dishes were just ok. The seafood gumbo was really nothing great. Lacked flavor and I don't think I had any seafood in it! We had an order of king crab legs which were great!
Entrees were also hit or miss. The roasted chicken was good but a little dry and the skin was kind of soggy. The grilled swordfish was also very dry and extremely fishy tasting. I didn't get to taste the burger but I heard it was good. The grilled ribeye was cooked more medium when asked medium rare but it was a great tasting steak. Awesome flavor and that maitre d hotel butter is unbelievable! The star which we all agreed upon was the shrimp and grits which was my entree. The shrimp were cooked perfectly and the jalapeño cheese grits were insane! An awesome dish! 
Overall Luke was a great meal! Nothing really negative to say about it. A few dishes lacked in my opinion and others were really great.
Oyster happy hour is phenomenal. Service is attentive as well

Top shelf experience, for food especially but also atmosphere. Raw oysters,  crab meat au gratin, and rabbit & liver pate (all with  exquisite crostini) made superb appetizers. At our table were served delicious and perfectly cooked mussels, a magnificent medium rare ribeye (and was glad to have taken the waiter's suggestion to choose only the pat of butter for the topping; this was an excellent cut and well cooked), and well received shrimp and grits. The cocktails, sides, and wine were up to the task as well.

We had reservations at commanders palace but woke up late and realized we wanted to wear whatever we wanted (they have a strict dress code). So we called Luke and made reservations there. My friends and I very happy with our decision:) I got the mussels with a glass of champagne. We also got the soft shell crab BLT and the Luke breakfast. Everything was delicious. Service was perfection. We were in and out. OH and the mussels came with frites

Excellent food, service and atmosphere! We all had several items and everything was cooked to perfection. The desserts were scrumptious, especially the bread pudding. The appetizers are a must, especially the Brussels sprouts. And the entrees were all amazing. A must in NOLA.

I went here a few weeks ago so my memory is not perfect but I did want to register my overall very positive impression. Their raw P&J oysters put paid to my former assumption that large warm water gulf oysters are not good on the half shell. These were excellent and nary a bit of grit in sight. Drinks were great, or at least I recall that the French 75 was. Our waiter was terrific too. The Alsatian tart was a little unusual, kind of sweet, but nevertheless tasty and we did eat all of it. We ended up splitting drum for the fish and while it was indeed tasty, it was you typical NO fare with the dirty butter sauce. I would go back in order to try the other menu items and get more oysters and drinks.

Everything was wonderful. The service, the atmosphere, and the food! All the food! We got the stuffed oysters, spring blossoms, Brussels spirits and the flammenkuchen for appetizers. Every one of these are even better than the other. Even the bread and butter they give you at the beginning was fantastic. Then I got the creole tomato salad before my entree. Y'all. I can't even express how dreamy this salad was. The sugar cane vinaigrette, the huge creole tomatoes and the Burrata cheese! Oh my goodness. I didn't want the salad to end. I got the almandine for my entree which was very tasty. Even the vegetables that came with it we're scrumptious. Then dessert! We tried the chocolate pecan tart, strawberry cheesecake and bread pudding. Wow! Sooooooo good. Our waiters, Kevin and Rich were awesome! Such great service to top of the wonderful night. I loved it and want to go back ASAP.
The food was amazing and the prices were reasonable, but our bartender was really rude. She could have at least acknowledged us when we said thank you.
I have never written a review and I'll tell you right now this is the best restaurant I've been to in longer than I can remember.  Visit this place if you can.
Ate here with coworkers way back. Great food and great staff. Hope to eat there again soon.

Everything was good... especially the brussels sprouts... so good we ordered another serving ;-)

Good cocktails... the somm was very helpful on the wine choices and steered me in the right direction... :-)

Definitely a recommend...

My favorite place on my New Orleans trip. Ordered the raw oysters which are 75 cents per oyster during happy hour,charred oysters, Brussels sprouts and the shrimp with jalepeno grits. Everything was flavorful and fresh. Wanted to try more, but my stomach was too full. Highly recommend in the New Orleans area

Went to the Luke Happy Hour for oysters.  It starts at 3pm.  What a joy!  .75 oysters and half price drinks.  Thanks fellow Yelpers for letting me know about the Happy Hour.  When you walk into Luke you just have to love the look of the place.  Of course this is a John Besh restaurant so you expect nothing less. 
They serve large PJ oysters on the happy hour.  I have  gone to other happy hour  oyster restaurants and they serve the smallest oysters they would not serve during regular hours.  Not here, they are large and succulent for .75 cents! You can also get 6 fried for $7.50.  There are also six specialty coctails that are half price and draft beer is half price as well.
several appetizers are half price.  The rabbit and chicken liver pate was just outstanding.  My wife ordered the crawfish bisque and the depth of flavor was heavenly.  (Bisque is not on happy hour).
Luke is just simply an outstanding restaurant with quality food and service. I have been for dinner and truely enjoyed the food as well.  The Happy Hour is just another reason to come and enjoy and save a little out of pocket as well.

Richie Rich is back y'all!!! I took some out of town visitors in the the full Luke experience and they loved every minute of it. I come here often, but am always excited to bring visitors. They have a great time and get to experience a variety of local cuisine that is always impeccably prepared. Excellent oysters - raw, baked, and fried - we had them all. I personally recommend the frites and the brussel sprouts. So delicious.

Great dinner experience! Enjoyed the food we ordered. Waiters were cool asked for recommending what's good. 
Crabmeat au gratin 
Crawfish bisque 
"En Cocotte" Jumbo Louisiana shrimp highly recommend their version of grits and bbq shrimp.

Great breakfast.
One of the people who had breakfast there day before recommended it. His description was great so we tried it.  Seafood omlet was great. Jucy and deletious.
French frise was crispy and little salty just like I like.
Cofee was not your regular cheap type of coffee it was good quality. Server was professional I don't know why but he looked like some kind of law school student. 

Overall great place.

Easily worst gumbo of my life. 
Service was pretty poor too. 
This place is supposed to to be fancy but you can find better almost anywhere on bourbon street. 
DONT EAT HERE!!!
The food here is beyond amazing! We were in NOLA for Mardi Gras 2016 and this restaurant came highly recommended. The severs here are equally awesome. I also highly recommend it!

So this is a Jon besh restaurant and you might expect things.  You would be correct.  We stopped in for a late lunch after the day at the WWII museum.  As we doy wife and I ordered two different things and split to get to eat two different things. I ordered the Luke burger and she ordered the coque Madame.  I ate my burger and discovered the best burger I ever had.  Onions had a great sweet taste and the bacon was great with wonderfully cheese.  Then I tasted my wife's offering and I knew the burger was not the correct choice.  There was running egg and great cheese and cream sauce and wonderfully tasty ham.  The Fry's were not the best but the egg and cheese made it all worth it.

Great service. I don't think I even waited more than a minute or two each time to have my glass of water refilled. Oysters for happy hour were great. Our servers suggestion of the Crawfish Bisque was a good one.

Luke is a John Besh restaurant. It is known for their 75 cents oysters at Happy Hour, from 3PM-6PM every day. If you like oysters, this place is definitely for you. However, I tried Luke for breakfast. I ordered the chicken and biscuits. It was awesome. The challenge with fried chicken is that it is easy to dry out the meat. The best fried chicken is tender and juicy in the inside while maintaining the crispy skin on the outside. In this regard, Luke is on par with all the best fried chicken I have eaten. I have also been advised to use honey on fried chicken in the past. Until Luke, I refrained from doing so. However, Luke does not leave it up to you and it puts the honey on the chicken for you. I am glad it did because it was great. I also loved the biscuit. Like the chicken, it was soft in the inside and crunchy on the outside. The portion size is not huge. I was full but not stuffed. The dish also comes with grits. It is good but I am not a grits fan.

If you are visiting New Orleans and looking for recommendations, feel free to message me through Yelp and I can share my itinerary, which includes my Yelp reviews. The information for an electronic copy can also be found via my Yelp profile.

The pain perdu is really good, especially with the bacon stuffed inside. Huge portion size, enough for sharing. Our waitress was very nice and service was prompt. I'll definitely remember this spot for brunch and breakfast next time.

When I first found out that I was spending a week working in the Warehouse District I was disappointed that I wouldn't have time to get to my favorite NOLA spots. Turns out it is just an opportunity to find some NEW FAVORITES! Lüke is definitely that. This was an awesome meal in a wonderful setting with top flight service. Shout out to our server Kenneth! 

Here's the long story. When I took the included photo my dining partner knocked his Martini to the floor shattering the glass and causing a minor scene. The waitstaff handled it perfectly. Then I said to Dan... here is the test... is this a good restaurant or a great one? Kennth had replaced the Martini within 3 minutes! That is a great restaurant. As he placed it on the table he said, "Usually when this happens the second one comes in a sip cup!" That's FUNNY!!  The oysters were perfect both raw and stuffed. My etoufee was spot on and i loved it served over pasta. This was a great night at a GREAT restaurant.

They have a great happy hour from 3-6pm, definitely recommend making reservations.  Raw oyster is $0.75each (they are huge) and stuffed oysters are $1.25each.  The cocktails and wine were also half off

This place was a good happy hour experience because the cocktails were half off and the oysters were discounted. I had the French 75, which they make with cognac instead of gin; vastly preferable. I'm not sure I would eat here without the discount. Still, good place.

The food was excellent but unfortunately the service made the night less than memorable. We ordered an appetizer plus a seafood platter with crab legs and a bottle of wine. We had to refill our wine twice (which isn't easy while cracking claws) and my utensils (claw cracker, little fork, shell plate) were taken before I was finished. The service was overall aloof and rushed. Had it not been for the unwelcoming service we would have stayed for dessert and cocktails (i.e. more business for the restaurant). There were only a few tables that night. It is unfortunate that we will not recommend this restaurant to friends, despite the quality of the food.

I had an amazing time at Luke, not only the food is great.  Oyster happy hour is only $.75 each and super big!  Servers always make sure your needs are met at the first time. They really deserve 5 star and yet they only charge you so low.. 
Compared with the Felix... I can only say Luke is like heaven while Felix is a nightmare...

Breakfast. The breakfast sandwich is actually a breakfast burger. The shrimp and grits is creamy, well seasoned and delicious. Come hungry if you choose to spend some dough on your first meal of the day.

While I can't speak for the notoriously popular happy hour oysters here, dinner here seriously hit the spot.  Luke worked out to be the very first stop on my recent NOLA trip and the chefs here executed Cajun Creole cuisine darn well.

To begin, my crispy brussies was arguably the best I've eaten yet as its incorporation of honey, marcona almonds and cheese gave it much textural contrast and a very pleasant sweetness to round out the savory tones.

Thereafter, my crawfish etouffee was just downright fantastic - brimming with crawfish and bursting with bold spicy flavor from the roux.  Even the pasta itself was hefty with texture almost like that of gnocchi.  All together, it gave me one glorious food coma for hours.

My one gripe was that the maitre'd was astonishingly cold, in fact the waitstaff in general was pretty much devoid of any warmth.
We came here for happy hour. The raw oyster is smaller than ACME. There is no non alcoholic menu and the coke is 3.75 and NO REFILLABLE. Very disappointed and will not recommended to anyone.

Amazing! My husband said the shrimp & grits were the best he'd ever had, and I loved the Lemonfish. We also had the brussel sprout (salad), and the stuffed squash blossoms, which were both bursting with flavor and well presented. We also had the best server in the house, and in Louisiana as far as I could tell. "Richie Rich" was funny, and on top of the evening. We never sat for too long with out food, or drink on our table. And he was worried about our experience because of a "loud(-ish)" table in the back. But his attention and the quality of the food, made our experience the best one we had in New Orleans.

We came here for brunch with a large bachelorette party. I couldn't quite corral all 13 attendees at our reservation time but I called and they were able to accommodate my request of pushing the reservation back 30 minutes. Our waitress (name started with a K, maybe Kayla) was very nice and attentive. Our food came out quickly and was extremely good!!
Great happy hour! I had a few French 75s which were amazing. I smacked on some brussel sprouts which were also great! Check this place out! I think happy hour is from 4-6pm.

We had an amazing impromptu brunch at Lüke. Honestly, could not have been happier that we stopped in. We hesitated at first, as we were dressed casually and had two young kids in-tow, but the hostess was more than gracious and told us we were most definitely welcome for brunch, and that they even have a kids menu. 

The atmosphere is beautiful--old school, upscale feel and the kids had a blast watching someone behind the bar schuck oysters. Service was stellar and the manager even came out to make sure we were happy and give the kids her favorite, Mac n Cheese, on the house.

As for the other food---amazing. Uh-may-zing. My chicken biscuit was perfection. The fluffy biscuit with crispy chicken, egg, and tobasco honey was literally one of those dishes you dream about. My husband seemed equally impressed with his Lüke burger, which I also snuck a bite of. Cooked to perfection and full of flavor. Bacon and grilled onion with smoked cheese paired perfectly with the sweet bun. The kids burgers were even delicious. Overall, an awesome meal and we will most definitely be back.

Every time I visit NOLA, I stay at the Hilton upstairs and eat at Luke's. It takes a while to get seated but the food here is worth it. The burgers are awesome and so is the bread pudding! I cannot get enough of that bread pudding.

The servers are nice and friendly but then again who isn't. We are in the south and everyone is so nice here!

I've always enjoyed the oyster happy hour at Luke. Everything I've had is delicious and the cocktails are on point. The brussels sprouts and fried oyster salad are some of my faves. Giving it 4.5 out of 5 just because the pricing on some menu items is a little over the top. Otherwise, I love this place!
Loved it! Everything was good from service to food to ambience! A proposal happened to!!(to someone else lol)

Wow! So much seafood and i want it all! The sampler platter is out of this world.

While staying at the Intercontinental for a week, I craved this place daily. Stopping in for fresh oysters, sometimes dressed and fried. I felt bad for the restaurant in the hotel that offered oyster deals as i walked across the street to Luke.

Everything I ate here was fantastic! The waitstaff, bartender, and oyster shuckers all had great attitudes and I swear I saw the owner treating some deserving man to the meal of his life on the house. Must have brought out 5 different dishes for him while we sat beside in awe. 

Happy hour deals really make it worth the while. I wish Luke was in my neighborhood.

Luke's was recommended to us and SO happy we went. Our server, Richie Rich (yes that's his name) was amazing. By far the best thing we ate was the Crispy Brussel Sprouts. They were so delicious that we actually went back the next day just to have the house special cocktails, Door#3 was awesome, and more Brussel sprouts! The only down side was the volume of the room where we sat. The back room echoes and they seat large parties there as well as 2 & 4 tops but at times we couldn't hear each other talk. Definitely going back the next time I'm in NOLA.

My girlfriend and I loved this place. We hadn't originally planned to stop here on our trip but after walking by and checking out the dinner menu we added it to our list of things to do. The environment was great and our waitress was friendly and funny. The food was excellent. One of the highlights of our trip.

We had Crawfish Bisque, Seafood Gumbo a la Creole, Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte", and Fruge Farms Crawfish "Etouffée. We ended up sharing everything and couldn't decide who's dishes were better. I will definitely stop in again next time I'm in town.

While I have no complaints about the food or drinks, because they were incredible, I am giving this place 2 stars due to service.  Both the hostess and our waiter seemed like they were completely "over it".  Hostess looked annoyed that we didn't have a reservation, we were staying at the Q & C and were told Luke was nearby and that their happy hour was about to begin, so that's why we just showed up.  Our server's attitude was pretty much the same as the hostess'.  When placing our drink orders he seems like he'd rather be somewhere else and when he'd leave we couldn't find him anywhere.  My husband finally asked him nicely, "having a bad day, huh?"  to which he replies, "nah.  I just started my shift."  THAT was awkward. 

Awkward service the rest of the meal.  Again, the food was delicious as we expected, we frequent Luke here in San Antonio so we know what to expect.  Won't bother paying a visit next time we are in NOLA.  We'll just stick to eating at Luke here at home.

This is our first time here. I had to write this review before we left because I do not want to forget how wonderful the food is. Kayla, our server, was pleasant, informative, and extremely knowledgeable about the food.

We had the Goat Cheese Stuffed Squash Blossoms for an appetizer, the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" or Shrimp and Grits, and Croque-Madame for our meal. 

The appetizer was a fantastic mix of tangy and slightly sweet using all Louisiana ingredients. The shrimp and grits were the best I have ever had, my absolute favorite. The croque-Madame was a perfect mix of ham, cheese, and egg. Melt in your mouth Chisesi ham. 

If you are in town for a day or you live here, I highly suggest stopping in for a meal. This restaurant is now on our top list of must visit again places.

Not impressed with this restaurant compared to Emeril's for the prices and John Besh was here himself, on Saturday night. But instead of walking around and making sure things were/should have been going well with his diners, he was having diner himself with three other people. Casual setting. My husband said it wasn't the best shrimp and grits as others have said. The crab appetizer was really good and my steak was great. The stuffed oysters were okay but didn't compare to Drago's. Rosemary potatoes were nice and crispy but too much Rosemary in them in my opinion.
Love this place! Great local bar/restaurant. The seafood is fresh and the matzoball soup is delicious! Staff is very friendly.

The shrimp and grits sounded like one of the better dishes so I gave that s shot. 
The dish was very good. Large shrimp, smooth cheesey grits, crunchy green onions, and a very flavorful sauce. I could actually taste the shrimp in the sauce before I ate the shrimp. 

Although, this is New Orleans style shrimp and grits and I take nothing from it. If you have had Shrimp and Grits from South Carolina it's in a whole different league. It is more savory as far as the sauce and has bit of Tasso in it. It also has less cheese.

Both are great but I prefer Charleston. South Carolina shrimp and grits.
Aside of the dish, the restaurant has a great interior. It does have a nice Southern/New Orleans feel to it. I really like the tiled floors around the bar and the wooden floors of the restaurant. 
Also, I came here not because it is a restaurant of John Besh but because the dishes looked and sounded good. But this does unexpectedly knock off a chef's restaurant to try while down here. 2 more to go!!!

From the moment we walked in, the staff at Luke Restaurant treated me and my friend like royalty. From the beginning to the end, the service, atmosphere, and food was incredible. The servers are passionate about the food they serve, and they made everything on the menu sound so tummy! We loved "Richie Rich" and his fun personality; he checked on us several times, and we loved him so much, we wanted him to sit with us. Kevin was our waiter, and he is fantastic! This was my first time here, and I am definitely coming back for happy hour (great deals on oysters and cocktails), girl's nights, and I'll be treating my business clients here for marketing lunches. It was all amazing! Food recs: Brussels sprouts, any fish entree, and bread pudding.

My husband and I were visiting from Los Angeles and had to try a John Besh restaurant in New Orleans. Luckily we were staying nearby in the CBD and found Luke on Yelp.

The food and service are both impeccable. 

The meal started with a complimentary warm baguette and whipped butter. I had the tomato salad, he had the Luke burger and we split the steamed chocolate for dessert. The tomato salad was a fresh delight in a city of deep fried everything; the tomatoes were flavorful and not overwhelmed by the dressing, burrata or ham. The burger was cooked perfectly medium rare upon request. The fries are shoestring and made fresh, but cool quickly so dive in right away. The steamed chocolate is their signature and most unique dessert, think of a cooked pudding served with salted caramel ice cream. 

Waitstaff are attentive without being overbearing. Individual sizes condiment bottles are a nice touch.

I'd make it a point to return here if we come back to New Orleans.

A misstep for breakfast.

Came in based on positive reviews. The hostess was nowhere to be seen. The bartender - or whoever she was that was cleaning the bar area - and a waiter was chatting. They saw us and neither greeted us, nor did they look for the hostess. We stood there awkwardly for 5 minutes before a CUSTOMER got up and asked us if we were waiting to be seated. When we said yes, the customer went around the other side of the bar to tell the hostess. Turns out she was enjoying her coffee and checking her phone at one end of the bar, her back to the host station.

The waiter was courteous. We had the shrimp and grits and the fried chicken with tabasco honey. The shrimp and grits were very good, but the fried chicken was a miss for me - sounds good in theory but tasted, for lack of a better word, confused in its execution. Completely subjective though.

The rest of the service was all right. Attentive waiter and we were able to get our check and leave in time to make an morning appointment elsewhere. No one thanked us or said good-bye as we left. For a classy place like Luke, there is usually more attentive service. Maybe we just experienced an off-morning, but given the price point and overall presentation of the restaurant, the service left something to be desired. Had originally planned to return to try the oysters, but opted not to based on morning experience.

We were staying at the Hilton on St Charles.  I had read the Lüke's reviews.  I was going to try and hit up each spot that i had read about about prior to my visit.  At the end of our first night we noticed Lüke's was right underneath or nose!  Reservations required if you'd like to sit outside the bar area..We returned for an amazing brunch and returned the following evening for the HAPPY HOUR  both times, we ordered the crawfish bisque!  Happy hour deals really make it worth the while.  For happy hour, we ordered a dozen oysters ($0.75 each) and half a dozen of their fried oysters. Both were really good and extremely reasonably priced in my opinion given the quality and size of the oysters. 

Again the food is quality the portion size was perfect and the drinks are FANTASTIC!  We actually ended up eating here twice during Jazz feast.

I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans. At the very least, swing by for a quick happy hour and order their crawfish bisque. Can't stress that enough!

Honestly, could not have been happier that we stopped in!  Everything we ate here was fantastic! The waitstaff, bartender, and oysters were delicious!!  The hostess was super sweet and not overbearing we even took selfies :)

I'd make it a point to return here when we come back to New Orleans in February of 2017.

Classic cajun restaurant with great crawfish bisque (opt for the bowl not the cup).  They had delicious (and very generous) chicken & rabbit pate. The fried quail wings were flavorful and great. The fried chicken & biscuits were more on the sweeter side with honey.

While our stay at New Orleans was full of amazing dining experiences, we have to say that Lüke's was our very favorite.  Just by researching on the internet, we were very excited to eat here.  In passing, when we walked in I mentioned that to the hostess how excited we were to be there.  Well, the manager, Stefan, overheard, and made it his personal mission to make our experience the best ever.  He succeeded- hence this review!  His job was made easier, as the food was absolutely wonderful, and Nicole our server was both friendly and extremely efficient.  We had (and we would all recommend)  the Crispy Brussels Sprouts, Flammenkuchen (the onion tarte), Croque-Madame, Soft-shell Crab BLT, and last but not least, the Crawfish Etoufee.  All were delicious, but again, Stephan and Nicole's service was so welcoming that we can't wait to eat there the next time we are back!  Thanks for a great and memorable lunch!

My husband and I make it a point to go to Lüke every time we're in New Orleans because they never fail to please. The food is ALWAYS exquisite and is priced well for the quantity + quality. This past weekend I was in New Orleans on a girl's trip & we happened to visit Lüke during happy hour. OMG! What a deal (/steal)!! First of all their drinks & food are already amazing and most things were 1/2 price! Our server Rich kept us laughing (rolling!) the whole time, was very professional & did a Wonderful job taking care of us! We ordered P&J oysters, brussel sprouts (so ridiculous!), dessert and a variety of beverages. I'd never had raw oysters before & was not eager to try them bc of the texture, but once I did, I was sold! Our experience was so great that we came back the next day. Sadly, Rich wasn't on the schedule but we still enjoyed ourselves and everything else. Lüke is a definite must if you're in the area!

I usually go during happy hour to enjoy 0.75/ per fresh and clean oyster.
This time, because my parents' in town visiting. We decided to have dinner after oyster. 

We had jumbo Louisiana Shrimp and crawfish étouffée with a French fries.

We feel those two entree were a bit to salty.

BEST RAW OYSTERS. This is Chef John Besh's most famous restaurant. Yes, you must come here for raw oysters during their happy hour. It was $0.75/ raw oysters. We had 2 dozens of raw oysters and a dozen of also the best fried oysters I've had. The raw oysters were the star though. They were so meaty, creamy and tasty. We also had the best service here. Our waiter, Willie Will ( I think that's his name hahaha) was so attentive and funny. He was awesome and we told the manager how great he was. They also gave us some delicious chocolate cake. 

A lot of restaurant in NOLA has great raw oysters but this is the best.

So this is where my wife and I went to finish our blitz around New Orleans. We had recommendations from friends that this is a place to eat at, and definitely happy that we were able to make it here.

We get there for brunch, no reservation, and with no wait went to a table near the back. After reading through the menu and having an incredibly hard time making a decision.

We ended up with Brussels sprouts to start. They almost had a sweet chili sauce flavor that surrounded them. It was a huge pile but didn't last all that long as the wife and I went to town on them.

I had some breakfast with eggs, grits, sausage and Allan Benton bacon. Sounds pretty standard, it really hit the spot.

Wife went with the biscuit and fried chicken sandwich. It used the chicken thighs because its better that way.

As I write my reviews of Nola food I wish I was still there.

Went here alone for happy hour and ended up being at the bar with a bunch of other women who all had the same idea as me. The bartender took good care of us, highly recommended. (Didn't have full dinner here)
Wow! The brussels sprouts were unexpectedly delicious.  Who knew Brussel sprouts could taste so Good! We came here on a recommendation by the owner of Trapani's Eatery.

Best raw bar happy hour I have ever been to. Happy hour is from 3 to 6 so I was a little concerned when I got there after 5. I was pleasantly surprised that happy hour applies to tables (in my home town it almost always only applies to the bar area). Nothing beats .75 cent oysters and half price cocktails.

You can probably go to New Orleans for a meal everyday for the rest of your life and not have the same thing twice. Well not being biased but every experience I've had at a John Besh restaurant has been magnificent! I've been to Lüke twice now and have ordered the same thing twice. Lol! The rabbit and liver pâté is the best pâté I've had in a restaurant. From the toasted thinly sliced bread to their creole mustard seed spread to the pâté itself. You'll finish the whole thing. I also had the Louisiana shrimp and jalapeño cheese grits. Talk about carb loading. You definitely don't leave hungry. My boyfriend had the burger and even he questioned getting a $16 burger for brunch but what the hell, we did and it was a wonderful decision. The burger had a nice grilled taste, fresh flavorful beef, and bacon. Bacon....the fries were pretty basic thin cut fries bordering shoe string styled fries which weren't salted and maybe taken out a bit early bc it wasn't quite crisp but nothing ketchup doesn't fix. Overall, we'd come again and again for the páté, the other food would just be a bonus.

Great location. Creative food. Solid service. 

Ate here twice this week. They describe some of the food as life changing.  Well, not for me, but it was great and fun. 

The soft shell BLT is delicious, inventive and really good. The shrimp and grits are wonderful also. 

For me, the place needs some music to bring it to
life. And that cost them the one star. Looking forward to LUKE in San Antonio.

Fabulous happy hour.  We arrived 30 minutes before our reserved time.  (It is highly recommended to make reservations for happy hour also because it gets busy. )  The host said there were couple empty seats so we could be seated.  

The two ladies that were bartending that night were fabulous, lovely and answered all of our drink questions.  We ordered the French 75 and the Sazerac, enjoyed both of them thoroughly.  We also tried the Saint and that was my favorite drink of the three.  The oysters ($0.75 each during happy hour) were good.  For someone that eats oysters often during business trips, my husband said they weren't the freshest but still good.  (This could be because we ordered oysters in June and not during 'r' months.) Who knows... I liked the dozen oysters and three cocktails for happy hour special.  I highly recommend going to Luke for drinks and some food.  (We had dinner plans otherwise I would've ordered off the menu as well.)   Can't wait to go back when we're in the city again...

Speaking as a current resident of the Florida gulf coast, and former resident of the central California coast, it pains me to admit it but the oysters at Luke are the best I've ever had. And I've had them picked same-day from the Monterey Bay. It surprised me to learn that the oysters are harvested from New Orleans, I had no idea that N.O. had access to such top notch shellfish. Anyways happy hour features deals on signature cocktails, 75 cent oysters and cheap apps, I went there twice during my week in N.O. and I should have gone more. 

Other than the amazing briny ice cold oysters, my wife and I also had a selection of various apps and cocktails all of which were in the good to excellent range. The one that really sticks out is the squash blossoms - do not miss this one even if trying new food scares you. They have a texture and flavor similar to a delicate bell pepper, and they are perfectly tempura battered and stuffed with tangy goat cheese with a little honey drizzle. It made me go home and plant a squash just so I can harvest the blossoms and recreate this dish. Luke hits a nice balance between casual and formal, from the atmosphere to the menu to the prices. Not to be missed.

I highly recommend coming here. If you do, ask for Kevin and Rich. Fantastic professional servers. They make you feel at home here. The food was unbelievable too. It was an overall great atmosphere and our waiters were wonderful. If you are in New Orleans, you must come here !
Food was great. A little bit pricey for what they offer, but the service was phenomenal. The environment and location were great too.

Fantastic food and service! The server, Richie Rich could not have delivered a better experience to my family! The shrimp and grits were the best I've ever had. I highly recommend to anyone and plan to come back.
和大多是的这边的饭店一样的好吃的程度，就这样，不高 不底！总体印象就是地面不干净，粘脚，也不平整，腥味大，整体的清洁度不是很满意！但是服务小哥还不错！和大多是的这边的饭店一样的好吃的程度，就这样，不高 不底！总体印象就是地面不干净，粘脚，也不平整，腥味大，整体的清洁度不是很满意！但是服务小哥还不错！

Another amazing meal in NOLA. We ordered a variety to share. Shrimp and grits amazing. First time tasting grits ( uh we don't have a lot of grits in Hawaii) and I am hooked. Croque Madame good as well. Fried chicken disappointing as it was very bland. Manager came over to apologize and took it off the bill this wouldn't deter us from coming back on our next visit.
Excellent food. Great atmosphere. The shrimp and grits are excellent and a must try. Ask for Nicole, she is a very good waitress.

Can you mainline crawfish bisque? If so, sign me up for rehab because I'm officially an addict. Convenient location. Reservation was promptly honored. Outstanding customer service. Delicious food. One of the best dinner experiences we had in NOLA. This is the first time in my life I've wished for more than two thumbs, so I can stick them way way up.

A French brasserie with a very solid happy hour with 75cent oysters and half off wines and cocktails.

Service is professional and friendly but unfortunately the kitchen is soooooo slowww....but I guess that gives us time to consume more wine!  

On a side note, I've never been a fan of oysters in New Orleans. They lack flavor and crispness and brininess whatsoever. But that's just what you get here.. At least they were fresh.

The best étouffée I have ever had! The cocktails are also spectacular. The staff is amazingly nice and make you feel welcomed and at home. If you are in New Orleans this is a place you have to go to! Their shrimp and grits is also very good and another classic to try.

Stopped in here for breakfast on a Saturday morning - the server was very friendly and paid close attention to our table. All the food was exceptional. Special recognition to the grits - they were fluffy and almost mashed potato like. The best I have ever had. The mixed berry marmalade was exceptional as well and was fabulous on top of the hearty multigrain toast.

Wish we had found this place for breakfast earlier in our trip! Highly recommended!!

Luke's was one of our favorite meals in New Orleans. Our only problem was I made reservations on Open Table, we get there and after about a 15 minute wait at the bar, we were seated at a table for two in the back by where the waiters come in and out. My husband was not happy and after asking a couple of times we were moved to another table for two (there were several) more to the center of the restaurant.

The Louisiana Rabbit and Chicken Liver Pate was wonderful and we loved all the sides that went along with it. The manager has since sent me the recipe that is used at that restaurant and also his Provence restaurant. Can't wait to try it.

I have also recreated the Salad Luke. I loved the presentation of this salad. I made my own pickled yellow beets and added beets to the different layers instead of just on the bottom of the salad. 

The black drum with the meunier sauce was also wonderful as was the lemon cheesecake with lemon sorbet for dessert.

We could have stopped eating after the pate but we surged on. They brought more crostini and it was just hard to quit eating the stuff.

Lüke's happy hour is phenomenal. It is everyday from 3pm-6pm; don't miss it. Their raw oysters are 75¢ and fried ones are $1.25. All drinks are half off during happy hour, also. What a deal! To make matters better, the service, which at times seemed like multiple folks taking and providing our orders, is exceptional and very friendly. This was our first time eating raw oysters, and Lüke didn't disappoint. Make sure to make a reservation. We will be back.

I would have given this restaurant five stars if it wasn't for the New York waiter with bad attitude. Thought he was a big shot great waiter and was in the beginning until him and the other waiter started fighting over who got the tip. In the end he places down the check without saying a word. Otherwise, fantastic restaurant with the best pate I've ever had. Shrimp and grits and the steak were incredible.
Obsessed with this place. Great fresh seafood and incredible hors d'oeuvres and the service is impeccable. 5 stars for another besh favorite. ASK FOR RICHIE RICH

Lüke's food is outstanding!! My mom and I came here after a long night out on Bourbon to try and come back to life. The Lüke Burger, Local Crab Omelette and Bread Pudding did it for us!! Our server and the hostess were super friendly and joined in the humor of how hungover we were. It's a little pricey but you're on vacation!! Worth the splurge.

Luke's is one of my favorite happy hours in NoLA - they have awesome specials on fresh oysters, and discounted drinks as well. It's only at the bar, so be sure to get here early to get a seat. I actually preferred the bar seating at Luke's because you got to see the oysters being shucked in real time, and learned new things about the food from the shuckers. Definitely a place I stop by every time I'm in NoLA.

Great Food very rich and tasty - good athmoaphere
Had the clam soup which was delicious but a bit pricey 
Oysters perfect

Visiting New Orleans for a few days and we came across this restaurant for lunch. OMG!!! I can barely think of the words to explain this food. I also sat near the kitchen so I got to see a glimpse of the action. Nicole M was our server and recommend the swash blossoms. Amazing. The stuffed oysters. Amazing. I had a small cup of gumbo. Amazing. My wife had the soft shell crab BLT, it's served open faced and looks so appealing your mouth waters as you take pictures of it to tease your friends, then you dig in. Amazing. I had there fried chicken and red beans/rice. It's was good. Celebrity chef restaurants normally live up to the hype but this one was beyond just a good experience. I currently work in celebrity chef Tom Colicio restaurant Beachcraft in Miami so I know what to expect. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone that has a mouth and taste buds. Again Nicole M was great she really made our experience 10 times better
Went there for a late desert. Cheese cake ... did not care for the after taste. Crumble... it was ok. Felt like my homemade was better. Seemed like a cool vibe great service just fell short on flavor

Everyone who visits New Orleans comes away with a story... well here is ours.

After a couple of really hot days and with only one dinner left before traveling back home to Memphis, my wife and I decided to try Luke being fans of the chef and it coming highly recommended from friends and others who had visited the area. Upon being seated towards the front of the dining space on a two top next to two other couples we began trying to navigate the menu and how to narrow down all of the delicious offerings. As wise shopper should, we looked to our left and right to see what everyone had ordered and see if we should do the same.

We noticed one couple next to us had decided to share the ribeye/steak. Unfortunately they were upset about how medium rare, their medium steak turned out and called for the waiter to complain. To our immediate dismay the gentleman decided to let the waiter have it even though the wait staff immediately apologized and quickly removed the steak to make it right. After the gentleman asked for the manager my wife looked at me and quietly said, "Do you think they are trying to get a free meal?" I dismissed it, but was wrong as the man immediately told his date that he felt the reason the steak was undercooked and not to his liking was because... (ready for this)... he was gay. His date replied, "Do they even know you're gay?" My thoughts exactly. 

Once the manager approached the gentleman asked to speak to him away from the table and let him have it explaining how his steak was undercooked and how somehow his sexual preference must be involved. I'll be honest, it made me sick to watch it all unfold. 

The manager of course helped calm the situation and replaced his waiter with another team (by the way, it turns our his original waiter was gay too) but this man didn't care and felt the restaurant owed him something. Luke bent over backwards to help this man enjoy his dinner and in the end comp'ed his meal - entire meal, wine, steaks, etc. 

My review here is to compliment the manager Derrick and the servers Gary and Tristian on how professionally they managed a challenging situation. I hated to see it all unfold especially with such circumstances, but had to tell the tale that we took home with us.

If you're looking to be treated well and enjoy a delightful meal, Luke is a excellent option. My wife and I share the burger and loved the bisque, oyster salads and special cocktails. Dessert was delightful and thanks to the amazing front house team we will return and tell others our tale while encouraging others to put Luke on your New Orleans must visit list. From all of the reviews here, I think my next visit will be during happy hour!

Located in downtown, right next door to the Hilton Hotel.

My husband and I decided to come here for their 3 pm happy hour (Happy Hour 3-6 pm daily: $0.75 raw oysters, $1.25 fried oysters, half off featured cocktails, beer and wine by the glass). 

After we walked in a little before 3 pm, we were greeted by the hostess. I asked her if we had to sit at the bar because we are interested in the happy hour deal. She told me that we can sit at a table if we would like (we were seated at a table). 

We ended up getting:

Door#Three, $10 prior to tax- There are 6 featured cocktails to choose from off of the happy hour menu and I am glad I went with this drink. I liked the pomegranate, lemon juice and mint flavors together. I wished my mint leave wasn't limp though that was served with the drink (sometimes presentation is part of the dining experience too). 

Riesling Wine By The Glass, $6 prior to tax- I didn't have any, but my husband did enjoy his white wine.

1.5 dozen raw oysters, $0.75 each (prior to tax)- The price was right for these little jewels and the wait time to get these out to our table was quick. But the majority of these oysters were gritty and still had some sand in them. I think they needed to be soaked/ washed off a bit more because tasting part of the salty gritty sand is definitely not good eats. 

1/2 dozen fried oysters, $1.25 each (prior to tax)- I have never had fried oysters and so I thought it would be worth trying. These oysters were pretty good with the 2 different textures (crunchy and hot with the cool and creamy inside). I would order fried oysters again. 

Complementary bread- Just a small baguette bread per person, pretty standard but good. Liked that each piece of bread was brought out warm. 
-----------------------
(Total= $36 After Tax)

Service was pretty friendly and attentive by both of our servers. We initially had a female sever and then halfway through, a male server took over. 

I think I would just come here for their strong drinks and fried oysters but pass on the raw oysters during happy hour (we had oysters over at St. Roch Market at the Elysian Seafood food vendor and their also have $0.75 oysters during happy hour. Their oysters were not gritty. We loved their fresh tasting oysters so much that we went twice during our NOLA vacation).
Our family celebrated my sister and mine's birthday here. It was amazing! Gary and Lillian were our servers, they were so sweet and accommodating!!!! Definitely recommend the Pate and French 75s!!!

Loved this place! This is a John Besh restaurant (celebrity chef, and featured on Top Chef many times). We came here for lunch on a Tuesday and had no problem getting a parking spot in front, and we were seated right away. The bread they gave us first was crispy and warm and the inside was nice and soft... just the way I like my bread. We had a bowl of the Gumbo. The Gumbo appetizer was nice and earthy. It had sausage, meatballs, and oysters stuffed with pate'. It was tasty and also very rich, but very good. That alone could have been a filling meal. My entrée was the Louisiana Jumbo Shrimp with Mozarella and Jalapeño Grits. This was my first time having shrimp and grits and WOW! Tasted like HEAVEN! I didn't grow up eating grits, but eating this somehow gave me a feeling like I had been coming home to Louisiana all my life. It was that AWESOME! I highly recommend this dish to have. You will not regret it. My husband had the special of the day: Gulf White Shrimp and White Squash Etouffee. It was served with Jasmine white rice and was also very delicious. What a great dining experience! Staff was very pleasant, ambiance was classic, and bathrooms were very clean. I will definitely return the next time we are in town and recommend this place to all my friends.

This place was absolutely delicious. We came for a work lunch and it was right around the corner. We were a group of about 8 and they were able to sit us easily. The menu is small and not overwhelming which I appreciate. I decided to go with the burger and they weren't lying when they said 10 oz! That thing was HUGE. I ended up deconstructing my burger because it was so big. The fries were also really great and crispy just how I like them. Everyone else was happy with their dishes. My director said the shrimp and grits was phenomenal. I will definitely come back! Yum!
Do not confuse this with Cajun food. That is like comparing Burger King with fine dining. The rabbit and chicken liver pate is truly wonderful. Service is great. Worth every penny.

Fried Oysters are the bomb! I've never enjoyed oysters to be honest! :/ 

Brussels sprouts were pretty good too, the drinks for happy hour are to die for absolutely delicious. Got hammered here. We also tries fried goat cheese stuffed blossoms, it was bursting deliciousness in my mouth!!

We just came here for desert and coffee. 
They had great strong coffee and their bread pudding was very tasty and rich.

As soon as you walk through the door you are great with a smile and friendly staff. Everything was delicious! We had the amazing brussel sprouts, shrimp and grits, and burger.  Great start to my weekend! I will definitely be back. Our waiter Tirrione was the absolute best!!!!

Came for HH with two girlfriends. Our cocktails were all delicious. I had the door#three. We got the fried oysters for $1.25 during HH and they are AMAZINGGGG! The sauce with them was so good too! They also had 0.75 cents raw oysters. But believe me, I will be back for those fried oysters! Five stars for the oysters

Stayed at Hilton and stopped in. Not your regular attached restaurant. Place is legit. 

We had the crab au gratin, salad w chicken, and the shrimp and grits. 

Shrimp and grits are best I've ever had. Was very impressed. We will be back!

A good place to come if you want good oysters for a decent price! They have a happy hour deal for oysters and drinks which is pretty good. The deal is 75cent oysters and 1/2 off house wines and draft beers from 3-6. Also they do accept reservations!

Oh my gosh!!! I had the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte". It was the best meal I have ever had in my life!!! The ambience was very nice and I was seated very quickly with my reservation. My server was adorable as well as the friendly hostesses. I would surely say that my visit here made my trip to New Orleans that much more memorable!!! Thank you!!!
This restaurant was delightful. We went for breakfast/ brunch. We ordered the pain perdu, omelette with local crab and the shrimp and grits. Everything was delicious.
Great culinary experience!!! Outstanding service!!! Just really awesome experience! All the food and even the dessert were great!! One of the highlights of our food road trip. Thanks!

They had the best brussel sprouts ever. I'm still thinking about them and I ate there almost a week ago. They're spicy and delicious. I came with 3 people and we also got the 50 cent oysters and drinks at happy hour. I got some ginger drink that was good. Nice spot to hit up. I would definitely go again. I also heard the burgers were really good but I don't eat that stuff.
I have not eaten Brussels sprouts since I was a kid (nightmare) these are so delicious, I could lick the plate!!

Had breakfast there a while back, and although the scrambled eggs, biscuits were ok, the sausage and bacon was highly salted and smoked.  An acquired taste not easy to get used to, being from California.  So would not order those items again.  However, the gumbo was excellent.

What can I say that everyone else hasn't?! Lüke's is phenomenal. I consider myself a "foodie" and am eating my way around New Orleans this summer... And tonight I had the best shrimp and grits I've ever tasted. Each dish we ordered was honestly (no exaggeration) better than the last.

We started with the crab and born bisque... Incredibly flavorful and full of crab, which was cooked perfectly. For the main course I ordered the shrimp and grits (much fancier name on the menu) and my boyfriend tried the soft shell crab "sandwich" which is really an open faced sandwich. I really can't even describe how delicious my shrimp and grits were... Jalapeño grits baked with cheese, spicy sausage, and scrumptious shrimp. 

As two recent college grads, this place was definitely a splurge for date night - but it was worth every bite. Some seafood dishes can be heavy and extremely over-filling. But ours were just outstanding. 

Appetizers/soups/salads range in price; you won't find anything less than $7. The main courses are closer to the $25-30 range, but well worth it in our eyes.

Everything was so wonderful- I'd love to come back and try their breakfast or brunch menu! Will definitely be back, and I suggest you give them a try.
Great food. Wonderful atmosphere. Great service.  Had the Luke Burger.  It was massive and very tasty.
Great place for all sorts of oysters. The raw dozens are massive.

Recommended by our hotel, due to well known local chef John Besh. Sorry John, never heard of ya up in Minnesota. Sunday night in July, busy but easy to get in without a Rez. Charming decor and extremely friendly host and wait staff. Brought us complimentary champagne after hearing me complain about getting my car towed at the French Market -total scam, BTW.  Besides the impeccable service, everything was fabulous. Limited menu choices, but all interesting.  Especially loved the Brussels sprouts appetizer (Crispy sprouts, MARCONA ALMONDS, ESPELETTE HONEY, PROGRESS MILK BARN CHEESE). Also loved the goat cheese stuffed squash blossoms. Entre was equally as good - JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP "EN COCOTTE" -
ROASTED JALAPEÑO CHEESE GRITS, ANDOUILLE & GREEN ONION SAUSAGES, though couldn't finish all the grits after our 2 apps. Loved this restaurant and would highly recommend it for a business dinner or romantic evening.

I was looking for a good breakfast place near Hilton Riverside hotel. This place was about 10 minute walk. My group loved their coffee. I had the southern breakfast and it was delicious. I think my group ordered 3-4 different dishes and loved them all.

We were there for a girl's trip in May (sorry I didn't get this out sooner, but I like to travel!). This was just an overall great place. First, they accommodated my 87 yr old mom with a pillow for her back (where'd they find THAT?).
Then there's the food. We ordered appetizers: flammenkuchen and crabmeat au gratin. DEE. LISH. Oh, and the crab and corn bisque. Amazing flavors! Everyone who had oysters thought they were awesome. My daughter and I split the ribeye and the jalapeno grits. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! The steak was cooked to perfection. Red wines were suggested and not over-the-top priced. 
We sought out the manager, Deidre Pryor, to let her know that our servers were terrific.Can't wait to visit their location in San Antonio!

Menu is ho-hum, especially for the price. I made the mistake of ordering this onion tart that reminded me of a bbq chicken pizza from CPK. Should've picked up that the waiter wasn't as enthused when I ordered but didn't dissuade me (too subtle for me at the time, but understandable behavior from him).

We only went here for happy hour. With is 3-6 I believe.  Half off beers and $.75 raw oysters and 1.25 fried oysters. We both got the fried oysters and they were probably the best I've had. Their beer selections were mostly local too which I liked!

Randomly came here with a friend one night because there was no other place to go to for dinner, and Luke closes quite late. Will be judging this restaurant a little more critically based on its standards and because it's a John Besh restaurant. 

Good service, the waiter was super nice and attentive so that's a plus. However, I do not know if he was just being honest about his opinions or he was trying to rack up the bill so he'll get a higher tip, but everything our waiter recommended was at the top of the list in terms of pricing, and after we were done, like done done, he kept on pushing us to get some more food and drinks. 

We had the fresh gulf drum and the Washington Parish roasted chicken for entrees. The fresh gulf drum was pan fried I believed, but it was topped off with sweet and well-seasoned veggies. Despite the veggies, the dish itself was quite bland. The roasted chicken was even more bland. Quite dry, and the veggies were less flavorful than the ones on the gulf drum. 

The only reason why I am giving this place a 4 instead of a 3 star rating is because, before this review, I came here and tried the grilled pork chop and soft shell crab dish, and the food were superb. That night I could have easily given this place a 5 star. Would definitely come back here, just because I think this night was a rare phenomenon, or that I could just have ordered the wrong dishes.

I HIIIIIGHLY recommend this place. I had the best experience and the YUMMMIEST food! OMG, the FOOD! Before I go on talking about what food I ordered, I would love to point out that the service here AMAAAZING! They are very accommodating and sweet. 

Our waiter was MATT! He is freakin AWESOME and probably the best waiter we have ever gotten! Definitely my top 3! I hope you get seated in his section! We had trouble ordering from the menu because everything looked so yummy! He helped out a lot with our food selection, especially the BREAD PUDDING! Best decision we've ever made! I would definitely come back to this restaurant!

We ordered:

A dozen P & J Oysters (which are also on their happy hour menu!) - VERY YUMMY

Croque Madam - Very Toasty bread and runny yolk that complimented the entire meal. Eat it while it's still warm! Don't take too long taking pictures of your food ;) haha just playin.. And the fries! Ohh my looooord, I finished mine and had more of my friend's! Haha 

Bloody Marys - They were nicely spiced! We had a few of these c(: And I looove how their pickles are string beans! Or so that's what they looked like

BREAD PUDDING & VANILLA BEAN ICE CREAM! - I don't usually like bread pudding and have given it a try quite a few times just incase it was actually good. I'm glad I gave it a try again this time since Louisiana is known for their bread pudding. And let me tell you.. if you are to ever have bread pudding, go to LUKES! LUKE's has the BEST BREAD PUDDING IN THE WORLD!!! In the WOOOOORLD!!  You will not regret it. You will actually fall in loooove :D The pudding was nice and candied on the top. The pecans are perfectly toasted and drizzled generously on top. Get this bread pudding with Vanilla bean ice cream. PERFECT COMBO! I ate as much as i can. I might not be able to have another bomb ass bread pudding like this one again. 

BREAD PUDDING & MATT ALL DAY!! :D

We had dinner here at 10 pm on a Thursday night after driving 8 hours from Dallas, TX to New Orleans. 
We were greeted warmly and the wait staff treated us as if we were royalty. 
Highlights:
*great drinks--French 75 and Sauzerac
*nice wine selection 
*brussel sprouts appetizer
*corn and crab bisque
*rib eye steak!!

Best restaurant in New Orleans!
Brussels sprouts are an amazing appetizer. I loved them so much they even gave me the recipe!
Fantastic happy hour, half off all drinks and oysters from 3-6 pm every day of the year. 75 cent oysters, you cannot beat that! I usually don't even like oysters but they were so fresh I loved them! 
Our server "Richie rich" was quite easily the best server I've ever had. He gave us great recommendations on drinks and food and was exactly what you would expect for the stereotype of a friendly and sweet person from the south. 
Would absolutely come back!!

Delicious meal. First time customer. Outstanding waiter Richie Rich. I have never left a Yelp review but I had to for this special circumstance! He was funny, attentive and the best waiter we've ever had. In other words- Request him!

My boyfriend and I were starving and found this place on Yelp! First, you're suppose to make reservations but they were still able to go ahead and seat us. The food was AMAZING! We had the fried oysters and a few drinks for half price. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits and I had a shrimp pasta. If you're ever here, check this place out! They won't disappoint you!

In a city full of great eating destinations, Luke may take the cake.

As others have mentioned, Luke offers the best HH in NO! 50 cent (at time of writing) oysters and half price drinks are a great way to kick off your NO weekend. The place gets busy quickly so to ensure your spot in the HH fracas, do arrive early.

Bonus tip: the pate is awesome.
Amazing food! I recommend the shrimp and grits- just delicious and fitting for this beautiful city. The service was also very welcoming and the ambience very impressive.

Amazing food! Rabbit and chicken liver pate with a variety of mustards, preserves and pickles. So very yummy. Possibly the best pate I have ever eaten, and I am a fan of pate! Brussels sprout appetizer was amazingly flavorful. Rib eye steak came with a creamy rich bernaise sauce, burgers were mile high and loaded with bacon, shrimp etouffe was spicy and served over pasta instead of rice for something a little different. Try the French 75 cocktail - champagne and cognac with a cherry... They even wrote the name of the restaurant with cherry juice in the foam! Wish I could be hungry again right now and order another pate appetizer...

My experience was disappointing, but that could very well be because I ordered the wrong dish. My friend and I both ordered the Tabasco and honey fried chicken with red beans and rice, the dish was very bland. We didn't even eat half of our food. We also ordered the crab bisque and seafood gumbo, both were delicious. 
The menu is pricey.

We sat at the bar, Jamal shucked our incredible oysters, they were clean and cold and crisp! Perfectly shucked! He had great customer service and shucked the best damn oysters ever! Maddy the bartender was incredibly attentive and gave great recommendations on drinks and wine, she knows her stuff! All in all Luke was a great experience made even better by the excellent service! Oh and tip your oyster shucker! They deserve it!

Hands down, this was the BEST dining experience I had in New Orleans. The wait staff was extremely friendly, personable and quick. We told them it was our last night in the city and they truly made it a memorable experience. We ordered the Gumbo and the Fried Oyster salad as a starter- I am not usually a fan of oysters but both dishes were amazing. The main course- the shrimp and grits and the cavatelli pasta. They were to die for! I definitely recommend both of these. It was heaven on a plate. The dessert: bread pudding and the peach and blackberry cobbler. Both were AMAZING! I can't say anything bad about this place. Throughout the meal the chef complimented us with extra dishes to try which helped us on our mission to eat our way through the city. Again, the staff was amazing and the chef was fantastic.

Overall if you're looking for a good place to eat in the city, I definitely recommend Luke. I will be back next time I am in town. It was a great dining experience.
Stopped in for happy hour. Drinks are unique and delicious! One piece of advice. Order the bread pudding. You will thank me.

Coming to visit New Orleans was always a desire growing up. Well I finally made it and I was looking for a GOOD brunch spot. Something that will give me that burst of flavor I was in search of. I found it! My friend asked me how was my food...it was everything I waited my entire life for. I tried the shrimp and grits with added lobster. We had some amazing cocktails. I believe I have door number 3  it was a refreshing vodka drink. Then my amazing server kept us laughing. I could not have asked for a better experience. Let's not forget the special drink the bartender made and allowed me to sample. It was so delicious and refreshing.

This place is awesome. My Fiancé, daughter and I we all overly satisfied. Great food with an outstanding staff. Jackson (the waiter) provided us with a history lesson on the restaurant and the chef. 
When I come home again I will return to this heavenly, face feeding establishment. 
5 thumbs up

I have been staying at the business district Hilton all week. Being a diamond Hilton member I have experienced tons of Hilton branded restaurants.  Twice I have sat at the bar and all four bartenders I have interacted with have been totally fantastic. Bryan made me feel like we had been friends for years going as far as lending me his wine key for my certified somm exam. In my opinion thats the kind is customer service that makes a visit memorable.  His counterpart on Wednesday was hilarious and welcoming as well. Maddie was great Friday night despite being very busy. She really made me feel at home.  I had Malcolm's heirloom tomato salad. The food was great and the service was far better. As an industry veteran compliments like this don't come easily. LUKE deserves all five stars and more. If you are looking for a modern take on classic Southern Fare or some amazing gulf oysters as well as top of the industry service this is a killer spot.

While all our food and drinks were absolutely delicious (crab au gratin, étouffée, soft shell crab, Luke burger) some of us were left feeling like it wasn't completely worth the price. Mainly due to the portions. 

They got my friend's order wrong for both the appetizer and the entree. The entree she decided to just eat since we waited a while for it to come out. And the portion for the étouffée was definitely stingy especially when they make it so damn good, with the perfect amount of heat. 

Service was good. And despite the small portions (for some of our apps/entrees) and high prices I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.

Upon finding out that we were celebrating a recent return from a military deployment the staff and chef went above and beyond to ensure that we had one of the most memorable nights of our lives! After sampling a majority of the menu, we can honestly say that there is nothing bad that you can pick out. Each appetizer, entree and dessert picked out was better than the last and our waiter was able to pair our wine with our selected entrees perfectly. We can't thank the staff and chef enough and we appreciate everything they did for us. Anyone looking for a restaurant in New Orleans should put this at the top of their list!

LOVE Oysters and drinks at this place.  We had the chargrilled oysters at ACME.  It's good.  But, Luke's fresh and fried oysters are the BOMB!!  We had a dozen of raw and half dozen of fried to start.  We ordered another dozen raw and dozen fried in the second round.  They are definitely fresh and big fat juicy oysters!!!  I had Door#3 cocktail to start.  I think it's a little too sweet for my taste.  If you are going to get one drink only, you should get French 75.  So good!!!!!  Hubby had a bowl of gumbo which he likes a lot.  All in all, it's the best meal for me thus far at NOLA.

We hit this place late night for dinner when we got back late from a tour. It was right near our hotel so that helped. The raw bar selections were very good, local oysters, giant shrimp and king crab. Service was excellent as well. The burger my wife and son split was good, but nothing to write home about but I wouldn't have come here for just that. Decent bar scene as well.

The food was fantastic, the staff for happy hour and table service were above and beyond wonderful. We had the local yogurt and house granola plate, shrimp n grits (an egg accidentally jumped onto the floor and they were so kind to whip up another quickly), oysters all ways. 

However, and a big however is the take-out experience. We opted to run downstairs from the hotel, cause the menu was bigger than room service. We ordered two soups, two salads, a dessert.....we got two salads, one soup, no utensils. When I called back, the lady seemed a bit skeptical. Really! So we ran back down for the missing items and alas still no utensils, soooo we ran back down again. Bothersome, unapologetic, and ended our eating there.

For me, the absolute best shrimp and grits anywhere. I went to a conference 5 years ago and tasted a friend's shrimp and grits and have been waiting to return and get my own dish. Shrimp are juicy, bursting with true shrimp flavor instead of the bland flavorless farmed shrimp, the grits are cheesy and creamy but what makes this dish is extremely deep and rich sauce that have layers of seafood flavor.
