Don't miss it. Dinner menu calls it JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP "EN COCOTTE". The crispy brussel sprouts were perfectly prepared and spiced and goat cheese stuffed squash blossom were very good. Going back soon - not in 5 years, but in a couple days!!!

This review makes me sad. Let's start with the good:  service was fantastic. The ribeye ($34) was cooked to medium rare perfection. The gumbo was amazing. 
The bad:  The ribeye had zero seasoning. zeroooo. It tasted like nothing. The burger had zero seasoning. It only tasted like the cheese that topped it. What use is cooking things correctly if they don't have any flavor? Why did I just pay a crazy amount for this 10oz ribeye and fries? Sadness and woe.

Had the shrimp and grits. Excellent choice and recommended by the server. Perfectly seasoned with a healthy portion of shrimp. My only issue is the price. Will service was great this place seemed unreasonably pricey compared to some of its competitors. 

But overall it was a good experience.

I bookmarked this place from my last visit to Nola. I was super excited to try this place! Upon arriving  the atmosphere was better than I expected (upscale). 
Me and my husband ordered the chicken biscuit which is a larger plate so we decided to share. The presentation was excellent the chicken was tender, juicy, & flavorful. I also order a mimosa it wasn't the best I've had I asked to have it returned and order another drink. 
Upon eating half way through my meal my chicken wasn't done all the way. Instead of sending it back and getting my ordered comped I paid for everything. 

Honestly I don't know if I'll try them again

A friend of mine recommended Luke to me and boy am I glad he did!! I was planning my mother's 70th birthday party and Luke had the perfect private dining room for the small gathering. Since I don't live in NOLA I was able to do all the planning with Melissa (their private events contact) through email. Melissa was very responsive and accommodating to all of our party's requests. On the actual night of the dinner, I was super impressed with the quality of the service, the food and the atmosphere. Our server, Kevin, was amazing and he did a wonderful job making our event very memorable. Everything I tried was delicious. The shrimp and grits, the gulf drum, the gumbo...everything was very flavorful!! Cannot wait to go back next time I go to NOLA!!!

I came here for dinner about 8 years ago and then went back for a brunch earlier this year.  Both times were enjoyable, but the food was a little rich for my tummy.  Food was a little on the pricey side for what you get. I did find it a tad loud, so it was a challenge to hear the other people at my table talking.  All in all, I would come back to give it another try, and hope for a better experience.

To the ladies of the bar and the men of the sea (doing the oysters).
Service was impeccable - Jamie and Brandi were awesome. VERY nice, attentive, and take great pride in their work. I truly enjoyed watching them make drinks (in the non-creepy way). I am a customer oriented guy and appreciate good service so I love it when it happens.

Oysters - they were wonderful and the guys work hard. Overall - great time, great people, well worth the trip.
Etoufee was amazing and so was the steak.  Service was very good and the place was busy so I wasn't expecting it to be.

After eating here on Saturday night, I can't wait to go back. The atmosphere is amazing! The staff seemed to be having a great time and really enjoyed their job, especially Rich. He made the experience fantastic! He helped us with food recommendations and all were wonderful! The crispy brussel sprouts were better than any I've ever had. The squash blossoms with goat cheese were amazing, as was the crawfish  etouffee and steamed chocolate with salted caramel ice cream! We sat at a great table where we were able to see the food being made, which I loved! All in all, it was great experience and I can't wait to go back!

Ok Luke you and I will now remain in Holy matrimony.

I came back to LUKE because Chef John Besh was so disappointed from my bad experience that he wrote me personally on Yelp (Yes I died) and told me to contact his GM Mr. Mire to let him know what happened. I did just that and Mr. Mire invited me back to make up for the terrible experience. 

What was so awesome was not only does Chef John Besh keep an eye on what happens in his restaurants but his team is on top of quality control and never break a promise. I came in almost a year later and emailed Mr. Mire and he was very accommodating. I will never forget that, it was beyond hospitable.

My Co-worker and I came in and it was the best night ever because Chef John just so happened to be there that night filming a show about Oysters.

I stared at him filming like a little girl who is in love with a boy band, it was so cool I fanned out completely. 

Food
Beet salad with Butter lettuce-The freshest beets I have ever had, so sweet the ate like candy.

Crab dip-Creamy, light, with chunks of crab. Delicious and a nice start to the meal.

Shrimp and grits with crab-My go to favorite, the best I have ever had hands down. Lump crab, creamy grits, huge prawns, green onion, and a whole lot of love. This is a must have.

Rib eye steak-Perfectly cook, seasoned to perfection and the Frites that come with are so perfect. If you want a steak in NOLA this is the way to go.


Dessert-Bread pudding it is a solid dessert, I love the Steam chocolate cake better but they were giving these to every table complimentary because Chef. Besh was in the house.

Besides the incredible food, wonderful service and star sighting of the Great Chef Besh I appreciate them for going above and beyond to fix my terrible experience it is truly something that I will never forget and I will continue to come here every time I am in NOLA.

Thank you LUKE for being so fantastic.

Came here with family only to try the oysters for happy hour. I don't like oysters raw so I ordered fried oysters, my s.i.l got the catfish, and my bf/b.i.l ordered 4 dozens of raw oysters. I really liked the fried oysters because I've been trying to try that! It was so good esp. With the sauce it came with I liked the catfish, but it was kinda dry - still good! I only tried one raw oysters and it was actually good. Haha but still I stuck with mine fried. We ordered mix drinks about 8 cups. The drinks were really good but they just serve it in a small cup like literally 1 cup of mix drink; I was hoping it would be in a taller glass :(((  waitress was really nice, I'd go with which drinks she recommends.

Quick service! And the food was a delight! I got the fried oyster salad and it was over the top good! The fried oysters were the best I've ever had. My husband got the croque madame and it was also great! Our only complaint was that there were some bugs, perhaps fruit flies, flying around, but it is the south right? 

Our waiter Kristoff was very helpful :)
I tried the shrimp and grits which i loved.  But before that i never have had grits at all so i was scared it was going to be real plain,these are so flavorful and im glad ive tried them

A place like this is not usually in our budget, but when checking into the Hilton New Orleans we were told about the happy hour specials...0.75 raw oysters and 1/2 price signature cocktails.  Yes!  My husband loves oysters and ordered a dozen raw and a gal dozen fried (also at a reduced HH price) and I ordered the crab and corn bisque.  The bisque was pretty amazing and outside of my husband making his own cocktail sauce a little too spicy, he loved the oyster experience.  I tried a French 75 and  at least I can say I have now tried one....absolutely no fault of the bartender!!  40.00 and we had a lovely, light, early dinner!

Went here for brunch a while ago. Very nice atmosphere, staff was very attentive and all brunch items were very good. My friends go here all the time, it's consistently good quality food. There have been places I liked better in New Orleans but I would return here.

Wow you guys never disappoint! 

We went there for brunch and got the soft shell crab blt, the chicken and biscuits, and the shrimp and grits. Holy moly everything was great. The biscuits were just perfection and I'm still dreaming of them. The crab was bigger than expected and the shrimp are always great. Must eat place for locals and tourists alike

I chose Luke for my last meal in New Orleans for my birthday weekend at the recommendation of one of the bell hops (Kevin) at our hotel (Le Meridian). Thanks Kev! When I first viewed the menu on Yelp, I was honestly nervous. But I went anyway since I had a flight to catch and was pressed for time. I didn't want anything fancy...just breakfast food. So I ordered the Luke Breakfast. I had a French 75 for my last drink while I waited. First of all, that drink is probably one of the best drinks I've ever had with cognac in it. I couldn't stop talking about it. I was highly disappointed when the bar at the airport said they didn't make it. And you call yourself a bar. Whatever. I'll make it myself. Now to the food. The food. !!! It was so good!!! Best Grits I've ever had in my life!!!! The biscuit was....immaculate. Tender. Even the jam was good. There are other parts to the breakfast that were also great but I won't comment on them. I'd rather leave you in suspense so you can be pleasantly surprised. Enjoy!!

Quick service. The 75 cent oysters during happy hour were delicious!! Very fresh. The fried ones were just okay for me, the bf loved them (i think it was 1.25$ each). We also got the shrimp & grits and rabbit & chicken pate board. The pate i would probably not get again, the chicken taste was overpowering. It came on a board with all of these pickled jams that were interesting, but not good enough for me to ever go out of my way to eat. The shrimp and grits was awesome though. Comes served on an iron skillet (so very hot ); great balance of flavor and textures, especially with the creamy grits and large chunks of sausage/shrimp. The bread roll at the beginning was also pretty good--soft on the inside and crusty on the outside.

Hooray for 0.75 cent oysters during happy hour!!!!  Their HH drinks specials are amazing and the cocktail selection makes me want to have a couple at a time and be very very bad.  We all loved the Silver Saint and French 75.  Keeping it classy!

Well I am in love. I came for a solo dinner and the food and atmosphere took me right back to my year in Paris. 

I opted to maximize tasting potential and ordered two smaller dishes instead of an entree. Well, for one person they're not really small! The pate was incredible. With the different mustards and jellies and pickled foods it felt like a playground for big kids. I had the heirloom tomato salad next, which was a big bowl of tomatoes and mesclun and cheese. It was a solid compliment to the rich, savory taste of the pate. I was sad to leave both dishes uncleaned but I could not fit any more food in to my belly! :) 

To drink I had a door#three (I think it's called?) which was very pretty but not mind-blowingly good tasting. I do however hail from DC aka land of the $15 cocktail so I have some heavy standards! I still enjoyed it.

Service was lovely and very minimal. My water stayed mostly full (they got a little busy towards the end of the meal) but once they realized it, they checked up on me more than average. Bravo.

Odd service style from one guy and the other was definitely more laid back, and water service wavered and the bill was left with dessert. Kitchen must've been in the weeds despite no one in the dining room because everything took forever, yet still came out too hot with no warning. Oysters, crawfish bisque, "etouffee" (cavatelli pasta instead of rice), pate, bread pudding were all ultimately very good. Dined during happy hour but didn't sit at the bar, and the oysters were oddly mostly from MA.  Use Wifi from the hotel it resides within, and watch your step to/from its restroom.

Went for Happy Hour!! Great prices, but couldn't enjoy after spending the last 3 nights in New Orleans. Oysters were huge and we both had the shrimp and grits. It was really heavy, but tasty!! I would definitely try something else next time.

The food is good, but it is very over priced.

Skip this and hit up something else, chances are it will cost you half and be just as good.

Happy hour from 3-6 everyday with 75 cent oysters on the half shell. The oysters were plumpy and fresh and the horseradish was delish. 

The crab corn soup was like liquid gold in a bowl--this might be one of the best soups I've had in my life! It was rich with crab chunks and buttery. I never wanted it to end. 

I had the Luke burger cooked to medium. The patty was huge and the onions complemented the flavors of the meat so well. The first thing I noticed was the bun which looked like a fancy artisanal bread. It was light and doughy. 

Thank you Kevin for awesome service! Kevin our server was very polite and personable. It was an unforgettable experience and I will be sure to come back next time!
Beautiful ambiance. Great brunch menu. Highly recommend the burger, which was cooked perfectly. Tender and juicy burger.

Was here for happy hour oysters.  I had a couple of drinks and some seafood.  Everything was ok. I'm not sure how other food taste cuz I was too full after eating  the cold seafood. Can't beat the 75 cent oysters. Lol
Great happy hour with 50 cent oysters and half off drinks. There food and drink selection is always wonderful  and the service is great. This is a place you can happily spend several hours.

This place is truly average. I've been here on 3 different occasions and have found the menu to stay almost completely the same, with very limited options. 

I've tried the steak, the burger, and the soft shell crab BLT. Out of those 3, the burger was the best, because a burger can never be that terrible. The steak as I recall was just decent and lacked much taste. Last night I tried the soft shell crab blt. It was definitely a beautiful presentation, but there was way too much going on in regards to taste. It was sweet and salty, which tasted weird. There was some sort of bbq sauce on it that completely ruined the dish in my opinion. It was also overpowered by lettuce. The French fries here are completely mediocre too. 

I also ordered one of their special drinks. The drink was extremely strong and difficult to even put down. 

So, why 3 stars? Service was damn good. And their raw bar is unbelievable. Some of the best oysters I've had.

This place was absolutely amazing, we came here on a whim. The drinks were great, the entrees were awesome and the staff were so friendly and wonderful. 
The corn and crab bisque was to die for. I also had the roasted chicken which was so succulent and honestly the best chicken I have ever had. 
The waiters were amazing, so sweet and had wonderful suggestions.
Very nice atmosphere... Staff very friendly... I ordered bread pudding and my husband ordered baked oysters... Everything was awesome... Taste great!!! A must !!!

Had Sunday brunch here while on vacation and the food was great. Upon arriving, the hostess was a bit pretentious with a few comments she made, but overall it was a good experience. The waitress was kind but could have been more attentive to water glasses and checking in on us. (She asked how everything was near the very end of our meal.)

Service was fine but the food was a great disappointment. Ordered the shrimp etoufee but it was really pasta etoufe. 5 small shrimp and a lot of pasta. I'd expect this in New Mexico but not New Orleans. Manager said that's the order but didn't charge me. I didn't want no charge, I just wanted a good meal

Ate at the bar as I was dining solo and late night.   Loved it.  Their pate dish is probably the best I've ever had.  I also really liked the shrimp and grits, although I would probably prefer to turn the cheese level down from an 11 to an 8.   Great cocktails but a mediocre beer list.  That being said, this a great spot for a late night bite at a bar.

Another John Besh restaurant, but more casual. When we came for breakfast the oyster bar wasn't open yet. They still accommodated us and got the guy to shuck us some fresh raw oysters. Ordered a dozen and it was so good we wanted another half a dozen, but they gave us 10 and didn't charge us for the extra. That is super good service!!! Who eats raw oysters that early in the morning? I do!!!!! It's NOLA!

We also got the local crab omelet and shrimp and grits. when those dishes came out it did not look good at it. It was actually very delicious. Ingredients were fresh and everything was very flavorful. Don't judge a book by it's cover....thumbs up!

This review is specifically based on our experience during their 3-6pm happy hour. 

.75 raw oyster
1/2 price house draft

We came in a little after 5pm and this place was packed! We managed to find a seat open at the bar and one of us grabbed it. Apparently, you can only order if you are sitting so we told him to tell the bar to keep the dozens coming. There's about 5 guys total in our group and we destroyed what they kept bringing. 

The oysters itself were huge, fresh, juicy, hint of saltiness so not too briny. 

The restaurant was an upscale and we came way under dressed however, we had a great experience with the little time we were there.
Pretty good! The jalepeno grits are yummy, and pulled pork sandwich is fantastic (though heavy on the mayo)

Must stop every time I'm in NOLA between 3 and 6pm for 75 cent oysters!  I was with a group of 11 girls for a bachelorette party and I called to see if they can seat us.  Unfortunately it was game day so the restaurant was pretty packed so they couldnt :(.  We took our chances anyway and stood by the bar.  The staff was so accommodating and ended up opening up a private room for us (so long as we were out the door by a certain time since they were reserving it for another group).  It was such an awesome experience - shout out to our server Rich who kept us entertained and put up with our crazy bachelorette party shenanigans.  We were so happy with them that even though we were only in NOLA 2 nights, we made sure to stop by one more time before our flight home.  Can't wait to go back.

Stopped by for happy hour and met Shawn!  It's great to meet someone who enjoys their job and puts customers at ease.  The oysters were grrrrrrrreat at happy hour prices!  Now, One of my favorites in NOLA!  Thanks Andre for the referral!

My husband and I stumbled (literally?) upon this place when last in new orleans and were so impressed. We like to share and split a entree - we each got a full plate served to us. I'm also pretty sure they put something illegal in the pate, it was too good. The service was some of the best I've had and I'm picky about this....Can you open one in Baltimore please?!
Really loved the service and the food was really really GOOD!!! I would get the stuffed oyster shells.  Beware the soft shell blt is a beast so huge yet delish!!

Great customer service...Clarence and Otis are the friendliest :) I got a croquet madame...it even came with its own mini ketchup! Loved it...the restaurant is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for :)
Delicious! Had the shrimp and grits, croque Madame and the seafood gumbo. All amazing!!! We ate every last bite! Definitely will be coming back here on our next trip to Nola!

I really like this place a lot. We originally came here to check out the brunch menu but we arrived too early and only the breakfast menu was available. We got the sausage biscuit which was alright... I don't think it was anything special or worth the price tag. We were so disappointed with our limited options that we decided to come back to dinner the same night. We got the stuffed oysters, pâté, burger and fried oyster salad. The stuffed oysters have definitely been the best oysters I've had in NOLA thus far... Or ever. He pâté was also delicious and one of the best I've ever had. I didn't try the burger but it looked perfectly cooked. The fried oyster salad was such a let down. The fried oysters were not good. It was more batter than oyster... And overly seasoned in my opinion. The best thing about the salad was the avocado...
The service was great and food came out speedy. I would highly recommend coming here for the oysters and pâté alone!!

Nice upscale French restaurant, they served brunch which was great after a hangover. They served some unique plates with amble amount of food for the price.  They don't serve French toast though, so I gave it 4- stars because I was really craving some that morning.
Fabulous! The service was great! Super friendly staff. The bread pudding and molten chocolate cake are delicious. Gumbo was seasoned to perfection. We will definitely be back again!

Tips: 
-Come for happy hour 3-6pm
-Make a reservation beforehand so you don't have to wait
-Order a ton of oysters, even more than you think you can eat, because you will probably eat them all 
-Fried oysters are just as delicious

Good food at a price. Went here with our daughter and had great drinks.  The sazerac cocktails were excellent as were the Brussel sprouts. The shrimp etouffee and hamburger were good but not screaming great. Service was professional but not the normal NOLA friendly. Overall I would go back but there are better less expensive restaurants in NOLA with warmer service (Elizabeth's and Jacques-Imo's).
Absolutely awful customer service. Had a 2:30 reservation and was told we had to be out by 4:30 for a large party. Service was extremely slow and food was average. Don't waste your money.

Everything from the lady that sat us to the men that served us to the food and drink was excellent. Our reservation was for six but we were 15 min early. They sat us early and our waiter came over and got us oysters and happy hour drinks before it was over. It's always a great experience with the people that live in Nola. Tonight didn't disappoint. Thank you for the wonderful time Jon Besh. I have been wanting to try this place out. Glad we did! We will defiantly be back next time!

Lunch!  Out of this world gumbo soup. I had a cup along with a bacon/avocado salad with the dressing on the side. 
Terrific service, I sat at the counter. This restaurant is connected to my Hilton Hotel and very convenient.
Best Shrimp & Grits in the city!  'nuff said. Learned of this restaurant by someone on my flight to NOLA.  The Shrimp & grits is as good as it gets!

Luke was my first visit to a John Besh restaurant (though I have had the opportunity to partake in Alsatian food in Alsace).  As a guest of the Hilton, I was excited to have an attached restaurant that raised expectations beyond the traditional hotel faire.  Ultimately, my expectations were not met.

The layout of the restaurant is poorly conceived - the dining area is bisected by a hotel hallway.  This is not a showstopper in terms of layout, however the positioning of the host stand at the front leaves guests that enter from the hotel side standing mid-dining room with no pointers to the host location.  Once the host stand was identified (through a query to a passing waiter), I was seated promptly the the hostess polite and courteous.

Within a very short time, my drink order was taken and I was offered bread that was relatively fresh.  My order was taken quickly, and my starter, the matzah ball soup, was delivered quickly.

The soup was well proportioned, not skimping on either the chicken or the matzah, and not falling into the over-salting trap that so many matzah ball soups fall into.  The vegetables included were fresh and appropriately cooked - neither mushy nor crisp - overall a good start.

Unfortunately, the positives (on the food) ended there.  I ordered the ENTRECÔTE GRILLÉE ET FRITES, better known as a ribeye and fries.  There were several choices of topping, but I went with the basic MAÎTRE D'HÔTEL BUTTER - a good ribeye should stand on its own.  The waitress asked if I would like them to bring ketchup for my fries - I appreciated the polite reference to fries to avoid embarrassing individuals who request it for their steak itself (I politely declined the ketchup).

The steak is where things went south.  The initial appearance was appealing, with the traditional crosshatch flame pattern on top and bottom, and I was looking forward to it until I cut into it.  The steak itself was one of the worst cooked steaks I have ever eaten - it was oversalted (which is difficult to do with steak), and had clearly been sitting out - the butter failed to melt even over the course of my dining.  More importantly, the steak looks like a sandwich from the profile view - two large white bands of well-done meat with a center that was barely rare (purple-red and cool).  I guess that they average out to Medium Rare when taken together.  With a ribeye that is barely 3/4" in thickness, this is almost difficult to do (the only way I could see being able to make this happen would be to pre-cook the steaks to Rare, then sear them quickly after they have become cold).  The chefs would have benefited from a Thermapen.  Additionally, the meat was largely flavorless.  Ribeyes are intended to have a fairly robust and dense mouthfeel, with a hearty flavor.  This steak had a limp mouthfeel with no flavor save "salt".  

Unfortunately, the salting problem did not end with the steak.  The fries were shoestring-cut (atypical for a higher-end steak), and had way too much sea salt added.  At least the professional and attentive wait staff were kind enough to keep my drink refilled.  

Especially for the price point, I expected much higher quality.  I do not know if this is representative of all Besh restaurants, but if the kitchen staff cannot get the basics correct, I would be hesitant to order anything more complex.  I definitely recommend a pass on this one.

The atmosphere was pleasant during lunch hour. The waitress was delightful! She was very sweet and consistently kept up with our table in addition to the others. My friend ordered an old fashion, and it was the best I've ever tasted. We ordered the pâté as an appetizer and it hit the spot. I wish I would have ordered just two pâté platters. Anyway, my friend ordered the swordfish and I grabbed the local fish grilled. Will go again. Kinda pricey but you get what you pay for
Amazing. Sat at the bar and had a custom drink made for me and they cooked beignets just for me!

I had high hopes but they were dashed. 
Ordered the southern breakfast- the eggs were supposed to be over-easy but they ended up nearly cooked through. My bacon was dry dry dry. Not a hint of grease kind of dry. Brittle bacon is not my thing. 
Husband had the fried chicken biscuit sandwich which he loved. 
Server was great. Coffee was delicious. They just need a cook who knows the basics.

Stopped by for happy hour (3-6) and we were clearly underdressed but really what do you expect from a couple of tourists walking around NOLA during the hot and humid summers. We had to awkwardly hang around the bar area until some bar seats opened up but it's worth it for $0.75 oysters! At that price, you can easily just tell the bartender to just keep the oysters coming by the dozen. Most drinks are also half off. My favorite cocktail was the Door Three.

Freaking amazing food and service. I'm classy AF and well traveled, and this is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to!! Our waiter, Kenny, was fantastic!!!!! We are slightly intoxicated now because the drinks were equally as amazing. Definitely recommend! 5 starzzzzz trying to get wet *mic drop*
Great food and service- food was fast, fresh, and delicious!  Great brunch spot- you can't go wrong!

We stayed at the intercontinental during our visit and this place was a no brainer in terms of the proximity to our hotel and the reviews. We dragged our hungover asses out of bed and walked in here with hopes of eating some delicious food and a well needed dose of caffeine. We each got started with coffee, which was absolutely fantastic. I ordered the southern breakfast and requested toast instead of sausage, while my friends ordered the soft shell crab and crab omelet. I loved the food I ordered.. except everything lacked a little seasoning. Also, the bacon was completely dry. I love bacon in any shape or form, so I didn't seem to mind the lack of grease. The jalapeno grits were spectacular and so was the biscuit. My friends seemed to really enjoy their breakfast as well. The fries again, lacked seasoning which seemed odd. How does one forget to add salt to fries? We were too hungover to notice or care.. Overall, its a pretty good place if you're looking for decent French food.

Absolutely amazing service and food. 

Hors d'oeuves - crispy Brussels sprouts -  OMG next time I'm getting my own.

Friend chicken & Tabasco Honey - the biscuit and sauce at the bottom was to die for.
Amazing! I can't stress enough how good this food was.. I had the Monday special (fried chicken with red beans and rice) and lobster corn chowder. By far the best I've had

Amazing happy hour. There oysters are always so fresh. And the fried oysters are pretty good too. entree was the steak topped with jumbo lump crab ahhhh to die for. Definitely a place to keep going.  Staff is very friendly and attentive as

My favorite place of ALL the restaurants we went to on our trip (and it was a lot)! What an amazing Happy Hour here:
 $0.75 Oysters! So fresh and large sized!
Chilled Shrimp that has been amazingly marinated. 
Chilled Mussels are a must have as well
CRAB & CORN BISQUE
SEAFOOD GUMBO Á LA CREOLE

It was also Friday and we're on vacation so we splurged on the Friday Special:
COURT-BOUILLON
REDFISH, CRAB, SHRIMP, OYSTERS, LOUISIANA POPCORN RICE

Just get it all. Everything was fantastic and we walked away with the smallest bill ever.

I honestly didn't know what the hype was for New Orleans food. It's just regular food right? No. New Orleans has some serious food and Lüke was my first experience of just knowing how delicious New Orleans food can really be. 

I came here for a cocktail hour so the whole back room was for our party. It's a great place if you want to rent out because theres an open kitchen concept there. I love the idea of open kitchen because deep down I want to see a Gordon Ramsay Hells Kitchen moment of someone cursing. Although, that didn't happen the food that came our was delicious and didn't stop. All the guest were completely satisfied. When you rent out the back they have a buffet style vibe with unlimited alcohol. My friends and I definitely took advantage of this open bar idea because hey, how often are we in New Orleans? and how often is a close friend getting married? 

Anyway, we got a great selection of their menu a little bit of everything. My friends were a little wary about eating oysters since they're raw but honestly oysters are the best! And especially being in New Orleans I had to take advantage of their seafood. The rest of the food was amazing and you can't make a bad decision.

The waiters were so attentive in making sure to give us another cocktail if he saw we were low and made sure to clean up anything on the tables. So happy my friends had a cocktail party here and will definitely be coming back here. There's no other place I can compare to New Orleans!

I came here for the happy hour oysters and they are AMAZING.  i ended up coming back here a second time because I had to have it.  they are just so fresh and i probably ended up eating 100 oysters my entire trip.  i couldn't get enough!  there was never much of a wait and their happy hour is daily which i love it when restaurants have a daily happy hour!  they had some drink specials too and i fell in love with the French 75.  It's so far made it to the top of my favorite cocktails and I haven't had a favorite cocktail in over 10 years which is saying a lot.  I did have it at another restaurant but it was definitely not as good as how they made it here. I can't stop dreaming about the oysters here.

I don't mind paying for good food, but I hate places where you feel taken advantage of. Lüke was one of those places. A chef-owned restaurant that thinks charging $27 for a BLT is justifiable, and charging full price for 11oz beers is OK. In the middle of New Orleans, where good food is everywhere, you find yourself wondering why you're eating here. To add, in the middle of all this pretentiousness, the silverware was filthy and the service was awful. We were ignored for a good 15 minutes while the table next to ours was being doted on...I'd say save your money and go eat somewhere else in the French Quarter.

I want to like Luke. I want to LOVE Luke. But, every time I dine here, I am beyond disappointed. My first experience, way back when, was for happy hour, and the oysters were pretty good. 

Now that I often stay in the area when I'm in town, Luke is one of the few restaurants within walking distance with my hopes and dreams for a decent experience still dangling on a string. I'm so determined to make it work that whenever I'm in town, I usually eat here at least once hopping that it's me, but alas, it's most definitely them...

On my most recent trip, I actually stayed at the Hilton St. Charles, and on my last night in town I was looking to not have to change into real people clothes, and instead get some food to go so I could eat in my room. I got a menu at the bar, and asked a bunch of questions. The waitress didn't know a lot of the answers, but she graciously said she'd check with the kitchen. Awesome.

I wound up ordered an appetizer with shrimp and then a side of rosemary potatoes. For some reason I was really in the mood for potatoes... 

A little while after I paid, someone from the kitchen came up to the bar and said that they could not make the shrimp dish I ordered gluten free (even though the waitress said that the kitchen staff said they could). I was instead given the option to switch to a crab dish. Without a menu in front of me, the kitchen worker explained what the dish was. I agreed. Shrimp. Crab. I love both.

The kitchen guy went back, and then the waitress told me it would be a slight up charge. Ok... I wasn't all that happy with this, but I understood. I handed over my credit card, and she redid the order. 

I waited a while for the order to come out (ordered to go), and just when I was about to leave, someone from the kitchen came out and said, "You forgot your fries." I didn't order fries. Apparently, they all forgot to mention that the crab dish came with fries. While this is not a terrible thing, it is pretty obnoxious that they clearly saw that I ordered potatoes, and didn't think to mention that the dish came with fries. Couldn't they have said something so I could then cancel the potato order? Or maybe they could have eliminated the fries and not up-charged me for the changed dish? The whole thing left a bad taste in my mouth, and that was before I even tried the food! I had way too many starchy dishes (one of which was thrown away...)

The food:
-The fries were over salted and wilted, not crisp
-The potatoes were ok
-The crab was tasteless. There was no seasoning whatsoever. It's like they just through the thing in the fryer. 

They get points for convenience, a nice location downtown, and pretty interior.

Brussels sprouts and bread pudding ... Is how you stole my heart! 

Here's a few Luke tips to keep in mind before you arrive: 

1.  You need a reservation (at least on the weekends). The hostesses were not taking any walk ins. 

2.  The menu changes often, so do g come with your heart set on anything... Even their menu online is boy current. 

3. Try to get a table in the back room so you can watch the kitchen work their magic. 

What I ordered: 

1. Old fashioned: 4 stars because they use the good luxardo cherries. Beware they use Jim Beam if you don't ask for something else. 

2. Crispy Brussels sprouts with cheese and awesome sauce: 5 stars hands down best sprouts I've ever had 

3. Luke salad: 4 stars: tip you can order 1/2 sizes on the salads. Awesome house made buttermilk dressing and yummy yellow beets!

4. Squash crepes: 2 stars ... I sent it back it was not flavors I enjoyed.. Heavy sage and thanksgiving stuffing taste. 

5. Jalapeño cheesy grits: 5 stars ... Best grits ever! 

6. Pecan bread pudding: 5 stars. We were drooling over this in the window do the chef sent one out for us... It was as amazing as it looked. 

Despite sending my entree back, we had a great meal. The service and food was spot on. Thanks Luke!
Service can be spotty - Don't let them out you in the back- the whole point of a bistro  is to have a bistro experience. great Happy Hour- and French 75s
Great seafood, in a not so great location. We hit the happy hour for half priced seafood, just amazing!! Drinks were very expensive.

AMAZING SERVICE!! I wish I would've caught our server's name but he was both witty and attentive.  He gave us an extra dessert on him because I was so skeptical about the bread pudding.  Our experience there was wonderful and everything is delicious! You won't be disappointed.

After an unsatisfying dinner at a nearby spot, we came here for dessert and a few drinks at the bar. We shared the bread pudding, which was ridiculously good; even my boyfriend thought it was great and he's not a dessert person. The bread pudding was of a generous portion, warm throughout the bowl, and topped with pecans and ice cream. It wasn't too sweet either - just perfect. Along with our desserts, our drinks were pretty strong which started off our night well.

Looking around, we wished we went here for dinner instead. Not only did we see great plates being served to our dining neighbors, we saw this very large and tall tower of seafood for a couple which looked like was a first date. Kudos to the gentleman (or lady) for going big with that impressive and seemingly delicious variety of seafood.

The restaurant was nice as well as the staff, who were friendly to speak with. When we are back in town, we will definitely check out this place for dinner.
Lunch was awesome. You've got to try the soft shell crab BLT. Geeeeezzzzeeee! Had to be sent from heaven.

Can't say enough GREAT things about the food and service @ LUKE! If you are gonna be in NOLA, you have to hit this place up! And if possible, ask for Rich! He's the best server and will make sure you have everything you need!

I love Luke- have come here countless times over there years.  They also have great happy hours.  They also serve my favorite raw oysters in town.  I particularly love the atmosphere of the front room/bar- the back is fine.
Somehow I had never been here for brunch. I brough my sister & her husband who were visiting from out of town and our experience was top notch.  The service was exceptional and the food was delicious.  The fried chicken biscuit was out of this world.  The shrimp and grits were a favorite too- their grits are uniquely creamy!
I love that this place opens as early as 7am.  We wanted to entertain our family for breakfast- not a boozy brunch & this was perfect.
Thanks!

The staff are wonderful. I went for a leisurely Friday lunch and loved the roast chicken. There is a reason this place's reputation is stellar. You won't go wrong. The space is quite charming, too. I've ordered oysters here in the past and haven't been let down. If it was possible to give more than five stars, I would.

So glad I decided to check out the .75 cent happy hour Oysters!  Happy hour from 3-6 half price drinks too. 
Got there at 5:00.  Was seated immediately.  They did ask if we had reservations which we didn't.  
Ok, you guessed it, started out with 1 dozen fresh oysters.  So good.  Plump and juicy.  Chilled to perfection!  We had to do it and go for another dozen.  Just as good as the first patch.
Our waiter had a weird way about him.  Was attentive, but never made eye contact.  I felt like he wasn't listening to me or that he might not get the order right but he did! Just wish he looked at me when I ordered my drinks or meal.  Funny thing is he was singing and dancing by the bar waiting for the order, but then a standoffish attitude by the table?? A weird way about him like he didn't want to be waiting tables, but was good at it? I Saw this with other tables.  His assistant, was excellent.  True charm, & professionalism.  With that being said, the manager made her way over to make sure all was fine, and that our needs were met. 
For our entree we both ordered the Ribeye.  Cooked to perfection!  Came with your choice of sides, and we both went with seasonal vegetables.  They were grilled fresh, served in cast iron.  Incredible!  That steak was incredible! The meal was incredible!  So impressed with the food. 
I usually don't give out 4 stars unless I'm that impressed!  I was impressed by the food.  Lost points  for the noise level, and for our waiter.  A shame.  this place was so close to making my first 5 star review!  Close, but no cigar!
Was looking forward to eating here, was not easy to get a reservation. I had the hamburger, it was cooked perfectly however the flavor was lacking. Service was good.

Had the French toast (challah bread) with bacon and mascarpone.  The picture really doesn't do it justice. It's a small menu. Larger brunch on weekends. The staff is friendly. It's cold!! Really rally chilly.

Outstanding brunch menu!!! A great mix of local flare and breakfast staples. The Brussels sprouts, jalapeño grits, and the fried chicken brisket were phenomenal. Cool ambience, great service, and yummy coffee!

Came for brunch and the restaurant was empty. Realized quickly why. Menu blah and over priced, service blah, and bring a coat because it was FRIGID. Coffee was like warm and full of grinds. Maybe the reviews are from dinner??
Disappointed that 5 minutes after we entered, I was told to not laugh as loud while sitting at the bar. It's 9pm on a Sunday night and the restaurant is half full. Not a positive atmosphere.

This place was great! Good service and even better food. We got the pork chop and shrimp and grits and they were both really delicious! The pâté is insane! The place is a little pricey, but worth it. We have come here both times we have been to New Orleans and will keep coming back

Great, casual place with terrific food and service!  One of my favorite brunch spots.  The French press coffee is a notch above the rest.  The menu is not too extensive, so I always like to try something new and it never disappoints.  The French toast and breakfast sandwiches are my favorite.  Any of the lunch sandwiches and crab omelet are terrific for lunch.  I highly recommend Luke!

I needed to catch a quick lunch before a flight home, and I stumbled upon this cute place. The waiter recommended that I get the chicken biscuit meal and I was not disappointed!

It was a huge, soft and buttery biscuit with fried chicken and honey all over it. It was wonderful in every way!

Service was quick and attentive! I highly recommend this restaurant for your perusal.
Came here twice on my trip because we loved it so much the gumbo was amazing we also had 24 oysters at .75 cents each and the bread pudding is to die for

Meh. Wasn't bad, wasn't great.  From the reviews I read I was expecting to have my socks knocked off. 

I had the fried chicken honey Tabasco biscuit
+ chicken was cooked nicely
+ the sweetness was wonderful
-biscuit was dry
- the grits that were served with it were not good. They were cold and gloopy

Husband had the crab omelette. He said it was good but not great. The fries they served with the omelette were great. Best thing we ate there. Nice think and crispy. 

We did have great service though. We were just not impressed with the food.

Excellent food, service and experience!  I came in solo during their happy hour. The space is beautiful and has a vibrant energy. I tried the gumbo and shrimp and grits. Both were out of this world delicious!  I had the French 75 for my drink (1/2 price during happy hour!).  It was refreshing and had a great, not too sweet taste to it. When in NOLA, be sure to go to Luke's!

Just had the Southern Breakfast here. Meal was everything you want in breakfast. I usually don't like grits but theirs were delicious. Not grainy or mealy, and just smooth and buttery. Silky texture. Really great. 

Good portions, great flavors. Clean place. Fast polite service. Curious to come back for dinner!

The food and service here was pretty darn good.  

I made reservations at 8:30 PM and arrived at 8:10 PM -- got seated right away. I was flip flopping between all of their yummy options on their menu & I was trying to avoid the shrimp & grits since that's what I've been eating all weekend, but ell into peer pressure when the the waiter recommended it.  He insisted that it was one of the most popular things on the menu, so I couldn't resist.  And I didn't regret it!  The customer service was great, very attentive and kind people!

Really great happy hour. 3-6. Half off cocktails. $0.75 oysters. Attentive service. 

Pate, corn and crab bisque, and grits are all great. 

WHISKEY A GO GO is a must try cocktail. Trust me.

So I am going to come clean here up front.  I love this place.  I love the food, the casual atmosphere and the staff is professional and welcoming.  
They are adjacent to my hotel every time I come to NOLA so I am here at least once per visit.  
I wanted to step outside my comfort zone and try something else today for a late lunch but when I sat at the bar, ordered a glass of wine and was given the menu- I didnt see what I wanted ( I had seen it on the lunch menu).  I wanted oysters, as in welcome to NOLA - oysters.  They would not serve them at the bar so I drank my wine and left. 
Here I am back at LUKE for my third meal this week.  And I got those oysters. 
I also got a warm welcome, great beer and hello - happy hour!  Thank you John Besh for doing what you do.  #superstar #kingofnola

Went to Lukes lastnight for a home cooked meal and this is not the place for that. No sweet tea, lemonade, sweet potato pie, jambalaya, or anything fried. Come here for an elegant, sit down dinner. The menu consisted of about 6 entrees, extremely limited.
Went for the  happy hour oysters. SO GOOD! Will go back for all my future NOLA visits

I was caught off guard by the casual/formal atmosphere of Luke. The food was absolutely top drawer, but it felt as though John Besh couldn't decide what type of restaurant he wants Luke to be. The waiters wear white jackets, the tables have white linens covered with butcher paper....the music is loud 70's and 80's pop. Can you say Adam Ant? The waitstaff was almost overly friendly, singing along with some of the songs!  The food was amazing.... delicious from the crab/corn bisque to the final bite of bread pudding.  It just felt a little like the old movie Sybil.....how many personalities can you have?
The bread pudding and shrimp and grits were amazing!! The male waiters look like models nice,.professional atmosphere.
Excellent shrimp and grits.  The best crab omelet I've ever had!!!  Awesome service...can't wait to go back there again!

I decided to go here with my mom & sister after seeing the reviews & pictures. Our experience here was wonderful and the food was just what I needed. Started with the Brussels sprouts & crab/corn soup, then ended with the bread pudding. Great service by our waiter Desmond... Just ask for they guy with most pens. We will be back, thank you.
Great happy hour, oysters and employees who do a great job.  Seafood bisque was addictive.
Excellent shrimp and grits.  The best crab omelet I've ever had!!!  Awesome service...can't wait to go back there again!

Excellent meal.  Went on a Saturday night 5:30 dinner, four adults, two kids and an infant. We were sat promptly, near the front - not a problem.  
Kids and wife  had matzah ball soup, was excellent.  This from a New York Jew.  Seafood gumbo was very good as well, though milder than I expected.  Kids loved their mac and cheese and the grilled geese was perfectly cooked. 

The adults had the chicken liver and rabbit liver pate, swordfish, the Luke salad, and the roasted chicken.  All were excellent. The pate is a huge, gout inducing portion. It was amazing.  Chicken was  perfectly moist, seasoned, with crispy skin. Potatoes underneath were some of the best home fries I've had in a while - salty, crisp, and a complement. Luke salad was the only so so pet of the meal, it was bland and overdressed.  

Wine was the 52 dollar Bordeaux on the menu - excellent at its price range. 
We spilt the steamed chocolate pudding for dessert.  The chicory gave it a wonderful mocha flavor. It was fantastic and a great end to the meal. 

The meal delivered, all for 200.   We will defiantly come back.
While the service was good, the shrimp and grits were just ok. This is an upscale restaraunt, if you want good shrimp in grits, I would suggest you go elsewhere

Ate here while working a convention. Really great place. John Besh really knows what he is doing. Of course, I had to try the local stuff even though I also travel to Lafayette. The Gumbo was really good with a nice dark, nutty roux with generous helpings of meat. The main dish was a very pork centered one with cracklin on top. Very filling and tasty. Also found out that Chef Besh is opening a restaurant in the Houston area, which has all of us there jumping for joy.

Savannah took great care of us with the help of Patrick.
Order whatever she suggests. Savannah is a pro.
We suggest the shellfish platter, crab appetizer, étouffée, soft shell crab sandwich, shrimp and grits, steamed chocolate and the seasonal pumpkin cake! The three of us had a lovely meal that I know I'll go back for when in NoLa. My only neutral thought is the gumbo wasn't exciting.

Luke's is definitely a solid place to eat. The atmosphere is great. The place was not too overwhelming. Somewhat upscale, but pretty laid back. 7 of us dined in for brunch, we were seated in the back of the dining area. Our server, was extremely accommodating and made sure we were happy throughout our meal (I forgot his name). We all know it's not easy taking care of a large party, but happily enough we all left stuffed and satisfied. 

The Brussels sprouts are a must. They're crispy, semi sweet, and topped off with feta cheese (so delicious). I had the burger, which is ginormous. (shareable). The burger and fries were ON POINT! 

Overall I would definitely recommend this place. Whenever I return to NOLA, I am for sure checking out their Happy Hour specials. Those oysters are calling my name!!

The setting and the servers are really nice. We really enjoyed our soups as starters although they were tiny. But the beet salad I had was soggy with dressing and they put the cheese on the bottom of the bowl on purpose (because it was so strange I asked). I didn't realize that when we paid $13 for crab meat it was going to be lathered in cream. My boyfriend found a long dark hair in his food halfway through his burger. The manager came over and apologized, still left the burger on the table as if he was still going to eat it. She proceeded to bring out a free dessert that we neither asked for, nor really wanted. When the bill came they had very graciously taken off the $7 coffee cup sized, little bowl of soup. Would never go back. It was ludicrously overpriced.
I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!  They make their own mustard and a pate that comes in a mason jar. Like the bar and staff is great. Has a fresh feel. Yummy.

Have dined here three time. Very big fan of John Besch. We were seated in the rear dining room. Service was personable, professional and relaxed. Food was, well, AWESOME. This is one of my favorite places in NOLA. Be sure and come for Happy Hour. Excellent Sazerac's and French 75's!

Ok came back for another meal and it was just as amazing as our first a year ago!Our waitress Deseree  was perfection, as was every dish! Had the French 75 cocktail and it was incredible. So happy to get back to NOLA & have another exceptional dining experience at Luke! May come back for Brunch on Sunday!!

Came here first for breakfast and had their yummy grits and shrimp dish, which had 2 fried eggs on TOP. Loved it but couldn't finish it it was so huge. Came back for dinner and had delicious steamed mussels. They were not the largest mussels I've had, but I loved the sauce and they accommodated my request for extra garlic, yum! The service was excellent. We were seated in the back room near the kitchen which I would recommend as it is a tad quieter.  The only disappointing item I ordered was an old fashion cocktail, wasn't very good, but wouldn't stop me from coming back for the food.

The restaurant is located right outside the French Quarter in the CBD. We haven't been disappointed with any of the food we've eaten in New Orleans and Luke is one of the best meals I've had... ever. 

The food came out ridiculously fast.... literally 5-7 minutes after we ordered, which is amazing since the restaurant was pretty much full. The service was impeccable and very on point and was a joint effort during our entire meal. Everyone seemed to be more than willing to help and we didn't feel like we had to specifically look for our server. I love places like that. 

We ordered some raw oysters which were of course very fresh. The gumbo was also an excellent choice. After reviewing the pictures and reviews, we had to order the Brussels sprouts and we're so glad we did. Definitely the best Brussels sprout dish ever! I was tempted to order another serving to take home.  The shrimp and grits was also very tasty although the extra $12 for the truffle mushrooms wasn't really worth the price since we didn't really taste it. Otherwise, the shrimp and the grits themselves was absolutely delicious. 

Overall a very pleasant dining experience that I would definitely recommend to everyone. I'd say it's a must-eat if you're visiting NOLA.
Unreal - great atmosphere, drinks and food. The pate was among the best I've had in the US - rabbit and chicken liver. Truly fantastic meal.
So. Good. If you love seafood try this place! The raw oysters were meaty and delicious. Everything I tried here was good.

The Hors d'oeuvres are on the larger side, and phenomenally delicious!! I had the Flammenkuchen and my husband had the Brussels sprouts, and we were quite full; But not too full to avoid dessert, that was just as fabulous!  Great service, Melanie was a delight. Highly recommend this place!!

Came here for a quick lunch while spending a weekend in New Orleans. It was Thursday afternoon and quite busy but we were able to get seated quickly and the service was great. We ordered the etouffee & shrimp "en cocotte". Both were outstanding. Will be coming back for brunch or dinner next time I visit.

Second day in NOLA.  Lunch at Lukes.  I'm a little bias going into this review.  Big John Besh fan.  I have many of his books and use them often.  

We started with a dozen chilled Gulf Shrimp.  Awesome!  I also ordered a half dozen stuffed oysters.  Should have ordered a full dozen.  These were delicious!

I'm a Croque Madame aficionado.  I first fell in love with this sandwich when I went to Bouchon at the Venetian in Las Vegas.  When I saw it on the menu at Luke I knew I had to have one.  Sadly, I found it to be very heavy and doughy.  I ate all the ham which was good.  Sorry John but Thomas wins this round.

The Washington Parish Roasted Chicken was the best dish at the table.  I managed to snag a bite!  My GF the Queen of Reseda got the Crab & Corn Bisque.  I tried some, very good!  She also got the Tabasco Honey Fried Chicken, red beans & rice.  She didn't love it.  Said the chicken was dry.

I would go back in a heartbeat and try other dishes and most definitely get more of those tasty stuffed oysters and Gulf Shrimp!

Happy Hour 3-5
 .75 cent RAW Oysters
1/2 of Cocktails, Draft Beers, & Wines by the glass
Fried Oysters (6 or 12pc) *i forgot the price

You have not lived until you tried the Monday lunch special (tabasco honey chicken w/ red beans & rice). It comes with your choice of a soup or Luke salad (bibb lettuce, celery root, carrots, beets, & buttermilk dressing) for 17$. The chicken breast is fried to a tender crisp, the meat still juicy and succulent. The red beans and rice, cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly, drool worthy!

The chicken & rabbit pate (11$) is a table pleaser too!

Definitely make a reservation on OpenTable so you don't have to stand around waiting! I am always able to score one for the time I need.

Luke was 4 for 4 last night. We ordered a cup of matzo ball soup, a cup of gumbo, the crispy brussel sprouts, and a mixed drink with gin, prosecco, lemon, and lavender. The brussel sprouts were quite possibly the best sprouts I've ever tasted. I will be telling my friends that come to New Orleans to stop at Luke, if for no other reason than to taste this dish. They had small apple slices, really really thin slivers of jalapeno, honey, cheese....every bite had a different amazing flavor explosion across the spicy, sweet, crunchy, savory spectrum. 

I also can't say enough great things about the soups, as they had the exact right amount of spices. I wish I hadn't had such a heavy lunch so I could have tried more of the menu. While the menu is a tad closer to $$$ than $$, the flavors in the food more than justify the prices. You can't go wrong!

Update: THESE BRUSSEL SPROUTS THOUGH! These aren't your mothers sprouts (sorry Mom!) Come here and have your veggies!

Came here specifically to get the Le Grand Plateau de Fruits de Mer--- an amazing seafood tower with it came 1 whole Maine lobster, 16 oysters, 16 shrimp, 16 mussels, 10 clams, crab (with the king crab legs!) and ceviche. On top of that, we were there for the $.75 oysters during the happy hour from 3-6----- did I mention half off draft beers, glasses of wine and cocktails? We ended up ordering another 2 dozen oysters to go with our tower. 

Service here was outstanding- we had two servers who helped each other out, and were great. This place has the look and feel of a fine dining establishment without being pretentious--- perfect since you'll be in the middle of eating with your hands are you're cracking crab legs.

I didn't think it would be possible to be sick of seafood, but us three girls couldn't finish that massive tower and had to leave 5 shrimp behind. Not too shabby though considering the size of that thing! I would definitely recommend this place--- especially if you're in the Midwest and have few choices for decent seafood.

This is a good restaurant for french food & those who like seafood. 

Be forewarned, if you go to this place wanting items off the breakfast menu, they only serve breakfast Mon-Fri - not on the weekends. 

The service was great, the atmosphere was welcoming & the restaurant itself was clean.

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants for happy hour. The drinks and appetizers are so good that it's hard to even save room for a main course. The French 75 (cognac, champagne and lemon juice) is fantastic!! And during HH it's half off! The fried oysters are $1.25 each and the sauce that comes with it will set it off perfectly. The crispy brussel sprouts as well as the crab and corn bisque are delicious as well. One thing that I love about Lüke is that the service is spectacular. There are always 2 people on each table so you'll never be lacking attention. HH is from 3-6pm and surprisingly never TOO crowded during the week (especially before 5pm).

Centrally located right inside the Hilton - Luke's seems like a good idea. Its bustling, all the wait staff is nicely dressed and polite - but the food here is very average. 

Oysters had no flavor

Croque Madame - bread was stale, cheese was pungent and the ham taste like processed ham.

Don't get fooled by the crowd - the food is meager at best

On my last day in New Orleans I decided to try this place. It is more of a upscale joint with a lot of business people come for lunch. I want to start out by saying the bartender, I forgot her name, was the beat service I have ever received. She knew all the ingredients of the dishes, what paired well, was very attentive, and all around great. I cannot stress that enough. We had a couple drinks to start out with. The cognac drink was very smooth and I'm not even a cognac drinker. 

We started off with a couple appetizers including the fries quail and the rabbit liver dish. The fries quail was cooked perfectly with a light crispy breeding which wasn't over seasoned or over prepared. It came with a couple sliced peppers I believe which added just the right zest. The rabbit liver dish was very busy. The liver spread was served in a small mason jar. The dish had various spreads such as marmalade, gritty mustard, apple spread. It was served with thin pieces of bread which could be used to put all the spreads on. If you are not fond of liver you probably won't like it. 

For an entree I had the sausage and shrimp dish with grits and Cajun spice. I forgot the exact name of the dish but they split it between me and my gf  on two separate cast iron skillets. 

The food was phenomenal and the service was even better. If I'm back in the area, I will be stopping in.

I wish Yelp had half a star, because this should be 3.5 stars. I might be punishing this place just for not living up to my expectations, but I was underwhelmed. The brussel sprouts were the stand-out (so much so that we requested the recipe). But an appetizer should never be the most memorable part of a meal in my opinion. Honestly the brussel sprouts almost earned that 4th star from me, but I just can't seem to make myself do it. Why not? Well, we had a seafood tower (the medium sized) and the crab was over cooked (really???). A few of the mussels seemed over cooked to me as well but I might be nit-picking. They should get those things right every time. In any event, maybe try the brussel sprouts and a salad.
Delicious Fantastic happy hour drinks option even better dinners. I had the shrimp n grits and they were awesome the bread pudding was great probably don't need it A la mode.
Best meal ever!!!  We had shrimp appetizers- fresh crisp shrimp.  Fried quail legs - with honey and sliced peppers sauce!!!! And shrimp remoulade on cheesy grits.

Whenever I am in New Orleans this is one of my go to spots for Happy Hour.  $.75 cent oysters, (was .50 cents 4 years ago).  Beer is half off as well, $3 bucks.  Very nice interior and the staff is always friendly and helpful.  I will keep going back.

We had breakfast at this restaurant today. I have to say that I found it to be a pretentious and unwelcoming. I got the southern breakfast. This included two eggs, three sausage links, biscuit, and grits for $15. The grits had a firm, congealed consistency. The links were good. The eggs were forgettable. The biscuit was cool and hard around the edges. My wife had the spicy frittata. This was pretty spicy but it was tasty. Overall, I found this place expensive and forgettable. The server, refilled our coffee once and never refilled our glasses of water. Once the food came out, she lost interest in our table. I doubt that we will return.

3 WORDS. 

RABIT LIVER PATE.  GET IT.

Last night of NOLA, was brought here for happy hour, I believe it's 4-6pm.

Oysters - $.75 each, had some beers wine, DAT PATE, and some more the bill was less than $65 for 4 people. 

Great busy joint bit upscale but happy hour is good deal the pate so damn amazing, I ordered another one for TOGO brought it back to San Francisco with me and it was still good!

Here's what you need to know: oysters from the Gulf are nothing like the oysters you're used to getting from the East or West Coasts. They don't have the same complexity, the same salinity. They're still good, but they're especially good deep fried in the batter that Lüke uses for their fried oysters. Head that way for happy hour and see what I mean.

I can't say enough positive things about this restaurant! The food is outstanding. I have dined here three times and will return anytime I come back to NOLA. The baked oysters and grits are a must. But the best park of my experience was the staff, Rich Whatley took care of us and made the entire night incredible! Thank you Rich.

Luke's is always a joy.  Brought a couple of out of town guests in for dinner last Friday.  These guys are world traveled and always know the best places everywhere.  Growing up here, they had not eaten shrimp and grits.  Indulge me, I insisted.  Wellll, it was a home run.  From salad to desert, no complaints.  Hats off to the wait staff. My compliments to the chef.

Great restaurant. Right across the street from our hotel. Fantastic happy hour. 75 cents raw oysters that were very fresh and clean. The liver pate is to die for. Best food in town. 

Happy hour starts at 3 here, then go across the street for more happy hour( more oysters and other great appetizers). Finish off the happy hour hopping down the street till 8 at the Marriot. Then you will be all set for dinner back here.

HH 3-6 75cent oysters, half off drinks. 

I loved Luke's when I was visiting NOLA. Came with a group of 8 and they were extremely accommodating. No wait at 4 pm! Who can beat 75 cent oysters?! Given there are places who sell em for 50cents a piece, but are they as good?? Maybe next trip. These raw oysters were definitely better than Acme. 

Anyway, the pate was one of best pates I've ever had. I prefer to eat it with the table bread rather than the crispy bread given with it. The fried oysters were sooo mouth watering. It was perfectly crispy and evenly battered. The quail was delicious as well! The bread pudding was okay imo. Maybe I was too full to indulge.

I'm happy I got to stop by 3 of John Besh's restaurants while visiting.

Lüke. One of the first restaurants in NOLA I chose to call my fave 4 years ago. 

This thought still holds true today. 

It's my fave because so many dishes have been my go-to since the beginning. Eggs in a jar...go-to, shrimp and grits...go-to, pain perdu....still shouting from the rooftops. 

It's also my fave because of this reason, always changing and bringing the best to the table. Softshell crab BLT, croque monsieur, and beignets oh my! 

I can't leave out the bevs... French pressed Joe and a French 75 to start your adventure in New Orleans. 

Did I mention they have a spectacular looking bar? Go see for yourself.
Fourth time at Luke. Wonderful oysters on half shell! I had shrimp and grits and it was sensational....well seasoned. Great noisy atmosphere. Wonderful wait staff.
Delicious breakfast. Inside was a little chilly, but the atmosphere is comfortable and the food surely will make you full!

The shrimp and grits were amazing and the BEST I ever had in my life! I get this dish often when I dine out and hands down it's the BEST! Also, try it with the crab meat, which enhanced the dish and made it so much better!

I am really disappointed that I missed the oyster happy hour. But we did stop in for Brunch which was very good.  I had the shrimp and grits. They were really cheesy and rich. I tried the French 75 after reading reviews on Yelp - it was good, but nothing to write home about. We also had oysters which were excellent.
If you are going to New Orleans then this is the place for oysters!! From 3-6pm they have $0.75 raw oysters and $1.25 fried. This is a must eat place and when I'm back in town!
happy hour oysters, half off drinks- can't wait to go back.

Stopped in for happy hour before the Pels game, half price drinks and $.75 oysters. Grabbed half a dozen and a whiskey-a-go-go. Massive cockles in an upscale atmosphere, yet the bill only comes to $11. Sign me up anytime.

We decided to have dinner here tonight due to convenience. Boy were we surprised! I had the Luke bacon burger and fries. Best burger I have ever had! The hubby had shrimp and grits, it was delicious! So creamy and cheesy! Our lil girl had chicken tenders with fries. Best dinner ever! Definitely recommend this place

If I could give this restaurant 10 stars I totally would...we ordered the most amazing Brussels appetizer, which came out in a fun cast iron skillet. It was like an explosion of flavors I would have never put together! The Brussels were coated in almost a Thai honey and chili sauce lightly and then topped with almond slivers, jalapeño and green apple straws! Amazing! I had chicken with a fried potato, which when rated together tasted like I was having friend chicken and mashed potatoes...amazing! We aren't from New Orleans but when we asked for recommended restaurants to try on our vacation many friend recommended Luke, and now I know why! Go!
Luke is great for happy hour and dessert. For dinner there are other restaurants in the quarter that are better that have a similar cuisine and price.

I have added a star to the review for the restaurant reaching out to ask about my experience.  Any restaurant that is looking to improve its customer experience deserves a second look - the next time I am in New Orleans I will do so.

The service and meal were superb! The shrimp and grits fall in the top three I've had in life. The sauce was sauce and paired perfectly with the creamy white grits. I'm sure I'll dream about devouring this dish until I can get back to New Orleans. The bread pudding was a decadent ending to a great brunch. I wish I could have bought a bag of those candied pecans. The vanilla bean ice cream gave the dish a perfect balance of sweet, creamy, moist goodness.

Fancy and upscale interior with great seafood, located in the CBD.

Luke bacon burger with fries was the best burger on the menu with what it was topped with, in my opinion. Shrimp and grits was delicious, as it was cheesy and creamy to the extreme. As a seafood critic, I am glad to have dined in here.

Chef here is wonderful bringing the elegance out of this restaurant. Decor is beautiful and service is just as spicy.
Great flavors, solid service, only a few things lacking on the execution (a little bit of clumping in my grits, brussels sprouts a little too spicy for a breakfast dish).

Great restaurant!  Just ate here for breakfast this morning after having eaten here the other night for dinner (which was our first night in New Orleans).  For dinner the other night, the service was excellent.  For breakfast this morning, somehow it was even better.  I'll start with this morning's breakfast.

Our server, Jackson, was completely on top of his game.  I cannot say enough how much I appreciated not only the excellent service he provided us, but I could tell from observing him with other tables that he is an outstanding server, because I noticed other people trying to order items not really on the menu, and in each case he was extremely accommodating.  You don't always find that attitude and approach in restaurants these days.  But Jackson just offered to "make it happen," as he put it himself.  That's awesome in and of itself.  In our case, we did go just a bit outside the menu but nothing too outlandish - my wife ordered scrambled eggs, hash browns, plain and simple, and that combination just didn't happen to be on the menu but Jackson was happy to oblige.

For me, the fried chicken on a biscuit with tabasco honey was terrific!  Man, that tabasco honey was great!  And so was the fried chicken, moist, and tasty.  And the biscuit itself was great, too.  And those GRITS, they are also great. Do not touch them.  Don't add butter, pepper, or salt.  Just eat them as is because they have plenty of flavor.

An outstanding breakfast at Luke.  Nice ambiance too.  And I haven't even gotten to dinner.  I must say service was excellent for dinner, and I had shrimp and grits, which was very good, but for the star of the dinner show was the happy hour oysters and shrimp.  SO fresh and delicious and you can't beat the happy hour prices.  Plus those French 75s are delicious and also on the happy hour menu!  Like is a FINE restaurant!

Went to Luke's for breakfast while on vacation in NOLA....it was INCREDIBLE! The menu was NOLA thru and thru! There was 4 of us and we all ordered different things and picked at all the plates.... everything was delicious although the hands down favorite from the group was the fried chicken biscuit and the jalapeño cheddar grits!

Very underwhelming. In their defense, of all meals, we had breakfast there. But honestly, this was my least favorite meal of the whole week (vacation). The Pain Perdue was dry and one-note in flavor. The additional bacon we ordered on the side was way over cooked. Coffee, orange juice, and 2 meals cost us $50. Not impressed.

Friday, 6:00 PM.

Quickie:
+ Food quality
++ Service
- Hygiene
+ Product knowledge
+ Menu variety

And then...?
Friendly staff offering good recommendations. Shrimp n' grits gets a thumbs up! 

**********
Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
*Compost

Luke's is fabulous! It was on our 'must visit again' list of restaurants from our last trip.  Our server, "Richie Rich", made the evening an experience!!  Amazing service, excellent suggestions , tasty food, wine pairings, etc.  (Can you tell we loved it?!) 

Visiting four months later we were thrilled and charmed to be at the same table and Rich is our server. All the food is amazing; you won't be disappointed-and ask to be seated with Rich and his team!

I love this place!  I try to go every time I visit NOLA. The shrimp and grits are close to the best in the city!  The drinks are always unique and top notch! 
The raw oysters are also fantastic.

Terrible dinner experience. Firstly, it took about 10 minutes for the server to arrive at our table. By that time, it was 6:03, and so happy hour prices were no longer available. Seriously. 
Drinks - GROSS. I ordered a French 75 and it came full of froth and terribly sweet. Obviously the champagne used was flat, or had been open for too long, which should have been obvious to the server and bartender based on the inch of froth in the glass. I was grossed out, but willing to overlook it initially.  
Next, they made a huge stink about us moving our drink orders from a small bar table to a dinner table once our entire party arrived. I have done this many times, in many restaurants, and never had such a huge deal made about it! In the meantime, a woman came by multiple times to remind us that this was a "VIP area" and we shouldn't take up room standing at different ends of the table and talking to each other (we had a large party to celebrate a birthday). 
The food was alright. Overpriced and unexceptional, but good, I guess. Nothing to write home about. 
When we divided up our check (we had a large party), it took 15 minutes for our server to return. When she did, she pointed out we had a discrepancy with our check - oops, sorry, here's how to fix it. Another 15 minutes, and she had run our cards. Half an hour to charge 6 cards? It was beyond awkward, and totally unnecessary. The woman there to apparently remind us how to behave had time to drop by during this time, just to ask us "how was everything," and yet our server couldn't be bothered to run the check for 30 minutes. 
In a city of exceptional food, please don't overpay here for decor and location, when service and quality is so severely lacking. 
Will NOT return, would not recommend!

Great happy hour on raw oysters (.75$) from 3-6 everyday! Specialty drinks on happy hour as well 1/2 off!

Had an amazing bread pudding for dessert too.  Can't wait to come back and try their Brussel sprouts

Cool ambiance and amazing food. All of the employees were very friendly to us from the moment we walked in until we left. We were an hour early for our reservation, so the hostess asked if we wanted to wait (drink) or even dine at the bar. We opted to dine at the bar. 

Appetizers:  We shared a dozen raw P&J (gulf) oysters that were shucked right in front of us.  They were on the small side (according to the shucker) so the he gave us four additional oysters from the next batch he shucked. (He ended up giving us a free sample of ceviche later, too). 

Drinks:  I had a specialty cocktail (I don't remember the name) that was citrusy, refreshing, and came garnished with a sprig of thyme. Wifey had Lüke's Amber beer and enjoyed it. 

Entrees: The "Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp En Cocotte" was the best shrimp and grits that I've ever had. It was spicy, savory, creamy, and very filling. Wifey had "Moules Et Frites" which had so many delicious mussels that we couldn't finish them all. We requested bread to soak up the yummy cream sauce and received an entire (small) Fresh baguette at no extra charge. 

Conclusion:  Do yourself a favor and eat here when staying in New Orleans. We will be back!

Exceptional service, accommodating staff and delicious food. I ordered the goat cheese / beet salad and the honey tobasco chicken with red beans and rice. This is served as a Monday lunch special for $17 (the price includes a soup OR salad and entrée). Because I'm visiting from out of town, I missed the lunch slot and came here for a late dinner instead. The restaurant staff were nice enough to make the requested meal for me with the ingredients they had on hand. I have dined in many restaurants and have never experienced such friendly and attentive service - throughout the dinner, 4 staff members were tending to our table. Since I am pregnant and not drinking alcohol, the bartender created a fresh strawberry lemonade - ish drink, this tasted amazing and I reccomend you order it if lemonade is up your alley. Overall, a great experience at Luke.

La la loved Lüke's. Can't beat $0.75 raw oysters daily from 3-6pm. They were so good we ordered 5 dozen of them. Hands down one of my fav dishes of all time is the Louisiana rabbit and chicken liver pâté. You must order it if you dine in. The bread pudding was nice and warm and a great way to end a meal. Make a reservation and go!

If you haven't been to Luke's or heard of Luke's then kill yourself. This place is a must when in New Orleans. For the best dinning experience order the following,

- raw oysters (75 cent during happy hour)
- char boiled oysters
- Brussel sprouts
- cup of gumbo 
- shrimp and grits ( split it for two and add crab meat on top)
- bread pudding (ask for ice cream on the side) 

Don't for get to follow these steps and do not skip the dessert portion. Best bread pudding in town. Hands and toes down.

Oysters are fantastic!!!! We always come here when in NOLA! Kevin and Rich were fantastic, friendly and efficient! Great suggestions for food and drinks! We also were welcomed nicely at reception and even the owner greeted us warmly! We will always be back when in NOLA!!

Of course, another fantastic dinner of shrimp & grits, followed by a mousse-like dense steamed chocolate dessert. Great service provided by Melanie (& Chi)!  If Richie Rich is your waiter, ask to move tables.
Best matzo ball and chicken soup then amazing local fish meunière. Why don't I live here? I'd be in every week.
Food was ok but not the same for service, it took forever for me to be seated despite the fact that there were several empty tables available.

The staff was able to accommodate us as we arrived into Nola pretty early. We came around noon and was able to be seated right away. 
Our waiter was attentive, kind, and educated us on the menu.
We started with the Brussel sprouts. Delicious!!! 
I had the fried oyster salad. A great balance of freshness and not to over powering with the oysters. Fried to perfection. Crispy!
Husband had the Luke Burger and he enjoyed it.  We will definitely be returning!
