Luke is great. Its john besh...you cant really go wrong there. The burger is great, oyster happy hour is a must and the French 75 is a fantastic drink.

Great place to celebrate Thanksgiving in New Orleans.

We were there on vacation and wanted a casual place and good food.

Luke's was perfect.

We had no reservation and got there about noon and the place was packed.   Great hostess staff and we had a fabulous server.  The receipt says Timothy.

For Thanksgiving we ordered the Turducken with sweet potatoes and cajun stuffing.   All excellent, we also had an order of the Brussels Sprouts salad (my Thanksgiving choice).  Absolutely delicious.    The bill included one beer and totaled $52.05.   Way better than cooking at home!

We were here for Luke's happy hour for oysters and beer, but also to check out one of Chef John Besh's many New Orleans Restaurants, who we were told we just missed by minutes! No worries, I had the pleasure of meeting a few years ago at a seafood festival, but it would have been nice! We sat at the oyster shucking station, and was totally entertained by 'shuckin Shawn' who had a vibrant friendly and happy personality, along with Johnny in the same area, and Savannah, our server, always smiling. The oysters were wonderful, and served beautifully, on white napkins, on ice, and in addition to cocktail sauce and the sinus clearing horseradish, a red wine vinegar concoction that was terrific. We also got a taste of the 'Bama Beauty' oysters, which were smaller, but nice and briny. Luke's label beer on draft was great. You will not be disappointed!

Great place, the service was amazing!! Were our first time in the city and the hosts gave us a famous drink of New Orleans called French 75 ( DELICIOUS!!).
For dinner we ordered the GULF SHRIMP (great great great!!), definitely the best one, with creole tomatoes, garlic and homemade pasta! And after the Moules and frites! If you are mussels fan is great, the sauce is awesome!

Came for breakfast and had the shrimp and grits which were good. The portion is a bit small for the price but it's a tasty dish. The other dishes at the table were bland (gumbo and the burger). The burger looked amazing but the meat had absolutely no flavor so that was disappointing. 

That same night I had a taste for bread pudding and heard that Luke was the place to go. It's probably the most beautiful bread pudding I've ever seen lol. And the flavors are unmatched! Omg so good, one of the best bread puddings I've had. You have to try it!

I came here for dinner. The service was okay, she hardly came around to our table. 

Beet salads (3/5) - The dressing was delicious with the pecan caramel. However, they need to chop those veggies smaller because when I eat the sauce would get all over my face. 
Fried oyster salad (3/5) - The best part is the fried oysters
Flammenkuchen (1/5) - Cheesy, salty and sweet....I did not like it at all
Cream brulee (4/5)

Overall, it was an okay restaurant. I heard their lunch/brunch menu is much better so I would come back to try their brunch.
Great hh oysters.   Definitely some of the best in town.  We went at 3pm and service was quick and friendly.  We will be back for more

Came here for brunch on Christmas Eve. Food is great, served in a big portion as well. I suppose the cuisine is creole. The menu is in French. We ordered three dishes to the table, for any of which I couldn't pronounce the name. But the food tasted very fresh and flavorful. Each dish had a hint of kick in it but not too spicy. The andouille sausages, the grits, the biscuit, the bacon and the cheese all were very satisfying. Definitely a place I like to go back to. Not a five star simply because there are so many great eats in New Orleans.

When I first called to get reservations the young lady told me there was no room for reservations until 1030. We decided to walk just to check it out and when we got here they had an empty table for 4. 


We looked at the menu and we were not excited with the menu. I was excited to try some of the previously posted item but to my demise they were not available. We did try some of the appetizers and drinks. 

I had the Bee in your Bonnet: not bad and would recommend it. Also had the Brussel sprouts and the au gratin which was good but not orgasmic. 

Overall, it can be skipped.

Babyyyyyyyyyy! Their shrimp and grits is EVERYTHING. I don't eat pork so they were able to accommodate my dietary needs. Unfortunately the first plate that was present s to me had sausage. I pointed it out to the server and he apologized. My next batch was great! The grits were well seasoned and I had plenty of shrimp. This restaurant is owned by Chef John Nesh so I expected nothing less than the best. Also try the Bloody Mary's! My BFF had the crab omelet with a side of grits! Heaven!!! I swear I heard angels singing as I took a bit of hers. And when the vinaigrette touched the perfectly made omelet, they made a beautiful melody that made my heart smile.

I'm currently sitting in a blazing hot dining room experiencing my second bad experience at a Besh Restaurant Group this week and we haven't even ordered.  I've been told "no" to very simple requests since I walked in that would accommodate my family better.  Not "we can try" just flat out "no."  We should have gone to Cochon. - Continuation after the meal...this really was a disappointment!  Lüke has been a favorite of ours for years, but the extreme lack of quality in attention to detail in the dining room and plating, the reduction in the Franco-Alsatian menu items, the so-so products used, and much more marks a new low for my former favorite brassiere.  We won't be back and to be perfectly honest we most likely won't dine at another John Besh restaurant.  Maybe this celebrity chef is spread too thin to check-in on his restaurants.  A sad day for this fan and frequent diner.

Fantastic fresh seafood, incredible (and unique) drinks and great service ! We went here on our last day in New Orleans in October 2016 and it was the favourite meal of our 5-day stay in NOLA for all 6 of us.

We love Lüke, but shocked they took the veal Jäger schnitzel, spaetzle and other items off their menu, so they are not really considered "German" anymore.  It's a real shame too, since Lüke was the last restaurant in New Orleans that served it now that "Jäger Haus" (only other German Restaurant in the city) has closed.

Had dinner here with my wife. We had the seafood gumbo and the bisque. For the mains I had the mussels in white wine sauce which came with steak frites style fries. Both were wonderful. My wife had the jumbo shrimp with grits which was also fantastic. Topped off the meal with a nice bottle of pinot noir. We would eat here again when we come back to town.

The food was very authentic to the chef. Their fries were hand made and were very good. The pasta noodles were also handmade. Got their croquette madame and the shrimp pasta. I would def recommend getting the croquette madame because the flavors of everything together was so good. Although, it is a heavy meal. The pasta was very good and worth it because the shrimps in the pasta were big and fat with lots of meat!
招牌沙拉就是生菜叶拌咸味沙拉酱，星期四特供的炒饭就是剩饭炒饭，绿洋葱香肠的味道实在不敢恭维，法式面包夹火腿奶酪腻到塞牙，整体也冷冰冰的，薯条和家里做的味道差不多。唯一觉得还可以的就是马芬，虽然上面漂了两片猪油糟，略微诡异。

Went for the happy hour deal and we stuffed our faces with raw and fried oysters. The bartender was really nice and attentive and we  enjoyed our time, we came in here to kill time while it was pouring down raining and it was a great spot to hang out for a few.

We had an amazing Christmas dinner here. The staff was attentive, warm and welcoming, and the food was delicious.  Our dinner was actually during the infamous happy hour, which they also continued on Christmas day. This happy hour does not disappoint - their oysters and fried oysters (that sauce!) were delicious, and half-off all drinks on the menu! We were there for about 3.5 hours, and at no point felt rushed during our dinner.  I had the Christmas menu and my husband had the gumbo and the shrimp and grits - think his dishes were a bit better.  Definitely save room for dessert - the bread pudding is sublime.

Sorry, Lüke - this place just did not meet expectations.

It's a white tablecloth kind of place, with waiters dressed in crisp shirts and black vests and ties. The items on the menu are a little pricey, so I decided to go with the Tabasco and honey fried chicken biscuit, a smaller dish, with a side of grits.

Though the biscuit and chicken were good, I wasn't wowed. The food was lukewarm, which made the grits kind of hard to swallow. 

Don't get me wrong - I think it's good food, but compared to everything else in the area, it's just not /as/ good.

Great brunch! The shrimp and grits are excellent although I have had better in Savannah. The grits in their own were quite tasty. The chicken and biscuits with tabasco syrup was ridiculously good.  The fried chicken was light and soft with lots of flavour. Service was also great.

I ate here at 3:30 pm. At 7pm I started getting soo sick. I didn't have anything else to eat or drink. I called manager saying i think i got sick at your establishment. She basically told me i didnt get sick from them. Its new years and im at my hotel puking my guts out. Its my first time in new orleans and im just sitting in my hotel puking and feeling awful. I spent like 70$ there and it ruined my vacation. I explained all this to the manager and she said they werent the reason im sick.

Was really close to 5 stars, but in New Orleans, every little detail counts. 

The drum was amazing. Wouldn't change a thing. The roasted beet salad was too big -- it would have made a fine entree salad. It was delicious though. 

I had a glass of Pinot Grigio and it wasn't as cold as it could have been. The service was really slow, but really friendly. It was also NYE. Great place.
Great place to visit. The food was excellent. We didn't have reservations but got a table within 5 mins.

Go here to eat.  Now.  We were going to to Ruby Slipper - 90 min wait - no thank you - walked right into Luke and into heaven.   Gumbo rich and dark - full of shrimp and oysters, the Etoufee with the handmade cavatelli was in a sauce that was silk - pasta soaking it up.  Attentive service.
Outstanding meal in a lively, upbeat atmosphere. We really enjoyed it and will be back.

Had breakfast here today. Service is very unattentive and we had to call the waiter multiple times for coffee refil and he also overcharged our check. I had the duck omelete, which was greasy and the waiter also misplaced my toast side order for french fries. For a 30 dollar breakfast I expected much more, would not go back.

Come for the happy hour and please get the fried oysters! I started with 1/2 dozen of fried and 1/2 dozen of raw oysters, and I kept ordering for more until I lost count (which I partially blame on the happy hour drinks). 

I'm not sure if I'll ever have the same awesome oyster experience ever again outside of NOLA, which kind of makes me sad, but definitely glad to know where to return next time I visit NOLA again! 

The waiter was phenomenal. He walked me, an oyster noob, thru each and every step and made me feel cared for from the moment I sat down until I left the restaurant. There was not one moment my glass (water as well as alcohol) was empty :)

According to me, a perfect meal always ends with creme brûlée, and so it was. When I visit this place again next time I want the night to go exactly as it did all over again. This place makes me look forward to visit NOLA again, whenever that is!
Good food here and don't forget to look up and check out their kewl fan system!!!

Luke is a great place no matter the time  of day. Food is excellent and happy hour is the best in NOLA. Staff is friendly, kind and very helpful with any questions you may have.
Shay the bartender is the best. And you have to sit at the bar down by the oyster shucking. Shucker Sean is awesome. He likes to be called Kenny Stills.
Thanks guys see you soon.

Another great John Besh establishment. This place made my trip to NOLA. Had a cup of jam packed seafood gumbo and simple boiled and chilled jumbo gulf shrimp. So simple but so delicious. My girlfriend had a cup of matzo ball chicken soup that was delicious and a sweet potato agnolotti that was her favorite dish in NOLA thus far. Great place with knowledgeable wait staff. They even knew of a place we could get cheesecake since that what we were craving for dessert and they didn't offer it on their dessert menu! 5 stars!

Very nice restaurant with great decor. The bar had a very intricate wood design, very pretty. 
The food was amazing!!! Props to chef John Besh. We had a seafood gumbo and crab bisque as starters and both were amazing!!! (Specially the seafood gumbo, there's none like it elsewhere). For main course, I had a Gulf Shrimp Ettouffée, which was delicious. MSO had some kind steak, which now escapes my memory, but according to him was heavenly. Waiter was very friendly and staff was extra attentive. Can't wait to come back next time around in NOLA!

Rabbit and chicken liver pate is really amazing. It'd be the reason I'd come back. Nice environment and good selection on the menu. You start off with a warm bread that is crunchy on the hot side and soft on the inside - real delicious. Shrimp and grits a little too much flavor.

Bread that they serve before the meal is warm and excellent. I ordered the Court-Bouillon that came with a soup so I chose gumbo because it was my first time trying it. I was disappointed by the portion because it was a tiny cup that was priced at $7.50 normally. The Court-Bouillon was good and J was able to try some local staples all in one dish including the region's popcorn rice and some fresh seafood. I also ordered the Lüke burger medium well which was cooked perfectly good but not outstanding in any way but did come with some pretty well seasoned fries. Lastly, I ordered the fried quail that had a really good balance of sweet and savory because it had a honey sauce but had a gaminess to it with the quail. The peppers were also a good garnish because they were also in the honey sauce but the whole dish was well balanced and of course the quail was cooked well and crispy. Waiters were friendly and I was pretty satisfied with my experience but the portion sizes were a bit smaller for the price which is on the upper side of $$(yelp price point).
Went here during their Happy Hours (3-6pm) for the Oysters and drinks. Please make reservation. Fresh oysters and good wine.

I came to this place twice during my stay. One day was with my girls. We came in without reservations and begged the hostess for a table. She told us we had to go to the bar because they were booked for the night. We did, and then were told if we could eat quickly. So we sat down and ordered about 4 dozen fried oysters and a dozen and a half raw oysters alongside 2 French 75's. We made it in time for happy hour so we decided to splurge. And yes i ordered 2 at once. If i didnt have plans to go somewhere else i would have ordered more. The oysters were all spot on. Fried to perfection and displayed in a cute frying basket. We toasted and were able to finish in 45 minutes. The next day I returned for lunch. I ordered the seafood tower, le plateau de fruits de mer, with crispy brussel sprouts and stuffed p&j oysters.  The tower came with king crab legs, stone crab legs, oysters, mussels, clams, crab ceviche, and shrimp. The presentation was so beautiful.  I wasn't the biggest fan of the ceviche or the shrimp. Everything else was great. Mussels and clams were prepared with garlic, and the shrimp seasoned with Old Bay. All eaten with a glass of wine and another French 75. The brussel sprouts were good. They had an asian flare to it, sweet and salty with a crisp. The p&j oysters were very garlicky and buttery, baked with crab meat. Melanie, our waitress was great. She sat with us to explain the menu. She was extremely knowledgeable and witty and made a few food and wine recommendations. Would I return back? You have a fan if I'm in NOLA.
Definitely order the brussel sprouts!!! The crab dip was also amazing! Did not love the Flammenkuchen, it was ok. Great service.

Was here on New Years Day in the afternoon and swear I spotted a couple of actresses, though I am hard pressed to find their names. The coffee was delicious, good Bloody Mary's and the service was on point. Get the P&J oysters, you won't be disappointed. I followed it up with the burger. It was good, not outstanding. I could not finish it. My date got the Eggs in Purgatory and those were rich and decadent. She had the jalapeño grits and they were absolutely amazing. We couldn't stop eating them. Forgo the French fries for the grits, you can thank me later.

I thought I had died and gone to food heaven, but no I was just in New Orleans, kind of the same thing. One of my favorite dishes is Shrimp and Grits so I asked my friend who was born and raised in New Orleans for a recommendation on where I could find this. Without hesitation she mentioned Luke. 

I snatched one of the last Open Table lunch reservations and was on a mission to try, arguably the best shrimp and grits in the city. I took a seat at the bar and got fantastic service. Both bartenders were extremely attentive and helpful. I started with their fresh bread and also a cup of the seafood gumbo. Then, I had one of the best main courses I've had in a while!! WOW! Shrimp and grits may never be the same again. The grits were jalapeno cheese so already the plate was off to a tasty and slightly spicy start, then it was topped with huge, fresh shrimp and sausage. The sauce was plentiful and just spicy enough. I highly recommend this dish and don't know if I could order anything else here.

Luke is located in the Hilton hotel on St. Charles Avenue. The service and food is worth the cost, which is reasonable considering that Luke is a hotel restaurant. If you are heading to New Orleans try to get a reservation at Luke on Open Table!!

What an amazing place! Lovely happy hour..must go in New Orleans for oysters (large and great quality)! Great atmosphere, wonderful food, but most of all, INCREDIBLE SERVICE! Richy Rich was fun, attentive and majestically entertaining! All without knowing it was for a friend's 40th birthday. Thank you Luke! Would recommend to anyone visiting NOLA!
The gumbo, people - it is to die for!  We also tried the crab omelette - delicious.  They also have a cadillac of a coffee maker - so good.

This is one of the best restaurants I had ever been to. Good service. The brussels sprouts were amazing, everyone should order them! Good drink selection, good main meal. Liked it so much we went back for breakfast on our week long trip another day. Must eat here if you are visiting New Orleans!
Great staff and great food. Took care of my dietary needs with expertise and great taste. Thanks

Went there for lunch during our 'Sugar Bowl' trip to New Orleans.  I have the PEI mussels and fries.  Mussels were small but they gave me so many I got over that.  Husband had the burger (gigantic - have an appetite).  A great last-minute decision.

Seriously THE BEST happy hour I've ever been to! Service was amazing (shoutout to Desmond and Chi they're awesome!), food was delicious, and drinks were strong. Wasn't too crowded when my boyfriend and I came at 5pm on a weekday evening, but it filled up pretty quickly soon after! You can make a reservation online through their website.

Here's all you need to know about HH. It runs from 3-6pm. PJ raw oysters are 75 cents a piece... comes with cocktail sauce, horseradish, and saltines. The oysters are HUGE and so yummy (we got 3 dozen haha)!! You really get the bang for your buck.

Fried oysters are $1.25 each -- they cost a bit more but it is definitely worth it, trust me! Eat them right away so they don't get cold and soggy!

There's a small menu with 6 cocktails listed -- these options are half off during HH... so that's $5.50 or less per drink. They are well crafted with pretty high liquor content I'd say. The bartender really hooked it up that night!

door#three - A vodka cocktail with pomegranate, mint, and lime. This and the Amor de Fresa were the sweeter options on the menu. They're like mojitos with vodka instead of rum.

Silver Saint - Tequila with cucumber, lime, serrano pepper, and soda. Very dry, but I'd highly recommend this for tequila lovers. This was probably the strongest cocktail of the night.

French 75 - Cognac with lemon and champagne. This was a very interesting drink, and apparently the best one around town is at Luke!! Flavors meshed very well together, very smooth.

Rosemary's Bourbon - Old Forester with rosemary and lemon. The rosemary flavor really stuck out surprisingly, I really liked this one! I guess it was muddled pretty well because flavors like this don't usually stand out when paired with darker liquors in my experience.

We were visiting from out of town, but will definitely be back to Luke next time we're in NOLA! Seriously the quickest, best service I've had anywhere, and the freshest raw oysters I've ever had. Probably my favorite HH spot as well :)

I had the pleasure of experiencing Luke's for a small business dinner. The food was outstanding. I highly recommend the P&J oysters and Shrimp and grits. The King cake was fabulous. Our server, Rich Whatley made our dinner a memorable experience. He was quick, witty and fun.

My expectations were quite high as the place was listed in the " must visit" in NOLA.  Maybe I caught them on a bad night. The atmosphere was nice enough. The wait staff friendly but so-so. We were a party of 4. We ordered cocktail, the appetizers. The appetizers came out before the cocktails, which I thought was odd. I ordered the same drink, several times. Each time it came, it looked different from the last. They have a dish on the menu with Marcona almonds. They almonds were not Marcona almonds. Ok, yeah, big deal. But the point is, the menu says one thing, they deliver another.  Not what top tier joints do. Shrimp and grits was very good. Other meals were ok, not stellar.  I think NOLA has many better choices. Limited selection in bar.

My SO, friend and I tried this place around 5:45pm Saturday night. Upon entering, the hostess asked if we had a reservation, which we did not but the front room looked pretty vacant so we figured it'd be no problem. They proceeded to take us to the furthest back area of the restaurant where the cooks are (you can see them because they work in a window enclosed space) and seated us right by the windows to their kitchen area. 

Our servers were prompt and friendly, it was still happy hour so we ordered a door#three, a rye drink and a beer. We were brought waters pretty quickly, my SO's had something in his and they quickly replaced his water upon informing the waiter. The happy hour prices are reasonable, half off the normal price which for cocktails was $11 but not sure how much the beer was. For appetizers I ordered the Bibb lettuce salad, my SO ordered the gumbo, and they bring bread and butter out immediately. Everything was good out of the appetizers and bread, we ate every bit of it 

For the entree I ordered the chicken dish with rosemary potatoes and my SO had the fried oysters, my friend had the shrimp and grits. Everything was very delicious and cooked perfectly. 

During our meal we noticed that one of the chefs put his finger in his mouth and then proceeded to handle foods with his bare hands. We thought we should probably tell someone, so we asked our waiter for the manager and a male manager came over. We informed him of what we had seen and he said okay, not seeming too concerned. He promptly walked off to go tell someone in the kitchen, "that table over there says he put his finger in his mouth, I don't know how accurate that is but that's what they said." Mind you, we are witnessing all of this due to the glass, and the manager is facing us and the kitchen when he says this. I went up to said manager and inform him we just saw everything he said and that's incredibly disrespectful. We had no reason to lie about it, as we already had our meals and had eaten. I was simply concerned for whose dish that was being handled. Our waiter quickly apologizes profusely and I point out that he did nothing wrong and it's not he who should be apologizing, but the manager - to which the manager stands there and says nothing. Our waiter went to go get DeDe the head manager and she came over, addressed our concerns with poise and was extremely kind. We would come back again because of how well she handled the situation.

We dined at Luke for Christmas dinner 2016.  This is a busy, hectic restaurant and does not bode well for a relaxing atmosphere.  In addition, the layout is a long galley so the servers are carefully navigating the space to not bump into each other or customers.  The lighting was bright, not what we were expecting.  We spoke with the manager that night, a woman named Tea who was really great and you could tell that she was the glue keeping the operation together.  Food was good, but I wasn't blown away.  It's tough to stand out in a city with so many great options.

Lüke, I don't understand your very superfluous umlaut usage, but that didn't matter the moment we sat down and were greeted by our amazing server, Jackson, for a holiday morning breakfast. 

The coffee is fresh French-press style and perfectly strong, accompanied by chilled fresh cream. The jam and butter to pair with the fluffy biscuits are also housemade. The music is chill, the napkins are cloth, the silver ware substantial. Everything here feels so rich and fulfilling, with wonderful service and even better food. 

Jackson recommended, hands-down, the shrimp and grits. Served in a cast iron skillet, the dark gravy is piqued with just the right amount of spice, and about six ginormous wild gulf shrimp swim among andouille sausage. The jalapeño cheese grits cling to every bit of the gravy, while the two eggs over easy on top cap everything off sunnily and heavenly. 

The Southern Breakfast is another fantastic choice if you want to sample many wares - perfectly cheesy grits, a fluffy biscuit, cane syrup sausage, oh - and order a side of the skillet potatoes - red potatoes sautéed in garlic with caramel ones onions and bacon lardons. Oh yeah! That's how you do it. 

Lüke has earned every bit of their healthy Yelp rating and strong reputation - it's not often you encounter a place with almost 4,000 reviews and a legit 4-plus star rating. A must visit in the downtown central business district of New Orleans!

Went here for brunch and it was really excellent. My partner had the waffles and they were amazing -- especially the cream/marmalade topping for them. I had the fried chicken biscuit which was also wonderful. The chicken has an amazing honey glaze with a subtle kick that really makes it so good. The only drawback was that our waitress was not the best. But hard to dwell on that when the food is so amazing.

My wife and I were traveling from California and had any John Besh restaurant recommended to try while in the area. Well let me say, we were not disappointed by the experience with the half off happy hour drinks and $0.75 oysters. The meal was great and especially the side of brussel sprouts were the best I have had in my life. Shout out to the server Elliott, who made the entire evening perfect!
Have dined here twice on my NOLA business trip. Both dishes were exceptional. Service and atmosphere are first class.

I came here just wanting to try 2 things, the Crawfish Bisque and the Shrimp and Grits.

I got there on Saturday during the brunch hour, and they didn't have the Crawfish bisque, so I went with the Crab & pumpkin bisque instead.

The bisque was very creamy and thick, and the portion was just enough for you to enjoy it before getting tired of the creaminess. I wish the bisque had more crab flavors, and more crabs in it though.

Moving on to the shrimp and grits, it was pretty good. Good sized shrimp. Decent amount of sausages. Cheese grits were creamy. Poached eggs w perfect runny yolk. A little salty though. But when i poked the egg yolk to have it with the grits, the flavor was perfect. 

I was pretty full after this "brunch," and the price came out to be $40 before tips, so it was quite pricey as well. The male server was super nice though, waving me off when I was leaving the restaurant.

Great oyster half shells.  
Went there for lunch had the Thursday special lunch. 
Jambalaya was ok just a bit too much of pork for my taste
Ordered a dozen oyster half shells and waited for awhile 
It turned out my server forgot to order and left. 
The server who had us after my first server left was quite nice. 
We had to order a half dozen cause we had to head out to the airport. 
Food were nice and the oysters were great.  
Wanted to try more but couldn't. 
By far the worst service i have experienced in New Orleans.  I was disappointed
But i will give it a try again next time i come.  
Hopefully, i will have better experience

Review is based on Happy Hour Deals only!!!

Located right next to the Hilton on St. Charles. Dropped by for happy hour (3 PM-6 PM every day) on a Monday night. We arrived around 5:45 PM and were seated right away, the restaurant wasn't busy.

Happy Hour deals are raw oysters are 75 cents each, fried oysters are $1.25 cents each, and half off drinks! We got a dozen of the raw oysters, a dozen of the fried oysters, and two cocktails.

Oysters were mixed between big and small, but all fresh nonetheless. Fried oysters were a hit, especially the sauce, but I still prefer the raw over them. The restaurant is nice, great atmosphere, and plenty of indoor lighting.

4 stars because I would say there are better happy hour deals out there (Samuel's Blind Pelican), but still a great experience overall. Would come back here if I wanted to feel fancy!
Have dined here twice on my NOLA business trip. Both dishes were exceptional. Service and atmosphere are first class.

Somehow we were able to get a late night reservation here at 9:45 pm.  We came earlier in hopes to sit at the bar, but there was no room so we went across the street to another bar.  Later, we find out there is another bar in the back!  Oh well - next time. 

But anyway, great oysters!  The gumbo and burgers were good but not anything to crave about.  

Great wine selection too.  I'd recommend the Russian River Pinot Noir!  

I did deduct a star for the service though.  It took a good hour for our food to arrive...

Decided to try this place out for dinner on a Thursday night. We didn't have reservations and were a party of two. Only had to wait about 20 minutes before we were seated. The hostess who sat us was sweet and had a lot of energy. The food was very tasty, we ordered the shrimp and grits along with the rib eye. Definitely recommend ordering the shrimp and grits! The service overall was excellent, attentive and quick.
Rich!!! Fabulous dipping sauce for the beignets. Delicious, savory breakfast grits. They serve heavy cream for your coffee! Would definitely return!
OUTSTANDING customer service and DELICIOUS food. Brussels sprouts, crab and pumpkin bisque, shrimp étouffée and bread pudding were all out of this world. Have to fit this into your vacation!

Everything was delicious. Amazing service - Rich was our server for the night- very friendly and entertaining guy. For appetizers we got the Brussels sprouts and the flammenkuchen. The Brussel sprouts were incredibly flavorful - highly recommend. For main, the shrimp and grits was amazing. Rich brought us a free sundae dessert after which was delicious too. Best dinner in Nola!

Delicious! ! Took the waiter's recommendation and had the fried oysters and the shrimp and grits. By far the best I've had.
Service was excellent and quick. Price was a bit above average at $40 for my dinner, but well worth it. Definately want to go back again.

The food and service and atmosphere here blew us away. We had Matzo balls in Chicken Soup, Buttermilk fried Quail and Seafood Gumbo for our appetisers all of which were cooked and balanced to perfection. Our mains were the Lüke burger, Covey rise farm Duck breast & Prince Edward Island Mussels, again great portions and delicious.  Tim our waiter was prompt, courteous and very helpful and  the music as a good mix if blues, jazz and modern songs. Could not fault anything, highly recommend!!

Love the atmosphere! The wait staff are very attentive. I always go for the oysters, but you do have to be careful and possibly count your oysters. One time I was missing a dozen oysters.

I absolutely love the duck pate! for $11, that's a steal!

Our visit here was the highlight of our Nola trip. Loved everything about it from the feel to the food. Went for happy hour and shared three dozen raw oysters (fifty cents  each) and half-off, fully delightful French 75s, a classic champagne cocktail. Then stayed for a dinner of shrimp and grits, one of the best versions I've ever had (say yes to the added crab option!) and a German flatbread with cheese, caramelized onions and big bacon lardons. This place is like John Besh himself (or what I imagine him to be:))--big, handsome and tasty.

Amazing place! The food was out of this world fantastic. We knew what to expect there because of the great photos and reviews here on yelp. But the best part of our meal here was the servers and the service. We had a late lunch with my husband, mother in law and my LO 11 months old baby girl. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. Thank you!

Awesome place... great food & even better service 
The food was fabulous... Try the shrimp!

For me, some Besh restaurants have been hit or miss. This one however was one of the best. It is located inside a hotel so be sure to look for the banner out front with the name as the hotel facade is under construction. I opted for the Luke breakfast that came with house made andouille, a biscuit, eggs, and jalapeno cheese grits.  All were delicious. My crawfish bisque was great as well. Brunch cocktails included a French 75 and the coffee was French pressed. My server and  meal was perfect after a late night at Tipitina's.

Shrimp and grits were good. I know there must be more reason this place has so many great reviews and I plan on returning for confirmation. The staff though were incredible from the hostess to Patrick the waiter.
Best shrimp and grits!  The bread pudding is also a must try, I couldn't stop eating it.

Party of ten, seated within 10 min on a Tuesday evening. EVERYONE was happy. From my Rosemary Bourbon to my squash 'ravioli' it was sublime. My tablemates who got the traditional NO food were tickled as well.  BROCCOLI APP WAS OUT OF THIS WORLD...who says that? All 10 of us.  Go. Enjoy.

I visited Luke with 4 of my colleagues on Monday 01/30/17 upon the recommendation of another friend who resides in New Orleans.  I was able to make a reservation.  Diamond was very helpful with the reservation.  When we arrived, we were seated very promptly. Tristan and Vocy were awesome.  They meet our every need with great professionalism.  Vocy recommended the Shrimp & Grits and they did not disappoint.  It was an awesome dish. I also had a cup of gumbo which was perfect.  3 of my party had steaks and were very complimentary.  Another had the drum which he said was delicious.  The bread pudding was devilishly good.   Service was excellent.  I will return.  Thank you for the enjoyable evening.

This was one of the first places that I wanted to try out, when I planned my trip to NOLA. Went to this place for brunch, and upon on arrival i was super excited to try out their chargrilled oysters. sadly, only their chargrilled oyster is offered at certain times. My girlfriend and I ordered the shrimp & grits, eggs in purgatory, and the p&j oyster(raw). The shrimp & grits was very flavorful and one of my favorite. Eggs in purgatory was okay, kind of reminded of shakshouka. But the OYSTERS was one of the best oysters I have ever had. Must try Luke when you're in NOLA. #JohnnyApproves

Went for happy hour and this was a solid find within walking distance of most commercial business district hotels. I'm a fan of John Besh since he was a loyal supporter of NOLA after the Katrina disaster so I enjoy trying his places whenever I can. I have never been disappointed and this was no exception. Since I was alone, I scored a great seat at the bar right in front of the guy shucking oysters. As others have described, fresh gulf oysters were 75 cents each and fried oysters were $1.25 while there were also drink specials going on. My cocktails were 50% off which I thought was a steal. I made friends with the shucker and got an education about the local bivalves. I appreciated his passion for his job and he was so proud of some of the local oysters that he shucked a few freebies from areas I asked about just so I could try them. I felt like I was a very welcome customer and his most important client while sitting there. I didn't get his name but tipped him well and I hope the restaurant knows that he represents them very well. I got out of there stuffed on oysters and bourbon for not a wallet-breaking amount. While you might be able to find oysters for cheaper elsewhere, it is hard for me to not love this place based on the experience I had.
Loved it.  Happy hour offers delicious 75 cent oysters.   Service was great.  Beer half price.

So attempted to go into Luke's to try the famous bread pudding. However, I say we have a table of 8. Without even looking at the host board, I was told that they didn't have a table for 8.  I look around and there are a good amount of open tables. Then the other hostess says well we can find something. I then say I will pass. It was like they just didn't want to help.  A man comes in ask for a table of 1. They acted as if they just didn't want to help.  They ten take him to the bar even though he clearly states he wanted a table. The manager just said she was surprised to hear that.  It was like she didn't believe.  I am sure the food is probably good here. However, with the lack of service at the hostess stand. I imagine the restaurant could be as inconsistent. The decor was nice in the restaurant.

Lüke is one of many restaurants that I wanted to try during my visit to the Cresent City.  One restaurant that I really wanted to try was closed on Monday so I gave this one a shot.  I ordered a Rosemary Bourbon to drink and a Crawfish Etoufee with pasta.  The pasta was similar to mac & cheese pasta instead of the noodle type but was good and filling despite the portion being a bit small.  I also received a complimentary bread pudding with ice cream on top since I was there around my birthday.  The servers were attentive and did a great job making sure I had an excellent experience. Lüke is located on St Charles right next to the iconic St Charles line Streetcar.  There is parking on the street and around the corner.  This restaurant is very pleasing inside and out.  A great place to take a date or to have a fancy meal while being surrounded by the overall unique character of The Big Easy.

From the lack luster service to the horrifically under cooked burger, Luke was almost a complete and total disappointment. The only reason they are getting a second star is because of the fact that once the burger came back out, it was properly cooked and delicious. Every time we asked the waiter for something, we felt like we were putting him out. I am not saying that I was entitled to a certain speed of service, or even a certain level of excitement, I just don't like feeling like I am asking you to sweep my driveway when I need a refill on my iced tea. The soups and salads were seriously underwhelming and I am relatively sure the eggs had what resembled a live embryo in the yolk. Awful service, awful food and I will NOT be back, ever. There are many other, better choices all over New Orleans. Do not waste your time coming here, yelposphere.

It was delicious!!! Shrimp and Grits = YUMMY!! Super ass delicious potatoes with roasted chicken. And the happy ending? Warm Bread pudding topped with vanilla ice cream with caramelized pecans. OMG. I can't wait to come back!! When you are in the business district make sure to stop by, to eat or for a happy hour!

This place was ok, it definitely didn't blow my mind. Well, the brussel sprout appetizer did blow my mind because it was fantastic. The entree, though, did not blow my mind. I went simple and got the burger, it wasn't cooked quite the way I ordered it. Additionally, I had removed a tomato slice from my burger because it wasn't quite ripe and I'm not a lover of tomatoes all the time. A waiter walked over and informed me that I could have asked for the burger without the tomato...uh, duh? I have been to restaurants before. I just wasn't hugely impressed. Our waiter was great, though, and super helpful.

Our Waiter was Tristan who was so patient & helpful in answering all our questions & service was tops!!  This Restaurant will be a NEVER MISS when we visit New Orleans.  The Décor was warm & inviting.  The Food was AMAZING. There were 4 of us, 2 couples. We each ate something different & every bite was savored!!  And Prices were very reasonable.
If you want great Oysters this place is a must-do. The restaurant ambiance is Ok and the service is good
Great happy hr deal. The oysters were very fresh. The atmosphere was classy yet down to earth. Drinks were great as well. A definite must do when you're in NILA.
Excellent! I was blown away by the Brussels sprouts appetizer. I was even able to get the recipe!!! So good!!
Such a great time every time but for the best time have Kevin and Elliott be your servers.

I don't want to sound like a broken record, but damn, you can not MISS EATING HERE if you are in New Orleans. We went back for dinner 2 days after our first time there. First time 4 of us, second time we took the rest of the family...so there were 8 of us!! We couldn't get enough!!  We had Tristan & Elliott as our awesome servers! We have made Tristan family!! Food choices are amazing & never a disappointment!!  (also, all the staff is wonderful..So pleasant & helpful & it is Genuine!! Thanks also to Hostess Belin!)

The guy (John Besh) is really into 3's which is good news because the Food, Service and Scene is a triple hit. Attached to a Hilton the classy wood and tile feel gives it a old school feel. Server was good although a bit unaware at times. Not a show stopper.
Schnitzel BLT was over the top in portion size and taste. Sweet and salty come together on the plate in an unconventional pile on. Think deconstruction. accompanied by a sweet topper that is just enough to thing SWEETNESS... Seafood gumbo was filled with fresh fish goodies and had a great roux.
Luke breakfast was also killer with Jalapeño grits (flavor, not heat) and a i suspect a house made sausage that was for real....German influence in NOLA was a real treat and like the address and theme; WORKS-WORKS-WORKS....gospel according to Luke:-)

Overall food is 4 stars and service is 5.

P & j oysters were awesome. Must have.

Luke burger was fine but nothing great. 

Waiters are all very friendly and attentive.
Nice and clean but oysters are ok... the fried oysters are better. Happy hour was ok... not worth for me imho

This is one of John Besh's more "casual" restaurants, so there's no formal dress code. I've come here many, many times over the years during their happy hour. I've eaten at plenty of other oyster happy hours but Luke's really does have the best raw oysters in town. It's every day (even Saturdays & Sundays!) from 3-6 PM. It's .75/oyster now I believe. Their oysters are always well-cleaned, fresh, with just the right amount of brine and REALLY good. I can easily finish off a couple dozen on my own with room for more. I've never had a gritty oyster from here before which I've had at other places and hate. Ask for the red vinegar sauce to go with the oysters! Their select cocktails are also half off during the happy hour.

Aside from the oysters, I've tried a few other dishes here and my other favorite is the Luke burger. It's served atop a cutting board with crispy shoestring fries in a metal pail. If you tell the server you're sharing it, they'll even split the portions for you which is super nice of them. I love the super cute condiments they bring out with the burger. I had a very rude server once a few years back but aside from that one incident, service is usually really good and consistent. I must make a return visit soon!

One of the best brunches in New Orleans! The pancakes are the BEST I've ever had...they are served with a cinnamon butter topping. The chicken biscuit is awesome with the Tabasco honey sauce...the jalapeño cheese grits are a must have!!! The burger was good but nothing special...This place is now a must do when I'm in Nola!

I'm definitely a fan of their Happy Hour specials. I love the 50% off cocktails. The French 75 is a must! YUM! Their raw oyster happy hour price of .75/each is fantastic. I think you have to order them in sixes. I got 12 for a meal. The oysters come with horseradish, cocktail sauce and saltines on the side. Give me a bib and I'm ready to eat! One of my companions ordered a steak and frites. He did not share the steak and I don't blame him. It looked delicious! I snuck a taste of the frites and it was the bomb. They do have wine and beers on sale too during the happy hour that runs until 6pm. We called ahead and got a table reservation. You are able to get happy hour at the dining tables too (not just at the bar). If I'm in Nola again, I will be back to Lukes!

You ruined my late valentines dinner with my wife. Not only was the service staff as unprofessional as could be, the kitchen staff completely dropped the ball. They could not cook a medium rare steak on the first or second attempt, then to have the balls to try and send me a free dessert to make up for the shortcoming was ridiculous. How about you just cook the steak right? Our server talking to us as if we were his friends and showing zero professionalism was another glaring issue, our table had a view into the kitchen and never once did I see the so called chef or any member of the kitchen taste anything they sent out. If this place is supposed to be a better option then the joints on Bourbon street, well the New Orleans you guys are fucked.

Doubt I can say anything new. You don't get this many great reviews unless you're nailing it.
Gumbo was perfect. Oysters were great, though they are a little pricey here. Probably the best brussel sprouts I've even had, and the bread pudding was so good.
The staff was very busy, but friendly once you got them to slow down for a second.
Shrimp and grits was delicious!  Wonderful selection of local beers.  Good times and great eats!

My first time at a John Besh restaurant and it did not disappoint!  The crawfish bisque was recommended over the gumbo and I can see why! It was rich, delicious and very smooth, though I am sure the gumbo is amazing!  The crawfish ettoufe was my entrée and it exceeded my expectations.  It is spicer then most but very delicious. The service was excellent from start to finish! I can't wait to go back or try other restaurants of his.
Excellent meal recommended by Audubon Cottages, fun atmosphere and great flavor! I am a huge John Besh fan and it did not disappoint, head there for a great experience!

Stayed in the Hilton St Charles. As the mardi gras parades had the streets blocked, we opted not to venture out and ordered to go here. Food was good, service at the bar was fine. The staff was friendly.  The restaurant was fairly busy (Saturday night), but not too loud. The guy next to me had mussels that looked awesome.  Maybe next time.

We made it here for happy hour around 4:30 and were seated within 10 minutes. I ordered a dozen raw and they were very good and nice size. At $6 a dozen it's just wrong lol. The Brussels sprouts skillet is Incredible! The shrimp and grits are freakin awesome and worth the price! Half price draft beer and wine to go with our meals! Even the kids meals were big portions and good! Service was as good as it gets!

I got the shrimp n grits and although it was very good, I could only eat one shrimp because of the gumbo and beignets I had an hour prior. I assumed since I had only eaten one bite and explained to the waiter it was delicious but I had eaten right before, he would box it up. As I sat there for long enough I realized he wasn't going to bring it. The waiter apologized and said he'd make me another full order for the inconvenience. Unfortunately when I came home, I found that he had not given me a full order but only 3 shrimp (out of a total of 5 that come with a full meal). Very disappointing.
Had a good experience at John Besh's restaurant. Make sure to make reservations. I ordered the mussels and gumbo and was pretty satisfied.
Best chargrilled oysters I tried and I tried 3 dif. Places. Not Acme. You have to ask for them. Good atmosphere.
Brussel sprouts are the bomb. Happy hour is from 3-6. Their raw oysters are always so fresh. Some of their courses, like the etouffee, could be a bit salty. The grits are pretty decent.

This seems like a fancy and upscale restaurant inside of the Sheraton, but the ambiance is casual yet elegant. 

We came for the 75 cent oyster happy hour before our flight back home and the seafood was very delicious and reasonably priced. The oysters were quite huge! Larger than I would like but I ate all half dozen anyway. I wish they had some vinaigrette instead of just cocktail sauce for the oysters.

The Gulf shrimp were good, but a bit of a pain to peel, but they were definitely fresh and flavorful.

Cocktails are definitely a steal during happy hour! We didn't order the French 75 but apparently that is their signature drink. I opted for the strawberry-themed one. That had the right amount of sweet and sour.

Service was also helpful and friendly!

Great ambiance. Food is good. Came here for breakfast in the early morning and got the southern breakfast. It was good but nothing over the top. The biscuits were the best part. Service was excellent.
Excellent service, but the food was really really overrated. Was expecting much more. Everything was really fried and not overly refined. Service was very good though!

LOVE THIS PLACE. Every dish here is delectable and unique! My ultimate favorites are:

1) Raw Oysters - Great Gulf oysters! They're nice and plump, soft and meaty. A must get!
2) Crispy Brussels Sprouts (Toasted almonds, Espelette honey, Progress Milk Barn cheese) - So flavorful! I've never had brussels sprouts like these. The almonds, honey and cheese really compliment one another. Sort of reminds me of a salad!
3) Crawfish Bisque - So creamy and rich! Lots of chunky crawfish! Another must get!
4) Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" (Roasted jalapeno cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage) - The cheese grits are fantastic! Shrimp tasted fresh!

Such wonderful customer service, everyone that helped us was so friendly and accommodating. We were a large group of girls too, so you can only imagine! The ambiance is very lively and fun. Would love to come back!
Saturday and Sunday Brunch Menu . . . Did not include Etouffee.  Did include gumbo.  Mission Yum accomplished!  Note, no Lunch Menu was available during this time.
You won't go wrong here.  Creative shellfish.  Fresh.  Its John Besh.  Location away from hustle and bustle

Great food and amazing service. 

We made a quick reservation a few hours before the Bacchus parade and they lived up to their reputation even during the mass chaos of Mardi Gras. 

Once we got there Elliott was top notch with his flair, pride, and panache in his service. Wine, lobster, and their shrimp and grits were all amazing. 

Sadly we had to leave in a rush once we realize the Bacchus parade was only four blocks south of us and we needed to get on the other side of the street prior to its arrival. Elliot and his team member packaged everything up and made sure we were out the door before the parade could travel another block. 

I look forward to coming back on my next trip to New Orleans.

The onion tarte is awesome! The burgers were some of the best I've ever had....service was awesome! Even on a busy Mardi Gras weekend.....did think it was weird that food runner looked throughout burgers with bare hands checking burger temps? Maybe those little picks with temp on it (rare,medium etc)...

Oh my- we made a reservation for 6 and when we got there, they couldn't find the res. I almost panicked, as this was for a special occasion. No worries though, the hostess found my phone number in the computer and could see something went wrong in the initial res process, so she worked some magic to get us a table. We sat in the back room where we could see the kitchen exhibition style. The servers are classy and friendly- we ordered a bottle of champs and they brought us another on the house, since there were so many of us. They gave us a champs bottle opening presentation as well- which was a fun touch. We ordered oysters With crabmeat to start, hot and tasty served on a bed of salt presentation. Also the brussels sprout were uhhhhmayyyyyzing - they even shared the recipe with us. How gracious! Each of us selected our dishes, i got the grilled pompano fish on top of crispy kale and roasted parsnips- the kale was amazing. I tried my friends white wine and garlic muscles and couldn't stop eating them, also another friend got the lamb served with faro and beats- which i really liked! The staff was amazing, the food was great, the atmosphere was classy NOLA- we really had a special dinner!

It's a very friendly restaurant with good food. Not the typical mom and pop restaurant. It's casual fine dining but with very reasonable price for appetizers and local oysters! Don't bother getting the imported ones, the local ones always can beat many types we have had in other places, Cali, Victoria etc. staff are very friendly and totally get the service queue, won't be asking how you're doing when you have a mouthful but will replace your utensil without even asking. Super attentive! Would recommend this place!

My friend and I came here during happy hour, and though we were not dressed fancily, we weren't treated any differently! We were seated (no reservation) reasonably fast.

The oysters were great as it often is in New Orleans, and the savory crab beignets were decent. Not enough flavor but the garlic sauce that came with was interesting to make up for the blandness though. The shrimp and grits though. OMG. so cheesy, so heavy, but so good.

The interior is decorated really well, too. Lots of space, and really helpful and friendly but professional service all around. Someone to my right ate 75% of his burger and complained to the waiter at the end that it was an awful burger, but the waiters dealt with it super calmly and reasonably! props

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. My friends and I liked it so much we even went twice! Each time we went, I made sure to order the stuffed oysters, brussel sprouts and shrimp and grits. The stuffed oysters were perfectly cooked with a shrimp, crab and cheese topping. But my absolute favorite dish was the brussel sprouts - I don't even like brussel sprouts this much but I thought these were out of this world. 

I thought the menu had a good variety of food. We came around 10:30am so we were able to order off the breakfast and lunch menu. The service was also great and really accommodating of medium sized parties. If you're ever in the area, I would definitely recommend checking this place out!!
Very tasteful. Breakfast shrimp and grits (w/ egg) were really good. However, they could add mire shrimp for the price. Opens at 7AM is also a good thing.

I've been to Lüke three times now and the food has always been fantastic but two of the three times the service was uncomfortable. Today I went for breakfast and the waiter seemed to hate his job. He didn't talk much, wasn't very friendly and was slow to fill our cups-- even when empty. Maybe he was tired from Mardi Gras. Who knows? At a place that is not cheap, I would expect better service.

Cute spot for a lunch. Ordered three small plates for the two of us. We had the rabbit and chicken patê (beautiful selection of jellies, pickles, mustard), fried quail, and crawfish cheesy beignets. Everything came quickly and was presented nicely. Great portions when sharing between two people. 4 stars - maybe more variety for small plates would help to compliment already great dishes.
Their brussel sprouts are addictiveand they have some of the best raw oysters in the city (their house horseradish is amazing, but super powerful).

We like the breakfast at Lüke. Fresh ingredients and interesting recipes make this bistro on point. The staff is knowledgeable and efficient. During the week there are business breakfast meetings and local folks. The hostess recommends reservations on Friday and weekends. Get your OpenTable points and enjoy!

The service was very good here. I came during happy hour and my drinks were very strong. I ordered a matzo ball soup-  very good and with flavorful broth. I also had the  beet salad because I'd already had enough fried food at lunch. It was light and refreshing and I loved the spicy pecan candied garnish. Very good. I finished my meal with the bread pudding which I didn't care for personally, I felt like the ice cream texture was flat, and I don't think I like bread pudding. But I'm assuming it's good if you like it because everyone gives it good reviews. The flavor was there. I enjoyed my dinner and my happy hour buzz.

I don't think I could say enough good things about Lüke. We were originally trying to grab lunch at another place in New Orleans that ended up being completely full so we came into Lüke as a back up option and it was probably the best decision of my life. The meal was probably one of the best I've ever had and we came back twice during our six day stay. 

Must orders are the brussel sprouts, shrimp and grits, and the stuffed Bienville oysters. The brussel sprouts are charred perfectly and cooked in this delicious smoky sauce. The shrimp and grits were also sublime with an excellent balance of spices. The oysters were by far everyones favorite - they're cooked and served with a mix of shrimp and crab and a breadcrumb/cream topping. I would recommend going for lunch/dinner over breakfast as their breakfast menu isn't as extensive but if you do go for breakfast I'd recommend the fried chicken and biscuit. It comes with a tobasco honey sauce that is so delicious.

The prices are extremely reasonable and you can enjoy a nice cocktail while there as well. Couldn't recommend this place enough and it's generally pretty easy to get a table (we didn't have a reservation either time and only waited 10 mins max).

The coffee and bentons bacon was good, but I wouldn't order the frittata again, under cooked so runny in the middle, too much caramelized onion and the dressing on the arugula was pouring off the plate. Made for a soggy mess.

I have been to LUKE four times and this was my worst experience.  There was a hair in my Crawfish Bisque so I quietly brought it to the bartender's attention.  She quickly removed the cup of soup and came back with a manager.  This is where I became disappointed.  The manager could not look me in my eyes and she never said, "I'm sorry" for the haor in my food.  She stated that it never should have happened (I agree) and she hopes I will eat there again.  She told me about the three new desserts and offered to give me a complimentary dessert or a new cup of soup.  Sometimes all you need to do is say, "I'm sorry this happened."  I hope there's some additional training on how to talk to customers and resolve issues in a professional manner in the future.  Otherwise, I love eating here!

I want to believe the customer service was a little slow because we went during Madi Gras. But No! I was talking to a total stranger from LA, California.  The topic of Mardi Gras came up, and I was like oh I was just down in New Orleans for my birthday. I mentioned a few restaurants that I went to and Lüke was one that I brought up. The guy asked me how did you like it because when I went  customer service was horrible. 

I was like wow, I thought it was just me! Which brings me to this review. My fiance and I went there for a late lunch. Once we were inside we were standing at the counter for about 5 minutes before three of the hostess even acknowledge that we were standing there. All three of the hostess were standing  talking and laughing as if they weren't at work.

Once we were finally seated and given the menu. We quickly realized the choices were very limited. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and my fiance had the Gumbo. My food was adequate, it wasn't gross tasting but it wasn't all that either. Now the gumbo my fiance had. Was not appealing at all. It was a dark thick gravy and it had very little Seafood. I'm from Baton Rouge Louisiana so I know traditionally how Gumbo should look and taste, bottom line it was not good at all. 

The issue that I had was definitely the customer service, it sucked. For establishment to be that upscale and high-maintenance the hostesses were very unprofessional. 

The two waiters we had made the experience a little better because they were very attentive and concerned about how our experience was but I probably won't be back.

We went for Happy Hour and we were thrilled by the quality of the oysters and the service. You can't beat 75 cent raw oysters ( that are fabulous) and $1.25 fried oysters (that were even better!) in a beautiful place. Our waiter was very attentive, as were the support staff. We'll probably eat here every day that we're here. It was that good.

Fabulous experience! We went for lunch. I ordered from the express menu which included choice of soup or salad, I went with the gumbo. The main dishes was shrimp etouffe . Both dishes were fantastic. The gumbo wasn't spicy and had a lot of flavor.

Ended up choosing Luke after a few trips to New Orleans.  Nice space with nice decor.  

Ordered:
Crawfish beignets
Raw Oysters 
Shrimp and grits 
Burgers 


The oysters were huge!!!!!     Crawfish beignets were average at best.   The sauce was delicious.  Friends enjoyed the burgers and the presentation was nice.  The shrimp and grits were tasty but could have had some more heat.  All in all not a bad choice.

Looked over the menu and asked the waitress for suggestions. I was torn between a couple of options which is always good. I thought I should behave and leave room for later so I found an absolutely amazing healthy option!! Had the fritata with onions and peppers and it also has duck sausage with arugula and vinegrette with chuncks of feta cheese and pesto, tomatoes, and avocado. Comes with wheat toasts. It was pretty big so I was able to finish about 3/4 of it. I would have taken the rest home if I lived nearby. Overall good service and food came out pretty quickly. Went early in the morning to get a seat. Staff wear white coats so you know its fancy. From the pictures, they serve a lot of oysters here but I did not get any whiff of fish smell which pleases me.
The fried oysters were fantastic, and the steaks were perfectly prepared. Great date night spot.

Went here with a few friends (4 of us) the week before Mardi Gras. It was a Wednesday night around 6:30 I think. We didn't have a reservation, and they said it might take 45 minutes-but they called me to say the table was ready in less than 30. 
We all ordered different cocktails, and were all pleased with how yummy, complex, and balanced they were. For food we shared the Louisiana rabbit and chicken liver pate--which was rich and smooth and came with a platter of different pickles and sauces to pair with on crostini. I was afraid it might not come with much pate, but there was almost too much for the four of us to finish! When we asked for more crostini they brought out a full plate of it. More than we needed, but I'd prefer that over too little. 
For my entree I got the shrimp and grits. The grits were creamy and smothered with cheese, the shrimp was cooked perfectly with a soft flaky texture (I think it may have been some of the best prepared shrimp I've ever had actually), and came with sausage and a sauce with creole/Cajun spices that had a rich warm flavor without being too spicy or overwhelming the other components to the dish. I was very, very impressed. It was definitely worth the $24 price tag for the entree. 
Our server was nice, although didn't refill my water as often as I would have liked (I drink a lot of water). But I have no complaints. A manager also stopped by our table to see how our meals were, which I appreciate seeing in restaurants. 
I'd return to Lüke for sure next time I'm in New Orleans! But next time I would probably make a reservation.
Excellent service and best duck breast I ever enjoyed!!! Dined there during Mardi Gras and was still packed with locals.

I'm from out of town and the hosts of the Airbnb I stayed at said Lüke was amazing. This place was just around average to me. 

Don't get me wrong, the food was good but I don't think it was worth the pricey amount it was. I ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp and it felt like it was missing something like a spicy kick. I feel like I could've got a better dish of shrimp and grits at another restaurant at a better price. Also, the shrimp was not all that jumbo in my opinion. They looked like regular sized shrimps to me. 

Service was not very good as well. Our server only came around three times to check up on us; the first to greet us, take our order, and drop off the check. Our waters were never refilled either. I don't want to say the server was rude, but it just felt like he was very stand offish and didn't care about us. The restaurant was not very busy so I'm not sure why this was a problem.
A Great Place for lunch for those of us who work downtown. Order a burger and ask them to cut in half so you dont have to do it at the table.  Generous Portion

The experience overall was very disappointing. I ordered the entouffee and the dish was very salty and could not finish even half of it. The oysters were fresh and large in size. 

The service was unsatisfactory. The restaurant was not busy but we were seated near the door next to a really loud table.

Came here for their awesome oyster happy hour. Great fresh, good sized oysters and half off all drinks - can't go wrong with both! The Crawfish Bisque is absolutely divine with a perfect consistency and chunks of crawfish. I wish I could've ordered a gallon to go, it was that good. Heard this place has the best shrimp and grits, so I'll be back.

Excellent!!! We had 3 hungry young kids in tow and there was a long wait, but we stuck it out because we really wanted to try it! And we are so glad we did!! Even the not-hungry-anymore kids were happy. They even wanted to go back the next day! We had the shrimp and also the Brussels sprouts as appetizers - delicious! Even our 5-year-old was chowing these down! Two of the kids split an adult cheeseburger and fries, and loved it! The oldest had the mac-and-cheese off the kids menu and was pleased with her choice. My husband got the Tabasco Honey Fried Chicken and a cup of the Crawfish Bisque - both excellent!! I got the Matzo Ball and Roast Chicken Soup. It was perfect for the dreary, rainy afternoon! The elegant feel of the restaurant is top notch. Our waiter was friendly and gave wonderful recommendations of things to do in New Orleans (we took 3 or 4 of his suggestions, and he was spot on!). We got to sit in the back dining area where we could see the kitchen in action, and the kids thought that was pretty neat! We recommend this place, for sure!
Amazing food and great service! Was the true highlight of our trip to New Orleans!

I'm very glad that my first true #shrimpandgrits experience was had at John Besh's New Orleans restaurant  #Lüke. The jumbo Louisiana shrimp "En Cocotte was atop roasted jalepeno cheese grits and loaded with andouille sausage. I always envisioned grits to be flavorless but salty. Boy was I wrong! The cheese and jalepeno proved me wrong! The crawfish beignets was the choice for my first sampling of a savory #beignet and to be fair, they weren't out of this world, just okay, but the green garlic aoili saved the day! The accompanying sauce had so much flavor yet had a subtle and pleasant endnote that made me enjoy every bite. Now, why would you order a burger here when there's #cajunfood to be tried? Well, you always take the recommendation of the few people you ask and try it. Very very glad that advice was taken. The Lüke burger was a definite hit! Seemed massive and heavy, but once you bit in to it you tasted the lightness abd fresness of the protein. The amazing caramelized onions, bacon, and Enmenthaler cheese all paired well together to create the perfect bite. I highly recommend this be added to anyone's list of places to eat in  #nola

Lüke was the very first restaurant I visited my first night in New Orleans, after hearing so many good reviews, I thought I would try it. Luckily, they did not disappoint! I came right in time for Happy Hour which was incredible, the French 75 was delicious. Oysters were super cheap, either raw or fried, both were great. The service was probably the best part of the experience, the servers were incredibly funny and were very quick to get anything we needed, even while being busy. I would definitely recommend this place!
Yum.  Consistently excellent. The daily menu items are a great value and fun. I could eat here every day. But.....I could not fit through the revolving door.....

You land in a city that has a million happy hours. You land and you want great drinks and some oysters immediately. Would you always think of Lüke as the place to fit the bill? Maybe not but I am glad we did. 

We landed with just enough time to catch the last 30 minutes of happy hour. We aren't scruffy looking but I was a little worried since this place looks very nice. We walk in and notice no room at the bar but then discover that happy hour is for everyone no matter where you sit!  Hurray!

Kevin our amazing waiter come up to us and assures us he can get our order in before the end of happy hour (he was able to get us two rounds in)!  We did a dozen raw (75¢ each) and a dozen fried ($1.50 each I think). The most amazing thing happened. They were able to do gluten free fried oysters for my husband. He is sensitive not full celiac but he felt great after so either low or no gluten. Looks like they were fried with corn meal and they did mention they do a separate frier. They did mention if they are slammed it would be a long wait but we got our in minutes. Yay Lüke!

The oysters were amazing and the horseradish cleared out my sinuses like it should. 

We drank the Silver Saint (tequila, soda, lime, cucumber, Serrano pepper) and drank another immediately. They seem week but I promise they are not. 

We enjoyed it so much it was the only place we came back to on our 4 day trip and then we tried the Brussels sprouts. They are really amazing and I don't usually like them. I always try one but this batch had me fighting my husband for some. Maybe the honey in the sauce. 

We will be back Lüke and hopefully Kevin will still be able to help us!

Ok, I know giving this place five stars is not shocking since it's the hottest restaurant in town. And I generally avoid the "hot spots" due to long waits even with a reservation, but our hotel concierge basically insisted on getting us a table there, so I caved.  And, wow, it really lived up to its billing! So great. 

We started with the baked oysters which are crazy delicious. Only six oysters and priced at $19, but trust me, it's worth it. I don't particularly even like oysters but these things will blow your mind. Sorry to be so dramatic but they are that good. 

I then moved on to the grilled chicken and you'd think "chicken is chicken" but not at this place. Seasoned and cooked to perfection. Very awesome. 

Great staff too, very attentive and personable. 

If in Nola, definitely go to Lukes! (Order the oysters..)

I came here twice during my visit to New Orleans, once for dinner and once for happy hour.

The happy hour was so worth it! Half off drinks and 75 cents for giant, juicy oysters. The service was impeccable and the drinks were strong.

For dinner my husband had the shrimp grits and I had the Luke's burger. The burger definitely lives up to its hype. It was juicy, tender and amazingly flavorful. However, we didn't really understand all the hype around the shrimp grits. It was way too salty, which we found to be a common problem with a lot of the restaurants around NoLa. Have they never heard of moderation?

The place is pricey for the portions you get.

I love happy hour! I wish this is a thing in Boston but I intend on taking advantage of all the happy hour deals while I am in town in New Orleans! 
$0.75 oyster, $1.25 fried oysters and half off drinks 3-6pm everyday, are you kidding me?!?!
Me and my girlfriend came here for happy hour and had such a blast. The oysters are really big and delicious, the fried oysters are just heavenly, and the prices cannot be beat! 
What a great place to get drinks, their cocktails are superb and creative, I remember the French 75 to be especially good. We enjoyed so many regular and fried oysters and had several rounds of drinks at such a heavy discount and it just had our day! This will be the first time we are returning to next time we visit New Orleans :)

My experience at Luke's was great. From the service to the food and the ambience. I ended up trying the Luke's burger and it was 5/5. I also tried there Bloody Mary 4/5. Finally, it was pleasant to know they serve Blantons Bourbon.

If I could give this place a 3.5 stars, I would. We visited this place on a whim for brunch and were not disappointed. The food is good and this seems like it would be a pretty classy place for dinner or happy hour. My only complaint is how pricey it is and maybe I just don't fit the lifestyle this place is catering for. I really enjoyed the food and while we sat at the bar, the bartender was very attentive.

As I came to New Orleans to visit for the weekend, I decided to visit Luke for some oysters.
This place has happy hour for $.75 oysters everyday 3-6pm! Asked where the oysters came from, and our waiter told us they were from the east coast. 

Location: located inside the same building as the Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue.

Service: couldn't complain, friendly staff and attentive.

Ambience: more upscale than abnormal restaurant. Just don't show up in a tank and basketball shorts with flip flops.

Food quality: Only ordered the oysters. Ordered 18 of them and absolutely devoured them. Definitely fresh and were very tasty along with the cocktail sauce, horse radish and lemons they provide.

Good place to chow down on fresh oysters especially if you're looking to go easy on your wallet, as oysters can be expensive. Go ahead and call ahead to set reservations as they do so.

How is this place not rated 5 stars!!! We came in for happy hour on Saturday at 5 and the place was packed. They were able to find us a table for3 in quick order and we ordered some happy hour oysters.  The gulf oysters are larger than pacific coast oysters but they were creamy and delicious . The drinks were so well made and perfectly balanced.  The service was much like service in the other restaurants we visited, generous and on point. Southern hospitality is real.  Come here for good food, great drinks and wonderful service.

Wanted to give this five stars but the food wasn't consistently great. Service was good but when they got busy it seemed like there weren't enough servers so the hostess/manager had to jump in. But they did jump in, so can't complain. And everyone was friendly and knowledgeable about the food. Appetizers were great! Such interesting flavors. The best Brussels sprouts I've ever had and the salads were phenomenal. The entrees were solid, but only the burger was outstanding. Desserts were delicious. S'mores torte was outstanding!

My gf and I had some seriously good bar karma this weekend and it stuck with us when we walked in the door at Luke's. Two seats opened up just as we approached the bar, right in front of the oyster shucking station. The man with the knife asked if we were planning to order oysters and when I responded with a DEFINITELY YES, he slid a dozen in front of us, an extra due to another customer's order mix-up. Lucky us! They were huge and delish. While we sat there, in awe of the pace at which the staff was able to shuck, we sampled another kind of oyster from Alabama that was even better.

My gf also ordered a salad- big leaves of butter lettuce with slices of amazingly sweet beets and a dressing I wanted to drink.

Per the recommendation of my friend who suggested this place, I ordered a French 75- yum! I should drink more of these!

When the check came, I thought there must have been some mistake. The cocktail (which was delish) was half price for HH, I think $5. And the oysters, comped (thank you again, 5 star staff!!). Even if they hadn't been, these are a crazy good deal during happy hour. 

Definitely go to this place, sit at the bar, chat with the crew, and enjoy!
The staff here are super friendly and helpful. The food was amazing! We had the jalapeño shrimp and grits and he muscles and fries. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.
Gumbo and shrimp and grits are well worth it. Door number three cocktail is quite tasty--not too sweet but refreshing.

Amazing!! One of the best places I visited in NOLA - and that's saying something!

Great friendly service. My mom is vegetarian. The cook made her a special pasta - that was the best dish on the table!!

Raw oysters are very good and a great deal during happy hour.  The fried oyster salad was a lil heavy on the dressing and the fried oyster maybe a bit too salty for some folks.  The texture, however, was perfect - not to bready and just the right amount of crisp and delicacy.  One of them came with a bonus, a small pearl!!!  Now where are the crap tables at!?!  I have to come back and try the bread pudding.

Stopped in for a late lunch! We had the raw and fried oysters and would come again for them. We also had daily entree special split with gumbo... think it's called something Bouillon... also really yummy and would have again...oysters shrimp crab all included! The service was prompt and helpful.... definitely would come again!

I found this restaurant on Yelp when I was looking for some oyster places in New Orleans. And wow - I'm so glad that I decided to check this place out!!

[Service]
My friends and I made a reservation for 4:45pm. We had to walk from French Market, so we were twenty minutes late to our reservation. But we still had our reserved table ready. The hostess was also very polite and welcoming when we arrived. 

[Ambience]
Very clean and classy! It is quite upscale so I recommend you to dress up a little when you visit this restaurant. 

[Food]
Luke has a happy hour for 75 cents per P&J oyster at 3-6pm everyday! This was the main reason why I chose this restaurant for oysters. My boyfriend and I ordered 30 oysters in total.
