They came with horse radish, cocktail sauce, and lemons. Beware - the horse radish was a bit too strong. Oysters were really fresh and tasty! 

[Drinks]
Luke also offers half price on cocktails and beers during happy hour. I got the door#3 cocktail which had vodka, pomegranate, mint, and lime. I enjoyed how refreshing the cocktail was!

All in all, I was impressed by this restaurant. Food, drinks, atmosphere, and service... they were all great, and I have nothing to complain!

My husband and I were encouraged to visit a John Besh restaurant during our first trip to New Orleans. We made an 8:45PM reservation for a Friday night, arrived about 20 minutes early, and only had to wait about 3 minutes to be seated.

Ambiance: Fantastic. Clean & lively without being too loud. We sat at a 2 top facing the open kitchen and enjoyed watching the staff prepare meals. You know you're in a great spot when the expo wears a sports coat!

Service: Perfect 10! The hostesses were friendly and accommodating, and our waitress Madison was knowledgeable, friendly, and made excellent recommendations. 

Food: Stuffed P&J oysters were absolutely phenomenal starters. They were the size of my palm, salty with a sweet finish, but weren't overpowered by the stuffing. Shrimp & grits were good--extremely creamy and rich jalapeño grits, but far from the best I've ever had. The amberjack was good, but the best thing on the plate was the vegetable/raisin medley with it.

If you're looking for oysters, this place has the variety and won't disappoint. Entrees were ok, but if I were to revisit it would be for a tasty happy hour & apps stop during the early evening.
Simply did not stand up to rating. Very mundane at best. They did offer to substitute some veggies for the less than satisfying potatoes served with roasted chicken.

Since we share the same name, I thought I'd give this place a try. Wow! The crawfish bisque was fantastic. Could have eaten 3 more bowls. Their shrimp and grits were possibly the best I've ever had. The only issue would be the lack of andoullie. Only two pieces in my dish. Shrimp was cooked perfectly. Their ambrosia dessert was a great take on a grandma's classic. Loved it.  Great experience from a guy who cooks from scratch everyday at home.

Well...you know it was double yum for the 5 Stars because we had an extremely difficult time getting to Luke. Totally not on them, but, our nerves were frayed trying to make our brunch reservation on time. Apparently a 'run' had closed every road to Luke! We were amazed they were so full considering the difficulty. But we made it only to find they had lost our reservation! No record of it! So why the 5 stars? They assured us we would be accommodated immediately, they chatted us up personably and the Bloody Mary was super good but the French 75 even better!!! Food was absolutely delicious!!! Brussel Sprouts are a Must Order!!! Worth all of it!
The Brussel sprouts were so crispy, with the honey and Serrano peppers that I had to ask for the recipe to try to make it myself at home.

I went to New Orleans with my sister looking to enjoy some authentic southern cooking.  I found it at Luke. We ordered all the recommended dishes.  The wait staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  

We started with the STUFFED P&J OYSTERS. I don't normally enjoy oysters, but these were delicious. Crispy and buttery goodness.  I had the gumbo next. My experience thus far had been that the gumbo in various other locations were generally over-seasoned and salty. But the SEAFOOD GUMBO Á LA CREOLE at Luke was perfectly balanced. Before I knew it I was scraping the bottom of the bowl with a hunk of the warm, crispy French baguette they had served alongside. 

For our entree we had the SHRIMP AND GRITS. The shrimp were enormous and perfectly cooked, cradled in the smoothest, cheesiest grits I've ever had. Just the right balance of spices and herbs, each mouthful was heaven. Even though we were completely full after the gumbo, there was not of speck of the shrimp and grits left at the end of the meal.

I'm a live and die Los Angeles girl, and it's rare that I crave anything in another city this intensely. But as I'm describing my epic meal, I'm wishing I was back in New Orleans.

Oyster happy hour is amazing. It was even more amazing when the oysters were only 50 cents, but even at 75 cents, the P&J oysters are a great deal. Get a couple dozen raw oysters and a couple appetizers like the crawfish bisque (that comes with a seafood stuffed crawfish head) and the crispy brussle sprouts (flash fried with a slightly sweet and spicy vinegar sauce) and you've got a very tasty, very filling meal for two at a great price.

This is genuinely one of our favorite places in the city. We've been for dinner several times and yesterday had our first brunch and it was EGGS-ceptional. (My sincere apologies. I couldn't help myself.) 

The brunch is ON POINT. The menu is small and excellently curated with a billion ways to mix and match large and small plates. We opened with a French 75 and a Bloody and an order of Berliners. The French 75 was topped with a foam of what we guessed were champagne kissed egg whites and there was a cherry in there. Not the French 75 that I'm accustomed to, but delicious. The Bloody Mary was spicy and smooth and outstanding. Our waiter asked for vodka choice and we chose Titos- not that you can tell once it's added to a Bloody Mary but it was spicy and velvety. A Berliner is a German donut with no hole and usually filled and fits into the German-Franco vibe here beautifully. The basket was big and we ate three before we asked them to be packed up. There was a tangy apple butter in them, if I recall...

For the big show, my husband got the Flammenkuchen and I got the Fried Chicken Biscuit. His only critique was that some of the lardons were cut really thickly and hadn't really rendered so he has some pieces of fat that he gathered to the side. Don't mistake, he ate the whole thing. When they set down my plate the people at the next table said "OHMYGOD." I offered them a seat if they wanted to come help but they stayed put. More for me!!!! And Jesus, was this thing every bit of joy. Two pieces of chicken on a biscuit drizzled with Tabasco Honey and topped with a yard egg, it took me a minute to plan my attack. (Pro tip: cut the biscuit in half, top each side with a piece of the chicken, and half the egg too. You've got two little chicken Benedicts and don't have to break out the climbing equipment to get to the top of that thing. Seriously, it's like 10" tall on arrival.) 

We got a side of the Rosemary Potatoes which is what I imagine they serve at the cafeteria in heaven and the Joe Fekete vegetables. I ate most of those with my hands. They were just amazing. 

We took a small break in the middle but both cleaned our plates. Our waiter Elliot was so tickled for us that he offered complimentary coffee. It was a Nicaraguan blend and put the pep back in our step. It came with a little pewter creamer of what we suspect was not half and half but, rather, heavy cream. And maybe everyone gets the free coffee but if you're offered it, say yes. Trust me. 

We were both full but not sick and even didn't really need dinner that night. But we did eat the rest of those Berliners. ;)

The breakfast was delicious. I ordered Mimi's pancakes with a side of cane syrup sausage and homefries.  The pancakes were soft and buttery, the homefries were made with what appeared to be thick cut bacon and onions.  The atmosphere gave a relaxed old timey New Orleans feel.  The waiter Jackson was always nearby and very quick to check in.  The food was out in 15 minutes and was excellent.

Visiting from California and Miami I can say this was one amazing restaurant!!!!  Food coma.  I was so pleasantly surprised!  Party of 8 came in and expected to eat at bar but luckily a table was closing out.  We ordered a few plates of oysters and the horseradish was so hot I couldn't stop smearing it on everything.  The homemade bread and dipped in steamer wine sauce that was out of this world.  Our first bottle of wine we ordered wasn't good and without hesitation Robert (the best waiter from Chicago) went and got a second bottle of the a different wine.  French fries were amazing.  We got a lot of everything to share and I was full by the end.  
Our waiter was so animated and made the 50th birthday dinner a fun fete!  Bravo !!!!! I usually shy away from celebrity chefs restaurants, but this was exceptionally delicious.  I would highly recommend
Loved this place!!! Great staff!! Food was the best we had in New Orleans!! Brussel sprouts were fantastic.l!!!

Rabbit + Chicken Liver Pate. OMG. To die for. I mean, to die for. Like, mmmmmmmmm. I could have ordered two more and just eaten pate all night. Also good, the lamb, the chicken, the wine, the cocktails... If you're looking for a casual yet classy dinner in NOLA, go here.

The crawfish étouffée was pretty good, even though the rice was crispy, which was different but good! The shrimp and grits were good. Nothing I just HAVE to come back for. The stuffed oysters were amazing but crazy expensive. Overall the food was just okay and way overpriced. The food itself only gets three stars... but Kayla, and her excellent customer service, got them a four.

First night in the city and we chose Lüke primarily based on location as we are staying in a nearby hotel. Totally impressed with this place! Food was delicious and reasonably priced. You'll find stronger/cheaper drinks on Bourbon Street, but the cocktails and beers were priced between $8-$11 and were what you could expect for this type of place. 

I ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" and let me say, it was one of the best prepared meals I've had in a long while. It's been a good deal of time since I've been in the south, but I don't remember grits being this good! The spice on the shrimp in in the sauce played well with the grits and it was delicious. Very happy with the restaurant and would highly recommend it to others.

Had lunch with my grown daughters, couldn't have been happier! We were a bit rushed, a flight looming, and the waiter made sure we were served quickly, and was attentive throughout, even brought our bill quickly without our having to ask. We shared appetizers, the crawfish hush puppies, Brussels sprouts, fried quail and a beet salad. All were delicious, but we also managed to pack down a shared bread pudding, excellent!
Ingredients in everything were fresh, sauces were nuanced and textures perfect throughout. This place stands out in a food city, highly recommend!

Our server was wonderful and took good care of us.  The Étouffée was AMAZING... however the gumbo was very salty and was warm.  

Menu is limited and its a gourmet restaurant... so not really kid friendly (they do have a fancy hamburger)

We had a large party and were lucky enough to get a private room in the back. We were lucky enough to have Rich Whatley as our server.  He was absolutely amazing and made our experience even better.  Besides for the food being amazing he was very attentive and helpful with a party of 8 rowdy fools. One of our guests was a little tipsy and asking some really stupid questions.  He was still helpful and even busted his chops which made us enjoy our time even more!  I will 100% go back any time I'm in Nola and recommend anyone and everyone go there and ask for Rich because you will not be disappointed!

The best tasting foods in town. The Étouffée was AMAZING. The Croque-Monsieur or Croque-Madame are to dine for. I definitely recommend giving Lüke a try if you haven't been there. You won't be disappointed.

Our first meal of the trip and fresh off a 7hr drive down from Memphis. I'm a NOLA regular but haven't had the chance to try out this spot. Great service. Surprisingly quaint space for its size. Great albeit slightly limited menu. The drum meunière was perfect. Shrimp grits were the best of our trip. Capping off with a $19 Thomas H Handy Old Fashined was a surprisingly nice treat. Not a cheap meal by any stretch but worth it. Next time I'll get the burger after seeing one walk by and hearing raves about it.

Quiet elegance, excellent cuisine (even by NOLA standards), prompt and attentive service.
This was the only restaurant we visited twice during our time here.

Enjoyed a terrific business lunch at Luke where we dined on rabbit pate with chutney, marmalades and pickles. The pate was bursting with rich flavor and filled me up for what feels like a week! Similarly, the crawfish bisque was velvety with texture and overfilled with bite sized portions of crawfish meat in a creamy broth. Luke is a wonderful blend of casual and serious diners enjoying food in a category of its own.

We stumbled upon Luke's on our way to Alabama via NOLA.  At first we thought we were under dressed because the place looks fancy (and it was) but they were very warm and welcoming, the food was delicious  and our server TRISTAN was very accommodating. He told us about some New Orleans history (French Quarter Festival and Nick Cage's cemetery plot). He was very professional  and the only reason for the four stars is because the didn't have flavored Vodka.
Absolutely amazing! Good portions and very tasty, savory food. Must haves: shrimp and grits, pâté, bisque and gumbo. Phenomenal! Great service too.

A first timer to NOLA and a fan of Besh, I cannot imagine a better spot to bring my friends. The bar at Luke has a fantastic happy hour that cannot be beat. P and J oysters for .75 and wine/cocktails/drafts half off. Kris, our bartender, had great suggestions while Phil and Tim shucked our oysters- the shells were clean and easy to eat. They're so fresh you don't need the amazing sauces. Ryan the manager even stopped by to say hello and was kind and friendly face. I can't recommend this stop enough and can't wait to be back.

The food was delicious and the staff friendly and courteous. Hollywood Oysters raw bar and Shrimp & grits are the best that I have had to date!

Was in New Orleans on Business and pulled up Luke on Yelp. Decided to try it and it was great. Sat at the bar and ended up talking to the Oyster/ Sea Food specialist Phil for a while.
Hostness Shemoan (She-Moan) was very pleasant as well. 

I will be back.

In terms of food, Luke is really a 3.5, but I'm rounding up because the atmosphere and service were really great. The Croque Madame and pomme frites were delicious, and, though it's probably a seasonal thing, if you spot their pickled watermelon rind on the menu--GET IT!
So disappointed.   French fries were cold.   Our waitress ignores us.    I would not come back.   It is highly overrated

We had a wonderful time on a busy weekend. They did great accommodating our large party and got everyone's order and ticket spot on! I ordered the LE PETIT PLATEAU DE FRUITS DE MER... Amazing presentation and everything done to perfection.

Went for happy hour (3pm to 6pm everyday). 75 cents raw oyster and 1.25 for fried oysters.  Half price on cocktails, beers and wine.  Food came with bread and butter. Oysters came with saline crackers.  The raw oyster was really good.  The service was great.

Review is purely for their happy hour.

$.75 oysters were out of this world delicious. I eat a lot of oysters in SF (when I can afford it) and having it at Lüke has changed my views on oysters forever. I did not know oyster meat can be so sweet and structured. Every one was super fresh and delicious. The complimentary bread was also really good! We tried a few of their cocktails and all were strong, not overly sweet, and made really well. Also, sometimes they have $5 Irish coffees (!!!) and it was one of the best irish coffees I've had. A must in NOLA.

Perfect!! After a weekend in New Orleans with mostly "off" service, our Easter brunch at Luke ended our trip on the highest note possible.
I was able to grab a last minute (literally 15 minutes in advance) reservation for a 1045 brunch.
Our server was fantastic. She started off with some drink specials- hubs got "the dude" which was a White Russian with a shot of espresso & I got a mimosa. While we waited on our drinks we perused the amazing brunch options. Literally everything sounded amazing. We narrowed things down to the newly added chicken & waffles & the crawfish etouffee.
The chicken & waffles was delicious- a full waffle & two large pieces of boneless chicken, topped with a pepper jelly & a sweet butter. The chicken was really crisp & the combination of the two toppings gave a nice balance.
But the star of the meal- the crawfish etouffee- OMG. Probably one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life. I am still dreaming of this dish & regret not being able to finish it. The crawfish were in season & were tasty, but the crispy rice- I'm obsessed. I have no idea how they do this, but I'm determined to find out. It was perfectly seasoned. I cannot stress how amazing this dish was (I luckily stopped halfway through to snap a pic), but order this!!

Soft Shell Crab BLT. Amazing tastes and flavor combinations and incredibly beautiful presentation. This restaurant never disappoints and is consistently amazing. Waitstaff are attentive but not suffocating. Perfection.

John Besh delivers in a big way here. The $.75 raw oysters are amazing and the fried ones are soft, not greasy or chewy and just friggin delicious. Drinks are half price during happy hour and I'd suggest the French 75 or the bourbon smash with peaches and mint. I was looking forward to this as was my wife and let's just say, there was not a single drop of disappointment in this place. Just fantastic.

My fiancé and I ate breakfast here and it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either.  I had the beignets which were overly sweet and the filling didn't quite work. The fiance had the southern breakfast, said the eggs were cooked poorly and the grits were too salty.  Overall it wasn't terrible, but it was probably the most disappointing meal we had during our four day trip to New Orleans.  We did eat here on a Monday morning so it may have been an off day.

Came here for Easter lunch and again for happy hour.  The crawfish bisque is tasty.  For happy hour the oysters are a great deal!! They were huge!  The specialty drinks were half priced.  Service was excellent both times.

I enjoyed my lunch at Luke's. The service was superb and the food was delicious. We could taste the love and thought process that the chef created to inspire our palate of the quality of food that Luke's is awarded in New Orleans and in the USA.

Wow! We came here for a special dinner when on vacation in New Orleans and this didn't disappoint. The atmosphere is warm, inviting and lively. Started with a bowl of the Chicken and Matzo Ball soup and the Crawfish Bisque. Both were delicious. The crawfish Bisque had a crawfish head in the soup stuffed with a crawfish stuffing which was a fun addition. Our main courses were the roasted chicken and boudin stuffed pork chops. Both again were delicious. My wife said the chicken was ridiculously good and she knows her chicken. The pork chop was smoky and had a little bit of a BBQ flavor. The boudin inside was rich and paired well with the pork. All around a great meal and would recommend this to anyone coming to town.

Amazing meal great service. It's not cheap but so far it's one of our best meals in Nola. The crawfish etouffee is good but not worth ordering given how much better all the other meals are.

The brussel sprouts are amazing!

The food was the best that I have had in New Orleans. Service was outstanding!! Try the chicken, burger or if you like fish they have lots to pick from. The fried Brussel sprouts we great. Can go wrong with this restaurant.

This is a great little spot, great atmosphere with a quaint little bar. I had the crawfish beignet and the gumbo. Both were amazing. The crawfish beignets had a green garlic aoli that complimented it perfectly and the gumbo had really fresh shrimp, mussels and sausage. All this for a really reasonable price.

visiting new orleans for the first time stopped in due to the amount of reviews so thought I would give it a try. whoa!!! was I impressed, the food was amazing everything my party had looked amazing and heard no complaints. the chicken and waffles was delicious beyond imagining. thanks yelp for the recommendation.

Wow. If you like oysters as I do, the Luke happy hour is the place to go. Great fresh oysters and half price drinks. Did I mention that the oysters are .75 ea. Doesn't get any better. Didn't have a full meal, but loved the grilled Brussel sprouts as well.
Great drinks and brunch. Crawfish beignets were amazing. Shrimp and grits were perfectly cooked as well.
Excellent food and service. Nice ambience, but has a casual feel. The Rabbit pate and brussel sprout appetizers were excellent, and the grits and shrimp was a big hit.

Super delicious shrimp and grits. Very satiating and savory. Will come back for the shrimp and grits. Took a bite of the chicken biscuit and it was all right. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful.
The Matzo ball soup, salad and the lemon grass fish were incredible. The happy hour drinks and fried oysters were on point!

I was kinda skeptical of this place at first since all the locals I had talked to recommended other places. But I decided to go on a gutsy feeling and checked it out and I'm glad I did...the food was amazing, our waiter was friendly, the other wait staff were attentive to drinks and such.

To start out we ordered the qual. I was extremely excited for this one at first, it came out with a beautiful crust on it (fried), smelled delicious, it was cooked to perfection.

As a soup, I went with the gumbo. I'm a gumbo snob, I make it...I make it pretty good. This gumbo was top notch, normally I always have something to say but I honestly couldn't really think of anything to say, it was perfectly balanced...not too salty or anything, I had to add some pepper but I like a little kick. Would recommend the gumbo to everyone!

For my entree I went with the Shrimp and Grits which was suggested by the waiter. This...was the damn highlight. If I could eat something everyday...I'd eat the Shrimp and Grits, everything was amazing....the Grits were cheesy and just freakin awesome. The Shrimp was perfect. The sauce along with it was on point. Everything was on point.

I wish I had room for dessert because I'm sure it would've been just as great as everything else. If you're in the area, Lüke is definitely worth a stop for!

I really wanted to dine at one of John Besh's (James Beard Foundation Award for Best Chef- Southeast in 2006) restaurants and decided on Luke. It was mostly due to their happy hour- 75 cent raw oysters and $1.50 fried oysters. Great deal for great oysters. 

The pate of Louisiana rabbit & chicken livers came with country bread croutons and accompaniments. It didn't look like much, but there was a lot of pate in the jar. The seafood gumbo a la creole was also excellent. I'm glad I chose this place to end my trip in New Orleans.

Good one. Ate at the bar, food was good, staff friendly. They were busy. Oysters fresh. Shrimp and grits can to me a little in the cool side but they corrected that with a new plate promptly. I will return.

The food was great, and the service was awesome.  We were a table of 12, and had a great time there.   I had the filet, which was grilled to perfection.  The potatoes on the side were great, but the dish is lacking some sort of sauce to go with the potatoes, other thank ketchup.
Literally one of the best meals I have had in the quarter!  Shrimp n grits is one of my favorite things to eat in the South...their version cannot be topped.  Can't wait to come back here.
Good food, friendly service and an overall nice looking restaurant. I do think the dinner menu could use a few more items. But overall,nice restaurant which I would highly recommend.

We were on vacation and staying at the Hilton located within the same building.  The hotel recommended the restaurant for dinner after our arrival.  We found the staff to be unfriendly, cold and a little snobbish.  They had people walking in to seat and told "us" it would be a 2 hr wait, when we could clearly see seats available. at least 4 tables in the main dining and several in a back dining area.  We felt discriminated against because we were not dressed in a suit and tie or dress.  We didn't wait!

This was one of two Besh restaurants that I visited during my time in New Orleans, and neither disappointed (see review for Restaurant August). Came here for breakfast and ordered the eggs in purgatory, which were fantastic. Perfectly baked eggs in tomato sauce with duck sausage. My friend ordered a stuffed omelet which was fluffy and delicious. Atmosphere of the place was lovely and bright, and our server was very attentive. Great experience.
Amazing place! Delicious food - amazing hospitality with efficient service ! Highly recommend!

Got the chance to make Sunday night dinner plans for my husband and some customers while we were in town for a convention. So happy that I chose Luke!! Spent weeks hoping the food was as amazing as I hoped.
Dinner on Sunday night started with the pate and crispy Brussels sprouts- both were outstanding. My husband had gumbo and the other three of us had the salad Luke with buttermilk dressing. This was the only less than part of the meal and it was simply 3 pieces of really rusty lettuce.
Two steaks ordered and totally enjoyed- one shrimp and grits with blue crab- and one crawfish etouffe.  Not much conversation and some fork passing was had- everything was incredible.
Our server (Melody/Melanie?) helped to make the entire evening very special. She is a gem. 
Thank you John Besh for an incredible meal that was not only supremely delicious but did not 'break our bank'.  We will be back the next time we are in from Kansas!

A part of me doesn't want to review this place, I would rather keep it a secret gem, but hey it's always good to share.

This maybe one of the best happy hours in New Orleans!  Happy hour is from 3 to 6 and it is not limited to bar seating.  It is a white tablecloth restaurant but most people where casually dressed and it seems pretty laid back.

Now on to the happy hour specials.  Raw oysters were 50 cents and I think the fried oysters were a dollar, but we kept with the raw.  These oysters were the best oysters we had during our twelve days in New Orleans and we had quite a few oysters.  No grit what so ever and they were good size oysters.

Specialty drinks, draft beer, and wine are half price.  We started with a couple of rounds of mojitos, the mojitos were not on the drink menu but they were included in the happy hour pricing.  They were a little on the sweet side but we asked our waiter if he could bring us some fresh lime wedges, which he did and that  solved that problem.

Decided on one more round of drinks but we changed it up an ordered a Silver Saint and a Sazerac.

The Silver Saint (tequila, fresh lime juice, cucumber syrup, Serrano pepper, and soda water) was a great drink, loved the kick from the Serrano pepper.  

The Sazerac (Rye, sugar, peychauds bitters and herbsaint) BF enjoyed this drink.

Definitely check out this happy hour, you will not be disappointed.  Wish we had learned about it sooner, I'm sure we would have gone a couple of more times.

The bar is small, but once you get up to it, the oysters make it soooo worth it! I had the PB&J oysters which are .75 during happy hour. They had no frills but they were sooo huge! The oyster shucker was nice enough to give me an extra one on the house! I got a half dozen and along with a cocktail. Loved it totally recommend!

I knew I wanted to eat at one of John Besh's restaurants (I think he has around 9) when I went to NOLA a few weeks ago. I just wasn't sure which one. Judging from all the yelp reviews, we chose Luke. 

It was around a 10-15 minute walk from Bourbon St., and we definitely worked up an appetite getting there. The restaurant is fairly small and once you walk in, you see all of John Besh's cookbooks lined up on a table for purchase. We came at around 2pm and the lunch rush was dying down. 

We ordered:

Stuffed P&J oysters: They were good and the oysters were large, but the toppings took away from the oyster. I prefer Acme's grilled oysters.

Crispy brussel sprouts: So yummy! I love the slivers of green apples they added.

Crispy crawfish etouffee: I wasn't sure what to expect, since I've never had etouffee. This dish surprised me with the texture. The waitress told us they deep fry the rice before making the dish. So it was kind of like eating a savory version of rice crispies. If you love crawfish (there were like at least 3 crawfish in every bite) and love texture, definitely order this!

Shrimp and grits: I've never had grits either! The first few bites were rich and creamy, but I don't think I can eat more than 5 bites. 

Jambalaya: I hardly remember it. It was a part of their daily express lunch menu. Too bad we didn't come on a Monday, I wanted to try the tabasco fried chicken.

Soft shell crab BLT: The housemade bacon made this dish!

Bread pudding: It was alright. A little too sweet for my taste. 

Service was great and our waitress did an amazing job educating us about all the dishes. She was training another waiter and they make trainees take a quiz about all the food after training. Nice to know they take such great pride in their service and food. 

Even if you're starving, share your food with someone else. The portions are large!
The agnolotti was incredible. My husband said "I would fight someone for this" - that sums it up. Drinks, brussel sprouts, and shrimp and grits all worth a return!

I was spending a few days in New Orleans with my mother, grandmother and sister. We decided to visit some restaurants by chefs we know from FoodNetwork. We picked Luke because of John Besh. When we got there, we were very excited about the food! Unfortunately, there was an incident where our food was served to another party. So, we waited almost an hour for our food. However, the House Manager was extremely polite and took care of our bill. The food was SO worth the wait though! We really enjoyed it and would most definitely come back!

Fantastic! We were lucky to get a table at 7:30 without a reservation and had a fabulous time. Our waiter Kevin was great and made several suggestions that were absolutely spot-on: Brussels sprout appetizer (never liked them before but now I'm a huge fan!), crawfish etoufee, shrimp & grits, and the Luke burger. All 4 of us loved our food -- everybody was raving about how good it was.
I highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for some memorable New Orleans cuisine! One note: I think $$$ is more accurate than the $$ price rating it has, but worth every penny!!!

Jumbo shrimp and grits dish was amazing! Nice and spicy. The Gumbo was too bland for me even after adding loads of Tabasco to try and spice it up. The P&J oysters were creamy and delicious. I give it a 3 star because the service was subpar. Server literally came zero times after delivering our food to the table and it wasn't even busy at all.

Food is amazing but I mostly come here for their French 75 drink that I adore. Seating is comfortable but tight quarters. Reservations probably best. Accidentally found this place because staying at hotel nearby. A nice atmosphere as compared to the rough and tumble of Bourbon St.
Really enjoyed our evening, the service was fabulous-the right amount of friendly and attention without being overbearing. Everything we ate was a treat, particularly the pate.

Are here for lunch and had the combo fresh seafood platter of six each - clams, mussels, oysters on half shell, and shrimp with a bit of fresh ceviche. Can't say enough about how fresh and well prepared this plate was. Want to come back for dinner to taste more of menu. Great service.

One of my favorite lunch spots. Food and drinks are on spot and very delicious. Luke burger is a great lunch option. Roasted Jalapeño grits and Crawfish bisque is also highly recommended. Finish the meal with bananas foster, can't go wrong with that. Highly recommended

Came here for a Saturday night dinner at 7pm for a party of four with a reservation. The taste and quality of the food exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend checking this place out if  you're looking for a nice, sit-down restaurant in New Orleans.

We got the crispy brussel sprouts which were the best brussel sprouts I've ever remembered having. They were in this sweet, rich sauce and honestly it's a must-try. We got it to share and it went so quickly. The cheesy jalapeno grits were also a hit, though paled in comparison to the brussel sprouts.

I ordered the seafood gumbo for my entree and I loved it. The seafood in it was so fresh - especially the oyster in it, which was cooked to perfection. Granted, I don't have much experience with gumbo but this one tasted exceptional to me.

For my drink, I got the apparently famous french 75. It was aesthetically appealing to see how frothy it was, but I didn't really care for the flavor. I think all of the egg whites in the drink kind of added an unpleasant aftertaste to the cocktail. Wish I had ordered something else.

We got the smores tarte to share and that was very good. As a bread pudding lover I wish I had tried that for dessert, but the smores was good for sharing and also tasty.

Came for happy hour before strolling to Bourbon street! Had the fried oysters for 1.25 each. Sooooo good! We also got the shrimp and grits, equally tasty! 

Half off all alcohol beverages during happy hour, which starts at 3pm! And 1.25 oysters either fried or cold.  They are huge! 

Service was awesome! And the waiter sent us an extra drink, because ya know, why not! The place is a lil upscale and adjacent to the hotel.

This was probably the best food experience I had in New Orleans and we didn't plan on going. 

Food:
1. The Brussel sprouts are probably the most delicious I've ever had, cooked probably and seasoned so that there was some sweet, spicy, and salty. Must have!
2. Agnolotti was so tender and delicious. 
3. The grits were so good that someone who doesn't normally like grits liked them - they weren't watery but cheesy and with texture. 
4. The bread pudding was my favorite dessert compared to other cakes, pies, soufflés, etc. With ice cream and caramel used pecans!
5. The oysters were fantastic!
6. The beet salad was great and healthy given the heavy meal but nothing that stands out. 

Service was wonderful as well even though we were looking for a light late night meal.

My wife and I came here to celebrate my mom for Mother's Day. We had the Drum Fish and the Shrimp & Grits! Both selections were fantastic! Their shrimp and grits is as good as it gets. The Drum was nicely cooked and perfectly complimented with the sides to create a delightful dinning experience. Great atmosphere!

Amazing oysters !! Went for happy hour ! 1/2 price draft beer which makes them about $4.50 . The oysters are .75 cents during happy hour and are super fresh ! They are served with cocktail sauce and extra horseradish !!! The fried oysters are $1.50 each but hey are soooo good as well !! This is a 5 star restaurant and no matter how you come dressed they treat you like you are a 5 star guest! Great service ! Great cocktails ! Great oysters !!! This is the place to go !

This place is so good I had to go twice in 3 days. Even my 3 year old was going nuts over their mac n cheese (from the children's menu) which was amazing. The people who served us were as awesome as the food. Even the chef (Blake) stopped by our table and said "hi." He was complimented by two thumbs up from our little one. We had a Luke burger, crawfish etouffee, roasted jalapeno grits, bread pudding, beignets, fried chicken biscuit. All were awesome but the etouffee was the best!
Happy hour from 3-6- so good. Best oysters. We had fried and raw. Sat at the bar. The bartender bragged that he made a better sazerac than the sazerac bar & I agree.

We came for the oyster happy hour and enjoyed the drinks, but were largely disappointed by the oysters. They were all very dirty and 2 of the 12 raw oysters we received looked like they had been mashed up or chewed and returned to the shell. I'd say they were not worth it even at the happy hour price, but I certainly would not pay full price for this. There are much better oysters in the city (and better oyster happy hours!).

Love this place! I usually stay at the Hilton attack when I am in town for work and it's super convenient and the food is pretty good. The menu is constantly changing so I never know what to expect.. other than deliciousness of course!

Oh-- and if you are in the mood to be mad-- definitely try one of their desserts! (Banana Bread Pudding, Creme Brûlée, etc)
We stopped by for lunch and had a great meal as was expected. Good friendly service. Really enjoyed the burger- cooked right- fresh ground- flavorful bacon.  On my list to try breakfast there.
I was in town for a conference and eating alone. Not only were my servers amazing and friendly, the food will having me traveling back to New Orleans again. I highly recommend a long dinner here.

I couldn't rave enough about how amazing the service was here. Shout out to our waiter, Kevin, who was working on his birthday! We got here and there was no wait at all. The staff from the hostess, to our waiter, to our busser were all very friendly. We were in NOLA to celebrate our friends bday and they overheard and without asking, provided us with a happy bday bread pudding which was delicious! 

The oyster were huge! They even put hearts in our French75. :-)

The silver lining here was the accessibility and extremely quick service...I always like to start with something positive.

My girlfriend ordered the soft shell crab BLT...except its apparently not a sandwich. Only one piece of toast on the bottom. It was exceptionally difficult to eat. The soft shell crab was supposed to be fried...I don't usually like a lot of breading but this had hardly any. The bacon marmalade was tasty but very salty. Served with a bland dish of seemingly boiled veggies.

I had the crawfish etouffee on "crispy rice." The "crispy rice" was odd, the best thought I could come up with as to why "crispy rice" was to liven up an otherwise very basic and almost bland dish. I was starving but couldn't muster the interest to keep eating. I took it to go because I thought that maybe I could get a homeless person to take a liking to it...the one I found seemed to have a similar reaction as me and didn't seem to eat more than a few bites.

All that being said, it wasn't the worst cajun I've ever had, but with all the hype I was highly disappointed. This was more like a cajun meal I'd expect to eat if I had ordered it in Minnesota or something, not NoLa.
Loved this place. Customer service was great. The Brussel sprouts were so yummy! Burgers and fries were also delicious. Dress code is business casual so dress accordingly. I recommend reservations.
Slid in for a quick snack before dinner. Had the best oysters, soft shell crab sandwich, crawfish and gumbo.
Best meal ever in New Orleans. Fresh taste and decent pricing. Will return to Luke whenever I visit New Orleans
Great place in New Orleans to eat seafood. The oysters are incredibly fresh.  Highly recommended In New Orleans.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday right before a flight out of New Orleans, and it was a great choice for last meal on our trip. We got the Lüke breakfast and the chicken and waffles, and everything was delicious. Service was great, and the atmosphere is awesome. For a place so packed, it didn't feel claustrophobic at all. Easily one of the best dining experiences we had this weekend, especially since a few other oft-suggested favorites disappointed. I don't know when I'll be back to nola, but I'm definitely putting Lüke on the itinerary when I do.

This is an above average restaurant but slightly below excellent. The menu offers different fare than typical New Orleans menus. The Shrimp and Grits seems to be the consistent favorite based upon other Yelp reviews and I can agree the item is good. My guest had the Boudain stuffed lamb chop. The Boudain was good but the lamb chop was overcooked (dry) even after specifically requesting it not be. The crawfish bisque was good but a bit expensive in comparison to others. I don't think you will be disapointed at Luke's but it is not likely you are going to be "wowed" by the dinner menu.

One of my favorite restaurant in downtown NOLA. We went there at 10pm and there still full of people. Their menu is small and simple covers almost every category. The cocktails were top notch. The peach flavored one (forgot the name) was my favorite. From appetizer to dessert, everything I had was satisfying. The burger was huge, but every tasty. Can be shared by two, save more room for the other good stuff. This is a place you can really be advantageous without much concern, because they are just that good. Even if you don't agree with some taste, simply tell your server and they will take care of you just like they did with my friend. She nicely shared her opinion about a salad dish and the manager just simply add a dessert for her. This is how a good restaurant should be. We will definitely recommend it to anyone loves food.

When I was planning my short trip to New Orleans, one of the restaurants my friends recommended to me was Luke. Apparently, Luke, a reputable establishment near downtown NOLA, is known for its 50 cent oysters during happy hour, its wonderful variety of drinks, and its excellent take on Southern cooking. I knew I had to make time to visit this restaurant.

For those of you who are visiting NOLA and are staying near the downtown area (e.g. Sheraton, Hilton, etc. on Canal Street), Luke is very accessible on foot. It's probably a five minute walk from Canal Street. Parking can be very bad, and so I don't recommend that unless you want to pay for parking or want to wait until the evening for free parking.

Unfortunately, I wasn't able to make it in time for happy hour (damn those oysters!). Luke has happy hour EVERY DAY from 3-6pm, and so if you want really cheap oysters (50 c for raw and a bit more for fried), come then. I arrived around 630 pm on a Friday night and this place was PACKED! If you are coming with a group, I recommend coming early or making a reservation. Since I was by myself, I was seated at the bar.

As mentioned, Luke is well-known for its assortment of alcoholic drinks. A lot of people come here just to party by the bar. If you are here just to drink, this is definitely the place. There's no real need to wait if you are willing to stand and the bartenders are very friendly. And if you are here to sit down and eat at a table, this is a great place for socializing. The atmosphere is wonderful and it's a fancy environment without a requirement for formal attire. Just a fair warning: it gets loud from the bar, and so this might not be the place if you want an intimate dinner. 

For dinner, there was only one page of entrees to choose from (rest of the menu was devoted to drinks). Coming in, a bunch of Yelpers recommended the Étouffée and the Gumbo and so I decided to get a cup of Gumbo and one order of the Crawfish Étouffée (so exciting!)

Gumbo (10/10). Not going to lie. This was absolutely the BEST GUMBO I have ever had. The soup was so savory, there was a hint of spice that wasn't overwhelming, and I could definitely taste that bit of seafood in my soup. In addition, the pieces of sausages were tender, and the rice blended well with the soup. It was $7 for a small cup, which I thought was reasonable given how tasty it was.

Crawfish Étouffée (9/10). For the first few bites (probably the first half), this crawfish étouffée was absolutely heaven. I've had and made my own before, but I have never tasted true southern étouffée until now. The crawfish pieces were big and plentiful, the sauce was so delicious, and there were also strips of cheese in there to give the dish texture. Furthermore, the rice was actually crunchy too. I've actually never had this kind of rice before, but it was an awesome experience. Unfortunately, after eating half of it, I started having an aftertaste in my mouth from the sauce. It was still delicious, but I ended up not enjoying it as much as the first half. This was probably also due to the crunchiness of the rice. It was awesome at first, but I would've preferred it soft. For the price (around $25), portion size is a bit small, but overall the étouffée was 100% worth ordering again.   

Overall, I was glad that I took the time to visit Luke. The food was good (omg that Gumbo) and the atmosphere was perfect for me. Even though I sat alone at the bar with no intention to drink, the bartenders were very welcoming and nice to me. The only downside was that if you don't speak up, they might ignore you and pay attention to people who are asking for more drinks. The price is a bit steep ($42 for one person), but that's what you get for such a premium experience. If I am in the area, I will definitely pay Luke another visit. I give this place an "omg, I'd travel 2 hours for this." 

Eat well and prosper,
The seafood gumbo was okay. Prion was nice size. No crab shrimp were very tender but very small. I wish I would have tried something else. Ice tea was perfect.

Service was top notch. Can't ask for a better service. Two servers for two of us kept it very personal and attentive. Baked stuffed oysters were fresh. I actually enjoyed eating oysters and crab meats separately because crab meat overwhelmed the flavor of fresh oysters. Pork chops was delicious. Pork chop was stuffed with shredded pork. It came with corns, beans, and broccoli puree. Highly recommend it give a try.

While in NOLA, you must try a John Besh restaurant. Maybe two. And I know most go for August. I promise you though, Luke has damn good grub and will not disappoint. Everything we dined on at Luke was just delicious.

We went for the lunch as it was right near our hotel so it worked out quite well for us. They do a daily rotating special and if you're smart, you'll go on a Monday for the Tabasco Honey Fried Chicken for $17. The chicken was crispy and the tabasco honey sauce it comes with? Divine! It also comes with a good size helping of red beans and rice. A more than filling midday meal.

I also was able to try the Croque Monsieur $16 - you can make this into a Croque Madame, as well, which is simply adding an egg on top. The amount of ham was inches thick on this beastly sandwich. Drenched in gooey cheese, it was anything but a basic ham & cheese sammich. 'Twas a monster.

Service was just lovely from start to finish and the dining room was a chill, business casual type vibe. 

For good eats, with non-jaw dropping prices from a signature John Besh restaurant slightly off the main drag, check out Luke.

After reading some of the reviews, I decided to go to Luke for breakfast. I wanted to try the Shrimp and Grits at an establishment that received good reviews for this dish. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and their beignets with apple sauce filling and a side of plum sauce. The Shrimp and Grits was superb! It was the perfect size serving. So much robust flavor yet it wasn't overwhelming. I was more than satisfied. The beignets fell short but not on taste. I've never had beignets here and the hardness of it was consistent with a scone.  I prefer it to be softer. The apple filling was perfection and so was the plum sauce had they made it more donut than scone I would've enjoyed it. The waitress was attentive therefore 5 stars on service.
The food here is good but compare to Nola standard I think this place mediocre, a 3 star and not 4. There are many other restaurant in this area that offer better items on their menu

Traveling through New Orleans and stopped at Luke.This is their "Monday Special". Tabasco Honey Fried Chicken with red beans and rice. This bowl of yummyness is $17 and so worth it. No one can ever say this dish lacks flavor but I did want just a tab more kick. Also at Luke in New Orleans is the JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP "EN COCOTTE... aka Shrimp and grits. For $21 is dish will have you licking the  bottom of the bowl. For an additional $13 you can add crab on top. This place was great! Great Service and great food! This dish gets  out of 5 from me!

Excellent food & phenomenal service! Special S/O to Rich Whatley "Richie Rich" who kept us entertained with his humor; He had the BEST dining room awareness EVER! We are definitely coming back to Luke's whenever we are back in NOLA. Five star rating, hands down!

Excellent Petit DeJeuner menu.  Our table had the Shrimp & Grits, Spiegeleier & the Southern Breakfast.  All of our food was amazing tasting and finished without hesitation.  The orange juice was fresh squeezed.  Would definitely return for breakfast again.

All I can say is YUMMY!!!!!  where to start.....the cocktails amazing! the happy hour oysters on the half...delicious! the brussel sprouts could be a meal in themselves!!! for dessert??? OMG the smores torte with the home made butterscotch ice cream??? you definitely cannot pass this up! I also highly recommend the yummy shrimp and cheese jalapeno grits....all of these flavors just rush in your mouth begging for more!!  We found this restaurant upon staying at the st. charles hilton a couple years back and we just keep on coming for more!!! I would say 4 1/2 stars EASY!!!!!

This was hands down my favorite restaurant in New Orleans during our recent trip there. I ordered the shrimp & grits (the best I had all trip). This is a nice restaurant white tablecloth & napkin. The ambience is intimate but lively. Makes for a great date night. The waitstaff was good. I loved my cocktail, I forgot the name but it was made of bourbon, lemon juice, and champagne. I typically am not a bourbon drinker, but this drink hit all the right marks. Dessert was also spot on. I ordered the bread pudding and it is everything you want in a bread pudding... (unless u r one who ruins good bread pudding with raisin) this is a must try place. John Besh is the truth!

Saw all the reviews here so wanted to try them out.   Not to mention they were downstairs from my hotel. 

Everything was good. Food had slot of flavor, servers were fast and easy going. 

Price is good for the environment.

Oh my lord. This is food of the heavens. First they start off with warm baguette and butter. You shouldn't fill up on this because there's so much amazing food here but seriously who can turn away fresh bread? I think I ate like 3 baguettes. 

My sister and I split the shrimp and grits for lunch (which is a really good idea, they give you two separate skillets which are ample portions for no extra charge). My waitress described the shrimp and grits as a food "that goes straight to the soul". And boy was she right. I have eaten shrimp and grits many a times, but this dish was a spiritual experience. The grits was equally cheesy and creamy- a consistency I didn't know was possible. Every time I would bring my fork to my mouth a fat string of cheese would follow. This is the life people. The tomato sauce was so flavorful and spicy. This is probably the best thing I've eaten in the world, and I've eaten a lot of things.

I had shrimp and grits 5 times in 5 days. Luke hands down had the best cheese grits! 

Luke's is an old school restaurant but worth it!!

I tried crawfish etouffee. It was amazing. The sauce is good, the rice is crispy and there were a lot of crawfish.  The environment and service is better than most of the restaurants in New Orleans. I will have a second visit if I could.

The food at this place is excellent. All the food we ordered tasted great and had nice flavor. We ordered the roasted chicken with potatoes, pork chop, and cheese burger and chicken tenders for the kids.  They have a good kids menu and the portion was pretty good. The staff was attentive and friendly. This place is a bit pricey and it's best to make a reservation before you go there.

All the food was excellent and prepared well.  Pricey to be sure (5 crawfish beignets with 1 tiny crawfish each for $15?), but very tasty.

The service was lousy with our disinterested waiter really putting a damper on the meal. The meal was saved when another waiter noticed, swooped in, and started taking care of us.  His name was Steve or Rich... great guy from Chicago.

At any easy $100 before tip for 2 people with 2 drinks, appetizers and entrees, I am not sure I can give a glowing recommendation.   It feels a little greedy for a small bistro with a very limited menu, but it was a very tasty meal.
75 cent Happy Hour oysters plus great service = 5 STARS!

Went w friends for dinner. 

Food: It was just okay. Swordfish dish was a no. Flavorless and dry. Ribeye steak...average. Lack flavor and nice char. Some got the butter on top and some didn't.  Limited menu.

Place across the street was awesome and meat seemed like a better grade. 

Location/site: Clean and cute. Smaller place. Making a reservation would be a good idea.

Service: good dinner service.
Great decor and service at this trendy spot.  I had the gumbo and the shrimp and grits.  All was excellent flavor and well prepared.  I don't even like grits and I cleared the plate!

We came for brunch and had the best shrimp n grits ever in my entire life!!!! And the other duck dish we had was also really good. Our server was really attentive and welcoming. The price is a bit on the higher side but since it's a hotel restaurant and has good vibes I wouldn't mind paying more.

The food is good. The service is great. Our waiter was very attentive. We had the rabbit pate, Brussel sprouts and crawfish beignet for apps - delicious! We had the shrimp & grits and seafood gumbo for dinner. The shrimp & grits were very flavorful but a bit too salty; the seafood gumbo was tasty but the texture was a bit thinner than I prefer but again, tasty. The bread pudding dessert was also very good. 
I had a bug in the pate and the waiter quickly switched out. I was running low on the crostini for my pate and I didn't even have to ask - the waiter brought me another order. Unfortunately at the end of the shrimp & grits we found a hair - at that point we were already done - bummed us out a bit though - we didn't make a thing of it.... but based on the service thus far at that point, I'm sure the wait staff would have done right by it. 
All in all a great dining experience.

I was concerned at first because they asked us if we had reserved a table (to which the answer was no) and they quickly said that there would be no problem. It would have taken a 5 minute table prep or we could sit at the bar if there as a spot open. We chose to sit at the bar and was served immediately.  Went for the happy hour and ended up enjoying the best oysters and cocktails. Highly recommend you visit here for the happy hour! You won't be disappointed.

side note- we did walk in with shorts and t-shirts on and I felt so out of place.  Perhaps to fit in you should dress nicely, but it didn't stop us from having a great meal.

This place is SO GOOD. I had a burger of some sort, but also tried a jambalaya type dish which my mom and sister ordered and some quail wings my dad ordered. 

Food: everything was absolutely delicious. The best food I had in NOLA, I think.

Ambience/waitstaff: the place is comfortable and not noisy, and the waitstaff is very chill and laid back, but also efficient.

Overall excellent place, the type of restaurant yelp reviews were made for.

Luke is one of the benefits of living in NOLA CBD. It is good both for lunch (best crawfish bisque you can find) and for dinner. This is the exact NOLA food we like - Cajun cuisine with European accents. Subtle, flavored, but letting you savor freshness and original taste of the food in every bite. Love the atmosphere and staff.

I didn't know what to expect with this restaurant as I'm not a fan of French or German food, but this place was excellent!  My mom and I came here for brunch, and not only was the food amazing, but the service was top-notch!   Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  The location is only a few blocks from Canal St./French Quarter, and it wasn't super crazy busy (as brunches typically can be).  My mom had the Croque Monsieur, which she loved, and I had the cheeseburger, which was so big I could only eat half.  The winner, though, was the brussel sprouts!  What??  I kept reading about how good they were and decided to give them a try... they were SOOO good!  I wanted to go back the next day just for the brussel sprouts!  My mom, who doesn't even eat sprouts loved them.  Tip - ask the girl at the front for the recipe, they have them printed on a card.  :P

The best shrimp etoufee I've ever had. 

I also ordered the fried oysters as well as the fresh.
The fried oysters were crunchy and met my expectations texturally but lacked flavor. 
You can't really mess up fresh oysters unless you don't shuck them right or serve ones that aren't fresh, but neither happened so I was satisfied with them.

They have happy hour specials every day so make sure you take advantage of the discounted price of 75 cents per oyster if you happen to want to eat oysters here during the 3-6PM timeframe.

After reading about how great the happy hour was, we decided we needed to try Luke.  We were a group of 8, headed in at 3pm for happy hour.  The food and drinks were fine, but the service was the worse.  From snooty hostess to the chippy servers, we felt unwelcome.  These are snobby people working here, they seemed annoyed they had to serve us.  Never again.

I've tried Luke's on several different occasions and have been impressed each time. They keep a steady flow of traffic and the staff is very knowledgeable of the menu so I've tried a variety of different drinks and happy hour items and have been impressed each time. Only think I would say that would make this place even better would be to have more seats at the bar but that can be easily fixed by showing up early. Always found a seat pretty easily in the main area; never had to wait to long for my food to come out; the fried oysters are cooked to perfection and for only $1.25 each during happy hour that's a steal.

HANDS DOWN BEST MEAL I HAVE HAD IN NEW ORLEANS DURING MY TRIP!!

Came here on a Friday afternoon, and even contemplated whether if we should eat here since it is slightly out of our budget (this place is more like a 2.5$ rather than a 2-$$ sign restaurant). Nonetheless, we figured we're here anyway, looked at the pictures, and decided that we didn't want to miss out. We were so glad we made that decision. 

We sat down, and wasn't sure what we wanted to order. our waiter gave us some recommendations and we ended up order the Friday daily special (Court-Boullion) with their seafood gumbo (which counts as a soup!), and their Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte".

The seafood gumbo arrived first, and was stuffed with literally all types of seafood! They had shrimp, crawfish, and even two whole oysters!! The taste of the gumbo was fantastic, I don't know how else to describe it. 

The daily special (Court-Boullion) and the shrimp and grits (shrimp "en cocotte") arrived after we finished our gumbo. They both looked beyond heavenly. My boyfriend was so happy with the shrimp and grits that he said "All shrimp and grits should be served like that"!! The presentation of both of the dishes were fantastic, and both dish was totally worth what we paid for! Plenty of seafood, big, fresh, deveined shrimp. The food was not oily nor too salty, yet powerfully flavorful. The cheese on top of the grits, beneath the shrimp, soaked up all the flavor. Every bite was blended with all different kinds of flavor. 

I don't know how else to describe this place, but if you want to spoil yourself with good creole food before leaving NOLA, this is the place to be!! This is as good as it gets!

3.5 stars. First the good news: the food here is amazing. Succulent pork, flavorful bisque, to-die-for jalapeño grits. John Besh knows his flavor profiles. But really, everything else about the restaurant was downhill from there. The oysters were tasty, but inadequately shucked. We had TWO servers, but still felt like we weren't paid adequate attention to. Getting our drinks, placing our order, and trying to pay took longer than we liked. The ambiance is confusing.  Are you fine dining? Or a bar? Or an Applebee's? Why are there newspapers hanging down as dividers between the tables? Some couples were dressed up for dinner - jackets, dresses, and heels. Others had shorts and flip flops. And then there were the fellas at the bar with Tshirts and hunting camo baseball caps on. Maybe it's b/c the restaurant is attached to a hotel? The hostess at the door had this really loud, piercing laugh that she unleashed more than once during our meal.

Food this good shouldn't be taken as carry out - unfortunately, that is the only way we can see ourselves eating it again.

4.5 review for happy hour.  The 75 cent raw oysters are surprisingly very good for the price.  Been to tons of oyster happy hours all over the US and this was probably the best one.  The fried oysters were hot and delicious.   Pate was a good balance of flavors. Cocktails were on point.  Brussel sprouts were okay but hey you cant please everyone with everything.

A couple of us wanted a fancy-ish place on the last day of our conference and landed at Luke's. They seated us inside, far away from the A/C, beside the kitchen area. Thumbs up for the fact they asked us instead of freezing us to death!
We ordered a bottle of wine, the Malbec. Our server was very nice. I ordered the petite seafood platter. Now I have ordered seafood platters a lot of times. The mussels and clams, especially, came spicier and more flavorful than I get at other places. The perfect, subtle kick to these otherwise strong-smelling sea animals. The oysters were fresh and tasted nice. The shrimp was great too. The way they serves food is quite cool. My friends said their steak and burgers were amazing. 
I also ordered the bread pudding because that was my last night at Nola. Nicely done, came with a dollop of ice cream and toasted pecans. We had a wonderful night for a reasonable price. Definitely going back.

This place was recommended by locals, so I stopped in for a snack and a drink. Crawfish bisque was delicious and had a generous amount of crawfish tails. Very filling and much enjoyed. Liked the atmosphere and the service was quick!

On my trip to New Orleans, I was on the search for good seafood and happy hour options because coming from Boston, happy hour doesn't exist! Lüke was the exact place I was looking for!

Lüke has happy hour from 3pm-6pm everyday. This includes 75cents P&J oysters, which are New Orleans local  and $7.50 for half a dozen of fried oysters and half off cocktails, beer and wine. 

New Orleans oysters are extremely fatty and delicious. Although I love New England oysters because of the super briny taste like I am tasting the ocean with every slurp, I still like the delicateness of New Orleans oysters. It comes with horseradish and cocktail sauce. I also tried the porchini and English peas agnolitti, which is like raviolis. It was so flavors and delicious. The pasta was aldente. The sauce was also super flavorful and tasty. I highly recommend this dish.

I also took advantage of the happy hour by getting a few drink. I got door#three and Pinot Grigio. Both drinks were amazing. 

Service here was over the top! Everyone was super polite, informative, and attentive. I would definitely come back!
fantastic food, very efficient and friendly wait staff I would definitely eat here again

This a thoughtful, delicious place to enjoy and have a great conversation. I was fortunate to stop by during happy hour. First the drinks were 50% off and oysters were 75cents fro raw and 1.25 for fried. At point I decided to try the fried oysters with a minimum 6 orders. This was my best decision. Crunchy, flavorful and not over fried but most important is you can taste the freshness of the oysters. I wanted to eat dinner like food so debating between the gumbo and ettoufee, I went with the crayfish ettoufee. It was creamy, yet the crunchy rice made it its own. I really love the twist and it was delicious. Totally new spin to a traditional dish.

The night was fun and the menu was clear.  The waiter approached with confidence and cheer. My last second decision left me curious as I decidedly asked said: your Lüke burger please. The waiter smiled and jotted it down, he looked at me and asked "how would you like this cooked?"

"Medium well please."  I replied. 

He mentioned with a sly wink that they tend to lean on the rarer side and I nodded in response, with a cheeky smile. 

With friends aplenty and drinks on the table, the rum and coke was quite satisfying. Just about 10 to 15 minutes later we found our table tight as food was incoming with no end in sight. 

Our party dined with glee and dined with joy as our waiter checked in often to ensure everything was satisfactory. 

Yes, oh yes it was. 

I forgot to mention that the waiter claimed that this burger was the best burger in all of New Orleans.  That's a huge claim, but I can say yes, so far, it is true. 

If you have the chance to dine at Lüke-do it. They don't live on the cheap side when making drinks and their food is to die for. 

Oh and they had no problem serving a cake we had baked at a bakery for dessert, we went on the occasion of a birthday. 

So yes, 5 stars.  Go eat there. You will not regret it.

This place is probably my favorite of the Besh restaurants. The reason for that is the because of the happy hour oysters (prices have changed over the years, by $0.25 each time). Currently the raw are $0.75 and friend $1.25 each. 

I love the raw oysters here, they are always high quality and very clean. When the peak season hits, they are the size of your palm

The fried oysters are also very good with a horseradish dipping sauce

The bar also has ample selection and probably has a few things you haven't tried before. 

Otherwise, the food is good, but the oysters are really the thing to come for

This a thoughtful, delicious place to enjoy and have a great conversation. I was fortunate to stop by during happy hour. First the drinks were 50% off and oysters were 75cents fro raw and 1.25 for fried. At point I decided to try the fried oysters with a minimum 6 orders. This was my best decision. Crunchy, flavorful and not over fried but most important is you can taste the freshness of the oysters. I wanted to eat dinner like food so debating between the gumbo and ettoufee, I went with the crayfish ettoufee. It was creamy, yet the crunchy rice made it its own. I really love the twist and it was delicious. Totally new spin to a traditional dish.
Happy hour .75 cent raw oysters and half price wine, beer , and cocktails. This place is the best in New Orleans. Not on the happy hour, but a must try are the jalapeno cheese grits!

One of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. I had the fried oyster salad tonight and OMG that was amazing. AND it's a John Besh restaurant which means the culinary fan girl comes out. 
Highly recommend for good southern NOLA cuisine.

The seafood gumbo and Luke salad were amazing. To finish it off I had the bread pudding. Definitely add Luke to your list when visiting New Orleans. Ask for Richie Rich and his team to make your experience.

They didn't shade me for ordering my steak well done. And when it came out, it was not burnt at all, but juicy, perfect, and wonderful! Not many people can do that!

Drinks were yumtastic and the atmosphere was chic! I'll definitely go here again!

We came here for dinner since it was close to our hotel. When we got there we just missed the tail end of HH which is 3-6pm .75 oysters! So sad we missed it. So we ordered three things off the menu ans everything was delicious! Flammenkuchen which is sort of like a flat bred pizza with lots of cheese and fatty pieces of bacon! And the ribeye with fries which was so flavorful and delicious! We finished off the meal with their famous bread pudding which did not disappoint.. Definitely a place to go if you are arouns the business area of NOLA @missericayvette

The main question I had going into this restaurant was the pronunciation of "Lüke". How does the 2 dots above the U affect the pronunciation? I asked the hostesses, and they seemed to be unsure. They said the ü is maybe pronounced longer like Luuuuuke, but it remains unclear. It is my personal opinion that the ü brands them as a fancier restaurant to charge higher prices.  Nevertheless, I really enjoyed my meal. 

We had reservations just to be safe, but there is plenty of seating in a separate section of the back. This place has an old school but classy feel to it. Plenty of nice artwork on the wall and decorated appropriately. 

I ordered the crab and shrimp étouffée. I know, it sounds fancy. It had tomatoes, garlic, and crispy rice in it. The crispy rice had a nice texture to it and complimented the rest of the ingredients well. Very flavorful and didn't find it to be too spicy. Plenty of food and the crab and shrimp were delicious. Service seemed to be good. Received food in a timely manner and my water was refilled consistently. If I am in New Orleans again, this is definitely a restaurant I would come back to.

I've eaten here several times before I was ever on Yelp and since I have been on Yelp I've never been back until the end of May 2017...that's about a 5 year absence...

Loved it before Yelp and enjoyed my brief lunch back in May...plus I recommended it for breakfast to my sisters and a group of their friends who were in NOLA for a birthday celebration just recently... So let's break down these 3 circumstances 

Pre-Yelp - ate here 2 or 3 times and enjoyed it immensely...never a bad meal..

Yelper - Always wanted to get back but something was always getting in the way and sidetracking me... until I attended a seminar in the Pan AM Tower across the street...was excited to do lunch but the people running the seminar were atrocious a time management so I was left with 30 minutes for lunch...not enough to truly enjoy this place but I went anyway and highly enjoyed my dozen on the half shell which is all I had time for...

Recommendation - the sisters and all their friends loved it for the breakfast the morning after the birthday festivities and if you think as a guy you can offer a dining recommendation that will please 7-8 women then you're an idiot...however this time I did and that's pretty much up there with seeing a freaking unicorn...

So take it from me, the see-er of unicorns, give ol' Lüke a try...

Oh my goodness. I am in love with this place. Delicious food; great oysters! Soft shell crab; jumbo crab. Amazing. The server we had Desmond is amazing. I can totally tell he is a foodie! 

Why oh why do I have to write more! This place is incredible!!!

Staff was friendly enough but the food was just so over the top rich and $50 for breakfast for two at the bar with no alcohol was very expensive. We probably should have just went elsewhere after studying the menu because there really were no healthy options at all. Eggs, crab and a side of greens could certainty be a healthy meal but I think it was all rinsed in butter before it was served. Not for me, thank you.

Went for brunch today. Had eggs in purgatory. Mediocre. Eggs over cooked. Service was ok. Not impressed. No high standards. Commercially average. Suggestion to check dishes before they leave the kitchen.

Father's Day Brunch, this place was close to my hotel and not too packed for a big holiday.

Waitress at front asked me how she could help instead of how many in my party. Before I could ask her what else they offer besides food and drinks, her coworker saved her and took over. Quickly seated, ordered Haphazard drink from cocktail menu. 

Had shrimp & cheese grits. The grits are really cheesy, so much so you can't eat them without cutting the strings of cheese. The shrimp, sausage, onion gravy mix that it's covered in is VERY tasty and flavorful. The grits are bland but it works with the shrimp.

I liked it and will return. Service was good too.

Came for happy hour before strolling to Bourbon street! Had the fried oysters for 1.25 each. Sooooo good! We also got the shrimp and grits, equally tasty! 

Half off all alcohol beverages during happy hour, which starts at 3pm! And 1.25 oysters either fried or cold. They are huge! 

Service was awesome! And the waiter sent us an extra drink, because ya know, why not! The place is a lil upscale and adjacent to the hotel. We got there just before the crowd started strolling in. Will be back next time I'm in NoLa!
This place didn't have anything German on the menu.  The burger was good but not $16 good.  Kind of overpriced for what they had.   It was okay but it is not worth the prices.
Great food and amazing service! They have a cool private room that we were lucky to get for dinner. To top it off, we had the best waiter ever!  Pretty awesome!

Such a yummy restaurant with a fun environment. The Jumbo Shrimp on Jalapeño Grits was delicious and cooked perfectly (we even added crab on top). Definitely recommend the Crab and Shrimp "Etouffee." It is amazing and served on top of roasted rice to add a bit of crunch. The service was great thanks to Jessie and Chi who were both very knowledgeable and very helpful!

Where do I begin? Everything at Lüke was simply spectacular!

I was in town for business, and after a long day of exhibiting at the Convention Center, we knew we would need a delicious place for dinner. My colleagues were discussing where they wanted to make reservations, and as they perused all the touristy French Quarter options taking online reservations, I decided to suggest this place I had bookmarked a few months back, after seeing some fellow Yelpers' vacation foodie photos. After a little convincing that they should save the touristy place for Monday in hopes of it being less busy, and that this would be closer to our hotel, they made us a reservation for four and our plan was set!

I was a little embarrassed because we arrived a few minutes after our reservation time, and one of our party had invited a fifth individual without updating the reservation. However, rather than making us wait until another large table opened up or splitting us as many restaurants would, they accommodated us within 5 minutes. I was incredibly impressed by that customer service -- wow!

Once we were seated, we ordered our beverages from a beautiful cocktail and wine list. I had a lovely St. Charles Summer: rum, pineapple, lime, toasted cardamom and Szechuan peppercorn. It was so smooth and flavorful from the cardamom, yet with a slight bite from the peppercorn. I wanted another, but decided to use some self control and savor the one I had. 

Although many of the items on the menu sounded amazing, I quickly decided on the fried quail, Brussels sprouts and a side of the jalapeño cheese grits (all small, but sharable potions, so everyone can have a taste). I was not disappointed by my decision at all! The crispy quail had a perfectly seasoned batter and then was drizzled with a sweet and spicy sauce and topped with cherry pepper rings. It was difficult for me to use proper manners among these new colleagues by using a fork and not just pick those bones clean and lick my fingers! 
The Brussels sprouts were fantastic as well, roasted to perfection, a little caramelized on the outside, but still crispy inside. Feta cheese accompanied them nicely, and the whole table sampled them eagerly, helping me quickly empty the serving dish! 

And of course, those jalapeño cheese grits... Just wow... Melt in your mouth creamy, with just a slight zest of the peppers, topped with melted cheese that had been bubbling under the broiler... I mean, I've met very few cheesy grits I didn't like, but these definitely rank up there as best around in my book. 

Our servers Christopher and Zane were extremely attentive. They regularly checked on us, answered allllll the questions my cohorts had (and there were a lot), gave us plenty of time to decide, kept the beverages full as needed and just did an all around amazing job of taking care of us. I'm so glad I had heard about this gem and it will definitely be on my itinerary on future visits to NOLA!!
Love everything about it! Best happy hour oysters bar ever. Fried oysters are amazing, best French 75 also.
I had breakfast here every morning I was in town.  The food was amazing and the coffee was perfect.  Great service rounded out the experience.  I would highly suggest the crab omelette.

Love this place. Went here four times during our stay in NOLA. Everything I tried was great. The shrimp and grits for breakfast are awesome and the oyster happy hour was great. Oh and you have to try the Brussels sprouts. Liked it so much they gave me the recipe. If I'm coming back to NOLA again I'll be back.

The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. I had the Shrimp and Grits...these were by far the greatest Shrimp and Grits I have ever eaten. I would highly recommend everyone try this place, you will not be disappointed. This was my favorite meal in NOLA, and we had some good ones, until this greatness.

Inexplicably poor food and service.  I ordered the Luke Breakfast.  The coffee was weak. The grits were salty and lukewarm. The biscuit tasted like a pillsbury pop-out-of-the-can type. My poached egg had clear egg whites and was cold. Worst meal I've had in New Orleans. My wAitress, while sweet, was clueless about the menu and returned twice to correct herself. When I asked for cane syrup sausage brought me bacon, explaining that they only have andouille sausage, which is incorrect.

In addition, when I sent the dreck back no one inquired about what was the matter nor how to fix it. The rest of our party choked down their food. Love Willa Jean but this place was a miss.

ETA-- I spoke to management on the way out and the best they could offer was that they hoped we would try them again.  Zero stars.

A local guy recommended this place to us, said if we were looking for good gumbo, to come here. It was near our hotel, so we walked. But it's just as easy to Uber it there. When we arrived, we were impressed with the cleanliness, the kitschy local decor, and the calm of the entire place. We were greeted by two women, both smiling, and happy to seat us right away. 

We sat down and it felt like we had two servers. Both were getting drinks and asking us if we needed more of this or that. The menu, though small, has so many great options for localized cuisine. And the server had his favorites, and shared them with us!

I came for the gumbo, so that was first on my list. I also order oysters everywhere, and Luke has crab stuffed oysters, and of course I ordered them. The local guy and the server both recommended the shrimp & grits, so that was my main course. 

The food came out quickly. First the gumbo. I had shrimp or andouille sausage or oyster in every single bite! It was amazing! My only regret: I should have ordered the bowl. 

The stuffed oysters came out next. They were creamy and delicious! It was like the best crab stuffed anything you've ever eaten. It was rich, so the six they give you is perfect!
