Then the shrimp and grits!!! The grits were so cheesy!!! The shrimp was cooked perfectly, and there were more than I expected! The andouille sausage was diced added this smoky flavor. The whole dish was to die for! 

If I ever come back to NOLA, I'm coming here first!

the shrimp n grits and grilled oysters were yummy. great service in the middle of mardi gras weekend .the burger looked ridic and most couples were sharing one with each having their own truffle fries. check it out! Great bar as well, enjoyed it very much
Great atmosphere, great service, and even greater food. Don't miss out on this one (Go for the shrimp and grits).

I had a really excellent brunch here. The mimosas were a bit weak but my shrimp & grits made up for the lack of taste in the drinks. The ambience was great for a casual Sunday and I can see coming here for a dinner date or business dinner.

I had a bite of a friend's French toast, I don't like food stuffed with creams so it wasn't for me. If stuffed food is your thing the French toast will be a winner.

Food was great.  Des and Savannah were fantastic!

Our large party would absolutely dine here again.

one of best meals I've had in a long time.   Crispy fried Brussels sprouts with toasted almonds, sliced apples, jalapeños, progress milk barn cheese and espelette honey in cast iron skillet - defiantly had some heat but very very good and jumbo Louisiana "en cocotte" - jumbo Shrimp, roasted jalapeño cheeses grits, andouille & green onion sausage topped with lump crab meat.  Friendly staff and made the recommendations!!
"Pearl" in the 19$ dollar oysters. Sounds like a good deal! If you are a high fan of "pearls", please come here and try their oysters! 4 out of 6 times you will find a "pearl"! Good luck have fun!

Came here while on a business trip -- it was fantastic.  I ordered the steak and it was one of the best steaks I've ever had and for only $35.  Well worth it. To be honest, the rest of the meal (apps and dessert) were not that memorable, but overall I would come back.
Everything was amazing. Being a visitor and new to the cuisine, I was surprised at how great each dish was. The staff was great too.

We had a great dining experience here at Luke. With a large party of 8 and then later 9, we got two waiters serving our party. All the dishes were delicious, and the waiters recommended shrimp and grits, duck duck rice, and etouffee. All the cocktails and drinks were delicious as well. The waiters are very knowledgeable, so feel free to ask them questions.

I went to Lüke for my birthday lunch with a co-worker of mine and it was WONDERFUL. Nicole made me feel so special and went out of her way to provide a great luncheon for my friend and I. It was truly a great birthday and I thank Lüke (and Nicole) for making my day shine.

I ordered the LÜKE BREAKFAST:  TWO EGGS COOKED ANY STYLE, BACON, HOUSE-MADE ANDOUILLE SAUSAGE, BUTTERMILK BISCUIT GRITS.

It was so rich that I was sick for two days. The bacon looked like it was deep fried which I have never seen before. The sausage did not taste like andouille. I didn't eat it. 

I would not recommend.

I visited New Orleans this past weekend and visited Luke for the happy hour on Sunday. Oysters were 75 cents from 3-6 pm - woohoo! We ordered as many as we could handle. They were fresh and absolutely delicious. The service was excellent. Tip: sit at the bar during happy hour and get a vip view of the oysters being shuck. Loved this place and would definitely return - not just for the food but the service!

All I need is a good waiter to tell me what I want and I feel I get the experience the chef was trying to express.  I got my waiter and I got my experience.... perfect.  Luke is now on my list for life.  I will be back with the wife.

Pretty nice restaurant.Shrimp and Grits were awesome choice.The best thing they had on the menu.I also had a chance to taste their kids fried shrimp and that was good as well. Over all it was a good restaurant.

My cousin and I dropped in here for the Happy Hour specials - oysters and fine wine? Yes please!  And these oysters...  So dang good!  And humongous!  And we had amazing service.    Our waiter explained the specials, fetched us samples when he could, gave us the history of chess pie...  now I judge a place first by it's service, second by the food.  This place passed with flying colors on both.  And the Happy Hour specials are a complete deal!  Go here!

Outstanding dinner for Creole brasserie cuisine.  Luke is a testament to John Besh's culinary magic in NOLA. It's next to the Hilton (across the street from the Intercontinental Hotel).  If you're in the CBD for a business conference or a visitor seeking an elegantly casual dining experience, this place is well worth a visit.  Why, you might ask? 

First, the appetizers are simply delightful. You can't go wrong with a cup of seafood gumbo or the crispy brussel sprouts (which go nicely with Abita Amber beer). I was impressed the waiter brought a card with the recipe for the crispy brussel sprouts.  Second, for main dishes, I would concur with other positive reviews for shrimp and grits (Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "en cocotte"). Third, the service was attentive and professional. If you are fortunate to sit in the back dining room (hidden from the main reception desk), you can watch the kitchen staff briskly performing their culinary magic. Fourth, the brasserie-like atmosphere gives a casual, elegant vibe. I also liked that several John Besh cookbooks were on display in the reception area (which is a bit cramped given the proximity of the doors). 

Although I came twice for dinner at 7pm, Luke Brasserie is open for lunch and brunch as well.    Given the layout and configuration of tables in the restaurant, smaller groups (2 to 4 people) may have an easier time with reservations during peak times. The entree prices may be higher than in the French Quarter, but well worth it for the high quality of food, cleanliness, and professional service.  Luke is a superb introduction to Creole cuisine!

I don't know about the rest of the food here... the oysters are A++++++++++++++.

Happy hour, 50c oysters, HOW CAN IT GET BETTER THAN THAT? Especially coming from LA where fresh (and even not so fresh) oysters run $2.5-4 EACH. My family and I literally came here every day we were in New Orleans during happy hour for their oysters, freshly shucked, incredibly creamy and light, so refreshing after being out in the New Orleans summer heat.

Just how much do we love it? 6 dozen for 2 people. Can't wait to go back and do it again. It's the first place I'm hitting up next time I'm in New Orleans.

Beautiful facility with spotless dining room and clean bathrooms.  I stopped by to try a selection of oysters.  The raw were sweet and creamy with a very nice home made cocktail sauce, but the char grilled oysters were fabulous.  It paired perfectly with the Bavarian style hefeweizen beer on tap.  The service was the absolute best I found during my week in NOLA. My only two regrets are I can not remember my servers' name and I couldn't get back to Luke's to sample more of their fare.
Semper Fi Devil Dawg

Can I just say the soft shell crab BLT with bacon jam is the greatest BLT I have had in my entire life. I also highly recommend the shrimp and grits. Great food and great service are pretty much a constant here.
Awesome, awesome, awesome! Fantastic consistent food with a pleasant atmosphere and incredibly gracious staff. If you like hamburgers try their's. I will be back and continue to recommend Luke's.

Yelp you've done it again! It was my birthday and we were attempting to eat at Acme but the wait was ridiculously long so we grabbed a table across the street...mistake. After ordering drinks we asked for the bill due to really poor service (think: server eating chips at the register next to our table). I searched on Yelp and discovered Luke so we took the short walk over.
Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised. We were quickly seated and served water and bread. The servers were informative, patient (we may have had a bit to drink), and friendly, but more importantly, the food was delicious! 
As others have said, happy hour is well worth it, we ordered fried, stuffed and half shell oysters along with a bowl of seafood gumbo for the table to share. BOMB.com! 
I wish I had pictures to share, but the food was so good I forgot. I do have one though...

This was a GREAT find. We went for a Sunday brunch of heirloom tomato salad and croque madam's. But possibly better than the food was the service. Roselyn took such excellent care of us that we had to call over the manager and make sure he knew how wonderful she was. We were treated like guests in the house of an amazing chef.

Make reservations! We stopped by when half of the restaurant was being remodeled and could not just walk-in.  We made reservations for the next day and came back. The waiters were very friendly and attentive. They had two servers  for each table. One waiter recommended the crab bisque. I didn't think it was that flavorful, so he took care of that for me. The shrimp and grits was delicious. Creamy and seasoned very well (slightly spicy). The bread pudding was amazing! Lots of caramel, ice cream and bread was soft and delicious. I would highly recommend.

My friends stayed in the hotel above Luke's so we went here for lunch one day. We did not regret it.

The food and service were good. Our waitress recommended the Brussels sprouts which were extremely flavorful, unlike any I've ever had. I ordered their chicken and waffles and was a little disappointed they use boneless chicken breasts but the taste was still good with the butter giving an extra dominion of taste. I didn't get the burger but one of my friends did and it was hearty. He said it was good as well. Definite recommend.

THERE IS DELICIOUS FOOD to be found here, thank you Chef Josh Besh! My coworker and I made last minute reservations for a late lunch, and they were busy, but still able to accommodate our party of 2 around 12:45pm on a Wednesday. We sat in the back room next to the kitchen, and tried:

-Seafood Gumbo a La Creole ($7/Cup, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=fn_2V849nbN3jss-BNXvSg&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): So delicious. We loved how chunky and flavorful this gumbo was (there are tons of oysters and Andouille sausage), and it put the version at Mother's and Commander's Palace to shame. A must order for any gumbo lover!
-P&J Oysters (Half Dozen/$9, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wLx1wqK8mdFK83yB9u_HXA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Super fresh oysters, and worth trying if you haven't had them before. They aren't very briny and not super flavorful on their own, but great with the cocktail sauce and/or horseradish.
-Luke Burger (Bacon, Caramelized Onions, Tomatoes, Emmenthaler Cheese, Served w/Housemade Fries, $16.50, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=RfrlmL8yqHnD4YbFyfQ7TQ&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Yum- this was cooked a perfect medium, and I loved how all the flavors worked together. The fries were also amazing, and had the consistency of the McDonald's fries back in the day- crispy but soft inside. This isn't the most authentic New Awlin's dish you can here, but it's still an excellent burger and fries- recommended!
-Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" (Roasted Jalapeno Cheese Grits, Green Onion Sausage, $24, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=chiuw3JVSTiu4XUZrN5hTg&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): SO DELICIOUS- a must order! The shrimp were cooked perfectly, and the roasted jalapeno cheese grits were amazing. I'm salivating a bit just thinking about this dish again.
-Bread Pudding ($9, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oXSFnooeonlP0IIfykEuYw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Yum, what a great way to end a great meal! This bread pudding comes with a giant scoop of ice cream and additional pecan praline caramel- a must order for any bread pudding lover!

Service was the only part of our meal that wasn't amazing- our server was ok, but forgot about us a couple of times so it took forever to order our food. However, all was forgiven once we started eating since everything was so delicious. Portions are on par for the prices, and we would definitely come back if back in New Orleans. Parking in this area looked really tough since there didn't seem to be much street parking.

Came here for a quick oyster fix during happy hour. On a Tuesday afternoon around 3:30pm, there was no wait, and the servers were very friendly and attentive. My partner and I ordered a dozen raw oysters and a dozen fried oysters. The batter for the fried oysters was very light and nicely fried to perfection. The raw oysters were some of the best and freshest that I've had. I love raw oysters, and Luke satisfied my craving in NOLA. 

I would definitely come back to try the other items on the menu.

My girlfriend and I came to New Orleans for the weekend. We ordered oysters and they were so fresh, huge, and delicious. . We also ordered one order of shrimp and grits which was plenty to share for both of us. 

Would highly recommend!

Very nice ambiance. This is another John Besh creation as well. This restaurant is located inside the Hilton on St. Charles across from the Intercontinental. My favorite hotel to stay at in NOLA BTW. The Honey Tobasco fried chicken dish is simply delicious! The only downside is that I believe it is only served on Monday's. Nonetheless, there are several great selections on the menu for signature drinks and awesome food. Don't cheat yourself; treat yourself when in NOLA!
Currently under renovation. We arrived and their computers are down and won't be able to seat us for an hour...argh. and no other customers are waiting
Came here for dinner. Had the ​flammenkuchen and fresh gulf drum. Both were very delicious. Kevin and Gary were very good servers.

Great drinks at a decent price for happy hour in a nicer restaurant. Specialty drinks were not your run of the mill usual, get the St Charles. Our server Rich, kept things light and relaxed. He was happy to direct indecisive pallets. The soft shell crab and shrimp and grits were hits.

The food here was delicious! Best meal we've had in New Orleans so far! Happy hour fresh and fried oysters were great and good size! 

Shrimp and grits was delicious as all the reviews had recommended! 

Duck duck rice was also excellent. I loved the crunchiness of the rice and contrast with the sweet fig. 

Brussels sprouts were the best! We even got the recipe to take home though I doubt we can replicate them as good! Haha

Last but not least the bread pudding was perfect for dessert. 

My boyfriend also had a couple drinks with the happy your price. I tried a sip of his Ruston smash and it was good! I don't even drink ;$
Best French 75 I've had ever!  The brandied cherry at the bottom is like a dessert at the end of your last sip.

Went for Sunday brunch.  Couldn't decide on what to eat so we ordered a little of everything to share.  Fried chicken and waffles were amazing.  Could 't get enough. Waitress was terrific.  Seated right away.  Pricy but worth it.

2nd best shrimp and grits I've had in my life! Chris bartender was great and made me feel so welcomed even though I was alone.  I spoke with some natives and they weren't familiar with this place but I followed my gut as long as the sun was up and took the walk to this restaurant and I'm happy I did.  I'll let them know tomorrow that they have to check this place out.  I'm not an oyster fan but seeing these guys "shuck??" the oysters gave me a new appreciation of them.
I love their Duck Duck Rice!! And drink menu!!!

I stayed in New Orleans and found this gem of a restaurant on Yelp.  Wow, the food was amazing and service was superb.  I had the shrimp and grits and they were the best ever. Even my friend, who is from LA said they were the best ever.

The food was amazing! The prices are a little higher than expected but it was money well spent! The place is nicely decorated and comfortable. The service was pleasant and fast. You must try the shrimp and jalapeño grits-they are life changing! The shrimp was so tasty and cooked perfectly- pairing that with the spicy, cheesy goodness of the grits and sausage you will be transported to tastebuds heaven!

Another great recommendations by my buddy Mark! I went for brunch and I was blown away by the soft shell crab in a jar! An explotion of flavor from the first bite to the last. You have to try it! I was feeling a little adventurous and I I was rewarded handsomely. I saved a little room for the oysters and a cold glass of a local IPA and thank goodness I did. It was an overall great experience and I will be recommending this place to all my friends.

Chef John Besh keeps knocking it out of the park.  Since arriving in New Orleans 6 months ago, I've eaten at four of his restaurants and have been amazed at each one.  So, when it came time to choose a restaurant to celebrate my birthday, I chose another one of his establishments, Lüke.  Service was excellent and helpful.  Wait staff was very knowledgable of the menu.  Although I have always hated brussels sprouts, he convinced me to try the appetizer of crispy brussels sprouts with honey, toasted almonds, progress milk and barn cheese. I hate them no longer.  They were amazing.  For an entreé, I had the roast duck with crispy rice, duck confit and grilled figs. Be warned that the duck is served very rare, which I like but some may not.  My wife had pan seared drum with roasted vegetables, almonds, brown butter and lump crabmeat.  They also serve it blackened (which should be outlawed) or grilled, but the traditional pan-seared is the best.  I remain a huge fan and can't wait to try his other restaurants.

If your in New Orleans and looking for a great breakfast try Luke. One of Chef John Besh's great restaurants. We went in the morning and tried their "Shrimp & Grits". It was a blend of smooth, creamy grits mixed with a variety of cheeses, spices, andouille sausage, and shrimp covered by two perfectly cooked eggs. Fantastic! The coffee is some of the best ever for a restaurant: brewed individually using a French press. The restaurant is a few blocks from the French Quarter on the St. Charles St. trolley route in the Hilton Hotel. It was a little more expensive that I'd prefer. You honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu - it's so hard to choose! Portions were large and filling. I highly recommend this restaurant for both expert, professional service and for the food. It didn't disappoint!

My husband and I stayed at the hotel across the street from Luke and we were so lucky to have been able enjoy Luke for happy hour many times during our stay. They have an amazing happy hour for drinks. The French 75 was the best. I still order the French 75 at places in Los Angeles and it doesn't hold a candle to the French 75 at Luke. They have a great deal on oysters too during happy hour. Their shrimp and grits are delicious too.

This place exceeded my expectations, I was just looking for a place to have lunch, and ran into this place, nice, cozy, traditional, but amazing fusion of flavors.  My wife got Brussels sprouts and I had a hamburger w/o bread.  This place has a great location between CBD and the French Quarter!! I strongly recommend it.

75 cents oysters during happy hour. I was in town to eat raw oysters and this place is it. I've tried 50 cent one down the street and came back here the next day. Luke's oysters just tasted fresher and 25 cents difference isn't a huge deal breaker. 

The waiter that served us for Wednesday happy hour was on point. Super nice at explaining the food and cocktails.

My wife and I went here for the first time for their happy hour.  We told our waiter that we were there for the happy hour and that we were not familiar with their specials.  He verbally explained the specials and I thought that I had ordered happy hour oysters but got the stuffed oysters instead.  They were good but I was surprised when we got a $19.00 charge for six oysters. I told our waiter, who had recommended the stuffed oysters, that I thought I had ordered happy hour priced oysters.  He pointed out that the stuffed oysters were not on the happy hour menu.  Guess it was my mistake but I specifically told him that were there for happy hour.

Luke's treated us great for the first meal on our NOLA Girls Trip. We both had the half price cocktails (French & St Charles Summer) which were excellent. The brussels sprouts appetizer was outstanding. Savannah & Dez provided superb service too. We'll be back the next time we're in town.

Atmosphere: The atmosphere here is very bright and trendy, although not very cozy. It's a good place to go with the girls for dinner but maybe not the most romantic location if that is what you're going for. It is also very loud so keep that in mind. 

Cocktails: DELICIOUS! I chose the Door#Three and my friends each got the Ruston Smash. These bad boys are dangerous since they are so tasty and easy to drink but still strong. Highly recommend getting a drink. 

Appetizer: We started dinner with the Flammenkuchen. Uh-mazing. The onion! The bacon! The cheese! All so good and so well put together on a very thin crust. The portion is also HUGE, even with three girls we couldn't finish it and it was very filling. If you're going with a friend or two for cocktails and an appetizer, I would recommend this one. 

Dinner: We had three entrees at our table... the Salad Luke, the Softshell Crab BLT and the Duck Duck Rice. I can only speak for my dish (the Duck Duck Rice) but it was so good. Keep in mind I was already very full from the Flammenkuchen but this crispy rice is seriously something I still think about a month later. It was so interesting and flavorful. The duck was cooked medium rare and very tender - to be honest I usually prefer my duck a little more cooked but it was still good. Everyone else was raving about their meals so I think all around it was a hit! 

Overall, I ended up being most impressed with the cocktails and appetizer and probably could have skipped an entree but everything was so tasty and unique that I was happy I got to try so much!

Excellent service. Delicious dishes and large one


We had the pork ragout. It is great, very tasteful and there is lots of it

We had the oyster salad. Wonderful, fresh greens and six large crisp fried oysters

The people at the next table ordered hamburgers. They are enormous

We will go back

Heads up this review isnt about the food. Its about the phenomenal service.

We made reservations at this restaurant. 

We were lost and the young lady who answered the phone helped us find the location.

When we arrived and reviewed the menu there was nothing my teenager daughter would eat. We had to leave. 

The waiter was pouring water for us when we told him. He invited us to drink the water while we found a more suitable place to eat. 

I have to give them 5 stars for not being pretentious or judgmental with us. When I come back to New Orleans without my kid you bet I will return.
The oysters were really good and fresh!  The drinks are tasty and I especially loved the shrimp & grits dish.  Definitely do the s'mores dessert.

This past Sunday, on my last day in New Orleans, my friends and I decided to check out Lüke for out last dinner... for me it was an "okay" experience.

Location:
Lüke is located close enough to Bourbon St as to where you can actually walk to it from there without it being TOO LONG of a walk... but far enough as to where you're away from the chaos. Honestly, I enjoyed the walk, and am glad that we decided not to Uber. 

Menu:
The only reason why I am giving Lüke 4 stars instead of 5 is because of their menu. Now, don't get me wrong, their food is good, but I do feel as if there menu is very very very small and limited... to the point where my friends and I almost left before we met our waiter. The menu wasn't extensive, and I found it to be a bit pricey. 

Food:
Now, the part we're all interested in, THE FOOD! I'm not gonna lie, Lüke knows what's up... they probably don't have a huge menu because they'd rather master a few quality dishes instead. 3 out of 4 of us started off with a cup of the Crab & Corn Bisque ($7)... along with the complimentary bread and butter... my other friend had a cup of their Seafood Gumbo á la creole ($7) we all loved our soup, it was perfectly seasoned, and the bisque was so so creamy (however, it was basically room temperature, not hot enough, which turned us off). Next, we ordered two things to share 1) Fried Oysters (forgot the price)  2) Fried Oyster Salad ($17) THE FRIED OYSTERS ARE TO DIE FOR! Omg, best I've ever had... I wanted to drink the dipping sauce by itself lol. The salad was delicious, but the bacon it came with was very salty. 

Staff/Ambiance:
Lüke is what I would consider an "intimate" restaurant; perfect for a date. It's rather small, and the owner stands around and talks to the guests.. he was a sweetheart. I don't remember the name of our waiter, but he had blonde spiky hair and he was really amazing, he was quick and answered all of our questions. 

IF YOU GO, GET THE FRIED OYSTERS!!!!

What a warm embrace of a send off on our last day in NoLa! I had brunch for a couple of relaxing hours here before our flight out and it was quite pleasant! All dishes from cheesy sandwich goodness and hearty NOla stews to the delectable bread dessert filled my insides with warm and comfy feelings of a grandma's love! I do advise to get dessert even if you are full to the brim and add poached eggs to the shrimp and grits dish! The servers were friendly and the interior decor was unique with a touch of modern simplicity. If you come during a popular time, do make reservations in advance!
Avocado and eggs over easy top this delish open-faced BLT with smoked bacon and toasted sourdough.  Brown butter waffles were light, fluffy, & crunchy on the outside.  Heavenly!

Literally the best dining experience from start to finish! 
We came in dripping wet no reservations and thank god the amazing beautiful brunette hostess took pity on me. We got sat with Elliot and Richie Rich and I can't even describe the duo it was like a beautiful dance that we were a part of and add in Dede the manager who like everyone else is so kind, funny and helpful. They made my night. 
This was my first time ever in New Orleans and all I can say is this place is the epitome of southern hospitality. 
I had the best time with the best food I have ever tasted. I'm so happy we got lost and found this place in the rain. Thank y'all so much I'm never ever forget my first time in the south!

I rarely give more than 4 stars but this place made it. Polite server (Deseree) and awesome food. The taste, dressing, and service for the price deserve 5 star. We ordered 3 types of food (mushroom omelette, crispy chicken, and egg sandwich) all were great!

Saturday late morning brunch. Everything satisfied me, dining atmosphere, friendly waitress, delicious food, classy interior, even good value!!! Must try when you're in town. Shrimp & grits totally recommended!!! The best fit cajun to my taste!

I was soaking wet from a torrential downpour when I popped into Luke's to wait out the rest of the storm. I was able to grab a seat at the bar and take advantage of their incredible happy hour offerings. Half priced beer and wine, and .75c oysters that were better than most I've ever had back home in Boston. I finished off my stay with a Luke burger, and I highly recommend it. Easily one of the most delicious gourmet burgers I've had--and the fries were great, too. The staff behind the bar was wonderful, and I hope to stop back in for another meal before the end of my stay here in New Orleans.

We wandered in on an evening hungry and grumpy from a long road trip but were quickly blown away by the great food. We both ordered the ettouffee and agreed that it was delicious and hit the spot. Delicious food and a nice yet welcoming atmosphere.

This was a lovely dining experience. We came in for brunch, were seated immediately. Our waitress was wonderful and I credibly helpful. She kept our glasses full the entire time we were there. The food itself came out fairly quickly for how busy it was. Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was attentive without being overbearing. Get the rabbit liver paté, it's amazing.

Went here for a business dinner, got a ton of apps to share: fries, Brussels sprouts, fried chanterelle mushrooms, mashed potatoes. Also, some sort of seafood raw bar- "Le plateau"? Such a well stocked tower of seafood- a little sumtinsumtin  for everyone, except for the people with seafood allergies, they were SOL.
For entree I got the red snapper with white bean ragu and garlic custard. So, I usually share or offer friends to try my dish, but in a flurry of utensils flying from my plate to my mouth, by the time I looked up and took a breath, I was already done... I guess it was that good ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ 
Then for dessert bread pudding amongst other things- even though I was stuffed I utilized my second stomach and tried everything and then finished everything. 
I ate some much at this business dinner, hope I didn't make a bad impression.

Jackson best server ever!!! I had the gulf drum and my bff has the soft crab blt.. I was amazing. I am a foodie and the food was the best hands now.. if you are visiting Nola please got to Luke.. I promise you it is worth the $$$.

The food was good. So, I'll start with the things I didn't really like. The brussel sprouts were not crispy and very, very soggy. They were drenched in something kinda like BBQ sauce and was overpowering. Don't get those. The Burrata was lovely but it said it would come with heirloom tomatoes, which it had but mostly cut cherry tomatoes, which was disappointing.

The pasta was great. Very flavorful and so many nice sized shrimp. The service was fantastic, the best I've had since being here. The panacotta was delicious. It was smooth and creamy with delicious fruit. So, all in all it was a good meal and I would eat here again.

Had one of the best meals I've ever had last night! Inventive and really tasty food, fantastic service! Kevin and Julian, our service staff, really made our night complete! Thank you for a wonderful dinner! We can't wait to return!

Luke never disappoints. I go crazy over their Brussels sprouts and get them literally every time I go there. I've always enjoyed my meals, service is consistently good and their deserts are amazing. I do like sitting in the upper area better, it's more quaint and not as noisy.

Delicious from start to finish. Drinks are half price for happy hour until 6pm. Oysters were a steal at 75 cents a piece. Got the chicken and rosemary potatoes and they were delightful. The brussel sprouts as an appetizer were insanely good. Everyone was happy with their choices and left pleased!

We stopped by for dinner, but filled up on appetizers. The service was excellent. We had the seafood platter and the rabbit and chicken liver pate. The oyster, peel off shrimp, and tuna were delicious. I am not a mayonnaise fan, so the lump crab was just OK. The pate with the in-house made marmalades and mustards was excellent. Finally the French 75 was the best I have ever had.

Top to bottom this place was amazing!  The food quality, presentation and wait staff were spot on or as they say on flek!  The kids and i sat at the oyster bar initially and talked to the shucker.  Good man that gave one the kids an oyster pearl! Made his day!

We ordered dozen raw oysters which were really big, cold, and succulent with side of fresh horseradish and cocktail sauce.  The fried oysters were even better!! Had to order another dozen of fried oysters!  

We then got our entreess, shrimp and grits, gulf coast fresh fried fish, Thursday special, seafood gumbo,mattzaball soup,  softshell crab,  luke cheeseburger, grilled cheese,,chicken and waffles,and chicken tenders. Then they brought sides if gnochi and brussel sprouts in small cast iron plate. 

Shrimp and grits was hands down the best ever!  Seafood gumbo had a dark roux but i think it was from the tomato paste. Really rich and decadent gumbo. 

Overall,DeeDee, the manager at lukes does a great job.  She is to be commended with her genuine personality.  Lukes is a must stop if you are ever in New Orleans!

$0.75 Oyster Happy Hour, need I say more? 

Seriously though, the oysters were delicious...all 26 of them. We also tried the chicken liver pate and the cheesy jalapeño grits. The grits, OMG the grits. They were so damn good, even the cold leftovers I ate the next morning were still delicious.

The Sunday morning started out a little rough since Saturday night ended at 5:30 am.  Got to Lūke around 11:25 am for a quick bite to eat before my flight out. I was a little worried it might take awhile since it was fairly busy.  I sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly. They made several suggestions, and I settled on the chicken cordon bleu sandwich with fries. It came out ultra fast and steaming hot. It was outstanding. I even liked the little cutting board it come on. Unfortunately they said this item is going away the following week-long but if it pops back up on the menu, consider it. 

I will definelybe back next time I'm in the city. Although the amazing sandwich is gone, I'm sure everything else is delicious based off of what I experienced so far.

Staff and food were all tremendous.

5 stars for the service ! Wonderful southern hospitality...
Now let's talk about the food. 
The gnocchi was delicious with a really nice creole tomato sauce. The veggie risotto was flavorful. 
They do make vegetarian pasta/ rice dish which is not on the menu for the vegetarians. 
The bread pudding was ok not that great, a little too sweet for my liking.

Luke was a good experience. I went on a weekend for brunch and really enjoyed the food. Everything was reasonably portioned but it was a little on the expensive side. I don't mind paying for food in any capacity but I spent $70 for two on brunch and that turned me off a little it. But even with the price being that high for brunch, the food was still great.
Wow! Chicken and Waffles, Shrimp and Grits as well as the traditional!!! All were simply delicious. Service was plus 5 stars... shall return

There are a lot of choices in NO. Luke's is very good. The fried oyster salad (with citrus dressing) was very good. Had it a few days later and forgot to ask for the citrus. Did not like the buttermilk standard dressing on it as much, but it was still good. My husband enjoyed the seafood gumbo and my son enjoyed the burger. The bread pudding was awesome.
If you're looking for a place that will have absolutely best food and original taste of New Orleans please go to this restaurant

I was pretty disappointed with this place, I had high hopes. 

I'll start with the good...Now the food was amazing - we got a few appetizers and cocktails. The Gnocchi was amazing! Like melt in your mouth amazing! We also had the Brussels Sprouts they were fabulous. The Tuna Tartar was also super good, menu describes as "with shrimp chips" it was just one fluffy crunchy on top of the dish. Wish it had more, but it was really tasty. Cocktails were amazing as well - best French 75 ever.

Now the bad, I was super disappointed with the service. They were nice but seemed out of it, we had two servers too, so for them to mess up was like really? There are two of y'all. The waiter forgot to put in an order of mine, so I was  

I'd for sure give it another shot, I hear they have a great HH. Service I'm sure is prob always stellar, they prob had an "off night" I'd still give it a chance again.
Breakfast was fantastic. Light and very fresh. Awesome service that's very hard to beat. Another success of John Besh's restaurant. Their BLTAE entree was phenomenal.

Lots of choices in this area for dining, Luke is amazing.  Happy hour prices are great.  Raw oysters were fresh, and the beer was cold, two important factors.  More of an upscale and trendy restaurant, impressive wine menu.  Three course meal was incredible, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly.  The Brussel sprouts were to die for.  This is definitely on the list for our return trip.

We arrived in New Orleans pretty late and were looking for a place to eat dinner at 10pm. Yelp helped us find Lüke, which was only a block away from our hotel. They have a full bar, but it was definitely far from a dive. The restaurant felt like a classy cafe but for casual people, which was perfect for us. Although the place was busy the whole time we were there, the staff was very attentive and the food was clearly made with care. My family and I had some of the best steak, duck and bread pudding that we've had in a long time. Highly recommend! The prices are a little high, but you're definitely getting what you pay for.

Every time we come to New Orleans, Luke is a MUST. We requested Rich as we always do and once again we had the best service and food! We tried the CRISPY BRUSSELS SPROUTS and they were some of the best I have ever had. I have always looked forward to the beet salad in the past but since they changed up their menu I tried the BURRATA & HEIRLOOM TOMATO SALAD which was just as delicious if not better! Luke will never disappoint and we will continue to go every time we visit New Orleans. Thanks again to Rich for making my husband's birthday dinner so much fun!
Good food, drinks, and service!!! Great place to chill and hang out with friends and family

We were visiting from San Diego, CA and read reviews to find a place to eat in New Orleans. I saw pictures and decided to give this place a shot. Holy Cow, if that was not the best decision I've made on this whole trip. In 3. Days we came here twice. We planned on coming a third time, to get food to-go, but unfortunately, time wouldn't allow us. Since I went with my partner, I had the luxury of tasting 4 meals in total, and each was perfect! We will come back to you 'LUKE' ..... and we can't wait!
Excellent place for drinks after work. Everything I have ever had to eat here is amazing as well. Great atmosphere. Super attractive bar tender.

I work nearby and got takeout breakfast here one morning. The food was out quick and very nicely packaged w a separate closed container for my grits. The grits themselves were creamy but the flavor was not for me. The chicken biscuit would have been absolutely delicious, had the actual biscuit not been hard as a rock. The people that work there are nice. I will give this place another try when I can dine in.

I really wanted to like this place more. The ambiance and decor is nice, and the service is excellent. The only thing for me was that the food was average. I came for brunch and ate the burger (it was recommended- they claim it to be nationally ranked), although the meat was tasty, the cheese and bacon weren't that good. I also tried the Madam, which was average at best.
Best chicken and waffles I've ever had. Would have posted a picture but I was too hungry to take it lol

The staff at Luke's is beyond amazing! Especially Josie. She deserves a raise for making sure our sick family member got her Matzoh Ball Soup and Jalepeno grits tonight. I can't wait to stop in next time we're in New Orleans.
Only came here for dessert and drinks. Banana bread was the best I've ever had. Oh and shot out to our bartender chris, he was great!

Ordered the crab & corn bisque to start. I should've ordered the bowl not the cup. For dinner I had the Fresh Gulf Drum (pan fried white fish) topped with crab meat. Great dish!! Service was great, waiters were friendly.

Food here was delicious! Everything tasted fresh and very flavorful! It's a bit pricier but very reasonable if you want to go for a nice dinner or a date night. I tried both their raw oysters and fried oysters and honestly I prefer the fried, I think it had a lot more flavor to it. The raw oysters were good too, you can really taste the sea water in it. Their shrimp and grit was AMAZING! I've had a few shrimp and grit dishes around New Orleans and this was hands down the best so definitely order this dish!

The Brussel Sprouts! These are must. The food is great and creative. The atmosphere, though...loud. I had to raise my voice to talk to my husband and strain my ears. We were seated right next to the bar and the noise was a little ridiculous. I wanted a fine dining experience and unfortunately the atmosphere killed it for. On a better note, the service was amazing. I'd go back but with a more casual mindset.

By far, one of the best places For dinner. If possible, use open table or call for a reservation. It fills up fast. Located in a hotel. And a celebrated chef puts together the menu and the team. We had the opportunity to sit directly in front of the kitchen - watching with wonder as the skilled crew creates our delectable delights! We started with oysters and burrata/tomato salad. Both amazing. Brussel sprouts were great but my company thought them a bit too spicy and saucy. Crazy as it seems, 2 of us ordered the newly added burger to the menu and our 3rd had the steak. Server ensured we had split plates and was always very attentive (sometimes a bit over the top). Cocktails were awesome (try the French 75). Limited bourbon / scotch choices and okay selection of wines. 
I made sure the sous chef and the team were recognized. By far a fantastic experience.

Restaurant was suggested for their happy hour oysters and drinks and it was awesome! We were from out of town and enjoyed our selves a great deal. Also had the happy hour drinks as well as some other meals

Can you say incredible?  My favorite place in NOLA. Everything is fantastic, the fried Brussels, are worth a direct flight just to get, staff is great, and all the seafood is 100% NOLA worthy. Go to Luke, it's worth it for sure!

So, we were told there was a two hour wait, stepped outside, made an Open Table reservation and where then immediately seated. Had fun waltzing back in to the same woman, looking her in the eye and saying. "We have a reservation". 

The highlights were happy hour 75 cent oysters and half price wine along with great service from Maddie and Kenny. The pate was great and generous. 

Lowlights. Crab and tuna appetizers were great, but tiny portions for $15. Did not order any entrees because I'm not a tourist and won't pay $28 for a soft shell crab sandwich or boiled shrimp. Spent nearly $100 and left hungry.

Best place we are at while in Nola! Firstly shrimp and crab etouffee was heavenly! The service was excellent - Richie Rich took such good care of us. They have a great happy hour deal on appetizers and drinks. Definitely a spot to check out!
My girlfriend went for happy hour the other day and Tristan and Vusi could not be more attentive and in tune with or needs. #flawlessserver #iwantedfornothing

We were here for happy hour and everything was delicious!! The fried oysters were perfectly crispy and the drinks went down almost too easily. The ambience is fun and bright, like a delightful party. I've worked in the industry for years, and the service was top notch! Tristan literally was there to offer me another beverage the minute I finished my French 75, and Vusi kept the water full and the table spotless. I can't wait to come back and I'll definitely ask for Tristan again!!

I have never ever experienced better service! We had to evacuate FL due to Irma and the manager- Ron- and our server- Richie Rich- did everything in their power to take our mind off of our worries!!!!! Our evening started with a round of drinks (which they took care of), next we got our appetizers- fried shrimp, a dozen oysters, crab bisque (all taken care of by the manager), our server also brought our children out some French fries (so they had an "appetizer" too) SO THOUGHTFUL! Next we're the entrees and they were beyond delicious! I had the roasted chicken (I think that's what it's called) and my husband had the Luke burger. He said it was the best burger he's ever had! Then dessert which they also took care of for us! Considering our day- they made us feel at "home" at a time when we had a lot our minds! For one dinner we could just relax for a moment! Thank you Ron and Richie Rich- we will never forget your kindness!
I absolutely love the FOODand the servers! it's a wonderful dining experience. Every tour should check out Luke's, you won't be disappointed

A great happy hour! 1/2 drinks, cheap oysters. The fried oysters were fantastic! I also enjoyed the Luke's salad. I will definitely come back on my next trip to NOLA. Service was very attentive. We also had lunch and  didn't have much time. We ordered the express lunch option and our server made sure we were out on time.
This was probably one of the best meals I have ever had in my entire life. Seriously. Omg AMAZING!

Can't say enough about this place: the ambience is great, the food is great, the service is phenomenal!  New Orleans on a whole is always an amazing culinary experience but Luke's took it to another level!  The stuffed oysters were amazing, the crispy Brussels sprouts were phenomenal (I'm raving about brussel sprouts people!) and people here were just awesome. Kudos to Didi the manager and our server Jesse!

This is a MINT JULEP review, we didn't have food.

We got our Mint Juleps to go. 

In short, this is most likely the strongest drink you'll have in the French quarter. Every sip, felt weirdly good in the sense that you know you'll lost fine motor skills in your body but you can't NOT finish a Mint Julep. 

Come here when you're ready to be fancy drunk, as this is a fancy place.

Pro Tip: get your Mint Julep To Go! We went there on a Saturday afternoon and the place was PACKED! No sitting or standing room, simply go to the bar, get your drinks, enjoy a clean hotel bathroom and bounce!

I like Lüke, their dishes were interesting and well presented and tastes great. The only comment I have is that maybe they should be light handed with the salt. We loved the stuffed oysters and rabbit and chicken liver pate as starters. Word of caution, the pate is pretty big and like organ dishes, it is very rich. So if you order the pate, then maybe order a lighter entree. I had the etoufee and my husband had the soft shell crab. We love them both except for the saltiness of both. Other than that, the cocktails are great and in general the food are delicious!

Oh. My. Word. We loved this restaurant! Service was fabulous and they rushed our order since we were going to see U2. I got the shrimp n grits and just wished I'd been able to eat every bite. Soooo good! Bf got a dozen oysters-super fresh!  A friend got the burger and it looked amazing, and he said it was great. Would definitely come back here!!

Stopped at Luke for brunch last Saturday. The restaurant is very well run, service was excellent, decor was great and the food was fantastic. Most of us went for the shrimp and grits which we all agreed it was the best dish of the week. The little gem salad was excellent as well. Highly recommended when you're hungry for some great southern food.
Best happy hour ever! Raw oysters are 0.75/each and fried oysters are $1.25/each. Good price, delicious food and drinks and awesome waitor! Definitely will come back!
I had the stuffed oysters which were the best I've ever tasted.  Great food, ambience and service.  Highly recommended and will come back often.

I'm still dreaming about the duck duck rice 2 months after having it here. 

The rice was soooo good. It was a bit crunchy and seasoned sooooo well. I usually don't like rice but I can eat the rich from this dish everyday. The dish comes with roasted duck which was very tender and juicy. But the highlight of the dish was definitely the rice. One of my friend ordered this dish as well and loves the rice as much as I did. 

My other friend ordered steak and fries. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. 

My boyfriend ordered the pan seared stripped bass. If I remember correctly one side was pan fried very nicely. He also really enjoyed the summer beans that came with his dish. 

This was probably my favorite meal from my entire New Orleans trip.

Overall I really enjoyed this restaurant. My wife and I went twice during our recent trip, once for dinner and once for happy hour. I'd highly recommend the happy hour (1/2 off drinks, $.75 oysters). During dinner, the service was a little spotty as it felt like pulling teeth to get information about oysters, but the food made up for most of it.

We came here for breakfast upon a friend's recommendation.   The shrimp and grits were excellent.  I added a biscuit which was steep for $3.00.  The shrimp were large and cooked perfectly.

The bloody Mary was the best ever.  I tried the bourbon milkshake which is a local special.  It was not sweet at all, and good with breakfast. 

The Luke breakfast has delicious bacon and sausage.  I would highly recommend.   The biscuit was ok.

After a few meals in NOLA, I was honestly over the rich cuisine.  My gf did a sh*tload of planning and Luke was our final dinner before we left.  A few of us (including myself) was craving Asian food HARD so we actually considered canceling our reservation.  Well. I'm so glad we didn't because it was my favorite dining experience on the entire trip.  

Our waitress, Savannah, was nothing short of amazing!  She def heightened the entire dining experience. She accommodated us when we told her that we disliked our vodka cocktails, she brought over a dish that we considered ordering and didn't, and ironically, it trumped the actual dish we ordered, and she made the sharing plates easier within our larger group by already halving our plates for the purposes of sharing. 

Highlights of our meal: 
-the charcuterie plate that had the pate 
-French 75 drink
-desserts
-Savannah, Savannah, Savannah....

We stopped at Luke lunch and dinner on our last visit to NOLA.  Service is professional and attentive, not overly intrusive.  The fried oyster salad is excellent.  My wife had the Jambalaya at lunch and there was so much meat that it could easily feed two people.  The quality of the ingredients and preparation are first rate.  I think Luke is a very underrated restaurant in NOLA and deserves more recognition.  I will be in NOLA again and will be sure to stop for another meal.
Fantastic food at Luke. Strong, custom cocktails too. Spaetzel, beet salad, shrimp and grits.

Wanted to try a John Besh restaurant while in New Orleans, so decided on Luke since the menu had a nice balance of seafood and non-seafood items. Made reservations for 7:45 and were seated immediately. I absolutely loved the ambiance and decor here- modern and rustic but open raw bar gave a great nautical feel.

Appetizers: We ordered half a dozen oysters on the half shell and the brussels sprouts to start. The oysters were large, juicy and extremely fresh- would return just for the raw bar alone. The roasted brussels sprouts were literally the best I've ever had. The combination of heat from the jalepenos and sweet from sliced green apples gave a unique but balanced flavor- definitely going to try replicating this recipe at home. 

Dinner: I ordered the shrimp and crab etouffee which was served over fresh homemade cavetelli. It was spicy and light and just an overall outstanding dish! My boyfriend ordered the Luke burger which was served on a fluffy golden brown biscuit with carmelized onions, bacon and cheese. It was cooked perfectly! 

Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great restaurant near the French Quarter but far enough away from the craziness!

Ambience and decor is wonderful. Service was excellent. Gary- our server was so nice and served well, and Ronald- the manager valued my feedback. his suggestions for things to do turned out to be great. 
The food was terrific! Oysters were fresh and really good. The pate is not to be missed. It had the perfect consistency, was served at the right temperature and the relishes served alongside were so creative and complimented the pate.
Our drinks were very nice as well- the French 75 and door#3.

We opted Luke for a fine dining spot in NOLA. We went for happy hour. It saddened me a bit though, because we came right before happy hour ended, and our server returned later, saying he could not grant us happy hour pricing. he did kind of meet us in the middle, with pricing though. Our trip to NOLA would not have been the same if we hadn't come here. It was a little ways off from bourbon street, but still very walkable.

The service was SO attentive, and knowledgeable.  We had the P &J oysters. BEST raw oysters in NOLA. They were clean, meaty, and just tasted so good. We inhaled these. ordered more and more, and these were easily the main component of our meal. We ordered salads and soups on the side.  if you can make it for happy hour, i'd definitely come back here. They also had half-priced glasses of wine, with a great variety offered. 

As a complimentary appetizer, we were given brussel sprouts. I'd NEVER had these in my life, but dang. These were great! nice sauce/dressing, some bacon, and a good crunch and texture to these. Makes me sad that I've been missing out on these all my life! I'm so glad i had something i never thought I would try before.

To finish, we had the bread pudding, which was great for a southern staple. Not overly sweet or rich.

Five stars for their Brussel sprouts alone!  Service was amazing as well.  

We made a 9:30 pm Friday night thru Open Table.  We were a little surprised to find the restaurant only about half full when we arrived to be seated.  However, we were just glad we could quickly get seated and get something to eat!

I ordered the matzo ball soup and Brussel sprouts.  The soup was ok, nothing too amazing.  But the sprouts - they are deserving of a five star review all on their own!  Totally different than any order of Brussel sprouts I've had before.  I'm not usually a fan of vegetables with any kind of sweet glaze/flavor, but the combo with all the spice was really amazing.  My husband, who can't stand Brussel sprouts, even tried them and said they were good!

The wait staff was really attentive, kind and quick.  My only regret is I didn't try the beet salad.  I spoke to a friend the day after we dined at Luke and she said the beet salad is her favorite salad ever.

A New Orleans legendary chef John besh has this jewel and a more formal restaurant August. He rules New Orleans.  But Luke's has the best burger I have ever had. Period  broiled oysters and shrimp and grits. Don't fall far behind.  A must when in New Orleans

Amazing! First off, our lovely animated waitress was THE bomb. I wish I could remember her name, but she was funny, attentive, and her nails had me gagging at how gorgeous they were. The place was clean, the food was delicious. Honestly, everything on the menu looked great. We ordered grilled oysters (as you do) which were great. My favorite part of the meal was the Shrimp and Grits, these honestly were the best grits I've ever had.  We were only visiting for a few days, but when we come back to New Orleans we plan to eat here again.

"Folks have a certain way o' doin' things down here".  Luke's is no different.  Great example of all the cultures in NoLa coming together on a table.   Duck Duck was very good but note the rice is crisped in olive oil so it carries that flavor throughout the meal but the crispy rice was a great texture/flavor addition to the duck. Their Étouffée comes on cavetelli which added a great twist to a big easy tradition. Cost was in-line, no Jacket required, reservations needed, would go again.  Bon Temps!
Fine dining and service type of place, food was seasoned perfectly and cooked the way I asked, the rib eye was soft and every bite was consistent, this is a place I will be back to eat.
Wonderful dining experience! Everyone was so friendly. Food was delicious and the dessert was to die for! One of the best meals I've had in my whole life.
Delightful happy hour experience. I recommend the raw oysters, gumbo, LA rabbit and Chicken pate, and St Charles Sour cocktail (not the French 75).
Might be the BEST omelette ever (crab) - very light, fluffy and tasty!! The shrimp and grits was AMAZING! Great service! Highly recommend for breakfast. Can't wait to try dinner!

Everything was excellent. I had the shrimp etoufee, which had pasta in it similar to gnocchi. I ate every bite. So delicious. My husband had the Luke Burger, and oh my gosh that was good. If I ever come back, I would get that burger. This was probably my favorite restaurant of our trip.

I came to Luke's for happy hour oysters with a friend-- she lives here, but it's my first time in the city. I've never had oysters before, but she told me she only gets them here, because they're always really clean and don't ever feel gritty. I don't have much to compare to in that respect, since this was my first experience, but they were definitely grit-free.

Far and away though, the best part about our meal here was the service. Our server, Rich, was attentive and pleasant without hovering, and really went above and beyond to ensure we had a good experience. He found out I was visiting NOLA, and that this was my first experience eating oysters, and really rolled out the proverbial red carpet. We asked for a sauce recommendation and were then given an incredible off-menu 8-sauce sampler (the duck sauce was to die for, but the béarnaise, 5-minute tomato, aioli, and signature Tabasco ranch were also wonderful. I wouldn't recommend the pepper jelly, but this may be more of a texture thing). 

My friend and I have both worked in commercial kitchens, and I appreciated the extra time and effort it took to pull that together for us--it was a little thing, but it elevated our whole evening. Our glasses were never empty, the food was always out quickly, and everything was delicious- but really, the service is what made this such a great way to kick off my trip to New Orleans. Would 12/10 recommend.

Might be the BEST omelette ever (crab) - very light, fluffy and tasty!! The shrimp and grits was AMAZING! Great service! Highly recommend for breakfast. Can't wait to try dinner!

So we came back for happy hour and light dinner. Good oysters, especially at .75 per.! The duck and chicken liver patte was excellent! This is definitely a favorite restaurant.

We are in town for my friend's 21st birthday and we chose the right place for a celebratory birthday dinner!

We had a party of 4 and we came around 5:30 PM and we're seated right away! Everyone was so incredibly friendly. We were greeted with smiles and upon seating, the hostess knew our name. 

The restaurant itself is very big, with multiple areas for seating, the front section has a bar, and the back area is more quiet. We were seated in the back right next to the open kitchen, where through a glass window, we saw the chefs prepare the food. We were greeted by two waiters, Jesse and Zain (I hope I spelled that right) and they were so friendly and professional. I loved the way they filled the water for the ladies first, then the gentlemen. Most people don't see those details but I caught it and was very pleasantly surprised. We were instructed through the menu and given recommendations and we loved everything they recommended!

HAPPY HOUR is from 3PM-6PM which includes a deal of: $0.75 Raw Oysters and $1.25 Fried Oysters! The drinks are all half off as well, I believe. It is such a steal for such a great place. We ordered 3 dozen raw oysters, half a dozen fried. We also ordered two cocktails! We told our waiters that it was my friend's birthday, and when they presented the drinks for us, they had "21" written on the foam in his! It was so cute! Then, we were given our first round of food. As we were eating, they presented us with a dish and said it was on the house. I was so surprised to be treated so well! For dessert, we got a free order of bread pudding for my friend's birthday as well. They came out and sang for him, and embarrassed him just the right amount LOL

The raw oysters were served on ice and were so fresh. I wasn't expecting the fried oysters to be as good but they were amazing as well! The presentation is great for pictures as well. The brussel sprout dish was so delicious. Even if you are not a vegetable (or brussel sprout) loving person, the sauce was so good I'm positive you'll fall in love as well! The bread pudding was topped with candied pecans and a scoop or vanilla bean ice cream! It was just the right balance of creamy, crunchy, hot, and cold. I would come here just for the birthday dessert, if I could. 

The service was out of this world. I have been to a variety of places on my trip here but this restaurant has got to have the best service to date. The amount of intricacy they put into serving and how friendly they are is amazing! The servers are very professional, polite, and helpful! If you ever go, ask for Jesse and Zain! They were so awesome. 

Our tab came out to be under $45 for 3 dozen oysters, half a dozen fried oysters, and a cocktail, which is great. I would absolutely recommend coming here if you are looking for a great experience with delicious food for an unbeatable price. It's the perfect place for birthday celebrations! I will definitely be returning when I come to visit NOLA again. Till next time!!

Came here for my birthday brunch (visiting from New York) and the service was amazing. Our server Matt was so pleasant and just simply amazing. He brought me a banana pudding dessert with a candle on it and omgggg it was amazingggg!! Only thing i didn't like were the grits that had jalapeños (hate jalapeños) and they ran out of regular grits that they serve for Breakfast (our reservation was at 1pm). Other than that everything was scrumptious. My best friend had the chicken and waffles that she devoured. Great and cute spot
75 cent oysters and half off cocktails and beers 3-6pm errrdayy! I can definitely get behind that errdayy! Much love for lüke and NOLA :)

Was staying and working near Luke so it was home away from home. The burrata tartine -- scrambled eggs, burrata, roasted tomatoes, ham and sourdough tartine -- is the best breakfast I've had in ages.  Lunch and dinner menus are traditional New Orleans fare - exactly what you want. The cochon banh mi is as experimental as it gets and delicious. Jalapeño fried chicken was a massive portion for lunch -- ate half and still needed a nap. Portions run from large to huge.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  And very welcoming when I fell in late without a reservation.

I'm sure the oysters here are good but if you don't care for oysters this restaurant doesn't care for you. 

I know there are a ton of great reviews here but if you do not like oysters you do not want to eat here. I really thought any place in New Orleans could certainly boil Shrimp for a dish the equivalent of shrimp cocktail. 

The first sign the shrimp was over cooked is that you couldn't get it to peel. The next clue was that it was chewy. We asked the waiter if we could get another order. Twelve came on an order so when he brought a replacement order he only brought 10 because, "we had eaten two." He watched me peel the second order which was exactly the same over cooked status except this time we noticed the shrimp hadn't been deveined. 

A woman we assumed was the manager came over and said she'd take them back and see what the cook could do. She brought back eight shrimp (again because we had tried to eat two more) and they were peeled, however you could tell the shell did not come off easily because some of the shrimp were a little mangled. One had a particularly large vein of poop still in it this time. 

When we were still displeased she asked me where I was from. I told her I was not from a coastal state but that my husband and I travel a lot. She said she asked because a lot of people do not realize that is the way they serve shrimp in New Orleans, not deveined. They finally comped the shrimp and we left. We still left a tip because we had eaten our soup which was good. 

When I returned to my hotel room I called my niece who was born and lived in Baton Rouge until she was a teenager. She laughed and said that is not how they serve shrimp in New Orleans -- not deveined and over cooked. And then we discussed the count down of shrimp as they returned to our table each time. That is really tacky service. 

This is my fourth trip to New Orleans and the first time I have ever had a bad meal experience.

Every time I'm in New Orleans, I try to swing by for the oyster happy hour here because it is such a great deal! 

I came with a group of 10ish, right at 3pm on a Monday, just in time for happy hour. If I recall correctly, it's $0.75 on the half shell, $1.25 for fried oysters, and half off select wines/beers/cocktails. We made a reservation ahead of time and we were seated almost immediately. The staff was very friendly, patient, and accommodating. The oysters were plump and fresh. Drinks were fantastic. The decor and atmosphere are on the upscale side, but not pretentious. My group had a great time and will definitely be coming back the next time we're in the area!

Came here with the team one night so we shared a few things. The French 75 is a NOLA classic cocktail and must be tried. The kuchen flatbread is fantastic. We got the PJ Oysters and they were amazing, I preferred the raw but the fried were good too. The Luke Salad is absolutely amazing. The shrimp ettouffe is served with amazing homemade pasta. (I can't spell, my apologies) The gnocchi is made on premises and also great. Finally, many folks at the table got the matzo ball soup. It was good. The matzo balls were a little mushy on the outside but good and good texture in the center. Our server (maybe Elliot?) was great and reminded me of Crispin Glover/Cillian Murphy. Highly recommend.

Went on a trip NOLA in May with family and friends. We tried out Luke since it was right across the street from the hotel. We ended up eating here 5 more times during the trip! Each time it was great.
The service was amazing and the food even better. I tried a bunch of stuff I've never had before, loved all of it. One night my father in-law got a steak, it was perfectly cooked to the temp he ordered. If we ever go back to the area, we will definitely stop in again!
Quick and tasty, everything tasted like it was from an NJ diner, with a New Orleans twist. It was fun to look at their murals on the walls too.

This breakfast was OUTSTANDING. We ordered the shrimp and grits and the chicken and waffles. Both were so different and flavorful. The shrimp and grits were decadent with the rich savory jalapeño cheese grits. When you add in the eggs and the andouille sausage...it's just wow. The chicken and waffles is HUGE! The jam topping was a great sweet and spicy accompaniment. I'm in a food coma now.

We only enjoyed a couple of cocktails and the pâté of Louisiana rabbit & chicken livers but must say that the entire experience was great! I also paid close attention to the atmosphere and how others seemed to be enjoying their experience and it was a really nice sight. I saw attentive servers, smiling patrons, and I enjoyed all the great smells as dishes past by us at the bar. Oysters is one of the only food I do not eat but I can say that this definitely seems to be the place to come for those fresh ocean beauties! I'm glad my friend recommended this place.

I've not been that impressed with Luke.  Food is good, not great, and service is hit-and-miss.  If you love oysters, you'll probably like it more than I do.  Venturing beyond the oysters is not as rewarding.  You're paying for the John Besh name more than anything really great.

Definitely recommend the pate. Very rich - way more than enough to share among two people. 
If you're not an Oyster connoisseur and just want some fresh oysters, go for the P&Js (local oysters) and skip the expensive stuff. 

Not a huge fan at all of the grilled stuffed oysters. The "stuffing" isn't enough crab and mostly cheese for the price. The oyster itself was also incredibly chewy. 

Overall the experience was pretty good!

I don't think I'll return to Luke.  The boiled shrimp were over-cooked; the white wine was only slightly chilled (needed ice); and the seafood gumbo, while tasty, was overloaded with okra and sausage...too many other better options in this city.

The food was exciting, multi-dimensional and vibrant- not unlike the service! Everyone enjoyed their meal, and we even caught a glimpse of a celebrity chef enjoying a dinner here! Per the waiters recommendation, I had the shrimp n' grits and it was unbelievably good- I will dream about it for years to come. Warm, diverse, convincingly authentic- though my friends felt the same way about their meals!

We stopped by w/o reservation and they said they had nothing available.  Hubby checked Opentable and there was one available. Booked it online, went back and they sat us immediately. Servers Gary and Kevin were great.  The small plates of gnocchi and brussel sprouts were fantastic. Amazing flavors creatively put together. Manager even gave us the recipe for the brussel sprouts. Hubby had prime rib w/creole spices topped w/ crab meat (at servers suggestion).  Fantastic combination.  Highly recommend for sit down or bar experience.  Crowd is more upscale late 30-40's crowd. Nice if you want to get away from the typical town scene.

First... after indulging in what I will say is the most explosive flavorful shrimp and grits, chicken and waffles, oysters and mimosas... ever... we wondered how it was possible someone could rate this place less than 5 stars. I could not believe someone rated this place 1 star after saying their shrimp were not cooked correctly... like there is a single way a shrimp is supposed to be prepared! And then requested the same thing 3 times... please...

The service was great! Not only was the staff friendly and informative for this Alaskans random questions about Cajun food and the South in general, 3 staff even came over to help with our plans for the day as we were tasked with sourcing exotic plants for the arch at a wedding!

If u are trying to treat yourself for your first time in New Orleans in the 20-50 per person. range, this is the spot!

Thanks Luke!

All 3 of us had fantastic meals here. The chef made a delicious vegan entree for my wife as nothing on the menu was vegan. The bread pudding in the rear of the photo was good. The smores desert in the front was outstanding!  It was far better than the menu described it. We had excellent service as well and I would highly recommend this restaurant for a classy, yet still affordable night out.

Tremendous experience here at Luke! We popped in for Happy Hour before our dinner at Arnaud's and were greeted by the lovely Ms. Elizabeth- a true warm and inviting welcome! We let her know we were just here for HH ( a rec from a NOLA native) and sat at the bar right in front of the buzzy oyster bar! The bartender was just precious, acknowledged us immediately and served us the most elegant French 75! These were to die for and went down a little too easy! The oysters and chilled shrimp were some of the best I have every had! I am drooling thinking about them! We loved the interaction between the bartenders and the shuckers- a pro of sitting at the bar! The entire team recognized it was our ten year anniversary and gifted us a glass of bubbles and a heart-donned French 75 to mark the occasion. Little touches like that, exceptional service and wonderful seafood have made us Luke fans for life! Thank you!!

Best fried oysters ever. And best brussel sprouts ever. Hands down. No question. We wanted to get more food but weren't starving so we decided on fried oyster salad which came with a generous amount of oysters and were perfectly fried and with a perfect texture! The shrimp and grits was also just perfect and the brussel sprouts....I need that recipe- some magical honey balsamic vinaigrette w almonds and cheese on top. Will need to go back again whenever we're back in New Orleans.

Lüke, how I love you,
I thought I had experienced happiness before we met, 
You introduced me to the level above happy, 
Pure perfection,
Elevated elation, 
JOY!

Lüke, simple words are not enough,
To express my love,
My devotion, 
To your deluctable food,
Your incredible service, 
Every part of my experience with you, 
PERFECTION!

Lüke, I wish I could keep you all to myself,
But like fine art, 
You must be enjoyed by all,
Thank you for your existence.

In all my years of coming to New Orleans this was the first John Besh restaurant at which I've dined. Since I don't have anything to compare it to I'm not sure if his recent resignation had anything to do with our evening, but I've got to say there was a relaxed and exuberant attitude pervasive throughout the restaurant. 
We started with a special request cocktail that slightly confounded the waiter and bartender. At first I thought, "Uh, oh" were in for a long and troubled night. But instead of making it a problem they made it a great learning experience and reveled in discovery something new. I think the fact that we were adventurous got our waiter Rich to really have some fun with us. We ordered small plates and large plates and everything we ordered was beyond perfection. The P & J raw oysters are some of the best in the city. Clean, briny, fresh. (The day before we were stuck in a late meeting and my companion wanted to get a plate of oysters afterwards. A friend had suggested the oyster bar at Luke but my friend wanted to go to Acme [thumbs down on that one]. After tasting the P & J's at Luke last night I'm kicking myself for missing out on another opportunity to experience these.) One of our party had ordered the oysters on the shell but they delivered the stuffed oysters instead. They didn't hesitate to fix the mistake and the waiter shucked the 1/2 dozen (+1!) himself. Oh, and the stuffed oysters were left for us to enjoy with the restaurant's compliments. Shrimp & Grits - spectacular. Perfectly cooked shrimp with perfect grits seasoned with roasted jalapeno & cheese. Other highlights were the Fried Oyster salad, Crab & Corn Bisque, and Seafood Creole Gumbo. We didn't order it, but saw the Luke Burger with duck fat fries being delivered to several other tables. If you order it, you better have an appetite. It looks like a pound or more of beef. Our friends have had it before and say it's amazing. After gorging ourselves we were unsure about dessert. Rich described them beautifully and as we hemmed and hawed he finally just offered to bring us two on him. Thank you, thank you, thank you. It was far too much but we might never have known the joy of a S'mores Torte or Brendan's Bread Pudding.
Service was relaxed, attentive, and spot-on. The management was always on their toes and came by several times to insure our evening was great. Looking forward to my next visit.
My second time in NOLA in 2 months and Luke is the favorite so far. Excellent service, food, drinks, environment. Seems like a healthy combination of locals and tourists.

Me and my husband stayed for two days in New Orleans. All I have to say about this place is: Amazing food! Full of flavor! Perfectly executed! The establishment was very clean, very good service, and I loved their decor. I loved everything I ordered at this place. Me and my husband were very satisfied with the service and the food. If we ever go back to New Orleans, we will definitely visit this place again!

It's actually more like 3.5 stars. Previously, this had been a solid 5 for us. We've been here several times. 3 years ago we were here for our 10th anniversary and they couldn't have been nicer or more attentive. We can back for our anniversary tonight and we were disappointed. No acknowledgement of the occasion, even though it was noted on the reservation. The back room we were seated in was extremely loud, our server, while polite and friendly, was less than attentive - my wine took a long time to arrive and he never checked to see if I'd like a second glass, we didn't get a refill on water until the end of the meal, food took longer than usual to be served but the check sure showed up quickly. The food itself was good but again, not as good as in the past. My husband is a huge fan of the gumbo and said that this time, it simply wasn't as good.  Nothing was bad but we feel the place has slipped. It won't be first on our list of places in NOLA anymore.

It is inside the Hilton on St Charles but has Valet parking or an easy uber. Lunch and brunch are all I have done and both are wonderful. The burgers are probably the best in town according to my companions, but I stick to lighter fare which they do have to choose. Seafood bar is excellent if you want oysters etc. Atmosphere is fun and service excellent. I like the front dining room.

The best Brussels Sprouts I have had!!!! The Luke salad is probably on my top 3 favorite salads so far. Just those 2 reasons right there are enough for me to come back here next time I'm in NOLA!

It was raining cats and dogs when we arrived. Not sure if that's the reason we were able to be seated right away during their brunch time without a reservation. The restaurant has 2 separate seating sections I believe. The decoration is very French colonial type, classy and beautiful. 

For starters, we got the Brussels Sprouts and Luke salad. They are must try here! The Brussels Sprouts have so many flavors going on, but not in an overwhelming way. Everything compliments each other so well. They are cooked perfectly too, nice crispy texture outside, a lil soft inside, not too greasy. The salad was super fresh and pair so well with their delicious dressing!

For the main entrees, I got myself the chicken cordon blu sandwich. It was huge and super hot with each bite, the hot lava cheese would almost burn my mouth if I eat them too fast. Definitely have to eat with a fork and knife. My SO got the shrimps and grit which I think I enjoyed more than my sandwich lol.

We ended the meal with the hazelnut Paris Brest which comes with pate a choux (not sure what that is lol), passion fruit, coconut. The ice cream and passion fruit were really good. The pastry (maybe that's wat pate a choux is?) that's supposed to bind everything together was too dry for me and didn't have much taste. 

Overall it wasn't a bad experience, except the super slow service at the end of our meal, it took our waitress a good 15-20mins to give us our check and another 10mins or so to complete everything. We would definitely come back here again for their salad, Brussel sprouts, and maybe try other entrees on their menu next time.

This is one of the best bar/restaurants in New Orleans. The food and drinks are amazing. The stuffed P&J oysters are a must-have appetizer. These baked oysters are huge and stuffed with shrimp and blue crab. For dinner, I had the roasted chicken with crispy potatoes. The chicken was moist and the entree was the perfect size. Yes, I said "moist". My girlfriend had the shrimp and grits. As a grits connoisseur, she says these are some of the best grits in the states. I have to agree. Drinks are really good too. We had the St. Charles sour. It's a slightly spicy take on the whiskey sour. I just wish the drink was bigger. We loved Lüke so much we came back for brunch. Get the chicken and waffles!!!
