My fiance ordered the gumbo which paralleled the shrimp and grits in quality and taste. We both chose to decline dessert because our entrees could not be topped. I will recommend Luke to anyone traveling to New Orleans.
Best oysters (raw) I have had in a very long time. Fresh, cold, meaty and tasty! Also has the shrimp, grits and sausage, which was excellent as well.
Breakfast selections all pretty good. Yummy shrimp and grits breakfast- super rich and creamy. Great coffee. cozy and friendly. Great last meal in nola.

Amazing Service and Food!!
My boyfriend and I are on a cross country road trip and arrived at 9:30; from the very beginning of our Luke's experience Chelsea the hostess went above and beyond for us.  She greeted us warmly and offered many suggestions as to local's things to do in the city.  We were both impressed by Chelsea's hospitality, we are both in the restaurant business as well and it's always so nice to be taken care of in return.  Our server Tristan was very helpful as well.  Great cocktails and delicious shrimp and grits.  Thank you so much Luke's for a phenomenal experience.

Best restaurant experience we had in New Orleans. We went for happy hour and had an amazing meal. Definitely try the 75 cent oysters, shrimp and grits, and brussel sprouts. The best thing was honestly the service. Gary was an exceptional server. My girlfriend and I have been in the hospitality industry for 15 years and have never received better service at a restaurant. A++!!!

Absolutely LOVED this place! We stopped by for happy hour and enjoyed $1 raw oysters, $1.50 fried oysters and half price cocktails. The fried oysters were the BEST! We also enjoyed several entrees and an additional appetizer. All top notch dishes. The wait staff was excellent...fast paced and on top of the situation. A must happy hour stop if you're visiting New Orleans.

The service wasn't great, but the food was DELICIOUS! Between the 4 members of my family we tried a little bit of everything. It was was yummy, but the shrimp and crab étouffée was the best thing on the menu!

One of the best oysters I've had (both raw and fried) and they were only 75 cents each during happy hour! 

I've had this restaurant bookmarked for months even before I booked my trip to NOLA. This was our first stop after checking in our hotel. When we first walked in, the place looked so fancy that I was afraid it was out of our price range. But everything was very fairly priced. 

The staff here are very friendly. They recommended a cocktail for me that turned out to be delicious. We were a little too early for happy hour but they were nice enough to put our hh orders in after it started. 

I'd recommend this place for couples, friends, families, everyone!

Wow wow wow!!! My boyfriend and I went out for his birthday dinner and we left in awe. Not only was the food absolutely amazing but it was the best service I have EVER had. Our servers name was Gary and man oh man, he did not disappoint. From the very beginning he took care of every need of ours. Always with a smile on his face. I never leave reviews but he definitely needs recognition for the way we felt after leaving the restaurant. 10/10 would recommend. Thank you Gary! We'll definitely be back soon :)

Come at happy hour and get a French 75 and the stuffed oysters. You won't regret it! The atmosphere here is great and the food is well worth the stop. They have great drink specials and delicious oysters. This was one of our favorite stops in NOLA

We were staying at the Hilton with a group of people. We decided to go down to the bar to have an appetizer and drinks prior to dinner. After hanging out for a couple hours spending around $700 for our group of 10-12 people, the manager approached us to tell us we needed to conduct business there or leave. What in the actual? In my town that's real money. My husband was so pissed he wrote on the check, thank your manager for the tip. In 15 years, I have never seen him not leave a tip. She then had the gall to come berate us for not tipping. Btw, while our server was polite he was not very attentive. For the remainder of the trip, we walked directly across the street to the Intercontinental bar and had great food and service without anyone busting our chops.

I've been eating here for 10 years or something like that and I've had various luck.  I've always enjoyed coming here and I have to insist that the original menu and it's variations for the first few years were much better than it is now.  They're going through some changes and it's painful.  

I had come here in December and had a terrible meal and the GM invited us back to try them again.  I was kinda thinking that before he wrote me that it had been my last visit.  We ate here last night and had a very good experience.  Of course, we received some special attention (the service last time wasn't good) last night was terrific.  We liked everything but the duck dish.  Even the oysters, still not nearly the best in NOLA, were decent.  

I liked the burrata salad a lot, it's really well balanced and was perfectly dressed.  Miriam's Luke salad similarly so but over salted.  Still edible but over salted.  

I liked her shrimp and grits a lot.  Too shrimpy for me, not my thing, but I appreciated it anyway.  She loved it.  I liked the grits and sausage.  The duck dish is too much.  Too sweet, too rich, too much rice, too salty.  It's cloying in the end.  The duck was prepared perfectly and it was delicious.  I loved the texture and preparation of the rice too.  I doubt anyone finishes this dish.  1/3rd of the rice, a little more confit and maybe a small pile of those great Brussels sprouts on the side would be perfect.  

We love their French press so we finished with some coffee and some of the best creme brûlée in NOLA.  The biscotti is a complete miss.  Heavy and made by someone who doesn't have a clue.  These are easy to make, by the way.  

Here's a big problem though.  It's a corporate restaurant.  Upper management here is ruining this place.  They're still serving the worst bread in NOLA, they know it, and are still serving it.  When you have people making decisions for your restaurant who don't work there and don't know anything about food you're in trouble.  It's just about the money.  It makes it impossible to create and execute a clear vision about the food your serving and why you're serving it.  How can you serve a product you know is bad and do it anyway?  Can't be 4 stars until they decide that their staff can make decisions about the food and they focus their vision about what the heck this place is supposed to be about.  Says a lot about the Besh group.... sadly.

I was really looking forward to Luke, but ended up leaving disappointed. I had heard such good things so my husband and I came to dinner on a Monday night. We were seated at a table backing up to the bar, which wasn't ideal but we dealt with it. We had two servers who were friendly enough, but for some reason just seemed very overwhelmed and unable to handle the tables they had. I had a bubbly to start and my husband had a beer. Both were fine but not special. I moved to a red wine for my meal, and it wasn't very good, especially not for the price point.

To start my husband got the stuffed oysters with shrimp and blue crab. They were very bready and underwhelming. The only crab to be found was small slivers. For our mains I had a shrimp, crab, and cavatelli étouffée. I expected more of a shrimp dish with some pasta underneath, but it was more like a pasta dish with minimal seafood. The shrimp was small and tasted like typical frozen shrimp. Like the appetizer, there wasn't really any real crab meat, just small sliver here and there. The pasta was fine but felt a tad overcooked. It honestly tasted like a pasta dish I could make quickly at home. And for around $26, that's ridiculous. My husband had the jumbo Louisiana shrimp with jalapeño grits. Luckily, his shrimp were large and flavorful. But the rest of the dish fell flat. The grits had very little flavor. 

Toward the end of our meal a very large group came into the bar, it almost seemed like a post-wedding thing. They were very rude and kept backing into not only our chairs and table, but the people around us as well. A lot of us were getting frustrated and the staff couldn't have cared less. They did nothing to remedy the situation. We left as quickly as we could. All in all, the food was mediocre and this place felt like a tourist trap, which I hadn't been expecting. I'd go elsewhere while in New Orleans.
Yummy and cheap oysters. That's all you really need to know.
Richie rich is the bees knees. He showed us such a good time, suggested great food and hooked us up!!! Definitely a great place to eat

It was as advertised. I ordered the burger and wife ordered shrimp and grits. We were seated quickly, food came out quickly, tasted great. Service was good but not as attentive as a 5/5. If I could I would give it a 4.75.

Oh my!  From appetizer to entree a delightful experience featuring an open airy dining room with a huge bar. Lump crab in a horseradish sauce, duck breast with a crispy dark rice, gnocchi with sautéed kale and to finish bread pudding with vanilla ice cream and praline sauce. The menu features some classic John Besh recipes. Service was solid.

Great place! The service was spectacular Brad our waiter was perfect ( LA accent). We had the salad Luke, the crab and corn bisque soup, chicken and waffles, and the jalapeño cheese grits. All dishes were awesome the Luke salad was very fresh with a dressing that reminded us of France. The pecan butter and Tabasco jelly on the chicken and waffles were very tasty. Dessert was amazing bread pudding! The restaurant is cozy, classy. We will be back!

We stopped in last night and were seated at a table that backed up to the bar. If you were sitting in the chairs with your back to the bar you constantly had people bustling by you & got whacked a time or two. It felt more like a busy diner sitting where we were. We ordered the eggplant sticks as an app. I liked the breading but didn't have much flavor to it. Marinara sauce was like water and no flavor. I wouldn't order this again. Portion was definitely shareable. It was just blah overall. I had the tuna rare and it was delicious!! I would definitely order that again. My husband had the lamb and the pasta that is served with it is delicious. He said it was good but nothing to write home about and my tuna was definitely better. Our waitress, didn't even know her name and was underwhelmed by her. I felt we were more of an inconvenience than her wanting to help. My husband asked her about a drink on the menu and she was like um and shrugged her shoulder and said I don't really like it. Never recommended anything so he didn't get a drink. We live here and there are so many good restaurants we truly enjoy. So, it wasn't a bad experience but wouldn't rush back here.
Good food the wait staff was phenomenal. Nice selection of cocktails would recommend for dinner.

5 Star Breakfast - Small menu but don't let that persuade you not to try it.  I have to tell you I have probably had grist 3 times in my life, but if they were as good as Luke's were I would eat them everyday!!!  The service was on point - Jackson did a great job keep my wife's coffee cup full and our needs fulfilled.

The Fried Chkn Biscuit was delish, The "Southern" Breakfast was fantastic - the breakfast meats were top notch!!!  We enjoyed it and will try to squeeze it into our already stuffed list of breakfast spots we enjoy in NOLA each trip.   D.

Simple food elevated to new levels and perfection. Also loved the sense of community at the bar between team and guests. They clearly love where they work and support one another. Will crave the fried oyster salad and burger until I return.

Highly recommended. Very good value for the money. Chef was very accommodating. Three people in our party were celiac. Waiter knew what dishes were gluten free, what dishes could be modified to be made gluten free and chef whipped up variation of another dish to make it gluten free on request. Went during happy hour. Drinks and oysters discounted. Food was fantastic. One of best meals we have had here.

I always make it a point to go to Luke when I'm in New Orleans, the food is SOOOOOO amazing.

My favorite thing to get, and I recommend that YOU try, is the flammenkuchen! Besides being fun to say (LOL!) it.is.DELICIOUS!!!! OMG!!!!! The sweet carmalized onions with salty bacon + cheese, OMGGGGG!! Just try it! Party in your mouth!

I also got the Luke Burger, more of those carmalized onions, so good. We went for dinner and the place was packed, so you may have a wait. However, the waiter(s) were pretty awesome, and attentive.

Again, don't forget, if you are here, get the FLAMMENKUCHEN!!!!!

Luke is a gem and a must visit for Foodies traveling to Nola.   The Oysters are always plump and tasty.   If you're adventurous,  then you have to get the rabbit patté.  It's to die for. 

Author David Moon 
Books on Amazon 
Zomosapiens
Scales of Justice 
The Wife's Wicked Weekend
Great brunch. I loved the atmosphere and I would recommend to newbies, visitors and residents. The food was so good and I was able to try new things and enjoy my staples.

What a wonderful meal! Everything was outstanding and the shrimp and grits were heaven sent! And the service by Elliot was so so exquisite! He did such a fabulous job taking care of our private party. He took such great care with the food and it was clear the joy he had in providing impeccable service just was icing on the cake. I will definitely be doing this to list!

Look at my previous reviews for Lüke and you'll see my stars are all over the board. This is due to their inconsistency, not mine. I've had great meals here and serious fails. Dinner last night was good, as I like their brothy, tomatoey shrimp & grits with andouille sausage. I also like the Lüke salad, with its distinctive horseradish dressing, but wish they'd offer a smaller, pre-dinner portion. The menu in place when this restaurant first opened years ago was firmly rooted in Alsatian cuisine, and now I feel like they've lost their focus. Happy hour oysters here are affordable, but I've had better oysters at some real dives in this city; theirs are lacking the plump juiciness that I've come to associate with P&J oysters. Perhaps they're shucking them in advance and the briny liquor is spilling out? I don't know. Specially cocktail menus usually have me vacillating with indecision, but the happy hour offerings on the current menu were not compelling. I had my usual French 75, and found it unbalanced, with too much lemon and not enough cognac. I've had this drink here more times than I care to admit, and it's usually excellent. I keep looking for the wonderful Croque Monsieur to return to the menu, but haven't seen it appear. It's winter now, and a great time to offer this decadent delight. I had Revillion dinner here in December, and didn't have one course that I enjoyed. The long and short of it is that Lüke is sometimes good, sometimes not, and has less to do now with Alsatian food than it did when I opened. Great restaurants have focus and do one cuisine brilliantly. I wish Lüke would.
Shrimp and grits was amazing! Also their chicken & waffle was delicious! Great food and great service-I would come back again ^_^
I've eaten at some amazing places in New Orleans. This was not one of them. The staff seemed flustered, it was loud, and the food was too salty to eat. Not a fan.

Let me start by saying the oysters are wonderful.  The rest of our meal, not so much.  Our second dish was the Pate of Louisiana Rabbit and Chicken Livers.  Flavor was nice but it was served icy cold, so the true  flavor could not come through.  The compotes served with the pate were wonderful, a great compliment.  Our entrees were the Steak and Frites and the Braised Lamb with Fresh Herbed Pasta.  The steak was perfectly cooked and well seasoned, the fries were limp and greasy.  The herbed pasta dish was interesting but there were only two tiny pieces of lamb, must have been less than 2 oz of meat in this dish.  Our total bill, with a $40 bottle of wine and two cocktails was over $170.  Poor value for inconsistent food.
Please note that our server, Chi, was knowledgeable, efficient and delightful.

The best happy hour oyster place I have ever. 
2 dozen raw, oyster and crab plus Brussels sprouts. A meal we will remember for a long time. We will be back.

Seafood restaurant, bill for $155 for 2, prices high, service really slow, food ok but nothing to write home about.  Our table wasn't cleared for 20 m so we moved to bar, and manager checked in with to us.  Offered us a glass of wine, which is nice, but didn't offer a discount.  Not sure I'd recommend.   Editing the review because the manager gave us a appetizer platter off of the bill.  Made us feel better.
Food was amazing.  Came for breakfast, had the shrimp and grits and the southern breakfast.  Shrimp and grits were delicious.  The coffee is amazing!!!!  Service was excellent.
Oyster happy hour is great, food is awesome! But service needs to be improved...takes forever for someone to pour water, takes forever to get the check...low standard for a tourism city.

We came here for happy hour and ordered 2 dozen of the raw P&J it was so flavorful! Best raw oysters in town! Also the happy drinks were amazing!!! For a really good glass of cab is was only $5! Can't beat that! Also I believe their happy oysters were only 75 cents!!! We came back for more the next day because it was that good! This wasn't on happy hour but we ordered a dozen of their Louisiana shrimp! Yummy!!

Great place! If you want a break from the Gumbo and Jambalaya of New Orleans. This is the place. Excellent staff...excellent food. Soups excellent, salads excellent, The Luke burger EXCELLENT the meat used for this burger is top notch! Coffee amazing, Desserts excellent.  Great place if you need a break from the Cajun food.

Came here waiting on the parade. Sat at the bar and met several people. Food was fantastic and drinks kept coming. They sell a place to watch the parade from and was worth every penny. Come during happy hour to enjoy the wait!!

Happy hour OYSTERS are amazing here. The quality of oysters is superb, juicy and plump. Unlike most other places, you do not have to order a drink to get the .75 cent oysters. But they don't have chargrilled oysters. Go to LUKE's and skip the lines at the French Quarter spots. 

I tried the gnocchi appetizer and it was delicious. It was topped with sautéed greens, browned pork and a delightful crumble. I also recommend the bread pudding dessert! I don't usually order bread pudding but I really enjoyed this one at Luke's. 
Although the raw oysters were perfect, the fried oysters were not that big. So just come here for the raw oysters during happy hour, and try out their menu! Everything on the menu looked great but we came for the oysters (2 nights in a row)!  

Located in the central business district and less than 10 minute walk from Bourbon St, this is fine dining without the fuss. The service is attentive and friendly. They have bar seating and even large tables to accommodate 10+ people. The atmosphere is pretty relaxed. 

You don't have to dress up to go here, and we only had to wait 15 min ish for dinner on Friday night. The restaurant is next to the Hilton hotel if you can't find the place.

John Besh place, so you know it's legit.  Fortunately, we stayed at the connecting hotel.  The wife and I got in many fights because I wanted to come here everyday.  I usually got my way by just saying "let's just stop in for a few oysters."  Then of course, you have to order at least a dozen because they are SO good, plump, and relatively cheap.

We only got oysters and fries during the happy hour, but I've heard great things about the other foods here.  Definitely check it out if you're in the area!

The food is not only wonderful, but the service is on point. Ask for Gary or Kevin, they are both great waiters and made our experience at Luke's the best. Come here, get some grits and bread pudding!

Happy hour review only. Great oysters and great price. The PB&J oysters were rich but so yummy. You have to try them. The gnocchi was tasty. Didn't think it was amazing. I'd come again for oysters but there's plenty of other amazing places.

The oysters were fresh and delicious, service was good. Surprisingly my favorite dish was the Brussels sprouts, it's a must order! 

I ordered the rabbit pate which I would also high recommend, I do think it's on the saltier side.

Excellent food, excellent service! What an amazing staff. We came in during Mardi gras at happy on the parade route. The resturant was sooooo busy, they had every excuse to drop the ball but instead Amili (sp) and Jamie made us feel so special. They treated us like kings and queens. They made my 80 year old, old man feel special for his 1st Mardi Gras. Hats of the ownership and leadership of this super AWESOME resturant, your commitment to quality and service excellence is refreshing. Shout out to the most amazing bar staff in all of NOLA, you guys are awesome. Definitely, the highlight of the trip. We'll be back.

Luke's has been a go to in NoLa for the past ten years. It reminds me of a Parisian brasserie and is centrally located in the central business district. Our last visit to Luke's was fair. The service was excellent as always but the food seemed rather uninspired. We had their house gumbo along with fresh and fried oysters, but the other menu items, I cannot even recall days later. Luke's a place you can stop in for a burger and a beer - or oysters and a cocktail. The food's solid and the atmosphere upscale.

So so good. Glad we ended up here after the Ruby Slipper had an ungodly wait. 

Beautiful space and charismatic servers (thank you Jesse!) made the ambiance, despite being extremely hangry, very pleasant. 

The Brussels Sprouts were some of THE BEST we've ever had. Perfectly crispy, so flavorful and sweet and spicy, with a slightly creamy element in the barn cheese. They look crazy with the almonds, apple shreds, and jalapeño slices but the flavors are to-die-for. We soaked up the extra sauce with the complementary bread it was so good!  

The burrata salad was delicious as well - light and zesty with some surprising spice in the pecans (they're dusted in Cajun seasoning, not candied!). Being a cheese fiend, the burrata-to-salad ratio was on point. 

The boyfriend had the pork schnitzel sandwich to which he said, "I have never been humbled by a sandwich like this before". "It looked me in the eye and said, 'here's the door; you're not ready.'"Jesse accurately said the servings are "aggressively generous". Something to keep in mind so you don't end up lugging half a pork schnitzel and fries around for hours on parade day!

Fabulous food, fantastic service. 5/5 would recommend!
Great Besh restaurant Mardi Gras day morning. Service was good. Food outstanding. But no caffeinated latte only decaf and grounds in the regular coffee made for a less than stellar morning

Hands down the best restaurant in New Orleans!

Crispy brussel sprouts appetizer was good, very saucy, not bitter.

Lump crab appetizer was pretty good. 

Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" (roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage) is my absolute favorite meal in New Orleans. Also their jalapeno cheesy grits is the best in town. No one makes it like them.

Amazing restaurant. Cute and cozy, service was fast and very kind. Boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday during Mardi Gras weekend and it was the best place we ate the whole trip. The Shrimp and Grits is an essential order!
You have not lived until you have tried their "etouffee". It's a delicious twist on the classic dish that is out of this world. Very rich but worth every bite.

*My review is solely for happy hour* -- I came here for happy hour (3pm-6pm) based on the recommendations of my fellow yelpers and was not disappointed! Half off cocktails, beer and wine, plus $1.25/fried oyster and $0.75/oyster. You are required to get the fried oysters in increments of half a dozen. They were some of the better ones I've had in the area; crispy on the outside, meaty on the inside, and were decently sized. The raw oysters were amazing- they were massive and good quality, and you can't beat the price.  Definitely some of the best happy hour oysters I've had in my life! Service was very friendly, refilling our water glasses frequently and checking in with us just the right amount. Would come back here in a heartbeat during my next visit to New Orleans!

I did not realize it was part of the hotel but that didn't matter.  The atmosphere, at least in the front of the restaurant, was very authentic with tin ceiling, white tablecloths and comfortable chairs.  The oysters were fresh and wonderful - not briny, buttery,and large.  The brussel sprouts were to die for with a spicy vinaigrette, almonds and apple and as a bonus, they provided the recipe.  Crab and corn bisque was rich and very tasty. On the downside, our server was totally indifferent. Rushed us and when we could not decide on our main, she abruptly left us with the feeling we were not using her time wisely and then gave us cursory attention.  If you don't mind that service, the food is worth it.  I would not return however.

BOMB

Had the shrimp and duck 
It was sooo bomb

They prob put a shit ton of butter but it was delicious

Also had the vanilla crepe bulee very yummy but that duck rice was legittttttt
Highly rec
Great old style decor, the shrimp and grits was amazing, as was the bread pudding.  The wait staff is very attentive and goes above and beyond to make sure you're satisfied.

Holy ****

Let me preface this by saying that I was really really not wanting to like this place because our waiter initially seemed too rushed/ and not focused on my table. 

I have eaten at 5 star/ Michelin Star restaurants around the world. Food is my passion. This place is incredible. 

It might be the perfect French 75 that I had to start my meal, but hot damn this would be my last meal on death row. 

The oysters: incredible. 

The "éttoufee" is the actual best thing I've ever eaten in my entire life. When I die, I will haunt this establishment and eat this dish for my eternal being. 

Don't go anywhere else. There's no point. 



I'm dead. I've gone to heaven. The end.

Matzo ball and roast chicken soup ($9 for a bowl) - 3 stars
We asked them for less salt in whatever dishes they could put less salt in and this was one of them! It was a delicious light broth to offset all the rich food we'd been having.

Stuffed P&J oysters 1/2 dz ($19) - 4 stars
A nice change from raw oysters but you probably can't eat more than 2.

Crispy Brussels sprouts ($14) - 5 stars
Probably my favourite dish and the best part is hat they give you a recipe for the dish at the end of the meal! Definitely gonna try to make this dish at home.

Jumbo Louisiana shrimp "En Cocotte" ($25) - 5 stars
Their star dish as they will tell you. The cheese and jalapeños made it taste like a Mexican dish, which was delicious.

The ambience and service cement the 5 stars. My favourite place in New Orleans so far!

Shrimp and grits: 3.5
I know this is there signature dish but I wasn't a fan of the pepper taste in the grits, and it didn't stand out to me

Brussel sprouts: 4 stars
I enjoyed the touch of sweetness from the honey but it had too much oil and I prefer mine crispier

Roast chicken and Matzo ball soup : 3 stars
The tomato was too prominent and made the soup acidic to me. Matzo ball was a tad flavorless and didn't have the right texture. 

Stuffed p&j oysters: 5 stars
Generous portion of crab, the Oysters meshed well and the overall dish was delicious 

Service: 5 stars
One of the only restaurants so far in NOLA who had no problem with the request for less salt and the staff were friendly. We decided to come back later for desserts and they were welcoming about it.

Had a great experience at Luke. Was actually seated a little before my reservation time.  Service was impeccable.  The French 75 really is good and worth a try if you've never had it.  Had some of the best oysters I had eaten in New Orleans her at Luke.  The raw P&J were delicious, but the stuffed P&J was probably one of the best food items I ate the whole time I was in New Orleans.  Also had the fried oyster salad. Oysters were cooked perfectly but breading was a little too salty.  Will definitely go back to Luke.

Kris and Tristan helped make our night amazing! We came to celebrate our anniversary and they exceeded our expectations! We were seated with champagne! We came early for the happy hour on wine and oysters and everything was delicious! In addition to oysters, we got the Luke burger and it was amazing! It had so much flavor! To end an amazing evening we got a complementary anniversary dessert! We will definitely be coming back!
The most decadent salad ever. Fried oysters and chunky bacon with a buttermilk dressing. Amazing.  Ettouffe was good. Service was excellent!
Very nice atmosphere, the food was really good as well! We had the shrimp and grits which was great and I highly recommend and also the swordfish was good. All in all amazing place!

The BEST food and service you will find! We had the Mozzarella salad, Brussels sprouts, and shrimp & grits. Two of us shared all three entrees and are completely satisfied. These Brussels sprouts will change your life! Highly recommend!
It was good however when you order medium be ready for medium rare on the ribeye.  All and all it was OK

Had fallen in love with Luke thanks to pictures on Yelp! Made sure to make reservations for brunch while we were in town! My friend and I ordered the coconut stuffed French toast as an appetizer and it was probably suited to be more of a dessert! So rich and yummy! I got the croque madam (I always order whenever I see it on any menu) and this one did not disappoint! Crust bread, juicy ham, perfect fried egg, gooey cheese and a little bottle of Grey Poupon was perfect! I'll be sure to make a reservation every time I'm in town!!

Best food in New Orleans, hands down. We got in early and we're seated right by the kitchen. Those guys are having fun making your food! My hubby, two kids, and I enjoyed everything we ate including the grilled oysters, gumbo, and shrimp. We wish we went back because every place we ate in New Orleans was a disappointment compared to Luke. Unforgettable meal we will remember forever!

Came here for their oyster happy hour, which is a great deal if you're looking to stock up on oysters. The raw oysters were good, and wasn't a huge fan of the fried ones. But didn't compare well to the delicious wood fire oven ones I had the day prior at Cochon (I know, it's not a fair comparison), so I walked away feeling a bit disappointed. Wouldn't make a special trip here unless I was craving a ton of raw oysters.

Best restaurant I ate at in NOLA-  and great service! A great staff that worked as a team to ensure I had a great experience. Shawn was an excellent server who gave great suggestions on the food. Had an amazing steak and the oysters were as big as my hand! Great selection of craft cocktails as well. Call for reservations because it gets busy.

Another amazing dining experience by BRG Hospitality. Every bite we took was amazing. The Shrimp & Crab "Étouffée," the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte," the Gnocchi and the Luke burger were all delicious, but the show stopper for me was the Tuna Tar Tar! The only problem with the Tuna Tar Tar was that I probably could have eaten 4 or 5 of the portions. Also, they use server "teams," which I usually have mixed experiences with, but both of our servers were phenomenal. We will definitely be back when we return to NOLA.

Loved Luke. Literally everything was delicious: we had the Brussels sprouts (a bit overly glazed & sweet for my taste, but it really was good), fried oyster salad, and the shrimp & grits. EVERYTHING was good! My favorite, though, was the French#75 cocktail...which was super delicious!! Our waiter was even so kind, he gave us the recipe for the Brussel sprouts! Overall-with all the NOLA options, this should make it on your list. I didn't do happy hour here, but they supposedly have a great one!

Amazing food and service. I had the roasted chicken and potatoes. Yum. Moist chicken. Perfectly roasted potatoes. Our waiter was "Richie" Rich. Extremely knowledgeable, attentive and entertaining. He and Ken (our server) made the experience all the more enjoyable. Our third trip to NOLA and our third visit to Luke. Luke is what New Orleans is about.

Yes, please!  A group of my girlfriends and I enjoyed a delicious dinner at Luke's while visiting.  

First of all, do not skip the fries.  They were cooked to perfection and highly addictive. 

The pate board was a large portion and quite tasty. 

I ordered the ribeye and split it with my friend since we planned on having more bites after dinner.  They were gracious enough to pre split the meal.  The steak was prepared very well. 

Of course, you can't forget the oysters.  If you love oysters as much as I do, you'll appreciate the selection.  Honestly, you should have the Louisiana oysters along with the others simply because they are delicious and you can't pass on price compared to the other oysters. 

The only downfall was that we were seated in the back room which seemed to be with out heat.  It just so happened we were there during one of the coldest days of the year in NOLA.  We were all freezing, but the good food helped to over come the cold room temp!

Nice place. I sat at the bar for a late lunch and the service was really good and friendly. The butternut/ricotta gnocchi was very good and the prices seemed on par with the other area spots in NOLA.
The oysters looked great. Fresh etc. I also had a very nice French 75. Really a nice lunch.

This was our favorite restaurant in NOLA. The barren tender, Brandy, was simply amazing and made wonderful recommendations while being so friendly and outgoing. Food was top knotch-the Brussels sprouts and crawfish bisque was amazing. Highly, highly recommended.

Not my favorite Besh experience. My gulf fish was fine, but my boyfriend's burger was bizarre. I'm not sure if it is intended to be eaten open face, but that is how it was served. It seemed like an odd way to serve such a large burger. Service was a little slow, but given how busy the restaurant was, not unexpected or unusual. The waitress was a bit...off. She openly flirted with my boyfriend, which made for an awkward dining experience considering my parents were present (maybe she thought we were siblings, but event then, still very odd behavior). Overall, my food was fine, and service was average; though, I'll stick to Besh's other restaurants.

Scene
I always enjoy the lively scene at this creole inspired brassiere. The front dining room is pretty cozy but there is additional seating in the back dining room so don't be alarmed when you check in with the hostess. There is a wait sometimes even with reservations so prepare to stand for a bit because there really isn't a lot of space in the waiting area. The raw oyster bar is definitely the highlight of the front dining room which offers two, four and six top tables. 

Service
The service is full of Nola charm and ever so knowledgeable servers...always pleasant, always southern and always extremely comfortable with telling what's good on the menu. 

Food
The food never fails here. I've dined in for breakfast, lunch and dinner and it really is my kind of wonderful. Some of my favorites are the shrimp and grits, crispy brussels, croque madame, drum puppy top with crab meat, stuffed p&j oysters and the crispy chicken biscuit. Oh and did I mention one of my favorite French 75 with cognac is made here #winning

Cost
$$

Tip
Check out the 75 cent oyster happy hour from 3pm-6pm. Get there early.
This place gives new meaning to Shrimp and Grits....AMAZING!  energetic vibe. A bit loud but great place to gather with friends. I'll be back on my next visit!

Great cozy restaurant with an amazing wait staff!

Food was reasonably priced for the area and definitely did not lack anything in taste. 

Everything we ordered came out quickly and tasted delicious. Oysters were great, steak was great, shrimp and grits were great, even the creme brulee was good!

Only thing we wished for was if we were around for happy hour!

I was staying at the hotel where this restaurant is located. I stopped in twice during my stay. The first night was for a quick sweet treat and nightcap. I ordered a glass of sparkling wine and order their modern take on a lemon meringue. Both were outstanding. The bartenders recommended this dessert, while I was leaning towards the bread pudding. They did not steer me wrong. My second visit was during happy hour. They have raw an fried oysters on special. I ordered a half dozen of each. Loved the mildness of the P&J raw oysters. The fried ones were outstanding. Different bartenders, but both times they were delightful. I did find out they are part of the same restaurant group as Borgne (which I love) and August (very upscale). The only downside is it can get very loud in there it's small, tight space. They do have seating across the hall, but the main space can get quite loud.

We tried this place for the first time. Raw oysters. Great. Stuffed oysters.  Great. Roasted chicken. Delicious.
The flammenkuchen  (alsacian specialty) was different from what we had in Alsace Lorraine,  but also delicious with Tennessee bacon! A southern twist to a specialty of France!] We enjoyed every bite and will return for more! Cocktails were also delicious... GINtilly lace.

My husband took me here for Valentine's day. The service was great,  but it was loud. I wouldn't suggest it for a romantic evening. I had an espresso martini that was just enough espresso to vodka ratio. We had the stuffed p&j oysters..... totally amazing! They were topped with a shrimp & crab stuffing that was so rich and delicious. If you like meat,  I suggest the duck duck rice. It was full of flavor and juicy. the rice was crunchy,  like rice crispy but it was savory. I had the tasso rubbed yellowfin tuna. This entree and the noise were the only reason I gave 4 stars. It just didn't work. It was  a bean stew that would've gone with a pork chop,  but not tuna. Everything else about the dinner was great!

I love going here for happy hour (3-6 pm), which includes 75-cent oysters, half-price beers, cocktails, and wines by the glass. Probably my favorite thing on the menu is the rabbit and chicken pate. I already swore to myself that I'd one day request a day off of work, order the pate togo, and binge watch the sh!t out of The Office on Netflix. 

Oysters - Decent-sized. Make sure you go easy on the horseradish. Don't try to prove how brave you are. It's not a competition.
Rabbit and chicken pate - Insert fire emoji here
Fries - Good
Crispy brussel sprouts - Okay, not missing much if you pass up on this

Bloody Mary - was bloody terrible
Door#three - Good!

I've never had trouble parking around it, which is always a bonus. Just keep in mind that parking downtown is $6/2hrs. You might want to make a reservation if you're planning on going during happy hour on weekends.

Had an amazing dinner with family for my husbands birthday. Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" was to die for. Best grits ever. Crispy Brussel sprouts were like candy and they even gave me the recipe. Our servers Gary and Kevin were fantastic. Kevin is funnier but don't tell Gary I said that. What a perfect evening.

Worst service I have EVER received, we had alarge party and they were rude from the start!  Ride about our orders, rolling eyes and huffing.  Bearded, shirt skinny server was worse in my life!  Made everyone uncomfortable!  Mentioned to another host? Who came by our table and she was rude too!  Food and drinks may be great at happy hour but not worth the terrible service!  Only place in NOLA that hasn't been hospitable!


Server came back and apologized for his rudeness!  Shocking moves up from 1 to 3, still unhappy he ruined my experience.  Even though we appreciate the apology very much!

Luke is just one of those places hat I have to visit each time in visiting NOLA.  It's a great restaurant attached to the Hilton Hotel that doesn't feel like a hotel restaurant.  Service is fantastic...usually. (I will get to that in a little while...)

Was in town with a coworker who is Vegan, and he raved about the concoction that the kitchen whipped up for him. It ended being his favorite NOLA meal EVER.  Unfortunately, it set up all the other meals during our trip to be failures because he enjoyed it that much and was impressed by our waiter's knowledge of the vegan diet and how he worked with the kitchen to make my coworker happy. Thumbs up guy with the ponytail! (Sorry, didn't get your name.)

We were so enablers by the service, that we hung out, ordered more drinks and dessert...forgetting our our urgency to make it to Bourbon Street for a fun night. Oops.

Fast forward to Sunday Brunch.  Waiter seemed hungover and slow. Kept reaching over the table to serve drinks and fill our glasses.  Now, I've never been a server, but I am pretty sure that is incorrect etiquette.  And as much as I have been to Luke's, all other wait staff made this guy look like a chump.  Anyway, we kept trying to warm him up by being super polite and friendly, but it was more out of annoyance than anything...

Food is always consistent here.  Although, I will say that the bacon bits in my salad seemed more fresh on Sunday morning than they did on Friday night.  I also love to get the shrimp and grits when I am feeling like something more hearty. Luke does it the best. 

Get the bread pudding.  It is a MUST.  You can hit the gym the next day.  No regrets.

My friends and I were in town for the week and went to many places for oyster and this place had the best oyster out of all the places we've been in New Orleans! We went for the happy hour, which is such a steal for such fresh oysters and great drinks! Definitely would recommend this place to anyone who wants fresh, quality oysters!

I stayed at the Hilton in the Central Business district because 1) It's a cool, reasonably priced hotel well located and 2) Luke is the attached restaurant. I was introduced to Luke by my friend Troy Black and had a terrific lunch there with him. On this trip, I had driven in from Nashville during the day and this was my dinner...

Started with a dozen oysters with 4 varieties. Six were P&J Oysters, a long-standing supplier in New Orleans. Are these the best of the New Orleans bay oysters? Probably so and they are worth seeking out. I had these last August here too (don't believe that old wives tale of not eating oysters in months without an 'r'). They were huge at that time, but it was summer, warmer water, bigger oysters, etc. still fabulous! The other three varieties were all delicious but "crisper" and more forward. P&J oysters are smooth, rich, and taste of the ocean. Just a wonderful, New Orleans, Gulf of Mexico oyster! Good red cocktail sauce with good balance. The Horseradish is the REAL DEAL. Searingly hot! It's a nose blower. Be cautious! But great!!

For a second course I had the agnolotti (like a small ravioli) stuffed with sweet potato, citrus fruits & almonds. Yeah that's what was on the menu. Was this the BEST pasta I ever had? Probably so and I've had some amazing pasta in Chicago, NYC and Italy.

Great service at Luke, my waiter was VERY aware of what was going on at the table without me noticing and at times in a restaurant I notice EVERYTHING. Kenny was very personable, and fun. I take notes on my phone during my visit but I try not to be too obvious. Either he figured out I was reviewing (maybe the pictures I took were the tip off-duhhh) or my sterling personality did it. Or maybe just because it's New Orleans, he comped me a huge Roady of very good Savignon Blanc (New Zealand) and a bread pudding with home made ice cream & hot buttered pecan sauce! Which I gladly took back to my room.

After returning to my room and consuming the Sav Blanc I tried the bread pudding. WAAAAAAY better than the menu description. I've had a lot (and made) of bread pudding. The ice cream is obviously house made with vanilla bean seeds (teeny, tiny) floating in the scoop. But the bread pudding is impossibly good!! Good bread pudding is easy. This bread pudding IS IMPOSSIBLE. I'm at a loss.

After eating all I could (and then some)... I'm in a very happy diabetic coma. Thanks Luke (and the John Besh team)

This place is great for happy hour! Their raw oysters are $0.75 each and their fried oysters are $1.25 each. My boyfriend and I shared a dozen of the raw oysters and a dozen of the fried ones. The raw ones are so incredibly fresh and they were huge! I've never seen oyster this big before. You definitely get the bang for your buck. The fried oysters are really good too- crispy and super flavorful. They come with a spicy, creamy dipping sauce. 

The restaurant also offered half off of selected drinks including wine by the glass, draft beers, and cocktails. I got the Gintilly Lace cocktail. I wasn't a big fan of this cocktail because it was super strong for my taste. I could only finish half- but if you're into strong cocktails, this one is for you. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend this restaurant for happy hour drinks and oysters! Such a great deal.

So good we made a reservation for the following night, while we were eating  there on the first night!

The raw oysters were super fresh, the crawfish bisque was as good as a lobster bisque, and the shrimp & grits was also a hit! (Slightly over done shrimps, but delicious!) We stumbled on their happy hour (before 6pm) when the wine and other libations were half priced! Can't sniff at that! 

A mention to the wait staff too, who were attentive and friendly.

Overall, a great experience. Can't wait for tomorrow night, when I'll be trying their rabbit and chicken liver pate, and the sausage and seafood gumbo!
Raw oysters during happy hour are a great deal and delicious. I've dined at the bar and at the table and both places have great service.

This was a good but not great brunch place in New Orleans. The server was friendly and on top of what I needed. The menu just didn't have as much variety as I expected. The food itself did taste great though and you will find something you like for sure. I'm just not sure it's a place I would go back to without trying out some other choices first.
Great happy hour! We got 1/2 dozen of fried oysters and also 2 dozen raw oysters. Great deal. Would come back!

Server was above & beyond... Craig?  I showed him a pic of the Chicken & Biscuits & he said 'it's no longer on the menu, but we have chicken & biscuits, so I'll ask the Chef & am sure it won't be a problem.'  Says it all.  Excellent service!  

The Chicken & Waffles, even the omelette, everything we saw coming from the kitchen looked mouthwatering & huge shareable portions.  Truly one of my new NOLA favs!  I cannot wait to come back!

I am disappointed with my experience at Luke. Reviews tallying 4 stars suggested a good experience, but i must not have ordered the right thing- the organic quinoa bowl. The bowl is cold- quinoa and roasted vegetables. The poached egg was warm and perfect, but the salad came smothered in a horseradish dressing. It may not have been that bad, but horseradish was never mentioned in the menu, so it was a surprise and WAY too overwhelming. The cheese was tasteless and the many many cherry tomatoes were mostly over- ripe and squishy.  I won't return since there are so many great restaurants in NOLA.

Great ambiance, while also being a close walking distance break from the hustle and bustle and price gouging that the quarter does so well. 

The bar staff was amazing and super nice.

Crawfish Bisque was amazing and the happy hour was killer for drinks and oysters. In the words of terminator, "I'll be back"...

The Tabasco Honey Fried Chicken has to be one of the best things I have ever eaten!  I expected it to be a basic fried chicken with rice and beans, but the flavor combinations and depth of flavors were amazing!  It has been a couple of years, but I want to return to New Orleans just to eat there again!
Service is great, even is rush hour. I love the food there, entouffee. French 75 is great.

Really enjoyed dining here!! The server was very nice and patient and I feel like the food were all prepared by heart and so delicious!! The dining environment was elegant but relaxing. My favorite dish would be the oysters and the gnocchi.

Excellent restaurant and exceptional staff. My husband and I are in new Orleans to celebrate his bday and our anniversary. I knew about Luke's because  it is located next to our hotel. We almost didn't eat here because I figured we probably wouldn't need a reservation on a Sunday night. Well I was wrong, when we saw the hostess she made us aware the wait time for a party of 2 was an hour. I called another restaurant and it was the same. I decided we would go somewhere and get a  drink in the meantime and exactly an hour later our table was ready. 
I am so happy we were finally able to get in because the food was delicious. I ordered the duck and my husband the seafood etouffee, both dishes were extremely flavorful. The fried rice that comes with the duck will amaze your taste buds and your senses, I wish I could learn to make it at home. I asked my waiter if they could bring dessert with a candle for my husband and they not only did that but they also brought us two glasses of champagne for our anniversary. I didn't get their names but thank you for making that night a little more special.
Two words: Happy Hour. The oysters are amazing. If you love fresh oysters, this is the place to get it. And the bread is fresh as well. Definitely recommend this place.

They have a large raw bar display in the middle of the restaurant. It is not a large place and it did get a bit noisy although you could still hear table conversation. 
The table next to us got the raw bar sampler which came out in a 3-tiered plate and looked quite impressive. They seemed to enjoy it. 
I had the shrimp and grits which was excellent and the Flammenkuchen, which was like an onion pizza - it was actually quite good, but a bit much for one person. The bread they serve is freshly made. The service was quite attentive and the waiter made excellent suggestions for dinner. 
The bread pudding was also excellent for dessert.

I stopped by for lunch and a cocktail this week. The food was solid and service was great. I was most impressed with their French 75 cocktail. It is one of my faves and theirs is the BEST I've ever tried. I had to get one to go. Haha.

Make reservations here! Luke's is phenomenal. I had the shrimp and grits, and it was the best ever although I really wanted to try the  etoufee. My daughter had the burger and said it was the best she's ever had as well...And she is a burger expert.

We passed by this place many times on our way into the French Quarter from the Garden District. Finally decided to give it a try- we made a reservation, which is a good idea. You can get this huge raw bar sampler for ~$125, and we saw one table get that - it was impressive. I tried the P&J half dozen oysters ($9)- not nearly as briny as the west coast oysters (and not as big) but tasty nonetheless. I also had those same oysters fried in an oyster salad with buttermilk dressing ($14?) - oh my goodness, so delicious. I would highly recommend it. Like 8-10 barely fried oysters, a huge salad, and absolutely amazing dressing. Because I was trying to have oysters in as many ways as possible, I also got a cup of gumbo ($7). It was good, but just stick with the raw stuff and the salad. My husband got the steak frites ($35), which was a gigantic steak served on a cutting board. He declared it almost better than his we make at home, which is saying something. The frites were excellent dipped in the aforementioned buttermilk dressing. 

Great service, and price wasn't too bad. We'd come back!

I found weeks Luke's by checking out a gluten free restaurant option google search for New Orleans.  I'm so happy I decided to make reservations!  The food was incredible!
The staff listened to my food restriction requests and delivered with tasty food.  Not just leaving off ingredients but making adjustments to the dish which enhances the flavors.  It was our favorite meal of the trip

I've only been here once. We went for happy hour which is a great deal. The deal is only for the local oysters which we ordered. I know it's a cheap time, but the oysters came out so dirty it was difficult to eat. One of our oysters also had a small shellfish (maybe a mussel) attached to it which felt weird. I assumed it would be okay since they shucked it and served it to us... I'm not sure if that was the cause, but I got food poisoning the next day. 

We didn't order any of the other menu items. 

The drink specials for happy hour are amazing. That is mainly the reason for the extra star instead of 2 stars. They have interesting and tasty cocktail concoctions and are included in the happy hour menu!

Other than that... the place is super cute and the service is great. They treat you like you are having an expensive meal, and the bill comes out to so little compared to the ambience. The table bread is just whatevers.

My family and I ate at this historic New Orleans venue this weekend.  To say it was fantastic was an understatement.  We started with a dozen P&J's and a bottle of Chablis which were both excellent.  We then had the brussel sprouts that had a hidden hot sauce mixed throughout that was like something I have never had.  They were also delicious. Our party had the Shrimp and Grits, the Ahi Tuna with lump crabmeat, the duck, the lamb, and a steak. Basically, we tried everything on the me menu and it was all spectacular.  The only thing that was not up to our liking was the lobster bisque. It was much to thick and had heavy tones of cinnamon and nutmeg.  It tasted more like a pureed pumpkin pie to me.  Be that as it may, I still give this place a 5 star review and will definitely recommend it for friends.

Service: Outstanding 
Food: even better
Wait: had reservations but made them an hour before I went. This was also on a Sunday night so others may not have the same luck.
Would I recommend? I recommend this is your destination.

The wait for a larger group on Sunday night was ~a half hour. Service was super meh. The waitress interrupted our conversation so many times for unnecessary reasons and it felt so intrusive. We were also rushed so much to finish quickly (even though the entire wait for a table was because two tables had paid already and weren't being rushed to leave...). Even though I asked for the remainder of my food to be boxed, it ended up being thrown away, which I found to be a strange miscommunication...

However, the food was not bad. I didn't like the Brussels sprouts (14$) -- too salty and overcooked, and they were billed as crispy, which they weren't really. I did like my entree, the fried oyster salad (17$) a lot. The oysters were crispy and tasty, and the greens were quite good.

happy hour features $0.75 fresh oysters and $1.25 fried oysters, you can't beat that!  The oysters can be ordered by dozen or half dozen, and safe with fried, and only one type of oyster is offered.  The breading on the fried oysters falls right off when you fork it up so it's a bit harder to eat, but delicious anyway !  We were lucky to get in on a weekday afternoon as well as the afternoon on a Friday - it can certainly get crowded by the weekend, and you're welcome to wait by the bar (which can get overcrowded as well) for a table, so remember to book ahead if you can!

Attempted to go here for dinner - checked open table to make sure there were open reservations. There were plenty (we weren't sure how many would be in our party so I was reluctant to make a reservation before I had confirmed everyone). When we got there I was told a table for two was 2 hours. I checked open table again when we exited - I still could have made a reservation for virtually any time in the evening, there were plenty of empty tables as well. Not sure what the thought was here...

This was our first meal in NOLA and quite possibly the best. We went to happy hour and were seated right away. You can call ahead. We had my 13 year old son with us. Not many kids there and definitely not a lot of options for picky eaters, but my son had an AMAZING burger and fries that he was happy with. Hubby started with dozen raw oysters and loved them so much he ended up eating 3 doz and decided to forgo ordering a meal. They didn't judge, just kept them coming. Big, plump fresh delicious oysters with cocktail sauce and fresh grated horseradish. He was in heaven. Yum!
I had the shrimp and grits. I don't have adequate words for how much I enjoyed this dish. I've had shrimp and grits in many places and these were special. The shrimp were big and so fresh and perfectly cooked. The grits were creamy and cheesy and absolutely delicious. Savory and decadent. It was perfection! 
We finished with the bread pudding at our servers recommendation. It was phenomenal. It was hot and sweet and gooey and delicious. I would have liked a bit more ice cream but nonetheless delicious. My picky son even enjoyed it and was digging in the corners of the bowl for every last bite.
Luke was a phenomenal experience for us and at this price point was comparable to some of the other touristy type seafood places that can not even compare to the food quality and the creativity and execution of the meal that Luke offers through their menu. I withheld the 5th star bc we had 3 different servers throughout the meal. Not sure why that was but we did have to wait quite a bit for drinks and refills at one point while our first server was talking and laughing and promptly getting drinks for the table next to us.
Best ahi and bread pudding I have ever had.  Period.  This is not to be missed. If you have one meal in NO this is the place.

This review is for Luke's happy hour. You DO NOT want to miss this happy hour. It's extremely popular and I've read reviews that you often have to wait and get it. My husband and I were lucky enough to nab a stool at the bar and we got to watch them shuck oysters. First of all, the service at the bar was incredible. Extremely attentive. Drinks came quickly and I greatly enjoyed my GINtilly. The drinks look smaller but you are paying half price for them so that didn't bother me. We ordered a half dozen fresh and fried oysters and omg. Now I'm from Cape Cod, MA so I know oysters. I'm spoiled with fresh Wellfleet oysters on the regular. But I can see why NOLA is known for their oysters! These were massive and fresh. And the fried oysters were out of this world, I've never tasted anything like them! .75 cents per raw oyster, 1.75 each fried oyster, but you have to order them in half dozens or by the dozen. Completely worth it, do not pass it up!!

This is one of my favourite restaurants in NOLA. Literally after 20 meals, Luke really impressed me. 

We went to the restaurant on a busy Wednesday. With our reservation,we were seated right away. The meal started with complimentary bread, meh, it was bland. 

I tried Crawfish Bisque. Wow, that's something! The flavour is very unique. I LOVED IT! 

I order the Puppy fish. While the fish was fried, it tasted very light. And my fiancé got entrecôte. Having eat steak all over the world, this piece of meat is in our top 5. Literally melting in your mouth. 

We finished up with Bread Pudding. I truly wished there would be more ice cream. The pudding was delicious and chewy. 

The only thing we didn't like was having different servers for our table. 

But I would come back! What a magical place.
$0.75 happy hour oysters, great deal. There can be a wait (HH 3-6 pm) so try to get a reservation or call ahead. Ask for the mignonette sauce with the oysters.

Stumbled upon this on accident. Cool upscale gastro/bistro with bustling waiters and staff everywhere you turn. I sat at the bar solo to watch them shuck oysters and ordered lunch. Bartender was nice and pleasant but didn't really oversell or go into details about the food or make suggestions.

I ordered the matzo ball soup and the Luke Salad. 
Salad was so damn fresh that I even ate the little cherry tomatoes- and I HATE those!!!
I can just have a plate of the pickle beets and stuff myself on them alone for a meal!!! TO DIE FOR! 
I almost licked the bowl and still didn't feel "bogged down" or stuffed. 
I was very glad to see veggies added to the matzo soup. Almost like a chicken & veggies w matzo balls. Veggies were fresh and firm but disappointed in the blandness of the matzo ball. 

I wish I was in town long enough to try dinner...next time then.

Wow. What to say - honestly one of the most disappointing meals I've ever had in New Orleans. Two stars only for the service and amazing brussel sprouts the table next to me shared with me!

I ordered the P&J oysters and steak frites per the server's recommendations. The oysters were huge, but the smaller ones were actually the more flavorful and tasty. The big ones tasted like ... nothing. They were also very gritty - I kept having to slyly take shell out of my mouth :(

The steak. I was SO LOOKING FORWARD TO A GOOD STEAK. It was chewy and fatty. I had to spit out so many pieces and left a good amount left. The fries were overcooked and burned. My server asked if everything was okay, I said no not really, and they said okay and took it away and gave me the check.

The only saving grace was the service and the people next to me. OH and the fabulous Russian River pinot. SO SO SO disappointed and cannot in good conscious recommend this place. Maybe it was an off day, Sunday? Either way, sad face.

Meh. I've been to other Besh restaurants and have enjoyed the experience way way more. BOTH times that I've been to this place, I expected so much more than I got. I insisted on taking my fiance here after his NOFD Academy graduation, and to say I was embarrassed for not choosing a better spot is really an understatement. Not only was the menu minimal, it wasn't nearly what I was hoping for to celebrate such an occasion. If you're in the area and spot this place, I would honestly only go in for fries and cocktails.

Recommended to us by the hotel staff where we were staying.
The oyster bar was a popular choice and my friend said he oysters were fresh and tasty. I'll take his word for it since I'm not a fan.
I had the roasted chicken, it was quite tasty and a very substantial serving.
The crispy Brussel sprouts were very very tasty according to everyone at he table.

This is my third time at Luke. Not a great experience this time due to careless service. He didn't write down my orders. We had to ask for services from other random servers. 

Crawfish bisque 
Matzo Ball & Roast Chicken Soup (not my fav)
Blue Crab 
1/2 Dozen of Louisiana Shrimp cocktail
Fried oyster salad (not my fav)
Chicken tender and French Fried
Apple juice( didn't make it for this table)
Pâté of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers (didn't make to the table)

Amazing food and service! We came here after a Pelicans game late at night, ordered the Brussel Sprouts and Shrimp grits to share between the two.

To our surprise, they split the grits in two so that "we would get more shrimp each"! 

The shrimps werent piping hot(even though they were in skillets) so we asked if we could reheat it. The waiter (Gary) was so nice about it and they were reheated super quickly.

The brussel sprouts were amazing, paired with the grits. And also... WARM bread for the table!! For dessert we had the choco torte with peanut butter icecream, also really good.

We simply just loved eating here and the waiters are super accomodating and nice. 15 mins before closing at 11pm they still seated two old ladies!

Came here for happy hour for half off cocktails (delicious), $1.25 fried oysters (best I've ever had) and less than a dollar for raw oysters! You get the local P and J oysters for the happy hour oysters, which are quite unflavorful and full of oyster shell pieces from shucking. Can't really complain though because for less than a buck a shuck it's still a steal! 

I would have given perfect star review had it not been for the strand of hair embedded/cooked into our crawfish.... kind of ruined the moment of a superb meal. We couldn't even just pick it off because it was so cooked into the crawfish! Also, no one even came by to ask how our meal was or if we needed anything else, so we never got to show them the hair-wrapped crawfish.

We were recommended here by a server at Johnny Sanchez... since John Besh is also the owner we decided to give it a try and we left extremely happy! 

We went around 4:30 on a Wednesday and were seated right away. They had their happy hour menu which is amazing .75 raw oysters and 1/2 off drinks. We ordered raw oysters, fried oysters, and tuna tartare. For drinks we had the jalepaloma and the french [ not sure if i'm accurate on the name] either way we had no complaints! We will be back and try their famous burger which is what we originally recommended there for.
They were super accommodating for our large group of 13 just before there dinner started they arranged a table for us and opened early. Even with all that the food the food the food!!!!

O-M-G, so delicious and with pro wait staff. They took us without reservations and sat us immediately.  I was so glad to hear they had kids menus given the sophistication of the offerings. Chicken tenders and mac and cheese, check! Our waitress was very personable, engaging with the kids and knowledgeable about the menu. From several potential selections, she steered me toward one which was especially good in season (right now). 
The crawfish omelet was amazing, full of buttery deliciousness, baby asparagus and little pieces of mushrooms, I think chanterelle, alongside a mixed greens salad. The omelet and the kids meals came with tasty frites. Hubs had a quinoa bowl with farmers cheese, poached egg and avocado, declaring it delectable. 
In addition to the awesome food they had cool decor, with contrasting parquet floors, stuffed board heads (also intriguing the kids) and oyster shell-framed mirrors. Wish we lived here to visit Luke weekly. My kids keep asking to go back, too.

I didn't get too crazy here because I was alone with my kids, and they won't share anything cool with me. However, the service and food were great. I loved the look of the bar and the floor. Very classic and tasteful. I had the monsuer (or something). Its a fancy ham and cheese. Their fries are DELISH. Also, bottled Coke?! Whaaaaat! Loved it.
Delicious oysters and great service. Fair prices for Happy Hour. Will return next time I am in NOLA!
Food was delicious! Service great! Loved the ambiance! Especially loved the coffee. Short walk from hotel.

Luke..P&J Oysters, Shrimp, Duck with Crispy Rice  and Etouffee!!

Luke is one of those restaurants that you fall in love with by bookmarking on Yelp after seeing pictures. Then you see more pictures..and more. It gets to the point that every month or so you go back to the bookmark and drool over the pictures. Then you finally make it and the pictures you fell in love with are not even served on the menu anymore. So what do you do?? You order the PJ Oysters, Duck with Crispy Rice and ooh the Etouffee!!!

~The shrimp was amazing. Southern California never 
  would have shrimp as good as Louisiana. The Etouffe 
  was well crafted and prepared.  

~Oysters.. definately the pearl of the restaurant! Baked, 
   Fried and Raw..they are all 5 Stars!

~Tables were tiny and made it difficult to eat with so  
  many dishes on the table. Service was meh.

Overall, I am a fan!

Had ribeye, Brussels sprouts, onion tart & bread pudding. Ribeye was delicious after we added salt. Brussels sprouts were excellent. Bread pud was great --a little too sweet for our taste but we suffered through. Worse thing: ketchup in little Heinz bottles. Very tacky for a white tablecloth restaurant. Best thing: Elliot our waiter.  He was knowledgeable, atttentive and very very nice.

Luke was a good choice for a fine dinner. The menu  was quintessentially New Orleans, and the ambiance was great. You can never go wrong with the local oysters, and our drinks were well-made. 

Our group had the duck duck rice (crispy rice in duck confit), shrimp and grits, and the shrimp/crawfish etouffee. Even the take-aways tasted good unmicrowaved (can't be too fussy after a night out on Bourbon). Anyway, overall a great experience, great service. It would have been a solid 5 -- but I got a tiny bit of hair in my etouffee. Didn't bother me as much as it did my friends. I would've still ate it.. but still, that was a little unexpected. 

Still would recommend!

We went for Oyster Happy Hour!
OVER THE TOP EXCELLENT!!! Huge fresh J&P Louisiana Oysters! Great service and food! We ordered 2 dozen oysters and 1/2 dozen fried oysters! Excellent! Just get there early 3-6pm we arrived at 3:45 pm and it was pretty packed. We got lucky and were seated in 15 min.
Great happy hour price. Raw oysters are not so clean. Whould pay more for better oyster shuck

Food was decent. I ordered the chicken with potatoes. The potatoes tasted weird and had like a weird tangy flavor. Chicken was dry and salty. Waiter was charming but bad with filling up water. He would fill one cup up and leave the others empty for no reason. Also had a very small selection. Though, I tried my brothers hamburger and it was outstanding! Children may not like this place but it'll be fine for adults unless you're picky.
The best place for oysters. Go during the daily happy hour between 3 to 6pm. The oyster is 75 cents with a size of an egg and the drinks are 50% off.
Great little place for HH! Oysters are HUGE! Service was great and the drinks delicious.

Delicious, delicious, delicious! 
Our server was kind, funny, welcoming, accommodating, everything was absolutely perfect! From the drinks, to the bread, to our main!  
Highly recommend and a great thank you to Alex for making this experience so wonderful!

Oysters are good especially if you're there during happy hour ($0.75 a pop). Burger was not great ($16.50), cold bun which was too large for the patty and iceberg lettuce. 

Jalapeno grits were good but definitely share as it is quite rich. Shrimp chowder was delicious.

Our server personally was pretty rude. Other staff were very polite but I suppose everyone has their good days and bad days.
Our party of 7 were seated in our own private dining room. Exceptional service and our most enjoyable meal in New Orleans!

This place is great! They have a great happy hour and some of the best (and largest!) oysters I've ever seen. The wait staff and hosts were very nice, but my favorite employees were the oyster shuckers Rob, John, and Tim! We got lucky enough to sit by them at the bar and they are super friendly and very funny. They know a lot about the seafood and oysters. If you like your oysters, tip the shuckers! They are skilled!

They have good cocktails and good beer and a great atmosphere! I'd also recommend the Crawfish etouffe pies.

The raw oysters were great! The creole gumbo was okay, my Bloody Mary was blah. It was a long ways away from the Bloody Mary I had this morning at Ruby Slipper.... which was amazing. Although Luke is conveniently located in my hotel, I think I may need to venture out for the remainder of my trip.

My boyfriend and I had a really good time. We had a hard time picking because there was so much to choose from! Our server was super nice and patient with us. She would put in an order and we would change our minds. We felt so bad but she was laughing and didn't mind at all. We ordered the oysters, shrimp seafood gumbo which we finished before I could take a photo. It was so good! But our favorite had to be the shrimp and grits with added crab meat. My boyfriends eyes lit up with the first bite. My boyfriend and i were sharing everything And what I appreciated the most is they split the plate for us so we both had even portions and we weren't fighting over the last piece of shrimp. Great food and great environment

This was the first restaurant I went to in New Orleans and the best one I've been to. I had the Oysters and the Gumbo and they were exceptional. The staff is very welcoming and attentive and the experience is truly filled with Southern Charm. A must go to when in NOLA!

Cajun food with German flare!

We came here for breakfast on a Tuesday & there was no wait.

Friendly customer service, very attentive, & good food!

Southern Breakfast:  2 eggs, bacon, Andouille sausage, buttermilk biscuit, grits.  A hearty breakfast!  Very filling & delicious.
Yogurt Parfait:  A light yet filling meal to start off your day!

Followed yelp here had a Bloody Mary and crawfish tartine. I didn't care for the Bloody Mary spicy but just not quite right. The Crawfish Tartine dish was ridiculously good. I am not a fan of peas and this dish is loaded but they were a light sweet compliment to the delicious butter crawfish broth poured over a crust bread and topped by a creamy poached egg. Hello my friend I love you.
Staff was friendly and helpful. Great way to start a day in the Quarter.

We had pre dinner snack and drinks as we were staying across the street but had Rez elsewhere. Sat at the bar which provided entertainment in the form of a delightful bartender making beautiful cocktails. We had the gumbo soup and crawfish soup. Both were perfect and accompanied by a warm and flaky baguette. Didn't have enough nights to try for full dinner but definitely will on next visit.
Prime atmosphere, phenomenonal food, and top notch service! Will definitely be back for more shrimp and grits.

It's good for the price- nowhere near great. Service is phenomenal but too many of the items are 80% there flavor wise. Its tough to say because I enjoyed my two experiences there- but I was not a fan of the prices.

The raw oysters were great! The creole gumbo was okay, my Bloody Mary was blah. It was a long ways away from the Bloody Mary I had this morning at Ruby Slipper.... which was amazing. Although Luke is conveniently located in my hotel, I think I may need to venture out for the remainder of my trip.

Update: Okay, okay! Oyster update... Since my initial post, I've grown somewhat addicted to Luke's. Not only are they delicious (some of the best I've ever had) the pricing are phenomenal!!

I snuck into Luke's just before the end of breakfast service. Ends at 11am. Look at the nice crawfish omelette with greens! It tasted wonderful. I feel like the greens with a delicate dressing was almost a European touch. Had just regular black coffee. Very strong but not bitter!! Great service, tasty breakfast!

This was one of my top meals in NOLA. 

There is a daily happy hour from 3-6 with 75 cent oysters (warning they are large oysters if you prefer small ones)! They have a great French 75 as well! A group of us of 8 went for dinner so we tried a large variety of items. 

The seafood tower was spendy but was so much food. Honestly, we could have been happy with that and not order anything else.

Highlights of the meal were the duck duck rice with crispy rice - the crunch and flavors were spot on and jumbo Louisiana Shrimp en cocotte which was rich in flavor so best to get this and a something on the lighter side. The service was great - they were patient with us as we continued to order many drinks! This is the place to go for a nicer meal in NOLA!

To be fair: I didn't actually get to dine here. But I still got low-rent service from a high-rent joint. And I wound up *way* happier down the street (see my review for Gallier).

Upon inquiring about a seat at the bar, the hostess said it was "first come, first served," and that it's usually a quick 15-30 min wait. After confirming it was okay to wait at the door, others trickled in 10-15 mins later also asking about the bar, and the hostess repeated the "first come" line. But she neglected to tell them I was the 1st person waiting for the bar--and didn't seem to mind when the follow-up folks waiting stood over the shoulders of dining bar patrons, waiting to poach their seats.

After waiting a few more minutes to see how it'd play out (nothing changed), I left. And I don't plan on coming back.
Delish food and great service!  A nice escape from the French quarter for an amazing dinner! Make a reservation.... but if you don't, it's worth the wait.
This restaurant is GOOD if you are in New Orleans go to this restaurant.  The service was great and the food was excellent.

Tried this for breakfast and it will be my go to.  Don't understand why people are waiting in line at mediocre tourist traps for breakfast when they can enjoy a fantastic meal in a beautiful setting with excellent professional service. Had the crispy chicken biscuit served with fluffy grits and homemade bread and butter pickles.  It was excellent.  Service was outstanding from the moment we walked in and were greeted by two friendly hostesses.  And they take reservations for breakfast.  Try this place out if you are looking to start the day with southern comfort food.

Slightly mixed review, but overall a very nice experience. Service was a little spotty, but when you got their attention, it was excellent. When we mentioned that we didn't particularly like our first course (flammenkuchen), the waiter offered to remove it from our bill. My steak was perfectly cooked, and the red velvet doberge was divine.

Everyone always talks about how New Orleans is such a great food town. So, it can be overwhelming to figure out where to go. I decided to try Luke based solely on Yelp reviews. 

Nothing overly distinctive about the decor. But there are wait staff in white coats. I felt like (and certainly looked like) an under-dressed tourist when I walked in and saw most tables occupied. I asked if I needed a reservation, and was promptly seated in the back part of the restaurant (which adjoins the lobby of the Hilton on St. Charles). It was happy hour, so I ordered Luke's signature French 45 -- champagne and fruit juice, it was quite delicious. A waitress brought over a small baguette wrapped in a towel -- warm -- with a metal bowl of soft whipped butter. So far, so amazeballs. 

Sadly, I am not too much of a seafood eater, so oysters are lost on me. My second waitress -- yes, I had two wait staff -- recommended shrimp and grits, with an addition of crawfish (currently in season). I also ordered a salad with buratta and grilled spring onions. The salad came with two slices of toasted bread, kale, onions and mushrooms tossed in a light vinagrette. The salad smelled heavenly and the cheese was meltingly soft and spreadable on the toasted bread. 

I really have no words to describe the shrimp and grits. I know that I will not have a dish like this anywhere else, ever again. Any other variation of shrimp and grits has to pale in comparison with what I ate at Luke. Smooth, cheesy, delectable grits. Huge, fresh, delicious shrimp. Butter. Chopped pieces of sausage.
