I didn't want it to end. There cannot be any greater compliment for a restaurant than for a patron to say they never wanted the food they served to end. The service was also top notch. 

Thoroughly enjoyable experience and highly recommended.
The menu is extremely limited and overpriced. Some of the seating is weird. I would not highly recommend this restaurant.

One of my favorite spots in NOLA.  Everything is fresh and seasoned so well. Would recommend making reservations ahead of time. I've tried lots of different things here (cocktails, starters, and entrees)... Never disappoints!

Solid, but nothing ground breaking or innovative. People dress business casual, or so it seemed when we went. No need to stress too hard about it though. There was a wait, even though we had reserved and there was lot of space in the back. Very good Liver Pâté with the assorted cheeses and such. Dessert was lackluster. Overall, more in the positive than the negative

Great atmosphere for lunch, casual or fancy. The service was fantastic and friendly. We ordered way too much food. The ONLY thing we didn't care for were the eggplant bites. But everything else was classy, elegant and tasty. If I can figure out how to attach the pics I took from my phone to this review on the computer I will shortly. It's definitely a food picture worthy place!

I came back to Yelp to make sure I reviewed this place. I have a confession - I visit every time we come to New Orleans, and I get the shrimp en cocotte (fancy words for shrimp and grits) every single time. No shame. We also usually get some form of fresh seafood from the raw bar and every time it has been amazing. My favorite is the small seafood platter - the tuna tartare and shrimp chips, omg. Huge shrimp, delicious mussels and clams, and giant P&J oysters. Luke is my happy place.

Went here for lunch. We started with the crawfish and burrata tartine. Yummy! Melts in your mouth and perfect to share! After reading the Yelp reviews, we felt compelled to next share the shrimp with grits. Normally would not have gravitated to this, but it did not disappoint! The flavor combinations were so tasty. They split it for us on 2 little cast iron skillets which was cute. Both dishes and their sauces were so delicious. Other people's food at other tables also looked good. Highly recommend!

Well.. thier service was really good. They customised our drinks and food as per our needs. Food presentation was really good and the sever was the best ever. She suggested some very good local places to eat
Had dinner here on my trip to NOLA. Food was tasty just a tad on the salty side for my taste.

The places was amazing!   Got lucky due to we didn't have a reservation. The food so delicious!  I ordered the tuna it's was on point, definitely recommend ordering it rare.  My friend got the duck it's was amazing, I don't even like rice but theirs is crispy which I liked a lot.  Dede the manager just made our last night in New Orleans amazing!  Loved her personality and awesome customer service!  She honestly went over and beyond to take care of us!!! This place is definitely a must if you are in New Orleans.  Great atmosphere, amazing food, super fresh seafood, and great staff.  Stop in and say hi to Dede for me!

First time in New Orleans and experiencing all the food and culture. Luke has amazing food and even better service. DeeDee is the best! She got us in on our last night and was the friendliest person and we saw her helping all the staff with everything and still made time to speak to the customers. The people here made it an awesome dining experience. Would recommend to everyone.

I had no trouble getting a table at Luke for lunch on a Wednesday. The waiter was extremely attentive, the shrimp and grits were delicious and the portion sufficient that I got to eat the leftovers for dinner, and I would eagerly eat here again.

We really enjoyed our happy hour here at Luke. We were from oot and came for oyester happy hour and honestly don't have a lot of money. The place was very nice. I wish I remember  the names of the staff. They were really so gracious and helpful. They didn't not seem annoyed that we were there for happy hour. They were so professional helpful and kind. We ordered fried oysters, raw oysters and drinks. We had a super lovely time and they food was wonderful. Really I suppose we don't really like raw oysters but had never had them. These seemed like good quality tho. Thank you so much Luke! If you are in the area I would recommend Luke.

The service was brusque and by far the least friendly of the places we ate at, but the happy hour was still pretty good - the fried oysters were our favorite, hot out of the fryer and crispy and the oysters pretty plump at $1.25 per. The raw were also good, and at only 75 cents, a bargoon. The cocktails were strong and also good - the blackberry smash was my favorite, a bourbon based drink, and the ponchat cooler. 

Pretty popular place for HH so I think people fill it up near 3, and then there's a lull by 4:30 or so as the first wave stumbles back (to the office?).

An interesting experience to say the least.  What rating do you give when the food is fabulous and the service is horrible?  

We had a reservation, and yet they couldn't sit the six of us.  We were left standing in the middle of the restaurant amongst many empty tables.  There was nothing the manager could do, he said.  When we asked to put three small tables together (along the wall), we were told it was "against the rules"!  They expected us to split up with two at one table and four at another!  How absolutely ridiculous.  Finally, a lovely woman (Deedee?) found us a table and we sat TOGETHER.

Four of us ordered cocktails, and two of us ordered wine.  The cocktails came fairly promptly, but we waited and waited for the wine.  Finally, I asked the waiter if they were out stomping the grapes, and he replied that they had run out of wine glasses!  Huh?

The duck duck rice was wonderful as was the shrimp dish, but only three of us stayed to eat.  The noise was UNBELIEVABLE, and the rest of our party ate somewhere else.

Much as I loved the food, I won't be coming back to Luke.  The noise, the ridiculous rules, the loss of our reservation, and the terrible service will keep me away.  Such a shame.

I came here with the expectation of "the best burger ever" maybe not the best ever but at the moment I could not think of anything better. My boyfriend and I were here for happy hour, we ordered the fried oysters and we were not disappointed. Then we decided to split the Luke burger as we were not super hungry. We were brought out a sliced burger and fries for each of us. The burger was delicious and were happy it was already split between us. Would definitely recommend it to others.

Wow, finally a great meal in NOLA!  We've suffered through a few lackluster meals in New Orleans, but this certainly wasn't one of them.  We had the Small Seafood Platter, Shrimp and Grits, and a bowl of Gumbo and everything was spot on.  We liked it so much we are headed back for Happy Hour tomorrow.  Our wait staff was excellent and very attentive and the ambiance was good as well.  No complaints from the couple who "lives to travel and travels to eat."
Everything we ordered was excellent. The server, busters and hostess were all first class. The burger didn't need any condiments and the gumbo was seasoned to perfection. I'll definitely come back!

I went here with my parents for their anniversary and we were so amazed by how delicious the food was! Their deep fried oysters were so cheap during Happy Hour and we kept getting one order after another of it. Their burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had and their pasta is amazing too -- all of their food was impressive. I'd definitely recommend it!

Amazing. Fried Oyster salad, crawfish bisque. I'll be dreaming about that salad!! Great service. We walked in with a 9 month old and 4 year old. Were nervous but were seated in the back. Kids behaved, dinner was amazing... wish we would have ordered more off the menu!

We visit this spot every time we go to New Orleans. During our last trip, our 9 year old animal activist came along, even though we knew finding something on the menu would be tough for her. We were seated underneath a large animal head and she became dramatic and said she wouldn't eat here with that "animal staring" at her. I was just about to beat her ass when our server, Ritchie Rich came to the rescue and covered the animal head with a towel. She was pleased and no beating transpired. The whole restaurant cheered. Ritchie also brought her a plate of fruit that was off menu. The food is incredible and consistent every time we visit. Thanks Ritchie, for saving me from jail time.

P ml hi o Jv 89274077147 mm 
p I'm I l l eat dry Jojo o mpub k0  m p7k H I  MI k WA ly

This place is busy! At first I though I was going to be waiting a long time to be served, not at all. Service was prompt and courteous ...
And the food was incredible. We ask the waiter for recommendations, and he gave us the most delicious dishes. My husband had the Tuna, I had the shrimp w grits ( best grits I have ever had) .

Found this gem on yelp. The service was top notch. Came in for happy hour. My wife loved the oysters. Were were educated on the various kinds and locations they came from. Great place. We visited twice during our stay in the city. We will go back.
Great happy hour with 75 cent oysters! Excellent beer selection and really wonderful Gumbo! We will be back next year!!!
Solo dinner at Luke's. The oysters were delish. The shrimp and grits were to die for. I really wish my beautiful Catarina was with me so I could try hers. This was a great NOLA dining experience.

Had an early lunch here. They were kind enough to serve what I wanted of if the lunch menu even though it was still early. 

I had the BLTAAU open faced sandwich on a very slim toasted bread. The tomatoes were thick and delicious. The Allan Bacon was thick and crisp. The sandwich was so good. 

Everything here was good!

Luke is one of my top 3 go to New Orleans restaurants.

$0.75 oysters during happy hour + delicious cocktails, what more could you want? Oysters are so fresh, big, juicy&plump. Service was great and atmosphere of restaurant is nice/upscale, but laid back. Would definitely come back!

This place is so cute ! We came here for brunch and could not wait to eat here. I got the shrimp and grits while the girls got a little bit of everything. Coffee was served is white teacups/saucer :) so cute! 
The shrimp and grits came in an iron skillet the grits were buttery and delicious. The shrimp were huge and seasoned well. What really made the dish was the sauce/gravy they smother the whole shrimp and grits with. So damn good!! I wish we had enough time to come back and do the lunch/dinner menu :) Next time I'm in NOLA I'm def. Stopping by here !

Recommended by the concierge and appreciated by me!  My go to question is "if you were to go eat right now, where would you go? "  I got there about 2 in the afternoon and I was asked if I had a reservation,  a strong indicator that they stay busy all the time.   There was bar space, so I sat there and enjoyed a nice glass of chardonnay.  I asked the server for their recommendation and was thrilled to get it,  shrimp and grits!  Delicious!  I also had 1 oyster which was a giant.  The grits were larger than I've ever seen and three was a sweetness to them that was unexpected.  Loved it all.

I tried gumbo for the first time here. It was OK, there shrimp was too squishy, something else in it tasted funny. The base of the gumbo was OK tho, maybe it was old idk but never had i had shrimp just squish in my mouth.

The service was terrible, the guy never came. I had to flag him down for a refill (which took 10 mins).

Food came out fast but i wouldn't recommend
Came here for Happy Hour, we tried their raw oysters, fried oysters and Rabbit pate. Everything was good, not mind blowing, although I have to say, their oysters are HUGE.

I visited Luke after a conference in New Orleans and had the best experience you could ask for. The servers were attentive, friendly and quick. The food was absolutely magnificent - we shared three dishes, a salad, brussel sprouts and the shrimp and grits entree. The dishes all came pre-split between me and my colleague. The wine selection was great, and happy hour was a great value. Next time I'm in NOLA I'll be back!
Hands down best shrimp and grits I've ever had. Prompt service and excellent presentation.

Had a wonderful early dinner there Monday night.  The service was outstanding and with happy hour rolling, the value was also outstanding. The duckduck rice and crispy brussel sprouts were superb and the raw oysters very fresh and super tasty - better than many others in town.  In fact, while not a place for a quiet meal, the ambiance was good and the overall experience top notch. Will definitely go again!

I hadn't been to Luke in many years, so the other night a friend was staying at a hotel nearby and I suggested we go to Luke for dinner. I was disappointed that they only had one of the five selections of oysters, however we enjoyed some tasty P&J's oysters as an appetizer. We moved on to order the Shrimp and Crawfish Etouffee and the Crispy Brussels Sprouts. The etouffee was excellent, not too spicy on the cajun side and just right on the creole. I look forward to exploring more of their menu soon.

Fabulous service, nice menu offerings - the shrimp and grits was very tasty.  I appreciated how the water glass was kept full throughout the meal and when they ran out of the local beer I was drinking, I feel like the waitress went out of her way to bring me other options to taste so that could make a decision on what to drink.  She had a several options and that went a long way to my satisfaction.  We had 5 for dinner and all had great meals!!

Two friends and I stopped in last Friday night while visiting for Jazz Fest (Anita Forever!), and Luke went ahead and delivered on the belief that there is only great food in New Orleans.

I ordered the Shrimp "En Cocotte," plus crab meat on top, with a side of Joe Fekete vegetables (roots like turnips, carrots, etc.)  We shared the crawfish and burrata tartine to start.

The shrimp and grits were just as you dream about: lots of flavor (if I had any critique it would be that they bordered on too salty, just a tad), a terrific portion size, and nice presentation in a little cast iron skillet.  The tartine was also terrific, a dish that we took turns trying to scrape the last bits of over and over again until the plate was spotless.  The vegetables were also tasty and in no way treated as an afterthought.

In terms of ambience, it's French bistro decor and full of happy eaters, but Like didn't necessarily carry the decadent mood that one would expect to feel her first night in NOLA.  So the bra stayed on, but the tummy was filled to the brim!

The fried Brussel sprouts were delicious and a masterpiece of art. Seafood and sausage gumbo was good. Waffles werevso soft and tasty and the chicken was so juicy in the chicken and waffle entree. Great service by Matt. Great recommendation from Eddie at the Courtyard Marriott.

The place neighbors the Hilton hotel on St. Charles in the Business district. Nice location, clean. We went for breakfast around 0900 on a Sunday and there were plenty of tables. We were initially greeted not-so-enthusiastically, no smile and a monotones "I'll be with you shortly" then seated quickly. Wait staff was good, friendly and attentive. I'm a bit picky with appearances and was put off by the waiter's stained, dingy white coat. I feel that if you are going to serve food you should look spotless or at least wear dark clothing (to hide the inevitable food stains that can occur.) The shrimp and grits with eggs sunny side up were good and just what I had hoped for. My husband had the chicken and waffles and unfortunately wasn't happy. The chicken tasted like it had been prepped earlier and reheated. Parts of it were cold! The waffles were descent as we loved the pepper jelly that added to the sweet and savory appeal. The chicken just broke the whole meal. I don't think I'd be back but if I HAD to, I'd stick to the shrimp and grits and try out the breakfast sandwiches which looked like they were made to order. There are just too many better choices that are less pricey in the area.

This is my go to place for bringing guests, breakfast, and brunch! My family was blown away by the burgers. 
The chicken and biscuit is a staple! 
Professional staff, 
Right on the parade route. 
Make a reservation as this place is always busy!
Two words - Bread Pudding! The menu is good especially for brunch food but you'd be missing out on a staple if you don't try the Bread Pudding at Luke's. So don't leave without a heapful of dessert

Luke is truly as good as it gets!!!!!!! We first walked in on a recommendation from a family member and we were hooked from there... I can't say enough about how we were pleased not only with the service but with the quality of food and drinks we indulge in.. Our server Chi was amazing taking time to answer any and all questions and even mentioning spot son recommendations. Her fun and upbeat personality gave our dining experience that epic touch. So much in fact that we returned the next night for happy our and a second meal...Thats how good this place is... For starters try the Door Number 3 drink it will knock your socks off, the mint and pomegranate mix adds the perfect touch to the vodka. Secondly they have a great selection of local micro brews that pleased my taste buds.
     Now as for the food we started with the fried oysters with the butter milk ranch dressing which were amazing and flavor packed...you could taste that fresh out of the water ocean taste with every bite. Secondly we had the pate plat'e which blew our minds and our taste buds... Lastly we more than enjoyed the shrimp and grits topped with fresh crawfish.. man just writing this review takes me back to another epic meal moment in time and makes my mouth water... 
    Lastly if you stop in and test the waters start off you Luke adventure first at the Raw bar. Walk up and take a stool preferably the seats infront of the US Marines memorial wall(the Owner/Chef John Besh was a former Marine and pays homage). These three seats are special because they will place you infant of the raw seafood masters... John, Tim, and Calvin are the most genuine characters you will ever come into contact with while in all of Nola. They truly made our Nola experience that much more special. These fine gentle man took the time and care to serve us some excellent seafood all while providing us with the best customer service experience ever. They went as so far as to make us feel like family and to us that says a lot. Trust me when I say that I will most certainly return to visit Luke enjoy another epic meal and experience all while visiting with my Nola family..
Super fresh and delicious! The service was great from stsrt to finish. I will be coming back there when I visit again.
First time.  Had the swordfish, perfect!  Oysters .75 for happy hour 3-6, try the fried.  Nice for lunch, pricey but worth it. Great service, nice place.

Going to preface this- my friends and I are from SF, but came to Luke for our first happy hour in New Orleans. $0.75 oysters and $7.50/half dozen fried oysters, plus half off beers and wines..what more could you ask for?! 

The oysters on the half shell were the juiciest, richest, freshest ones we've had. The fried oysters were a perfect balance of spiced batter not to overpower the sweetness of the oyster. 

Ambiance is nice-white table cloths, but the service is great, people are friendly, and oysters amazing. Great happy hour!!
The food was amazing.  We were sat without reservation because I wasn't very busy at the moment. By the time I was done with lunch it was packed. The fried Oisters are heavenly.

A typical refined oyster bar with friendly staff & well portioned dishes. The service however regarding pacing of dishes is off & needs refinement as main courses were brought while we we still working on our appetizers & then we were expected to make room. Overall though a good place to perhaps meet friends.
Amazing! Rich was our server and he went above and beyond. Hands down one of the best dinners on our trip!
The waiter will speak Chinese and it is amazing! The environment is very good, the price is reasonable, there is parking near the restaurant, the first impression is not bad.

My friends and I came here for Happy Hour and had a great experience. Our server Gary was excellent, explaining everything. He even gave my friend a free oyster to try as she had never had one before. He was passionate about the food which is always a great sign. 

75cent raw oysters were great. They were huge with tons of meat and did not taste gritty or salty as some others. $1.25 fried oysters were soft and delicious. We also ordered tuna tartare which was excellent. 

I would definitely return in the future

My surprise birthday dinner was here and everything was AMAZING! We started off with the Stuffed P&J Oyster which had shrimp and blue crab in them. I do not like Oysters, but fried?! Really great! I had the Shrimp and Crawfish "Étouffée". So delicious. It was made with pasta. Really great flavor. I had some of my friend's Crawfish Bisque. Really good and creamy. My two waiters, Elliot and Tristan, were AWESOME!!! So attentive, entertaining, and simply just kind people! I would definitely recommend them to be your waiters. Loved my experience there!

I went to Luke with a friend for the happy hour and we had really good experience.  The decoration and the service both met my expectation. We tried raw oysters, fried oyster and red bean and rice on their daily special menu. All of them are good. I am surprised that their fried oysters are not too greasy. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely visit again.

It's located a short distance from the French quarters. We unfortunately missed HH but luckily had already made reservations for dinner so we were seated in the dining area not too long after we arrived. Our waitress was so friendly and professional. She gave us a number of recommendations and checked on our table throughout the night. We ordered the raw oysters, seafood gumbo, shrimp & crab etoufee, and the Brandan's bread pudding (YOU CAN NOT LEAVE WITHOUT TRYING SOMETHING OFF THEIR DESSERT MENU! )

The raw oysters were delicious. The best I've had in a while. They were obnoxiously large; some were almost the size of my hand...so fresh and sweet...

My husband's gumbo was SO good. It was very flavorful, each bite had little piece of shrimp.

The shrimp & crab etoufee fell a little flat for me. I've had etoufee at other restaurants in New Orleans and they were so creamy and savory. But Luke makes it with this large pasta that's a little too dense and can fill you up really quickly.

Brandan's bread pudding was so fluffy and the ice cream just melts in your mouth!! A must try!

"Sometimes we create our own heartbreaks through expectation." My friends and I were in New Orleans for vacation and of course the food was a major selling point. And every place we had been to had delivered... until Luke's. We had ordered the Giant Seafood Tower which consists of clams, mussels, tuna tartar, oysters, and the main piece of the puzzle: lobster. Presentation was great, but we were in for quite the surprise when we made our way to the lobster. Upon cracking it open, a gooey, guacamole looking green substance oozed out of the lobster. To say my friends and I were shook would be an understatement. After a quick google search (we thought this was lobster excrement) we found out that this was "tomalley"- the lobster body cavity that serves as the pancreas and liver of the lobster. And what we learned is .... don't eat it because it contains many toxins. Trust me, no one was planning on eating it, it was an immediate turnoff. Being that the lobster was the crown jewel of this $150 meal (yes, not a typo) we mentioned something to the manager who tried telling us that it was a "delicacy".... we told him we saw articles of the FDA saying not to eat this. This debacle was a big turnoff for us, especially considering that our waiter had checked on us only twice the entire time we were there (not that crowded). The manager, sensing we were not happy, offered to give us a round of drinks for free. This wasn't going to win us over but we weren't going to say no to free booze. But we should have considering we had to wait another 15 minutes for 6 beers. Food overall gets 3 stars, service gets 1.5 stars (the manager rubbed us the wrong way due to his condescending attitude) and that combines for a pretty disappointing end result. Too bad!

I won't be back. 

My first time here back in February was phenomenal. Five stars. 
Second visit with work friends was "good" but lacking attention to details. 
Third visit will unfortunately be my last. Please don't misunderstand, the oysters and raw bar are spot-on, but attention to details and being service oriented are no longer present in my last two visits. 
I couldn't even get my server (I sat at the bar) to pay any attention to me, even though I kept saying I couldn't decide on anything other than oysters. I felt like I was keeping her from tending to more important matters. 

The manager, or a person who looked as such-big guy- kept walking by but never stopped and asked how things were. I think I may have been visibly upset because the "oyster guy" interrupted his TWENTY MINUTE flirtation with the customer sitting beside me (he was peeling her shrimp for her as she ate it, piece by piece) to ask "are you doing ok?".  

On the comments line on my receipt, I wrote "I felt like I wasn't important".  They probably didn't notice.
Delicious pate and jambalaya, best shrimp and grits in town. Great service. Make a reservation or sit at the bar as it is first come first serve and full service.

After a wonderful dinner at August the previous night, we wanted to try another restaurant in the BRG Hospitality portfolio. Luke seemed like a popular choice. 

When we arrived for our reservation, we saw that Luke was a popular choice...if you are a party of middle-aged men dressed in suits and ties.   What I'm trying to say is that Luke seems to be the place for a nice business lunch. We definitely stood out as tourists. 

My family decided to share the crawfish bisque, gumbo, stuffed P&J oysters, and hot buttered crawfish and burrata tartine. Everything was just alright. The crawfish gumbo was so thick it took on an almost sticky texture. The tartine had so much potential but fell short in flavor. The best item was probably the stuffed oysters, but I'd rather have the char-broiled oysters at Acme.

Overall, the food was mediocre and it was difficult to relax and enjoy our meal with all the hustle and bustle around us. After reading all the good reviews, I was disappointed by our experience.

A GOOD EXAMPLE OF A BAD SERVICE
Had a chance to visit this place on Monday and got seated pretty quickly - within 10 minutes as hostess promised. Our server, a middle aged man whose name I haven't memorized was exceptionally nice and professional at the beginning, he was very good about the food recommendations and even said my gin cocktail was going to be on house - "because it took too long", as he explained. We were absolutely enjoying our food and the outstanding customer service and couldn't foresee this ending badly at all.
After less than an hour when we were just done with our food and were continuing our conversation the waiter appeared out of nowhere with a bus boy. Without saying a single word or asking us whether we were in a mood for another drink or desert he demonstrably placed the check on our table, stretched his arm right under my chin, picked up my plate and placed it on the tray held by the bus boy. The same combination of actions in a complete silence happened to my friend's plates and utensils.   Strictly out of curiosity I started looking around in order to see whether we were really abusing this place's hospitality and it turned out there were FOUR vacant tables without a 'Reserved' sign on any of them and two people by hostess' desk waiting to be seated. 
The second wave of negativity and passive aggressive behavior was demonstrated when we requested our bill to be split between two of us -  we were frowned upon and were shown, so there are no any doubts, how annoying we were. 
The food was pretty good though, hence one star.

P.S. The tips I've left to my check were solely provided to pay for the complimentary cocktail and not the service or the level of professionalism of the above mentioned person. After what happened I don't feel comfortable accepting any on-house drink from this place.
The service was pretty bad. The food was ok but not exceptional. This place used to be very very good. I won't be coming back with my friends when it's time to pick a restaurant.

Great lunch spot! The service was very attentive, we had a main sever and an assistant taking care of our needs.

I highly recommend the crawfish gumbo; it's garnished with a stuffed crawfish and the flavor is amazing.  Beware of the bread if you have carb-addictions,  because once you take a bite; you will want more and more.

My husband had the fried oyster salad, which was very good and was a nice portion to pair with soup.
Best shrimp and grits I've had in NOLA.  Brussel sprouts are also excellent.   A must stop every time I visit the city.

I have to say the experience was far superior to the food.  And the food was DAMN GOOD.  We showed up for Happy Hour and it was EVERYTHING.  The raw oysters were plump, fresh and sweet.  The fried oysters were fried perfectly.  The Brussel Sprouts??  OMG, they were DIVINE!!!  My mom had the Luke Burger....it was HUGE and cooked perfectly.  The only disappointment was the boiled shrimp.  I think we were expecting shrimp cocktail, so having to peel and eat shrimp was like UGH.  But the remolaude sauce is also DIVINE!! Plus our server Rich was the bomb!!  We will be back...
Great P&J oysters - fresh and tasty. French 75 for a cocktail. Hope to visit here again - especially during HH!
Shrimp & grits is highly recommended! The atmosphere and service are really good. My boyfriend and I had a nice time here

A-MAZING FOOD. Came in on a Sunday at ~4pm on memorial weekend and the wait was thankfully not too bad at 20 minutes. We decided to wait by  hanging out at the oyster bar to drink some chardonnay and eat 75cent oysters for happy hour. The oysters tasted great for the price, and the shucker working behind the counter was extremely friendly! For the main course we ordered shrimp and grits, gumbo, and seafood étouffée...All of the dishes were the best I had in NOLA. Would love to come back again if the occasion arises.

This was the last place we visited before leaving NOLA. The service was excellent, as our waitress was very friendly. I ordered the shrimp and grits, which our waitress said was the most popular breakfast items. It was a great great last meal before we left. The shrimp and grits were very filling and the grits were creamy. 

I also ordered a Bloody Mary. It was on the spicier side (but that's how I like it). Toppings were pickled green bean, olives, and a lemon. 

Would definitely come here again.

I have heard several people talk about Luke... now that I finally made it here... i can't believe I have deprived myself of this place for so long.  Very very excellent food.  Shrimp and grits w/crab meat was a one of a kind dish!  Crawfish bisque was no slouch at all either! Already planning an encore visit.

Honestly, if you're looking for amazing food, great staff, and a fantastic ambiance, come to Luke. I cannot tell you how amazing Chi (girl, I hope that's how you spell it!) was. She took great care of us and treated us like ROYALTY for my dad's birthday. When we started chatting with her about being in from out of town, she offered to give us a list of personal favorites and went over each with us... Above and beyond, y'all. You will not be disappointed when you come to Luke!
Great food. Staff is a gem -particularly Chi (?). Really took special interest in us. A definite in NO.
Excellent service, excellent hospitality and excellent food equal an excellent experience

I would have given this place a better rating but the custom service is lackluster.  The food is pretty good but the servers are rude. On the brighter side, at least the hostess was nice. Do not visit this establishment unless you are not particularly interested in good service.

One of my favorite restaurants when visiting NOLA!!!

Came here for their happy hour - we ordered a dozen raw oysters, half dozen fried oysters, and a glass of wine each. It was sooo worth it. The raw oysters were cleaned very well (barely tasted a piece of sand whatsoever). My boyfriend was a huge fan of their fried oysters - they were so fat and juicy!! The texture was just so scrumptious. It was also my first time trying fried oysters, and it did not disappoint. 

Also of note, is their bread. Although it is compliment, it was SO GOOD. Warm, and soft, and chewy, I could have eaten the bread as a meal. But maybe I'm just a bread fanatic. 

Anyway, muuuuust give this place a try!!
We had great oysters and crab legs! Our waiter, Elliot was attentive, humorous and every suggestion was spot on! You can't go wrong here!

We came here for oyster happy hour and it did not disappoint. The shuckers are fun to watch and so fast and kept the oysters coming and we got to try a few varieties, and all were delicious! Had a lot of fun and met some characters. Definitely will come back if we are in town again!

I came here for happy hour with my husband and friends. Our friends ordered several dozen oysters (delicious) but I had my eye on the "Shrimp & Crawfish étouffée on top cavatelli". LIFE CHANGING. The entire table could not stop eating it. 

Also ordered: the fried oysters- delicious but pretty chewy, and the Brussels- YUM.

Do yourself a favor and order the étouffée w/ a nice glass of pinot noir.

Came here for breakfast and I was very disappointed. I got the chicken as waffles and the chicken was so dry and the waffles were just ehh. I wanted to love this place because I heard so many great things! But I can't even finish it cause It was just okay. The taste of everything was good, just everything felt so dry.

The best thing I had there was probably the french fries. Maybe next time I come back, I'll have a better expereince.
I had the crawfish bisque. It was delicious! We had a party of 8. They accommodated us and put us in a private room. Great service

Oh hell yes! Hands down one of the best places I have eaten on my trip. It is located on St. Charles Avenue in the central business district. We were greeted and sat immediately. 
Service at this place is superb and so is the food. We started off with their Crispy Brussel Sprouts that were the best Brussel sprouts I have eaten at any restaurant. Just imagine the crispiness along with toasted almonds, honey and cheese. Mouth watering already. 
My favorite part was dinner. I had ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte"...let me give you a visual...jumbo shrimp, jalapeño cheese grits, andouille and green onion sausage...is your mouth watering yet because mine is!!   
It was a party in your mouth. So damn good. Seriously. I ate it very slowly because I didn't want to make it disappear. Ha ha!  Dessert was their Louisian Peach Meringue. Delish! I highly recommend this place to anyone coming into town. This is another place on my "must go" list when I come back.

Nice enough restaurant. Excellent service and ambience, but I wasn't floored by the food. I went in with the expectation for real Cajun, New Orleans food so that might of been what messed me up. If your after authenticity, try something else. But if you just want a nice meal in a nice place, give it try.

Breakfast was tasty, but it didn't blow me away. Service was great and atmosphere was attractive, upscale and clean. They lost 2 stars due to price. I felt they were priced for convenience of the hotels rather than trying to be competitive with other restaurants. 

I heard they have a decent happy hour, but after breakfast being so pricey, we didn't go back.

I had the Entrecôte Grillée et Frites (picture included) and my wife had the Boudin Stuffed Porkchop. Both meals were amazing. In addition, we walked in on a Friday at 5pm with no reservation and were seated immediately. 

The only negative comment is the that the wait staff seemed stretched a little thin. We got our drink orders and it was probably 10-15mins before they came back to see if we were ready to order. I even noticed the couple next to us also trying to get the wait staffs attention so they could pay their bill.

Overall, it was a great experience and we plan to come back in the near future.

I thought I had found the world's best chicken and waffles until I went here. What a great place in dt Nola! My friend took me to brunch and she had the omelet and I had a tough time choosing, but ultimately took the waitress's advice and I couldn't have been more pleased. The pepper jelly is so fresh, the chicken is so moist, the waffles are so fluffy, and whatever cinnamon-butter with which  they top the waffles is divine. We also had a dozen oysters on the half shell, so fresh and clean! I couldn't recommend this place more for a really nice brunch experience.

The food was pretty good. I had 6 P&J Oysters, 6 Fat Bastard Oysters, and a cup of crawfish bisque. I highly recommend the horseradish vinegarette salad. I preferred the Fat Bastard Oysters, the bisque was okay and I actually was more excited about the bread stuffing in the crawfish. The salad was perfect! It had just a hint of horseradish, not too powerful and the beets balanced everything nicely.

Good golly Miss Molly this was some good eats!  Luke always pleases. Service is personalized and sets a bar well above the standard. The fresh seafood bar is da bomb!!  The meal was well prepared and a true delight, served with flourish and fan fare. "The Ladies' Man" awards you five stars!

I really enjoyed dinner here. I was traveling alone so I walked in and sat at the bar. I started with a cup of the crab bisque - I should have ordered a bowl. For the main course I enjoyed the shrimp & grits.  The meal was excellent and the service was solid. I would definitely go back!

Came for drinks and an appetizer and was not disappointed at all. The best roasted Brussel sprouts ever. Sat next to a local and had a great conversation.  We will be back in the future to have dinner next time.

Luke's has an amazing happy hour....which I did not make it to. But I really wanted to try their Shrimp and Grits based on the pictures, so my friends and I had dinner reservations here for our first real meal in New Orleans; reservations were easy to make via Opentable. 

Shrimp and Grits ($24.00) - On the menu, it's  Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte," and described as "roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage." This was a touch too salty for our taste, but the flavors were good, grits were a nice consistency, and it had a good amount of plump shrimp on top. This dish was an explosion of flavors and textures, savory, meaty, perfectly cooked shrimp with some creamy grits. I really liked it. 

Shrimp & Crawfish "Étouffée" ($26.00) - Heirloom tomatoes, garlic, cavatelli. Please note that this comes on a bed of cavatelli (tiny shell pasta), NOT rice as you may be used to with this dish. This was still a solid dish and we were content with the amount of seafood in the dish too. This dish was good, but we all liked the shrimp and grits more.

Service was friendly, knowledgeable, and quick. For a group of 3, the 2 dishes filled us up because these items do tend to be a bit heavy. Prices are a bit on the higher end, but they do use quality ingredients and  give a fair amount (a little on the small side at first glance, but it's enough). 

THE SHORT: Get the shrimp and grits! Try to make it for happy hour if you can --- apparently it's $0.75 oysters and cheap drinks. Reservations can be made easily online, it gets packed. I'd definitely recommend sharing a few items so you're not too overwhelmed by all the rich flavors.

Walked in on a Saturday night and sat at the bar. Fantastic service all around! Our bartender was friendly and she had us try the bread pudding which was delicious. 

-Tasty fried oyster salad (with bacon!)
-bead pudding was warm and moist
I've had the oysters there in the past and they are great.

Amazing service! The crawfish bisque is a MUST. We had the fried chicken with rice and beans it was delicious. The beans have brisket and a Cajun flavor. The portion is large enough to share - we also had the praline bread pudding dessert. No complaints would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting NOLA!

Happy hour has 75 cent oysters and half off drinks! Can't go wrong with that!

Was here for  breakfast and the ambience is old New Orleans  with tile and wood and the food although easily considered standard breakfast fare was fine excellently. The biscuit was delicious as were the eggs and the smoked sausage was large and robust.

How do you go to a Hotel restaurant and they remember you... remember your name and your favorite drink... even though they see sooooooo many people DAILY...  they always take really good care of us here... I've had just about everything on the menu... the Steak is amazing... shrimp and grits off the chain... all the drinks are crazy... oysters for Happy Hour... the Brussell sprouts are awesome... and the service is AMAZING... Huge shout out to my man Richie Rich who always takes really good care of us each time we come! My favorite restaurant in NOLA thanks to the incredible staff and amazing food! Looooooove Luke!

The place is very nice and clean. The waiters were very friendly . 
I had the stuffed P&J Oysters. Omg it was so good ! Even though there were only 6 pieces, they were very filling. 
I also had the entrecôte grillee et frites (ribeye). 
I shared it with my boyfriend, so the waiter brought out two cutting boards, which is really sweet of them .

Went twice.  First for a late night drink and then a second night for dinner.  

I went back because the bartender the first night was a nice guy.  He took some time to recommend a *really* good bourbon and was not stingy on the pour.  

The dinner the second night was just some oysters on the half shell and a fried oyster salad.  The raw oysters were delicious and the salad was perfect.  Right amount of dressing, portion size was right on, and it tasted great.  

The next day I asked a local for a restaurant recommendation and without prompting they mentioned Luke.  So that says a lot.

Ambiance: attached to Hilton, relatively small dining area, very bright inside, full bar service

Service: half bad and half good, waiter was changed after the unpleasant experience from the first one, who stared at TV all the time and ignored our table, didn't serve us bread as other tables got, later another server helped, who was awesome from the very beginning before he was assigned. Since our original waiter was not in the mood to take care of us, I asked the second waiter questions about food on the menu and suggestions, he was very patient and friendly 

Food: overall good taste, not particularly extraordinary 
  Stuffed P&J Oysters - **** gulf shrimp and blue crab, very bold taste, recommend
  Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" - *** roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage, the shrimp wasn't very fresh, but the grits was creamy and taste
  Tasso Rubbed Grilled Swordfish - *** fresh corn, fire roasted poblano peppers cilantro lime beurre blanc, very fresh fish, thick and chewy texture, the vegetables were very flavorful 
  Brendan's Bread Pudding - *** vanilla bean ice cream, hot buttered rum sauce, candied pecans, average taste

Price: medium portions and most items are on the pricey side, normally expect more than $30 per person

Very disappointed with the food and service.  When I walked in, the host stood there on the phone, ignored me.  So I stood there staring at him for nearly 3 min.  Unfriendly host put us all the way in the back room. Our server never smiled.  Maybe it's New Orleans thing.  People are not friendly here overall.

My family and I ate here on our last evening in New Orleans.  Food and service were excellent.  We had the raw oysters, ribeye, entouffe, and slow-braised pork.  Best overall restaurant during our four-day stay in this city.  Thank you.

We went to Luke's on accident really. We ended up loving it. Rich is an awesome waiter! They have the best oysters. Rich got them to chargrill them and they are better than every other place we went to. They have great cheeseburgers also. It's our new favorite restaurant.

Okay so we are suckers for ambiance and great service. Thats what makes us regulars at any place. We do not mind paying extra for great dining experience and showing appreciation for it.
So...
We went to luke for breakfast last saturday and had an amazing experience. Because of which we decided that breakfast at Luke every Saturday would be our thing as a family.

Unfortunately , this Saturday it totally bombed. We have a toddler and a baby so to us the booth seat perticularly in the back out of the way and away from all other diners but close to the waiter station suites us the best.  That way we are able to better manage the kid and still enjoy dining while watching hustle and bustle of the restaurant.

I called Friday and made reservations for that particular table and stressed that we absolutely need that table or we wouldnt be able to enjoy dining. Saturday mornings usually arnt that busy for them so i was assured the availability .

We get there and the table was given away. It looked like it was given away maybe 20-30 minutes before we arrived..as the people had just got their food.

Considering the kids, We had to pick a table in a spot that was very easily neglected. From there it was down the hill. We didnt  get water for atleast 15 minutes we were there. I had asked for buscuits so the kids could eat sonething while we wait for food and get busy.  They came 15-20 minutes after we asked for them.   The table never got cleared as needed. After we got the food..the waiter wasnt able to check with us if we needed anything..which we did.. and had to flag him down.  "
We were definitely very annoyed since our kids were starting to get wild. 
My husband has been on sugar free diet and made sure the waiter was informed. His food came with salad topped with "sugarcane vinaigrette". 
The whole table was never cleared till the end so we had a mountain of dishes with a 1.5 year wanting to go wild with it. 

Ok so bad day right?..it happens...it wouldnt have deterred us from coming back.

My biggest dissappointment was when the manager did not want to admit that they gave the table away by mistake and instead defended and defended with a defensive tone. We would have to pay an upcharge to book a table in a half empty reataurant? Really? Then why didnt you guys ask for my credit card when i made the reservation??

Just admit..mistakea happen...the hostess made a mistake and didnt check on reservations and notes and mistakenly gave the table away. 
 
Mr. Manager, we have trained in hospitality management,  worked in the restaurant industry for a long time in the past. We know restaurants and service standards. The excuses given were B.S. 
Its such a turnoff when you talk to your customers like they dont know better. 

The restaurant wasnt full...there were plenty of tables available to be given away. So No you did not try "your best" to get us the table we needed. Your hostess made a mistake. You didnt want to admit it. 

For a restaurant of this caliber, we expect better customer service 

Food is good not great..we mainly came here for the experience.

My husband loved his shrimp and Grits, rich and satisfying. The raw oysters were delicious and the fried Brussel sprouts. I wasn't thrilled with the Gumbo but all else was tasty including the bread pudding. It's the perfect place to eat if you are looking for deep comfort food.

Came here for lunch. The service was good but the food was underwhelming, especially for the price.

Ordered the...
1/2 dozen stuffed PJ oyster ($19)
Croque Madame with fries ($15)

The oysters were stuffed and broiled over a shrimp and crab mix. They were very salty and had very little flavor.

The Croque Madame is two pieces of bread with ham covered in cheese with an egg on top. This dish was also very salty with little flavor. The Croque Madame along with the fries was cold.

2.5 stars for food and 3.5 stars for service. 

Let me start off by pretty sure I ordered the wrong thing or maybe I came on an off day. I forgot my friend recommended the raw oysters here and I did not order that. 

Service was very friendly! Arrived straight from the airport and the staff offered to store our luggage so we didn't have to roll it to our seats and take up space. They were also attentive and checked in frequently.


 Stuffed P&J oysters - very salty. Only finished 5 of the 6 oysters with the help of lots of water. Oysters were broiled over a seafood mix. Had it been less salty and the seafood flavor more enhanced, it would've been so delicious. 

Croque madame - average. Ham & cheese sandwich with egg. Paired w/ fries that were slightly over cooked. 


If I come back, I'm sticking to the raw bar

First stop on the trip and it was absolutely delicious! This would be my recommended spot for shrimp and grits every time! I can't say enough about their delicious food, friendly staff, and speedy service.

Made a reservation with open table for lunch and we were seated right away. Seriously if you want to make sure you get a table and anticipate it might be busy make reservations!!! 
Everything was delicious and the service was great! This is located right next to the Hilton on st Charles. Inside is clean with classic designs. 

Everything was delicious from the drinks to the food. I can't say I ordered anything that didn't taste good. I was impressed with the food and the service and would definitely come back again. 
I ordered the shrimp and grits. It was probably the best dish I had!

Since I'm in town for business and I have an early day tomorrow, i decided to let dinner be my vice tonight and I have found a place that is happy to lead me down thay path.   Luke is grounded on local flavors but throw in some pan-european flair and choices as well.

I started with a half-dozen boiled shrimp from the raw bar.  The shell was a bit tough to peel but the meat inside was sweet and delicious.   They came with an excellent cocktail sauce and a remoulade that I hope to live.long enough to duplicate.  Truly outstanding.

Next was supposed to be a burrata salad but it came out with a complimentary crawfish bisque that the kitchen made by mistake.  I'll gladly eat their mistakes - it was spicy and rich with kernels of corn and chunks of crawfish. 

Then I got to the salad - an unlikely combination of cucumber, melon, tomato, crispy ham (let's just call it really good bacon) and the silky creamy burrata all married in a mile citrus vinaigrette.  A very successful melding of flavors.

I wrapped up with crispy Brussels sprouts and crispy potatoes, two dishes sharing their adjective.  The potatoes are fried chunks, indeed crispy outside and deliciously soft inside, seasoned with herbs and parmesan cheese.  

I don't know why Brussels sprouts have become the It vegetable but im glad they have.  The ones here were finished with some honey and goat cheese, a very nice combination. 

All in all it was a very satisfying meal.  The service at the bar was just the right amount of attention, and the noise level in  the room was convivial but not overwhelming.

This was R's FAVE place during our short visit in NOLA. They're famous for their burger or at least that's what R told me. We came during happy hour on a weekday. I think it was like 4-6 PM? Or maybe it went to 7 PM. Regardless, we MADE it, that's the important thing. Because their HH is amaze-balls. There were $0.75 raw oysters, $1.50 cooked on the menu. Half off of cocktails. We ordered a few, like 5? These raw oysters were so huge, like a little bigger than the size of my hand. What an amazing deal. They were delicious too! The service was nice and attentive. Oh yeh, the burger. R loved this burger too. I think he just likes burgers in general but if you're a burger fan, you've really got to try their's out. We saw other people in tables next to us that ordered like, 20 oysters at once. Despite ordering a small number, I think it was satisfying. Their cocktails are really good too. This place is next to the Hilton and the crazy thing is that when we walked to our hotel room (yup, we stayed at the next door Hilton), there was a Luke's takeout bag in front of someone's door! Apparently, you can use hotel credit at Lukes AND have them deliver I think.

OMG went at 3 pm for a late lunch
Fantastic 
Brussels sprouts 10
The crawfish Bisque 10
Oysters HUGGGE $9 for dozen  10
Happy Hour
Wednesday special Pasta Sausage dish 10
Yelp rating scale sometimes is just to low
If your within an hour 
This is a must eat at

Oh my gosh. Three words: duck duck rice. If they ever take it off the menu, it'll be a crime. The flavors are phenomenal. The duck was cooked to perfection. And the rice is like fancy adult rice krispies, somehow double-cooked so that it's crispy/puffy and soaks up all that delicious sauce. We had a delicious bread pudding for dessert, but the entrée truly stole the show. This is a dish I'll never forget!

This place is pretty good for a couple of things, the Brussel sprouts and the cooked oysters. I've tried many other main courses that just didn't wow me and took off stars for that. Service was good at least!
This fairly newcomer is my all time favorite restaurant in New Orleans and I've been to most of them!

Friendly service and a brief but thoughtful menu. My dinner buddy enjoyed her etouffe, and I liked my stuffed pork chop, though I wouldn't have said no to a few more peaches mixed in with the veggies. They were so delicious with the sauce. Our desserts came faster than the cappuccinos, the appetizer never arrived, and the drink orders were a struggle - I'm not sure if that was on the kitchen or what, since the servers were friendly and bustling about the place. It wouldn't be a spot for quick meal but it would be a good one!
Great staff, fine kitchen, nice beverage choices and open all day! A better than home away from home!
The gumbo and the oysters were top-notch! Our waiter was very friendly and informative.
Amazing service, nice staff and delicious food!! So glad we got to try it, def recommend if you are visiting in NOLA.

Solid 4.5 star
We had the Monday special - Tabasco honey fried chicken with red beans and rice. Highly recommend it! The jumbo shrimp and cheese grits was great too.
For dessert, we had the bread pudding, it was a bit too sweet with the candied pecans.

The hype is real! 

Did not have reservations, but was seated within 40 mins on a Thursday night after reminding the hostess I was still waiting. 

Servers are very friendly, and accommodating. 

The oysters are so fresh!! hot bread rolls per table .. yum! 

The crawfish "etouffee" is amazing - instead of pasta they make a homemade pasta made of ricotta! So delicious and definitely worth it!!

Service by Gary and Kevin was phenomenal! Walking in late on a Sunday, we were seated quickly. Tried the stuffed oysters, house fries, p&j oysters, crawfish bisque, and the gumbo. Everything was delicious! At the end of the meal, they presented us with a bottle of champagne on the house because 2 of our friends were getting married. It was such a great surprise. Next time in New Orleans, I would definitely go back to Luke!

Not worth the hype. The prices are higher than other places and the food is ok had better. Nice ambiance however the service was poor. The servers seem to have a bit of an attitude and not fully understand the meaning of good customer service.

The best time we've had out in a long time. The guys were funny and we just connected with them and had a blast. Oysters were great and the gumbo was the best but had to order two bowls cause they were a little on the small side. Will definitely be back, Semper Fi Besh!
Excellent service and delicious food. Rich was a fabulous waiter. The hosts and servers were all gracious and pleasant. Crawfish bisque, melon salad, shrimp étouffée, creme brûlée:  all amazing!

I really enjoyed Luke. This was right near our airBnB and thought it would be worth trying, and I am so glad we went. The oysters were fantastic (but that can be said about most oysters in NOLA) and the gumbo and crawfish bisque were also wonderful.

The atmosphere is very nice. We walked in when it was still quiet and within 15 minutes i it really picked up and was full by the time we left. I suggest reservations. 

Away from the French Quarter, but worth the 10 minute walk.

This was my go to place for meals and drinks. Felt comfortable at the bar as a single woman and the food was beyond excellent, especially the shrimp and grits, Brussels sprouts, crab bisque, bread pudding AND the French 75!

One of the best brunches I have ever had. First time For me to have Crawfish with no shell. Together with the creamy tasty sauce, it was very creative brunch dish! My bf had the chicken waffle and also agreed it's the best waffle he has ever had. The Brussels sprouts was served first, and we liked it a lot. But compared to the main dishes, no words left for it. The portions for all of them are huge, so we couldn't finish them, neither did the guests at the two tables next to us. So if you don't want to waste food, no need to get any appetizer to share.
But weirdly, not many ppl come to this place during a busy Sunday brunch time. I definitely recommend this place over other popular and long line brunch places. Try it urself and like my post.

Great food, good portions, great service. But we don't know top with slightly crab meat cost $13 after we got check. That's expensive for a entree already $26. But general is good, will come back again.

Was in for breakfast today. The front and back of house should be a training ground for any restaurant that believes they are doing it right ( you probably are not )

I started off starting brunch three hours to early. The waitress and cooks said fuck it he wants pate let him eat pate. He doesn't like the crostini and bam they made me a lightly toasted crostini. The shrimp and grits all perfectly presented and delicious. My water always full and attention to experience well beyond expectations. If you don't stop in you made a bad choices with your time and money.

The grits and french toast are to die for. Service is quick, but who cares...  try the grits and french toast! Ate here twice during my weekend stay in NOLA. Will go  back next trip for grits and French toast!
Very disappointed... waited extremely long to order drinks... ordered appetizers and one plate came out with hair and waiter acted like no big deal... finished and left!!!
We've never eaten dinner here...only lunch, but it has always been great. Perfect oysters (for $.25/each sometimes) and the blue crab BLT are not to be missed.

First and foremost, I want to say the service here was excellent.  With a group of 9 girls who may have had 1 drink too many, I know taking care of us was not the easiest task.  On top of that, we also had a show to catch.   Our server(s) were on top of it!  Quick, friendly, attentive, and overall we just had a very positive experience.

Coupled with excellent service, the food was also delicious.  We ordered:

Stuffed P&J Oysters (broiled) 
Raw Oysters
Hot Buttered Crawfish 
Crispy Brussels Sprouts
Fresh Gulf Puppy Drum (white fish)
Shrimp & Grits
Shrimp & Crawfish Etouffee with pasta

I think my favorite item might have been the etouffee with pasta.  There was a ton of crawfish and shrimp, and it was bursting with flavor.  Of course, needless to say the Shrimp & Grits are delicious too.  Oh, and so was the Hot Buttered Crawfish (if you can't tell, I LOVE shrimp and crawfish!).  I don't think you can go wrong with any items with shrimp and crawfish.  How many more times can Cecilia say shrimp and crawfish?!

Yes, I would highly recommend enjoying a dining experience at Luke!  Stellar service, delicious food, beautiful and classy space, it's a win all around!

Our party of 7 made it in time for our 11:30 Sunday brunch reservation, after a long night out on Bourbon street. We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share:

Stuffed P&J Oysters (gulf shrimp and blue crab) - I'm not sure why I kept reading this as PB&J, but I'm really glad it wasn't, even though it wasn't that good. It was mostly breadcrumb. I'm not even sure I can remember tasting any shrimp or crab in there.

Crispy Brussel Sprouts (toasted almonds, Espelette honey, Progress Milk Barn cheese) - sat this one out since I don't like brussel sprouts but everyone else who tried it said it was good

Pâté of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers (perfumed with truffles, country bread croutons) - I enjoyed the crispy bread but this pâté was not for me. It was too buttery tasting and not enough liver flavor. I did like that they gave four different mustards and pepper jellies to try it with though.

Citrus Cured Gulf Tuna Tartar (crispy shrimp chips, chili garlic vinaigrette) - there was so little tuna in there, that none of us even realized that it was the tartar. We thought it was just another spread that came with the pâté.

On top of all of this, we each also got our own entree (although most of us were already getting full from all the appetizers by the time our entrees showed up). I had the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte (roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage) - this was pretty good. The grits were very flavorful but also very heavy. Might have been the wrong decision for a first meal after a night of drinking. Also not sure if it was really worth the $25 price tag.

If you want to splurge, it seems their entrees are pretty good. But skip the apps because they're all pretty mediocre. Except for the raw oysters. Oh yeah, we got those too.

The happy hour oysters were the size of my hand for 50 cents each!! This is not a drill. We pretty much split 50 oysters among the three of us because they were so tasty & affordable. Luke has plump raw oysters (more meaty if that's your preference) and fried oysters (but they were much smaller) and a variety of other styles that we didn't try. The bread pudding is definitely a must - it was the perfect ending to our meal! So delicious!

Ok.  Just ok. I had high hopes but fell flat.  Service was excellent, setting is nice and location is convenient if you are staying in a hotel downtown.  The menu was small as I expect for a better restaurant.  However, the fried oyster salad and hamburger just didn't hit the spot.  

Oyster salad had six fried oysters that were cooked ok but the batter didn't have much flavor.  The hamburger had large smoked bacon that was mostly fat and chewy.  Had an ok taste but for $17 I expected more flavor.  The fries were excellent!! 

I would give it try if I was ever in the area but can't say I would make a special trip to visit  again or go out of my way to avoid if I was in a group that wanted to visit Luke's.
The hamburger was really good and we enjoyed the clean atmosphere. They have a nice varied menu - worth doing again.

My friend and i went to Lukes for a 4th of July dinner and had one of the best meals of our stay in NoLa.

Made reservations online so we were promptly seated when we arrived. Our server handed us menus, topped off our glasses with water and handed us some complimentary warm bread. Bread was delicious. Freshly baked, crunchy outside, soft and moist inside. :) 

For dinner we ordered a dozen P&J oysters, crispy brusselsprouts, jumbo louisiana shrimp en cocotte (aka shrimp & grits) and the french 75 for an alchy beverage. Everything was delicious. From the oyster to the drink. Oysters were fresh and large in size. I'm not a fan of brusselsprouts or veggies in general but i wouldn't mind eating this dish again. It's flavorful with a hint of spice from the jalapeño. The entree was the highlight for me. The server had the kitchen plate our shrimp and grits to share so we each had our own plate prepared. The shrimp was cooked just right. The sauce was light but flavorful and tasted lovely with the grits. 

Will love to eat at Lukes again when I am back in NoLa. :)

Tip: Make a reservation in their website so you dont have to wait!

Excellent happy hour if you can get a seat at the bar. I stayed there all night once I managed to nab a stool. A nice dude, and total stranger bought me and another new friend I made sitting in my other side tequila shots. Thanks Miles! It was the girl on my left's 21st Bday. 

Do yourself a favor and get the crab salad as an appetizer with those airy chips. I loved the hint of grainy mustard and the huge pieces of crab. I also tried the smoked fish spread as a starter and thoroughly enjoyed their shrimp and grits. The bartender, Kristoffer recommended I add lump crab to the S&G. Ummmmm, yes please! It was divine! Thanks Kristoffer and staff!

Best chicken and waffles I've ever had. Don't be afraid of the pepper jelly. It's made in house and makes the dish!
*I forgot to take a pic so I asked my neighbor lol. He already started but at least you have an idea...
Pretty good brunch. Wonderful venue, friendly & competent staff, and delicious food. I'd certainly recommend the mixed vegetables, tuna tartare, and the fries (but with the house aioli).
Really enjoyed our meal. The raw oysters were fresh and salty and the shrimp and grits were awesome. It's a great place to go for brunch or before an event in the Superdome.

Luke's is awesome! If your looking for some place that's a bit fancy but still has friendly vibe, this is definitely the place! I had the shrimp and grits and it was awesome!! There's a drink named something 75 that'll give you the right amount of tipsy for the meal and the hummingbird cake was worth every bite. Definitely a bit pricey but it works well for a group of friends or a fun date. Word to the wise, make a reservation!!!!
A happy hour fav. Oysters - raw and fried never disappoint. Add in the Brussels too!  Dont forget to ask about the 1/2 off cocktail menu as well.

This is our 2nd time in new Orleans but our 1st time at Lukes. My wife and I are celebrating our honeymoon! We got a referral to go to Lukes, so we checked them out. Our 1st waiter Kevin was not present after his 1st greeting! We almost left because we didnt initially see what we came there for. After he passed by us more then a few times we were greeted by JULIAN! He made sure to get what we were looking for. He is our new favorite waiter! He showed up and made things happen, with a great personality! My wife wanted her favorite a croque monsieur sandwhich. It turned out to be a lunch item and we showed up at dinner time but Julian made it happen. This turned out to be the BEST we ever had! We also had corn fitters for our appetizer, and I had the shrimp and grits, which were very tasty and flavorful.  He also gave us complimentary champagne and a complimentary bread pudding dessert for us dinning here for our honeymoon. We were very impressed with Julian and this restaurant! 5 stars!!!!
I really enjoyed my fish. I had never tasted drum fish before. The staff were super friendly. Elliot was doing tricks. Classy place. Everyone in my party enjoyed their food. Prices were not bad.

Food is excellent, service is great, and we had the nicest and most fun waiter, Richie Rich! 
My fiance and I are both foodies with high standards when it comes to seafood. After being disappointed at ACME and the Court of Two Sisters (seriously, worst service ever), we tried Luke without much anticipation. But it turns out to be the most pleasant surprise. We were pretty hungry so we ordered a lot. They came at the same time by three waiters, and it feels like carnival. Everything was great, but I gave their "Plates to Share" section highest recommendation. 
Richie Rich is just the perfect waiter when you want a true taste of southern hospitality, but the guy is from Chicago and hilarious. We had a great time chatting about the Chicago Cubs, and he gave us a little surprise to take home. 
Thanks to Luke and Richie Rich for making us love New Orleans much more than we would have!

I give Luke 5 stars based on their service and oysters. I came here during happy hour and lunch and the service was superb! I wish I remembered my HH waiter because he made our experience special. I ordered a drink and he flat out told me it was horrible and recommended the Frenchman. (Try it, half off during happy hour!) The oysters are delicious! The stuffed P&J aren't on the HH menu and are a little pricy ($13 for 3) but they are perfect! The swordfish was the best I've ever had! Worth it!

Ok.  This is a tough one to write... I love this place, love the food, love the room.  I've partied a bunch with the kitchen team.  Awesome people.   But as one of the very first men to embrace the #metoo movement, I feel obliged to give the lowest ranking.

I was SUPER early to #metoo.  Probably one of the original people.  I remember liking a Twitter post from an actress I used to date (don't want to name names, but solid B-list celeb... used to be A list when she was younger).  Before long I saw the hashtag more and more, and I eventually even retweeted a few posts.  

So when I saw that the ownership of Luke was engulfed in the #metoo controversy, I felt I needed to replace my old 5 star review.

Bright, open space with a bistro feel. Traditional tin ceilings. Large and ornate wood trim on the bar with matching wood half-walls to break up the narrow space. Luke is inside the Hilton Hotel on St. Charles. Side note: take a look at the hotel hallway to the bathroom and nearby elevator area for its gorgeous marbled walls and flooring.

We came on a Thursday afternoon at 4:30 for happy hour. It's a great deal - all the wines by the glass, beer, specialty cocktails and well drinks are 1/2 off, and .75 raw P&J brand gulf oysters. Our oysters were large and fresh, brought with red cocktail sauce and separate horseradish. These were comparable to those found at Crescent City Brewery and other NOLA favorites. The Jalepaloma tequila cocktail was refreshing, though a bit too sweet and not enough "picante" (heat) for my taste.

We had been wanting to come to Luke's after we had tasted their yummy shrimp and grits at an outdoor music festival on the river. But, the shrimp and grits ("En Cocotte") disappointed. The shrimp almost seemed to come from frozen. They were a bit too soft. The sauce was uninspired but the grits were good with a soft texture, a bit cheesy and not dry. We prefer the shrimp dishes at Mr. B's Bistro, to be honest. On the upside, the Luke salad had big chunks of heirloom tomatoes, yellow and red beets, and shaved carrots with a light vinaigrette. Couldn't really taste the horseradish. It was fresh and delicious.

One of the unfortunate trends in today's cooking is the overuse of sweetness on vegetable dishes (and cocktails, too.) Being on a low carb lifestyle, I asked the waitress if the Brussel sprouts were overly sweet with honey. I hoped that the honey would be an accent, not the main flavor. If you're cutting down on sugar (and, yes, honey and fruits are sugars), don't order these. They're as sweet as dessert. Even my husband didn't care for them mostly because they didn't compare with the crisp, tasty sprouts at our local Brown Butter restaurant. The wait staff, though, was very accommodating and took the charge off the bill. I would add an extra star for service, but the food really was disappointing overall for a restaurant of this reputation.

Not sure if we'll be back unless visitors would like to try the good deals at happy hour and see the beautiful space.

We went to luke purely for happy hour oysters and drinks. This was a perfect place for those items. Drinks were delicious and oysters were an amazing deal. I would recommend this place to anyone, whether local or tourist.

On my Sunday before leaving Nawlins, I decided to venture out on my own for early brunch (while everyone else was sleeping off Bourbon street) and study the (recipe) book of Luke! I was going to catch the trolley, but meh...decided to walk the entire way, which was 15 minutes. Near many of the hotels, this place has great location! Great southern charm with wood foundations and white linens...a bar is tucked away on the side as well to indulge in a few concoctions, mine being a simple mimosa to cheer on my Sunday indulgence. I wanted a traditional nawlins dish that was a little on the heavy side just because it was early! and why the heck not?! It New Orleans! I had perused the menu earlier and saw that this placed served shrimp n grits--my fav so I ventured out just to savor this dish. OMG!!! Great dish minus the eggs on top.I did try to let the dish remain as prepared, but when the eggs started running, I had to remove em! The texture of the white eggs were excellent-- not too hard and seasoned quite well, but it was the Shrimp nGrits that stole my heart! The first bite will leave you speechless! I had to savor that first bite for sure and just take it all in! I leave it there- I cant describe it enough to even make you comprehend tbe excellence at the Luke. Service was also excellent as well whereas the waiter checked on me frequenty and made me feel at home but not to pushy. Im glad I came early Sunday morning and not only had no wait but excellent service and food. I'm leaving Nawlins nice and full folks--its only right!

I've never reviewed a restaurant on Yelp before but my family's dinner at Luke was so phenomenal that I felt compelled to write. This meal was one of the top three meals of my life and I've eaten at some of the best restaurants in the world. Our waiter, Richie Rich, was the best waiter we've ever had. The perfect combination of funny, knowledgeable, and compassionate, he made us feel like part of his family. The food was to die for. The bread was warm and fresh. The drinks were perfectly mixed. The raw oysters were fresh and succulent. I had the shrimp étouffée, which was excellent. My wife had the chicken, which was perfectly cooked and full of flavor. My children split the chicken tenders, which were obviously hand-breaded and perfectly cooked. The desserts were to die for! This was the best meal I've ever had in New Orleans and I've never had a bad meal in that town. Don't sleep on Luke!

Skeptical New Orleans native here. Far exceeded my expectations.  The fried oyster salad is the best salad I have ever had. The gumbo was hearty made with a dark roux. Togo was quick and the server was enjoyable. Worth it!!

This place is amazing!!!! Oysters are 75 cents during happy hour and they are so fresh ! We had an amazing server ! Everyone checked up on how we were doing and if the food was good, my group of 3 had ordered the corn and crab bisque, the Luke burger, 12 oysters and a dish with ham and bread and so much more. The chefs are so kind and checked on us through the window, they gave us each a fry and cut up our burger since we splitting it without extra cost or us having to tell them, I love it here and will most definitely be coming back, they gave us a table straight away without a reservation.

Came to Luke solely for the 3:00 - 6:00 pm happy hour special (half off drinks and 75 cent oysters). Made reservations for 3:30 pm but that wasn't necessary as the restaurant was pretty open (we went mid-July)

We got exactly what we were looking for. Oysters were great and provided to us quickly. Much bigger than what we were used too in Toronto. Staff was extremely friendly as well.

I enjoyed a nice lunch at Luke's during a recent visit to Louisiana. I ordered jumbo lump crab ravigote with toasted ciabatta  bread. The crab was excellent the only thing is it comes with a horse radish dressing mixed into the crab and it was very strong. If I went again I would not order it with the dressing although I'm not certain it can be extracted. The corn and crab fritters are a delightful taste of seafood, but crunchy enough to pass for a stand alone afternoon snack. The crispy brussels sprouts were fresh and in season and had great  texture to the meal.
We went for happy hour and their prices for oysters and drinks were amazing! So good, that we're going back for brunch! Also, their service was fantastic and the bartenders made a great drink!

Service was good. But the food was incredibly salty. Beyond anything I've ever eaten. We ate at quite a few other Cajun/Creole places during our time in New Orleans. This was by far the worst due to the amount of salt used.
Food was amazing. I had the gumbo and I also had the shrimp and grits. Everything was flavorful and silky. I'll definitely be back.

This place is phoenominal. Walking in I will admit it didn't look like much.  I misjudged on appearance. I was quickly proven wrong after I tasted one of the best drinks ever had, the Jalapenoma cocktail while we waited for our table. For appetizers we had the Brussels sprouts... So so good. My entree was the shrimp and grits with a side of corn and crab bisque. Both were so delicious and were perfect representation of the area. My husband ordered the ribeye. While good, it wasn't the best we've had, but steak isn't the known specialty in NOLA. Overall wonderful experience.

Came here for happy hour after the game. The person seating the customers looked completely overwhelmed. She sat people who were behind us first. Then lied to make excuses for not being able to keep track of everyone.  Would've like to try this place out, but the management has no idea how to seat customers :o

Luke provided us with a great meal and awesome service during our last night in NOLA. The oysters were fresh and tasty. Crab fritters were large and we enjoyed it with a fried oyster salad that we split for us on two plates. Our server was a professional and tended to our dining needs with flair. The evening ended with coffee and a bread pudding pairing that knocked my socks off. There was so much charm provided in the food and service. Please check this restaurant out for your signature New Orleans meal.

Ok I've been meaning to write a review for this place for ages and just haven't gotten to it. Ate there again last night and boy it never disappoints. I love the food and the vibe! Our waiter was great and my friend and I had a fabulous night. Thanks again Luke for a wonderful evening!!
You get what you pay for... the shrimp and Gritts are second to none. The chargrilled oysters are also some of the best in town.

We went there after making a reservation for two. The menu does not have a lot of variety and the food is mediocre. I had high hopes but it did not meet my expectations. Service was good overall along with good ambiance.
