We were headed to the Ruby Slipper for shrimp and grits but with an hour wait we opted to go hunting a new haunt. Luke's fit the bill. Really we picked it because I'm a Gilmore Girl fan and any chance to eat at Luke's I'm gonna take. While there was no grumpy good looking flannel
Clad owner behind the bar, our server Adam was wonderful and whit filled  with excellent and honest selection recommendations. Shrimp and grits to die for with house made andouille sausage and an open faced blta topped with poached eggs. Go here!!! Oh and no wait!
Clean, slightly upscale atmosphere w jazz softly playing in the background. Went for Saturday brunch and had the crab omelette, which was very good. Attentive, friendly staff. Would come again.

Visiting New Orleans for the first time and I made to make a reservation at Luke for our first dinner.

I had stuffed P&J oysters for appetizers which was so delicious!

I had shrimp etouffee for my main, it was just as great!

Ambiance was nice.

I took a star off because our server passed us on to another server, and they weren't really very friendly to us.

Amazing service, amazing happy hour, amazing cocktails! Can't wait to go back to New Orleans and/or they open up a restaurant in San Francisco. 

When you go, definitely get a French 75 (made with cognac-yum!) and the oysters are superb -and a great happy hour price! 

Can't remember our servers names but both gentlemen were friendly and attentive. 

Go now!

Ambience perfect
Staff needs improvement 
Location perfect
Cocktails delicious
German starter surprisingly good 
Food ... well this is the kind of place you pay 25 dls for a salad and when you specify no bacon because you have an allergic reaction to it an they bring bacon on it because kitchen forgot or waiter forgot who knows but makes  you think is it worth paying 25 dls for the salad and after you request for a fresh salad because you think they will do a fresh salad with no bacon and they only remove the bacon and you find a piece of bacon  again !! ... is it worth paying 25 dls for this salad?  No!! 
I loved the place but imagine they missed this huge detail and I will end up in a the hospital not worth it !!

I was really disappointed in the food here. The gumbo was so bland and the waiter agreed with me. The happy hour deal on oysters was worth it as they were a really good size. I wouldn't spend my time going back here. The fried oysters were way too greasy!
Entertaining wait staff (Elliott) and good food and drinks! The Brussels sprouts are amazing.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for my birthday 7/28/18 and decided to have dinner downstairs at the Luke. It was AMAZING! The food was our best experience while visiting NOLA. We had two different waitresses and they were super nice! We even were offered a free glass of champagne!

I want to give this place 4 stars, but there have been some quality issues lately that I have to point out. Luke has a potential to be a solid casual brunch/dinner restaurant to visit for years to come, but they have to keep consistent with their food prep. Months back, I enjoyed the rabbit pate. Just the right amount of liver taste, not too salty. However, each time I've ordered its been different in texture and taste. Less livery, more buttery..too salty at times. I've noticed the same for the crawfish soup...too creamy one day...too bland or too salty another. Some servings with chunks of crawfish, some without any. Not to sound too picky, but its the small things that really make a difference in the dining experience. 

I've also noticed that when ordering through Doordash, they often forget an item. If Luke can keep consistent, I would continue to visit. But they really need to work on this.

OYSTER HAPPY HOUR AM I RIGHT?! I love eating raw oysters, but even more so when they're for a great price. We were seated in the back of the restaurant, which was probably one of the last available tables for our reservation time. As other Yelpers have noted, be sure to make a reservation during happy hour. 

Our server was fabulous and awesome and always seemed to be around and I wish I could remember his name because I loved him. There was another server who sometimes stopped by and took additional orders from us or refilled our waters periodically. 

Happy hour specials include 50% off glasses of wine,  beer and specialty cocktails, as well as $1.25 per fried oyster and $0.75 per raw P&J oyster. Our table was a graveyard of raw and fried oysters. My one complaint about the oysters is that the shells weren't cleaned very well, so when they stacked the oysters, some dirt got on the otherwise clean oyster meat. I rinsed it with my water.  The fried oysters were hot and crispy - do order at least half a dozen to try! I also ordered a French 75, which was not only 50% off but also a lot bigger than the French 75 from Arnaud's. 

We also ordered some apps to share, too. The hot buttered crawfish and burrata tartine was super rich but super tasty. Any dish with hot butter and burrata cheese in the title has my name on it! We also shared crispy sprouts, which were a tad undercooked. The flavor was on point but it definitely could have used a little more time in the heat. 

Overall, a tasty meal at a great price! Luke's is a must visit in NOLA during happy hour!!!
Perfect experience. Oysters were delicious! Shrimp and grits were some of the best I've ever had. Solid 5 stars!

The vegetables in creole sauce was amazing, so was the shrimp and grits my friend had. The bread pudding was perfect best I have ever had. Ponchatoula Cooler was refreshing my friend really enjoy it. The service was excellent Kevin and Gary really took good care of us. Will definitely be a New Orleans staple when am in town.

We were visiting NOLA and came here for my sister's birthday dinner. From the hostess to the waiters, the customer service was superb. But more importantly, the food was delish. Highly recommend the oyster and avocado as an appetizer and the shrimp and grits as an entree. Of course you can't leave without trying the bread pudding. So good!

Menu was small and we didn't love the rabbit and liver pate. I started with the stuff we didn't like because we loved everything else. The food was excellent, service was top notch and the location was convenient. If you are in NOLA and want something good outside the French Quarter go to Luke!!

Excellent service and delicious food! We had the shrimp cocktail, Shrimp n Grits, Porkchops, Creme Brûlée, everything was amazing! The service was on point-our server was funny, attentive, and friendly. Would definitely recommend Luke's!

Of all the restaurants I visited while in New Orleans, Luke was probably my favorite. I made a reservation for dinner here at 5pm for a party of 10. They sat us in a private room which was a nice plus and as usual we ordered a variety of dishes to share: 

*Crispy Brussel Sprouts - served with toasted almonds, honey, and milk barn cheese. This was a table favorite, really crispy and flavorful. 

*Pate of Louisiana Rabbit and Chicken Livers - served with country bread croutons. I loooved this dish, the pate was so delicious and served with two types of jam and dijon mustard. 

Boudin Stuffed Pork Chop - served with bourbon peach glaze, grilled peaches over tomato and summer squash. Delicious glaze and the porkchop was cooked to perfection. 

*Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" served over roasted jalapeno cheese grits, andouille and green onion sausage. The grits were AMAZING, arguably the best grits I had on this trip.  

Luke Burger - served with Allan benton's bacon (idk who or what that is), caramelized onions, tomato and cheese. Good burger (home of the good burger can I take your order?). 

*Shrimp Etouffee - cavatelli pasta served with shrimp etouffee, heirloom tomatoes and garlic sauce. The pasta was the perfect texture and the shrimp etouffee was creamy and delicious. 

Tasso Rubbed Grilled Swordfish - served over a bed of fresh corn, fire roasted peppers and topped with a cilantro lime buerre blanc. I didn't get a good bite of this to leave a proper review, but most people seemed to like it. 

Raw Oysters - surprisingly I think I like raw oysters on the west coast are better. For New Orleans I would go with the fried oysters or specialty oysters. 

*Fried Oysters - this was one of the big highlights of the table as well. The oysters are fried to perfection and served with an aioli... we ordered 5 of these. 

Not only did we get a private room, the service was top notch and the food was so delicious. Luke staff went above and beyond and comped us 4 bottles of champagne! I have to say, this was by far my favorite experience in New Orleans and I would love to come back to eat those amazing fried oysters again. Until next time Luke!

Best French 75 anywhere! Pretty good fried oysters too! Not a huge fan of the entree menu but they have amazing kids meals that are extra fresh and full of delicious veggies. My 4 year old approves. Always had great service as well except for once and they have happy hour 7 days a week!
The shrimp and grits are incredible. The seasoning and spice were perfect for a breakfast dish.
The chicken and waffles is a great brunch option. Decent wine selection. Get the crispy potatoes over the fries
Had some gumbo. It was very good. Nice atmosphere and excellent serves. Drinks were good too. Desserts were out of this world

Great place for happy hour oysters. The gumbo was delicious and they kept the drinks flowing. Service was impeccable and the servers are very polite and friendly. I wish they would expand to other states.

Weekday lunch, near the French Quarter. Outstanding food and service!  Don't miss this place when you come to NOLA.  Amazing brussel sprout recipe. Great oysters.  Shrimp and grits is heavy on the cheese, FYI. LOTS of great flavors here! Check it out.
Everyone was really nice and this restaurant was so cute. Loving the tin ceiling, carved woodwork and floor tiles

I came to Luke specifically for their raw oyster Happy Hour special. Came in at 5pm on a weekday (with a reservation).

The raw oysters were super cheap (75 cents/each) and they came out pretty fast every time I reordered. I also tried the fried oysters and those were pretty darn tasty. Service was good, and the restaurant was lively and had a nice ambiance.

However, I went to Trenasse across the street the next day to also try their raw oyster Happy Hour, and Trenasse was better in my opinion. Both restaurants were great in terms of quality and price, but the oysters were larger/plump, had more variety, and more juicy at Trenasse compared to Luke.

*(0 stars for the hostesses at the front, as I was met with rude stares and unfriendly demeanor upon looking for my party)

Group of about 12 of us, we came for some bites and HH oysters. We ordered a few dozen of these, some crab and corn chowder, and shrimp and grits. Everything was exquisite.... The oysters were FAT and the chowder was thick, the shrimp and grits were also to die for........ The food was nothing short of food-coma inducing. 

The service, however, was super...... s l o w. Some orders came out late or perhaps even forgotten altogether. This combined with the surly hostesses at the front made the experience kind of meh. Food = 5/5 though.
Incredible breakfast and so much food! Try the crab omelette and get a side of the cheese grits. You won't be disappointed.

Okay, by far the best French 75 I've had here in New Orleans. Crispy Brussels Sprouts were delicious - with just the right amount of sweetness and they melted in our mouths. Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" were indeed jumbo. Whoever decided to mix jalapeño with cheese grits should be knighted. The staff was helpful and fun. My colleagues and I had a great night after a long day. Perfecto.
Wonderful experience. Johnny and the oyster shuckers where great. Gave us the 411. Our bartender was great. The drinks where great

We came here on a Friday 08/10/2018.
  It's a small place so you are lucky if you are seated within 30 minutes, then you are lucky. 
  Good food, courteous servers with positive attitude.
  Especially liked dessert.
  Thank you Kevin for serving us. 
   Must go place when you head here 
 Just a question from an observer: "is there a symbolic representation for the wall blocks being all at 3 o'clock the whole time.

First time here and we WILL be back. Had the crabmeat rivgote and corn crab bisque as app. Both were excellent!! Split the shrimp and grits as an entree. It was phenomenal!! Great brunch spot. Great NOLA cuisine.

Shrimp & grits was overpriced at $25. It tasted good, but the portion was small. The grits were cheesy.

The oysters on the half shell were a decent price. Half dozen for $9. They shuck fresh ones in front of you if you sit at the bar.

Rich and Kenny were awesome. Hilarious guys, always fast on checking in but doing it in a really charismatic way. 

The food here is fantastic. First stop on the New Orleans vacation foodie tour and it did not disappoint. Do yourselves a favor and order the Brussels sprouts!

Came here around 9:30pm on a Tuesday night and got seated right away. We got the oysters, jambalaya, and swordfish entree. Being that the restaurant wasn't too busy at this hour, everything came out very quickly. The two servers for our table were extremely attentive and friendly; they seemed genuinely interested on how we enjoyed the dishes.

I'm not huge on raw oysters just due to the sliminess and texture, but I honestly really really liked the P&J oysters here. For those in the area during the day they have a happy hour for $.75 oysters from 3-6pm. 

Regarding the main swordfish dish - it was easily the best I've had. I've only had swordfish a handful of other times, but it was always too dry for me. The Tasso rubbed grilled swordfish here, however, was seriously cooked to perfection. It also sat on a puréed corn/ polenta kind of sauce, which was really bomb. The spicy peppers also complemented the dish very well. Personally I would've liked if the swordfish had more of a salt crust, but that's just nitpicking. Overall really enjoyed all of the food and experience at Luke's.

During my first visit to New Orleans, I visited Lüke for their .75 cent oyster happy hour and a French 75, which is a cocktail made from gin, champagne, lemon juice, and sugar. The oysters were delicious, but the French 75 was exceptional. The crowd wasn't as stuffy as you would expect for an upscale restaurant, and since I was alone, a local and large family invited me to sit and celebrate with them.

A few days later, I impressively visited Lüke, blacked out after a couple of hurricanes, and ordered $75.00 worth of burgers and fries that were still decent the next day.

Moral of these stories: dine at Lüke and take any leftovers (except for oysters) in a doggy bag.

Ate here for lunch with a client and we loved it. I had the Shrimp Étouffée and the Roasted Chicken Matzo Ball Soup. My client had a sandwich and it was HUGE! Enough for two meals at least. Service was great and we had a pretty neat seat next to the kitchen which is surrounded with glass. I'd definitely recommend this spot.

This restaurant is one of the BEST! I was disappointed that the 4 days I was in NOLA, that I didn't run into this gem until the night before I would leave. I came here with family but sampled everything, the crab and corn soup is amazing. My mother had amandine fish Was good but she was jealous with my order which was the swordfish. BEST fish I've had. Packed with flavor and will not disappoint. 

The next day was brunch here at Luke's since Dinner was so yummy. We ordered the chicken waffles, crab omelet, shrimp and grits and got a kids burger. Tried everything was impressed and glad I got to try everything because I would be stuck choosing. The kids burger was out of this world and has this smoky flavor . Highly would recommend!! Service is great. Get the tables in the back with the view of the chefs cooking the food.

The food at this place was good but not great. The service was good but not great. The waiter was nice but forgot to ask what we wanted to drink, so we basically didn't get drinks. They didn't have many drink options so we didn't care too much. I had the pork chops, which seemed like the best thing on the menu. My girlfriend had the shrimp and grits, it was good. This place wasn't great because the menu didn't have a lot of options and they also had a lack of drink option. I don't understand any restaurant in the south that doesn't have sweet tea or a good lemonade.

This did not disappoint! I am staying at the Hilton that it's attached to restaurant which is super convenient for walking downstairs for dinner and a glass of wine.. 
It was pretty packed but I sat at the bar and the bartender was slammed but did a great job multitasking. Highly recommend the shrimp and grits  I will definitely be back!

Everything about this place was amazing. The decor reminded me of a French restaurant with much better service. The local oysters are great value, but the real reason to go would be both the French 75 cocktail and the jumbo shrimp en cocotte. Neither are a particularly original choice as they are considered favorites of the restaurant but they are favorites for a reason. Would definitely recommend for a good overall dinner experience.

I tried this place for the first time today. I thought I saw online there were chicken and waffles, but then I didn't see it on the menu (could be for breakfast). However, it allowed me to try their croque madame, and it was very tasty! I liked the atmosphere, and the service was great. I would come back to this location.

Went to brunch here on a Sunday. Was pretty obvious I had a rough case of the booze flu, so our server was quick to suggest and deliver a bloody mary. It was a bit horseradish-y for my liking, but after asking for less on the next one, I couldn't have asked for much better. We split a soft shell crab sandwich, and literally had more than enough food for two people to take home leftovers. The service was attentive, and personable. And the food was STELLAR. I've always heard that it was a bit pricey, yet I found it pretty affordable for the quality. Highly suggest this place.

Came to NOLA for a few days and this was our favorite restaurant. Everything was delicious, service was incredible. I highly recommend saving room for dessert, both the creme brûlée and bread pudding were worth every calorie!

This place was fantastic! Went with my husband and our 7 yr old son and we all enjoyed our meal. Service was great and food was delicious. The fried oysters were cooked to perfection. It says casual but you definitely want to dress up a bit to get the true feeling of dining at Luke's. A must try!

Went here on a recommendation and the food did not disappoint.  Shrimp with grits were excellent and the swordfish was wonderful.  P&J oysters were good but thought three per order is too small for the price.   The place is a little loud, the atmosphere promises to be high end but really comes off as more cheap. The bench seat was dirty. The waiter didn't smile or have any sense of humor. He was nice but learn to smile and act like you enjoy being a server.  I think this place is past its prime without some cleaning up of the staffs attitude and a little more polish.   Think of red lobster with coat and tie.  Food is good but the atmosphere lacks and that is half the experience.   

We may go back for the food since it was good but don't expect huge wait staff miracles.   Also go a little earlier like 6 pm and you can pick just about any seat in the  house.  Bon apetite
Luke was a very good place to eat.....not quite around the French quarter but, it was good....I had the Swordfish and it was cooked to perfection!

Please please please do yourself a huge favor and order their crawfish bisque! It was one of the best bisques I have EVER HAD in my entire life thus far!! Not too creamy, not too salty, crawfish flavor was not overpowering, and it was simply such a well balanced bowl of heaven. Please please order this!!! You can thank me later.

Oh, and our server was super helpful by telling us about happy hour that was coming up in 30 mins. And he was more than happy to accommodate our burnt roasted Brussels sprouts. Service and food were both excellent. I recommend if you're in NoLa but even if you don't have time to dine here, just order the crawfish bisque to-go at least! It's THAT GOOD!!!

Food was great! I got the shrimp & jalapeño grits! I definitely recommend. It was a short walk from our hotel downtown. Unfortunately service was very slow. Once a bus boy cleared our plates after a few minutes, we still waited 10+ minutes before I asked a random server for our check because our waiter never came back.

Probably the best chicken and grits ever created. Yes, my date didn't eat shrimp so they made chicken and grits which melted in your mouth. My stuffed pork chop was fantastic as was the dessert. I wish I could remember the servers' names because they were awesome as well. Great atmosphere and certainly a fun crowd.  
To the hostess - "BOOM".

The good...Calvin, and Dave were excellent servers!
The Shrimp and Grits....extremely salty, but I was hungry so choked them down with two very good draft IPA's. My friend had the fried oysters,  but had to be sent back since they were overcooked, chewy and dry.
They brought her out some more, which were somewhat better. Dessert, the Hummingbird cake was bland and dry, very disappointing. Sent it back in exchange for the bread pudding, which was very good.
Excellent staff, friendly, great service. Will not be dining here again though. I will go to the tried and true, Mr. B's for their BBQ shrimp, or any other establishments that do not over salt their food.

This is a must if you're going to be in New Orleans. Cute atmosphere, trendy but not too crowded, and absolutely delicious. I suggest making a reservation here.  I ordered buttery crawfish with shrimp burratta tartine, eggs, and sweet peas. It was combined in a messy dish that somewhat fit on the pieces of toast but it was fine that it was messy. I suggest getting runny eggs so the sauces and flavors mix together better. I will definitely come back here.

Love Luke's. Came back to New Orleans just so we can go to Luke for my bday after finding it in 2016 for my bday and we wanted to come back again on my bday this year. They did change up their seafood tower abit, but it was still amazing. Hoping to make this an annual thing for us as long as we can

So good -- we ate it all before I remembered to snap a pic!  All small plates and cocktails at happy hour for us.  The GINtilly Dragon and the Pate plate were some of the best, but everything was wonderful. Service was ON POINTE! Everyone was attentive to our table, not just "our" server, and incredibly friendly.

Luke is my favorite oyster happy hour because the drinks are good, the service is fantastic, and the oysters are so clean. A lot of places serve gross gritty oysters but Luke scrubs them. I take every visitor to Luke and we always have a fantastic time. Food, atmosphere, service AND prices are great. It's an amazing value. Can't wait to go back!

Went for happy hours. Got 10 raw
PJ oysters and 6 fried oysters. The oysters were really fresh and delicious. They don't skimp on it despite the happy hour. Got some wine(rosè) and cocktail (French 75). Friend got beer and Chardonnay and was delicious as well. I am
Really impressed by the servers there and the quality of food for happy hours. I will come back for sure and it doesn't matter if you are visiting NO or local, it's worth a trip.

This review was solely based on our experience during their happy hour. 

We made reservations for Luke's happy hour before our dinner for more seafood nearby -- and boy did we have a good time. Our table of five ordered three rounds of raw oysters (.75/ea), a round of fried oysters (1.25/ea), brussel sprouts, and a couple orders of their stuffed oysters and plenty of drinks. All of their drink were half off (excluding bottled wine).

Raw oysters = to die for, Fried oysters = so good (not even a fan of fried oysters), brussel sprouts = stole the show -- perfect blend of crispy salty brussel sprouts with sweet honey surprises and crunchy slivered almond bites, and the stuffed oysters = ugh, so good. 

Drinks: Definitely get their Gintilly Dragon and the French 75. Also if you love tequila like me, get it! it was amazing! 

Great food and drinks and great atmosphere.

Luke is always a great place to eat especially to bring out of town people. Drinks are on point! Freshness of the oyster is one of the best. Entries portion are shareable. Will definitely recommend to everyone!

We went for happy hour & thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. How could you not, with half price oysters? Both raw and roasted are available at a discount, as well as half price on most drinks. I had a perfect Bloody Mary, and my husband enjoyed a wine from their extensive list. Friendly, casual yet well appointed atmosphere.

Another great Besh restaurant. Happy hour has nice oyster specials. The rest of happy hour is just ok to be honest, nothing really special. The swordfish rillietts were really good. I'd come back for the tasso wrapped swordfish...or just a few beers when I'm downtown.
Only 2 stars because everyone was nice other than that food was too salty and uncooked. I'm the type to not bother so I did not say anything, but, never again.

This place doesn't even deserve a star. We called ahead of time to try to give a heads up that we had a large party of 17. Instead of listening to me, they gave us a number to call to speak to a caterer. I called the number, no answer, the person stated she was on limited hours on her voicemail...ok. So we show up for lunch and immediately are received by a severely ungracious hostess who looked angry we bothered to come by. It was 1 pm on a Thursday and the place was almost empty, however they acted like they couldn't accommodate us--we didn't even ask to all sit together. The hostess grabbed I guess who was supposedly the manager and he proceeded to act like we never should've showed up. Finally once they realized we weren't going anywhere they sat us. The waiter came over and had zero personality. He treated us like we were a burden. My friend ordered a dirty martini which came back literally just vodka, no olives, no vermouth. The drink was $15 and when my friend asked for olives she was ignored. Then the waiter told us he couldn't split our checks. I've never heard of that. The way he said it made it feel like he was chastising us for having a larger group who ordered separately. At this point we hadn't ordered food, so we decided to just leave--they wanted us to anyway! I've never felt so unwelcome before in a restaurant. They clearly didn't want our business. I'm not sure why this place is in business as they have zero hospitality. I would not eat here! Take your business to some place that will appreciate it. We walked down the street to the acme oyster house and had a blast!

A must visit spot during every New Orleans visit! The atmosphere is awesome, a lot of relics to admire. The shrimp en cocotte / aka shrimp and grits is to die for! I order the same thing every time I come and am never disappointed!
The food and service was amazing. The raw oysters were fresh and the baked p&j oysters were the best we've ever had.  The shrimp and grits were amazing. You will not regret it.

This stop is number two of our happy hour tour which is based on our hotel, AC hotel, location. Luke's is a fancy-ish place. Way busier than our last place. Better then our last place. The bartenders are good, even though they are slammed. The happy hour drink specials is half off cocktails!!! Hello french 75; this F75 stands out from others because it is made with cognac, lemon, champagne, and granished with a marchenio cherrie. It was so lovely that I got one to go!!!! 
We had 6 oysters which were on ice and they were bet tasty. I didn't need hot sauce or anything on them. Oysters are $.75 each during happy hour. They were medium to large and since they are gulf oysters they are not briny.

Luke never disappoints. I go crazy over their Brussels sprouts and get them literally every time I go there. I've always enjoyed my meals, service is consistently good and their deserts are amazing. I do like sitting in the upper area better, it's more quaint and not as noisy.

I came here a few years ago for the first time after my fiancé read an article that they had one of the best hamburgers in the whole country. 

I remember that first visit, we were in the french quarter enjoying lots of drinking and listening to jazz music and we were in the mood for that burger so we got here really late and they were still really busy. We decided to order the burger to share and an order of Shrimp and Grits. 

The article was right (the hamburger was so good) and the shrimp and grits were also amazing.

I came back last week because of that burger. We shared it again and it was still awesome. They didn't have the shrimp and grits on the menu anymore but they had plenty of variety. 

The burger and the staff at the bar were so good that we came back again the next day to enjoy happy hour where we ate a ton of oysters (and another burger).

Came to New Orleans for my Birthday, and Luke was recommended by several locals. Only thing better than the amazing atmosphere,  was the food ( burger was out of this world!), and probably the best service we've ever experienced at a restaurant. Kenney and Rich were outstanding! They provided excellent service, a crazy sense of humor, and went out of their way to make sure we had an amazing experience. We highly recommend Luke, and we will be back!

South belle oyster were ok. The Alabama one last we're on point. Not the p&j stuffed oysters with crab were delicious. As far of the service by Tristan top notch. I recommend it for a fancy little date. The gumbo was delicious had to order more bread so I can clean the plate. As far as the main dish. Shrimp étouffée that was amazing. Their sauce, seasoning of everything that was cooked here was just strictly amazingly delicious. This is what food should taste like. Luke is killing the game! Parking was not too bad and their big sign show where they are located. Is definitely for people with money as the prices are high. Now to close it off I had some creme brûlée which put the cherry on top for a good 4 course meal. I shared with adding all the oysters and stuff and came out to an even meal for 2. Unless you are planning to be stuffed or just overindulge then I suggest sharing. As it will help with cost and still get to enjoy many plates.

Enjoy your come. You are about to have a party of flavors in your mouth.

On a business trip to New Orleans, a co-worker, native to the area, recommended this restaurant.
The service was exceptional; Brian and Chi offered prompt attention and quality menu suggestions. The food was terrific: matzo ball soup; mussels and French fries; crawfish étouffée; fresh bread. For dessert, the house bread pudding was to die for.
To enhance the experience, we sat right next to the glassed in kitchen area; we voyeuristically witnessed chefs preparing fantastic cuisine all throughout the evening. Very cool!!!
Loved the Brussels sprouts so much that I came back the next evening we had a great time here

One of the best places I tried while in NOLA! Came in for dinner and then came in again a couple of days later for happy hour. I would highly recommend taking advantage of happy hour from 3-6 if you want to get some raw or fried oysters! It is a great deal and there are drink specials as well. Also for dessert, try the hummingbird cake!

Wonderful wonderful food and service! We had an outstanding lunch amid bonus that it was directly across the street from our hotel.  1 star off for service on the next day - I called that morning to order a to go to take with me for my long flight home.  I specified pick up time. When I got there they said the person who took the order forgot about it.  It wasn't ready and I couldn't wait as I had to leave for the airport. Disappointed when I had to have airport food instead.
The service was only beaten by the food. Atmosphere was great. This MADE my trip to New Orleans! It's like walking into a fancy restaurant from the 40's. Richie Rich defines good service. Thanks!

Absolutely incredible experience at Luke! My boyfriend and I went on a weekend trip to New Orleans and Richy Rich waited on us. He was personable, friendly and had great recommendations. He even sat down with us and gave us the recipe for their incredible brussel sprouts. We ordered a few appetizers and oysters and he talked to us about their happy hour and invited us to come back the next day. (We ordered a half dozen oysters but they gave us a dozen at no extra charge!!) We came back the next day and he waited on us again. He put in the appetizer we loved from the night before AND gave us two glasses of champagne as soon as we sat down - ALL complimentary! The fact that he remembered us, remembered our order and felt compelled to treat us so special is pretty amazing. Customer service is tough, but he makes it seem like he's having the best time in the world! He joked with us that the food is almost as good as the service but truly, he's right! The food AND the service are top notch. Richy Rich made our trip so much more special and we are already looking forward to coming back next time we stop in NOLA! Thank you, Richy Rich & the whole Luke staff!

Great place for good food and amazing service! I'll be back. I came for happy hour (on a Sunday!!) and the oysters were freshly shucked. The service was bar none. The atmosphere is fun!! Thank you Calvin and Phil for being the best part of my night!

A colleague recommended this restaurant and I'm glad I tried it. I came in for breakfast on a Monday morning. The breakfast menu is limited, but this allows them to focus on the quality of the dishes and it shows. I was seated quickly. Coffee took a few minutes to arrive because I ordered decaf and they brewed a fresh pot for me. I really appreciate when a restaurant does this since many places brew a pot of decaf and it sits for hours.

I ordered the local crab omelet and substituted fresh fruit for the potatoes.

The food came in a reasonable time and the presentation was very nice. The omelet was accompanied by a generous fresh greens salad with a light dressing. The omelet had a very generous portion of crab chunks in it and the flavor really came through. The eggs were light and fluffy and the amount of cheese was just right. The fruit was top quality and very fresh and flavorful.

Service was unobtrusive but I never lacked for anything. The staff were pleasant and professional.

I will definitely return to this restaurant.

WOW! This place was pretty amazing in every way! We had a short wait, but got two seats at the bar . This was our first trip to New Orleans and had SOOOO MANY RESTAURANTS to choose from, but we picked right !
The bartender made me a perfect French 75 cocktail . We sat by the Ouster shucker and that Was a  highlight. What a nice guy!
I am not an oyster person but these were so sweet and fresh that I had about 1/2 dozen. Amazing variety.
The boiled gulf shrimp were also delicious. 
My bourdin stuffed pork chop was perfectly cooked and accompanied.
Definitely have the beet salad after you have the gumbo.
This is a great place to try all things NOLA. 
This dinner was unforgettable. 
Try to sit at the bar if you can and order a little bit of everything to share .

Service was great- food came out fast and staff was super friendly. I had the shrimp etouffee which is usually with rice but they do it here with pasta (cavatelli). I substituted the shrimp for chicken cause im not a big shrimp person. I asked for the chicken well done -im super picky with my chicken and it was not well done at all. To be fair, i did change the plate and the sauce was awesome and my boyfriend said the chicken was fine so i guess it just comes down to taste. French fries were amazing- super crispy!! As an appetizer, boyfriend had the p&j oysters which were delicious - i dont even like oysters and i thought they were so good. For dinner he had the jumbo Louisiana shrimp which he loved. Its a smaller portion so order accordingly. We both had dirty martinis which were ok- def had way better but not terrible. For dessert we had creme brule and bread pudding - sooo good. Overall great place but very limited menu.

This place was a tough one for me!  On one hand, the food was fantastic.  The drink/food specials for happy hour was great, but the service, was lackluster.  We sat for some time waiting for water refills, drinks, and the food.  The food that came was wrong, although corrected quickly.  I do have to say, the Brussel Sprouts were some of the best I've ever eaten.  I may actually dream about them :).  Also, I feel like there is a time when the drinks can get "too fancy" where they end up tasting like cologne/perfume.  Regardless, with so many options in New Orleans for amazing food, you may want to keep walking.

The food was pretty good, not quite as fantastic as I'd expected, but the portion size was definitely worth it. The boudin Benedict was a little dry and bland. Service was great, we happened to go on a Sunday for breakfast before a Saints game so everything running smoothly and quickly was a blessing. It got a little busier after we'd received our food, so I'd recommend going earlier than later. Would probably order something different next time, but would definitely recommend overall

We went here for their famous Happy hour and it did not disappoint us at all. Most of their signature cocktail drinks were half off and raw Oysters were only $0.75 per piece. We tried couple of their  drinks and our favorite was Honey, It's Hot out there. It had a perfect amount of Bourbon and honey. The Oysters were also fresh. I went there with someone who never had Oyster Shots before and he was able to devour them in hot seconds!  It is located below Hilton and close to French Quarter. If you are in the area, definitely stop by for their HH.
It was so beautiful and delicious! Wandeful place and nice interior I had breakfast omelet with octopus and coffee, I was happy

First Chicken and waffles I have ever had. They were delicious. The pecan butter and the Tabasco raspberry jam...mmmmm. The staff were friendly and attentive. We had a bit of a wait due to lunch rush and a few larger groups, but were seated promptly. Excellent experience.

We got off the plane and had to wait for our hotel room so we needed a place to snack and have a cocktail. This is the PLACE!!

Really great happy hour. Delicious menu items at great prices and oysters at 1/2 price. What more do you need in New Orleans!! Cocktails were quite unique and fun. My husband ordered a bowl of the gumbo... twice!! And even the dessert menu was offered. Hospitable waiters and friendly menu suggestions make this a place we'll come to again for a NOLA happy hour!

Ate and licked everything Off the plate. This place was a Last minute find for my husband and I. Glad we found this place. My husband got a hamburger and finished the whole burger without offering me a bite..(he usually shares but that's how good it was) 

The service was top notch too. Everyone there was on top of the service and was very nice.
Food and atmosphere is nice. As one should expect in the CBD. Sometimes the back room can be stuffy on a busy day. I recommend the raw oysters and burgers. A few dollars on the high side for lunch.

Just returned from a 3 day weekend. I went here right after checking in because I just needed some fried oysters. It was too early for the oyster happy hour so the only way to get my fix was to get the fried oyster salad. What's not to like. Lettuce, ( the fancy kinds that make you look foolish while trying to find a small enough bite to shovel in), Benton bacon , avocado and ranch. Cadence was my lovely server and she was a delight. I was sitting near the glassed in kitchen so I could watch them work. Quite a well oiled machine. Well, I am a bacon lover and discovered that I could not stand Benton bacon. The hickory smoke was so strong it overwhelms the delicacy of the oysters and they were quite generous with it. I tried to pick it out but it was just too prevalent. So I just picked off the oysters which were fried so perfectly and ate the avocado. I never tried a bacon I didn't love until that day. The wine was nice but ridiculously pricy.

We did return for the oyster happy hour. They were just wonderful. The seafood gumbo was okay, all the veggies were cooked to death but I am unrealistically picky about gumbo. I had to take a star because while it wasn't busy, I think the bartenders were changing shifts and it took forever to get the check. Still love the oysters!
Their Omelete of Local Crab is absolutely phenomenal! This will be my official go to breakfast place in new orleans!

This was an amazing place to go for a birthday dinner!!

Our server was amazing and the food was so good!!

We split a few things and went away satisfied and happy. 

The bread pudding was highly recommended so I tried it. Pretty good. 

But not nearly as good as the shrimp and grits!!!!


Our favorite item was the pâté!!! 
I'd eat that every day if I could. 


Would highly recommend and we are considering going again while we are here for only 2 days. 


The drinks were good as they need to be for NOLA. 

Everything was nice. 

There were even secondary waitstaff to make sure no one got left without anything they needed. 

Don't be dissuaded because it's at the Hilton. 

The place is charming and tasty and kind. 


Will go again for sure!

Absolutely loved the food at Luke's! This was my second trip to New Orleans and the last time I was here, I didn't think much of the food in the city- and it was mostly places I was visiting in the busy French Quarter. This restaurant is on the other side of Canal Street, which definitely feels off the beaten path of the bustling Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. But it was such a pleasant surprise.
We got the corn and crab bisque with their crispy Brussel sprouts and Shrimps and Grits. All the dishes were great but the best of the evening were the Brussel Sprouts. Smoky and intense with flavor, it was such an indulgence. Even the shrimps and grits were incredible, especially the gravy. Mmm. Really good!
For dessert we got the Bread Pudding which is their signature dessert and it was one of the best desserts I have had! 
Such a great dining experience. Will definitely be back.

A fantastic meal! The service was also fantastic. We shared some food and they split it for us, which is always a nice touch. The burger was as good as they say! We had the stuffed oyster and brussel sprouts, both were amazing! Would highly recommend.

This place and their service has left me speechless and eagerly wanting to come back. We were a crew of 10 walking to Billie Jean who said 90 mins wait, minimum, at 11 AM. I frantically started calling surrounding eateries which either said no or a similar wait time. LIKE was my 4th call. I wasn't expecting a yes from them when I asked about our large party, but surely, they came back with a "come on over, we have seating." Took us 10 mins to get there and when we walked in, we were taken through several dining areas (the place is huge!) I didn't understand where they were taking us and when we finally arrived in our own fully private room, my jaw dropped. 

From there - our waiter, Corey blew us away even more. He was polite, attentive, friendly, and honesty. He went above and beyond what impeccable service is and truly gave us a remarkable experience at LUKE. 

And then then food came! From the oysters to gumbo to Benedict sandwich, everything was extremely delicious. We had quiet a few drinks and in the end, we paid $125 per couple (5 couples & generous tip included.)

Highly highly recommend LUKE and ask for COREY to be your waiter! He will not disappoint!

How far this restaurant has fallen- Came 4 years ago and had a wonderful culinary experience. This time came for breakfast- Our Waiter, when asked how he was said " I'm here" then was not seen again until it was time for the check. Took 15 minutes to have our cocktail brought us and when the food arrived it was cold! Not sure how, in New Orleans, French fries are literally cold at 10 in the morning unless they were taken out the fridge from the night before. I noticed the elderly man at the next table get up and grab some cream for his coffee from a table where the diners recently left. I had to walk across the restaurant to find a half empty carafe of water after realizing that was the only way to get a refill- again never had any wait staff stop by my table but to drop off food/drink. My guest commented at end of meal that he had never had OJ delivered- though it was on the bill. I do not usually post reviews but felt the need to warn unsuspecting travelers.

Terrific dining experience. We decided to go to Luke because of its proximity to our hotel , Yelp reviews and ability to make a reservation. We were seated in the back; great to see the cooks at work they the glass wall. My dinner mate and I were pleased to receive the comped roasted Brussels sprout appetizer which was melt In your mouth delicious. We then shared the puppy drum entree and oyster salad which was plated for 2. The Puppy Drum is a light white fish served with an almond sauce and was excellent. The salad was very good and was a nice balance with the fish. Portions were good. My only wish is that I had saved room for dessert. Luke is next door to the Hilton on the other side of Canal Street from the crowds and worth the  2-3 block walk on the other side of Canal St. Service was very attentive without being at all overbearing.
Loved the southern breakfast oysters and Benedict.  Little pricey but great food.  Service a little slow but who cares in nola.  Went twice would go back again

This is an excellent brunch place in New Orleans. While it has the regular greasy good typical brunch options, it also has a decent amount of vegetarian breakfast options which are actually excellent like the Benedict. Reasonably priced and excellent service.

Brussel sprouts are excellent, as was the fried oyster salad - the salad is close to a meal on its own. We also enjoyed the shrimp and grits and the shrimp ettouffe.  We were too stuffed to have dessert. Remember to call ahead for a reservation, or you may have a good wait for a table to become available.
Out of the 100+ shrimp and grits I've tried, Luke's is best. It's the only one I crave.

This wasn't the top restaurants that was originally suggested to us ahead of time, but our hotel recommended it so we decided to give it a try. Unfortunately it was pretty booked out during prime dinner times, so we made a reservation for 5 pm. Thank goodness we did!! They have a fabulous happy hour! Half off drinks, $.75 raw oysters, $1.25 fried oysters, etc! Really good deals so I recommend coming for happy hour from 3-6 pm. 

Honestly, this was the best meal we had during our one week stay in New Orleans. Better than ACME, Nola, Oceana, etc. Everything was so good. We felt like the other restaurants had only one good meal, but with Luke's, everything was delicious!! The group felt the raw oysters were the best here over all the other restaurants we went to too. The Luke burger was really good and filling. The crispy Brussels sprouts were hands down the best- it was SO good... omg! I wish I had them in front of me right now. The Jumbo Louisiana Shimp "En Cocotte" was really really good too! The shrimp Étouffée was really good too but we liked the en cocotte dish better. They do have a vegetarian option- you have to ask for it though since it's not on the menu. When I asked my waiter what my vegetarian options were... he recommended mussels... so I think he might have been confused with what vegetarian meant. He asked the chef & told us that there was a vegetarian pasta that they can make. The vegetarian pasta was SO good!! Super flavorful & very filling. It was the best vegetarian option I ate compared to all the other restaurants we went to. The jalapeño grits was also really good! 

Service was fantastic as well! Everyone was super friendly, hard working, and attentive! I definitely recommend coming here! The best food, awesome happy hour, amazing staff made the entire dining experience fnatastic!

What can I say about Luke other than omg thank you for being you! We ended up coming here twice during our stay in New Orleans and both times were fantastic. The first was on a Friday right before lunch to celebrate my wife's birthday! Our server was fantastic! I wish I would have written this review sooner as I would have remembered his name, for that I'm awful!! Anyways he recommended some amazing house drinks  1 with vodka and the other with bourbon. So so good!! I ordered the chicken and waffles with peppered jam and honey butter. The chicken was crisp, flavorful and cooked to perfection. My wife had the shrimp n grits with a sunny side egg. Equally as good, so much flavor and spice, but comparing both I leaned towards the chicken n waffle. Which funny enough we both ordered on our second trip back here Sunday morning! Luke was by far breakfast and lunch spot during our lovely New Orleans weekend!! Thank you again Luke for being you!! #neworleans

We checked in to our hotel and decided to try to find a place to eat that was fairly close. A quick internet search led us to Luke. My husband got the matzo ball soup and I got the corn and crab bisque, which was exquisite. We both got the same entree, which was essentially shrimp and grits. It was so flavorful, and the grits were smooth and creamy. Although we were both stuffed, we couldn't leave without sampling their signature bread pudding. This was our first meal in New Orleans, and the bar has been set extremely high. If all the food here is as good as Luke's, I may never leave.

This restaurant was recommended by a local, so I had high hopes. It did not disappoint! our servers were excellent, and great at making suggestions on what to try. All of the recommendations turned out to be on point. The crab dip was very good! The wine was reasonably priced and our w tress were excellent. The shrimp and grits, were the best I've ever had anywhere and living in the South that's saying a lot!

Great place for happy hour. Drinks are 1/2 price. Happy hour is on Saturday too. Happy hour is honored at dining tables and bar. Also discounted raw or fried oysters. We had both and were pleased with them. They have small TVs at the bar showing sports. The staff is friendly and efficient. They bring you small loaves of French bread and whipped butter. For happy hour is, it is definitely a great value!

I had a cup of gumbo and most amazing crab omelette with a mimosa for breakfast. Not to mention our waiter Matt was fantastic. The ambiance was very classy and inviting. I was with a group of 5 other girls and we had a great time.
One of my favorite restaurants for Happy Hour.  Order a French 75.

The great reviews do not lie. The grilled brussel sprouts with honey & hot sauce are heaven.  And I'm not a  brussel sprout fan.  I could be after today. So here is another great restaurant we found in New Orleans: LUKE.  Tim, the Manager, and Deseree our wait person were terrific!  Ordered crispy brussel sprouts, fried chicken with red beans &  rice, Croque Madam w/ jalapeno grits and drinks...  Don't be fooled that it looks like it's part of Hilton.  It really isn't. Check it out.

Possibly the best meal we had all trip. We called on a Sunday morning and were able to get our group of 7 in and got a private room! The ice tea cocktail was fantastic. Had the most amazing Brussel sprouts. The corn and crab bisque and jalapeño grits were a stand out. Wonderful service and a great end to our vacation!
Awesome place.  Tradition New Orleans food  the best oysters in the world  fast friendly service

We put in our order 50 minutes ago. We ordered the burrata salad, shrimp and grits, crispy Brussels sprouts, and flammenkuchen. We asked our waiter to bring the plates as they were ready. 50 minutes and nothing has come out. AND ITS MY BIRTHDAY. To top it off the staff just seemed annoyed that we mentioned we were hungry. They brought over two more rolls.  I don't want to get full on bread. 

Our waiter did give us two glasses of champagne after he saw my hangry face.

Happy hour here is a great deal! Cocktails were just ok but half off. Oysters were similarly just ok but 75 cents. The crab gratin was tasty, cheesy, and creamy. If you like gulf oysters and cheap drinks, stop by during happy hour.

I like this place because of the service and the shrimp and grits. I have never had it before and it was delicious. I'm from California so grits was surprisingly like mash potatoes. Not your boxed grits. What drove me here was the well made drink French 73 which I was unimpressed with. The salad with beets was just that. Beautiful old school NOLA building. The maître d' didn't keep me waiting more than 7 mins. Have patience  and enjoy!

Food, Waiter & Waitress- 4
Hostesses-0

Went for Happy Hour because they have 75 cent Oysters which for 75 cents were not bad. When we get to the restaurant we were asked by one hostess if we have reservations. We did not so we put our name on the waitlist and was told it would be 15 mins. While waiting we see these random ppl walk up and stare at the menu. They walk in and talk to the other hostess there and were seated right away. After we told our hostess that ppl who didn't have reservations were seated right away she told us that we still had to wait and we would be seated soon. She turned to the other lady and she told us she seated them "cuz they talked to me and ya'll didn't." Then 3 seconds later miraculously there was a table open for us to sit in.

Waiters were on point and the food was decent but the hostesses left a bitter taste in my mouth. Will we come back, probably not.

Everything on this menu was great. Even the cheeseburger! Fantastic service! 
The shrimp etouffe is best with both breaded and grilled shrimp as recommended by our server.

Very overrated  and It was underwhelming based on the great reviews. Service was good, but the food took a long time. We had the fried oyster salad and it was bland. The Brussels were ok, I think it was trying too hard with so many ingredients on it. The shrimp etoufee had nice flavor but wish it wasn't served as a pasta dish. Portions are quite large here.

Due to construction outside you could easily walk right past this gem.  Inside it has a nice bar and it is loud because it's packed.  Make a reservation if you can.  The decor is so so.  The service staff are nice.  We tried the Brussels sprout dish that they are known for.  I don't like Brussels sprouts and must say they make them tasty.  PJ oysters were good.  Bery thin oysters.  The shell 8s 5 times b8gger than the oyster. Sneaky shell fish.  The puppydrum was good.  It's a fish by the way.  Yeah I didn't know that either.  The shrimp and grits is the best.  The French 75 is a good drink here and the draft beer is good.  Don't waste your time with the Dixie unless your a bud light guy.  Food is presented nicely and tasted great.  I was full.  Restrooms are large and clean.  I say check it out.

After a bit of Yelp research into really great breakfast places in the area, we headed over to Luke. It was a Sunday morning so I made a reservation so we could avoid a wait if there was one. We arrived and were shown to our table right away. Our waiter was not really friendly but efficient and pretty attentive. We ordered the Croque Madame and the Fried Chicken and Waffles. He had the gumbo to start. 
The place started to get busier as it approached noon - diners were crowding into the entry to await a table. Our food came quickly. The presentation was impressive. My Croque Madame was good, not the best I've had but food quality and piled high with lean ham. It was not hot, a little more like warm. It would have been better hot. My guy loved his meal and enjoyed the pepper jelly served with the chicken.  
We agreed that it was good enough to warrant a trip back in the future for lunch or dinner. Great location off the beaten path and away from the touristy part of the  Quarter.  Satisfied and pleased with our find, we started our day with a smile and full bellies.

Stopped in for lunch on Monday, the service was friendly and the food was good.  Had pj oysters and the Monday special.  Now the Monday special with rice and beans was good, the chicken was fantastic.  The mino cocktail was pretty good too.

The food was magnificent as well as the service. We order the jalapeño grits, crab and corn bisque, stuffed P&J oysters, blue crab gratin, and Brussels sprout. It was one of my best dining experience in New Orleans.

Came here on a whim looking for a good chicken biscuit. Wow! Was not disappointed. Best one I've had, it came with cheese grits that were also the best I've had. The design from the floor to the ceiling is amazing. Our server Matt was also fantastic, we informed him our son's name is Luke and he hooked us up with a bunch of restaurant items that have the name Luke on it. I'm bummed that this is our last day in NOLA, I would love to come back here and try out all they have to offer.

If you are anything like me and do your research before you go anywhere.  Then you will be pleasantly surprised that Luke was never suggested from any website or verbally from friends that have been there before. The concierge at our hotel recommended it to us because it was super close to the hotel. Surprise, surprise this was the best dining experience hands down.  Happy hour is from 3-6 with half off of cocktails and 75 cents oysters (vs $2) AND to top off our experience we had our waiter Richie Rich for entertainment! He is funny as hell and had us laughing the entire time. Their cocktails are delicious and oysters were the freshest. With that being said, my husband who does not eat oysters tried theirs and ate several more after that. Smh, I never thought that would happen. We loved this place so much that not only did we recommend it to everyone we met in New Orleans but it was the only repeat restaurant we went to and will definitely make it our first stop when we go back. Can not say enough other than we highly, highly recommend!

What a gem. The bar area was lively and they have a dining room in the back for a quieter experience. The food was great. I was in time for happy hour and had oysters for 75 cents each and 1/2 price cocktails. The staff was friendly and respectful, providing high end service and grest food and drink recommendations. I had the soft shell crab BLT, it was wonderful.

While visiting New Orleans I decided to eat at Luke's for my birthday dinner with my friends. We had the P&J stuffed oysters, the shrimp etouffée and the entrecôte grillée et frites was beyond delicious. I will definitely come back on my next visit to New Orleans.

Came for happy hour specials, Oysters were small and Fried oysters my daughter had were even smaller and noting special. 
Place was nice and service was good. I gave them it a three because ultimately. I come for the food.

Had an opportunity to take the ladies out tonight to this restaurant popular with locals. Fortunately was able to make reservations on opentable and did not have to suffer the wait that the crowd by the entrance endured.

Did I mention that the place was popular? And loud. Not recommended for quiet conversation or a romantic night.

The service was congenial and attentive. Our server was quick to notice empty glasses needing refills.

We started with the crab and corn bisque. It was delicious, but arrived merely luke warm (not a pun). The brussel sprouts were enjoyed by the girls, but not my kind of fare. On the other hand, I savored the crab gratin on toast.

Through no fault of our server, who was constantly concerned about our wait, our entrees of oyster salad did not arrive for an hour.

Individually, the components of the oyster salad were delicious. The fried oysters were incredible. The lettuce, tomato and dressing were a delight. The bacon was a unique (to me) intense combination of Smokey flavor and salt curing that I liked immensely. However, the bacon was served in large chunks that tended to overpower the rest of the salad. I would have preferred smaller pieces to reduce the Smokey bacon influence over the salad. (I would love to have this bacon in a quiche).

In all, I like what the chef is saying to me, but the management of the kitchen has room for improvement. I've read other reviews where speed of service was a complaint. I don't see this as a dining room issue, but a kitchen management problem. The delay in serving dishes (a salad for heaven's sake) would not be tolerated by most and affects the turn over of tables. Improving kitchen management would certainly be appreciated by patrons and improve the profitability of the business.

They were very accommodating to our breakfast menu request even though it was 11:15 and they stopped serving breakfast at 11. It literally made our day. 

We started off with mimosas and bloody Mary's. I ordered the Crab omelet but it didn't live up to my expectations. The egg was a little runny for me and I didn't love the pesto sauce mixed in. 
My friend ordered the Southern breakfast and omg the grits were a fluffy cloud of heaven. The cheese and jalapeños mixed in made this the hottest dish of our dining experience.  My other friend got the Shrimp and grits which was our second favorite. Similar to the other grits but these had some sauce and jumbo shrimp tossed in.

They surprised us by giving us a few complimentary desserts which were mouthwatering. The bread pudding, crepe brûlée and pumpkin cheesecake were OMG Instagram worthy.

It was my first time ever in NOLA; late flight in, the restaurant was scheduled to close in 20 minutes. The manager seated us, we had 2 waiters waiting on us, the food was out of this world, the Reisling was my favorite one. I was literally in Heaven. The Shrimp Etouffe yum, yum. Excellent service, delicious food, drinks. You can't go wrong. Cheers to Luke restaurant
Good service. I really liked the Brussels sprouts; the mussels were good; jambalaya was salty. Going to try the shrimp and grits next time I visit!

I wanted to explore one of New Orleans' upscale restaurants for a snack and a drink to mark the end of my time in town. I love trying out places that may not be in my regular budget by going during happy hour. After doing some research, I chose Luke on the recommendation of my good friend and local host.

Part of the John Besh (now BRG) culinary empire, Luke is an old-school brasserie in the CBD. It's classic interior with white tile, loads of dark wood, and servers in white, buttoned jackets reminds you of historic New Orleans. I wandered in a little before 5 pm and sat at the crowded bar. With $.75 raw oysters and drink specials, Luke's happy hour is popular with folks in town and tourists. 

Knowing I'd be having dinner later, I limited myself to a half dozen of fresh bivalves and a Stigel Radler. The oysters were large and very fresh. Luke serves them with lemon, cocktail sauce, and crackers. I'd have preferred mignonette, but no one's getting picky over sauces at this price point. The bar staff was prompt and courteous, but the large TVs showing football recaps did detract from my overall experience. They seemed out of place in this restaurant. If you love oysters and want to ry out one of NOLA's celebrated restaurants, check out Luke and it's fantastic happy hour.

Happiest of Hours!
Current hours are 4-6 pm (even Saturdays) half off drinks, raw and fried oysters. Oysters tasted very fresh. They were clean and huge. Service was extrememly attentive without being intrusive. Everything was perfect. 
A short walk from the French quarter, this spot may have a wait (what place doesn't in the city) during happy hour specials, especially until they open the lower backroom dining area for dinner. 
This place may look fancy, but I can assure you our entire group left very full on a fraction of the price we would pay anywhere else in New Orleans.

Perfect place. Great 7 day happy hour with oysters, liquor, beer and wine and great food. Nice establishment, staff, menu, quality, prices etc. 

5 stars fo sho

We got an appointment, which was the best idea ever. 10mins in the place was out of free tables and for good reason. The food was excellent. 

The roasted beet salad I got was perfect not overwhelmingly sweet, but the juices from the roasted beets made a great addition to the dressing.
The fresh gulf puppy drum was apparently great.

Although I wouldn't get the bread pudding unless you like very sweet deserts.

We were there for dinner last night. Service was excellent, the place is very clean. Must try their raw oysters, they're super clean and fresh. One of our entree was a bit salty. If you're not from NOLA, it may not be a bad idea to order your food with light salt. Overall great restaurant and would come back.
FANTASTIC!!! Fresh oysters and the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp and Grits is AMAZING!!!  FUN atmosphere and the crew here is great!!!

Had dinner at Luke for the first time over the weekend, and let me tell you it was well worth it! Not only is their happy hour great, but the food is amazing. Elegant and clean environment, with things on the menu ranging from soft shell crab BLTs to ribeye steaks and tuna tartare. What really floored me most was the service. Not only was our waiter attentive and upbeat (thanks Kenny!), but I watched as the manager went around to every table to make them feel welcome. When he made it over to us (Tim is his name by the way), he welcomed us to Luke and to New Orleans! He pointed out his favorites in the menu, and encouraged us to try a bit of everything. We took his recommendation and are glad we did! Best Brussels we had ever tasted! It was nice to see a manager that truly cared about his patrons and his staff. Thanks to Tim, Kenny, and the wonderful team at Luke for a great dinner and experience. We will be back!

Too bad I wasn't super hungry when it was time to visit Luke, but after stuffing my face at other spots, I didn't have a large appetite. It was definitely one of the best restaurants we visited during our trip, and after sampling some of my partner's food, I could tell everyone was having a great experience.

AMBIANCE is classic style and beauty. Fellas- definitely take the time to wear a nice button down shirt. To give a depiction of their unannounced dress code, the waiters wear tuxedos.

ORDERED stuffed P&J oysters. My partner ordered the pre fixe menu, which included crispy Brussels spouts, shrimp "étouffée", and I believe vanilla bean crème brûlée.

FOOD was solid. The oysters were a little saltier than desired, but still tasty. The Brussels sprouts were INCREDIBLE. Definitely the best I've ever had. Moist and well seasoned with a delicious dressing. The shrimp "étouffée" and dessert were lovely options. 

OVERALL a fantastic four stars. Luke will be on the top of my list the next time I return to New Orleans.
We have been here 3 times and I am so obsessed with this place. Check out their happy hour. You will not be disappointed!

Amazing food and the staff is extremely friendly and well-knowledgeable. My husband asked if they had fried shrimp even though it wasn't on the menu and they said that they could make it for us. WOW! Just WOW! It was lightly breaded, butterfly shrimp that was so fresh; a dozen for the same price as their chilled shrimp that is on the menu. To top it off, being new to LA, the waitress so kindly drew up a list of must-try restaurants and sent us on our way :)

I went here for lunch and there wasn't really a wait time. Very large dining area with a large sea food bar. Our waiter was a little off and midway through our lunch brought us the check for the people next to us but apart from that everything went well.
I ordered the cochon sandwich and it was sooo goood. The portion size was so big I ate only half. It has ham, shredded pork that's not too thin, good French mustard, good cucumbers. It reminded me of a Cuban sandwich but this was so well done. I also had the crab and corn bisque which was incredibly rich but very tasty. I really enjoyed the food here and would definitely recommend it for lunch.
If for some reason I were ever sent to jail and was given the death penalty, my last meal would be the jumbo shrimp from here and Rich would be my server.

First of all Rich and Kenny are excellent waitersEach had great recommendations, kept our glasses full and clearly went above and beyond to make our visit great. My food was also exceptional, literally the best fried oysters I've ever tried ( raw oysters were just as good and very fresh) i also recommend you try the Brussel sprouts, I have never liked Brussels sprouts until I tried them at Luke's. . . Great food, friendly staff, good cocktails . If I ever make it back to N.O I would definitely go again

THE BEST in NOLA!! 

After our horrible experience with our server yesterday at Trenasse across the street, we did not have high expectations. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We showed up at 5pm (without making reservations) and were seated right away.

Our servers Eldwin and Jesse were both amazing in terms of providing service! They introduced themselves as soon as we were seated and drinks brought to the table within 3 minutes. There was never a time we had to look for either one of them to add on items to our order. They, along with other servers seemed to master the art of multitasking with smiles on their faces. Bravo!! Real pros deserve the biggest tips.

Skip the over-rated reviews for places in the French quarter, and come here. I promise you won't be disappointed! 

Wished we went here sooner... but glad we tried it before leaving for home tomorrow.

So we came here twice, why?

Happy hour oysters.  $8 a dozen. Some
Of the biggest and juiciest I've ever had.  Service was great and a clean establishment.

I would come back in a heartbeat.  It's not touristy and off the beaten path so were good there.


Had the beet salad and corn/crab bisque and very good as well.

So I came here for my sister's birthday, and OMG!!! It was amazing. I really enjoyed the vibe the restaurant gave off. It was a great dinner spot and I would most definitely go back. Also if want to get a good drink, you have to get the French 75. It was a huge hit with everyone at our table! So if you want some good food and hang out with good people you have to come here.
Richie Rich may be the best waiter my wife and I have ever had the pleasure of being served by. He made our experience very special by catering to our every need. One of a kind dining experience!

Got into town late. We were hungry. Consulted Yelp.  What a great experience. Went across the street from the hotel to Luke and found dining according to the gospel of Luke. You gotta have Gumbo when you visit New Orleans. Gotta have oysters in November in New Orleans. Saw the Luke burger at the next table so I gotta go back. They were crowded and we had no reservation but the wonderful host staff fit us in and the wait staff was awesome. It was noisy. But this New Orleans y'all.

I came during Essence Fest and ordered the Southern Breakfast due to its generous offerings, but sadly I only enjoyed the bacon. After noticing that I only ate a small portion of my food, the server insisted that I order something else since it was apparent that I didn't enjoy my food. I declined the offer, and shortly after, the manager came by my table to see if there was anything that he could do. In short, the manager only charged me for the bacon that I ate, which was an extremely generous offer. Although I didn't get to enjoy my meal, I think it speaks volumes of the staff to see how invested they were in making my experience a good one. It's a beautiful restaurant and I'm sure they have other delicious options. I applaud the manager and his team.

Came here for lunch from a recommendation from a local bartender. We order the fried oyster salad and a Croque-Monsieur which came with fries. Everything was delicious. I am not a fan of ham but the ham was delicious!

Review for just happy hour oysters. At 75cents you can't beat that! I had 20 raw oysters and they were great along with 6 fried. Fried were good but a little small for fried (when fried I prefer the plump ones). I also ordered the jalapeno grits and that was good. I have only eaten diner grits and I just never got what's the deal with grits. So it was a surprise how much I enjoyed the grits. Service good as well. Very happy with my happy hour late lunch here.

I don't understand the big deal.  Told 45 minute wait on a weekday at 4. My friend made a reservation thru Yelp after we walked in and that got us seated in 20 minutes. None of us liked the half price specialty drinks. The Brussels sprouts were tasty as were the fried oysters, but honestly we had better at cheaper restaurants.

YES YES YES YES YES YES YES!!

CRISPY BRUSSEL SPROUTS: I make amazing Brussel sprouts. People that hate Brussel sprouts, eat my Brussel sprouts. BFF took of a bite of these Brussel sprouts, looked at me dead in the eye and said, "Your Brussel sprouts are great. These are AMAZING."

Our server overheard him while attentively refilling our water glasses. He held his breath and tensed, ready to put out the fire that I would inevitably set on BFF. I took a bite.

Savory. Sweet. Tart. Spice. Remember how Pixar's Ratatouille visualized taste? Yep. Me with fireworks watercoloring through my brain. Our server looked at me and said they have a printed recipe card. So thoughtful. BFF was on point. And he did not catch on fire that night.

For dinner, we ordered the Luke Burger and Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte". Fabulous. Fantastic. The flavors made my head swirl in lush content. I could eat buckets of their shrimp en cocotte. Of course, BFF would need a wheel barrel to carry me out.

Hip diverse crowd, TVs at the bar, very good draft beer selection. Small but creative menu. Good food, from what I gather even though I don't eat oysters it's one of the best raw bars around. To that point the atmosphere indicates that. So don't expect an elegant ambience.  I had matzoh ball soup (being from New York, it was a very good example), and a perfectly cooked steak, nicely seasoned.

What a lovely place! With $0.75 happy hour oysters... YESSS! Loved it!

Happy hour drinks were also a deal!  Tried the French 75, which was highly recommended.  I liked how the number 75 was written on top.  Taste wise was decent.

Beyond happy hour, I tried the shrimp and grits for dinner! It was a delightful dish served in a hot cast iron dish - the grits were very nice and creamy with jalapenos (nice spin), with a decent amount of shrimp.  I might prefer a little less cream, and more zest.  It wasn't the best shrimp and grits I ever had and certainly not the largest of portion, but it definitely was good.

Service was nice and attentive.  I would recommend Luke!

We tried Luke's on a last minute dinner decision due to the location to our hotel. We were not disappointed at all. We went during during happy hour by accident. I would not recommend going during this time if you are not a drinker (which we are not) or you don't like a loud restaurant. 

The food- was delicious. I ordered the "shrimp and grits" which was honestly some of the best I've ever had and the oysters, which were delicious. *we also live on the gulf, so we frequently have fresh oysters! 

Limited menu, so read over it before you go! 

Great option if your in the city!

Enjoyed lunch here with co-workers. We started with oysters then gumbo and finally main meal. The gumbo was the winner for sure. It was just the right kind of spice. I ate the red beans and rice, which I enjoyed. Service was good. Overall a good experience.

This place is everything you ask for on a good restaurant. Fast service, good customer service and awesome food. Highly recommended

Ahh and the owner is a Marines! Semper fi

The food here was really good and flavorful. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was good. The reason I gave 4 stars is because the food was not as hot as it could be and the flavor could have been a little spicier. The bread pudding however was amazingly delicious!

Nothing special , average classic American concept food . It is not a restaurant gives you good after delish memorable   taste . You can experience this restaurant for one time and nothing special about it

We were blown away by Luke. We came here just for the happy hour since it looked like a cool place, and ended up staying for dinner and coming back the next night. The happy hour is one of the best in town, both for the food/drinks and the price. Definitely get the oysters.

The dinner menu was also great, although the tarte flambe wasn't quite authentic. Other than that, everything was great and very reasonably priced. Service was also great, and I especially loved the interior and atmosphere. 

They take reservations and I would highly suggest it since it can get busy pretty fast. I will be coming back for sure!

Cool looking place and good staff but the food was just okay. I went for lunch so I assume it was a smaller menu option. I got the burger and shared the brussel sprouts and both were presented well but like I said earlier it's was just okay.

Definitely a mustEats! Best Shrimp & Grits & Crab Au Gratin I've ever had and I don't even like Shrimp or Grits! Delicious Brussels Sprouts, Corn/Crab Bisque & drinks had generous alcohol pour too. Atmosphere is nice, old southern, home some vibe. Ask for Chi Che to be your Server!‍ #hellohelloeats #eattheworld #foodporn #musteat #livetoeat #eatswithlovedones #withmybb#icjourneys #eatwithcin #flexitarian #ourchoice #NOLA
This was awesome. I had the shrimp and grits. My friend said the burger was so amazing.  The server was very attentive. It a little pricey, but it's worth it
Good oysters. Good service. Outstanding selection of bourbons and rye whiskeys. Friendly fast service.  Corn and crab bisque excellent.

This review is for breakfast. I would bet that Luke is the best breakfast place in a 10 or 15 block radius. We had a terrific hearty breakfast there with fresh eggs, thick bacon, nice big biscuits, and the true standout, the grits. Normally grits are just sort of meh, but at Luke they are light and fluffy with a bit of white cheese, and totally delicious. The prices here are reasonable, at most a dollar or two more than the street cafes. That is a bargain for fresh food and superior service. Our order was taken quickly and our water and coffee cups were swiftly refilled. Most of all we appreciated being able to make a reservation for breakfast instead of standing in line outside on the curb for an hour with grumbling stomachs at the other places.

This place is great. It has nice breakfast and nice dinner. Yes, I had two meals in this restaurant. I ordered crab omelet and British black tea for breakfast. The omelet has crab and mushroom in it. The best omelet I've ever had in my life!
