I ordered steamed oyster with additional jumbo crab meat for dinner. Not too many seasoning, but the flavor is right. The dinner seats were all reserved so I ordered food to go.

Seeing Luke highly recommended on Yelp, I stopped in when I was in New Orleans recently. Even though the restaurant was crowded (Voodoo Fest weekend) and I didn't have a reservation, the host was able to find me a seat at the bar. The bartender also provided excellent service, and I ordered the Shrimp and Grits, which did not disappoint.

What did disappoint, however, was the rest of the staff. My seat at the bar was next to a wait station, and I heard a lot more than I needed to. The shouting and profanity that came out of the wait station was excessive, and I heard more than I needed to about how much the staff hated their managers, their coworkers, and the customers that night. Even though the shrimp and grits was pretty good, it's hard to speak highly of Luke when much of the staff seems to take no pride in being there.
Food was delicious! Staff was friendly and accommodating, and very knowledgeable with the menu.

We had an awesome time at Luke thanks to or amazing server, Richie Rich!  He was kind, generous, and extremely hospitable.  We had giant oysters, delicious brussels sprouts, and fantastic cocktails.  We'll be back and definitely hope to see him there again soon.

really good,fresh oyster,the fried ones are much better than other restaurant we visited , the raw is as good as some other restaurants. The Luke burger is huge and very tasty. The soft crab BLT is very good as well .

We spent Thanksgiving here enjoyed some Turducken, oyster stuffing, raw oysters, brussel sprouts and so much more! The price is reasonable. For 8 people our check came out to under $400 and that includes cocktails.  I dont think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.
The service was the best. Jessie and Savannah were our waiters. The day before that we had Gary and Kevin as our waiter.  Gary made it a point to co.e to our table to greet us. The manager (Byron) was also great. He fit us in at the last minute. Thanks for making our Thanksgiving (away from home) such a fun experience!!
Food presentations are amazing!! Jess, our server was fantastic!! Loved the fresh baked biscuits! Some of the food came out cold, so had to return. Overall, good experience.

Luke is a busy and happening restaurant with a bar in the French Quarter. I was walking around looking for a nice restaurant for dinner and definitely glad to discover this place. It's quite popular so it was packed when I walked in around peak dinner time. I waited around for like 15-20 minutes for a spot at the bar.

The Luke Burger sounded pretty good - Allen Benton's bacon, caramelized onions, Emmentaler cheese (apparently from Switzerland) with housemade fries, for $16.5. Definitely a good choice and I'd recommend it. 

I'm a sucker for pate, so I got the rabbit and chicken pate, which sounded interesting; it turner out to be quite delicious. The caramelized brussels sprouts was also very good.

I'd highly recommend this restaurant, which I'd imagine would make a fun dinner date place.

Was staying at the Hilton on the recommendation of a local friend I didnt realize how lucky I was that the Luke was downstairs. Good drinks and the food was nice but the oyster bar put it over the top. The oysters were delicious and plentiful for a good price. Most important though was the great info shared by the folks working the bar. They gave spot on suggestions and got us pointed in the direction of a Second Line parade which is a great time. In summation, food and drinks here are good but the staff makes this place top-notch.

We made a reservation through open table for a large party of 7 for dinner, which is obviously a benefit as not all places allow a res through open table, let alone a large party. Our table was ready, and our appetizer orders were taken right away. However after that service was a little shaky. It took quite a while to get refills on drinks, and we ran out of water on the table quickly. When the entrees came, my entree was incorrect and I had to wait. I encouraged the rest of the table to go ahead as their food was getting cold as we sat, but as this was a dinner among colleagues it was a bit awkward. They did then bring my food but by then everyone was half done and I burned my mouth trying to catch up. The wait staff never really apologized. The food itself was good, but not outstanding in my opinion.

A friend recommended Luke for the food, and he wasn't wrong. During a recent class, my fellow students and I, after a bad experience elsewhere, ended up eating here most days. We each had the special offered which took us through amazing ettoufe, gumbo and jambalaya. We ordered salads and fries and coffee. The service was fantastic. The beet salad and their regular salad were delicious. The fries were crispy. And the crispy brussels were beyond amazing!

The **only** thing (4 instead of 5 stars) was the jambalaya, which was overy salty. And not just a little, a LOT! We were in a huge hurry each day with less than an hour to eat and walk back to class so we couldn't send anything back, plus the specials (as we understood it) were made in advance (maybe that morning) so we would have had to ask for something different and wait, which we didn't have the time to do.

Regardless, I loved Luke and so did all my fellow students.

My husband loves this place and I finally got to see why. We came here for our anniversary and despite the server being a little brusque preferring the couple next to us, she kindly gave us Prosecco and bread pudding to celebrate. Both of which were amazing. I ordered a burger and it was phenomenal. Normally I would get seafood but I was in the mood for a burger and it was great. My husband got his usual shrimp and grits and complained they were a little blander than usual, but I was quite happy.
Food was good service was excellent. Sat at the bar and had stuffed oysters, gumbo and 1/2 doz raw oyster. Oysters were great, gumbo was good

This was probably one of the best meals I had while I was in New Orleans. We accidentally stumbled upon it while looking for a place to have brunch. The stuffed French Toast was amazing! We were a group of 6 and I can't remember the last time that I wanted to try everyone else's food aside from mine because their plates looked so good. From the service to the food and drinks this is definitely a restaurant worth stopping in to either have a meal.
Delicious! Had fried oysters and the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp En Cocotte. Spicy and hearty-you'll need an appetite to conquer this dish!! Staff were super helpful and polite and attentive.

Really solid restaurant if your in the mood for fries, steak or burger. 
- Customer service is ++
- Drinks are good 
- Nice set up

Oh my goodness, what a phenomenal experience. The ambiance is great, we went on a busy Thursday but were seated in minutes, maybe call for reservation if you don't like to wait at all, I can imagine it's busy on the weekends. The service was EXCELLENT.  We had two servers, a male (I think his name was Rich, Richy Rich? Lol) and a female. Both awesome. He showed me a trick in eating the muscles I ordered that he said his wife uses, using the shell to extract the meat. He treated our table like we were friends, and it was so welcoming. The shell trick worked like a charm. He was charming, had a great sense of humor and was helpful. Service can make or break a meal, and this was no exception the food was great and the service was even better. This was probably some of the best service I've received in a restaurant. I'd highly recommend Luke.

we had reservations for lunch but you didn't really need one because it wasn't packed. The restaurant is well lit and spacious.

We sat towards the open kitchen at the end of the restaurant. Our waiter was very eccentric and set a pretty good mood for the table. 

We ordered a dozen oysters to begin with. They were clean, juicy, briny, and meaty. I loved them. we contemplated ordering another dozen but decided against it, regretfully. 

my boyfriend got Cochon de Lait Pressed Sandwich and he's not even a big sandwich person but he really liked it. He couldn't finish it because it's soooo filling but he wanted to. 

I only got the mussels that are cooked in garlic chili sauce with your choice of ciabatta or fries. I prefer a white wine sauce with my mussels but these were really good took. not as big as i've had them but they were clean. They were all de-beareded and all opened.

This place is my favorite!! Stopped by on a busy night and was luckily able to sit at the bar. They were doing a half price oyster special which made us order a dozen. Only to 14+ oysters on the house. Delicious and highly recommend.

The stuffed P and J oysters were OMG!  The best way to eat them is to start by order a French 75 cocktail - as soon as its delivered, order a second one.  By the time the oysters come out your second cocktail should be finished (its now time for a third) and then you can chow down on the oysters.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu here in all seriousness.

Service was less than stellar (seldom refilled water, which was primary beverages) and food was ok. Not horrible, but expected a bit more considering the reviews. With limited time in town, not a restaurant we want to give another chance.

I'm usually very skeptical about restaurants that are attached to hotels, so I was unsure about how I would like Luke, but I LOVED it. About a 10 minute walk from our hotel on Canal street, I found it to be in a relatively convenient location. My friend and I stepped in on a Wednesday evening and were able to get seated immediately. The restaurant was clean, and for being an oyster bar it thankfully did not smell very fishy! Additionally, the atmosphere is very intimate and the service was wonderful. Though the menu is small, my friend and I both found dishes we'd enjoy. We had the Pork Schnitzel and LOVED it. The pork was perfectly cooked, the jus that is served with it was excellent, and the French fries were delicious. Did not have room for dessert. I would definitely come back here if I find myself in NOLA again!

Stopped here for a quick drink and couple dozen oysters. The service was quick and the oysters tasted very fresh. The oysters were huge! We definitely ordered a few too many and has leftovers. Would definitely come back for dinner as I've heard great things about the restaurant.

We'd already just had dinner and were craving some raw oysters so we honestly just came here for the oysters happy hour. This review is strictly for their oysters. We didn't have dessert at the restaurant prior to coming here so this was pretty much our dessert. We ordered stuffed oysters, fried oysters and raw oysters (75 cents each!). We thought the fried oysters were okay. They were small and bready. The stuffed oysters were better. I thought it was pretty good. Then we ordered some raw oysters which you can't really go wrong with if you like raw oysters. Our server was wonderful and attentive. I may have to come back to try other items on the menu. We just couldn't because we were so stuffed from our dinner earlier.

I love Luke along with the other restaurants in the "John Besh" group. The location and atmosphere are both major pluses. I got the Rabbit Ragout and a dozen P&J oysters. The Ragout was AMAZING, such an interesting take on a typical pasta dish and it was so incredibly fresh. Same goes for the P&Js, they were huge and obviously fresh. My experience with Luke has always been great so it really does surprise me to see some negative reviews. Overall Luke is fresh and trendy, and I always have a great experience.

had the red beans and rice. amazing. like seriously i loved it so much, especially the fried chicken - it was so much better than the pork which itself was already very delicious. however it was a biiiiiig portion and towards the end i just felt like i was gonna die eating it lol.

Ummm how does this place not have 5stars. I mean almost 4000 reviews and they do have 4, pretty good average, but seriously!

Gumbo-my husband eats gumbo every single place it's served. This is the first time he said, "its perfect". 
Beet salad-perfect as well. Roasted to perfection, blue cheese that was unbelievably creamy, candied pecans and the greens were crisp. Oh yeah the dressing was the perfect balance to round out the fork full. 
Oysters-raw, fresh, succulent
Bread pudding-also did not disappoint! 

Mussels- The guys next to us all had a large bowl each and they said they were phenomenal. 

Tip-make a reservation-especially for dinner. 

Well done! Every time we come to NOLA this will always be our MUST HAVE!

When a place is that good, (well, and that close to the hotel *literally across the street*), you gotta go more than once amirite? 

Originally planned to just stop by Luke's during their infamous HH (3pm-6pm) and thennnn head to the dinner ressie. Welp, that didn't happen. The crazy fun bar side vibes had us sticking around for the long haul. 

We sat bar side on a Thursday afternoon around 5pm, to a pretty busy crowd. Lucked out on grabbing the last two seats. Proceeded to order 3 dozen raw oysters (obviously), half a dozen fried oysters, and a couple of drinks to round it out. I started with the door#three, which frankly, I wasn't crazy about. Flashbacks of my early 20s drinking cheap mixed drinks is what it tasted like IMO.

When we finally decided to cancel the dinner res, and stick around, the second round included the "ohhh snappp, gingerrrr"...and yes, you have to say it just like that. The bartender gave me a Z formation snap to go with it. I'm not saying that's what made the second drink better, but maybe I am. Haha 

In the end, the food and drinks were delish. I definitely came back a second time before leaving for the airport. Cheap, delish HH can't be missed! The waitstaff and bartenders are everything sassy and sweet. At times, a smidge overboard on the sass, that my dad didn't pick up on all the time. There were a handful of awkward "huh?" moments, and some plain just awkward moments in general. And for all of that, 4 stars. Would I come back though? Hell yeah.

We were fortunate, or so i thought, to book a room at he Hilton St Charles's 
Luke's, the best restaurant in NO is connected. 
However, currently the Hilton, and Luke's is a construction "WAR ZONE". Who knew the intercontinental would be upgrading the front area
Well HILTON did. Could they let guest know. NO!!!!
Anyway, getting back to Luke's. The best food in the entire world. We were fortunate to have THE BEST PERSON SERVE IS, Lilly. She is one of a kind    Perfect!
She made our visit to the Hilton NO perfect. She really needs to be recognized as an employee that turned a bad day into a great day

Awesome food and service. By myself visiting for business, sat at the bar. The bartenders made me feel so welcome. Wine by the glass selection was fabulous. Went back the next morning for breakfast. Best shrimp and grits I've ever had.

My wife and I went there for brunch. The Service was very good. French press coffee was great and just what we needed. I had the chicken and waffles which were phenomenal. My wife had the crabmeat mozzarella omelet which she said was good as well. I had a side of andouille sausage which was the best I've ever had but didn't need it as my dish was a generous portion.

Had to make this one of my FAVS!  Don't miss this place.

Food:  Great oysters.  Fried or raw.

Atmosphere:  Cozy.  Get to happy hour early to get a seat at the bar 

Value:  Unbelievable value.

Service:  Outstanding from what we could tell.  Knowledgeable about other places in city for your next stop.

Listen: Luke is fantastic. If you want great oysters, cocktails, and service this is the place to go. It's never as crowded as Acme and is truly awesome. Check out daily happy hour from 3-6 for .75 oysters and half price cocktails! I love this place.
Loved my dinner at Luke! Beautiful venue. Excellent food. Enjoyed the oysters, table bread, fish, and salad. Server was a little slow, but I highly recommend this restaurant.

This is the best happy hour I have been to in NOLA - especially for the oysters. I have never been to an establishment that provide to you such big oysters. Seriously, you may think you're eating something from a different planet. Surprisingly, the flavor is fantastic which is not what I always experience with large oysters. The place gets crowded really quickly so be prepared to get there early or to wait in line. My wife and I have tried a number of the drinks there, and they are all good - with the Sazerac being quite delicious.

You can't get a better value and environment outside of Luke's which is why people rush to get there for the happy hour all days of the week.

Go here for the happy hour and say hi to Jelly and Uncle Phil. 

Rabbit and chicken liver pate was bomb with the baguette
Great food great environment， highly recommend！！！Seafood is so fresh and well seasoned. Better than most of the well-known restaurants that tourists will go to in French Quarter.

Came here for happy hour. 75 cents oysters, can't beat that. Fried oysters were $1.25 which isn't bad either. Got here around 430, no wait got seated right away but by 5, it was starting to get busy. You also don't need to sit by the bar to get the HH oysters which is a plus too.

You can literally find oyster bars anywhere in NOLA. And Luke stands out for a reason. A friend of mine recommended this place to me. And I came here on my last day at NOLA, just to check out how good the its oysters could be. 

In addition to the local P&J oysters, Luke also had several other options to choose from. I ordered half dozen of P&J, as well as half dozen of Beausoliel, with recommendation from the oyster shucker. If you come by yourself, I would highly recommend you sitting at the bar. It was such a piece of art to look at. 

The P&J and Beausoliel were so different in their sizes. P&J was giant and looked fatty, just liked the ones I had tried at other oyster bars at NOLA, only fresher and tasted better. 

As for the Beausoliel... oh my they were truly amazing! Upon first look, they may seemed shriveled, especially when putting right next to P&J.  But when I slurped down the whole thing chewed it, I instantly got to understand why it was highly praised by the shucker. It was so refined and light, giving me a nearly sweet and crisp flavor... just everything I could ask for. 

Oh and did I mention they had happy hours from 3-6? Definitely go and take advantage of the 75 cents oysters!

I never thought this would happen.  LUKE has been my go to restaurant since they opened.  Today is Christmas Eve. We walked up at 2pm .  We asked to sit in the front.  The"hostess" told us that all 11 empty tables were "reserved".and we had to sit in the back room.  When I protested she explained that they  had to be a fair distribution of tables for the servers.  Remember when the customer was always right.  Well not anymore at Luke.  We decided to go someplace else because this was soooo insulting really.  Back at the front another "hostess" tried to repair the first offense made by the naif who told the truth of why we were being directed to a part of  the restaurant we had no interest in sitting in, she revised the story to say. " We have reservations.  All these tables are reserved and we give preference to our clients who gave reservations.  "Hmmm  this was such an obvious lie I was speechless just then the manager, a cute fellow in some serious Christmas tie, walked up.  He asked''how many in the party"? immediately the little liar turned on a dime...We have a table...she showed us to the worst table in the front of the restaurant which for me was still better than sitting in the back room.   She repeated her lies.  We then got to enjoy excellent food and clock the empty tables as they remained empty until about 3:15.  For fun , on our way out I asked those new diners if they had reservations...NONE of them had reservation as in NONE.   UGH we wanted an impromptu Happy Christmas Eve Lunch at my favorite restaurant LUKE.  We got a cheesy BS Nightmare... Food as ever...so good.
Hands down best place to eat in New Orleans!! Food was awesome. Service was the best we had all week. Bartenders went out of their way to treat you like family!! Loved the French 75 drink!!

We had high expectations going into Luke, and left mostly whelmed. Points for being open on Christmas Day, though. 

I ordered the fried oyster salad, which is essentially a cobb salad minus the egg with fried oysters. To be honest I mainly just wanted fried oysters, and Luke does them well. However, they definitely lacked that "omg amazing" factor. The salad itself was decent, but somehow they managed to put too much bacon in it. It sounds like sacrilege, but it's true.

My girlfriend got the roasted chicken, which in contrast was fantastic. The chicken is fantastically juicy and the potatoes were perfectly crisp. I would order this again in a heartbeat. 

Three stars for the oysters, five stars for the chicken, but three stars overall because we were really looking forward to oysters.

Excellent from the beginning to finish, every bite. 
We were there at 4:30 and the timing could not be better. They oysters are at happy hour pricing ($0.75 per) and you can eat to your hearts content. Crab bisque is super buttery and the depth of flavor is incredible. We also got blackened jumbo shrimp, yummmmm it makes me drool just thinking about it. Shrimp creole was our main dish, and we also got bread pudding for dessert. Everything, including the warm fluffy bread, was excellent by foodie standards. Highly recommended.

This place was great. We had Christmas Day brunch, the food and the service were spectacular. The rear dinning area (where we sat) has a great view into the kitchen which was fun to watch. We wish we could have gotten back in for dinner...
Great service. The gumbo is amazing. Same with the salads- both big so good to share with the fam. The Brussels sprouts might be the best I've ever had- sooo good. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered

Amazing happy hour deal here but come early or have a reservation!! We arrived at exactly 3pm on a Thursday and it was already packed. The oysters are only 75 cents and cocktails are 1/2 off though! The oysters are decent sized and tasty and the cool dudes shucking the oysters even gave us a few extra for free! The French 75 cocktail was also really refreshing.

Best meal I have ever eaten. Roasted chicken was flavored so well and some of the best potatoes I have tasted. Delicious grits as well. Staff was very friendly even on Christmas Eve. Waiters recommendations were right on. Very attentive staff. Clean restaurant.

Luke Restaurant was the most memorable thing about my 5-day trip to Nola. Boyfriend and I visited every single day during their weekday happy hour for delicious $0.75 raw oysters, $1.25 fried oysters, and amazing half priced cocktails. 

I recommend sitting at the bar for a good view of the gentlemen shucking the fresh oysters for you. During our first visit, one of the men gave us several complimentary oysters and just placed them onto our plates, he was very sweet. All of the oysters are fat and juicy and their fried oysters are too die for. The fried ones go well with the aioli dipping sauce that they come with (for happy hour, you have to order these by the half dozen). 

For cocktails, you can't go wrong with any of them. I think the most common drink that people order here is the French 75 which just tastes like a lemonade mimosa but it gets the job done. Depending on the bartender, they can make the drinks pretty damn strong which I love. 

Overall, if there was one place in Nola to go for happy hour oysters, I recommend choosing Luke because not only do you get amazing quality oysters for cheap but you also get fried oysters, great cocktails (compared to the sugary crap you get at other places), and your good ol' southern hospitality.

We decided to come here for Christmas Day dinner, which may have been the mistake. However, after research and looking at other yelp reviews, we thought it would be a good decision. We had a 945 PM reservation, there only one available, which was late but acceptable. We arrived at 935, and were not seated until close to 1015. We tried to be patient and understanding since it was a holiday. We did not receive our drinks until 1045. Some what disappointed by the long wait, we tried to rush and put in our order. Our server explained how tired he was to another table, which is understandable, however we placed in our apps and only received half of our order. I had put our reservation under a Birthday celebration, and reminded our waiter as well. As we closed out our meal, I waited for a special dessert or song, and nothing happened. I was very disappointed. I not only made the reservation with this in a note, but I asked front of the house, and our server! To say the least, our food was mediocre and service was less than fair. And, the menu posted online was not what was available. Which was also disappointing.
Happy hour oysters + Brussel sprouts + bread pudding were memorable... highly recommend
Just went for a late dinner. Our appetizer was never put in and when we inquired about it, it showed up with our meal. Disappointed in the dinner visit. Interested in trying out breakfast/brunch.

I popped by Luke for the simple reason of hitting them for their HAPPY HOUR SPECIAL - $0.75 oyster, $1.25 fried oysters and half off drinks 3-6pm Everyday.

I just wanted a couple of the fried oysters, but was told that they come by the half dozen.  Okay, that's fine.

They arrived in a cute fry basket, and down they went way too easily.
This restaurant was fabulous for breakfast! Everything was delicious.  Although pricey, the shrimp and grits was amazing. A bit on the salty side, this dish was amazing comfort food.
Elegant setting, awesome food , great service at a reasonable price. Will come again! Shrimp & grits was creamy deliciousness..Perfect balance to the crisp beet salad.

Fun time there.  Made a last minute dinner reservation for a party of ten.  They handled it with great service and humor.

The food was plentiful and yummy.  We tried a good cross section of their menu and everything was delicious and filling.

All in all a great evening
Great service and happy hour. 75 cent oysters between 3 p.m. and 6 p.m. Half off drinks. Really good deal!

Luke was decent and the service was super (waitress with the long ponytail and great attitude- thanks!).  One of the relatively few places open on Christmas night.   It's a traditional bistro, bright lights and noisy.   Good start to our first NOLa visit.

We went there at Christmas but no seat available. It is a very hot place. 

We made a reservations the day after Christmas. The environment is elegant. The raw oyster is awesome and we can't help order another half dozen after finish one. Gumbo and bisque are also good. I like this place!
We had Christmas Day brunch and it was delicious. French bistro feel, lots of delicious seafood. I had the fried oyster salad and the oysters were perfectly cooked.

"Fancy, aren't we?". This is a known high end restaurant. From the moment you walk in you get a, "I have to mind my manners in here". From what I observed, the customers were diverse. The host was very kind and friendly. Our seating was near the kitchen, with the glass view. Watching our food be prepared was clutch, it was cool to see the staff prepare our food. 

On to the food, I destroyed the Shrimp and Grits, it had a great mixture of flavors and crab and corn bisque was nothing short of amazing. The only take back from the bisque was that I ordered a bowl but the portion was more like a cup serving. Overall I'll give LUKE 4.6, nice place for a simple lunch date or just lunch period.

My husband and I stopped in for lunch and enjoyed every bit of Luke's. There was not wait, we were seated immediately. The service was excellent, I had no complaints. The decor was upscale but you could still feel the New Orleans vibe. The food was phenomenal, I enjoyed everything. I ordered the  crab and corn bisque, shrimp En cocotte (shrimp and grits), and fried oysters. All 5/5! A bit pricey if you're on a budget but I believe in "you get what you pay for" and the food was well worth the price. I would definitely recommend.
Food was just okay. We had the schnitzel and it was tough and overlooked. Service was slow, didn't get our first drinks until after the appetizer was served. Overall felt rushed.

10 stars!! Such an amazing meal. Have been here before but it has been a while. In town so I made reservations for 2 the same day. He had the shrimp and grits. I went with Luke salad, grits and we shared the sprouts. Everything came out so quickly and well cooked. There was bread for the short wait and received a second loaf with a smile. 
We got seating on the wall which I much prefer to the middle of the narrow restaurant where there is a tendency to get bumped a lot. 
Only suggestion is the same one I have for most restaurants. You have vegetarian options (pasta, rice) please put them on the menu/website. 
Well done - Can't wait to be back!

One of our favorite meals in NOLA! Raw oysters were excellent as was the corn and crab bisque and etouffee. I don't enjoy bread pudding, but this was moist and we'll flavored - perhaps the best I've ever had. Service was slow, but it was a busy night. Would recommend to friends and/or return on a future trip.

We made reservations for 9:15 and arrived at 8:30. We were told that we wouldn't be seated until 9:15, which we expected. I asked if we could wait at the bar and was told we could. At 9:05, I went back up to the hostess to let her know we were waiting at the bar. She said "oh, so you don't want your table anymore?" and I said "yes we do." She then glared at me and said "Well we've been calling your name."  We were only about 7 feet from where she was allegedly calling my name, so I have a hard time believing that, plus she said it was fine if we waited at the bar, so I assumed someone would come and get us if the table was ready early. She seemed entirely inconvenienced by my presence. She proceeded to grab two menus and rushed off towards our table without waiting for us to follow. It was a really rude welcoming to what ended up being a nice meal. The waitress and everyone else were lovely and the food was very good. It was just hard to get over such a rude and disrespectful greeting. If you don't want to be nice to customers, don't work in a customer service based industry.
Great food, awesome service and nice atmosphere. One of our best experiences in New Orleans and the best food hands down!

We came for happy hour- amazing oysters at such a discount at 75 cents each! They were fresh, large, and delicious. Also got the tuna poke, which was tasty. Excellent service, cool French cafe ambience.  The entrees I saw people being served looked great. I really wanted to return for dinner but ran out of time in NOLA.  Definitely recommend!

This was our second oyster place during our trip because why not. Honestly, their menu looked like you couldn't really order anything wrong. Since we were here for dinner we also got mixed drinks. To be slightly healthy we added the sprouts to share. Overall I enjoyed my time here.

Very disappointed here... 
Food and service was 1 Star. 
Really food came out cold and I asked them to heat up more... it was my New Year's Day dinner with my mother. Very poor service. There is better place to eat beside here.
Great atmosphere and great food. A little salty for me so if you're trying to limit your salt intake you may want to request less salt. Great bread pudding!!

Our hotel was just a couple of blocks from Luke, so after looking at their brunch menu online, and reading their reviews, we decided to go there for New Year's Day brunch. We were happy we took a chance, because the food was wonderful! I started with one of their signature cocktails. The name escapes me but the ingredients were: tequila, fresh blueberries, jalapeno and basil. It was delicious and I drank the whole thing, which is unusual for me. Other items ordered were the corn and crab bisque, shrimp and grits, and steak frittes. We weren't interested in partaking of their raw seafood bar, which looked great, btw.  The food we ordered was tasty, and satisfying, and the only things that could've been improved were if the shrimp and grits were hotter (was luke warm) and if my husband remembered to order bernaise sauce with his steak instead of butter. :) The service was stellar, too. Would definitely go here again, especially during happy hour (3-5pm) when some raw oysters are discounted and their signature cocktails are half off!

Thanks to the Yelp reviews, I found about the happy hour special here! There is no happy hour menu on paper but they offer $0.75 raw oysters and $1.25 fried oysters during happy hour. Awesome offering and really enjoyed coming here! Very professional and efficient service in a nice setting. The oysters were very fresh. Cocktail sauce accompanies the raw oysters and a spicy ranch sauce comes with the fried oysters. They also serve complimentary bread which was hot and fresh. Highly recommend Luke!!

Excellent meal and service. Great atmosphere. Really enjoyed ourselves and staff was attentive and very helpful. The only issue were the 2 hostesses that were rude, non-smiling and very unwelcoming. Treated us and other waiting guests as if we all were bothering them. And we all had reservations. Very disappointing way to be introduced to the restaurant and took a very good server to set the mood right.

Mixed review here. We ate with a group of 10. Service was awesome. Most of the food was incredible. The shrimp etouffee had enough salt to turn the Great Lakes into oceans. The grits and Flammkuchen was to-die-for good. Creamy grits. Giant burgers. Oysters fine.

Arrived for happy hour yesterday - their happy hour deal is excellent! We each had a glass of Tempranillo and shared raw and fried oysters. Everything was fresh and tasty. The bar was packed the whole time we were there and I can see why!

Rating only for happy hour.   Very affordable oysters during happy hour for only 75 cents each, fried ones are a bit extra.   Half off draft beers.  Server is personable and available for water fills.  

Fancy but not too pretentious ambiance.

Let's just start by how amazing the service is. My hands are clapping to that! The food doesn't stay behind though. We started with cups of soup I enjoyed the gumbo. We also ordered the Brussel sprouts to start and all I can say is WOW. I've had brussel sprouts almost everywhere I can get them and the honestly take the cake. By far some of the best Brussels I have ever had. Then my bf and I shared the shrimp and grits and once again blown away. The waiter was aware that we would be sharing so he had the kitchen serve us each our own portion, which just magnifies what I said about the Service. All in all amazing experience.

Stayed in town at the Hilton for work, was hesitant to try the restaurant downstairs but read great reviews. Was incredibly impressed. Every staff member was incredibly nice and helpful. The fried oysters were the best I've had and the shrimp and grits shouldn't be missed during a stay in the area. The meal was on the expensive side but absolutely worth it. Will recommend to friends and family for sure.

Found this gem of a place around the corner of our hotel and it has a very comfortable vibe and even business savvy for a professional lunch/dinner but still relaxed for a casual dinning experience. Loved the Oyster Salad and the table service we received was excellent. I travel a lot with my mom and she is a picky traveler when it comes to food, she loves her burger and fries so thankful LUKE's had that. I really appreciated it because I love the seafood and it had a burger for my mom also. It was a win win. Highly Recommend.

I expected nothing short of fabulous. I ordered the Luke Salad with Jumbo Lump Crabmeat as an addition. Sadly I had to pick some black leaves out of the greens and the crabmeat was nowhere near jumbo lump. Extremely disappointed.

Hello. Just a heads up about our visit this morning for brunch.   The hostess was on her cell phone when we arrived.  We had to wait for her to finish her text before we got greeted.  At that time she seemed annoyed that she had to take care of us.  This in turn set a negative tone for our visit.  I saw her on her phone while others arrived as well.  I am shocked by the lack of professionalism at a well established restaurant.  While I won't be back, I thought this needed to be shared.  The food was decent- the housemade sausage was the best thing we had.
I highly recommend going during their happy hour times because it is 0.75 each for raw oysters.

Not sure where to start but starting at the beginning seems fitting.  First sit at the bar and be served by the team (Garrett, Calvin Johnny) their service is impeccable.  They work together and are verily observant of your needs. They respond immediately even before you ask. Next, the drinks. Garrett makes a great "Belle of the Bayou" and I'm pretty sure he can do any drink well because of his commitment to  customer service. Then there's the food.... we ordered the P&J oysters (local) to start however they allowed us to sample two other types and shrimp just to get a feel for their flavor. P&J won hands down.   Followed up with the Louisiana Shrimp En Cocotte...Amazing. Check them out when in NOLA can't go wrong!

They have a nice Oyster happy hour with 75 cent raw oysters and $1.25 fried oysters. YUM,  can't beat that.  Also, had their beet salad which is effing delicious. It's my favorite new salad.  I'd say their corn and crab bisque is just ok. A little thick and too salty. Crab gratin a nice starter.

Attempted to visit this establishment 1/15/18... Granted, members of my group were not dressed in Business Casual but we had just arrived from Los Angeles... We got great recommendation from a friend that visits NOLA on a regular basis and regularly goes to LUKE. 

Unfortunately, the hostess at the front treated my party disrespectfully and lied straight to our face.  The second we walked into the establishment she rolled her eyes at us... We clearly saw several open tables and asked for a table for 7... She looked dead in our eyes and said, "we don't have any seats available," and promptly smirked.  My friend then asked if we could put our name on a list for the next available seat... She then smirked again and said, "ya maybe in an hour". Conveniently she gave us a time after happy hour would be over... 

Not a problem though... We gave her our phone number and she said she'll call us when a table is available.  An hour later and no phone call. We attempted calling from the phone number we gave them and we're unable to get through to the restaurant.  We then attempted calling from a different phone number and we're able to get through without a problem. It's as if they blocked our phone number!  

Our first stop in NOLA and such a negative experience.  Very upsetting.  We feel it would've been more professional just outright telling us, "we feel that you are underdressed for our exyablishment.". We would've gladly gone back to our airBNB to change our clothes but due to the negative experience certificate we just opted not to return to the establishment.

We had a 30th birthday celebration at Luke's and they devinatley delivered! The food was great, the atmospher was great, and the waitress we had (Christin) was amazing!! Next time I'm in NOLA, I will make sure to go back! 
If you're looking for a nice place to eat, but also have fun - PLEASE go to Luke and ask for Christin to be your waitress!

Every time I visit New Orleans I make it a number one priority to stop by Luke. Bottom line they have the best breakfast there is. The Croque Madam if I am spelling that correctly is simply Perfect! As I heard one of the waiters call it a ham and cheese sandwich on steroids. The cheese and ham blend together in the best way possible and the fries they serve with the dish could be better than the sandwich itself and I swear are fried in duck fat and or lard in addition to just regular vegetable oil. "I never said anything about being healthy." Also Luke has a wide variety of oysters 5-7 types on hand from all over the south! I would recommend Luke to anyone every time!

I've been to the Big Easy many times and have never wanted for a good dining experience. There are so many great restaurants in New Orleans that it's hard to go wrong. But even among such lofty company, Luke stands out as an example of everything that is great about dining in the Crescent City.  Not only is the food excellent and the seafood expertly prepared, the service is outstanding. Our waiters were so personable and attentive that we practically ask them to join us for dinner.  Classy, but not pretentious; traditional, but with a modern touch, Luke is a fresh catch in the NOLA dining scene.

My wife and I just stopped here to try to get dessert. They had a bunch of tables open as well as seats at the bar. Somehow they wouldn't be able to seat us, but had tables open for reservation when we checked online after leaving. All we wanted was bread pudding :(
Friends recommended this place, the food was decent, a bit too greasy, but the service was not what I expected, I am not saying was bad but they can do a better job.

Overpriced touristy fare served up on crisp white table cloth. The waiters are either imbeciles or criminally indifferent; they have the competence and sophistication of C minus middle-school students suffering from chronic ADD. I guess that's what they mean by living in NOLA: working at Luke is the Big Easy. Leave Luke to the wide-eyed travelers from East Cleveland and go to Mother's across the street. Order yourself the Charlie Stevens Bloody Mary. After a visit to Luke, you'll need it.

Great ambience and superb service. We enjoyed the gumbo, corn and crab bisque & fresh oysters. Wonderful wine list and lovely cocktails. The gentleman next to us ordered the tallest, most decadent burger I have seen in a long while - he said it was delish. We were just too stuffed from eating through NOLA all day, to order more! I will be back!

I felt like I wasted my time to come here I am not interested in raw oysters. I was under the impression they had other oysters they sold in singles by themselves. Quite a walk from French Quarter to come here. The selection of the cocktails is very very very minimal I was confused why that is.  This is more of a place to go if you're staying at a hotel nearby and don't want to go out of your way. The entrées looked good but they're very small and pricey I came for happy hour I was disappointed they didn't have a bigger selection.
Brunch on a Saturday....... ughhhhhhhh no Redfish.....however the Chicken and waffles, were great. Crispy filet boneless breast, buttermilk waffle and the pepper jelly was very tasteful.
Great service! Gary/Larry/Steven was awesome. Pate was delicious, so was the pork schnitzel. Shrimp etouffee and shrimp and grits were reportedly good too! Casual and fun!

Wonderful place!!  Great food, good atmosphere and weekend happy hour.  I had the stuffed P&J oysters, amazing!  The soft shell crab BLT was one of the best things I've ever had, finished every single bite!!!

Luke serves my favorite oyster happy hour by far. Half-off cocktails and 75 cent oysters EVERY..DAY 3-5pm. I'm sold. I've always passed by this place and have always seen lines, but there is plenty of seating and I've never had to week. The happy hour oysters are farm raised but they are always clean fresh. The happy hour oysters go either raw or fried, with the fried being a little more money. Can't go wrong either way. By the way, I suppose December and January are the oyster seasons.

I've also had the fried quail appetizer which was solid and like chicken tenders, but I would definitely try others options next time. The schnitzel they serve looks amazing but I have yet to try that. As for cocktails, I have tried the French 75 and door#3 which seem to be the customer favorites. Their cocktails don't have too much ice and have the right balance for flavor and alcohol content.  Everything at Luke is consistent since I have been here 3 times.  Excellent, attentive service and impeccable menu. Luke is definitely a must-try in New Orleans. It's classic.

We go to NOLA once every year and try to do what the locals might do and eat where they recommend.  Someone FINALLY mentioned this restaurant to us so we decided to try it out for Happy Hour...we couldn't have more pleased!  
Raw and fried oysters were outstanding!
Beet salad was my absolute favorite new thing!
Richie Rich (our server) was incredible!  Funny, kind, knew his stuff and made great recommendations.  He also is from the Midwest so we had a lot to chat about!  He even had chef make char-grilled oysters for me even though they were not listed on menu.  That is a sign of a great restaurant when they listen to how you like the food...not just how they want to serve it to you.
Go there!  Try it out!  You'll go back!!!  We did...3 times!!!  It is fantastic!  And don't forget to try the dessert.  We got the chocolate cake that was decadent!  Very small but delicious and a great way to top off your meal!
Watch out Richie!!!  We'll see you again next January!
Best service and best oysters in town! Sit at the bar and talk to Uncle Phil and Nephew Jelly, they will make your day.

The oyster selection, presentation & flavor were all outstanding. Larger than expected, we were seated in the back room - kinda missed some of the ambiance. Food was great - I had the ribeye and it was on par with a good steak house. Appetizers looked good, but opted for 24 oysters - lots of flavors - loved the Southern Belle's that we had not had before. Yum!

This place was great! Atmosphere was wonderful too. I give it four stars simply because the oysters were not the greatest. Small and bland. Otherwise, their Luke burger was delicious and they had a wonderful Strawberry "shortcake" that was out of this world. It even had freeze dried berries and other wonderful toppings.

Luke exemplifies craft NOLA cuisine. My first stop after my flight in from San Francisco was this restaurant and not one thing disappointed. The service was 5 star, the recommendations from the waiter were spot on and the price was on point. I will definitely return to Luke on my next visit to NOLA!

We came here around 5:30 pm on a Saturday and were seated right away. Luckily we made it during happy hour which ends at 6pm. The happy hour was awesome and includes half of most drinks and cocktails, and $0.75 oysters! So we shared oysters and each had a French 75 a great pairing for sure. We then ordered entrees, I ordered the fried oyster salad and my husband got the shrimp and grits. I got my salad first, the fried oysters were really good. They smoke their own bacon which was nice and salty and cut into hardy pieces. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because our server brought us 2 separate shrimp and grits entrees when we only ordered 1. For some reason he thought I'd ordered one too, even though we had a lengthy conversation about how I was ordering salad and would try a few bites of my husbands entree. At $25 a plate that's an expensive error, he was quick to walk away and after waiting a few minutes to inform him of the error he didn't return so I went ahead and ate it. We both loved the shrimp and grits, the grits were thicker than traditional but weren't a grit cake (which I dislike). I wish the tails were taken off the shrimp so it was easier to eat, but other than that the food was fantastic!

Amazing and wonderful location, top notch staff and my new favorite place in New Orleans. Found myself there every day for happy hour which includes five dollar specialty cocktails as well as $.75 cent oysters on the half shell. Fried oysters are $1.25 each and they are so good so good so good so good. 
I became addicted to the French 75 cocktail and tried them all over the city and this was the very best one. I cannot tell you how much I miss going to happy hour at Luke's , I swear my eyes are tearing up as I wrote this. 
We also had brunch there I had the shrimp and grits and it was some of the best I've ever eaten. I feel like the quality here is amazing and the pricing is very good for New Orleans. 
I cannot wait to return!

Come for the happy hour!!
The half off cocktails and 75 cent oysters ($1.25 fried oysters) are so worth it. Luke is a large restaurant with ample seating, and on a Saturday night at 5PM was already quite bumpin. I made a reservation for three, and were seated near the back of the quite large restaurant.

The cocktails were excellent, especially being half off! I started with a gin based drink that I thoroughly enjoyed. My friends and I started with a dozen raw oysters to start and a half dozen fried. The oysters were large and fresh, and was the first time I tried oysters with no brine (personal preference is with some brine). However, the cocktail sauce, horseradish, and lemon provided plenty of additional flavor. 
I enjoyed my fried oyster quite a bit as well. They don't skimp on the oysters and mine was large and meaty with an excellent crisp.

We didn't stay for a full meal, but had a great time at happy hour and would highly recommend the experience!
Such a great experience! Great gluten free options available- service was excellent as well as the food! We had the Brussel sprouts, shared the grits and crab dip - enjoyed a great meal!

The gentleman behind the bar shucking oysters (Tim and another man who is tall, skinny with a gold tooth) completely made my experience amazing. Knowing I didn't like seafood, Tim introduced my husband and and I to many different types of oysters. He wouldn't give up until He found an oyster I could handle. They both made for great conversation and a great time!  I would definitely recommend sitting at the bar and laughing with these to guys. You won't regret it!

I was recommended by my hotel to eat at this establishment. When I walked in I thought oh no this place is too pricey. They seated me and I looked at the menu. At my surprise it was very reasonably priced. I had the jalapeño grits and gumbo with a yummy drink, since it was happy hour. Sooooo yummy. I will be back again.

I can't think of any restaurant that is so good that I can serve breakfast lunch and dinner and be spot on.
I could attempt to sing about specific dishes which were good.
That would be impossible just everything was five star excellent

@TravelNTings #TravelNTings we always stop at Luke when we come to NOLA! Their oysters are a must try along with the shrimp and grits.  Tried the Shrimp "Étouffée" this time around and of course we were not disappointed. There's so many great things on this menu :-)

Oyster happy hour for the WIN! 75 cent raw oysters, $1.25 fried oysters, and half off cocktails! Our table definitely did HH right, with 2 dozen oysters and two drinks each. 
The service was great - they really made sure we enjoyed the drinks and dishes (read: oysters) we ordered.  If I lived in the area, I'd come for oyster happy hour on the regular - highly recommend.

Gary was the best, most attentive server i've ever had the pleasure of being served food from! Great suggestions from he and Savannah about what to get including freshly shucked oysters and savory crawfish bisque.

We came in just after they opened for some breakfast. We almost had the place to ourselves at 7 am. New Orleans parties hard and sleeps in!

We got the Southern breakfast: bacon, sausage, grits, biscuit, and eggs. We also ordered coffee and a side of fruit. 

The bacon and sausage both had a nice smoky flavor. The grits were unlike any I've had before. The waitress said they mix in mascarpone cheese which gives them their unique flavor and texture. They were so tasty, and our toddler wolfed down a good portion of them!

The coffee was delicious, and it's free refills on regular coffee. 

The restaurant is a neat place and I suppose the only downside may be if you need to park somewhere. I did not see much public parking around. However it is right near the St. Charles streetcar stop at Poydras, so at least there is another way to get there. We just walked across the street from our hotel!

Wow!! I found myself talking about this place all day it's that good!

Stopped in for breakfast.  We received excellent service, coffee was refilled frequently, our order was taken promptly and the food was brought out in a timely manner.

The food was amazing!

Order:

Southern breakfast $15 - 2 eggs, Allan Benton's bacon, housemade andouille sausage, buttermilk biscuit, grits

Side of fruit & berries $6

French press $3.5 (Santa Lucia coffee), free refills.

The coffee tasted great.  

The fruit was fresh and cut into nice size pieces.  It included watermelon; blueberries, honeydew, strawberries, and cantaloupe

The meal was so amazing.  The bacon and the sausage smelled so wonderful, and had a Smokey taste that was out of this world.  The bacon was perfectly crispy, and the sausage was cooked perfectly as well.  It had a bit of spicy to it but was excellent.  The eggs were scrambled and fluffy.  The grits were made with mascarpone and were oh so wonderful. The biscuit was tasty and served with a side of whipped butter and strawberry preserves.

The meal was perfect, service was excellent, and we really enjoyed our visit.

I highly recommend eating here often :)

** high chairs = yes
** kids menu = no
Brussels sprouts to die for!!! We stumbled across this little jewel and it was beyond worth the wait!!! Yummy!!

Our first night in town, our hotel concierge (Greg at the International House) recommended them for dinner and he was right!  "Richie Rich" helped us with recommendations and split our entrees so we could both try the dishes. My husband's favorite was the ettouffe with crispy rice (great touch with the rice!) and I loved their cheesy shrimp and grits. BEST grits I've personally ever had!!  We had a fabulous experience on the first night of our honeymoon, and we plan on going back before we leave for home. Excellent!!
Absolutely a 5 star!   Creativity from the bar staff and superb wait team were fitting accents to the incredible food.

You should have seen the look on the bartender's face when I ordered 30 oysters all to myself. 

But perhaps I would have reacted the same way... These were pretty massive oysters and the platter on which they were laid out was practically larger than me. Why did I order so many oysters on an ordinary afternoon? If you saw their HH deals, you probably would too!

I don't think I had had such fresh and meaty oysters before. They were delicious, and paired really well with my half-priced glass of Austrian wine. This giant "appetizer" was so appetizing that I ended up staying for dinner, and I was not disappointed!

I had tried shrimp and grits at a few other nearby restaurants by that point, but I must say I liked Luke's version the best! 

At the other places, there was either too few shrimps, or the sauce was too salty, or it lacked flavor, or it was overcooked to an unappetizing mush. However, here, the shrimp and grits here were perfect in flavor, quality, balance, and texture. It's not a cheap dish, but tasted delicious and thoughtfully made, with roasted jalapeño cheese grits topped with andouille & green onion sausage and a good amount of jumbo shrimp in a flavorful sauce. 

Other delicious highlights were the rabbit and chicken pâté appetizer, as well as the bread pudding dessert topped with vanilla bean ice cream, hot buttered rum sauce, candied pecans (a.k.a. pure heaven in dessert form). Service was friendly and attentive. I definitely look forward to being back!

We came here for a 3 days trip and we been to Luke twice, one for valentine dinner and one before we backed to NY. This is the best restaurant in New Orleans, the most delicious oyster we had, Kumamoto oyster is $5.25 each, so worth it!! We had dozen of them, fried oysters are good as well. We also love the chicken/rabbit liver, and Brussels sprouts! Highly recommend, you won't regret it!!

Stopped by this place for a pre-dinner "snack" and the happy hour $.75 cents oysters...wow!! What a deal!! Started with door#three which was tasty on the sour end and their Tempranillo which was tasty!! Then had 16 of their raw oysters and then another 10 raw oysters after that!! Also got 12 of their fried oysters which was nicely fried as well!! Also got their gumbo which was tasty!! Added a side of delicious crawfish tails and it was a nice "snack!!!" The oysters were super fresh and clean tasting!! Really fun atmosphere and super nice and attentive bar tender!! Great happy hour!!!
Amazing food and atmosphere   Busy Valentines Day and we got right in!   Seated overlooking the busy kitchen. Staff friendly

I had never heard of this restaurant when I and a party of eight arrived here this evening. It was packed, but they took good care of us and the food was absolutely fantastic. A great steak, great drinks, great appetizers. Definitely worth your time. I would feel good about bringing friends here to eat. I will be back.

Best happy hour! A luxurious and very NoLa experience with perfect oysters and delicious cocktails. FYI- happy hour is offered at the tables in addition to the bar. Good to get there earlier and possibly request a reservation for a time during happy hour.

This place hands down is my favorite place in New Orleans. The crawfish etouffee is amazing. It's crispy and has plenty of crawfish. It's a big portion so I normally share it. The gumbo is also very hearty. Brunch there is also awesome. I love this place.

I'm not a big one star type of guy, but in this case it's deserved. The level of chaos and poor manners from the hostess to waitstaff, servers to manager and even the servers to customers was so severe we left, after being seated and before ordering.

A server was loudly verbally trashing a patron to the manager, who obviously had no control, at the check in area, while the hostess rolled her eyes to us, clearly indicating this wasn't out of the ordinary. 

These behaviors continued until after we had been seated. After getting up and beginning to walk out, one of the servers yelled "What? How y'all going to leave?" across the restaurant, confirming our decision to escape.

Hopefully, someone will read this and do some much needed hospitality training.

Think of fancy meets good ol' southern comfort food! Wow this restaurant was nothing small. The have two dining rooms with great music and fresh oysters from multiple locations. We started with some oysters that were from two different locations. The service was great and it worthy of mentioning our service Ricky was super down to earth and very welcoming. He knew the menu items like the back of his hand. He recommended we try the crawfish soup so I had a cup of it... mouth watering! Side tip: get the fresh bread they provide... its perfectly warm and excellent for dipping with the soup. We ordered the prime rib steak. Note to those that are foodies: this is a 12oz steak and because of the marbling, it will be a little small to share with two people. We also ordered the Luke Burger. Perfectly cooked a medium rare. This was a monstrous burger and was full of flavor. The side of fries were crispy and Cajun seasoned. Now on to the top of the table, I personally ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte"... heaven in the South on a plate! The plate comes Jumbo shrimp with grits, melted cheese and roasted jalapeños (not spicy by the way) and green onion sausage. This is probably one of the best dishes I've tried in a very long long time! Check this place out.. I promise you won't be disappointed!

Hands down the freshest oysters I have ever had! It was my first time visiting Nola so of course I had to yelp a few places. It was Luke's or Acme and a bunch of my friends said Luke's! They said Acme was super touristy and crowded. They did not let me down!

We came here for happy hour and WOWZERSSS it was fresh, delicious, and best of them all CHEAP! I would highly recommend coming here for their HH special. I ordered 2 dozen oysters and half fried oysters. They aimed to please!

Food was good overall, although some dishes were too salty.  

Very very loud, couldn't hear the person sitting across from me.  

Staff a bit overwhelmed by a conference crowd.  But made up for it by comping a 2nd round of drinks.

Hostess reading her phone as we exited, a thank-you would have been nice.

Our bellman, Jonathan, at the Courtyard Marriott At St Charles, recommended this place after a long trip from Beaumont, Texas, and a $10 tip.   

The place is world class!  We went in with appetizers in mind at 8:30 and left after the Bayou Rum Cake in a strawberry sauce.  If you like crawfish, get the appetizer on sourdough covered in crawfish and a white cheese was a hit.

I rarely post 5 stars!!

Luke was fantastic because every dish you get had a different flavor. 
I highly suggest ordering a bunch of entrees and sharing amongst the group. Every dish has great flavor of it's own.

My personal favorites were the brussels sprouts, the lousiana jumbo shrimp and grits and the roasted chicken!

The happy hour here is not to be missed!  The best deal in town from 3-6 pm!  Fantastic cocktails bursting with flavor, wines and beer all half price and fried or raw oysters that were the best in town for a dollar twenty-five a piece or less!  The restaurant is very classy with tablecloths and a beautiful tiled floor and it is my impression that they do everything well!  We will return!  Note to all: you can and should reserve a table for happy hour.

Very limited menu here at Luke restaurant. The portion size is huge, the service is so so, the drink selection is below average the ambiance was average but the food is pretty good. Definitely not the best place but certainly not the worst either. We had the chicken, duck and schnitzel.

Luke was a great restaurant to visit. Definitely a higher end restaurant and the food there was likewise matched to my expectation! The waiters were very kind and well presented. The food did take a bit longer to come out, but I think it's safe to say they take a lot of time to make sure the food is well prepared.

A platter of oysters was what my friends and I started out with and it was reallly good. Very fresh and their cocktail sauce was exceptional too.

The Brussels sprouts were cooked well. I'd highly recommend getting this dish. It's a dish mixed with honey and cheese which was balanced well. No other flavor overpowered the other and I thought it was a very well rounded dish.

The mussels and fries were very flavorful. The garlic butter sauce was fantastic with the fries that complemented this dish so well.

The shrimp and grits were out of this world. This is another must get dish from this restaurant. It's just a dish you can't do justice with words.

This place is very well known for their banana bread pudding and definitely lives up to its reputation. This is a must get dessert!

Overall, I really enjoyed dining at Luke, I think it's best if you can go with a group to try out different dishes!
The food is ok. Service was good and fast. Price is a little on the higher side but expected.

THE CHICKEN AND WAFFLES ARE TO DIE FOR. Home fries were perfect. The boudin Benedict was delicious as well. Mimosas have the option of pineapple juice, orange juice or grapefruit juice .. we got the orange juice ones and they came out super light in color. The waitress (who was so sweet) confirmed it was OJ & said they just use the juice for a splash of color (fine by me!). 

The food portions are HUGE. We could've split the chicken and waffles and left full. 


The bathrooms didn't seem like they were cleaned recently (10am on a Sunday), but they had the tissue that covers the seat at least. 

We went in on Sunday feb 24th at 930 and were seated right away. Highly recommend !

Service was delightfully on point; the happy hour wine, cocktail, and oyster specials were so good, we went twice during our recent stay in NO. The place was crowded and we never wanted for anything. We ordered a few items off the regular menu and the quality was fantastic throughout. You won't be disappointed.

The crab omelet was excellent, and I was surprised with the side of fries that came with it because  I didn't see that on the menu. I also had a mimosa for my early breakfast here.
Disappointed in the lack of friendliness from the hostess, and general ambiance of the restaurant. We were  the first in for the day on a Saturday morning. I thought it felt very quiet, but realized later they didn't turn on music until we had paid and were leaving. 
If it were not for the high quality of the food and preparation I would be have a lower rating.  Staff had a vibe of  ambivalence and annoyance of our presence.
We went here yesterday for Happy Hour 3-6 and had the fried and raw oysters. They were both very delicious. The drinks, Frenchman 75 in particular was fabulous.

Great shrimp and grits! Tried the rabbit and chicken pate, which was good, but didn't stand out like the shrimp and grits. Would have liked to try the quail with picked peppers and Tabasco honey. Sounds really good! Atmosphere was nice but loud. Looking forward to coming back.

Happy hour every day!!!!! Not that I care about the drinks, but the 75 cent oysters are what I'm coming for. Initially, I was extremely annoyed as the hostess made a joke at our expense to another set of diners. However as soon as we told her we were just there to sit at the bar she was much nicer *eye roll*

We were tended to by a great bartender who was helpful in recommending some appetizers. After we placed our order for 2 dz oysters (no shame here), we also decided to go for the pate of Louisiana rabbit and chicken livers. This. Was. Amazing!!!!!!!!!!! The oysters of course were excellent - nice and meaty! Not only did we get near 30 of them on our plate, the shuckers gave us a few extra after we were done! I noticed they did that to pretty much everyone at the bar. Extra points for them!

Overall a great experience and I would not hesitate to come back for happy hour!

We came here mainly for the 75 cent happy hour oysters! I made reservations before we arrived in NOLA specifically during the HH time. We found that we didn't really need them since we came on a Wednesday and it looked like they weren't too busy. 

Service was great - our waitress was extremely friendly and attentive. We ordered two dozen oysters and shared the jumbo louisiana shrimp "en cocotte" which had roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage. The oysters were delicious - I had gone through about 6-7 until I saw what I thought was a red vein on my oyster... yikes, it wasn't that at all. I picked it up with my tiny fork and I couldn't believe what I was seeing... the little thing wrapped itself around my fork. It was a tiny little red worm. I found another one on another oyster. That was it for me, no more oysters for the rest of the night. I called over our waitress who then brought over the manager. He informed us that their oysters come fresh and that these worms are naturally found around the oyster shells, but not normally when they are plated at a restaurant. I asked if I could eat them since I could potentially have eaten one already without knowing and he said no. This worried me at the time. But I did some research online and it seems as though these worms are probably harmless. Nobody really wants to see a worm during their meal, c'mon... honestly, I just think the oysters weren't properly shucked and thoroughly cleaned before plating. 

I appreciated the offer for a new set of oysters. I declined, but my boyfriend agreed (not sure how or why) but was super careful eating them. They also gave us fried oysters on the house. The appetizer & two dozen oysters were taken off the bill so we only had to pay for the shrimp entree we had ordered. 

I guess that's the risk when eating anything raw.. lol. No more oysters for me, I'm sorry.

Excellent restaurant. Stuffed oysters were to die for. I had something that I believe was crawfish carbonara. I have posted 2 pictures during my time on Yelp and generally dislike doing so, but I was so moved by this dish that I will indeed post a picture. Here it is. Please enjoy!

Fantastic service and great food, I'm glad I came here for my last meal in New Orleans. The salad was just a dinner salad but had fresh flavors from the cherry tomatoes and beets. I had the Jambalaya special and the spicy was just right, the sausage was perfect and the pork was a great surprise. I will definitely return next time I visit.

I came here for happy hour and seated myself at the bar with my mom, since the next seating available for 2 was in 2 hours.
The oysters here are HUGE and super super super fresh.

I got a dozen P&J oysters and I also got the stuffed P&J oysters.
I felt like the price in itself was a complete steal.
We ended up paying $24.24 for around 18 oysters.

I loved it here and highly recommend this joint!

My go-to for lunch when I visit NOLA.  Has been great for many years.  A dozen P&J oysters, followed by jumbo shrimp and grits. Get the crab meat w the shrimp and grits. Bar service is great. Highly recommend.

Enjoyed a wonderful afternoon at Luke on Saturday before Endymion. In case you didn't know, they have Happy Hour everyday from 3-6 with specialty drinks included. We tried several of the French 75 (Ha!), as well as a few others. The raw oysters and the fried oysters were fresh and delicious! We even convinced my picky 11 year old to try a fried oyster and she liked it. I ordered the crab gratin and thoroughly enjoyed it. I would definitely order it again. Everyone else ordered the burger because it came highly recommended and they all enjoyed it. We never felt rushed and our server was very friendly, while not over staying his time when checking on us. It was a great experience, especially since we needed a break from the crowds and the atmosphere was exactly what we were hoping for.

Came on Ash Wednesday and I'm thinking this may have had something to do with the slow service and  subpar food. Ordered a cocktail for my friend and a sprite for me. Sprite bottle came in a 237 ml glass bottle. We ordered Brussels sprouts for an app which was really good and probably the best out of everything ordered. My friend ordered gumbo and shrimp cocktail, and requested it come out at the same time. This request was not met and as we were ready to get the check her shrimp came (at this point not wanting it). Appropriate to note here the shrimp cocktail comes with full shell and legs. I ordered puppy drum amandine and was totally disappointed when the fish came out as it looked and tasted like fried catfish. Servers were super friendly however the service was really really slow. I changed my review from three stars to four when the server noticed that I hadn't eaten much of the fish, he politely took it off the bill and advised to try it grilled next time. I didn't know that was an option but apparently it can be served pan fried, grilled, or blackened. Thanks for the tip Gary!
Amazing food, phenomenal service, going to miss this place when I'm back in California. One of the best experiences I've had while in New Orleans

Best service!!! And as always, great food. We came with a large party for a friends birthday. Our waiter made sure everything was out at the same time and everyone's meal was nice and hot. Even shared their Brussel sprout recipe!!
Good food, nice place! Only oysters I had on my NOLA trip this time, and they were excellent!

This is our go to restaurant after Mardi Gras.  We started with the peach bourbon smash during the 3-6 happy hour.  Tasty!  Next was the jumbo lump crab ravigote which has a kick of horseradish.  The soft shell crab BLT is devine because it marries bacon with a perfectly fried soft shell crab.  The fries a perfect because they are fried in duck fat.  We closed out with fried oysters and the brussel sprouts.  All of which were delicious!  U can't beat the prices either...total tab was $90!

I came by during happy hour. There was no wait, so that was awesome. The prices for the oysters was great and the oysters were delicious. I liked the raw oysters better, but the fried were good too, and they were still super tender. The brussel sprouts were pricey for a veggie side dish, but they were very different than brussel sprouts I've had anywhere else. It had honey, cheese, apples, and hot sauce. A weird combination that seemed to really work.  I do wish it had more cheese and apples on the dish, it got a bit tiring at the end with all the hot sauce. Finished off our pre dinner with a bread pudding. It was good, but not the best bread pudding I've had. A little too sweet, and it would have been nice if it had some crispy pieces for texture. The ice cream on top was good, but there wasn't enough of it. 

I definitely considered going back to try to shrimp and grits and eat more oysters, but there was just too much food to try in New Orleans. Next time.
Great meal as always, but wanted to give a special shout out to Gary and Savannah, our servers, who were incredible. Great suggestions, extremely helpful, and very friendly.

If you're looking for incredible oysters without dealing with the lines or the general debauchery of the French Quarter, this is the place to be. Oysters here are huge and a good value for the price. Luke is well lit and has a very old school, upper crust feel to it. Sharp contrast from what you find just across Canal. Staff is friendly and engaging at the bar. Highly recommend the hot buttered crawfish bread, which comes slathered in burrata. Quite the treat. Highly recommended next time you are in New Orleans.

This place is AMAZING! The brussel sprouts are to die for (trust me, just order them - send me the bill if you don't like them)! The shrimp and grits were perfect ,and this is coming from someone typically who refuses to eat GRITS! You will not be disappointed. Also if there's a wait, just wait - your tastebuds won't regret it!

Guys let me tell you. I love this place and their Happy hour 75 Cent Oysters!!! My friends and I were on a hunt for Oysters but somewhere affordable and came across Luke. I read several of thier reviews which happen to be great so I suggested we check it out. HH is from 3pm-6pm and usually it seems that it would be wise to have a reservation because it can get crowded. The first night we went we were told it was an hour wait but we were lucky that we found space at the bar. We ordered two dozen oysters and let me tell you they were DELICIOUS. They were so big and we could never get those types of oysters where I am so I was very happy. We  shared two dozen oysters with 4 people and I felt like I could eat more but the Oysters are so BIG and FRESH! The next day we wanted more oysters and we looked around for somewhere new but we loved Luke so much we wanted to go back! We went back the next day around 3pm on a wednesday and I didnt need a reservation. We then again ordered our two dozen oysters and I also got a cocktail which was 50% off. I was very satisfied with the food, service and location.

Oysters are fresh and only $0.75 each during happy hour, but shell chips left on oysters and ruin the texture. Grill oysters are good at taste but too oily. Fried oysters are over cooked and too salty. One star for the price and fresh oyster, another star for the service and environment.

In the era of "ethical eating", where "food is politics", I feel like I should announce my love of Luke while hiding my identity.  For those unaware, Luke is one of the restaurants in the John Besh empire and this empire was reported, in a 2017 article in the Times-Picayune, to "foster a culture of sexual harassment".

I assume that the problems reported have been addressed by now, 2019, and don't wish to perpetually punish the restaurant, its workers, or the general public by simply pretending that Luke doesn't exist.  

Luke exists and has an amazingly satisfying happy hour.

Served in a sparkly atmosphere with a buzzy vibe, Luke was my favorite happy hour experience in NOLA.  One dozen fried oysters ($15), 3 dozen raw oysters ($27: 75 cents apiece), Jalapeño Grits ($5), Crispy Potatoes ($5), Crawfish Bisque (bowl $10), and Bread Pudding ($9), there was nothing not to adore here.  Did it help that the Champagne was half off during happy hour as well?  At $4.50 per glass, you can bet that added to the joy.  

Luke's happy hour (4-6 daily) is popular.  Arriving a bit past 4 p.m. I waited for a seat until 5 p.m., when more tables were opened up.  The wait is worth it:  75 cent Gulf Oysters and 1/2 price alcohol are worth waiting for.

I love a happening atmosphere in a busy, buzzy place with decor that makes me feel special.  Luke has all that and good deals to match.
We enjoyed this place! They have a great happy hour. The fried oysters were the best we had in NOLA.
I miss this restaurant being in San Antonio. Went very early and they accommodated our party. Great service! I love ordering the French 75 and the oysters are always great.

Amazing place to sample some New Orleans seafood and hospitality. I had an amazing experience. 

Sat at the bar and watched a gentleman shuck oysters. He has got some talent. I ordered a 4doors vodka drink that was amazing. Has jalapeño cheese grits, converted me to a grits lover. I also had the chicken matzo ball soup which was perfect for a cool day. I really enjoyed myself. 

Atmosphere is comfortable and bartender was attentive. Got a sample raw oyster and omg what a shock! It was very kind of them since it was my first one. 

Definitely worth a try. Affordable too!!! Happy Hour!!!

Came here with a group of friends for a bachelor party, and this place did not disappoint. Our servers were friendly and upon hearing about our celebration, came back with shot glasses of Jameson to kick off the night. We started with the fresh oysters, and the pâté. Both Amazing starters. We followed it with the P&J oysters, etouffe and shrimp and grits. The Etouffe was such a unique dish that featured crispy rice and crawfish. Combined with the buttery and cheesy grits, it was the perfect entree to experience high end southern food. There wasn't a bad dish in the house and everyone absolutely loves their dinner. Everything is also priced very well. This is a must visit next time we are back in NoLa
We went here because the reviews were all excellent. While the service was good the food was just ok.

Came here for happy hours with a friend during our trip to New Orleans.  The oysters were super fresh and super sweet!!  We also order half a dozen of fried oysters, which were ok but i preferred the raw oysters.  We also ordered their fried brussel sprouts which were delicious!!  I have never had brussel sprouts prepared like this before.  They were fried, tossed in a honey hot sauce and covered with slice apples, almonds and cheese.  Very different very delicious.
