We topped the meal with a bread pudding with a rum caramel sauce.  It was good but a little on the sweet side.  Great place to have oysters and some brussel sprouts.
It's been a few years...so glad to be back at Luke. Thank you all for taking care of us...Front of House all the way to the Back. Thank you Richie R. and Gary for taking such great care!
Great happy hour!! Fresh and fried oysters along with great drinks. Make reservations!!

Must Go! After so much consideration and so many choices we came across Luke on yelp. I was hesitant going back and forth because we had kids joining us for dinner and it didn't seem like they had a kids menu but we went ahead and made reservations. We arrived early because it was raining and the kids were cold and they didn't have anything earlier so we came back. We had Chi as our waitress and she was amazing! Ok now the food part they DID have a kids menu so it is very kids friendly! We ordered a dozen of oysters should have made it two dozens they were amazing . We also did shrimp and grits and Brussels sprouts they were all amazing as well. Make sure you make reservations and if you are debating on another restaurant just stop here!

Went with my gal pals for happy hour. It's a cool chill place. We enjoyed watching the hustle and bustle of the locals. Our server was great and very attentive. We stopped for libations and a lite snack but ended up getting coffee, dessert, and a cocktail. The cocktails were a bit strong for our taste but once the ice melted a bit they were good. Will definitely visit again before the end of our trip when we're not in a rush.

Happy hour has half priced specialty cocktails, wine, and 75 cent oysters. Drinks are strong. The staff was very friendly. I had the cappuccino and bread pudding. This bread pudding was heavenly. Hot with cool vanilla ice cream on top. Perfect combo with my coffee. Absolutely would go back!

The food was amazing. We came in for a mid afternoon snack and drinks. We had the quail, rum cake, blue crab, and the brussel sprouts for the food. Everything was delicious! The drinks we ordered were good, but it took a long time to get a lemonade and a Riesling. A very long time as in they must have forgotten them. Maybe just an off day.

Like is a great option for breakfast, lunch or dinner and doesn't come with the wait time of other local options with similarly priced good. While it's not my favorite restaurant in the city, there's no denying that it does a darn good job of delivering refined good with a local flair.

For breakfast I can recommend the CRAWFISH OMLETTE, which is full of crawfish and had delicious flavor. The SOUTHERN BREAKFAST is filling and basic, but they do it well.

I recommend staying away from the PAIN PERDU unless you have a serious sweet tooth. It's covered in a huge amount of what amounts to slightly sour icing made out of moscarpone cheese. The bread itself is good, but no amount of scraping fully reduced the sweetness of the icing.

The coffee is made in a French press and is rich and delicious..I highly recommend it.

The SHRIMP AND GRITS was a great choice as well.

Overall there are enough dishes here to keep you happy and well fed.

The server put a $20 tip on my $45 meal, knowing that I was very upset with the service, and I put nothing on the gratitude line. Totally fraud! 
I got the worst service ever, the server ignored me for most of time, my food was late for almost half an hour while sitting there out of the kitchen, even when I wanted to have the check I got nobody came to me. I complained twice but nothing changed, and I put nothing on gratitude when signing my copy, then later my credit card was charged an additional $20. 
I wouldn't have noticed this if it was not for a business trip and I had to ask for a copy later to get it reimbursed.

LUKE IS SO GOOOOD!!!! wowwwwowwowow. This is somewhere that has been on our list for a long time. We had to wait an hour and a half for a table but it was worth it. When we were seated we were greeted by our server savannah (literally an angel from above). She got us bread, water and took our drink orders. My boyfriend got a French 75 which is made with an egg white (he's a bartender on the weekends so he was super into it) he said it was the best one he's ever had. I got the belle on the bayou, which had tequila jalapeño and blueberry and basil. A little on the spicy side but very good. We started off with the buttered crawfish bread AND WOW, it was amazing, there is burrata cheese on it then bread is nice and crispy. 

For entree's we got the burger with fries and the softshell crab blt I opted for the cheesy jalapeño grits instead of the fries! My boyfriend said it's the best burger he's ever had. The softshell crab blt is awesomeeee tooo it's opened faced so it can get kinda messy but wow. So worth it. lastly savannah brought us out the smallest dessert to try no charge!! It was a dark chocolate cake made with steam and these great amarena cherries with amarena cherry ice cream!!! It was sooooo great, truly a great night !!! Thanks savannah!!!!

Amazing happy hour! Oysters, jalapeño cheese grits--OH MY!! Get there for this happy hour! Fabulous hand-crafted cocktails--all very inexpensive during happy hour! Definitely will be back here for dinner after this visit. Outstanding service!
This place made me an oyster convert. Happy hour is awesome, with 75 cent oysters and nice drinks. Def add it to your list!
We were quite disappointed there. First waiter did not bring us any bread. And shrimps did not taste right for us.  Their fried oysters are good.

This place was awesome.Happy hours make me so happy..75cent per oyster was fantastic with half price glass of wine.
$1.25/fried oyster also good!
No need to talk just go and get them.

Last night, I ordered Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" at Luke. After the first bite, I could tell the shrimp was mushy. But I didn't believe that a highly rated restaurant and a $25 dish would serve shrimps that were not fresh. I still finished my dinner. One hour later, I got rashes on my whole body and it was very itchy. It happens when I eat bad shrimps and I need to take an allergy pill to relieve it. I feel deeply disappointed with this restaurant. Will never go back again.

Amazing oysters , during HH it is only .75 each.  
I also ordered crawfish bisque, basically no crawfish.. my bf ordered shrimp jumbo, portion is really small... Everything tasted ok, but since I had a really high expectation to this place, it turned out to be just ordinary.

I'd looked forward to my first visit to Luke and my already high expectations were exceeded!   Simply the best meal I've had in a couple years.

The 1/2 seafood cold seafood tray was awesome-the tuna ceviche, oysters, clams and shrimp were so fresh and large, and the sauces were perfect.  The shrimp and grits entrée is the best version of this dish I've ever had-every aspect of it-the cheese, sauce, andouille and shrimp were cooked just right and it was a great mix of flavors, spice and heat.

My son had the ribeye and fries-again, cooked exactly as he ordered it and he loved it.   Bread pudding was terrific as well.

Good two-man servers and a small request I'd had as I hated to not get the crawfish etoufee was granted and for that and the entire experience, I'm recommending this place to everyone I know who is going to N.O. and will definitely return some day!

Loved Luke. Problem is, you should make a reservation if you want to splurge on happy hour oysters! We went twice and in the end were able to secure a spot - we actually had to rush to the airport so the hubby and I slurped down 24 oysters within 5 minutes. Not great if you are an "on a whim" diner like me in a new city, but it was so worth it!

TL;DR this place may be good for happy hour oysters but don't expect anything extraordinary otherwise. Service is good. 

Okay, if you look at most of my other reviews from this week, you'll see why this was such a disappointment. Expectations were high and ultimately we felt like everything we had here ranged from mediocre to just okay.

To start, my wife asked for a recommendation on a dry wine but got a fairly sweet wine with a slightly dry finish (I tasted it and agreed even though I barely know wine). She felt bad about asking for a different glass but the waiter gladly replaced it... with the most watery, flavorless wine either of us have tasted. At least it wasn't sweet?

We started with the oysters, a half-dozen each of the Miyagi and Southern Belle. My wife liked the more briny Miyagis and I liked the more balanced Belles but neither of us felt like they were special in any way.

We then put in the rest of our order, asking how much food we should order. We asked for the Blue Crab Gratin, the famed Crispy Brussels Sprouts, and the Softshell Crab BLT. These were all recommended by the waiter and he didn't think it would be too much food.

The Brussels should be called Soggy rather than Crispy since they have so much balsamic glaze on them. I found them way too sweet and the cheese wasn't helping. I did have one nice bite with a fresh jalapeño but there weren't enough of those to save the dish. The Gratin was fine, nothing special.

Even with these starters half-eaten, we were full and probably should have canceled the Crab BLT but also figured it was already being made and would feel guilty canceling this late. It soon arrived, split for the two of us and it would have been more than enough food by itself for an entire meal (even before the oysters). 

Looking at the generous cup of fries that each of us got and the fairly large sandwich on each of our plates, we couldn't figure out how the waiter would have let us order all this food.

We did our best but the fries were mediocre and the sandwich was fine. We agreed that the oysters were probably the best part of the meal but nothing to write home about. Compared to most of the meals we've had here, the food lacked creativity and savory, unique flavors.

Yummy. I'll write more later. Fork in my face at the present moment....

Okay, it's been a while. Where does the time go?

I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!! This was my second visit and it didn't disappoint. Those jalapeño grits are so darned good! I didn't even want to share them with my hubby. Or my best friend. Stabbing with a fork is merited for anyone attempting to get between me and these grits!

And then, there's the stuffed french toast! Stuffed with what you ask? Well, nutella and strawberries! Need I say more?? Yep, that good.

Oh, and the coffee.... French press served with real, whole cream. Heaven! 

I can only imagine how good lunch and dinner are - gonna have to make it for one of those instead of just breakfast. 

Please, go and enjoy this restaurant. You won't be disappointed.

I wonder if the deliver to California...?

Everything at Luke is fantastic. We came with 7 guys with a reservation and they seated us right away. It was a Wednesday at 4pm and the place was pretty busy. We started with raw P&J Oysters and the Stuffed P&J Oysters. The raw oysters were great, but the Stuffed Oysters are NEXT LEVEL. They only come with 4, so we had to order more. A few of us said the Crawfish Bisque and said it was phenomenal. 

Definitely worth checking out, especially during happy hour!

TL;DR this place may be good for happy hour oysters but don't expect anything extraordinary otherwise. Service is good. 

Okay, if you look at most of my other reviews from this week, you'll see why this was such a disappointment. Expectations were high and ultimately we felt like everything we had here ranged from mediocre to just okay.

To start, my wife asked for a recommendation on a dry wine but got a fairly sweet wine with a slightly dry finish (I tasted it and agreed even though I barely know wine). She felt bad about asking for a different glass but the waiter gladly replaced it... with the most watery, flavorless wine either of us have tasted. At least it wasn't sweet?

We started with the oysters, a half-dozen each of the Miyagi and Southern Belle. My wife liked the more briny Miyagis and I liked the more balanced Belles but neither of us felt like they were special in any way.

The Brussels should be called Soggy rather than Crispy since they have so much balsamic glaze on them. I found them way too sweet and the cheese wasn't helping. I did have one nice bite with a fresh jalapeño but there weren't enough of those to save the dish. The Gratin was fine, nothing special.

It soon arrived, split for the two of us and it would have been more than enough food by itself for an entire meal (even before the oysters). 

Looking at the generous cup of fries that each of us got and the fairly large sandwich on each of our plates, we couldn't figure out how the waiter would have let us order all this food.

We did our best but the fries were mediocre and the sandwich was fine. We agreed that the oysters were probably the best part of the meal but nothing to write home about. Compared to most of the meals we've had here, the food lacked creativity and savory, unique flavors.
The stuffed oysters were good. However our waiters were rude. I probably will not recommend to others due to the bad experience.

Came here with my family & were told it would be an hour wait, but honestly we only waited like 30 minutes. We were starving so we really appreciated the fast service. We ordered the small seafood tower, stuffed P&J oysters, the rabbit/chicken pate, the crawfish bisque, motzo ball soup, crawfish etouffee, moules et Frites & shrimp and grits.

The seafood tower was great, everything was fresh and my whole family enjoyed it. The stuffed P&J oysters were also delicious, nothing like the charbroiled oysters elsewhere, but definitely still so good. The crawfish bisque was creamy and hot, very satisfying. I would probably pass on the motzo ball soup though. The crawfish etouffee was full of flavor and had a great crunch texture to it. My personal favorite were the mussels. It was served piping hot in a spicy broth. After the mussels have been eaten my family used the bread given to dip it in the soup and eat it all up. I've had pate, but never rabbit pate, I was a little hesitant to try, but it was great paired with all the sauces.  I loved everything at this restaurant and the service was amazing. I recommend anyone to try this place!

The soft shell crab "BLT" was good all around. The heaviness of the fried whole crab was nicely paired with fresh lettuce and tomatoes on a light mayo bread. There was some sort of green sauce, but it didn't seem to add much to the dish.

The fries definitely could have been better. They reminded me of McDonald's fries after you leave them in the bag too long - soft and limp.

This is our go to restaurant after Mardi Gras.  We started with the peach bourbon smash during the 3-6 happy hour.  Tasty!  Next was the jumbo lump crab ravigote which has a kick of horseradish.  The soft shell crab BLT is devine because it marries bacon with a perfectly fried soft shell crab.  The fries a perfect because they are fried in duck fat.  We closed out with fried oysters and the brussel sprouts.  All of which were delicious!  U can't beat the prices either...total tab was
Great oysters and delightful staff.  Soft shell crab BLT was yummy.  We were there for happy hour, select drinks were half off and they have oysters on special also.

I'm not sure I have adequate words to describe our experience.  

It started with drinks at the bar.  One of the shuckers gave me a sample of mussels, clams and shrimp that was incredible. 

When our table was ready, hubby ordered oysters and bisque.  His comment concerning the oysters was " if I smoked now would be the perfect time" as he finished them. 

I had the mussels.  Fantastic is too tame a word. I enjoyed them immensely. 

Finished it off with a to die for bread pudding.  

I highly recommend.
If you want to try authentic Cajun and Creole food this restaurant can give that experience. Loved their seafood and desert. And the service was excellent. Will definitely one back here.

Definitely a must eat location in NOLA!! I searched some breakfast locations and read some reviews and definitely was everything they described. 

Luke was packed! The Service was Amazing!! I'm a big stickler about how you treat your customers. Our waiter was awesome. He even gave me their Brussels sprouts recipe. The shrimp & grits was mouth-orgasmic! The boudin biscuits were different and delicious!! I was ranting about this restaurant to everyone. Must Visit!

For a $25 Softshell crab BLT you expect the crab not to taste fishy. Unfortunately, it was. I only did not send back because we were a party of 15 and on a time schedule. Our waitress did a great job, but drinks and food took an excessively long time even for a large party. French fries were decent as well as martinis well made,  and a friend enjoyed her Brussels sprouts, but for what we paid I expected better quality. I will not go back.

Everything here was pretty great! The service was pretty good - a little slow, but seemed almost like they were letting us enjoy our meal. They use those stupid tiny water glasses that have to be refilled every two sips - felt bad for the servers.

We shared a seafood platter - 5 stars, I had seafood gumbo - 5 stars, my mom had the beet salad - surprisingly 5 stars as well. My dad has a burger and it was not that great.. the fries were kind of limp and soggy. We also tried to split a Flammenkuchen and it was weird and tasted like burnt things. Would not get that again.

Finished off with some bread pudding - pretty tasty!

Overall, good - just stick to the seafood - you're in New Orleans after all!

Dinner at Luke was our favorite meal on our NOLA trip! We did not make reservations but managed to snag seats at the bar and the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. We both had the Bayou Belle for drinks and tuna tartar and oyster salad as our entrees. Cannot recommend the tuna tartar and salad enough but everything that came out of the kitchen looked fantastic so I cannot wait to come back and try more! We ended the meal with the carrot cake sundae and bread pudding, both were great and we had a hard time choosing a favorite. I would say this is a must visit restaurant for NOLA!

Luke's happy hour is a must when visiting New Orleans! They offer half off drinks, 75 cent raw oysters, and 1.25 fried oysters. Their oysters are big and juicy! The biggest I've ever had! Their other menu items are also really good if you have room for them.

We had some lovely oysters here that were briny to perfection. The crab dip was also spectacular. The burger was good, however the portion size was quite massive and we wished they'd told us that when they saw the amount of food we were ordering. Other than that, we really enjoyed the food!

We came in as a table of 6 and ordered family style, which was great because the dishes are so good but so rich and a few bites of each was perfect.

Must get: crawfish étoufée, shrimp and grits, rabbit and chicken livers pate, blue crab gratin, crawfish bisque

Would skip: Brussels sprouts (too sweet), beet salad (way overdressed), seafood platter (meh underwhelming)

Reservations recommended!
Food and service was great. Happy hour $0.75 oysters were really good. Drinks were fantastic. All around a very nice restaurant. I would eat here again
The atmosphere at Luke is great. The breakfast is amazing and the staff took their time to explain the menu. The shrimp and grits is

Had lunch here on Christmas Day. It was absolutely and crazily busy. I'd give my experience there a 3 or even 2 stars; but considering they had to work on Christmas day to wait on a bunch of tourists or lazy people who didn't want to cook for themselves, i am willing to give it a break. 
That said, with so many wonderful and innovative restaurants in Nawlins, I don't see myself coming here again.

Highly recommend this restaurant! 

I went there for their happy hours 3-6 pm. 
Drink - 4/5 it was too sweet for me
Raw oysters - 5/5 their oysters and cocktails sauces are amazing. We got 2 dozens
Fried Oysters - 5/5 you must try this even if you are not a big fan of oysters. You can't really smell or taste the oysters which mostly turned people off
Services - our server is very attentive and fast

Totally will visit again next time I go back to New Orleans

My husband, son, daughter in law and I had dinner here last night and enjoyed the fine dinning experience. My daughter in law and I had the mussels and were seasoned so nicely that we soped up as much of the sauce we could. My husband had the shrimp and grits and said it was great flavor and balance. My son had the flammenkuchen and said it was really really good, the gravy he wants to learn how to make. Waitstaff was spot on with drinks and service.

Nice food.  Uncomfortably racist.  Gay (I am gay) waiters dancing around
 making all the money while the black shuckers do all the work.  REALLY UNCOMFORTABLE

First meal in New Orleans. Easter Sunday at 9 PM meant plenty of tables. 

Loved the shrimp and grits ($25), crawfish bread ($16), crawfish bisque ($10), and blue crab gratin ($16). 

But definitely felt a pang of jealousy when I saw the rabbit and chicken liver pate ($11) hit the next table.

Tip: definitely order at least one shrimp and grits for the table

Bottom line: Food was excellent, good ambiance, but small dining room. Food was expensive.

I had the shrimp and grits and it was on point. Succulent shrimp, not mushy, and the gravy was exceptional. 2 dozen raw oysters which were heavenly. Service was good and ambiance ebullient. The only negative was that I found the pricing to be a little high for a few things, but worthwhile as a treat.
they have an oyster happy hour and its so good and so cheap! nice place and very nice staff!

Food 
MUST GET THE ETTOUFFIE! 
sooooo good. I had already finished my own dish I don't remember what I got but I only was trying to take a bite and sample some of my friendMs ettouffie and ended up finishing it all for her OOPS! It was just thaaaat good! 

Service 
Out waiters were great, he even cracked a pun regarding the wine bottle name

Atmosphere 
Don't remember the style of it but overall it was nice classy borderline fancy
Stumbled on this and what a happy hour find. Been there several times. On our "always list" along with GW Fins. Raw oysters by the dozen, yum!!

Great food and excellent prices for a higher end restaurant.   The give you a lot of food on appetizers we got.:  onion tart.  Brussels sprouts and beet salad.   We were pretty full before entrees came    Soft shell crab blt excellent and came with great fries.   Gumbo and etoufe also tasty.   Service a little spotty but it was a crazy busy night

My wife made reservations at Luke's for my birthday evening.  It was Saturday evening and the place was full. 
Tip: always come here with reservations.  The place does get full very quickly.
We arrived on time and got our seat for 2. They greeted us with champagne glasses on the house for my birthday. What a great way to welcome. We ordered stuffed oysters and rabbit pate plate. Oysters were mind blowing. Best I have had ever. Pate just nailed it. The food presentation and quantity both hit the spot. We got full with just 2 apps. And decided to go directly to desserts. They had limited option so we decided to skip anything sweet to cut calories. But. To our surprise they got us bread pudding with ice cream and a small chocolate wishing "Happy Birthday ". Really neat gesture. Completely unexpected. 
Overall, we had a great time and enjoyed amazing food and service. Ambience of the place is classy so make sure to dress up.
It was a busy Monday night. Service was spotty. Our fries were cold and limp, the steak underdone. Drinks and oysters were good though. If you like salty food, get the shrimp and grits.
Highly recommend their fried oyster salad! The shrimp and sausage was satisfying too!

Went here while in New Orleans for the first time ever. 

Did not have reservations but they had a table for us. The matzo ball soup was the best matzo ball soup I've had in my entire life and trust me I grew up on that! The Brussel spiritus were delicious and generous portion! 

Let's talk about the raw oysters!! This was the first time in my life I've ever tasted raw oysters so I can't say if it's better than other places or not, but it was good and interesting lol, my friend who loves raw oysters claims it was delicious! 

Will definitely be back next time I'm in town :)

Just came from lunch at Luke. Ordered the cheese grits and shrimp and it was great. Nice atmosphere and courteous  service but I think the $$ rating should changed to $$$ or $$$$. Regardless of the cost I would recommend lunch or dinner here.

I must say the Shrimp and blue crab stuffed P&J Oysters were great!  Also, the French 75 cocktail which consist of cognac, lemons, and Champagne is my new favorite cocktail! This was my first visit to Luke's and they did not disappoint. While my husband was looking for shrimp and grits. I was looking for a good oyster bar and this was it!
Old school building vibe, sort of feels 1920s to me which is fun. Cool staff. Dining room is open and not best for intimate setting but good for casual business dinners with good food.

Visited this gem of a restaurant during my trip to NOLA and instantly feel in love with amazing decor, classical vibe of the place and of course with their seafood tower. I will definitely be back to Luke next time I visit

Amazing! Possibly the best place to eat in New Orleans! I have been here several times and everything I've ordered doesn't disappoint! Today I had to Luke Burger, the photo I attached doesn't even begin to do it justice. ENJOY!

I'm giving Luke 2 stars.  The food was just ok.  But the service was not what I expected at all.  Coming to my home town and seeing for myself how the staff here is Chy St crazy to me.  We had to be moved because the air condition was dripping water on my back. So not cool. I hope when I come back it will be much better.... Chow for now

I usually get the Luke Burger, but decided that it's time I tried something else AND wrote a review, so here we go!

Luke Burger (and Housemade Fries):  My wife disagrees, but I hold that this is the best burger in New Orleans.  I'm gonna qualify this by saying that for $5 less, I could get almost as much pleasure out of a Five Guys burger or a Dave's Single at Wendy's.  Take it for what it is.  The value here is in the distinctive flavors of the burger--Emmenthal cheese, SMOKED bacon, and carmelized onions.  If you can't imagine getting $5 more flavor from a burger than at Five Guys or Wendy's, then this isn't your item.  HOWEVER, it's still worth getting a side (or starter) of the Housemade Fries, cooked in duck fat and perfectly salted.  Just make sure you get to those fries sooner rather than later.  They don't sit around very well.

Fried Oysters:  OMG.  So good.  We were meeting friends at Luke for dinner this week.  We're usually on time or a few minutes early, but we arrived at 5:15 for our 5:30 reservation.  No problem.  The table was ready and waiting, so my wife and I were seated early and decided to get some discounted fried oysters since it was still happy hour.  They were delicious, and the dipping sauce was a perfect complement--creamy but light, not heavy or overly buttery, a complement of flavor that didn't override or obscure the taste and texture of the oysters.

Crispy Brussels Sprouts:  Our friends arrived and we got another starter of Crispy Sprouts.  Crispy is the correct adjective, and not burned--a wonderful texture that was rounded out with a fruity-sweet honey sauce and toasted sliced almonds.  This is happening again the next time we go.  (That's the theme of this review..."again...next time...")

Fried Oyster Salad:  This is where we lose a star.  Loved the oysters.  There wasn't a SINGLE leaf of wilted greens in the whole salad (yes, I'm that guy that rifles through his salad and tosses anything that even looks like it might have been crushed or wilted), but the bacon was too smokey for this use.  It's delicious on the burgers but not so much in the salad.  I read other reviews that said the same thing--too smokey or too much bacon (not possible)--but didn't believe them.  It's not too MUCH bacon, but there was definitely too much smoke (in total) in my salad.  That's such a devil's dilemma for me because I don't want to toss any of my blessed bacon, but there it is: too much smoke.  I (almost) ate it all, and regretted it when I was eating dessert 20 minutes later with smoke flavor still in my mouth.  I would say half the amount of bacon would be perfect, but my rule is, "if you have to ask for changes, you should probably order something else or go somewhere else."

Crawfish Bisque:  mmmmmmmm.  So good.  Smooth with kernels of corn for texture.  What I SHOULD have ordered was a whole bowl of this instead of only a cup on the side of the Oyster Salad.  Next time...

Dark Chocolate Torte:  I had a bad experience with chocolate cake as a child, so I tend to avoid it.  This was a happy exception to my rule, thanks to my wife.  It came on the plate with a ball of coconut sorbet, both of which were silky smooth on the palate, and garnished with tons of toasted sliced almonds.  The cake is small--the size of a hockey puck--so if you have "plenty of room for dessert," I recommend that you NOT share this one--you could end up like Gollum when there's two spoons going for the last bite:  "That's MY PRECIOUS!!"

Bon Appetit!

Fantastic, had a business dinner here with 12, and the food was top notch!  I had Oysters, they were week made, and set up perfectly.

We had multiple apps, all were fantastic.

The service was better than the food, and the food was above 5stars.  I will take my wife here when we are back for vacation, and she will be blown away.

The desserts were crazy, huge and everything seemed to be cooked to order, like it was baked that minute, really unbelievable.  

Can't say enough about this place.
Great restaurant. I went during a business trip. Staff was friendly, service was fast, and food was fantastic.

Was let down by this place.  Our first NOLA experience 5/12/19 and chose Luke's. First off the fried oyster's were delicious!  Highly recommend them.  My entree of Jumbo Shrimp En Cocotte was good but lacking in portion size as well as the sausage.  The cheesy grits, shrimp and broth were very good.  My gf ordered the blue crab blt and i gotta say it was NOT GOOD.  It looked like a mess! Miniscule amount of crab except for the shell on top of the mess. The bacon was GREY and the whole entree was as if a kid made it.  Not sure why it show's two dollar signs for expense because it is fairly expensive.  Might give it another try..l but overall wasn't impressed for such an expensive place.
Delicious Cajun cuisine in an elegant old fashioned venue. Reasonable prices, good service. Be sure to make reservations during popular hours.

Food--the quality of the food was 5 stars but it was difficult to find something that I felt like ordering.  The menu felt disjointed.  I would recommend knowing what you want before going here.  Soft shelled crab open sandwich was excellent, Brussel sprouts excellent, bisque was excellent, and of course the oysters were solid.

Service--good

Ambiance--nice restaurant was nice, clean, sleek, but also cold and basic.  

Although the food was good and I would recommend this restaurant, it was not good enough to make me come back when visiting New Orleans in the future.
Everything was fabulous, but the one thing that stood out among the rest were the fried brussel sprouts.  Awesome wine list, great service, impeccable cuisine.

Had a reservation for 8:30, quickly seated. Only place that i will eat Brussel sprouts! Delicious!
Loved Jalapeño grits. Beet salad was incredible tasty! 
Bread pudding a must! Pomegranate mixed drink was delicious until server suggested we stir. He was wrong. Extremely biter. Moved to French 75 after.. much better.
Very nice outpost. Friendly and attentive waitstaff. The raw oysters are great. An excellent fine dining choice.

Ok I've heard it over and over. Luke Luke Luke. Y'all their happy hour is off the hook! We had specialty cocktails that are stout on the alcohol but not overpowering the original design of the drink. The food! P&J Oysters raw .75 and a half dozen perfectly seasoned and fried in a light tasty batter for $7.50.  You can also order off the menu and we did. Hot Buttered Crawfish Bread. It's absolutely perfect. Big thick slices of French bread with a healthy slab of Burrata and then covered with a savory buttery crawfish laden sauce. The Smoked Redfish Rillette was another gorgeous surprise a creamy light smoky fish dip that has a briny vinegar based chow chow on top. It's paired with thin slices of French baguettes. 

The service is impeccable. Tristan and Savannah were our servers. Tristan was knowledgeable and not afraid to be an ambassador for the restaurant and its offerings. Savannah was prompt and completely attentive. 

If you haven't been for their 7 day a week Happy Hour with half price specialty cocktails and oyster specials you're missing the out. It was a perfect way to have dinner and drinks!!

Had a three course meal here. The baked oysters were my favorite appetizer. I hate the steak cooked rare as an entree and the dark chocolate cake for dessert. I enjoyed the meal here, was not too loud and our waitress, Samantha, was very kind and helpful. Great place to go out on date or have dinner with friends.

Had a great happy hour here. Great, strong drinks and excellent bites. This was the first place I've been where I actually really liked the fried oysters--usually they have an odd, mealy texture for me. A little pricey but worth the quality. Would go again.

We came here for the oyster happy hour, and I think that's the only thing this place is really good for. I had gotten half a dozen raw and half a dozen fried. Both were good. However, any of their other food is generic and forgettable. For the price of the happy hour, the place is not bad, oysters were fine (I think I preferred the fried, though usually raw is my jam), and the drinks were strong enough. However, I didn't care much for the gruff persona of our server, or how quickly they would disappear. We weirdly had two servers, yet somehow it was hard to flag either down. It's not on my return list, but I wouldn't say no if others wanted to go.

If I ever find myself on death row, the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" will be what I'll be fantasizing about for my last meal. Really, everything is delicious and I know it's been said to death but do stop by and take advantage of their happy hour oyster special. So delicious, and the oysters are absolutely massive.

The oysters and alligator dishes are amazing, the service was really good, compared to other places in town a little more pricey and usual but still worth it, the 75 drink is really good and the desserts are absolutely amazing.

Great spot to grab food. We came here for breakfast, so i can't speak to dinner, but their breakfast was very good and worth going back for!

Will definitely come back for dinner when we are back in town

Luke was a great find in the Hilton hotel. We tried brunch and were very happy with the results. We ordered the Boudin Benedict and crispy chicken biscuit. The boudin Benedict was a huge portion and very tasty-the best part is you get to choose how much hollandaise sauce you want to pour. The crispy chicken biscuit was very tasty with a Tabasco honey and delicious grits.

We arrived in New Orleans, Louisiana (NOLA) last Thursday afternoon the 23rd of May, 2019 for the Memorial Day long weekend. After a long road trip we were keen to get some food and try some local cuisine. We came across this restaurant Luke which was attached to our hotel. They have happy hour every day from 3-6pm on drinks and some of the seafood too. Bonus! We ordered a dozen of the P&J Raw Oysters at 75c each, 6 lightly fried Oysters and the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" with roasted jalapeño cheese grits, andouille and green onion sausage. All of these meals were shared between the two of us and the waiter was nice enough to have the Louisiana Shrimp dish plated into two individual servings as it's very filling. Overall we had a great dining experience at Luke, the atmosphere and service was fantastic also great value and very impressive food.
Platinum Best lunch experience and food heaven!  Very satisfied, so delicious, great wait staff, impeccable service and over the top delicious entrees!  Recommended 5 star!

First , I was in New Orleans over the memorial day week, so as always I asked the locals. I was told to go to happy hour at Luke since I was staying in the hilton hotel that was easy its attached to the hotel. Onto the food the oysters (pj) raw were so good and at 75 cents a piece made them even better. Also upon recommendation from my server I tried oysters stuffed with crab and shrimp and the were delicious also. The staff were very welcoming and attentive.

Really great food, really great service. I came with a semi-large party and had a very pleasant experience. I'd highly recommend Luke - their prices are reasonable for their portions and the restaurant has a really nice feel. An interesting change of pace from many other downtown restaurants, but a welcome one!

I came here with a group of 5 people for dinner on a Saturday night.  This is my favorite restaurant to get oysters in New Orleans.  They also have fresh and great tasting seafood in general.  They have a great happy hour (3pm-6pm) where they have 75 cent oysters and half off drinks.  We ordered the small seafood platter (shrimp, clams, mussels, oysters, tuna tartare), hot buttered crawfish bread, stuffed P & J oysters (stuffed with shrimp and crab), fried oyster and bacon salad, and brussel sprouts side.  All the dishes were delicious.  My favorite dish was the stuffed P&J oysters.  Their gulf oysters were enormous and very juicy.  Service was excellent, very attentive and fast.  Our waiter was so nice and gave us champagne and Brendan's bread pudding dessert on the house since it was my bachelorette weekend.  If I ever return to New Orleans, I'll definitely be back!

Happy Hour! The oysters are fresh and delicious. I mean, they're worth it even if you don't get them in the 'happy hour' window but if you do, that's just an extra perk :) Service was friendly and attentive, even when the floor was packed because many were seeking refuge from the storm! Great vibes all around

Amazing from start to finish. Try the étouffée and the Brussels sprouts. The oysters are so fresh and sweet and the service is amazing, drinks are amazing, and the food is so so amazing. The waiter also printed us a recipe for the Brussel sprouts to make at home. Thoroughly impressed.

Luke's is my favorite restaurant in New Orleans. The everyday happy hour from 3-6 is amazing!They also take reservations on Open Table, which is extremely convenient. This place is awesome for solo diners since they have a bar that overlooks the shucking station.

Great dinner at the bar since I was solo. Excellent Serbians food was great except my ribeye was a little too chill by the time it got to me. That's the only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars. Definitely will be back!

I went here Sunday instead of going to the oyster festival since it was so hot outside and I'm glad I did. Luke has happy hour on Sunday's from 3-6PM. I went for happy hour and it was such a treat. The happy hour menu is pretty good. I settled for some P&J raw oysters which were priced at 75 cents. They were huge just the way I like them. Cocktails were half off so I got 2 French 75's. The drink was so good and it was served in a big glass with 75 written in it. I think they may use egg white in the French 75, which gave it a nice texture. I also had the blue crab gratin, which I recommend. The boudin balls came with a tangy sauce that paired well with the balls, since they were a little dry. The service was excellent and the ambiance was relaxing. I definitely will go here again for happy hour.
I LOVE MEAT BUTTER!!!!!!! And the oysters were devine!!! If im ever in NO again i will defintly go again

Showed up 45 minutes before they closed with a group of 6 and we still got amazing service! Tristan was our server and did an amazing job! Food was amazing, and I feel we spoiled ourselves for the rest of our trip, as this was the first place we tried!

To top it off, we were in NOLA celebrating my brother's 21st birthday and they surprised us with some amazing bread pudding!

Really awesome meal. The crispy Brussels sprouts were by far my favorite thing. The chili paste added the perfect kick. The fried oyster salad was yummy with the oysters just right. And the bread pudding was heavenly. Great rum sauce and the toasted nuts made it. Richie was a fantastic server and went the extra step to make the experience great.

I had the burger on my first trip and it accidentally went to someone else, so I had to wait a little longer- they were far more upset than I was and gave me the burger for free. The next day I went in and the manager personally waited on me- I had the etouffee, it was delicious!

Service was above and beyond! Very welcoming for a traveler and I highly recommend.
I see why they call it Luke's..... everything was LUKE WARM. Waste of money and time. Food tasted like it was cooked 2 days ago. I could of made a better breakfast with 1 arm tied behind my back.

Went for breakfast.  Food was expertly cooked and delicious.  BLTAE. Seriously the bacon and eggs were perfectly cooked.  The tomato and avocado were ripe.  Let's be honest, you usually get some elements right but nobody hits all five.  Luke frappe great balanced espresso cocktail. So many times you are like ugh the liquor overpowers the coffee.  Not here.  And last but not least... side of grits.  I didn't need to.  The sandwich was enough but I had a craving.  And it was not a mistake.  Fluffy and creamy.  Texture not at all gritty (sorry).

Bartenders are really friendly and nice. Had the Saison named Desire, Salad Luke, and half dozen Gulf shrimp. The salad Luke is a great salad for salad lovers -- chock full of a variety of vegetables including tomatoes, beets, and I believe it was orange segments. I was really glad I ordered it! My friend got the oysters which are a good deal during happy hour. She said they weren't chewy at all (unlike most oysters she's had).

Made reservations at Luke tonight with some co-workers for a nice authentic Louisiana meal. Awesome vibe and great drinks while waiting to be seated. 
Ordered a variety of appetizers consisting of P&J oysters,  crispy brussel sprouts, and cheesy jalapeño grits. All I can say is "wow". Really fresh and delicious apps. The cheesy grits were by far the best I've ever had; creamy, cheesy, and delicious. 
The brussel sprouts were very good, though a bit on the sweet side and had a nice bbq type flavor.
The oysters were awesome. Big, fresh, and delicious with some really spicy horseradish! 
As we waited for our entrees, the manager came out and provided a complimentary appetizer of which I cannot remember the name, but was a thin crust type pizza with amazing blend of cheeses, artichoke, onion, pesto; UNBELIEVABLE! 
Meals arrived and were all truly outstanding. My crawfish ettoufee was really great, the rice was crispy, loaded with crawfish, TONS of flavor. Others got the ribeye and raves about it, redfish, and shrimp gumbo. 
Desserts were totally awesome. Bread pudding was rich and decadent with fresh vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce, pecans. Lemon meringue pie was great as well.
Overall just AWESOME food and service.
Really great spot, clean, great service and food quality! Decent value for the area, nice vibe.

I was in the New Orleans area and was looking for an oyster spot. It was around 3 so I had a couple happy hour places that I was looking at. Initially, I heard good things about this place so I decided to check them out. When I first walked in, I was greeted by the front and was immediately sat down. There was a lot of seating and it was not too pack given it was a weekday and an odd time. Upon sitting, I see a waiter bring around some of the biggest and fattest oysters I have ever seen in my life. When he came to our table, he explained which oysters were on the happy hour menu and that they were only 75 cents! My mind was still in awe on the huge oysters so I asked him what types of oysters those were. He told me those were the on the happy hour menu and I knew right away I was going to like this place.

My party of four ordered 3 dozens and were patiently waiting as they were getting shucked. We were able to see the chefs shuck them from our table which made the food more appealing. They came out pretty quickly and they were finished just as quicked. My group devoured these oysters. They were amazing! The first oysters I have the area were amazing and set the standard very high. They were so juicy and creamy. Also for 75 cents is a price you cannot beat. The service was great and the place was very clean. Overall a 5-star experience. If you are in the area and love oysters, check Luke's out!

Luke has been on my go to try list for a very long time and I'm glad to finally have it crossed off my list because I probably won't be back LOL. I made it during happy hour which oysters are 75 cents a piece. Normally I would go to superior because it's 50 cents but I wanted to try out Luke's oysters and oh boy oh boy! I have never had an oyster that tasted like grass. It was nasty but I tried to drown it in Tabasco sauce but you could still taste the grass in the oysters. I ordered the crawfish bread, gumbo, stuffed oysters( server recommended it) and Brussels sprouts. Food came out really fast. Alrighty so the crawfish bread. Hmmmm it was tasteless and room temperature. I didn't know what to expect but I thought it would come out piping hot. I asked the server and she took it back to reheat the dish. Well instead of room temperature it was warm. At least they tried. The gumbo was thick. Thick like slime. One bite and I was done. The stuffed oysters were recommended so I was very excited to try. But man I was disappointed! It had so flavor whatsoever and what made it worse was the texture. Just a bunch of mush in my mouth. $14 for four oysters. I ate one and my bf ate one. The rest we didn't even touch. The only good thing were the Brussels sprouts. Server was nice though. She took off the crawfish bread even though she didn't have to. But overall my experience was mediocre.

I came in on a Sunday and was glad to see it was busy but not too busy to where I would have to wait.

Food: We had a dozen oysters and those were very fresh and just the right size! Not too big and not too small. They have some of the best shrimp n grits and I love their ribeye and fries! The price is great for the amount of food. They also offer happy hour oysters and fried pb&j oysters.
Hidden gem in New Orleans id say some of the best food i have had there! Staff is super friendly and professional! The Brussels are a must have!!

Had a great experience at Luke's on Friday night. The P&J oysters and shrimp prepared by Phil was amazing. I followed it up with the Louisiana Crawfish Étouffée which was delectable, especially the crunchy rice combination with the crawfish. Highly recommend!
What a great meal.   The waitstaff was on par.   Had an absolute blast and lovely meal.  Thank you!

Every time I come to New Orleans, I come here. If you can get in for the happy hour, that's the best bet but even if you miss it, it's worth coming here. The French 75 cocktail is the best I've ever had! We also love the oysters, they are always very fresh. My partner had the fried oyster salad which he loved. Everything we see that comes out of the kitchen looks appetizing.  Try it, you will not be disappointed!

This was the fanciest place we've been to so far in NOLA. Prices were a little high but well worth it. For starters, we ordered the raw oysters & the stuffed oysters which were stuffed with shrimp & crabmeat. For entree we ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp to share. For dessert we ordered the bread pudding with pecans & vanilla ice cream. Everything was delicious & fresh. Would go again for oysters.

We were seated immediately with a reservation. The food was good, but there are lots of places for good seafood in New Orleans. Despite having two servers I felt like there were long periods of waiting to order, waiting for our drinks, waiting for the plates to be cleared. For the price, I just wanted more.

A friend of mine has constantly raved about how great Luke is. Well, I finally had the opportunity to taste it for myself today at lunch. Every weekday they have an express lunch which is $17 and includes a side salad or soup of the day and a daily entree. I opted for that she opted for the bowl of gumbo, another friend had the Luke burger which was huge and we split the stuffed oysters. 
During lunch, the stuffed oysters come as an order of 4 served on a bed of sea salt. 
The lunch menu offered a really nice variety of Southern delicacies, German dishes and a raw seafood bar, and all dishes are prices between $11-$25. 
I opted for the Express lunch and Monday's special is red beans and rice with honey fried chicken. The chicken was 2 huge pieces of filet breasts. Soo good, and just a touch of honey.  
Overall everyone enjoyed their meal, and I can't wait to come back to try everything on the menu for both lunch and dinner because everything looks delicious! 
Since it's on St Charles, there is no street parking or valet service. There are a few hotel parking garages nearby that is open to the public and accessible on the streetcar line.

This was very mediocre in my opinion! The service was just okay, the courses were way too spread out, and the food was very okay. For what we spent, I can think of a hundred other restaurants I would have rather gone to.
It was good, but for the amount of reviews and ratings I expected better. The Crawfish bisque is something I really recommend!
Absolutely delicious.  We've been here several times and have always had a great meal and pretty good service. Highly recommend the Brussels!

FINALLY got a chance to try this Yelp icon! I can absolutely say it was worth the wait!! The dining room is split into two rooms separated by the Hilton Hotel Entryway. Even though there are a number of tables, make a reservation by calling or on Open Table. There is not a link on Yelp, so we were lucky to get worked in by the very friendly understanding host. 
The restaurant was beautifully decorated in New Orleans Coastal style decor and the ambiance was lively yet refined. 
The small details around the restaurant really add charm. Like the fresh seafood bar and the open kitchen views. 
So appearance was beautiful and service was too notch, but let's talk about food!
For an app we ordered the Blue Crab Gratin, a suggestion from our server. It was the perfect suggestion, we almost ate the whole thing!
Dinner didn't fall short of perfect! We ordered the Gulf Puppy Drum blackened w a side salad the Fried Oyster Salad with homemade fries. That side I will get the Drum next visit, I'm still dreaming about it lol. 
If you want a light meal, the Roasted Beet Salad was fine! 

I recommend everything we ordered!!!

Savannah was our server tonight. She was gracious, professional and knowledgeable. Gary gave us the excellent recommendation for the bread pudding. Best I've ever had!! We are in town for a conference and fell upon this restaurant. I had the fried oyster salad and it was AMAZING!! I highly recommend!
Everything was delicious !!! Oysters , shrimp , and the Bread pudding was the best !!! The service was better thanks to Kris and Mike !!

Every year, 
John Besh brings out the best of himself whenever he throws his Marine Corps Birthday on every November 10th. 
I would go to his restaurant when not going to every annual Marine Corps Birthday Bash and id still love the way the restaurant Luke, conducts business.

What a lovely spot! Bright and quiet-a great place for a business lunch. The croque monsieur was so good - covered with a thick crusted cream and made on bread that was a little sweet and super thick slices. The Brussels sprouts are the best I think I've ever had -not greasy or overloaded, and cooked to perfection.
I was not disappointed. My cocktail was good and my meal was good. Ordered the soft shell crab. Delicious!!! Will come back.

Went here on a friend's suggestion for happy hour. Went for the happy hour oysters. The oysters were 75 cents each. They just tasted okay. I wouldn't come back again because I'd rather pay more for better tasting oysters. Also got the brussel sprouts. Those were really good but after a while the sauce they have on them started to taste too sweet.  Didn't get to try any of the other food.

Based on my research and my experience here last week, this has to be a top 5 happy hour spot in New Orleans!  3-6pm. 75 cent raw oysters. $1.25 fried oysters. Half price beers, cocktails, and some wines I believe. Cocktails are tremendous. Nice beer list. Oysters were delicious. I ate my very first raw oysters here, so it'll always have a place in my heart. Got some coaching from the friendly bartender. Fried oysters were amazing. They come with a spicy ranch sauce, but if you ask, you may be able to get some remoulade, which the oyster guys told us we needed to try. 

I know there's plenty of reviews about the happy hour here, but it can't be recommended enough. Beautiful restaurant that offers a cozy spot to spend the mid afternoon sipping quality drinks and enjoying top notch oysters. This is a must try.

Holy shucks. It looks like I've found my go-to place for happy hour. My boyfriend and I came on a Friday around 5 pm for happy hour (happy hour is from 3-6 everyday) and were seated immediately to our surprise. They don't have an official happy hour menu so you just got to ask what the specials are. 75 cents raw oysters, half price off their cocktails, drafts and wines. What an amazing deal. 

My boyfriend ordered the Ruston smash cocktail to drink and enjoyed it. I had the door three and thought it was refreshing with just the right amount of vodka. 

For apps, we had the brussel sprouts. MUST GET! You won't regret it. We also ordered a dozen raw oysters and half a dozen fried oysters. Oysters were fresh and soft. Best oysters I've had thus far in NOLA. Fried oysters were cooked to perfection.

In addition to the amazing food, the service here is outstanding. Our server's name was Richie Rich and he was very personable and attentive. Very nice guy. I'd definitely ask for him again when I come next week and the week after that. 
Honestly if I could give this place more than 5 stars I would.

We were staying at the Intercontinental Hotel and right across the street was Luke's. Walked by it several times going here and there . On our last day were we in between lunch and dinner and decided to stop in to have a drink and grab some bar food. Left two hours later and couldn't tell you how great a time we had . First off we sat at the bar and the guys behind the bar were just fabulous. We arrived at happy hour which they have every day as this was a Saturday. All signature  cocktails half price and .75 cent oysters. So we started  with a dozen and wished we had order more but be careful of the horse radish it is great but super strong just as I like it . Had a bowl of gumbo half price again and several more items that I can't even remember . All in all we had a great time the Service was spot on and food great. Ended up with bread pudding with ice cream a great way to finish. Will never make dinner but we ate at more restaurants then I can remember  during our stay but Luke's for a semi casual but up scale eatery was for me as good as most and if you hit happy hour it's pound for pound better then the rest

This place is a MUST if you're in the area. The BEST crab dip and crawfish soup. We stayed at the Hilton property and decided we might as well try it since we were starving. It was so good that even on our second trip we went out of our way to eat here. The best French 75 in all of New Orleans and for all of us who aren't familiar with boudin...try it here!!

Came for coffee and bread pudding!  Did not disappoint

Delish!! Also appreciate Tim's kindness and friendliness!
We had a great server and experience - thanks, Tre!!  Food was excellent. Drinks excellent. Price is high but worth a splurge.

So, the wife and I just checked in at the Jung Hotel and we are starving and I ask my man Delfo what's good around here ....he chuckles what do you like, try the seafood, he gives us a number of restaurants but writes down a couple more and Luke was one of them. The wife and I take the 15 min walk (which was nice ) and we walk in to the Luke and were seated , the place is fairly busy. Julian is our waiter and l ask what's this dish ( pointing to a picture on Yelp), he says it's shrimp and grits with crabmeat, so I order two, one for me the other for the Mrs., I'm not that greedy people.
  Our dishes come out and I think the wife died and went to heaven, after the first bite she says " Oh my God this is delicious" and after repeating that a few more times during the meal, I think she definitely enjoyed it, and by the way she doesn't like much. I have to say it was very delicious, didn't skimp on shrimp, and the grits were definitely not instant. There was a snafu on on my P&J oysters,but my main man Julian corrected the issue and all was well....This is a spot I will definitely return to when in the Big Easy, thanks for the great service.....P.S. try the oysters......I see you Julian.

When we visit the city, Luke is always our 1st stop for happy hour. Best oysters, raw or fried. The Brussels sprouts are to die for. Also great hand crafted cocktails. We've always had great service. It can be a little noisy but that's just everyone having a great time!

Always the best happy hour that I've been to in New Orleans.  Half priced beer, wine and specialty cocktails plus $0.75 raw oysters and $1.25 fried oysters.  Overall a fairly small dinner menu, but everything that I have had has been amazing.  Make sure to try the baked jalapeño cheesy grits and the crispy potatoes.  

The wait staff and bar staff are equally fun and attentive.  If you can get a seat st the bar, grab it, but during happy hour, you will more likely be standing at bar or sat at a table.

One of the best restaurants in New Orleans. After our second visit, I can say overall it is top notch. The waitstaff is attentive, prompt and friendly. On this most recent visit, our waiter, Rich, was fantastic. 

The food is fresh and delicious. I had fresh oysters, which are 75 cents each during happy hour. My girl had the king crab and while I didn't eat it, it looked great and she said it was phenomenal. The drinks, also on happy hour, were generous in booze and tasty. For dessert, we had the bourbon peaches and cream cake, which I highly recommend. 

We'll definitely return on our next visit to the city.

On a business trip - great location. 

Had the small seafood platter (not small) it's amazing
Really great service - sat at the bar 

Wine and cocktail list great 
They have three options - glass/carafe/bottle 

Had a carafe and was able to sample an of world and new world wine selection 

For sure a nice spot to catch some fresh Louisiana bites

I stopped in here based off of the Yelp reviews and mention of awesome happy hour. I walked in and there were three young girls at the hostess stand. After asking for a table for one since there was no room at the bar I was questioned, "how many"? After explaining I was just stopping in for a drink and app I was ushered away from the main dining area which had plenty of seats. I asked if I could sit in the main dining area and was told "this will be fine for you". 

I was seated by the kitchen, this ended up being great, the kitchen staff was clean and working hard.

I waited a few minutes for my waiter, asked about the drinks and was given water. My drink was quite tasty, a speciality cocktail with champagne that. Y server recommended.

I decided on grits for my app as they sounded amazing. They came out fast, one bite and they were warm at best. I waited a few minutes for my server and asked if he could warm them up. I also requested more water as mine had been empty for a while. He was super nice about both requests.

My grits came out a few minutes later (fresh cast iron dish) and they were bubbling over, nice and hot. I wasn't given a new plate or utensils, one I got these I was able to DIG in! They did not disappoint! The chef came over to make sure they were hot enough and I assured him they were amazing. My only regret is I didn't try the tasty French bread I was offered and declined.

During my dining experience I noted my server standing in the back corner chatting with co-workers and laughing. He was very nice, not the most attentive but very nice.

The table next to me ordered a burger and it was so huge they so huge they spilt it. The presentation was beautiful and I could tell they greatly enjoyed it. 

Another table ordered the Brussels sprouts that looked to DIE for! Bowls of gumbo that they raved about, soft shell crab and etoufee. 

Would I come back again? Likely not, there are just too many other places to try while I am here.
Salad, soup, and oysters were a perfect hit for lunch. Just down the street from all the huddle and bustle. If you want to escape it a little. We enjoyed our meal.

I had high expectations based on reviews for this place. The service (in my opinion) was NOT good although we were assigned 2 different people (Kevin and Chi). Every time we had a question or needed something we had to flag them down. Odd, it was a Tuesday and not overly crowded. The crab bisque was amazing. However, they served a cup when we asked for a bowl. Quickly rectified this though and served us a bowl.
The baked oysters were good, the pasta I absolutely would do without. I wouldn't revisit, it's not worth the money to deal with LESS THAN GREAT service and okay food.

Great happy hour with 75 cent oysters! Excellent beer selection and really wonderful Gumbo! Get there early for happy hour as the place can fill up in a hurry!

We will be back next year!

They had the best menu during our trip to New Orleans. The shrimp and grits was absolutely amazing! The staff were light hearted and so welcoming. They made great suggestions and everything was perfect. The crab and cheese appetize was absolutely delicious. I wish I had more time while I was here to stop there again.

When I am out of town during the week I make it a goal of mine to find the best place in town for happy hour and boy did I find it.  From the hours of 4 to 6 you can come to this wonderful location and enjoy $.75 raw oysters or 1.25 fried (sold by half dozen) and they accept reservations!!

Upon arrival this place was not nearly as crowded as I had expected it to be which is why I had originally made a reservation which was not needed.  We were seated by the Kinde staff and immediately told about the happy hour specials and drink specials (half off cocktails). The staff was very patient with us when we were trying to decide what we wanted to eat and we received our food within 10 minutes of ordering.

I cannot remember the name of my drink but it was some type of jalapeño drink that was way harder than I was prepared for it to be LOL but it was still tasty. The Oyster's both raw and fried were made to perfection and they provided you with plenty of different sauces and seasonings to flavor your oysters. Overall we got 4 raw oysters, two bowls of gumbo, a half dozen fried oysters, and two drinks all for about $42. Would definitely co

Things started well but we were behind a large party so there was a very long delay between appetizers and entrees.  They made up for it with 3 exceptional comped desserts. (The bread pudding was the best I have ever had). 

Baked oysters were outstanding.  The fried oyster salad was also really good.  

Shrimp and grits were delicious.  

Service was attentive and would have been great if not for the delays.

Good service and great food. We were seated promptly, even though we arrive :30 early. Food cake promptly and piping hot. Everything was to our liking and service delivered. Wouldn't hesitate to visit again.

Luke's was good especially the Happiest Hour! I think the happy hour starts at 3p. They have some drink specials and specials on the raw and fried oysters! However my bill by myself still ended up over $50! Oh maybe because of this awesome Cognac/champagne drink they make. But I enjoyed the happy hour and food and drinks and will
Be back! Btw TD Jakes came to dine while I was there and I was able to shake his hand. It was a honor to meet him and he was very pleasant to meet!

Food was delicious!  Don't miss the jalapeño grits!  I had the Cochon de Lait Pressed Sandwich it was big enough that I took half home with me.  My husband ordered from the express menu and really enjoyed the Jambalaya and bisque.  


We went during the week around 2:00 and were sat immediately at a table.  There were several other open tables available.
Great place with great service! They prepare the oysters right in front of you at the bar. Great staff and highly recommended! Best happy hour in town!

Thoroughly enjoyed a respite of oysters, tuna tartare, rabbit & chicken liver pate and brussels sprouts and the service was exceptional.  In a city where there are more touristy venues than legit ones, this place rates a "we'll be back"!

We walked in like clowns, so of course the hostess and servers were more playful than I would normally expect.  We got the last table in the back corner.  Oh well, it was National Oyster Day, where Luke offered $0.75 oysters.  They were shucked very well and arranged as normal on a bed of ice.  No issues.  The martinis were dirty as requested along with my requested 3 blue cheese stuffed olives.  It was strange though that my  friend said she didn't care on the number of olives and got only one olive.  I would expect at least two.  Later we saw the hostess snacking on the olives and realized that there was probably only those 4 left.  Anyways, great time, the volume of a full restaurant wasn't so overpowering.  The service was excellent.  I will definitely come back for a regular meal.  Boom!

Decided to stop in to have appetizers and drinks, little did we know we walked into a great happy hour. The service was great and everyone was very friendly.  Our servers were very informative and personable. The Ruston Smash cocktail was amazing. My husband really enjoyed the door#three cocktail. The best part was happy hour included half off cocktails, beers, wines and 75 cents raw oysters and 1.25 fried oysters. You can't beat that! The stuffed P&J oysters were so delicious. We didn't try the Brussels sprouts appetizer, but it seem to be very popular as most of the other tables were ordering it. We were sitting next to this gentleman that was from out of town and he stated "I waited two years to come back here to eat."  He couldn't stop talking about how much he loved it. The ambience and service over all was top notch. Would highly recommend and will definitely be going back.

Although the food was truly exceptional at Luke, I must say what made both our two evenings at this restaurant was our server David. Truly, should you come to this restaurant (and you really, really should!), get David as your server! He has the perfect recommendations on food to try (our first time in New Orleans, so we needed to narrow down all the tantalizing delicacies), and is quite possibly the kindest and sweetest person I have ever met! Not to mention the perfect service on top of all that! Should you wish to have some amazing food to accompany this superior service, I would highly recommend the boudin balls, the fresh oysters, the shrimp and jalapeño grits, the fresh fish...if your mouth isn't watering yet, it should be! All of the food at Luke was delicious. A must-go when visiting New Orleans!

Extra great service from arrival to departure. Love a waiter that has a favorite dish and is willing to give an honest review of the dishes rather than "everything is good."
The heirloom tomato salad was not for us, but the brussel sprouts are a definite- yes!!!  Really nicely roasted with excellent full flavor. 
I had the shrimp n grits with crab on top- OMG, the grits are just absolutely amazing. As in slap yourself amazing- 
My friend had the burger (minus the bun) and said it was delicious. 
We ended with the carrot cake- there are few words to explain how truly sublime the brownie like carrot cake was- my gluten free friend couldn't help herself but have some it was that good. Just WOW!

This food is amazing! Eat here.  This ended our culinary journey of new Orleans royalty including: john besh, Emeril Lagasse, Paul Prudhomme, I've visited several before, but not in succession.   Straight up comparisons where possible were done.  
Here we had the following: 
Boudin balls
Pate
Crab bisque 
Pork schnitzel 
Shrimp etouffee 
Watermelon sorbet 
Lemon torte 
The pate and accoutrements were flawless and a major standout. I was soooooo happy I could have eaten it alone e for dinner.  My companion who "hates liver why should I taste it"  really liked it and ate an entire country crouton alone with a little brown mustard. 
I preferred the pepper jam with mine.  Adventure forth and try things here you've previously disliked John and his crew can make a shoe taste good with a bic lighter! 
Best etouffee I've ever had.
I personally prefer Emeril's boudin balls. See my review of Emeril's for specifics. 
I will never eat at K Paul's again. The management is suspect.  The food poorly prepared and served BLATANTLY untrained.  See my review of Paul's for details.   
The food and service from Emeril's and John's Luke are a close race and personal tastes come into play.  Both are worth your money and time from experience.   Follow me to enjoy my other reviews from around the country.

The first time I came here was in December 2018, and my mom and I absolutely enjoyed our meal. We came here specifically for their 75 cent oyster happy hour. I'm not a fan of raw oysters myself, but my mom absolutely loved the oysters at Luke. Juicy, sweet, super clean, and big! The service was also impeccable as well. I came back to New Orleans in August 2019 and my mom and I decided to bring the rest of our family here since our first visit was so amazing. Big mistake! 

Now, I know August isn't the prime time to eat raw oysters, but we went ahead and ordered a half dozen anyway. Our waitress brought a platter of NINE oysters that were DARK BROWN and looked SHRIVELED. I wish I had taken a picture. It was super unappetizing to look at it. Now, there's two things here that I don't understand: 1) How did the guy shucking oysters behind the bar think it was okay to send that out? 2) How did the waitress think it was okay to serve that? Clearly, no one was paying any attention at all to their jobs... Never mind the fact that the oysters were terribly dark and dried out, but there were 9. You can't even order that amount (has to be in half-dozen increments only). 

Wanting to be polite, we immediately flagged down our waitress and pointed out that we had ordered 6 (we didn't mention the dark discoloration). She looked at it, and realized that indeed, there were 9 instead of 6 oysters, maybe to make up for the fact that "some of them were small." She then noted that hey, these oysters are sort of dark. (An understatement, but at least she addressed it.) She apologized and took the platter of oysters away, proceeding to consult with management about what to do. She ended up bringing out new oysters that were a little more decent. Now, we had also ordered a half-dozen of fried oysters... when these came out in a little fry basket, we realized that there were definitely more than 6. YUP, there were 9. Those 9 funky, gross oysters that were at our table earlier? Those just got fried and served right back to us. Not professional. You would think a nice restaurant like this wouldn't resort to cutting corners. 

That whole experience with the oysters soured our experience for the rest of the meal. Our Luke burger, which we ordered medium-rare, came out well-done. A waitress accidentally dropped a used fork on my brother's lap. On a positive note, the brussels sprouts were as good as I remembered it though. We also tried the fig flatbread & that was delicious as well.

Overall, a really disappointing experience, especially after looking forward to my return trip to Luke.

Took my mom here for dinner, and our server Julian treated us so well! He was super attentive and we felt special the whole time we were there. The food was amazing. I enjoyed the French 75 cocktail and shrimp and grits. Our apps included gumbo and the boudin balls. Very satisfied! Take a peek at the desert menu, you won't be disappointed.

Our came here on our first night in NOLA for dinner. The local oysters was fresh and yummy. It was more cheap than what we paid for in CA. We ordered small seafood platter and add half dozen of local oysters, shrimp etouffee, softshell crab, fried oysters salad and ribeye. Oysters were so fresh, the tuna poke with shrimp chip was really flavorful. Fried oysters salad was refreshing. The only dish I was happy with was the shrimp etouffee. The pasta is too doughy. Service was good and our server was attentive. Bread pudding was on the house as we were celebrating my friend's birthday.
Coolinary menu is awesome. Great place.  Frankly among the top two or three restaurants in New Orleans IMHO

I've been to New Orleans a hand full of times and feel like I've tried to tackle the best things to eat here scene so when I say I think Luke is one of, if not the best meals I've ever eaten in Nola that's pretty high praise. 

Booked a dinner rez here not really knowing if we'd keep it or not but more as a we are booked in somewhere for dinner instead of having to try to secure something last minute. 

We were staying super close which made walking over a non issue, even in dinner attire (I say this mainly for the women in heels ;) we did uber to/from our after dinner location since I wasn't in flats hahaha) back to dinner... pretty much blew my mind or shall I say palate. 

We started with a half dozen of p&j gulf raw oysters which I've never had in life so this was a game changer night from the jump. I actually really enjoyed these and would totally order them again here. I think having a "first" experience and it going this well always sets the right tone for a meal. 

We shared the most amazing bisque soup I think I've ever had which makes enjoying turtle soup and gumbo in this city nearly feel like they are only second best to Luke's bisque. 

Then it was onto the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" shrimp and grits dish and our incredible server brought the heartiest of samplers of their Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp & Crab "Étouffée" when we couldn't decide on which entree to share. 

After our dining experience the night prior and totally over ordering our server was the absolute best and understood we wanted to pace ourselves and be able to enjoy meal after meal during this trip without wasting things or having to bring meals back to our hotel fridge to sit in styrofoam. 

He steered us to the best dish to order being the shrimp and grits which is the absolute most correct answer. This dish is mind blowing with flavor in each and every single bite. The etouffee is also amazing, less flavor I'd say but the cripsy rice is one of those things you just need to experience, very yummy! 

We shared the Carrot Cake blondie sundae with cream cheese ice cream, butterscotch whiskey sauce and candied carrots, nice finishing touch to the meal. 

The service and atmosphere was perfection, really exactly what you'd want for a nice dinner out in New Orleans and even if you're a local I can see this being a great go-to option for the most yummy meal. I think what was most shocking in the very best way, was the bill... this meal was outstanding and other than us ordering a bottle of wine that cost nearly as much as our meal the price point is so reasonable for such amazing quality and service. 

Cannot wait to return and will surely recommend to anyone looking for one of the best meals in New Orleans. Luke is bar none, one of them!

My wife and I have been in New Orleans all of 4 days, but we both agree that Luke is one of the best restaurants we've ever eaten at, and for sure the best meal we've had on our first trip to Louisiana! We were taking a long walk and were deciding between Luke and Tressane (or however else it's spelled), and we're so glad the coin flip led us here.

We started off with the duck/rabbit pate and the fried boudin balls. To be honest, I still have absolutely zero idea what boudin is. Sometimes it'll be like pulled pork, other times a patty, and here it was like a fried hushpuppy or arancini, but regardless, it was still delicious! Not sure what the yellow sauce was that came with it (it was foamy and tasted like butter and mellowed out hollandaise sauce), but the sauce helped add another level to the boudin balls.

The pate was to die for. They brought out a giant jar of the stuff along with a full board of large-grain mustard, pickles, a pickled radish or some other vegetable, and two types of vegetable jams. When we ran out of crostinis (the jar is HUGE people) our waiter brought us some more bread. The pate is rich and has the lovely iron-like flavor you would find in liver dishes. Combined with the acidic and sweet flavors of the rest of the board, the pate was perfect. I would strongly recommend it, as long as you don't absolutely despise liver.

For our main course, we ordered the shrimp and grits to share, and the kitchen graciously divided the dish into two small skillets (thank god, otherwise I know my wife would have eaten more than her fair share of the plate). The shrimp were juicy, the sausages moist and full of flavor, and the grits cheesy and just bland enough balance out the strong vegetable stew/sauce that coated everything. It really was a well balanced dish and the portions were huge! I felt full even after eating just my half of the dish.

And holyyyyy cow, the bread pudding and ice cream was FANTASTIC. Probably the best part of the meal. The bread pudding is soaked in a whiskey caramel which, you'd think would be saccharine, but it was just the perfect level of sweet. If I wasn't in public, I would have licked that bowl clean.

The best shrimp and grits! I was surprised that I got delicious shrimp and grits at a hotel restaurant but they were so so good. We got another side of grits. If my memory serves me right, the grits are cheesy. We are at the bar as the restuarant was super crowded. Definitely worth stopping by if you are in New Orleans.

Nice server (think his name was Matt). We both got the chicken and waffles for brunch, my boyfriend gives the dish a 8.5/10 Id give it a 6.5/10 but that's just personal preference. It ended up being a lovely brunch! Would recommend!
