I don't have any photos of my food because the food didn't last long enough for me to take any. We went at happy hour which has an awesome deal on both fried and raw oysters. They were prepared perfectly and paired nicely with the good local craft brew. There was a full bar if that's more to your liking too. 

The environment was nice with a fancier vibe than the shorts and flip flops I was sporting, but it's August and hot and I don't think anyone cared.   The service was excellent with a tag team approach to keep things moving. I certainly recommend it to anyone looking for great oysters and great service in with nice upscale feel.

The atmosphere is cool the service was attentive without hovering over you. The food is okay. I only had dozen oysters they were good but nothing to write home about...My buddy got a burger said it was over cooked and dry his exact words were what a boring burger...I have to tip my hat to acme they have fresher oysters and they are litter on the pockets.

What's not to like about Luke?!?!? Good location, many great food options, clean, and classy restaurant. The boudin balls are amazing! Gumbo is good. I came with a group and we went with the raw seafood tower. Everything was great! Highly recommended!

I went for the steak Frits but they are only available for dinner =(..... so I went for my safe zone the burger! I have to say one of the best burgers I've ever had. Service was great, the wine selection was limited but worked, all in all a really pleasant experience btw try the pate appetizer it is amazing

Clean. Fairly quick service but was sat all the way in the very back which made us feel like only the fancy Caucasians got to sit up front. At first. 

But seriously, The service was great. The food was beautifully presented and extremely tasty.  The two of us shared four appetizers as our meal. We had more than enough to eat and our taste buds and bellies were very happy

Located within Hilton Hotel, I made a reservation via opentable app. They were busy and people were having a great time. They were a bit too loud after too few many drinks.

I asked for a quite table I saw in the back but they didn't want one person to sit there.

Server was friendly and fairly prompt.

I tried gumbo and oysters for a small dinner. Gumbo wasn't what I remembered as a traditional gumbo. I am not a gumbo expert but it wasn't what I remembered from 10 years ago.

I arrived after a happy hour but I heard they have a good happy hour menu here.

Best steak ever! So tender and juicy! I wish they had a few more food options, but I'd probably still get the steak every time. The appetizers and everything were nice too, but the steak from the steak frites definitely stood out.

The staff was friendly and attentive, and we had a local acapella group come around the tables and sing for us. It was a wonderful experience.

I was a bit disappointed!  If someone said, pick one  word to you describe your experience here?  It would be INCONSISTENT.  
I ordered the ribeye steak medium well, but it came out to me with portions of the steak well done to medium rare.  My son ordered the chicken tenders and one of the chicken tender was cold.  The raw oysters were delicious and fresh, but some had broken shell pieces in them.  The french fries were unforgettably heavily salted. Didn't expect this at all with the positive reviews I read.
The positive is that my other son did enjoy his cheeseburger and my husband's shrimp and grits were really good!  So maybe it's just a different cook who dealt with theirs?  Who knows!  But if we ever do come back to NOLA, I don't think we'll be back here to eat again.

Connected within the Hilton Hotel it was pretty easy to navigate to in the Warehouse District.

We were date immediately and given great service from beginning to end.

I order the P&J Stuffed Oysters which were light yet tasty enough for my last day in Nola. My friends had the roasted chicken and the other the Shrimp and Grits. No complaints!

The decor was great, the bathroom was easy to find and the costpoint was comparable to locations attached a Hilton $$-$$$

I would come back during happy hour. The oysters were plump and yummy.

Happy Hour Only ***

I came in on a Tuesday afternoon for their well known happy hour. They seem to be one of a few places near the French Quarter with oysters for happy hour. It was .75 per raw, $1.50 for fried. I opted for a half dozen raw and a glass of Cali Riesling. For HH food, it was only the oysters. Drinks were half off beers and domestic wines. I was hoping for half off some sides or something but there wasn't much else.

I sat by the bar since I was alone. I like that they have small TVs above the bar to view and you can watch the oysters being shucked. My bartender was nice and welcoming. I was provided the whole menu in case I wanted anything else. My table setting was made once I ordered. It was a white triangle napkin, small dish with saltine crackers and a napkin with utensils. My oysters arrived quickly after since it wasn't too busy. It came with cocktail sauce, horseradish and lemons. They were all pretty big and none were fishy. I didn't have any shells in mine but I noticed some sand grit in one.

I enjoyed the rest of my wine and another bartender  asked if I wanted anything else or more wine. I politely declined and he closed me out. I look forward to returning one day as it's hard to pass up those oyster prices!

Great food, fantastic service, lovely setting. Happy hour! Couldn't be happier! Yep this place hasn't disappointed. I don't normally really frequent the CBD, but when I do, this is a favorite spot. Great for meeting in a central location and I always suggest it. Great oysters. Great burger. Hats off to these guys.

Good happy hour special! .75 cent raw oyster ( good and plum some of the shells should have be scrubbed a little more), 1.50 fried oysters (I think it was average), half price cocktails, selected wine and draft beers

I stayed at the Hilton so Luke was easily accessible. Fantastic happy hour, as I had 30 oysters. 18 fresh gulf oyster, one that came with a pearl, and 12 fried. The fried oysters and sauce was fantastic! I went back another night and ordered gumbo, and crab claws. The gumbo was ok, the crab claws were good. The carrot cake dessert was not very good, although the ice cream with it was.

While in New Orleans playing music for a convention, the music staff and I had dinner at Luke 's. We had about 36 people and the restaurant was very accommodating.  Even with that number of people the staff took the time to provide excellent customer service.  I will go back when I'm there again.
Not the most amazing food, service or atmosphere- there are so many more amazing places to eat and experience. Was solid but just not worth the high price tag overall.

Yummy. Simple. Close to my hotel and beaming with fresh oysters and a solid bar menu. The space is big and is connected to the hotel - I mention this because after our table's order of oysters on the half shell, I went to wash my hands; unfortunately, there were no paper towels. I mentioned this to a member of the waitstaff - who apologized but told me, "...the bathrooms belong to the hotel, that's not us." I left it with that and didn't follow-up, fishy hands and all. 
Yeah, that disappointed me with what was otherwise, a good meal, moderate price point and convenient. #NOLA #Luke #NewOrleans

I was in the mood for some oysters after the Saints game Monday and this place hit the spot! The staff was friendly and the food was speedy. We got a dozen oysters, stuffed oysters, crab gratin and Brussels sprouts. They were all delicious and those oysters were amazingly satisfying when your kicker hits the game winning goal to win the home opener! Who DAT!

Luke was recommended by a local to us. We trekked to this spot from a local Irish dive bar. I cannot emphasize how AMAZING this place is! Check it out- great impeccable service, delicious food, stellar cocktails and we did the happy hour which of course made our meal that much more fantastic! Oh and get the Brussels sprouts!

I am a native New Orleanian and eat at this restaurant many times throughout the year.  Happy hour, birthdays, holidays, etc.  Today we sat at the bar and this was the worst service ever!  Bar staff had terrible attitudes.  Ordered a dozen of fried oysters and we received 8.  Informed the bartender and we thought she put in a new order or additional oysters.  She didn't.  We get the bill and it still reflected a dozen.  Brought it to the attention of the staff and they acted like it was a Problem to correct.  They did however correct it.  I refer all my out of town guests. Not anymore.  They are officially on time out.
What can be said. Very upscale restaurant nice for special occasions. The food was some of the best we had in NOLA. Definitely a nice dining experience. Would recommend it for the great experience.

The food here is delicious! Originally came here for Happy Hour since they have oysters for $0.75/each! But we also ordered some food and it was sooo good! So good that we came back twice in our 5 day stay in NOLA, lol. On our first trip to Luke's, I made a reservation even though the restaurant was quite empty when we walked in, but the hostess asked if we had reservations anyway.. and they couldn't find my name, but were nice enough to seat our group of 6. They also don't write down our orders so food that we didn't order came out, but again, nice enough to give it to us on the house... or so we thought. They accidentally put it on the check and we had to make them take it off. Regardless, food is great, service is typical southern hospitality, and the drinks are yummy! 

During our second trip there, the same thing happened with the food, where they brought out food that we didn't order, except we didn't get to keep it this time. But we ordered everything new that we didn't eat the first time. All in all, def would recommend this restaurant.

We stayed at the Hilton that is connected to Luke's and we stopped in to have a quick drink before our dinner reservation at another restaurant. Their Happy Hour is FANTASTIC!!! 1/2 select drinks and bottles of wine and 50 cent oysters and these oysters were HUGE!!! We ended up having a couple dozen raw oysters and their Baked Jalapeno Cheesy Grits. We enjoyed Luke's so much that we came here everyday on our trip for Happy Hour. Get the Jalapeno Cheesy Grits...you won't be disappointed!!

One of our favorite spots out of the many, many places we went to during our visit. The chicken and waffles were so good I don't even know how to begin to praise them. The chicken was so juicy and crunchy- southern fried chicken perfection. The Tabasco pepper jelly was incredible not crazy spicy just amazing flavor. Went back for HH the next day and some of the best cocktails in the city especially when they are 1/2 off such a good deal. The cocktail with tequila, jalapeño, basil and blueberry was so unique and refreshing. MUST GO HERE!

Super impressed with this place!  A group of 8 of us had just landed and gotten situated at the hotel and wanted to go and grab a few appetizers and some drinks on a Friday night around 8:30. Our hotel recommended Luke's, so we headed over. Got there and the place was packed!  We were already looking for other options to go when they said they could accommodate our large party.  We were sat in about 3 minutes after checking in!  We had a private room and some of the best service we've ever had!  Kudos to the manager for accommodating us last minute with no reservations for a large party on a Friday night and to the servers who got our table!  The food was phenomenal!  Brussel sprouts were some of the best we've ever had!  Highly recommend this place!

Got food "to go" since I don't enjoy eating by myself.  Ordered the food over the phone and it was ready and neatly packed for me.  The staff who helped at the bar were very friendly and genuinely looked happy.  The food was really delicious so I plan actually dining inside later this week.

The corn and shrimp bisque bowl was a filling and slightly spicy entree for a light eater. A little dismayed by being handed a menu with a squashed bug on it which probably led to my light appetite. Although the menu was replaced, the original should never have been used.

We had lunch today at Luke's. First, the food was outstanding. We had oysters, crab dip (real crab by the way), shrimp and the Monday special. The oysters were meaty and sweet. The crab dip with crostini was the bomb. The boiled  shrimp was so flavorful that I could have eating 2 dozen! The lunch special was beans and rice with fried chicken. It was so good! The service was outstanding. Andrew, Jonathan and Calvin were great. Very attentive, engaging and fun! I would recommend Luke's highly.
Best happy hour in NOLA.  Food and drinks are spectacular.  Service even more magnificent...ask for Linda.  She is the best server in the world!!!

Shrimp and grits. Wow. We spent a week here and tried it several times and this was far and away the best version of it. Very clean restaurant and reasonably priced. The service was a little off but dang the shrimp and grits...make you want to slap your momma.
Don't waste your time, you can fine better food in the tourist area if the quarter.  Service and food not worth the time you have to wait for your food.

Visited on a busy Friday night and our waiter Richie Rich was very knowledgeable and attentive to our table of five.  Had the Pate, crispy Brussels sprouts, and shrimp and grits. Enjoyed every single bite.  Will be back!

Tried to walk in without a reservation and told to try the bar (which was full) and not offered a wait time. Considering we were dressed appropriately (dress for the lady, collared shirt for the gentleman), this felt unwelcoming. We went across the street to Trenasse and had an amazing dinner with no wait.
Good beer and wine selection, thoughtful cocktail suggestions. Happy Hour from 3-6 including fresh oysters

Luke deserves every single star available lol!

We went there for dinner the very first night of my Bachelorette Party weekend in New Orleans. 7 of us girls and multiple people in our party said their food was "the best thing they've ever eaten".  

Our waiter was amazing! He was very enthusiastic and fun and any time we asked about a menu item he explained in great detail. His recommendations were on point and he even suggested some customizations to some of the menu items for us that turned out to be fantastic! 

Definitely no surprise this place comes highly recommended. If you're in New Orleans, its a must-do!
Great friendly service by hostess and waiter.  Welcoming.  Keto friendly.  Not too much seasoning (if you can't handle spices). Great wine! Will definitely return.

We were excited to have dinner at Luke and were met with disappointment. Our waitress (Shawn)was inattentive and kind of cold towards our group. Even though we were assigned two servers, only 1 came by and that was pretty rare. We spent 2 hours here- no appetizers and only 1 of us had wine. The food was okay but we had to send our frites back as they were cold. Our server did bring a new side out but it's just a little disappointing to have to send food back at a higher end restaurant.  The shrimp and crawfish étouffée was decent but the pasta in it was a little gummy. Another person in our party had the schnitzel and it was tough.  My husband ordered the roasted chicken and it was really good. I would not recommend this restaurant based on our first experience. Luke has lots of great reviews but we didn't have a great experience.
Great food, great service! Very classy place and clean. Highly recommend this place. Group of 6 people. Sat us quick. You might want to call before hand to reserve a table.

New Orleans has excellent cuisines and Luke is no exception.  We don't usually like greens but we devoured their Brussels sprouts dish. The crabmeat remick was delicious. So were our main dishes of shrimp and steak.
Stopped in here for a light, late dinner. I had the crab corn chowder and my husband had the gumbo. Both were really good, and hit the spot. We had the bread pudding for dessert and it was awesome!

Seriously, this place was so good we came twice during our 5 day trip to NOLA, yes it was THAT good!!! We were able to experience both breakfast and lunch and they were great.

The shrimp and cheesy grits here are AMAZING!!! They are suuuuuuuper cheesy, the sausage is tasty with a little kick - oh man it was so good I ordered it both times! We enjoyed the oysters, the crab claws, the crab omelette and I can't remember what else. But everything we ate was delicious and the service was on point.  

I highly recommend making this a stop on your stay.

My husband and I had a great dining experience here. The place is wonderful, the service is excellent, and the food is fantastic. Every single item that we ordered was really good and flavorful. This was the first restaurant in New Orleans that my husband and I checked out on our vacation. I would say, if you are visiting New Orleans for the first time, this should be your last stop on your trip as this is such a great place for a last meal. Since this was our first meal in New Orleans, it definitely raised the bar super high, other restaurants were great but this one has to be our favorite.

Orders:
Crawfish Bique
Pate of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers
Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cotte"

This is the best food I had while in New Orleans, and I was purposely hunting for the best food. The service was great and quick and they were super accommodating for my baby and I. They actually have a changing table in the bathroom and very few restaurants in New Orleans have anywhere to change a diaper. I got the shrimp Etouffee and DANG so good with the perfect seasonings. The beet salad had golden beets in it and they tasted like they came straight from the garden!!! The bread pudding was by far the best I've had in New Orleans and the ice cream was clearly homemade and so delicious.

Being in a hotel property I was skeptical. Thursday night, torrential downpour outside, there were plenty of locals willing to wait for a table. 

Best shrimp and grits I have ever had. A guy next to me had Luke's Burger. Biggest hamburger patty I've ever seen with bacon and cheddar wrapping the outer edges, cooked medium rare to perfection. 

Definitely worthy of a repeat visit!!!
Went here for my husband's birthday and it was wonderful. The service was amazing and so was the food!

The happy hour lived up to the hype. Raw oysters were only 75 cents each. The fried oysters were like $1.25 each. Both delicious. The service was top notch too. Fine dining experience at the HH price.

The best experience I've had while in New Orleans. Will be coming back for dinner and probably breakfast too before I leave. Ordered the Brussels sprouts and oysters . Asked for a champagne pairing and it was just wonderful .

This was a disappointing dinner experience especially since it had been recommended by a friend who is usually right on... 

First off it was excruciatingly loud. Uncomfortably so. We could not have a decent conversation and barely heard the explanations by the staff of various menu items. Service was quite good, though. It was the food that was just ok.

One item stood out as being very good and innovative  -- their rabbit and chicken liver pate. It was served in its own little jar topped with aspic. On the board were dollops of grainy mustard, pickled watermelon rind, apple chutney, and half sour pickles. Thin toasts came on the side. 

The cup of crab and corn chowder was just okay. They reheated it for me as the first time it was just barely warm. But I've had a better version at bonefish grill of all places. 

My entree was their drum fish. I ordered it almondine. It came fried with a light coating. But it was dry and topped with only 4 little almond slivers. I was hoping for the traditional brown butter sauce with almonds.... The fish was served over some root vegetables that had an off putting flavor. Not sure if it was the spice used or what,  but I didn't care for them at all. 

My husband ordered their featured pork schnitzel. The portion was large, but it too was overcooked and dry. Luckily there was some sauce on the side which he used to make it edible. The fries were cooked well done as requested. 

In a town where even a bad meal is usually good, we felt we'd waisted our evening. The seafood towers going by did look good though... as did the burger the kid next to us was served. Maybe we ordered all the wrong items? Now we know...

Highlight of my NOLA trip with my group of friends. Our party (14 people) got the private dining room in the back of the restaurant, but we easily could have sat in the regular dining space. The restaurant feels like an upscale diner - very family friendly, casual and warm - with wonderful staff who make you feel right at home. 

We ordered - 
APPETIZERS:
- Crispy brussel sprouts: GET THIS. This was my favorite dish of the night. Tossed with mouthwatering glaze and seasoning that adds a ton of kick, and topped with crumbled cheese. Heaven.
- Mushroom flatbread: I was a fan! Cheesy, savory, and easy to share
- Shrimp BBQ toast: good but not that memorable. If you're with large party, then go for it, but would not prioritize this
- Rabbit & Chicken pate: great to share and big portions, but I was not blown away, unfortunately. They give baked/thin crouton which I was not a fan of (would have preferred soft bread)

ENTREES:
- Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte": this is the most ordered item, and customer favorite, per our waitress. I got this as my entree (see picture) and was pretty happy. But the dish is 85% grits and 15% shrimp. Just FYI.
- Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp & Crab "Étouffée" : our waitress said this is her favorite dish. And I WISH I got this instead! My friends who got this loved it. I would say go for this if this is your first time.
- Luke Burger: one guy in my group ordered this. Your basic burger, nothing special, if that's what you're in the mood for.
- Washington Parish Roasted Chicken: huge pieces of chicken with country potatoes. My two girl friends could not finish even half of their dish.

Bon Appetit!

A go to that I take all my visitors to when they come to New Orleans. Great raw bar selections, the tuna tartare and crab ravigote are my go to appetizers. The salads are enormous and so fresh. The steak was cooked perfectly. Shrimp and grits and the French 75 are the best in the city!

Really exceptional!  I had a delicious brunch here with my husband and badly wanted to return to try more of the yummy menu while in NO for 3 day stay. Too many restaurants to choose from!! This place won't disappoint..great food, menu, ambiance and service.

Luke was marvelous.  From the very friendly hostesses to the excellent severs, all service was impeccable.  The stuffed oysters and gumbo were both fantastic.  The wine list was substantial and well priced.  It was clear that manager Tanya was very present and ensuring that every guest had a marvelous experience.  Definitely recommend Luke for a memorable night out in New Orleans.

What a great little spot with an chill atmosphere, amazing food and outstanding service!!! 

I must say the waiter Eldwyn was one of the best I have had in a very long time.

Out last night in New Orleans dined at Luke and glad we did. The shrimp and grits was delicious. Large shrimp was cooked just right and grits were very creamy.  We ordered the gumbo which was good. The pate was one of the best we've had.  The stuff oyster was basically like baked clams but with oyster...very good.  Skip the blue crab dip; not worth writing about. The special for October was pork schnitzel with mushroom sauce.  My husband's order had 3 good size cutlets which were tender but a little on the dry side.   Overall a good meal but our dishes were not cleared for 15 mins so we just skipped dessert and asked for the check.  The plus is that they took reservations on open table.

Happy hour oysters .75 a piece from 3-6. Half price cocktails and well drinks. Oysters are what you would expect from the price and enjoyable for a dozen, but they lack mineral flavor, are large, and are shucked quickly so lose salt water and add pieces of shell. Overall good experience for the price though with nice staff and good atmosphere.

steak was extremely salty.  shrimp not fresh.  poor service. little portion. $100 for 1 appetizer and 2 entrees which is very expensive compared with others in the neighborhood.  very disappointed and will never come back again.
OK, the food tastes great and the service is good.  However the portion and price of the chicken soup were completely ridiculous.  The bowl was only dampened with the soup at the bottom.

possibly the best shrimp and grits ive ever had. shrimp was gigantic and grits taste like they were hand ground. who knows. not overly spicy if thats a concern, even with the jalapenos

it had huge chunks of sausage and the service was superb. 

table bread was some par baked generic baguette

i would go back in a heart beat. 

JEANS: OK by far
ORDER: wait staff
Good oysters and drum fish. Always a limited menu but generally everything is fresh and tasty.

Thanks to the Lyft driver who brought us from the airport to our hotel during our recent long weekend in New Orleans, we learned about Luke -- an oyster lover's paradise.

We checked into our hotel at about 3pm, then made the not-too-distant walk to Luke's.

Why so early in the afternoon? Happy hour.

But not just any happy hour. Of course, the usual beer, wine, and cocktails were available for half off from 3-6pm. But the star attraction is that they also sell their local P&J oysters on the half shell for just 75 cents each during happy hour.

So the 3 dozen oysters (yes, that's right -- 3 dozen, 36) my wife and I ordered to share that would have cost us more than $100 back home in San Diego, cost just $27 during happy hour. They were fresh and meaty. Being local, they weren't briny like the ones you would typically get from the Pacific Northwest or New England but they were tasty nonetheless.

My wife had a glass of Malbec to go along with the oysters and I had a local IPA. Both excellent. The server also brought us a warm baguette with soft butter. Perfect.

We liked the Luke happy hour so much we came back on our last full day in New Orleans. This time we scaled back to 2 dozen oysters and tried the cheesy grits (AMAZING) and fried potatoes (crispy and very good).

Very glad we followed the recommendation of our Lyft driver! Great food and great service -- what more could you ask for?

Don't let them sit you in the back room which is SO loud. 
Restrooms were clean, but smelled like sewage. There were no paper towels in the bathroom and one of the two soap dispensers was empty.
Food was just not good. Simple gem salad was drenched in beet juice, it took forever to get our first round of drinks, two people in my party of 12 added crab to their salads and both thought the amount of crab was way too little for the price, two people sent back the shrimp cocktail because it was mushy and tasted funny, flat bread was good, gumbo was good, I won't be back.

I hosted brunch at Luke the morning after my wedding. I had never been before, but the team who helped me with planning and booking was super professional and really accommodating. I picked the menu purely based off of my own preferences and I was shocked by how good the food was. The crispy Brussels sprouts were so incredibly good. We ordered appetizers for all the tables and I am pretty sure that I ate one entire order myself they were so incredibly good. The stuffed French toast was also to die for. I am not a sweets person but this dish was so incredibly unique and the perfect balance of fruity and sweet. I had the fried chicken and waffles and I think that is the best entree for brunch. Everyone was stuffed and absolutely loved the food. Great prices and ambiance compared to some of the other fancier restaurants in New Orleans. This place is fantastic for brunch.

We visited for happy hour drinks and oysters but ended up ordering a few extra things. Oysters were delicious and fresh and the bisque was the best I've ever had - I ordered a second bowl. The service and atmosphere was welcoming and very friendly.
Nice place and good service. Disappointed they would not grill oysters...Blue crab dip is a must!!!! Hamburger was delicious as well.
Breakfast this morning -- mediocre.  Restaurant was dark and smelly.  Eggs were cold.  Coffee lukewarm at best.  The morning at Luke has cast a pall over the day.

W were here for Brunch on Daturday. Delicious Chicken and Waffles. My husband and I shared chicken and waffles and a Luke burger. The burger was good too,, but the Chicken and Waffles were delightful. I had a French 75 drink it was also very tasty. My husband had a Bloody Mary. It had a touch too much horseradish for him, If you like a lot of horseradish, you'll like the Bloody Mary

The staff was friendly and it was very close to our hotel. So all around a win, win.

This small place is at the base of a Hilton hotel.  Went here for brunch one day and I think one dish out of 4 was worth writing about.... the croque madam was really great!   Fries were soggy and a disappointment, other dishes were all cold.......
Not a great experience... BUT... someone told us this was not the norm and maybe there was an issue with the staff that day.... 
So we tried again this morning, we had a completely different experience.
I had one of the best chicken and waffle plates I ever had!!
The chicken was hot and juicy on the inside with great crunch on the outside.... perfect!  The waffle was crispy and perfect.  The jalapeño relish on top was perfect!!
Loved it and so so happy I went back!

BTW-  I went for the daily happy hour starts at 3:00 and if you want oysters and cocktails at about half price go here!!

We had a group of about 20+ (all in town for a conference) and the service was UNBELIEVABLE - seriously, pay these people more, they were outstanding. We made it for happy hour (3-6pm) and ordered a barrage of food and drinks which included:

-Crispy Brussels sprouts
-BBQ shrimp toasts
-wild mushroom flatbreads
-pate and bread
-dozens and dozens and dozens of raw and grilled oysters at 75 cents each
-shrimp and grits
-other flatbreads
-I can't remember

I can't remember because drinks are half priced during happy hour, and that was an insane deal. Great cocktail selection.

A must for those stopping by New Orleans for the first time for both food and hospitality!
Come here for happy hour. .75 cent oysters and half off drinks. The oysters and crab gratin were delicious. You get fresh bread and whipped butter. The staff were very attentive.
Came for HH which is a beautiful way to go.  I came right at 3 and was sat immediately.  Great atmosphere and ambiance.  Definitely worth the visit if you like oysters!

We went here for breakfast one day since it was close to our hotel and we loved it. My husband is still talking about the grits we had here. I got the croque madam and it was huge- I ate a 1/2 of it and was stuffed.  They serve the coffee with heavy cream and it is so delicious. We went around 10 in the morning and there were a few parties seated, it was very quiet and a nice way to ease into the day. Wish we had more time in NOLA, would've definitely returned to try dinner here.
I came here during their happy hour. Oysters were very delicious along with their delicious cocktails. Everything here was amazing and I would come back in a heartbeat. Highly recommend!
One and done! Rushed and spotty service in a cramped space with pedestrian room temperature food! Not sure who has been giving the good reviews

Grits and shrimp, boiled shrimp, hamburger and fries, etouffe, creme broulette, bread pudding were all good. Service was good, drinks kept full. We arrived without reservations and got seated in 15 minutes.
The seafood, the fried Brussels sprouts... it was truly epic. A beautiful brasserie, with fantastic, attentive wait staff!

Wow! the BEST oysters I've ever had in my life! I guess everyone has a different preference for oysters. I like it big, not salty, and chewier basically East Coast oysters. Even out of all the oysters I've tried from NOLA, this place had the best and the freshest. As you can see from the pics I've posted, first of all their oysters are HUGE. Shrimp and grits were amazingly delicious, so much taste in it with shrimps cooked very well and the grits were so smooth, yet solid and filing. I went to this place on my first day in NOLA and went back on my last day. Since this place is a bit out of bourbon street, not crowded much and didn't have to wait like other restaurants on bourbon street.

I decided to try Luke as my first restaurant in NOLA. However, we waited at front for around ten minutes and no server came serve us. Those two ladies were counting the menu and did not even talk to us, never explained about the wait. Thus we left. It was a horrible experience that made me feel so bad. Hope the waiters at least pretend they are welcoming customers.

Luke is my favorite spot in the city. It's away from the hustle but still close, and is 100% New Orleans. The menu is small, but somehow managed to have a great variety. Lastly, the service is always on point. For a good time and professional waiter experience, ask for Richard. He will be sure to make your evening dining memorable.

LA Gulf Oysters just okay. The ones we had were lifeless and not that salty. Nothing like Martha's Vineyard oysters.  The hot quail was just okay too. The ambiance is 4+! Chill music. Good service. The carb bisque--B. Not that thick on the sauce.

Wow this food was amazing. I had never been before, but my friend works at Pizza Domenica and gets 50% off, so we decided to all go and indulge. They were very understanding when I got there on time and my friends showed up about half an hour late bc my friend was picking up her sister from the airport and the airport was a disaster. Thankfully the restaurant wasn't too packed and they were very understanding. I asked if they wanted to reseat us and our server said no worries and brought me bread and butter :) I'm not sure if her name was Kristin or Kristian but she was amazing. Both our servers, the other was David, were so thoughtful and helpful! Everyone was joking around as I waited for my friends and I got started on a drink. I got the Belle on the Bayou. It was very strong and spicy (tequila, jalapeño, blueberry, and basil) and delicious. Then we got the Wild Mushroom Flatbread (fried kale, charred onion, pesto, fontina cheese) which was absolutely amazing. We shared one and then I got a second one as my meal. I sometimes eat seafood, but I didn't really feel like it that day. I also got the delicious house made fries  with aioli. My friends got the muscles, bbq shrimp, stuffed oysters, pate, and corn and crab bisque. We had so much food and had to bring some home. Seems like the bbq shrimp was a favorite, as well as the flatbread. The flatbread had so much flavor and the leftovers were good cold the next day as well :) I would definitely love to eat that flatbread again!

Really good place. Only been there once. One of the famous addresses in NOLA for visitors, but also locals. Pretty pricy with pretty high standards. Had the steak and fries but nothing else. Steak was really tasty and well cooked, buttery sauce was excellent. Only down point was the French fries which were not fresh, kinda disappointing for that price and a steak like this. But I will go back for sure next time I'm in town.

The Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" is delicious. I had mine without the sausage as I don't eat pork. This this was very filing and had me dancing in my seat. We also enjoyed two desserts, the bread pudding without the pecans due to my nut allergy, and the chocolate cake item with ice cream. The service was great and this place is highly recommended. The only downside was that it was a little chilly inside the restaurant.

12/3/19 - updated review: I went back to Luke due to late work meetings. Well this time is wasn't as great. The service was great but the food was not. I ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" which was amazing the the night before. This day, it was disappointing. The decor on the food wasn't the same. The dish came out cold. The waiter got
it reheated but the food didn't come out the same.
The grits were not as cheesy and delicious as the night before. It was watery and not as flavorful.
The highlight was the brusselsprouts. They were flavorful and had a hint of spice to it. Simply delicious! I was very disappointed with the grits, the dish was the only reason I came back. The plating was even different.

Was disappointed with our meal here but based on the majority of positive reviews, assuming it was just a off night for them. Service was lackluster and the food was not great. We ordered the shrimp appetizer and the crab Ravigote. Most of the shrimp weren't deveined properly and the crab dish, while super fresh, had WAY too much horseradish. We love spicy but this was just over the top. Entrees were tasty but the fries were just pitiful - soggy and not seasoned. This was our last dinner while in Nola so maybe we just expected more, especially after it came so highly recommended.

Here in NOLA for a conference and I heard great things about this place... so a few colleagues and I decided to give it a try... and I do have to say the food was delicious, the service was on point and the manager checked in with us. (Server Richard and manager Tanya) we had a variety between the five of us and it tasted great.

So your probably wondering why the four stars...originally I was going to give them 5, but we came here the next day and the food came out luke warm (no pun intended) we had to ask to wake it up again and it just didn't tasted the same. Service was still great.. and the manager was very apologetic. 

I understand things can't be perfect all the time... will I come here again, yes... do I recommend yes.. just a warning it depends on the day.

Amazing happy hour!!! 75 cent oysters that are local and delicious. Cocktail happy hour will blow you mind !! French 75 is amazing and beer is only $4. Highly recommend!!! Service is not as great as it should be but still worth going for happy hour 4-6. Cheesy grits are also the best I have ever had!!!

The menu has a good selection of tasty choices, and the chefs demonstrate proficiency in the canon of creole-style cuisine, and especially w/ seafood. Luke isn't visually interesting, or particularly comfortable, but the kitchen and staff deliver a good experience.

Hands down the most amazing service I've ever had at a restaurant. We celebrated our anniversary here tonight and the food and service was beyond our expectations. Richard I believe his name was, greeted us with complimentary champagne and if that wasn't enough, after a fabulous meal he brought out a dessert with a candle and happy anniversary chocolate. We were blown away by this recognition of our special dinner. Thank you so much. We will be back .

THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!!! I cannot say enough good things about this place!!! The service was out of this world!!!! I told our servers our sons name is Luke and they gave us a free cup and bag to take to him! The reisling wine I had was THE BEST glass of wine I have ever had!!!! The fried oysters are AMAZING!!!! Never have had better and never will!!! We got the salad but asked for the oysters to be kept separate. The salad was phenomenal. The bacon that was on that salad was unlike any I have ever had. We split the shrimp and andouille sausage dish. The creamy grits it came on were so tasty!!! Plenty of kick and seasoning but could still Tate what I was eating. The portions are huge...so splitting the meal was still so much food!!! I truly cannot say enough good things about this place!!!! I will come back every single time I am in NOLA!!!

Food 4/5: We ordered a dozen of oysters and Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp. The size of the oysters was smaller than I imaged, but it was still very good.  Both was very flavorful and the shrimp was tender. The oysters was fresh for sure, no doubts about that. 

Service 5/5: The waiter was top-notch, he was very attentive to our needs and explained the food in the menu very well. He was very nice and smiley. I hope the waiters there get pay more for their service. 

Ambience: This place is very bougie including their menu. If you need to find a place for a nice date, I'd recommend this place. I heard many companies would come to this restaurant for lunches. The interior design is very comfortable and high-class for sure.

are you kidding me luke's knocks it out of the park best food ever drop  mic ! this is where yelp makes me type more words in order to post a review so how about this ......... greatnesssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss

I was really disappointed with Luke. The breakfast was simply just okay, nothing special at all. What really disappointed me was that the food was cold. The grits, which could have tasted fairly good, would have been better had they been hot. I asked the server for hot grits. He returned a few minutes later with a fresh serving  but they were barely warm. 
What I had hoped would be a great breakfast experience turned out to be a great big disappointment.

Fantastic shrimp and grits. I always look forward to stopping in for breakfast or lunch at Luke when I visit town. Great little spot that I always recommend to friends and family that are heading to New Orleans.
Excellent meal and venue. We sat by the kitchen window and saw the magic unfold. The roasted chicken, mussels, and fried oyster salad were so delicious.

Hice un pedido viendo que el lugar dice que este cierra a las 11 y que tenía disponibilidad de Grubhub por lo que decidí hacer una orden (8:34), una hora paso y no recibía la confirmación, dicido llamar y resultó que ya habían cerrado.
Aquí podría hablar dos situaciones, los empleados no les gusta trabajar y quieren ser pagados por solo decir que el restauran está cerrado o si no les gusta hacer pedidos para llevar pues que quiten la opción. 
De las dos formas el restaurante al igual que el dueño quedan con una mala imagen y ojalá sean los empleados y no la cabeza de el lugar por qué me hubiese encantado ir ya que todas las reviews son positivas.

AMAZING. Food was delicious! Equality good was experience. Combination made it a true New Orleans evening. Stayed in the hotel and were to tired to walk around searching for something so popped in later in the evening without a reservation. Hostesses were so sweet about it  Had broiled fish and the most amazing dark chocolate dessert ever. Went back the second night after dinner at Galatoires to have the dessert again. Also had room service of fries one afternoon- so good. Manager so sweet and came and visited with us. Waiters Karl and Richy Rich were so absolutely amazing definitely ask for them.

The shrimp and grits is one of the best dishes I've ever had. I crave it when I'm not in New Orleans and  always make Luke one of my first stops when I return. My husband says the Luke burger is the best burger he's ever eaten..and he's eaten a lot of burgers so that's saying something. Excellent service every time.

Came here for a fancy birthday dinner and was not disappointed! Our server was class, the place was beautiful (especially the building its' located in) and the food was amazing. We ordered so much and loved every single thing. Their menu is mostly creole/Cajun...and then they had a couple of german items on it, which were delicious! I remember having some flatbread and the shrimp and grits, which were both great. And the bread pudding was delicious!
Great local cuisine. I had the shrimp and grits which were amazing. The decor is cosy. Good for groups and have really good wines. The bread pudding is amazing

We went to Luke because it was super close to our hotel and was highly recommend. We ended up being a little disappointed though. Although their food was good it was pretty expensive. We also got sat so close to another table that the waitress had to ask me to move every time she wanted to get to the table next to us even though there were plenty of other tables available in the restaurant. Overall it was a little over priced for my taste and had an uncomfortable seating arrangement.
The best service we've had in a long time! Delicious fresh oysters on the half shell. We went for Happy Hour and then took a few drinks to go.
Mediocre at best. I really wanted to like this place but have been 3 times and it's just been ok all 3 times. Food is lackluster and serves is just ok

Happy hour 3  to 6pm is good. Half price for the drink and p&j raw oysters 9 dollars for a dozen (reg 27 for a dozen). Some are big and some are small, all of them is super fresh. Last call for happy hour oyster takes a while which makes sense.

It's like people say on this review.  Great staff and Great food. Portions are large. You don't leave hungry.  My wife and I are from north of Toronto Canada. Next time we are visiting New Orleans we will definitely stop in.  Thanks again.

The "Luke Burger" was one of the best burgers I've had in my many visits to New Orleans over the years. I ordered mine without bacon, and I'm glad I did -- the burger itself was so flavorful with a slight spicy kick. I could've eaten the patty by itself. The layer of caramelized onions added another delicious tang to the sandwich. I had never had Emmenthaler before, and I hate that it's taken me this long to discover it. It added such a unique taste to the burger. Lastly, the fluffy bun did a great job of holding everything together.

The house fries, on the other hand, were disappointing. Served in a tin cup, the fries were more soggy than they were crispy. They were incredibly short -- coupled with the sogginess, they were nearly impossible to dip in ketchup. 

The service was good, but I was surprised by how long it took our food to come out. Nonetheless, everyone seemed satisfied with what they ordered.

The food was good. We had the shrimp and grits with sausage and the roasted chicken. The cocktails were also tasty. The service, however, was not great. The waiters split our table (2 waiters). At one point, it took over 20 minutes for one of them to check on us, so long that we opted out of dessert due to the excessive wait. Wish I could have given five stars, but the service needs some work.

Had breakfast there and the Chicken and Waffles are awesome. The waffle is fluffy yet crisp ( I know it's an oxymoron) and the chicken with the whipped butter and sweet and spicy compote is a perfect combination. The staff was very attentive and professional.

In a world of small plates to share, Luke is serving up big food.  There are starters to share (the Brussels sprouts are truly divine deep fried crispy goodness and they'll give you the recipe) but the main dishes don't mess around.  The schnitzel come with three large portions.  The drum is a huge filet.  The steak is enormous.  The chicken generous.  I'm assuming g the burger is even big enough to share.  All very good.  Come hungry and leave happy.

Like a fine breakfast establishment from long ago landed in New Orleans today. And brought along lunch and dinner too. Including a great oyster bar.

The shrimp and grits were decadent, the coffee was fresh and kept full, the service was friendly and attentive (huge shout out to Devin, who was superlative), and we basically loved the whole experience.

My entree, the BLTAE, was tasty but served on the cool side. I was expecting it to arrive more warm, more hot and fresh, but I'm not sure what happened. Maybe it just sat a bit while waiting for my wife's entree to be done? In any event that was the only miss during an otherwise wonderful breakfast experience. We would happily go back. Hopefully the next time all entrees will be served equally hot.
This is probably a little on the pricey side for the value but the food and drinks were good, especially the Shrimp and Grits and the Pain Perdu.

This restaurant services the Hilton St. Charles hotel.  We ordered in-room breakfast, food & coffee was cold when it was delivered.  I complained to the hotel & they said I would receive a credit.  Today I checked out & no credit was given.  Management ignored my complain today.

My first stop in New Orleans and my first time trying etouffe. I ordered the shrimp etoufee and the bisque. Both were good. There were chunks of crab shell in my bisque so I had to sort of watch out while I was eating. I also ordered the fried osyters, stuffed oysters and the raw oysters. The raw were good, but I probably would not order the fried (not very good) and the stuffed were okay. There were three hostesses at the stand cleaning menus and we stood there a good minute before we were acknowledged and when we left they didn't bother to say anything to us either. Our server was nice. I would eat here again.
Came for happy hour 75 cent raw oysters. No wait to get seated, we were quickly in and out. Very satisfied with the oysters. Amazing meal for under $20 bucks.
Great burger and the Brussels spout appetizer is a don't miss.  I get the best service at the bar.
Got oysters here for 75 cents a piece during happy hour. It was really good! Presentation and taste is 5/5. It's a classy place and tastes fresh. Only negative is that the restroom is out of order.

Great bar with good food and excellent service. Stopped by during New year's time because we were staying in the area. Bar was packed and bartender was working with a smile and great attitude! A guy got drunk and caused a scene and tried to loud talk the bartender. He shut that down quickly and then poured the rest of us shots for our inconvenience of listening to the drunk! Great staff and excellent customer service! We will definitely be back next time we are in town!

Go for happy hour! 75c raw oysters, 6 fried oysters for $10 or 12 for $14. Half price wine, beer, well drinks and signature cocktails. It doesn't get much better. Also the place is beautiful and classy, the service was very attentive and the food plain delish. Other than oysters we also ordered the pate which comes out on a board with excellent condiments. It was smooth and rich just like it should be. It was a large portion so be prepared to share with a few people. The rest of the menu items also seemed reasonably priced. Definitely glad I walked the few blocks over from the French quarter.

Nice atmosphere, low key but also nice. Feels cozy. Food was excellent. The seafood tower is not to be missed. Great oyster selection. Moules et frites is a very generous portion. Was not disappointed with the menu. Cocktails were good, great breadth of wine too. Desserts also good. But the highlight was the service. Jesse W took awesome care of my party of 6!

I loved this restaurant! The menu is the perfect size so you don't feel over whelmed by so many choices, yet don't want anything because it so small! I got the tuna tar tar and the my husband got the Shrimp and grits/ed touffee. We shared the Brussel spouts and those were amazing!! If you like spice eat the single crUnchy pieces, if you don't want to burn your hiney up eat the halves! Will defiantly come bsck when we come to New Orleans.

Ohhhh my!! The shrimp n grits were to die for!! I could eat this every day! Tried multiple restaurants and this is the best!! Just a tad but too much cheese, but I pushed that to the side and dug into this baby! You got to go to this place if you're ever in New Orleans.

service is amazing. during our 3 hours we had 3 different servers (rhonda savannah and gary) and all three knocked it our of the park. food was great. atmosphere is cool. and it waac time too pricy. love love love.

We ate here as our last lunch during our conference. 
Linda was our server she was Amazing!!! 
We had learned at our conference about peaks and valleys people experience during service at an establishment.  Linda absolutely gave us many peaks during our experience. The food was great but Linda made the experience Awesome!!!!

My sister and I had a quick 4 day get away to NOLA. This restaurant was right around the corner from our hotel, Le Pavillion, and it was highly recommended by them.  WE AGREE!!!  The service was just wonderful and the brussel sprouts, out of this world.  The waiter even gave us the recipe.  Wine was wonderful and the establishment was just too cool.  We will certainly go again on our next trip.

Excellent service, food & ambiance. Our server Rick was the perfect accompaniment to our dinner service, a perfect blend of funny & knowledgeable, his recommendations were 100% on point. I had the p&j  oysters to start and had the crab & shrimp etouffe and it was delicious!!!!  I wish I lived here so I could go broke eating here. Even sang my girl a happy birthday tune. Would definitely return next time I'm in NOLA

This was highly recommended to me by a friend and when I found out this was right across from the hotel we were staying in (intercontinental), I knew it was fate! 

We came here for happy hour and they certainly did not disappoint. We were seated immediately. I thought there would be a wait but it wasn't bad for a sunday afternoon. Of course, we came for the 75c oysters and they were every bit as delicious as I expected. We started off modest with only one dozen and then quickly realized this wasn't nearly enough for 2 people! We are fatties! We ended up consuming 2.5 dozen.

We also ordered the pate of louisiana rabbit/chicken livers. Sounds a little adventurous but don't shy away...pate is delicious. The portions were incredibly generous, the pate was placed in jar and served with crostini and a multitude of other toppings like a grainy mustard, chutney/jam?, pickled veggies, etc. Tasting each toppings individually was quite strange. However, once you put the pate on the crostini and pick your topping and eat it all together -- that's where the MAGIC happens. Wow, just incredible how well the flavors all somehow worked together. Don't be shy in asking for more crostinis because what it comes with isn't enough for the amount of pate they serve with. We shared this amongst 2 people but I feel it is more than enough for 6 people.  

Our server was just the right amount of attentive and our overall experience was very good. If you're in NOLA for a quick trip, this is worth it to add on your list.

Loved the happy hour! Can't go wrong with the $0.75 local P&J oysters on the half shell - they were luscious, fresh, sizeable. We also really enjoyed our cocktails, which were also a great deal during happy hour. Service was also friendly, attentive, and kept it fun with a good sense of humor. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience and would definitely consider returning for happy hour the next time I'm in New Orleans.

Is Luke's showing their age?  Came here a couple years ago and had their brussels sprouts side dish. It was so good; we ordered seconds. But I guess since then Brussel sprouts inspired dishes have been popping up at many restaurants.   

So ordering it tonight was nothing greater than what you find at other restaurants that have a little creativity.


Brussel sprouts: very good
Drum fish:  okay, small portion Not that much flavor
Bread pudding: good; probably best part of meal.

The absolute best bartender works here ! Lillian  is fabulous- grace, art and talent in action.  We came in and sat at the bar.  Lillian immediately clued us in on the happy hour deals and the food was phenomenal!!! 
We are from Baltimore so seeing barbecue shrimp wAs a bit of a turn off ( I envisioned tons of barbecue sauce over shrimp). Luckily we were befriended by some lovely military folks who made food recommendations and reassured us.   
Get the BBQ shrimp -awesome! 

Best happy hour !!!!!

Very cool environment with great service!

Dropped by late at night as a second dinner. We ordered half-a-dozen PB&J oysters ($14) and a cup of silver queen corn and crab bisque ($9). Both were delicious! I loved how fresh the oysters were. They tasted refreshing and clean when paired with a squeeze of lemon juice and dab of mignonette sauce. 

I was also pleasantly surprised by the bisque. It was  a good creamy consistency and not too salty. It's definitely one of the better ones I've had.

Loved my experience at this restaurant overall. Would recommend if you are dropping by and want to taste delicious dishes in New Orleans!
Great farm fresh food! Waiter was amazing and made awesome recommendations. A bit noisy, but it's NOLA

This place is amazing. I've been there for two days(dinner and happy hour)in a row. For dinner, you'd better make a reservation. I'm not sure they do validate parking but street parking is plentiful near here. The food is really tasty and the portions are quite large. During the happy hour (3-6 pm), the P&J Oyster is only 75cents each and drinks are half price. The staffs are very friendly and the atmosphere was great. I'd definitely go back!

Delicious tried three or four dishes from our large group - and they were all great! 

The French 75 I had was extra as well.

Came for happy hour- $9 for a dozen oysters, half price cocktails, beer and wine- how can you go wrong.

In our New Orleans weekend this was a happy hour stop before dinner that didn't disappoint!!!! In the future  it will be a dinner stop.

Yum.  I travel more than anyone I know and have a rule against eating in a hotel. Break the rule and eat here..  The shrimp and grits with jalapeño were easily the best shrimp and grits I ever had and I am from NC. We had Brussels- excellent - and barbq shrimp.  If you havE had barbq shrimp in NOLA, it is not shrimp witH bbq sauce on a grill - it is soooooooo much better. Our only complaint wass that we were so full that couldn't eat dessert.

Great happy hour! The best French 75 I've had and cocktails are half price. The oysters are a great deal (.75 cents) and are big and delicious. We also enjoyed the pate, which was served charcuterie style with crostinis, picked veggies, and house made mustard. We'll definitely be back.

Super fancy place. Lol. Not exactly what I was expecting but they had happy hour oysters for 75 cents. Which is a steal. I'd never had raw oysters before so that was interesting. Very very salty and there's still sea water or something when you slurp it down lol. Awk.

On my recent trip to New Orleans I found myself wandering near the French Quarter looking for a nice meal. The wait times at every stop were over an hour, even for a single diner.  When I popped into Luke, initially the answer was the same. But I could see the place was packed and the food looked delicious so I asked if I could wait for a seat at the bar. 
I often find eating at the bar a doorway to an excellent meal, as the bartender, wait staff and patron usually are spot on in their recommendations. Luke was no exception. The bartender steered me towards the Gulf Puppy Drum but recommended I order it "poor and dirty" - blackened. The patron next to me said the jalapeno cheese grits were to die for...so I did both.  The grits came in their own little cast iron skillet and were surrounded in a crispy coating on the bottom and luscious cheese on top. A meal in and of itself. Not to be outdone, the drum fish was perfectly blackened and served over a bed of roasted root veggies. Holy cow was this dish an explosion of flavor.  I was so overjoyed that I let anyone within earshot hear my satisfaction, over and over again. The menu suggests lump crab on top of the drum, but frankly I think it would have overpowered the taste of this impeccably prepared gulf fish. I was too stuffed for the bread pudding, which looked scrumptious!
I know where I will be dining on my next trip to New Orleans...Luke.
This is a lively place with charm and atmosphere. Don't go for quiet conversation! Go for the delicious food, which is well-served by a friendly professional staff.
Very nice restaurant. The only reason I found this place was because I was staying at the Hilton. I skipped my free company lunches and ate here. Price was right and the food was great.

Their happy hour is bomb. $0.75 oysters and half off draft beer, cocktails and wine. We came here for a pre dinner snack and drinks and spent $150 for 42 oysters and loads of drinks for 6 people. The oysters were HUGE and very yummy. We came at 4:30, which was the perfect amount of time before happy hour ended at  6. Their first dinner seating was around 5/5:30, and at one point, we heard the waitress say there was a 1:45 min wait so make a reservation, even for happy hour.

Came here for convenience-sake and it was a disappointment: 1) wait for food was longer than anticipated; 2) gumbo roux tasted like flour- no touch of Creole seasoning whatsoever- I did not finish it. In addition, it was lukewarm3) and kid's meal fries were limp from being saturated in grease. 

I was not charged for the gumbo and I requested fresh french fries, which were delivered how they should have been initially. I will add I was given the opportunity to order another soup; but it was a tad late and I was over it.

The brussel sprouts were a winner. 

Not sure what happened to the gumbo though (insert sad face). Even though the roux was thicker than what I'm accustomed to, it was bland. First night in NOLA to eat good food, and was disappointed.

Happy hour is the bomb 
75 cents raw oysters
Inside the Hilton hotel across from intercontinental

Luke restaurants' items are always tasty and you will never go wrong with any of the choices. I have tried their food like 4 years ago when we were living in NOLA and 4 years later I cane back for a conference. I ordered b sprouts and it was unique and super delicious. I also ordered crawfish bread and it was good. The managers are very professional and they will address your concerns (if any)immediately. I highly recommend it for brunch.

Came here last night for our first meal in NOLA and we are so glad we did..  We ordered a dozen of the P&J raw oysters that they had on happy hour.  They were so big and delish that we had to order another dozen right away.  Honestly we could of went for another dozen but ordered other dishes instead.  

We then had a bowl of seafood&sausage gumbo which was thick, rich bowl of goodness with a nice kick from the sausage.  The we split the shrimp and grits  which was freaking amazing!!!! Ton of flavor, big ol shrimp&sausage and the jalapeno cheesy grits were on point.  We finished the meal with the strawberry shortcake which was just alright but the pistachio ice cream on it was very good.

Service was good and we had no problem finding a seat at 4 pm  for happy hour on a wed night.

We would highly recommend this place and will definitely will be back here again before the end of this trip and whenever we visit new orleans.
The food was amazing, I tried their shrimp and grits and it was seasoned to perfection. Their brunch options are competitively priced with absolutely no wait times on a Sunday morning.

Luke on St. Charles is THE place for fresh Oysters!  They have HH everyday 3-6p, and the best, largest, most succulent, tender oysters (for $.75 each) I had in town.  For HH, they have 1/2 off drafts, specialty drinks and glasses of wine. For the amazing Oysters, drinks plus excellent, friendly, witty and attentive service, a solid 5.0 for me!  Expect to spend $10-20pp for lunch or HH.

Was looking for a recommendation for the best oysters around town, and while many places in the area have 'em, this offer was the "deal of the day"! We started with 1/2 dz raw, but these were SO good, we ordered another dozen; and some of the larger ones were like "double" sized oysters.  These were served with fresh (strong) horseradish and cocktail sauce, mix it to your liking! 

To top it off, we ordered a dozen of their fresh fried oysters as well, served with a house remoulade.  These cost 6 for $10 or 12 for $18, and were the best fried oysters I've ever eaten, YUM!  And their fresh cut fries rocked as well!  Plus fresh warm rolls with your meal too.

Decor is traditional dark wood with tablecloths, but HH is the way to go, plus they also have a full menu of N'Orleans tasty foods like Gumbo, Po Boys sandwiches, and burgers for lunch.  But don't miss this treat if you LOVE oysters!  Enter Luke from the street or thru the Hilton. ENJOY!!!
We went on valentines night and did not have a reservation. The food was amazing. We had the raw oysters  and bisque. I would recommend the Brussels sprouts  I would definately go again
Awesome experience! The food is great and Mandy, our waitress was amazing. Will definitely come back and recommend it to all our friends

We spent a few days here in New Orleans trying the local food and ambiance. None of the places we have been to even compare!  The food is incredible, the ambiance is warm and friendly, but what stood out the most was the staff.  
Mandy is an absolute gem! Super friendly and makes your experience unforgettable! 

Habds down best place in New Orleans with the best staff!

Restaurant linked to the Hilton on St. Charles.
Limited menu item selection. Excellent soups & salads.  
Happy Hour 3-6 with reasonable drink selection.  Lunch until 4.
Very pricey afterwards.
Excellent bar service.  Very good table service.  If female dining solo you may get missed by waiter numerous times while they seem to prefer guests dining with a male & missed for follow ups after receiving your meal, no matter how pleasant you are.
As a solo diner suggest you dine at the bar so you can get served quicker
Good option for those staying nearby. Apparently it also attracts locals too as our table neighbors were going on and on about the place. Oysters were fresh. Burger was good. Bread pudding was yummy.

We met the most amazing manager Tonya Alexander made sure that our experience at Luke was 10 stars out of five!

If you get the opportunity do you are the freshest oysters I have eaten in a very long time make sure you say hello to Tonya Alexander

Best service we had in N.O. the waitress knew the menu backwards and forwards and could make great suggestions.  We had the etouffe' and it was spot on.  She made great recommendations for happy hour. Overall it was the best experience even compared to some of the big name restaurants.  Mardi Gras parade right outside the door too!

Best raw bar around.  Be sure to try the boiled shrimp; you'll never eat boiled shrimp anywhere else again, Tim is the master.  The staff, both bar (Lillian) and table service (Kevin and Rich) are amazing.  This place has its fair share of tourists but don't let that scare you off.  All food is top notch...when we're not eating the raw bar our go to items are stuffed oysters, gumbo, flatbread, Brussels sprouts and ribeye but you really can't go wrong with anything.  Check out happy hour for great deals.

Luke is a Creole-inspired Brasserie located in New Orleans' Business District (near the French Quarter neighborhood).

I tried the following:
- Raw Oysters
- Silver Queen Corn & Crab Bisque
- Crispy Brussels Sprouts - toasted almonds, Espelette honey, Progress Milk Barn cheese
- Jumbo Lousiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" - roasted jalapeno cheese grits, andouille & green onion sausage
- Entrecote Grillee et Frites - Painted Hills 14oz ribeye with maitre d'hotel butter
- Shrimp and Crab "Etoufee" - heirloom tomatoes, garlic, cavatelli
- Cocktail - door#three - St. Roch vodka, pomegranate, mint, lime  

Photo of Meal:
https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=KB7vu1tVw_ykTHqTFDSnJQ&userid=NvUeb5G_mSSxgKhEE_Hueg

Overall, food was pretty good, but the trend for all of the food that we tried in New Orleans was that it was too salty for our personal preferences.  The steak was pretty good, but since most of us were from New York City, our standards were higher (nitpicky, I suppose).  

Definitely worth a trip if you're in the New Orleans area.  Just be wary that food might be a little too salty for your preferences and depends on your standards for steak.  

ENJOY!!

The mussels were so good, I can't remember ever having eaten any this delicious before in my life - and I've had mussels all over the world. They were gooooood! The sauce was so perfect I asked them to pack it up - which they did, including extra bread - so I had it for breakfast the next morning. Incredible! Great meal!!!!

Great spot. Staff was excellent too. We started with the flatbread. Although I was hesitant to order since it had anchovies and olives, the two with the cheese were amazing! For my main I had the shrimp and crab étouffée. I've never had étouffée with pasta, but it was delicious and on spot. If only I could take the pot of it home. Now my friend had the 1/2 baked chicken. Unfortunately it came out warm. The staff was quick to correct the situation and my friend truly enjoyed the chicken.

We came here for happy hour twice. They have fresh oysters for 75 cents a Piece. Have a great wine list and a decent beer list. The oysters fresh and yummy. My only complaint would be if you don't like oysters,  there is no other choices.

Because of their PJ Stuffed Oysters, we have been going to Luke for a few years now. On each visit to NOLA we have made a point to eat there once, and sometimes twice, per day. We have recommended Luke to countless random new friends we've met in the French Quarter.  My wife literally dreams about these damn oysters! 

Well....no more.  They changed the recipe on the PJ Stuffed Oysters and now we can't eat them. They aren't anything like before, totally different, and we will not be going back. Really sad...
This place is elegant. The food is good. Great place for a fancy brunch. Great if your in the mood for seafood.

Luke has a nice atmosphere and my table of 4 received amazing service. We got the Pâté of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers for my table to share and it was a great deal due to the abundance of pâté they gave us! It came with croutons which was in the shape of sliced French bread, but since we also got bread on the table we also used that to go with the   pâté as well. My friend got the burger, which she mentioned was decent but not life changing. Another friend got an appetizer of the brussels sprouts which I tried some of and was absolutely delicious. The other appetizers, the blue crab gratin and the stuffed gulf oysters, were great as well!I also got the bread pudding dessert, which was really rich topped with delicious vanilla bean ice cream and you can definitely taste the rum in the sauce. It was good, but for its size which I felt was quite generous, it needs to be shared as it is quite filling and sweet. I took off one star due to the table we were seated at not being big enough to accommodate the food we ordered. Overall though, my friends and I had a positive experience and our waiter Matthew was attentive and made us feel comfortable.

I just came back to New Orleans for another Mardi Gras and this was my FAVORITE dinner. Despite the fact that it was Mardi Gras, they got us in relatively quickly and the bar was open for drinks. Our service was incredible from the moment we walked in the door. 

For dinner, I ordered BBQ shrimp and the Brussels sprouts. The shrimp wasn't the best bbq I've ever had but it was pretty good. The Brussels Sprouts has the entire table talking about them for days. It was incredible!

If you're in NOLA, stop by here for a more upscale dinner. You won't be disappointed.
Best happy hour in NOLA! Can't beat the half price cocktails, glasses of wine, and wells. 6 fried oysters for 10 dollars! A must stop anytime your in town.
Food was so good! Service was great at lunch! Has a really good lunch menu! Dinner service wasn't greatest but food was good. Overall it wasn't too bad!

Landed in New Orleans on Thanksgiving day and managed to get a spot here for Thanksgiving dinner. Since it was Thanksgiving, the other customers were mainly Asian tourists - it was pretty homey.

We ordered the turducken for the bragging rights. Honestly all the meat kinda tasted the same, but I was pleased with the juiciness. In addition to the turducken, we also got the gumbo (good) and the bread pudding (excellent!).

For two people who just got off a plane, this was a good amount of food. A pleasant first meal in NOLA.

Visited NOLA during Valentine's Day weekend, and carnival.  We hopped an Uber to our hotel off of Canal St, dropped our bags and rushed to find a late dinner (after 9pm) within walking distance from the hotel.  I saw good things about Luke when I was searching Yelp so we heading over.  No reservation, but we were seated quickly at a table for 4.  The menu looked great and our server got us going quickly.  Sorry, no photos of the food because I was too busy stuffing my face and enjoying the moment.  started with a bowl of the corn &crawfish bisque.  so rich and delicious!  the french bread was a perfect compliment!  We had 2 entrees:  shrimp and grits, and the puppy drum.  The shrimp and grits were rich, creamy, and had a great flavor.  The puppy drum was amazing!  Our server (Shawn) was good, and helped to break down the menu.  Enjoyed cocktails with dinner from the full bar, and walked out with a go cup just because I could.  Good option if you are in downtown NOLA.

We were really underwhelmed by this restaurant. In a  city like New Orleans, known for culinary excellence this felt like a fancy tourist trap. Adjacent to a hotel, the decor gave me fancy, old American. The food was mostly watered down and mushy. My mom ordered the shrimp and grits as suggested by the waiter. It was like a cheesy, mushy soup. My crispy brussels sprouts were ok, but drowning in oil so I was only able to make it half way through. After it was all said and done we spent almost $100 for two people and left very disappointed.

It took me a dozen or so trips to Lüke in Nola and SA before I ran into the Crawfish Homefries.  Everything at Lüke is excellent (though they could cut back on the bechamel for the Croque Madame) but the Crawfish home-fries sit alone atop a very specific category: hangover food.  Technically, I wasn't even hungover but my sobriety didn't impede my ability to appreciate the rejuvenative power of this dish.  Crispy home-fries smothered in crawfish tails, bits of fried okra, a creamy creole sauce with a fried egg on top (over medium please).  There's something salty and cheese I couldn't detect but the combination doused with Tabasco resurrected me completely.  Sweet baby J, I need to learn how to make this dish at home.

This little fancy shmancy place is know for their seafood. It's cute and sweet inside the hotel of a Hilton? I don't remember honestly. Had a very urban feel but white table cloths look. I order some oysters on the half shell. They shucked them great! No prices of shell in my slurpy bites. I got a bunch of P&J and Southern Pearls. Yum yum for people who can really enjoy some fresh good seafood. They have bunches of seafood options. I also got the crispy potatoes. Very good and very crispy. Excellent. One thing I heard from my friends who joined me is that the gumbo is extremely salty. Maybe a little heavy handed with the salt. Or maybe just not our east coast taste. Either way I can't personally vouch since I didn't order or try it. Anyways this please is a bit posh but I have no other remarks!  For the oysters it's worth it!

Came here for happy hour on a recommendation and was so glad I did.

Made a reservation for HH just in case (there's a bunch of open time slots ahead of time, but it was pretty packed when we arrived and fuller every minute.)

The raw and fried oysters were great! I felt like I ate an ocean's worth of oysters before dinner. We also got the Belle on the bayou which was on the stronger side but very good. I didn't taste the jalapeno too much, so if you're worried about it being "spicy," it's not. My partner got the French 75 which he loved and I also liked, despite neither of us being fans of lemon.

The service was good, we were served and checked up on in a timely manner. Although I noticed the table next to us waited a while for their order to be taken and a little longer to get their food, but again, it was pretty busy. I loved the pins our server was wearing, it adds a touch of personality in a small way.

I've already been recommending this spot for HH! Will definitely return!

My friend and I discovered that gem accidentally when visiting Nola during the Mardi Gras madness. Luke has the best oysters and desserts: Dark chocolate torte and Maple Crème Brûlée are  to die for! And we aren't even into sweets! 
But beyond food, the service was impeccable, the staff is very attentive, kind and genuine. It was our server's birthday the night we came, and staff sang him birthday song - it was so so touching. That gesture speaks volumes about the team and the management. Overall amazing atmosphere. I'll definitely be back and recommend to everyone. Skip all the touristy places that you need to reserve a few months in advance. Enjoy tres chic Luke

Richie Rich crushed it!  We had a big group and he made the night amazing!  Marinaded crab claws were way too spicy, I couldn't even eat them.  But he more than made up for it with how much fun we had!  Shrimp n grits will blow your mind!  All great and he will make your visit memorable.   Thanks Richie!

We were visiting from out of town. As our first meal I wanted to try some local type cuisine, and this seemed perfect! The atmosphere was great! Clean and simple. We had 2 wait staff helping us, that was different and both were very nice and helpful. My friend ordered a appetizer and didn't realize how it came and they were very nice and let us pick another since she didn't want to try the first. We ordered a second appetizer the BBQ shrimp and it has a lovely smoky flavor. I had a cup of the matzo ball chicken soup, and wish I ordered a bowl! I also ordered the apple salad with ham and still think how yummy it was! They have a large drink variety, but I wish they had a few more items on the menu. Definitely would recommend though.

I've been to Luke twice over the past couple of years, and I have never been disappointed. On this past trip, I brought my sister's bachelorette group, and we had the best experience. The waiter recommended the Brussel Sprouts, and we were in LOVE. We also got the crab dip which was delicious. I had the brandy milk punch, super aromatic and smooth,  and shrimp and grits, hearty savory, and delicious. The alcoholic frappe was strong but really yummy. Everyone was very happy with their food and the experience we had here.

What a great place. Very accommodating they gave us seating exactly where we asked for. Jessie our host was great! Very attentive and personable. Happy hour and the food top notch. Highly recommend, wish we found this earlier in our trip.

An amazing happy hour menu featuring New Orleans local P&J oysters for only 75 cents each! Super fresh and juicy. I tried fried oysters at Luke for the first time - really good! Um and can't forget this minor detail - half off draft beer, wine, and cocktails. RUN THERE NOW.

This was my first stop in New Orleans and I'll always remember it--sat at the bar and was well cared for by fun, enthusiastic, and just-the-right-amount if attentive service.
