Ordered half a dozen oysters (YUM!) but a dozen came...they still only charged me for the half. Got crab and crawfish etouffee--this was the star of the show. Silky and rich and lovely. The crispy rice is a beautiful touch of textural difference. Ugh. I wanna go back. 

Ruined my perfect meal with bread pudding as suggested by staff. I get that it's a specialty, I get that it's typically highly rated...I just discovered that I don't love bread pudding. And after such a delightful couple of bright seafood rounds, a heavy ass bread pudding just wasn't right.  It that's my fault, I should know better.
5 star Shrimp and Grits. Worth every dime. Glad they were open when the rest of New Orleans was shut.
Went here right after they opened back up after COVID stay at home order. It was spectacular. Shoutout to Tanya who came by and made sure we were enjoying everything. We certainly were!

To go order: seafood gumbo, corn and crawfish bisque, bread pudding, and roasted brussel sprouts. 

4 stars with over 4k reviews, what could go wrong? Just about everything let's start with the worst dish, the seafood gumbo. The seafood gumbo can only be described as eating the leftover gravy from a smothered steak dinner. There was no seafood to be found in this dish only a few peices of sausage with a poor display of okra, DAMN Luke!!! Next up there was corn and crawfish bisque. This dish was more salty than I am right now it could have been a lot better, but there was crawfish so I guess that's a plus. The bread pudding is the only thing saving this place from 1 star, nice job Luke!!! The roasted brussel sprouts, a little too long on the roasted part. The first few layers of these tiny sprouts were complete ass...I mean ash. On the bright side someone told me they had the best burgers in N.O. don't think I want to find out.

Memorably, today's was the first sit-down restaurant meal we've eaten since COVID-19 shut down our adopted hometown, and Luke (333 on the Avenue) certainly did not disappoint in any aspect of our dining experience. We made OpenTable reservations upon the recommendation of two friends who had recommended Luke for their burgers, as we continued our quest for the best in the city. 

Tanya warmly greeted us from behind her mask, promptly showed us to our table, and occasionally checked to make sure that their quality standards were being maintained. Jesse quickly filled our water glasses, answered our menu questions, took our orders, and kept the experience moving right along without making us feel rushed. Gary arrived with our entrées soon after we finished our boiled and chilled and succulent--as well as really jumbo--Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp, served with delightful remoulade and shrimp cocktail sauces. Our friends had not misled us.

My wife's medium-ordered Luke Burger was served with a nice outside char and pink inside. The Swiss had beautifully melted, and because of the thickly sliced bacon, caramelized onions, tomato slice and crisp lettuce, there was no need for mayo, ketchup (the cute little bottle of which we used for dipping the fries--which were crispy on the exterior, with a lovely, flavorful, inside chew), or mustard. The burger was juicy without being greasy. While in the restaurant, our exuberance resulted in declaring it the finest burger in New Orleans; however, on further (unemotional) reflection, we agree that it is at least in the top three of the twenty or so different hamburgers ordered from as many different restaurants and cafés, out of the 88 at which we've eaten in the last 3.5 years. Congratulations, Luke, and we will be sure to let you know where you stand after we have retested the current standings in the NOLA burger trinity!

Also consumed was the Louisiana Blue Crab Garganelli, with saffron cream, creole tomatoes, wild mushrooms, chili, and parmesan, and I *do* mean consumed, as in almost inhaled. Al dente was the pasta, and the entire dish was exquisite. Upon our future returns, if we both order burgers, I'll also have to get the Blue Crab Garganelli to go--it's that good.

We are closing in on the end of this review, so here are a few words about our shared dessert, Brendan's Bread Pudding with vanilla bean ice cream and hot buttered pecan sauce. The two of us were unanimous in declaring Luke's to be the best (densest and tastiest) bread pudding that we have so far eaten in our tour of the Crescent City's culinary establishments.

Thanks to everyone who makes Luke one of the very best in New Orleans.

Just had a thoroughly enjoyable dinner with gf at Luke. We both had the wood smoked chicken and it was very good, not dry at all. And large half chicken portions. It came with potatoes and broccolini. All good. I substituted red beans and rice for the potatoes and could have made a meal of that. And we had a very pleasant bottle of Frech rose, reasonably priced. 

Service was excellent too. I can't recall the server's name but she moved to the city recently from Montana. We were too late for happy hour, so will need to return.

First dining experience in New Orleans since the reopening of restaurants. We had an amazing experience & spectacular service from Rich. He was very attentive and patient with us while deciding on our orders. We ordered the Stuffed P&J Oysters as an appetizer and they were amazing! The main reason we decided to dine here for my birthday because they are so delicious & unlike any oysters I've had before. Rich was also able to accommodate my needs for not being able to decide between two entrees & giving me a half order of each which made it perfect. Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp & Grits & Louisiana Blue Crab Garganelli. Both full of flavor & the best of both worlds. My boyfriend ordered the Crispy Softshell Crab which paired so well with the watermelon, cucumber, & tomato. He almost licked the plate clean! It was so nice to be in a restaurant again and really appreciate the friendly staff that made our experience so wonderful.

We had to find a restaurant last secound because another restaurant we had reservations at was closed due to Covid. Luke's was the best food and service we had the entire weekend get-a-way! We drove in from houston and came right in for dinner our first night. We talked about the food the entire weekend because it was that good!

First time here at Luke, absolutely delicious! The Brussel sprouts were a fantastic appetizer, definitely recommend. 

My boyfriend and I both split the crab pasta and burger meal- homemade noodles and sauce was to  die for.!!! Absolutely amazing!! The burger was delicious as well. 

The service definitely stood out, our waiter "richie rich" was hilarious, personable, and so attentive! I 10/10 will recommend to anyone, we will be back

The Fruit De Mer platter here is really good.  And when they have it on the menu, the best Choucroute Garnie you'll have stateside.  I particular enjoy the oyster selection as they carry not only Louisiana Oysters but Oysters from the Pacific Northwest.  Who doesn't love local oysters, but they're really one trick ponies in comparison to the variety and flavor of the infinite selections that thrive in the NW.  

The one thing I'll say about this place is the manager was really weird with us and made me think "How is this person in charge?"   We dropped in to take my MIL to lunch who works in the building across the street.  We were initially to go to the Pavillon but discovered they don't do lunch there anymore, so we said we'd give Luke a try.  We've been before, MIL hasn't.  So we drop in to see if we can get a table, but they were booked up.  That's fine, I've worked in the business many years as well, we knew this was the lunch rush and we were taking a chance, no big whoop.  But this manager kept almost like scolding us that we didn't have a reservation and kept repeating that we should have made a reservation.  Like, we heard it at least 10 times while we stood there because I was talking to a lifelong friend of mine who is a serve who I just hadn't seen in a moment.  And the manager was like "aw, you know him, yeah, I could've sat you in his section had you requested that when you MADE A RESERVATION, but you didn't make a reservation".  

We'll be back, because the place is still great if not for that one weird thing with the manager.

Our hotel recommended this place and we are so glad they did! It will be on our list of places to go any time we visit NOLA again. Everything we ate from starter to dessert was amazing. I can't eat much spicy or acidic food comfortably and they adjusted the blue crab garganelli for me. My husband had the shrimp and grits, best grits he's ever had. We would definitely order the spinach artichoke crab dip again, but the best part was the bread pudding. It was perfect. The service was excellent from the minute we walked in until after we were leaving. Do yourself a favor and put this on your list of places to eat in New Orleans! The place is clean, friendly, delicious food, and a great environment, not much more you can ask for!

I'm so glad I did not try the BBQ shrimp anywhere else, but now sadly Luke's BBQ shrimp have ruined it for all other restaurants, as they won't measure up. Richard and the team went above and beyond, the food and service was great. This will definitely be my come back to place whenever I pay a visit to this city
Came back for the bread pudding! The blue crab garganelli in saffron cream was loaded with crab meat and excellent!

Everything was amazing! Our first time going, and while it is on the more expensive side, I can't wait until we get the chance to go again. 

Their French 75 champagne drink was very delicious. We started with the spinach and artichoke dip which was filled with lumps of crab too! The toasted sourdough bread it was served with was the perfect compliment. 

My boyfriend ordered the Pecan Roasted Chicken and really enjoyed it. I got the Garganelli which was a bit spiced than expected but really great flavor rise and the noodles were cooked perfectly. We also ordered the crab ravigote which I would highly recommend! Perfect amount of horseradish and the crab was really fresh and delicious.

Recently, I have been here several times for lunch.  The Luke burger is excellent, the shrimp and grits is very good and a bit different.  The crab, spinach and artichoke dip appetizer is excellent and needs someone to share it with.  The chocolate dessert was fantastic.  And the service is always excellent.  Highly recommended.

Came in post Covid end of May 2020 for my daughter's 16 birthday. Read great reviews and wanted to support our local businesses. Every single entree was to die for! My favorite was the chicken and red beans and the pate! The staff did a phenomenal job with making us comfortable and always check on us. Will be back soon!!
Great food, great champaign and lovely people. All this during Covid situation - thanks a lot for being so good to us!

I will say the service and oysters were excellent so that is why I did not give it one star; HOWEVER, it says ON THEIR WEBSITE and the staff member that we called ahead that day to make reservations with TOLD US that Luke's happy hour special $.75 an oyster still applied from 3-6pm daily. We made the effort to call ahead to double check since they opened back up after the quarantine before we came all the way out there to eat. I went with a group of 4 people and we ordered 7 dozen oysters to split with some drinks, and the waiter says NOTHING about them changing the happy hour from everyday to just Monday thru Friday... so we get the bill and our mouths dropped. The bill is $120 over what it would have been for happy hour!!!! The waiter gets his manager who ONLY takes off $60 from our bill which still is $60 more than what it should have been. Somebody should have told us this difference before we ordered 7 dozen oysters....

We eat at Luke each time we visit New Orleans. It is directly across the street from the Intercontinental Hotel. We went for lunch and started with the watermelon and grilled shrimp
Salad which was both flavorful and refreshing. Our entree was the gulf puppy drum which is a very mild fish with a meuniere sauce on a mound of rice surrounded by a moat  of lightly sautéed tomatoes and fresh vertically sliced okra. All was delicious. We splurged and enjoyed the decadent dark chocolate torte. So wonderful! Service was excellent.

I wish I remembered to take pictures! The food, the staff and the ambiance were all great. 

1/2 of the tables were empty as they adhered to social distancing for all guests. They had signs advising that masks were required for entry & masks/gloves were required for staff. 

We ordered the spinach & crab artichoke dip w/grilled bread for the appetizer and it was so deliciously creamy. There were chunks of artichoke with a nice melted layer on top of the cast iron dish that it's served in. We also ordered fried oysters. They were piping hot & served in a mini deep fryer basket. Admittedly, I am not a huge oyster fan, but wanted to try new dishes on vacation. They were seasoned well and tasted like fried liver to me, so it you're into that, they will be great. My partner loved them. 

For dinner I ordered the Bacon Avocado salad w/grilled shrimp & it was oh so good. The bacon "bits" were huge and tasted great. They were a bit salty, so I opted not to eat as many when I reordered the salad (I ordered this 3x while we were in town). 

My partner ordered the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp & Grits & it was great as well. He's typically a heavy eater and wasn't able to finish his dish. 

They had a nice Pinot Noir (I don't remember the brand) that was great. Sweet, but semi dry. We were told that happy hour was closing & ordered 2 glasses of bourbon to wrap up our meal. 

The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because the table near us found a bug on the wall during our meal. The staff addressed it immediately & appeared to be very attentive to the couple who was disturbed by their uninvited guest. However, even they said, "you're lucky the food was so damn good." It really appeared to be an isolated incident & the staff seemed to take every necessary precaution in the reopening since COVID. 

Because they are directly across from our hotel (The Intercontinental), Luke was our go to for the entirety of our stay. We came back to order the salad several times, the Luke Burger, Dark Chocolate Torte & Brenden's Bread Pudding. All were delicious & packed carefully to go. This will definitely remain a NO staple for us.

I want to preface this by saying I've only eaten here once, but it left enough of an impact that I felt like I had to post a review. The fried chicken sandwich here is a spiritual experience. Sweet, a tiny bit spicy, and cooked to perfection, this is truly the best chicken sandwich I've ever had and maybe ever will have. I might order one for breakfast tomorrow, and one for lunch too. Seriously dude, it's that good. If you're in town and nearby, this place is an absolute must.

I had a really good time at Luke. It was a special occasion. The service was excellent very friendly. The table was socially distancing so I felt safe. Gumbo was good. But the bread pudding was the best! I would definitely come back.
Great food, excellent ambiance. Even better service. They are all taking this very seriously
This is a very nice French and creole restaurant in New Orleans.  The ambiance has a fine dining feel and the menu is really pleasing to foodies.  It's all about flavor and taste.
My favorite spot in the CBD for oysters, happy hour, French 75s made the correct way, and great service.  Geaux Luke!!

Went in for a lunch. Good Bloody Mary (Tito and tony) - I was able to customize my burger and replace the patty with grilled chicken which was great. My son had a BLTAE - excellent- duck bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado and egg. Looked beautiful and tasted great
Um.. it's ok if you like child sized servings.  This is what a bowl of gumbo looks like.  Including the rice it measured out to be 1.5 cups.  For $12 yet.
Delicious!! Great food from apps to dessert!! The spinach artichoke blue crab dip was amazing and shrimp and grits were too. Beautiful restaurant as well.
Attached to the Hilton hotel and great food! The service was a little slower than expected but we were seated distanced from other parties and our waiter wore a mask.

Haven't been in a while, but I always enjoyed it.
Bro. Those oysters. Those oysters bro. Those oysters.
It's a little pricey but I do want to go back when oyster season comes back around. I believe they have oyster specials for happy hour, but I could be wrong about that. Either way, place is great and worth it.
Bummer during covid. A limited menu, no flatbreads. I usually go for HH for the 50 cent oysters, now $1.50. Maybe again in the future they'll bring it back.

I almost never go to a restaurant twice when traveling, but have been to Luke 3 times. The atmosphere is great, the service is prompt and friendly, and the food never disappoints. 
We came for happy hour and the $.75 raw oysters. We were very sad to see that they are not currently having $.75 oysters for happy hour. But, with all the struggles restaurants are having right now with COVID, we were ok with paying $1.50/oyster. We had three dozen and an order of the Brussels sprouts. Was an excellent way to spend happy hour!
We usually love sitting at the bar, but that too is a COVID casualty. We look forward to returning to Luke post pandemic!

Great date night spot! I ordered the French 75 on their cocktail menu-- delicious! I ordered the shrimp and grits, super cheesy and loaded with shrimp and sausage. They followed all COVID guidelines and each table was spaced at least six feet or plexiglass installed between tables. 
Overall great food and atmosphere, the service wasn't bad but they weren't as attentive as they could be I felt.

Came here for an anniversary dinner. The service and food was great. All staff had masks on. The sweet corn bisque was amazing. The Louisiana shrimp and grits was also really good. The French fries were also super delicious...but for $6 they had better be lol.

I loved that crab dip so much! I can't even explain how amazing that fried chicken sandwich was. It was so juicy and crispy. This sandwich, crab dip, and oysters are definitely a must. The flavor of the sandwich was so delicious.. I'm missing my Luke lunch more and more typing this!

Don't trust the seafood display.  The oysters are very small "seed" oysters.  Worse, when I placed my order, I mentioned that I preferred "nice sized" oysters and the waiter said that they were nice.  Then after the oysters were delivered he just smiled and said that the seafood display was fake, empty props.

Came for happy hour and it did not disappoint. Our server was great and the food/drinks were amazing! Best Oysters my sisters and I had in NOLA. Sad to see we were the only ones here. We definitely came at a quiet time during Covid and possible storms. Looking forward to come back and visit NOLA when life goes back to normal a little. Will def be coming back here!
The food is somewhat overpriced for what it is.  The atmosphere is nice.  There are much better restaurant options in the city.

All the staff is super friendly and attentive. The oysters were good and the happy hour is a great deal. I was also surprised with birthday bread pudding on the house. Everything was great, but I docked off one star because the plates and glasses were stained from probably just being put in a dishwasher and not being properly washed.

Absolutely loved Luke !! The food was fantastic!!! Definitely will go back!! I chose a fried oyster salad to die for. Oysters were perfectly cooked in a light batter and fried to perfection and they love thick slices of fried bacon that was heavenly!!!!

Well, always a favorite so let's start there. The French 75 is always good and the oysters are always good. The food almost never disappoints. What did tonight was service. Fully staff, or don't open, or don't oversell when you don't have enough staff to cover. We love Luke, don't make us not want to come back.
Every time when I back to New Orleans for Thanks giving and I will take dinner there. I enjoyed to have a dinner with my family here. The food is very and and the price is affordable.

Richie Rich attended our table with lots of help and laughs for us Out of Town Folk. The food here is AMAZING! The Best dishes I think I've ever had!
Thank you to the staff for such Excellent service

Love love love! Everyone who worked here was sooo friendly but also the food was delicious! I came here for an early birthday dinner and everything was lovely! We started with the spinach crab dip as an appetizer and ordered a bottle of champagne. The dip was so tasty! I ordered the crab pasta and my friends ordered shrimp and grits and the mussels and fries. I really enjoyed everything! (Of course I sampled off of everyone's plate!!) We went to order another bottle of champagne and our server said they were waiting on it to chill so they gave me a complimentary bottle of a different type. That was so shocking and so sweet! I also got a complimentary bread pudding and it was melt in your mouth delicious! 10/10 recommend! Also, the raw oysters were so big and didn't have that fishy after taste like you get from some other restaurants!

The very few items on the menu are delicious. I would first recommend the bread pudding with extra pecans and the hamburger which tasted like smoked meat . The shrimp and grits had a twist that I never ate before which was added got sausage bites to it. It was really tasteful especially if you like spicy food. They can definitely add more selections to the menu but like mentioned before the very taste really good.
Best happy hour in the city! Servers are amazing and those briny oysters are amazing. Solid cocktails, too!

A coworker told me I needed to have Oysters while in New Orleans, and Luke's popped up on the radar. First off the staff is really friendly. I arrived during happy hour (which I had no idea of) but the waitress kindly told me so. They don't have the full menu currently but it was still a great visit 
I ordered the oysters and they were great! I also had the Burger medium rare, it was good but nothing extraordinary. I had the jumbo shrimp and grits , it was phenomenal. I was stuffed but I tried my best to finish as it was great. I also had the Brussels sprouts but I wasn't a fan of those. Overall the experience and food was great! Definitely wanna go back again

Literally so delicious. I got the blue crab au gratin to split as an appetizer with my boyfriend and it was absolutely to die for. Richie was helping us out most of the night and he has the best input for us. He was so incredibly helpful and we were happy to have him! The rest of the staff was extremely friendly as well, but we forgot to catch their names. The ambience was nice, you could show up dressed up fancy, but we also saw people dressed in jeans! Definitely recommend, delicious food, good vibes, and a friendly staff!

Sadly, I got only one picture after my visit to Luke. But it was really cool experience. I am not a regular at fine dining restaurants, but this one is really great. Reasonable prices for seafood. Good selections on menu. We got oysters, salad and duck. Food was normal. But again, after a visiting of this fancy place, I did get really exited. Maybe I need to be more mature for such a places. 

Thats the photo of Old Fashioned by the way.

Debating on 3 or 4 star review. I decided on 4 because the food was amazing! The crab dip and the mussels I got were FANTASTIC. I was very happy with my meal. The service, however, was lacking. Two things we ordered never never brought. The first was a soup we reminded them of before the entrees came out and didn't get until well after the entrees came out. The second was a mimosa that we ordered near the end of the meal. We never got the mimosa and no one checked on us so the next thing we got is our check, and we paid and left.

Again, the food was great. Maybe they were having an off night. I will try again in the future!

I'm from st. Tammany parish staying at a hotel close to Luke.
I ordered takeout of their duck duck rice. Opened the box to see a very small portion of greens with 1 duck breast - no rice at all!! The duck was half fat and so tuff I had to sit out strings of meat after every bite.
I called Luke's to ask why I received something different from the menu? I was told a manager will be calling me to resolve the issue, no one has called. $30,00 for this, it is not right. I'll go to bed hungry tonight, but everyone I know will be warned to stay away.

My favorite experience during my trip 11/6/20. We had the BEST TIME EVER! Went for happy hour the drinks were lovely, small plates delicious, the staff was so amazing, I cannot recall who served us but both people we so great. A guy with a very spunky personality, and a girl with an Afro. I even told the manager same night.

wow super super super overpriced, this place has nothing special , also their product not even fresh
order a blue crab dip, you'll see what i mean 
absolutely this place not recommended 
there's tons of places out side of downtown please look for them
Great meal, had the duck, it was delicious. Also had the Pate appetizer. Highly recommended.

Ordered here 2 of the 4 days I stayed in NOLA. The crispy Brussel sprouts & jump lump crab cakes & corn & crawfish bisque were my faves! My waiter was high energy and very pleasant & made our experience great. It's about a 15 min walk from the French quarter but so worth it!
Service and food were both divine! Fresh oysters, blue crab au gratin and the tartare were a few of the choices we had for lunch. I will be back!

My husband couldn't decide what to get from the menu. The fried Crispy Brussels Sprouts were delicious and the Butternut Squash Bisque was to die for. The wine selection was great also, they also had some drinks that were very interesting but after so many oysters we kept with the wine.
Wow !! Is an understatement. I was only in New Orleans a couple of hours !! This place is amazing the brunch is good big portions!! U have to have the fried chicken & red beans

My oldest son Jack and I we're on our way to Texas from North Carolina and had an overnight stay in New Orleans. We needed someplace where he could find a burger because he's a basic eater and I could find some complexed tasty foods. This was a fantastic place. I have no complaints. But because of Covid the quarter is extremely barren and boring. 
I'm ready for things to get back to normal.

First meal during our stay in NOLA and it did not disappoint. We came in on a Thursday evening and the place was somewhat busy, but we were able to be seated right away. Tables were spread apart. We lucked out in a corner so I felt comfortable dining indoors. 

Food was fantastic! We picked Luke's based on Yelp reviews and distance from our hotel so we are happy how it panned out. Oysters were large and fresh. I was surprised by the number of Mussels I got (felt never ending, but in a good way!) and the sauce was very flavorful. Our server did not hesitate on recommending the Shrimp and Grits and we thoroughly enjoyed that as well. Definitely recommend this restaurant to others!

Wow.  The power of good burger.  If you have a taste for a fantastic burger uniquely made this is the place. It's enough to share, comes cut in half with thick bacon, and is loaded with fries.  Located in the heart of downtown New Orleans Luke doesn't disappoint, even during the pandemic. Staff is wearing masks, tables are mostly socially distanced.  I also like the fact that several members of the Luke team waited on us, we never had to ask for anything... They were on point.
The menu is a bit limited but the items offered are some of their most popular!!
Food and service was great. Indulged in croque madam and it was delicious. The cheese was perfectly melted and the egg yolk was perfectly made. Would go again.

Came here pre covid with two of my friends and LOVED it. We came during happy hour for their drinks, apps and most of all.. OYSTERS! Service was amazing, food was amazing, just amazing all around. We came here twice within 5 days. Will be back here whenever I make my way back to Nola!

Dined for Thanksgiving 2020.  My nephew and I were touring the city and made reservations at this delightful NOLA gem.  I was thrilled with their kindness with my sweet babe, age 9.  They spoke directly to him, took his order and made small talk with him.  I am grateful to Luke's staff for making this day so special for my little guy.  I adored that they had a burger on the menu for him even though it was Thanksgiving.  He was thrilled with that and the tiny ketchup bottle.  :) 
I had the turducken, creamed spinach and the most magical mashed potatoes that have ever graced my plate.  From staff, to food to the unique decor this has become my new fav NOLA spot.

Always excellent food and service. I've always had a great meal here. Delicious entrees, tasty appetizers and tempting desserts always please, and servers are always outstanding. A favorite for takeout on the way home.

I like this spot, but the hostess was judgemental. I had a reservation,but she acted like I was a freeloader. I didn't have a mask, but there was a sign that they would hand out one if you're dining there. She looked at me and said I needed a mask. I said I saw the sign that they would give me one. She said it's only for customers dining here. Why would she assume that I was not dining at Luke's? I assured I had a reservation
I am very understanding but poor customer service I understand the owner is a vet and loves his Marine vets sad to say his staff is far from respectful "I am a former Marine and would not come back
This is my go to! Happy hour is great here and the food and service is always great! Shoutout to Miguel the manager for always taking care of us!

Finally got the opportunity to check out Luke. Modest brunch menu but what they do, it's well done. Enjoyed what was ordered. It's a bit pricey but is what you expect to pay for the area. Bill was even 100.00 that's including one starter, two entrees, my cocktail and  tip For two people to dine. The highlight definitely was the fried oyster salad. Oysters were cooked perfectly. Service was excellent and cocktail well made!

Excellent service, food was very good, menu is very limited, and way overpriced. If oysters is what you seek, this is their specialty. Fountain drinks come in bottles (Coke), so forget the free refills. The restaurant is located downtown, in the business district, so obviously they cater to business people who don't blink twice about paying $17 for a hamburger.

I came here pre-COVID and it was amazing. I can't speak to their entrees, but they offer HUGE $0.75 oysters for happy hour that insanely fresh. I would be satisfied with just these, but they also have fantastic fried oysters! During our 7 day trip, we stopped by here 4 times, that's how good the happy hour is. This is a must go for happy hour in NOLA!
The food was good, but the serving sizes were small.  The restaurant was clean and the staff were not overly friendly.
Amazingly  consistent excellence. Not a mediocre dish in three visits this week! The shrimp & grits are to die for as is the fried chicken and red beans.
Food was less than par. Disappointed that we chose this place on New Years Eve. At least they didn't make us pay for it.

You can't go wrong with Luke.  Fresh oysters and the famous Luke's Burger are must here.  The red beans and rice with fried chicken on Monday's are also a must.   I'm not sure if they still have Happy Hours during the pandemic, but if they do, it's great price for fresh shuck
Oysters.

We had seen the place on many visits to New Orleans because we always stay right across the street. We decided on our last visit to give it a try for happy hour and we are so glad we did! 

First of all, it's a nice place but approachable, not shorts dining but not suit and tie. Second do yourself a favor and ask if Richie Rich is working, what a guy, he won't let you go wrong and is an absolutely awesome server!

We had the Brussels sprouts, which I can say were hands down some of the best I have ever tasted in my life. Rich and flavorful while maintaining the integrity of a Brussels sprout. We also had the crab dip on Keto friendly shrimp chips thanks to our waiter. We also had a couple glasses of wine before we had to relocate for dinner.

I can tell you we loved our short time here and next time we're in the Big Easy, we will be dining here! It's amazing highly recommend!

I love this little French bistro in the middle of the city. The french fries with truffle oil are worth the trip. It has a great atmosphere. If you sit in the back you can watch them cook. If you prefer to sit in the front it's very cozy and you feel like you are in France. The food is delicious!

This place is great and if you're looking for some oysters and drinks between 4 and 6 the happy hour makes it a relatively inexpensive treat.   The PJ raw oysters are very tasty and a great deal. The Brussel sprouts are five star delicious and a must order if you're into brussels!!  The tuna tar tar is wonderful as well.  Decent local beer selection as there were multiple pale ales/IPAs to choose from. Great food with great service. 
Win win for sure

Amazing service! Our bartender serves the drinks with fresh strawberry lemonade, made to order. I recommend the vodka strawberry lemonade or the spicy margarita of you like spicy. The crab au gratin and the duck & andouille gumbo were really delicious!
One of my favorite spots when I visit NOLA. The crawfish hush puppies are ridiculous good and the drinks are superb.

I  am not a seafood person, I don't like fish or shrimp, and it has been that way since childhood. However, being in NOLA, I knew I had to try Oysters at some point. Luke's is a restaurant downtown in a hotel and they have an amazing happy hour deal with drinks and oysters. The service was amazing and the bartender really made me feel comfortable ordering the large oysters to give it a try. I shared it with a friend but I have to admit it was an interesting experience. I cannot speak to the volume if these are the best oysters in town because it was my first time trying them but from what I have heard it's great for the price that they offer. I think this is a must-visit location on your list if you are to ever visit New Orleans.

The starters & soups eehhhh you can do without. We weren't a fan of the BBQ P&J oysters at all. Not your "traditional" New Orleans Oysters at all. Shrimp & Grits -  by far the BEST shrimp & grits ever! The waffle was great also. The champagne in the mimosa is a better quality also. Doesn't give you that bloated feeling afterwards. Overall great experience.
You just cannot go wrong with Luke's. Covid safe and happy hour is still consistently fantastic. I'd be here every week if I lived here. Wonderful service and delicious.

I've never been disappointed in this restaurant! ORDER THE MOULES ET FRITES! You will not be disappointed! A huge serving of steamed mussels seasoned with chili, thyme and garlic and served with thin and crispy French fries! It's a must have! I also recommend ordering the crispy Brussel sprouts as an appetizer. They are topped with honey, almonds and a delicious cheese! The restaurant has such a great atmosphere and a wonderful bar serving delicious cocktails!

I had a visit to Luke twice in 3 days for the oxtail ragú. Our friends flew in from Miami as we told them how awesome the meal was just to have it. It's a complete must have with the black truffle, chunks of oxtail and an earthy flavor. The BBQ Oysters my hubby had both times and he loved them. The service was excellent both visits. It will be

I tried this place twice prior to COVID. Management and hostesses were rude and unaccomodating. The oyster shuckers and bartenders were nice and friendly. I might give it another try soon to see if it has any redemptive value.
Great food and staff. Really, the service is what the gold standard should be. The chicken sandwich and burger were great, but the Brussels sprouts are where it's at!!

Lukes was actually a saviour of a place on Valentine's Day for dinner. The place I thought I had originally booked I made a mistake so we booked Luke's as a last minute what a great mistake to make!

From the moment we got there we love the place. The turnstile door was a perfect portal into an amazing restaurant.

Being that we had to book our Valentine's dinner last minute we were eating at 5:30 which worked out in our favour as it was still happy hour.

 Our server Gary gave us great recommendations on drinks and informed us that the P&J oysters were part of happy hour at a dollar each.  These were some of the freshest oysters we've ever had and you could taste the ocean in every bite.

Next we had the tuna tartare are. Great flavour amazing combination of tuna avocado cucumber and jalapenos. Just enough heat to add to the overall dish.

My sexy hot wife ordered the oxtail which came over a bed of homemade egg noodles, wild mushrooms and with crispy kale mixed in for texture. Season perfectly with amazing flavour.

I had the courtbullion which was a tremendous mixture of oysters, crab claws, shrimp and redfish over rice in a very flavorful sauce.

 This was a perfect mistake to make him reservations for Valentine's Day as we had an amazing meal and would definitely go back next time we visit New Orleans.

The food here was spectacular! Delicious selection. Absolutely loved this place. We had the best service! Truly enjoyed my time here. I could not get enough of how cute this place was. Finished off dinner with a delicious cappuccino. Wouldn't have it any other way!

Decided to stop by on Valentines Day after reading all the good reviews. Ordered the BBQ Oysters. Didn't really care for them. My boyfriend had the fried chicken sandwich that he said was just ok. The Brussels sprouts and Oxtail Pasta were amazing! Drinks were a little watered down but service overall was great

The food and drinks were flavorful but the service and atmosphere negatively impacted the experience. The server didn't know how to describe the menu items to us and we had a lot off wait time during our dining experience as well.  The cleaner used on the tables also made it sticky. Ambiance is okay.

Luke was connected to my hotel, so after a travel day and working, I decided to eat here instead of going out. I was NOT impressed and wouldn't patronize again. The best thing about my visit was the glass of Malbec and the fact that they were abiding by social distancing protocols. I'm sensitive to slower business and lean staffs due to covid, but that shouldn't change service. As a lone diner, I was seated at a table for two. I sat for what seemed like longer than normal without anyone coming  to greet my table. I even started looking around for a server after putting down my menu (the signal that a patron is ready to order -- I was a server in high school and college). One server came to pour water only, gave a short greeting and that was it. But, I was surprised to hear him introduce himself to the table of three men sitting next to me. When the server finally came to take my order, again, no greeting or introduction, he started with "do you have any questions". I asked for a recommendation and he did a good job providing an explanation to help decide between my three choices. 

I ordered the shrimp and grits... it was ok, nothing exciting, not terrible, but I felt like it was missing some flavor. 

Finally, I asked for the bill and manager... I told him all of this above and he apologized. May seem like nothing, but again, being that I've been a server, I expect more. I'm a standard 20% tipper, this time, I left 15. I love NOLA and the food, but I'm rarely disappointed.
We came here for happy hour, enjoyed some beautiful oysters and a huge Croque Monsieur.thankfully we split it!! Great service and friendly staff.

Great happy hour and great service. The oysters were tasty, the beer delicious and the servers went out of their way to help each other and us.
Super classy place!!

Great Happy Hour from 3-6 serving freshly shucked Oysters or Fried every day of year. One the best French 75's you'll ever have is at Luke. 

The P&J Oysters, as well as the Mussels were such a hot during our happy hour visit we didn't get any pictures!

Walked in for Happy hour and the hostess was an absolute sweetheart! We were a party of 8 and our table was ready instantly. The $1 oysters on happy hour were delicious! Service was great. The Chicken noodle soup was the best I've had, ended up ordering 3. This is no chicken soup from a can. The drinks were delicious. A gentlemen who helped our table truly made our experience even more memorable. We were seated near the kitchen which is all glass and we can see into it. I would return to try dinner for sure !

Luke's is one of my go-to restaurant in New Orleans! I always come here for the happy hour oysters and drinks. They also have amazing entree dishes. 

2018 
Crawfish étouffée - OMG. This dish was so good! It was my first crawfish étouffée ever and it did not disappoint. The dish was made with crispy rice instead of the regular white rice. I came back here in 2021 but this was no longer on their menu. 

Shrimp & Grits - Also really good. Super creamy and loaded with protein and flavor. 

2021
Shrimp & Grits - I'll always order this dish if I see it on a menu in NOLA. I love that they always include jumbo shrimps. 

Slow Cooked Oxtail Ragout - This dish has to be on my top 5 dishes in all of NOLA. It comes with homemade pasta so soft and chewy. Cooked just perfectly. The meat was so tender, and even included truffle shavings, and mushroom fried kale.

Pate of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers - Such generous portions. Every side dish accompanied the pate very nicely. (Side dishes: mustard, pickled cucumbers/onions, & etc)

Amazing surprise. 
The char-boiled version of their oyster is a must try ! We went in for a quick family dinner and didn't expect much but we were pleasantly surprised! Kids friendly and very welcoming staff. 
Good selection including a kids menu made it easy for us. The crawfish flatbread was excellent as well. 
Drink menu was below average but we will definitely head back here for dinner

This is a great spot.  I stayed in the Hilton St. Charles that is located in the same building and had room service and happy hour here through out our stay.  The happy Hour us 1 dozen oysters on a have shell for 1 dollar each or 1 dozen fried oysters for 15 dollars and 1/2 price speciality cocktails, wine, beer, and wells.  The service is prompt and very well staffed.  You will want to make a reservation to ensure a table.  The is a great southern vibe and well ran establishment.

I enjoyed this restaurant. We came here during one of our many trips to New Orleans. We were recommended to visit this establishment by the staff at Hotel Monteleone, which is our favorite place to stay in the city. We tried a few dishes. I didn't take photos of all of them but the Brussels, oysters and cocktail shrimp were  delicious. My husband ordered some type of pasta that was very tasty as well. It is pricey to dine here but worth it. This is not your typical creole cuisine that you get in New Orleans either. Although they offer creole staples the menu has a spin on it. But it's  definitely worth the visit! Whoever the chef is here, is very creative! I will definitely come back. The staff was also very kind to us and accommodating to my infant .

AMAZING spot. It takes a lot for me to rate a spot five stars, so believe me on this one. The ambiance was impeccable and made it feel like I was in Europe. With the staff in their uniform, it was a great atmosphere and did not feel like New Orleans. Service was phenomenal and they were just the right amount of attentive. I came for lunch, which was great, but I can see this place being amazing for dinner as well. 

The A.B.V. was hands down one of the best cocktails I've ever had. I'm a whiskey sour kind of guy and this cocktail embodies that essence with a twist. The vanilla in it really brought it together too. The crab appetizer was amazing. The cheese was the perfect amount and the crab was good quality. The pork schnitzel was great too and was a hefty portion for what it was priced at. The mushroom sauce it came with made the dish, so definitely ask for more if you order it. Overall, an amazing restaurant and if I'm ever back in New Orleans, this will be the first spot I visit.

The oysters were so fresh almost like they caught them at the restaurant! We ordered matzo ball soup and it was just as good as my bubbe makes ;) me and my best friend addison got matching salads and im so deadass that was the sickest salad ever it was so fresh and delicious we actually ate it all! (addison has an eating disorder) i will dream about that salad for the rest of my life!

Went to this place due to it being across the hotel. Food was alright-not the best,not the worst. Would stray away from the Tuna Tartare. Service was not the best-had three different waiters and needed to ask a couple times to get a glass of water. I understand it's tough times, but still :/

During this stage of COVID, there is no seating allowed at the bar. We were staying in the hotel that is attached and wanted to sit to watch some sports that the hotel television did not get. We were willing to sit in the restaurant to see tv while we eat, but the bartender was NOT HELPFUL. She didn't know what type of cable there was (DirectTV, etc) so we couldn't tell her what channel and she seemed increasingly confused. So we left the very loud restaurant and opted for room service. We ordered two desserts (couldn't decide between the 2) and a sandwich with drinks. They forgot ALL of our drinks. That was a bummer. But they corrected it (poor delivery guy). The food was really tasty and I recommend you try the Gateau Breton!!!!

I loved the atmosphere of this restaurant. The staff were all very kind and helpful as well. Service was great and all were very attentive. I ordered the crawfish etouffee. It was my first time having it and I have to say I am hooked. It was so delicious. I will definitely return

Went to their happy hour because I heard they had 75 cent oysters by the half shell. Although disappointed to learn they're actually a dollar each, they were still great quality and well priced. I did prefer the oysters at dragos a bit more in terms of size and taste but these were a steal. The beers and cocktails were half off as well. The waiters were very attentive. Overall a great place to have raw oysters.

I am highly disappointed with the service and overall attention to customers. I went there with my family, waited 20 minutes even if I had a reservation and then they give us a table in the hallway. Do not recommend. Very bad place
My all time favorite place, happy hour included. Best appetizers, fresh seafood and amazing French 75's!

So I'm weird in the sense that I don't like fried food, because I feel like the oil just gets stuck in my throat after the first few bites and it feels weird. But omg, why is the fried oysters here so good? I mean, it's fried-food-good but it's not oily. What black magic is this?
Happy hour raw oyster $1/each, so fresh and big. The most valuable food. Crawfish Étouffée is tomato base with cream, high quality crawfish. Highly recommend.

This was my birthday celebration and another hotel guest said it was the best meal he had ever had. So we went. The menu is extremely limited. We were joking about how extensive it was. After reviewing the menu, my brother said he was going to order French fries(everything had French fries) and pudding! We asked our waiter if there were any specials to which he retorted, what you see is what you get. My husband ordered local oysters, which were billed as being large. Some were no bigger than a Nickel (okay less than a quarter but larger than a nickel) my sister in law ordered the PJ bbq oysters. There were four for $17. Pricey and you could not taste the oysters. I ordered the crispy Brussels sprouts. The saving grace was the honey drizzled on them. We all had drinks with our dinner. I ordered pork schnitzel ( menu had about five entrees and this was one)
Rather odd for a city known for Cajun food and seafood but nothing else looked interesting. The schnitzel was huge(two big pieces). Everything had French fries, which, I had no desire to have for dinner. I exchanged them for the cauliflower. This was barely warmed. The "mushroom gravey" came in a tiny container and was cold. My sister in law ordered the shrimp and grits. The sauce was thick, salty and obscured the taste of the shrimp.Our waiter filled water glasses but never asked how the meal was. He had words with (we assume), was the manager informing him he would not take any more tables to which the manager said that's fine because we are closed. Not something that helps digestion. We ordered another round of drinks. After a long enough period of time that the men in our group were going to cancel the order, a server(not ours) brought the men's drinks but not my wine. I asked if my wine was coming and the answer was no because they ran out of clean glasses! Now, most restaurants would have poured the wine into any acceptable container, brought it to the table and ask if I minded the same glass, explaining the situation. This young lady did not. I gave her my glass so they could "wash it" for future customers. She then asked if I wanted some wine in that glass. Too late not interested and done with the dismal dinner experience. Oh yeah, I forgot about boxing my meal. The manage boxed my meal. I asked to have the schnitzel and cauliflower boxed but not the gravy. He asked if I wanted new cauliflower. I said no just what I had. He boxed only my schnitzel and nothing else. I had to ask for cauliflower. For this wonderful meal, we paid 88 dollars before the  tip ( and yes, in spite of a bad experience, we still tipped the waiter)
Best burger in New Orleans!!! The staff was amazing and the wait time wasn't as bad as other places.

My family and I (4 people) came to Luke for Easter brunch. After having looked at the menu, the waitress came to take our order. My son (12) who was ready to place his order for appetizer and main course, told her what he wanted. My husband and I were not quite ready and needed a few more minutes. The waitress felt the need to say (referring and looking at my son): "well, he will have to take a chill pill".
This set the tone for the entire visit, bc that was not only rude, but unnecessary. My son wasn't loud, he didn't misbehave ... he was just eager to order his entire meal. A response like "I'll be back in a few minutes" would have been sufficient.
It's never ok for a waiter/waitress to put someone's child in check. 

This was an unpleasant experience and should not have gone this way. We were there for a special day, and will not be returning. 
I hope that after reading my review, the manager can have a talk with this waitress.
The shrimp and grits here were legit and the service was really good as well. Presentation of the food was on point. My Burger ws not seasoned.the bread pudding ws delicious.

I loved it. The place reminded me on one of those long Brooklyn restaurant/bars with tile on the floor. The oysters were beautiful and my shrimp and grits were the best. I cannot remember what my wife ate but other than the oysters it probably did not have many calories. Felt very comfortable with the covid separation.

We stayed at the hotel across the street and wanted a quick breakfast so we popped in here and we were glad we did! We started out with the blue crab Au gratin and it was fantastic!! Hubby had the seafood gumbo...awesome as well. I had the jumbo Louisiana shrimp & grits and he had the slow cooked oxtail ragout...both were amazing! Hats off to Luke's!! A bit pricey but very tasty!

I moved to New Orleans a few months ago and looking to go out to a nice dinner with my boyfriend and another couple.  After some yelp searching, we decided to check out Luke.  I will say, I would give more of a 3.5 stars than 3 but overall, we would most likely not go back but wouldn't be mad if we had to go back.  

Service - was hit and miss.  We didn't have one server, but anyone in a white coat could be our server.  Because of this it took a while for someone to take our order and check on as at moments.  We did have one server who I got the attention of that we were ready to order and then he didn't come back to check on us so we had to find another server to help.  The other servers were very friendly and attentive  but it was hard to tell who to go to when we needed something.  

Cocktails - were delicious!  and bartender was attentive

Food - the four of us split the grits and brussels sprouts - both very good!  Two of us got burgers, unfortunately very very salty.  One of us got the pasta oxtail ragu -  good, very heavy and filling.  One of us got the mussels - a big bowl of tons of smaller mussels - good.  We also started with a few raw oysters and they were yummmmy.  Overall the food was good but not outstanding or super unique.  

Atmosphere - a tad disappointing.  I thought it would be kind of a cool atmosphere for a little double date but the place was filled with tourists and families dressed very casually in t-shirts and shorts.  I felt like I expected too much coming into it.

Overall I would say a great place if you're a tourist staying downtown and want a solid place to eat without having to dress too fancy.  I would not suggest it as a "special" place if you're a local, but that's how I'm learning now that I moved here!

Luke came highly recommended by my cousin who's a foodie local in New Orleans.  This place didn't disappoint at all.  Love it.  The corn bisque, oysters, gumbo and the sprouts are so awesome! Will be here again next time in town.

When we used to stay at the Continental we would eat at Luke's every once in a while and didn't think much of it.  After we bought our condo we didn't have a reason to sample them in our dinner rotation.  Once New Orleans opened back up after the End of the World and every restaurant was booked solid with out of town visitors we decided to give Luke another chance - and we are glad we did.  The Brussels Sprouts are the best we've ever had and the chargrilled oysters are amazing!
I highly recommend the Shrimp and Grits! You won't be disappointed! It's full of flavor!

Spectacular! My husband and I had lunch at Luke for our honeymoon and the entire staff was amazing. They treated us with champagne AND dessert, which was completely unexpected. The pate appetizer was the best my husband and I have ever had (including in Paris and other parts of France!) Our waiter (I believe his name was Jesse) was phenomenal! There is not a single thing I would change about our experience at Luke. All of the food, drinks and staff were so wonderful. I highly recommend that you visit if you are in New Orleans.
Had take out while traveling. The appetizers and soups were a little salty but very good. The shrimp and grits were salty and very average. We would go back.

Overall a good place to eat.  We had a carry out.  Probably a better experience eating in.  Food was above average .  Tuna tartare was great. Soups were exception. Grilled shrimp and grits was average.  I'd go back.

I enjoyed this restaurant and recommend it 1000%! The food was delicious, The service was perfect, And they took us in on time for our reservation. My dad was familiar with the chef from the cooking network show that owns this restaurant. This was the last dinner we had while we were visiting in New Orleans and we were all very happy.

Absolutely delicious! My girl and I tried the Pâté of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers & Tuna Tartare! I am not a liver person but this dish was pair nicely and won me over. Kudos to the cooks in the kitchen!
Luke has the best wait staff and oysters. Their happy hour is awesome and their French 75 is the best!
Sensational oysters, drink sand the service is amazing!! This is a John Besh restaurant and it is stupendous!!
Great spot and classy place to eat. The chicken biscuit was the best I ever had and I've never seen grits like this. Must visit
Great fried oyster & bacon salad. Everything worked well in this simple but delicious dish

I have yet to be disappointed by any of John Besh's offerings. Coming back five years after my last visit, the happy hour is still great as well as the food. It's one of my favorite happy hours in the city and one of the best ones I attended on this trip. $1 oysters are better quality than other places we went to and the craft cocktails are excellent. I enjoyed both the ABV and the French 75, both very good. Also their weekday lunch special is fantastic value --now that August no longer offers their Friday prix fixe lunch I'll have to manage with this one.

Went there for breakfast and had the best fried chicken and biscuit I've ever had. It had a jalapeño bacon marmalade that elevated what should have been a simple  breakfast sandwich, to another level. Oh so yummy!

Rabbit and chicken liver pâté w/ grilled garlic bread. Then I was recommended the schnitzel by a local. Great food excellent service. However,as a solo diner,  I felt rushed.   Nonetheless, great place
We loved our meal, the ambiance and the excellent service by the wait staff and bar, who were unobtrusive but very attentive. Food was delicious, exceptional paté, our favorite.

If you are a raw oyster lover,  this is the place and still offering happy hour too.  Don't miss the fried oysters for a variety .  They do include some specialty cocktails and beer on the happy hour menu so make sure to order the French 75
CAN WE SAY FRENCH 75!!!!??? That's about I have to offer for this review. Get the french 75 and I promise you won't be disappointed. PERIODT!!!!

Had a late reservation and showed up there straight from our kayak tour. Felt a little weird because people were sort of nicely dressed. However, the staff was still very nice and friendly. It took about 10 mins for us to get attended to but once we did, the server was wonderful. He had lots of great suggestions too. We got the crawfish étouffée, cheesy jalapeño grits, shrimp, and for dessert the pecan maple butter bread pudding. The grits were so cheesy and good, the crawfish étouffée was very tasty, and the bread pudding was absolutely delicious. A must visit for when in New Orleans, but remember to dress nice.

I knew I would love this restaurant. 
One of My Favorite Celebrity Chefs is Chef John Besh and I fell in love with New Orleans when I read his cookbook...before I even came to this city.
The restaurant is classic in decor but cozy and welcoming.
The staff here are amazing and gracious, especially the elderly  sweet woman who walks around, asking if all is well. She is adorable!!
I never had raw oysters before, but ended up having 3 dozen!! They were amazing and so fresh and so sweet, I couldn't stop eating them
Cocktail drinks were great and we had one of the best bread puddings EVER!! It was an amazing mix of indulgent and comfort food all in one dish
We are coming back in a few months and this will be my first stop

Excellent service and delicious food. We went here for happy hour upon arrival in New Orleans and it was amazing. The PJ Oysters were so large and fresh and delicious . I absolutely could have eaten all 12. The fried ones were delicious too (but since it trying to be good I only ate like 3). Let talk about the drinks! FIRE!!! The bartender hooked us up!! I was literally tipsy off of my first Ponchatoula porch punch. I felt like a pirate (ahoy). I can not express how amazing it was, definitely try that punch. The service was excellent!!! Shout out to Gary. If you get a chance, definitely go visit Luke's.

One of my favourite spots for happy hour in the city, which runs from 3-6pm every day!! P&J Oysters are a $1 each and really fresh and sweet, although the fried oysters are my favourite. Their cocktails are also excellent (esp. door#3!!)
Definately worth a visit if your ever in the NOLA. We had oysters during happy hour which saves a lot of money. Drinks were great, and the server was awesome.

This place is top notch. Best oysters on this vacation. The service is Diamond level here. The entire staff works as one. Amazing service and some of the best fried and raw oysters in town. We also had thier trout which was perfection. Don't miss out on a true gem of a restaurant.

We went to Luke on a recommendation from friends, and I will no longer be asking those friends where to eat. They should call this place, "luke" warm, because it was an all around disappointment - from the service to the food. We went for brunch and it wasn't very busy when we arrived. Both hostesses asked if we had a reservation, which we didn't, but there were plenty of open seats. We were seated and waited at least 5 minutes to be greeted (mind you, there were a total of 4 parties, all less than 4 in the house). We were greeted by the busser, who later brought us water. We then waited another 5 minutes for our server. We ordered coffee and our meals, and waited another few minutes for our cold coffee to arrive. I ordered the buttermilk biscuits and the shrimp and grits, my hubs got 1/2 dozen oysters, and the croque madame. The biscuits were super disappointing. They arrived cold. (Insert shocked, sad, and disappointed face.) What good is pecan butter, if it doesn't melt when you put it on your biscuit?!?! I also asked for the strawberry preserves. Instead, lemon curd was brought to the table, it was not great all. It tasted like an ingredient, not a biscuit accoutrement. The server did eventually bring the strawberry preserves; they were good, but again, not really interested in any cold biscuit no matter what gets smeared on it. My husband said his oysters were decent. His sandwich came with fries, of course no ketchup was brought to the table. The sandwich was very average and warm but not hot. The sauce on top actually was very thick and seemed like more flour than anything else. The shrimp and grits had a lot of flavor, but again the meal was "luke" warm when it arrived at the table and it contained 4 medium-sized shrimp, and an extra tail with no shrimp attached, and a shit ton of sausage. It was flavorful, but the sauce to grits ratio was way off and again, why was it not hot?!? The meal was one of the more expensive we had for breakfast in the city, and I wish we had passed and will not recommend to others.

Make reservations ahead of time. Not your typical walk in restaurant, but more good for special occasions. It is super nice and the food is really good. The croque monsier was REALLY good. Brussel sprouts were good too, but crazy greasy. All in all would recommend.

Thank you for the amazing food. Came in with no reservation around 4pm. Wait staff informed us of specials still available HAPPY HOUR which wasn't on the menu. So we were still able to get half off drinks. This is my moms first time in the city and she has been planning for 12 years. It's her birthday and they treated her with upbeat attitudes, great atmosphere and a surprise from the staff. Highly recommend this establishment!!!
Fantastic oxtail pasta! Good helpful service. Split check on large table with no problems but my husband never received his side salad.

Horrible service. I don't know if we did something to cross somebody but we scarcely saw our servers. We spent almost three hours there and most of it was spent waiting. Also -- this place is super noisy. It would benefit them to add something insulating. I don't know. Uninspired ambience. It really felt like we were eating in a bar. And that would maybe be okay if some other aspect of the meal had blown us away but the food was only just adequate. And at the end of the night, thread messed up our bill so we had to wait to flag down our sever and wait again for a new bill. This was my very first meal in NOLA and I'm disappointed. At minimum, I won't be back. Photos of food included because it wasn't bad, so there's that.

We tried shrimp and grits and softshell crab. Each dish was flavorful. One friend in our party was vegetarian and there was nothing on the menu. The staff was very thoughtful and offered to just whip up something off the menu. That dish was just as great as any others on the menu!

We came here on Memorial Day for lunch around 12 PM but was told by the hostess that the next available seating would be at 2 PM. I could see the place was very packed so we decided to leave and come back later. I was able to make a reservation online for 2:30 PM so after walking around New Orleans, we came back to eat. I will say the food here is excellent! We enjoyed everything we ordered (oysters, pasta, jambalaya, and truffle glazed chicken - all delicious options!) 

The only thing that was a little disappointing was the service. You have one waiter that takes your order but we were told anyone wearing a white coat can help. Throughout our lunch, no one really comes consistently to ask if you need anything or to check on us. The staff were very kind, it just felt like we had to keep reaching out for things and didn't really have one waiter to go to. Aside from that, this is a nice place to eat in the downtown area, but I'd recommend making a reservation ahead of time just in case!

One of the best and most memorable meals I've had in New Orleans and in recent memory. We got the last reservation spot at 9 even though it says they close at 9 (their phone tree wasn't working when I called throughout the day). It's a mid sized place attached to a hotel, and it's fairly casual (people in tshirts and shorts) despite being a little more upscale. We started a half dozen with the P&J oysters which tasted very fresh and fishy but didn't blow me away - maybe I'm just not an oysters guy. We had had a pre-dinner beforehand and we weren't too hungry for a whole entree so decided to each get a gumbo bowl and then split the crawfish flatbread. The gumbo was very solid - very comforting and warm and satisfying. Great rich flavor. The flatbread was so good. The tomatoes had a fantastic flavor, sweet and savory and richer than any normal tomatoes. And the texture of the bread was perfectly crispy. Would definitely recommend getting this for an appetizer. We capped off with the bread pudding for desert which was phenomenal. The vanilla ice cream and the candied pecans were nice elevated touches but the real stand out is the buttered rum sauce. So damn good. An absolutely unreal desert and one I'll be thinking about for a long time. Overall an excellent meal and well worth the price. My only regret is that I couldn't eat more.

Truffle Glazed Toasted Chicken was to die for! My friend and I shared it, they played it separate. So juicy, cooked to perfection and the potatoes were spot on. Another friend got shrimp and grits and the cheese pull was a sight to see, nice size shrimp. We plan to come back!

We truly enjoyed our Anniversary dinner at Luke's. The food was excellent, loved the crawfish corn bisque, the P & J oysters were okay not bad. I had the soft shell crab which was delicious, my wife had the ox tails which she enjoyed. We truly enjoyed our Dinner and look forward to returning on future trips.

I'm so torn on this. 

First the food is very, very good.  The portions are kind of small for the price, but the food is very, very good. 

I went to get take out today, and they forgot part of my order.  So, I would normally let them know, but I wasn't treated well.  

The person up front asked me twice if I had a reservation, and I said "oh no, I have a to go order." There were two groups behind me.  The first group behind me looked more expensively dressed, and said "we don't have a reservation."  The person up front said "that's fine, we just ask it of certain people."  Anyways, I'm torn.  

Food is really good. 

Its overpriced for the portions on most items. 

The employees - not so kind.  I do get it - more people are out now, and I know restaurants are saying its hard to find people to hire, but I don't know.  I might delete this later.  

Thank you for listening.

I'm a huge fan of all things Chef Besh; he is a dynamo at menu creation and preserving the food heritage of the city. Having said that, I'm not above a fair critique of Luke. 

I can only get so many food opportunities in when we're in town so Luke has been on my bucket list for a while, waiting for the right time. On this stay, it was a short walk from where we were lodging and convenient for dinner after we got checked in. At 6:00 on a Wednesday evening the place was busy but not completely packed and we were seated promptly. The interior is beautifully comfortable, very French bistro-esque with charming black and white vintage tiles and gorgeous woodwork at the bar. Watching the staff was an exercise in fine dining perfection. The front-of-the-house manager and head waiter (I'm guessing) worked the floor with precision while also tending tables when needed as well as discretely guiding new staff on points of detail not to be overlooked. White-jacketed serving staff were welcoming, energetic, and polite and add to the posh old-school ambiance. 
In our particular experience this evening, there were just a few downsides. Despite amble wait staff, service to our table-for-two was fairly slow. It took a good 10 minutes or so to get our initial drinks after a bit of a wait for someone to bring water and take our drink order, explaining that So-and-so would be our server but he'd go ahead and get our drinks. Then another stretch of time before the (same) server came around so that we could place our smoked trout dip order, another stretch to place our entree order (same server), and another good wait before  my empty wine glass was noticed by the head waiter(?) and asked if I care for another. The trout dip was delish while just a tad over-salted, however to my hub it was perfectly fine. I usually ask him to weigh in to make sure as my tastes can be sensitive when it comes to saltiness; what is often very salty to me is well-balanced to others. It may due to back down on the salt to allow the diner to adjust at table, but I'm not going to be too critical here - overall, the dip rocked. The crackers served with were absolutely tasty all on their own and complimented the dip perfectly. 
For entrees, hubs ordered shrimp and grits and I went for the schnitzel. The S/G were very flavorful and decadent, however the amount of cheese used in the dish, while being a big selling point I'm sure, was absolute overkill imho and threw the balance off. Moderation on the cheese factor would make this dish outstanding. The gratin portion size is perfect for such a rich dish. My schnitzel leaned toward disappointment. While the flavor was very tasty, the pork juicy, and the breading substantial and nicely crisp, it was a bit over-browned and came sans a sauce/gravy of any kind giving it a dryness that a drizzle of a nice anything besides merely the juice of the grilled lemon half garnish would have improved. It comes served with a healthy portion of standard frozen thin-cut fries, another let down. Some good fresh cut side fries and a delectable sauce for the cutlets would make this dish shine. 
All-in-all I was almost in tears for finally getting to dine here and relished the fact that the slower service allowed me the time to take in the atmosphere and have a relaxing meal on our first night.

I decided to come here with my husband after a good friend's recommendation. Unfortunately, I am very disappointed from my overall experience.

I ordered the Pâté of Louisiana Rabbit & Chicken Livers, and it did not have all the truffles as seen on many photos on Yelp (I had four with mine, whereas most, if not all, had six truffles/assortments). In addition, I did NOT receive the bread either. I asked the waiter if any of the truffles and/or the bread was missing, and he rudely said, "Why would you trust any of the pictures or posts on Yelp? You definitely shouldn't. We change the menu all the time, you have to know that." However, he did get the bread for my husband and I after.

We also ordered "BBQ" P&J Oysters, Specialty Oysters and Citrus Cured Gulf Tuna Tartare. The food itself tasted great, but again, the service was lacking. 

For instance, the waitress would forget to get the refills of our drinks that we requested (water and Diet Coke) several times throughout the night, to the point where we had to keep reminding her and eventually another waiter. Overall, service could be better, and the waiter could have done without the rude comment.

My husband and I decided to have a late evening dinner at Luke's since it was right across from our hotel.  This visit turned out to be a horrible mistake.

The restaurant was fairly full for the late evening hour.  Our host attempted to seat us tightly between two other tables.  We asked and received better seating at a nearby table closer to the entrance.  

After perusing the menu, I settled on the chicken, broccoli and potatoes.  My husband ordered the shrimp and grits thinking that we haven't been any place in New Orleans where this dish wasn't a winner.  Both of these entrees were $26 each.

When our meals arrived, I had a nice size half chicken, potatoes with plenty of broccoli.  Everything was nicely seasoned and quite tasty.  However, my husband's shrimp and grits was a big embarrassment. It came in a side dish portion.  Basically,  it was about five teaspoons of grits with five tiny shrimp on top.  He said the taste was pretty good but the portion size was ridiculous for the price.  He had to request some bread to supplement the entree.  I even shared some of my meal so my dear husband wouldn't leave the restaurant hungry.

We had two servers for our table and no one was really checking to see if we were okay.  Just before receiving the bill, one of the servers came to refill our water glasses and my husband used this opportunity to complain about his meager meal for the price we were paying.  The server seemed quite disinterested and said that she doesn't set the prices.  At no time was she apologetic or offered to bring anything else.  She did say she could send the manager.  She did not follow through with relaying any of his concerns to anyone.  A good server should have taken some sort of responsibility for her table.  

By this time, my husband was totally annoyed and asked for the bill so that we could leave this sorry excuse for a restaurant.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AT LUKES!  There are too many good restaurants in New Orleans to settle for this nonsense!

I've been twice. Once to dine in and once for takeout. Food and service were amazing. My first visit I had some briny oysters, crawfish etouffee and a great glass of wine. Service was super professional and warm. The next trip I grabbed the Fried Chicken Sandwich and the Crawfish Corn Bisque. Everything about the sandwich was spot on the bread, the cook toppings and fries. With seemingly every restaurant in in America having a Chicken Sandwich on the menu this was set apart. They did a great job with the to-go packaging as well. When I got back to my hotel everything was still hot and fresh.

Another great place we went to for oysters. Ridiculously fresh and happy hour is a great deal. Honestly probably my favorite place that we went to on our trip for raw oysters and I would highly recommend anyone to try it if you're like us and came here to eat several dozens.

best meal we had in New Orleans by far. everything was superb.

made reservation for a party of 6 and was seated promptly. restaurant shared the same building as Hilton Hotel. very clean and neat.

we did family style and ordered a bunch of stuff
- 1 dozen of P&J oysters
- half dozen of Jumbo Shrimp
- half dozen of Peruvian scallop
- crispy brussels sprouts
- fried oysters
- Oxtail ragout pasta
- Moules et Frites

oh boy, i don't know where to start, because everything was that great. service was excellent too. ordered a few drinks and we enjoyed the drinks as well.

will i come back? 6 yesses from our party.

My wife and I came across this restaurant by accident and I was happy that it happened. We were trying to get into a restaurant off of Bourbon Street in the French Quarters. All the restaurants had over a hour wait time and we were starving.
So we wondered around outside of the French Quarters until we came across Luke. 
They were able to seat us right away and their service was speedy. The food was fricking great and we've never had Cajun food before. We shared the Seafood Gumbo which was yummy with shrimp, sausage and oysters. My wife had the Shrimp and Grits and I had the Truffle Glazed Roasted Chicken. Must have the Pudding Bread for dessert.

Good service! Nice people. Lots of options. Just didn't personally like the food enough. We ordered chicken/rabbit pate charcuterie plate, raw oysters, and something else but I can't remember.

I love raw oysters, but these were huge and kind of gross tasting. The best oysters are the smaller sweeter ones (an example is kumamoto). Obviously, they don't have that type of oyster in Nola, so not their fault. It's just hard to enjoy it after having raw oysters elevated in izakaya restaurants with ponzu sauce, chives, and tobiko. We both didn't like the oysters, so we had to leave them. I felt bad that they had to die for no reason, oh well :/

I usually LOVE pate, but I think the rabbit added a strange taste to the pate which made it less appealing. It was definitely worth the try though! I love trying new and unique foods.

By far my favorite meal in NOLA. Received a lot of recommendations to come here, so my group dashed here as soon as we arrived! 

Luckily we made reservations and caught happy hour. P&J oysters were going for $1 each and drinks were 50% off! The oysters are easily one of the top 3 oysters I've ever had in my life. They were huge and creamy and super fresh tasting. All the cocktails we ordered were really good and enjoyable! 

As for the entrees, we ordered the crawfish etouffee, shrimp and grits, soft shell crab and mussels. The crawfish etouffee is a must get. That was by far the best dish I've had in Nola. There was a generous amount of crawfish in every bite and the burst of flavor was absolutely delightful. Shrimp. + grits were good and cheesy! There was also an abundance of shrimp in it. Soft shell crab was also a solid choice. There was a hefty amount of crab. Could've done without the mussels though to be honest. 

Service was also good. They were quick and attentive! All in all, I highly recommend this spot. It's the one restaurant I definitely would've gone again in Nola.
Great spot to grab a bite. Excellent oysters and beer. The staff is very courteous and they even have a couple TVs if you're trying to catch a game

These are the biggest, freshest, meatiest raw oysters you'll ever have. Best happy hour in the city, one dollar for these massive oysters, worth every buck. You'll also find one of the best burgers in the city here.

First time in New Orleans and I got to say this is the best place to go! Mouth watering food/drinks and AMAZING service :) Our server Richie Rich made our dining experience even more enjoyable! Make sure to see if he's working #Nashville/CaliGurlz
