I was a guest at Hilton and this restaurant was located onsite. First impressions: I was not asked what I wanted as I sat, not even water, just an empty glass at the table. I had to ask an employee cleaning a table to help me get the waiter. So not a great first impression. When I placed the order, it did arrive quick which was a plus. I had the crawfish etouffee. At first sight, I was disappointed at the quantity for the price. Was really small and I was done eating in like 2 minutes. Lol. However the taste was alright. I also had to ask about the dessert, waiter did not offer or ask if I was interested in dessert. However I loved the bread pudding. The cold Ice cream and warm pudding made for a nice melt in my mouth. If you like pecans, you'd love the crunch as well. I loved the ponchatoula punch. Well balanced and sweet. Rating 3 stars because I don't think I got a bang for my buck with the entree and the customer service was less than ideal.
Luke was amazing with great customer service! The food was great and so what the staff! Shrimp and grits are the best I've had and the bbq oysters are tender and well flavored..

Unfortunately, there was a bit of an initial mixup with my party's reservation and schedule. However, the waitstaff and manager at Luke did a phenomenal job to make sure our experience was outstanding. Plus the food & drinks were amazing! Everyone was so kind, personable, and brought a lot of joy to our evening. We wanted to give a HUGE shoutout to "Ritchy Ritch" (pictured), as he went above and beyond our expectations in taking care of us! Definitely recommend paying this spot a visit in NOLA.

This place was wonderful. We stayed at the Hilton St. Charles. We came to breakfast. The architecture was amazing. The brunette server was prettier than Brittany Spears in 1997 and sweeter than sweet tea. The gentleman with the really short hair was gracious and also provided great service.
The crawfish omelette was amazing and my Dad let me try their grits. Coming from California, I am not very familiar with the grits. These grits were amazing and my Texan father agreed.
I usually don't write reviews but being in the industry I like to acknowledge wonderful service. Hope to come back soon!!!

We stopped in for a quick lunch with our family on the way to the airport. It was a gorgeous space with easy parking. The staff were all so pleasant and the service was great. Food was very good. We had oysters for a starter and then lunch fare. The chicken sandwich was everyone's favorite along with the madame.
Higher end cost but you get what you pay for! If you're looking for a more formal dinning experience this is the place. Cuisine is the creole you're looking for and the quality is equally matched.

Probably my least favorite meal in Née Orleans. My mussels were overcooked, bland and fishy. Tried a couple other dishes at the table, the crawfish étouffée was delicious but everything else was middle of the road. Not particularly good or bad, just middle of the road at best.
The food was good but the waitress never followed up and I got sprayed with the disinfectant for the table next to me.

I can't wait to come back here. They have an amazing happy hour, lovely service topped only by their amazing oysters (excellent raw and fried). We also loved the cocktails... The French 75 was strong and delicious, the Dr. Orders was an amazing Fanta-like boozy drink, and the ABV was excellent as well.

Shell yeah! We came here for happy hour at the recommendation of my sister and her fiancé and the hype is real. We had our fill of raw and fried oysters and kept the drinks flowing. The oysters were so fresh and briny - honestly the best oysters I've ever had. The drinks were really tasty and strong. Their specialty drinks were half off - great deal for good drinks. The service was also impeccable - our waiters were very friendly and attentive. Special shout out to Chef Rich who came and checked on us throughout the night! Honestly shook that they have happy hour daily. Can't wait to come back! Luke, you are my father now.

Definitely a popular hit with locals because this placed was packed when we got there. I do recommend getting a reservation, especially during happy hour. The oysters were a good size and fresh. My favorite were the Peruvian Scallops, which I recommend any seafood lover to try. It was packed with flavor and a kick. I will definitely be back to Luke for HH again!!

The Happy hour 3-6pm daily is one of the best in the city! Happy hour includes half off oysters, signature cocktails, wines by the glass and beers. What more can you ask for? 

Get a couple dozens of the raw oysters and the fried ones too; they are both fresh and delicious!

The French 75 is what they are known for so try it. It's very yummy and a little on the sweeter side. If if you aren't keen on the sugar, get the blanc de blanc because it pairs so nicely with the fresh oysters and super refreshing.

Skip the gumbo. Order a juicy burger to soak up all that alcohol - you won't regret it! 

Overall, we had a wonderful experience Luke and cannot wait to come back!

Amazing food! So good I had to go two days in a row on a two day trip to NOLA. The main thing I went back for was the Peruvian Scallop, my god, so yum. Bread pudding was also fantastic. The only issue I had, which doesn't take away from the rating is the second night I ordered coffee with my bread pudding and it never came. The waiter apologized and removed it from my bill (the coffee in the pic was from my first visit).
Everyone was so friendly, and the food is insanely delicious. Definitely order the truffle baked chicken!

Although this is an oyster house, we didn't actually have any. Instead we opted to try the Peruvian scallop. The flavor of the citrus and toppings went well together/was a good bite, but it overpowered the fish and I couldn't tasted it all. Makes for a great presentation though. 

We both got fish - swordfish with eggplant and trout almandine and we both were really happy with our selections. Custom cocktails were good too. Staff was pleasant and friendly. The table next to us got an extra/free order of the Brussels and they looked AMAZING. Very good portion size and stuff on top to justify the price. Would definitely try them next time. 

All in all a good experience, not a 5 star because of how crammed in the tables were. We were at a 2 top designed for us to sit across from each other, but I actually moved to the corner so that the waiter had space to get to the table behind us. If you're still wary due to COVID maybe sit at the bar or wait a bit longer.

Best meal that we had in NOLA. Probably best meal that I have had all year.

Their version of gazpacho was heavenly-highlighted with fresh cherry tomatoes.

The shrimp ettouffe (sp) was a delight.

The Luke salad included super fresh and crispy chilled Bibb lettuce with delicious beets, cherry tomatoes, and cucumber. The sunflower seeds and soft creamy dressing were nice touches.

The grilled BBQ oysters were good. The gumbo was average. 

We enjoyed grilled broccolini and brussel sprouts, the later was dressed nicely and perfectly crisped. 

The staff was amazing.

We had breakfast here today. It was better than I expected. The shrimp and grits was the most flavorful I've ever had and served with two perfectly cooked sunny side up eggs on top. The bourbon punch is the southern brunch cocktail of my dreams. The coffee was strong. The service was exceptional. The place is intimate, but not so that you can hear conversations at other tables. I wish we could go back several times.

Lüke Restaurant is consistent with their food: fresh, prepared as requested, the correct temperature, and served up in a eye-pleasing fashion. However, what is inconsistent is the service by the hostess. I visited with a party of three on July 8, 2021 at 1:30pm for lunch and the hostess was a complete disaster. We walked through the door right on time. The hostess never once greeted us. Instead, she glared at us while wrapping up a conversation about future reservations with a customer on the phone. It would have been understandable EXCEPT she stayed on the call for five full minutes (unacceptable). When I finally said, "excuse me, would you please call someone to get us seated" the hostess rudely retorted that she's the only one seating parties. I asked her to please put the call on hold and seat my party. She rolled her eyes, grabbed menus and quickly shuffled us to a table. No apology was extended. Unacceptable. Once seated, our party enjoyed both the burger and the chicken sandwiches, all accompanied by thin, crispy, and delicious French fries. The buns were toasted and the meat was seasoned well. The food experience was exceptional, as usual. The hostess situation left a lot to be desired.

Saturday night in Nola without a reservation. Tried Tranese across the street and was unsuccessful. We saw Luke across and thought we would give it a try.  Tried to make small talk with the hostess, without much luck.  She offered up a seat at the bar which my friend was not up for.  Said the wait would be an hour and a half for a table.  We were about to leave, and the manager called the hostess over, she said they could accommodate us, not sure what changed.  We were whisked away and seemed like we were heading for the kitchen.  The restaurant appears to be divided into two sections, we ended up in the rear section which overlooks the kitchen.  Which was o k as the restaurant really doesent have a view.  You could tell that the restaurant has been able to adjust for the throngs of people looking to dine post Covid.  But everyone there was hustling and commited to providing a good experience.  
We settled in and ordered a couple of cocktails.  And we're going to start with cooked oysters from the shared plates menu.  Until we learned it was $17 for 4 oysters.  We told the waitress that we needed a minute and she seemed irritated and said she would be back.  This may have been a mistake as we didn't see her for 20 minutes.  Once she got back we ordered we opted for half a dozen raw I think they called it PJ oysters, 2 cups of gumbo and as entrees my friend had the chicken and I opted for the pork cutlet.  
The food came quickly we got our oysters and soup at same time, I would have preferred a little bit of separation of time between oysters and soup.  The soup was good but Luke warm.  Oysters were fresh and tasty and $11 for a half dozen which I thought was reasonable. 
Entrees were large, could easily be split. My friend got a half chicken, nicely crisped potatoes, and some type of greens. Presentation could have been on larger plate, and chicken could have had a little more gravy but was tender and moist.  
My pork had two large breaded patties and a ton of perfectly cooked fries.  Both were on the well done side which I loved.  
Normally I would rate this a 3 to 3.5 star experience. However given the fact that manager got us a table, they were understaffed but everyone hustled, the food was tasty ,  with large portions and fairly priced I'm giving them 4 stars

THE SERVICE IS AWESOME! 


I came here on a Friday night to catch the end of happy hour and get some dinner. Our server was Richie Rich and let me tell you, he was the most considerate, kind, and funny server I have had in a while. While the food was good by itself (the brussel sprouts were delicious!!) the service made the evening!  Rich gave great food suggestions, served with efficiency and speed, and made us laugh the entire night! We will be coming back just to see him!!

I heard about this place a few times so I had to try. The food was not on the level I had expected but it was good. Our server kind of forgot about us in the end. Gave us our check and never came back. I'm know that businesses are suffering right now because they can't find help. I will try again when this crisis is over.

New favorite happy hour spot:
-Amazing oysters for $1 each
-1/2 off cocktails including their AMAZING French 75
-New favorite bartender (see pic!)
Come early (starts at 3) because bar seating is limited- 
Guy next to us ordered the most beautiful burger I've ever seen so we are going back for that (it's $18 and when you see it, you'd pay more!)
We ordered the tuna tartare with shrimp chips and 3 scallops app as well and they were both fantastic!
Bartender was hustlin- busier than anyone else in the room so we tipped accordingly and he was fabulous

Celebrated a birthday with brunch today. Great service, our water glass and drinks were never left empty. Food was amazing with huge portions and one of the best sazeracs we've ever had. Make sure to try to Brussels sprouts, they are addictive and if you're nice they will give you the recipe! We will definitely be back.

My favorite restaurant. I typically come here for friends birthdays with 10-12 of the guys. They're very accommodating and are a lot bigger inside the restaurant than what You can see. The food is unique and very professional too. So professional that I'm going on a first date here soon :).

DELICIOUS! Their servings are big (and so good) so they're honestly worth the price. Our server was extremely friendly and it was a nice place, with good lighting and olympics on the bar TV, which we could see from our table. Only downside was that our table was a bit too small to fit everything we ordered! The brussel sprouts are amazing!! Raw oysters were delicious, as they often are in Louisiana. Tuna tartare is 10/10, as well as the peach & goat cheese flatbread.

This place was delicious!

I was in town for a conference with my team and this place came highly recommended. It was easily walkable from our hotel, which was nice.

The inside is awesome but not too big, so I would recommend making reservation to ensure you get a table without waiting.

The food is amazing! We started with the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer. They were delicious and it was a large bowl of them, which explains why they are an app and not a side.

For an additional app, I ordered two scallops from the raw bar. They were fresh and delicious.

Most of us ordered the shrimp and grits for our entree, but one person ordered the étouffée. Everything was incredible! We all loved the grits. Very creamy and a lot of whole shrimp. I also ordered the broccoli as a side and it was excellent. My coworker who ordered the etouffee loved it, but said it wasn't enough food.

I would definitely recommend this place and go back there again.
Awesome & polite service. Great food & beautiful atmosphere. Small drink selection, but lots of delicious eats

Amazing service and food. We had a party of 10.

#1 shrimp and grits
#2 Pork
#3 oysters
#4 ox tail

However, everything was incredible.

My wife and I had dinner here on August the 10th. Our waiter was "Richie Rich". He was Excellent!!! It was "Coolinary" month with a nice selection of food. I had the pork schnitzel which was cooked perfectly. We started with brussel sprouts and the serving was HUGE. Overall an enjoyable experience and LUKE is definitely one of our "top tier" restaurants in NOLA. Signed....PappaGeorgio
Went for the butter cake and ended up with a scone. I wasn't satisfied. The staff was pleasant

Hi! 
My mom and I had breakfast here a few weeks ago. The hostess was  but the service was great and the food was EVEN BETTER! 

YUMMY  ‼

 Shrimp and Grits 

Louisiana shrimp, farm eggs, andouille sausage, jalapeño cheese grits

Southern Breakfast

two eggs cooked any style, Allan Benton's bacon, sugar cane sausage, buttermilk biscuit, grits

Check them out 
Rating 






#food #nola #foodie #rivvaeatsnola #delicious #nolafoodie #foodporn #yummy #foodiesofinstagram  #shareyournola #nolagram #instafood  #neworleansfood #brunch #instagood #love #photooftheday #happy #shrimp #foodgasm #wherenolaeats #whereblacknolaeats #summer #nolafood #neworleansfoodie #yum #delish

The food was incredible but the service was UNMATCHED. Richie Rich made our dinner unforgettable and was the sweetest, most thoughtful waiter we could have asked for. We'll never forget this experience, it made for the perfect night!

The food is pretty good. I've been numerous times and the French 75 is my go to cocktail. The oysters are not your traditional chargrilled oysters, however, they are absolutely delicious.   The gumbo is amazing because they actually put duck in it. Lastly, I will say order a burger. It was perfectly cooked and super moist. Again, I have never had bad service.

This place was really good and it was a lot bigger than I thought it was.  We had reservations and were seated in the back right next to the kitchen as we watched them cook all the food.  The restaurant was busy and crowded and the service was nice and attentive.  One thing that we didn't enjoy too much (nothing against the restaurant itself) was this party of women across the room from us, and I swear one of the women had a laugh similar to a witch's cackle.  It was hard to enjoy our dinner when she was going off every 5 minutes.  No hard feelings for people enjoying their own dinners and having a good time but I wish they were more mindful of being inside around others.

We had the crispy Brussels sprouts to begin and they were roasted to perfection.  We shared the slow cooked oxtail ragout with a side of the baked jalapeno cheesy grits.  All of the food was so good.  The oxtail was tender and the grits were also so tasty.  I would come here again to try other items off of the menu for sure.

Luke
When it comes down to it, New Orleans has many different flavors of food to offer. We are most distinctively known for fresh seafood, soul food and of course Creole and Cajun cuisine. @lukeneworleans is a Creole inspired brassiere located right in the CBD. Now while it's known for happy hour every day and fresh seafood, I took a different approach and went for brunch and honey, they did not disappoint.

 The very first thing I enjoyed about their menu was the variety. The menu was well balanced w/ both breakfast and lunch items, but didn't overload the guest with too many options. My drink of choice was a French 75. The presentation was great. Cognac glass, lite fizzle and a highlighted 75 to finish it off. And yes, it tasted as good as it looked. 

 Now let's dig in! For starters, I ordered the "Crispy Brussels Sprouts" and the "Cast Iron Cinnamon Roll". I truly enjoyed both. The brussels sprouts were fried perfectly w/ toasted almonds, espelette honey and crumble cheese. Oh but the cinnamon roll was fantastic! The candied pecans were a perfect touch, the Creole cream cheese icing was irresistible. The entire cinnamon roll was just so soft, gooey, and warm. I had to stop myself from eating it all to make sure I had room for my meal.

 For my main course, I let my server choose for me. He surprised me with "Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp and Grits". Man he did not let me down. This order of shrimp  and grits  was a little different from what most restaurants offer. It had a tomato  base, roasted jalapeño  cheese  grits, andouille & green onion. The amount of heat from the sausage was perfect and the dish had all of your traditional creole flavors, topped off with flawlessly cooked shrimp . My date had  the "Croque Madame". It's very similar to a ham, egg, & cheese  sandwich, except the egg   is on top of the sandwich and sunny side up. I would suggest a knife and fork for this cheesy, yolky, goodness. 

 The server was attentive & knowledgeable. The vibe was nice and the location is fair. If you're not from NOLA, just a little hint, it's not spicy, it's only full of flavor! 
Overall 
Food, Service, & Atmosphere
Very good brunch and service. Classic southern Louisiana ambience. Had the chicken and waffles and cast iron cinnamon roll and both were deliciou
Great menu, but our office favorite is a burger with Brussel sprouts - they do a great job with all seafood and Cajun food as well

So we went to Luke because it's around the corner from our apartment building. I'd heard the burgers are good so I was anxious to try one. Sadly, I didn't like it at all. It was undercooked and had very little flavor. I was happy with the Fried Oyster Salad, it was amazing. The hubby said the chicken sandwich was good. 
Great staff. Very attentive and polite. 
Very loud.

My friends and I have decoy that this is must each time we come. Definitely take advantage of the happy hour on Friday. We initially stopped in for something and we're pleasantly surprised by the delicious French 75s. They were half off for happy hour. The bread pudding was really good. The ice cream comes directly on it. Which I feel was too much for me. Next time I'm definitely getting it on the side. Our waitress Savannah was great! She was so nice and attentive.
If you're in the CBD, I'd recommend going here for their oyster happy hour - otherwise, pass.
Great local food and drinks. We loved everything. Super cool they do happy hour on Saturdays too!

Wonderful experience! A dozen of us  showed up for oysters and had a great time. Even though we pestered our server Savannah often, she was skilled, efficient and very pleasant! The fresh, sweet, local oysters were as good as Savanah's service! Great combination.

Came here for lunch one day while visiting NOLA. Best meal the whole trip. We all really loved our food! I had oysters and my partner had a croque madame sandwich. I wish I had this restaurant close to me because I would be a regular without a doubt!

Went to Luke's with a large party and I understand that 10 people is a lot but I've had much better service with large groups at other places.  It was also a Sunday brunch so they were very busy. The hostess took 20 minutes to seat us when we had a reservation. They couldn't properly split the bill, we even split in to 3 separate groups to hopefully make it more manageable but everyone had each others orders on other bills. There were up-charges on substitutions with out being mentioned when ordering. The martinis were beyond overpriced. 
Overall, it was a very underwhelming experience for mediocre food at best. Very disappointed. Hopefully in smaller groups the experience may be better.

The Burger was super juicy and tasty.  It was good.  The Brussel sprouts were a little bitter.  Nice casual spot downtown with upscale service.  The only problem was that we had a few gnats flying around our table.

The bread budding was so good!  I come here for the oysters, seafood, and dessert.   Luke has a great wait staff and the quality of the food was amazing.  Make reservations if it is on a game day.  We could not get in for dinner and the wait time was quite long for lunch was over an hour when Tampa Bay was playing the Saints.  We came back the following day to dine here for lunch.   Just as tasty as I remembered it from the last time we were in town!

1st offical meal in New Orleans and it was amazing. I had the shrimp and grits and my daughter had the seafood gumbo. We finished with the bread pudding. Everything was amazing. We went on a Thursday afternoon and there was no wait.

This place offered up the perfect bistro-style brunch.  I had the best Croque Madame I've ever had- thick cut bread, piles of delicious smoked ham, Swiss cheese, béchamel sauce and perfectly fried egg.  The side fries were hot, soft on the inside and crispy out.   My daughter got the southern breakfast and loved every bite.  Side of potato hash was delicious (very crispy!). 
The service was prompt, knowledgeable, and friendly.  I heard the waiter tell another table they were under-staffed, but I wouldn't have known.  I recommend this place!

This place is by far one of the best restaurants in New Orleans! Our servers gee was amazing! The seafood is to die for ! 100% recommend and go for the seafood plateau! Oh and the bread pudding is out of this world amazing!

Forget Acme, Luke is where it's at! We came for the oysters and ordered them by the dozens. The fact that it was a John Besh restaurant was just a bonus. $1 oysters at happy hour, served daily!?!? YES, PLEASE! And the happy hour deals apply to all restaurant seating - not just at the bar.

We arrived around 4pm on a weekday and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. It seemed like the happy hour deal was a well-kept secret. My sister actually discovered Luke from a Facebook ad, so our visit was a bit spontaneous. Service was friendly and our first round of raw oysters came out quickly. I commend the hospitality from the manager - she greeted us during our meal and chatted with us. As more people rolled in during happy hour (who also ordered oysters by the dozens), the wait for more oysters did increase, but that's on us for underestimating the number of oysters that we wanted to eat when placing our initial order.

Having dined at Acme Oyster House the night before, I liked Luke's P&J oysters much better. We also enjoyed the tuna tartare which came with shrimp chips. Come hungry, leave happy. Luke was such a great find in NOLA!
We came with a large group for a bachelorette party lunch. We got several appetizers, oysters, and entrees, all of which were delicious. The service was great and we would absolute recommend!
A fav for gumbo. If you haven't had it you'll be WOWED! Over dinner had a nice visit with an actor in town to film a movie. It's that kinda place.

We were group of 8 and got our reservations like a week ago. 
We got Brussel sprouts for starters, gumbo, shrimp and grits, oyster and pork schnitzel. Every single dish was delicious. The Brussel sprouts were so crispy, sweet and so well cooked. Gumbo & shrimp and grits were sumptuous. Tuna was fresh and had the right amount of tart. We were so happy with our selection. Door 3 for drinks was a great start and to end out feast, we got bread pudding for dessert which was fingerlicking good!

This place is absolutely wonderful for breakfast! We made a reservation via Open Table for 9:45am on a Sunday. Our table was ready the moment we arrived and our server promptly took our order. Everyone from the hostess to the servers clearly cared about providing their customers with top service. For example, midway through our meal, our server replaced my hot tea with a fresh bag and water at no extra charge. The little things! And of course, our food was unreal good. My partner and I split the shrimp and grits with over medium eggs and the chicken biscuit sandwich (two courses for two people). Both are a must! Very fresh, very yummy. Many thanks to Luke for bringing us to life on a rough Sunday morning!

Came here for lunch with the ladies and we were seated immediately since we had reservations .good service considering they were understaffed and super busy. The team of servers were responsive and incredibly gracious. Appetizers were delicious and my entree perfect.

By far best oyster happy hour in the city.

Great service , killer drinks - and best happy hour.

Review for happy hour only: while the rest of my bachelorette party crew decided to take a nap, I decided that I'd rather go to an oyster happy hour! The hostest let me know that the happy hour was 7 days a week and you can make reservations for it (!). When I showed up alone, initially there was no room but I reassured the waitress that I'm there alone so I should be quick. She made me feel welcome, gave me a table right away and even though it was reserved, she emphasized that I should not feel rushed. I ordered half a dozen of $1 oysters, a drink, and the fried oyster appetizer. The fried oysters were good, but if I had to do it all over again I would do a dozen (at least) raw.

We had dinner at Luke's last night. Loved the food: we started with Luke salad; the gumbo was excellent and the rabbit chicken liver pate pleased even my kids. The entrees are quite sizable: my teen kids split the burger and could barely finish it. My husband and I shared the shrimp and grits dish and took a doggie bag home. 

The only reason I gave 4 stars was that the service felt a little too rushed. Don't get me wrong: it is better than having to wait for a hour between  your appetizer and the main course. But we could barely enjoy our pate and I had to ask the waiter to slow down.

Great ambiance, great service, but more than those - really good food. 
The liver pate surprised with richness; brushless sprouts were a huge dish and tasty too; friend oysters were not as crispy as I waved, but fresh and tasty. 
The table next to us has the friend oysters salad and reported that it was a favorite as well.

Luke, is quintessential New Orleans food with extraordinary staff! It's a white coat type of restaurant but you don't have to be dressed up, and the food is just marvelous! I highly recommend the chicken liver board as a starter!
Was in town for business training and went here for proximity to hotel. Food and service was absolutely amazing. Had the shrimp and grits and bread pudding- delicious!

A group of seven of us made a reservation after our city tour at 10pm. We read all of the good reviews and we were super excited to give Luke a try. When we got there, we were told that we had to order asap because the kitchen was about to close - understandable - but why allow reservations for 10 pm if the kitchen closes then? 
We ordered oysters (delish), tuna tartare (very good) and an assortment of different entrees. The swordfish was tasty, slightly over cooked, but the squash that it came with was nearly inedible salty. The burger was good - nothing to write home about, but it was a burger after all. The crawfish etouffee was just ok... I had much better from other spots in the city. The mussels were mediocre, not terrible though. 
We finished eating, and waited for an uncomfortable amount of time for the server to bring the check. Staff was closing the restaurant around us, and we were just ready to go. Finally after probably 20 minutes of waiting, the check was dropped. 
The servers were friendly but seemed agitated with our presence. Again, understandable as they were trying to close, but we made the reservation over 12 hours ahead. 
Unfortunately, Luke is not a place that I would recommend to family and friends visiting NOLA. We had much better meals, with better service, at a lower price at other restaurants during our stay. 
Overall very disappointing.

The worst restaurant I have experienced in New Orleans. Made reservations for their Thanksgiving dinner (turducken is what they offered) but they ran out before 6:30. We ate salads and a couple of sides. Service was slow (like we were invisible) and rude. No second chances.
Good is good! Setting nice! Reasonably priced! Fried oyster salad was amazing! Schnitzel was enough for two!

Amazing raw oysters!!! Happy hour is amazing! Not only the oysters are a dollar each, they are fresh and delicious! Fried oysters were just okay. Great service and atmosphere!  Also love the Brussels sprouts!

Mussels were so good! We ended up running in because the restaurant was attached to the hotel we were staying at and we are so glad we did. I tried the pork schnitzel and my hubby had the mussels. I think this was my first time trying mussels and I was ready to trade dishes with him. It was so good. Everything was good and loved the door #3.
Perfection! Great atmosphere, delicious food, friendly staff. Our first time here tonight and it won't be our last.

What an amazing lunch we had! Three of my best friends met up for our 10 year reunion and decided to meet at Luke's! Boy were we surprised by the great service from Gary & Savanna! Their entree recommendation was more than we could've expected! They recommended the shrimp and grits and by far the most amazing dish we had in New Orleans. And the drinks and the birthday dessert were pretty fabulous.

Was visiting New Orleans again, my daughter is considering Tulane University. 

Had lunch by myself. Very busy restaurant. Located in a hotel.

Wonderful service. Very loud and robust clientele. Fun atmosphere.

It was delicious. Had a pate which was amazing. Also had a salad. Rosé to boot. Very simple menu. I will definitely be back when I am in New Orleans again.

My party was excited to try out Luke.  We had reservations and were seated immediately.  Luke had this older feel to it. White linen with wooden decor.

To start we had the BBQ P&J Oysters.  They were fine.  My plus one liked this dish because of the bread crumbs and parmesan, which is why we got fresh oysters too.   The fresh ones had a good salty flavor, but I've had fresher and sweeter.  

I did like the pate dish.  Spread that pate on long pieces of toasted bread with pickled cucumbers and watermelon rind.  Mustards as a condiments.   

We also got a bowl of gumbo a la Creole.  Gumbo was OK.  I wasn't my favorite dish.  Every part of the dish was not impressive.  Rice was fine and the included meat was not great.

My favorite was the bacon Luke uses.  We got a small side of it.  Delicious!

We went here after a work Christmas party and had a great experience. We ordered so much food. My favorites were the Flammenkuchen and the Louisiana raw oysters. I never would have ordered the flammenkuchen but the manager on duty, Peter, highly recommended it. It didn't disappoint! The oysters were so fresh and had a great salty taste. I was super impressed with the manager who was attentive to our table and noticed I wasn't drinking my cocktail. When asking me about it I said " it was a little too bitter for me but please don't worry about it" instead he took it and immediately doctored it up and then brought it back saying that he would be happy to get me a new one if this didn't help. Well whatever he did to it was delicious and it was so nice to have someone so attentive as fine dining should be. The food was delicious and the service was excellent... both which equally make the expertise of fine dining worth the money.

Disappointing online order. Overcooked schnitzel, missing Mushroom vinaigrette, burnt roasted vegetables. Grilled shrimp salad was very good, tasty bacon. Buttermilk dressing not substituted with balsamic per online order. Very little attention to detail.

Fried oyster salad was mediocre considering the hype; could barely taste the oysters once fried. Good value for the pâté, intriguing taste and paired well with provided toppings. Although the bread was burnt and had to be sent back; wait staff was professional and receptive.

As the restaurant for the Intercontinental in NOLA, Luke keeps up to the hotel's high standards. The restaurant decor matched historic NOLA and the food was great. We made reservations beforehand and it was a breeze from there getting seated. Our server was sweet and made sure to check up on us often. We went during happy hour but wasn't given an actual happy hour menu. I'm glad I studied the menu beforehand so we tried their boudin bites, crab bisque, dozen raw oysters, oyster platter, crawfish pot pie and brie burger. My wife and I enjoyed the crawfish pot pie the most. It was creamy and succulent while the crust was flaky and delicious. The bisque had great crab flavor throughout and the raw oysters were decently sized. The Oyster platter allowed to try all 6 broiled oysters but our favorites were the rockefeller and the one with bacon. The other 4 kinds were average and nothing to write home about. The brie burger was humongous and the meat patty was moist throughout. The sesame bun was toasted and the burger was everything you want in a gourmet burger. I would definitely come back to Luke next time I visit NOLA.

I went during daily happy hour (3-6pm) and waited for 20 minutes to sit at the bar on Christmas Day. They were completely booked and I can see why due to the quality of food there. I ordered a dozen of LA Gulf oysters ($1) and tried their fried oysters ($8/6). They were amazing! Like have you seen oysters this fat?! Worth my money. The fried oysters just melts in your mouth. I would say between these two, I prefer the raw on, given almost every food I ate in NOLA was fried . But also you can taste the natural sweetness in Raw oysters than fried. I also ordered myself 2 drinks (half off) and they were so good! I also had the best bartender, Lori (I think.. she has green hair). Would highly recommend this place.

Alright guys. Because the oysters were so impressively large and fat, I came back my 2nd and 3rd day LOL. Oysters were a bit smaller, like average size on the other days, which was fine because we never know what kind of batch we are going to get. Regardless, they were fresh oysters every day! On my last night, I also tried their shrimp grits and bread pudding. Best shrimp grits EVER. I ordered similar food elsewhere in French Quarters but alot of restaurants make food so salty! This dish highly recommended by people who ate at Luke's and I just had to try it. The quality really lived up to these recommendations. Creamy and it felt like I was eating mash potato (haha). So good! Also the bread pudding was so CRAZY GOOD. I only had bread pudding at Mambo's and I had to go back to edit my review because Luke's really set high standard what bread pudding should be. The bread was so soft and puffy. There were.. walnut and they were powdered and roasted I think. It compliments the dish well. There were also vanilla icecream. If you grab some bread and icecream, it literally melts in your mouth with satisfaction. This is one of my top 2 recommendations to come back to!

Highly recommend an advance reservation. Visited during a Saints game and was looking to sit at the bar for a quick drink and appetizer. Upon arrival the bar was packed and the restaurant reservations were full and people were turning around. Long extensive drink menu and small plates, not many options for entrées. Ordered The French 75 and brussels sprouts. The brussels sprouts were good more soft than crispy. The sauce and overloaded almonds made it a good dish. French 75 was made with cognac instead of Gin which had a very settled taste instead of the tanginess which I appreciated.

UNBELIEVABLE! We went for the happy hour $1.00 oysters and had to belly up to the bar due to not making a reservation. This ended up being a huge blessing and addition to our fun. The oysters were gigantic and DELICIOUS. The bartender "Lillian" was absolutely amazing!!!  watching  her wait on her folks at the bar in addition to making drink for every customer in a full restaurant was live entertainment that you can't pay for. She was delightful, and never frazzled. 
The Gumbo was the tastiest I have ever eaten and we have lived in the deep South for 45 years. 
To make a great time even better we pulled into a parking space right across the street.

Highly recommend to come just for oysters and cocktails. All my oyster were delicious! I've been here before years ago for them and I'm glad I tried again. This will be my go to spot for them.

Entree wise, roasted chicken was a waste. The chicken was very basic. I probably could get a better flavor one at Sams Club. The potatoes cubes just didn't make sense. As I tried to eat the dish I felt Unfulfilled. I should have trusted my gut and went with the hamburger.

Order an old fashion made with their well Bourbon and that was really food.

Catherine was our server and had some great suggestions.  We took advantage of happy hour to do an unofficial wine tasting with 4 glasses of different dry reds.  Started with 2  dozen oysters, half raw half fried.  Wife thought fried were the best we've ever had and I'm not sure she is wrong.  Catherine convinced me to try the Shrimp and Grits.  Never really liked them before but these were REALLY good.  Other entree was Grilled Swordfish which was also quite good.  Finished with the best Bread Pudding ever.  We had table 81 which let us watch the kitchen at work.  Go to Luke's. You'll be glad you did.

I would give 5 stars because we LOVE this restaurant. We eat there every single day for each stay in NOLA. Yesterday we had brunch, it was delicious as usual but were so sad that our favorite dish, baked, crab and shrimp stuffed, P&J oysters was no longer on the menu. Understanding the shortages these days we know crab is expensive but maybe just use shrimp and still offer this awesome dish! We will still come but would so love to see this item added back by the two trips we have in February when we will be back (and already have reservations) for each day we are in the city!
The pate appetizer is amazing, oysters super fresh, and service super good. Wish I had more time in New Orleans to try more dishes.

I've been meaning to come here for years and didn't realize it was a Besh restaurant.  I made it for the 3-6 happy hour where oysters on the half shell are half price and speciality cocktails, wine and well are also half off. The host was friendly as was the bartender. I sat at the bar and got the fried oysters, (also a half hour deal i think i got 6 for $8) 
I loved the seasonal cocktail called "Barrely- making it through the holidays" which was a gin drink made with Prosecco and Licor 43 (which in never had before. She described it V as a vanilla flavor)
I ordered the fried oysters  and va the broccolini. As the oysters arrived at my table I could smell the aroma, they were gently fried and came with a white sauce. They were a little salty but V still amazing, likely  the natural sea salt.  The broccoli was perfectly charred with the right amount of crunch on the outside and not too chewy ok the inside.

One thing: the oysters are the best in the town (better than the popular ACME etc). Besides this, the environment is awesome and the waiters are so nice and try to give you the best service they could provide. I ordered my personalized shrimp  , which is fabulous! Would definitely recommend it!

We had a lovely dinner here! It was very busy when we arrived to our reservation, but were seated right away. Everything from the menu sounded delicious! We ordered oysters, brussels sprouts, calamari & chorizo pasta, jumbo shrimp & grits and flammenkuchen. 
The the drinks were great and the food so rich in flavor! Service was amazing, everyone was so friendly and attentive.
Highly recommend! We will definitely return on our next visit to NOLA.
Great cocktails and oysters. Went during happy hour so can't speak about the other food but loved that you can make reservations for HH.

We came for happy hour and we ordered the raw oysters, the fried oysters, the fries (not on HH menu), and I got the French 75 cocktail. The raw oysters were quite large, and we enjoyed the fried oysters (the sauce carried a lot of it). The fries were also quite good. Overall it was a good experience but nothing really blew us away.

Stopped by for lunch and was not disappointed. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the fried chicken sandwich. Both were cooked to perfection as was the bread pudding. Wait staff was awesome. Would both recommend and return to this restaurant in the future.

There are plenty of restaurants where you can get a good meal, but there are very few where a great meal is the combination of exquisite food (i.e., crispy Brussel sprouts and oysters on the half shell) and the attention of a waiter (i.e. Richie Rich) that is beyond compare. This was one of those meals/events that make the trip. When you go, try to sit in Richie Rich's section. You won't regret it.
This is a must if you are coming to New Orleans.  Their happy hour is so amazing and we have been coming back numerous times for amazing oysters.

I had been wanting to try Luke for some time now and never got around to it. My best friend was visiting and we decided to go together. My absolute fav was the pâté & oyster (murder points). I had a Bloody Mary & extra dirty Martin (the dirty was my fav). Our waiter was awesome, he helped us choose the perfect oysters and suggested coming back for HH. I can see this place is going to become a fav for me.
The food was good. I specially enjoyed the gumbo soup and roasted Brussels sprouts. The service was OK.

We made a reservation at 5:30 on Sunday and found out they have happy hour til 6pm! Our initial drinks were half off! Pleasant surprise. We ordered a dozen raw oysters to start which were delicious. I started with the Luke Salad which has a variety of items that all paired perfectly. For our entrees we ordered the Jumbo Louisiana shrimp and Grits which I loved! We also had the moules et frites that had great flavor, you just have to love mussels. For dessert we had the apple cider sorbet which was amazing! If you love apple cider and sorbets get this! Service was perfect! There were multiple servers working together. The receipt says Team 1. They were awesome. Highly recommend this place for a nice dinner.
